The eggs are always pouched perfectly, runny yolk but firm outside. I hate places where the white is runny. The cinnamon roll pancakes are so sweet but so good. I don't think I could only eat this because of how sweet they are but that comes with name.

Finally made my way over here at a good time when the line isn't out the door.  Their pancakes/waffles and french toast definitely live up to the hype.

We came at like 8:45 or so on a sunday, when we left there were blobs of people waiting outside.  So my advice would be to buckle up and get here early.
What a wonderful experience. Great family atmosphere and excellent staff!!  The food is amazing. So far there us nothing I do not love.  I wish I had a bigger  stomach!

They had a wait for 45 mins for sunday brunch, We booked a spot on Yelp before leaving home and timing was perfect when we reached there.
We ordered two portion of omlette which came with toast or pancakes and hash browns or fruit and beverages. The quantity and quality of food is perfect for a group of 3.
I'm usually a guy who is so picky about my food and this is one of the amazing place I have visited in Chicago. The ambiance was super busy and the person who severed our table was awesome.
Thumbs up

Came here for brunch on Sunday and it was very busy. There were people waiting outside and inside. There is an upper level with seating but even then, it was still very busy. We were finally seated and were handed the menus.

I ordered the los altos benedict which had chorizo sausages, red peppers, poached eggs, and hash browns. It was very savory with a hint of Mexican burrito taste. I loved it! It was also quite spicy, so if you can't handle spicy, I wouldn't recommend getting it. My bf got the Butcher block skillet which had hash browns, cheese, eggs, sausage, and bacon. He also got a side of the specialty berry bliss specialty pancakes.

The food was so good, I was very pleased with the generous portions and the quality of the taste. Of course, we had leftovers since we ordered too much food.

We also got the Wildberry orange juice which was super tasty! It had a touch of berry and orange taste to it. The blend was very smooth and refreshing.

I just wished they had the AC on that day. It was very hot outside and humid and the inside was very stuffy! Everyone was eating with sweat dripping down. I would have liked to enjoyed my meal more.

So. Much. Food!

Wait time - Very fast despite a long line. 20 minutes on Thursday 12PM.

Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes - Most popular item. Sweet, fruity, hearty. and a stack of 5 pancakes for $13. Way too much food. Only could stomach three or four bites. Plenty of maple syrup and blueberries were provided.

Oreo S'more Pancakes - Rich, chocolate, thick.

Mexicana Skillet (hash browns, cheddar and jack cheese, 2 eggs, chorizo sausage, roasted jalapenos, avocado, cilantro, onions) - Rich, salty, heavy.

Hash Browns - Fluffy, crisp, lots of burnt edges.

Service - Excellent, cheery, joyful.

Interior - Casual, clean.

pics.caption: Mexicana Skillet (hash browns, cheddar and jack cheese, 2 eggs, chorizo sausage, roasted jalapenos, avocado, cilantro, onions)

review.des: Came here with great friends and had a blast! The food was great! We had create your own signature omelet, pumpkin pancakes, and chicken and waffles. The Wildberry Orange Juice is awesome. It had freshly squeezed oranges and berry purée for a sweet and tangy refreshing taste. Caramel macchiato and mocha woke us up!

One of the best pancakes I tasted!!!

Came here with the wife in a Sunday around 8:50am and the place was packed. Was lucky to get a table given people were just leaving.

We ordered the skillet garden dish and the barbacao chilaquiles l. We went with the option to substitute our toasts with pancakes for an extra $2. The portions were very large!!!! The barbacao chilaquiles was obviously the winner between the two orders given its lesser healthier but much tastier!

For the pancakes we went for the chocolate chip banana and the Oreo s'mores. Do yourself a favor and stick with only the Oreo s'mores it was by far the better choice!

It is hard for me to believe that I haven't written a review for Wildberry yet. I have been here multiple times and it is a great place to take out of towners because of its' location. I like to share one of the specialty pancakes and one of the egg skillets with a friend because it is truly so much food. They also have delicious lattes and coffee flavors that go along with the seasons, and a minty hot chocolate that is sooo good.
The line is always long on weekends but you can put your name in on NoWait app to get in line without having to wait out in the cold or the heat. All the wait staff is so nice and they are such hard workers too! Take the time to go to Wildberry, it will be well worth the wait!

With generous portions, a wide-ranging menu, creative dishes, and a stellar wait staff (Jeremy is the bomb), Wildberry 100% lives up to the hype. We got 2 dishes and opted for pancakes and french toast for our sides and left full as a party of 4.

My one complaint is that the Intelligentsia coffee is not prepared well. I'd recommend getting your Joe beforehand.

We made a reservation on yelp before heading there because we heard the wait was a while without reservation. When we got there, their line was out the door, but since we had reservation, we only waited about 10-15 mins before getting seated.
       We took a look at the menu and quickly picked what we want to eat. We ordered the southern Benedict and the butcher block. They were both pretty good. I really liked the gravy they used, really good with my muffin. Their hash brown was also really crispy, which was a plus. We were both really full but still decided to try the berry bliss pancakes. Omg they were so good, supper fluffy and soft. And surprisingly they weren't too sweet. We couldn't finish a good amount of our food so we got it to go. They package it for u really nicely too!
    Will definitely recommend and come back if I'm ever in the area again.

With over 4,000 reviews and a high Yelp score - how can you not try this spot for brunch while in the area. It's only open until 2:30 pm so they only serve breakfast and lunch so I had high brunch hopes!

We went on a weekday AM and were shocked that there was still a wait albeit brief.  Once seated, I was a bit overwhelmed with the HUGE brunch menu. Waitstaff was attentive and helped suggest some of the most popular items. I opted for the garden skillet ($13) which was sort of the insides of an omelette (veggies in this case) with hash browns mixed in topped w/cheddar cheese and then your choice of eggs (I did poached). It was sort of an inside out omelette which I liked. Sort of a new take on the standard and it was really good. I opted for the side of buttermilk pancakes (2) - really good pancakes. Flaky, delicate, buttery goodness. This was a TON of food and I barely made a dent. My husband got the veggie omelette with pancakes for $14 including cheese. HUGE omelette and also well cooked and darn good.  

Believe the reviews and give it a try - you won't be disappointed.

Really fun restaurant with an extensive breakfast menu. Came in at 7:30 in the morning and was surprised (though I probably shouldn't have been given the time and its central location) that there were so many people eating there at that hour. Made for a nice, lively start to the workday.

Ordered the Two Eggs Any Style scrambled with fruit (1 cup), bacon (3 strips), and pancakes (2 of them). A review of each item:
- The 2 eggs felt like a portion size of 1 egg, which I was actually fine with.
- Fruit cup was your typical fruit cup.
- I wasn't big on the 3 large strips of bacon because they were salty and pretty thick slices as far as bacon goes. They serve the flat/harder kind, not the crispy/bendy kind (yes, I'm sure those are officially what those types of bacon are called). As a result, I felt like it was simply too much meat and sodium for breakfast (call me un-American).
- Pancakes were excellent. Fluffy and topped with a sprinkling of powdered sugar (at least the top one was). They were even good enough for me to eat one without maple syrup.

pics.caption: 2 eggs any style (scrambled) with fruit, bacon, and pancakes

review.des:
Thank you Yelp! If it wasn't for you I wouldn't have found this place. Last week I scheduled a breakfast meeting here with one my manufacturers that I work with. They do not take reservations so a Monday morning 8 AM I figured it would be good. It was no wait which was great.

My colleagues got there before me and I was directed to where they were at a booth in the back. Service was top notch since time was of the essence I quickly ordered my favorites. Nice cup of hot earl grey tea with fresh lemon. Two eggs sunny side up with crispy bacon and rye toast. Also I had to try their specialty pancakes and had the wild berry. OMG were they fantastic! Additionally my breakfast came with either a side of fruit or hashbrowns. Well the fruit was a nice variety perfect in season melon and berries.

I will definitely be back soon hopefully tomorrow!

Amazing pancakes. I tried the Blackberry Key Lime Pie and its was delishhhhh! Pancakes so soft and the flavors, best I've had in a long time. Also the Florence Benedict.  My friends ordered the vegie omelet, crepes, the cream of cheddar Soup (so so delicious might I add), Refreshing orange juice and white chocolate mocha.
Over all, you can't go wrong with any order so to say. Delish Delish Delish

pics.caption: Vegie Create Your Own Signature Omelette

review.des:
The food was good, but the service was a little all over the place. I work in the prudential building and my team and I wanted a table for 8 people. I went down at 10:45 hoping to get a table between 1130 and 12. I walked down to the lobby and into the cafe, the woman taking walk in reservations (this is the only way you can get a table) said it would be a 30-45 minute wait. I said "no problem" and put my name in. 10 minutes later, the table is ready. None of my coworkers are able to drop everything and go an hour earlier than we planned, so I went back down to see what they could do. Well, cut to me missing the 5 min window, being put back on the list, not getting a table until 12:15 and having 1/2 the team not being able to eat.

Long story short, good food but a pain in the butt to eat at.

Absolutely wonderful! I enjoyed the Rutherford omelette and it was so delicious. A perfect combination of flavors. My sister had the highly recommended Mexicana.... and loved it.  The pancakes where amazing-super light and fluffy. I was glad we got the regular buttermilk which allowed us to really taste it.

Our waitress was so nice and recommended great options as a first timers.  

Overall, we enjoyed our breakfast.

Pro Tip:
The line is long. Be prepared to wait. It's worth it. Or carry out .
The most AMAZINGGGGG signature berry bliss crepes I've ever haddd! I think I have to say I liked the crepes even better than their pancakes and waffles. I would definitely recommend this place.

Review # 27 out of 365

Get on the wait list...stop reading and do it now. This restaurant is no joke on wait time. 180 minutes? Are you kidding me? No, I'm not joking. Don't go over thinking the wait will be less when you arrive. No, it's probably longer now...just by reading this it's getting longer.

When you arrive, let them know. The ability to push through the crowd will take finesse, but you'll get there. Try to aim through the left side. Then you have to find somewhere to stand. I try to get on a wall because I hate being in the way of the waiters who brush past me to get to the outside tables. They will call your name and if you have timed the wait list just right it won't be long.

Get anything with berries, I like the wild berry crepes. A delicious crepe filled with custard and a ton of berries. Others around you will get pancakes, but don't do it. Get a short stack if you choose to go that route. You'll be thankful you did.

AMAZING! We checked in before we left the hotel. We left a little the hotel earlier than we should have but the wait was worth it! The service is top notch and the food was AMAZING. Our server was on point the entire time. We may go back tomorrow morning before we leave town. Definitely recommend putting yourself on the waitlist in advance.

I walked here from my hotel for a nice mid morning breakfast. I checked in via yelp to wait in line while we walked there. When we arrived there we were seated promptly and I'm glad because this place is BUSY. And for good reason. The food is delicious. I ordered the veggie omelette with fruit and pancakes and my mom got the garden skillet with blueberry danish pancake. The portions are HUGE. You will feel FED. You are essentially eating breakfast and lunch. My favorite part was the pancakes. They were light and airy and melted in your mouth. Our server was great, the food came out pretty quickly. It was a great experience.

pics.caption: Veggie omelette, pancakes, garden skillet, blueberry danish pancakes

review.des:
Memorial Day morning and many options for breakfast are closed. Thankfully was able to make a reservation at this extremely popular restaurant (with an hour and a half wait time). Like clockwork, got a text after an hour and a half to see the host up front to be seated.

Many wonderful options from the menu, so we ordered a bunch without considering the portion sizes. Already had a coffee earlier, thus deciding on the Strawberry Mango Smoothie ($5) to go along with the Brisket Hash; adding the Strawberry Poppy Specialty Pancakes option ($15+2). Overall way too much food for one person. A heaping pile of hashbrowns topped by moist brisket and two poached eggs. This is accompanied by two thick buttermilk pancakes covered in buttercream powdered sugar, and strawberries. Loved the brisket - overpowered the oily hashbrowns and made even better by the runny eggs. Pancakes are super soft and had a delicious lemon tang to it. Smoothie is a refreshing counter to all the warm food, though wish I had ordered something lighter to drink.

Despite the large crowd, service is quick and helpful (they do want high turnover). Highly recommend to make a reservation.

pics.caption: Slow roast brisket hash. Lemon poppy pancakes add on

review.des:
Omgosh amazing brunch spot!!!
My boyfriend and I went for brunch on a saturday around 1230 and the place was pretty busy! They said the wait would be like 1.5 hours so since it was a block from our apartment we decided for takeout. Took about 15-20 minutes for our food so we took a little tourist trip to the chicago bean right across the street. When we got back it looked like there were more free tables so who knows we may have been able to get a table if we tried.
Between the both of us we split 3 entrees (we take brunch very seriously).
Caramel apple pecan brioche french toast - this was just okay. The bread was a little tough and I wish the apples had been cooked longer. The pecans were amazing though.
Cinnamon roll pancakes - soooo good!! probably the best thing we had. It tasted just like a cinnabon. Didn't even need any syrup and was quite a serving with 5 pancakes.
We got an omelette with havarti cheese, prosciutto and mushrooms which was delicious! The shredded hash browns were also crispy but did need some salt.
They also did a great job with the to-go stuff. Plenty of utensils, butter, jam and even ketchup.
Pretty reasonably priced as well, all this food was like 42$ which seemed like a good deal.
Definitely would recommend this place!
This place is a crazy long wait on weekends so the yelp wait list was super helpful. Enjoyed the chorizo eggs Benny and wildberry pancakes! A bit of slow service but worth it for the yummy brunch

Bottom Line:  Popular and delicious breakfast and lunch.  

There was a line forming by about 8am on a Sunday morning so I think that says a lot!  (At home even the most popular breakfast places in the touristy part of town don't have a wait until about 9am.) My husband and I are early birds so we arrived about 7:30am and then the restaurant quickly filled up.

Service was prompt and friendly and all of our food was tasty. The portions were large so neither of us were able to finish out breakfasts.

My husband had the famous Wildberry Pancakes which were huge, beautiful and sweet.  They were drizzled with what I would describe as a strawberry cream cheese frosting.  The pancakes had blueberries cooked in them and were accompanied by a mound of beautiful, fresh berries.

I always crave a sweet breakfast but I feel like I need a savory and filling protein breakfast.  What I appreciate about Wildberry is that you can get a side of pancakes with your savory breakfast instead of toast! I loaded my omelette within ham and veggies and thoroughly enjoyed the taste and the protein kept me feeling full for hours.  The omelette cafe with fruit fruit, and drumroll, two buttermilk pancakes.  

Hooray for the flexibility to get a sweet and savory breakfast combo in a comfortable atmosphere!

I can

Typically when I see a place with a TON of reviews it makes me not want to go there. Wildberry is right by Cloud Gate (let's be real, it's the bean) and was only three blocks from my hotel. It was a no-brainer to try it out. Wildberry was so busy, which had to be a great sign!

I did another thing I don't normally do: I got what everyone else suggested, the berry bliss pancakes. Holy moly y'all, these are the BEST pancakes I've ever had. Loaded with berries, jam, and berry marscapone cheese. The marscapone totally balanced out the sweetness of the pancakes, and they were so good that I went back two mornings later and got them again, haha.

I also wanted to try a skillet, so I got the butcher's block one, but I traded in some of the meat for onions and peppers. This thing was MASSIVE! It was delicious, but it was so big that I suggested they start doing a half portion for people who want to try other things too.

The bf got the omelette with fig, havarti cheese, and bacon. He was hesitant until it was as big as his face! It was filled with cheese and he said it was the best omelette he's ever had.

The next time I went back I got the berry bliss pancakes, sausage patties, and hash browns. I thought a la carte breakfast would be smaller, but it was still a ton of food! Wildberry is a 10/10. Go there!

Wow. This place is amazing. The pancakes and breakfast skillet (eggs, hash browns, cheese, bacon, sausage all mixed together) were extremely tasty and satisfying that I came back the next day. The price was very reasonable for the amount I received too.

I usually eat a fair amount and still brought some home after I stuffed myself.

Fair warning: book your spot online well in advance because there is a long wait to get in. 30 minutes one day and an hour the next. Moves really quick for the amount of parties waiting to get a table. That's the price to pay for a popular place.

Visit Wildberry. You won't be disappointed.

I had the Denver skillet with berry bliss pancakes. The skillet was cooked to perfection. You can tell they use high quality ingredients. The pancakes were perfect and no need for syrup with the fruit and sauces that are already in place. I'm going again tomorrow!

Awesome breakfast here! Across the street from the bean at Millennium Park. Get on the waitlist ASAP. There's an app for that. Perfect omelettes, incredible pancakes, really good coffee. Loud and active dining room, just how I like it. Try the amazing omelette with figs. Unique and delicious.

It is enough to make my tummy happy but not a 5 star Yelp review.

Heard this place from a friend for breakfast. I came here around 9:15am on a Wednesday - my first stop in Chitown. The line was not long at all (5-10min).

For some reason the setting of this Wildberry reminded me of Cheesecake Factory. Anyways, I ordered a Oreo-la-la waffle (wished that there is a description on menu). It is pretty sweet since there is an ice cream on top which I didn't except.

I would say a good place for hangout or gathering, not really for real good food.

Is the waffle worth 13$, not really.
Will I come back, maybe not.

I can see why this restaurant is so popular! Make sure you check the Yelp app before you go to see the current wait time and to waitlist. I checked on a Monday morning at around 9:30am and there was no wait. The app was accurate!

The portions here are huge! I started off with a turtle mocha which I thought was good- not too sweet. For breakfast, my friend and I got the espanola omelette and Napa valley fig omelette. It comes with fruit or hash browns and toast or pancakes. I recommend the hash browns! It was nice and crispy! I got the pancakes and upgraded to a specialty pancake for $2 extra dollars - worth it! I got the signature berry bliss pancakes, really tasty and good portion!

I prefer the espanola over the Napa valley fig because it comes with this delicious salsa on the side and avocado on the inside! The napa valley fig was good as well, but less ingredients and it has a sweet & salty flavor if you like that combo, due to the figs.

Overall, we were stuffed and couldn't believe the portion size for the price. I definitely recommend coming early to avoid the wait. They are friendly and efficient here! Will be back!

My wife and I had a wonderful experience at Wildberry. They had just opened their outside seating for the morning so we got right in. The sun was shining, the weather was perfect, the people watching was fantastic, and the food was even better.

It's located right across from Millennium Park -- the location of the bean aka Cloud Gate. So that was nice.

They give you enough food for two people in one entree so be prepared to share, or stuff your face. I stuffed my face. It was awesome.

My wife got the eggs Benedict, they were good. I got the mexicana skillet. It was good, but not my favorite taste at 10am - tasted like a bowl of chili. The side stack of pancakes was delicious.

Get on the waitlist through Yelp because it gets busy.

Not too much left to say given the almost 5k reviews of this place.

The wait here can be insane - up to 2 hours for weekend brunch. It is absolutely a good idea to use the Yelp wait in line in advance feature - you can get to it in the Yelp app. You can just check in at home on the app before and it tells you to show up a certain time (usually an hour or so after) and you don't have to spend as much time standing outside waiting.

Portions here are huge. The skillets are like having an entire frying pan of food to yourself. I really like the cinnamon pancakes as well as the benedicts. Staff is always really nice and efficient despite the absolute mob at the front, and really keep things moving.

Definitely worth checking out at least once. The location up in river north/gold coast is also less busy than this one.

The long lines at wildberry are exhausting. I will say the one that makes them successful is the fact that they have different spins on pancakes. Like the wildberry pancakes are bomb because of the sauce of top. And to their credit, the pancake is quite moist. But everything else.. Like their omelette that we had was pretty standard. Ran out of water several times but the waiter was understandably too busy.

Not sure waiting in that line is worth it. You get the text to go check in with the front desk but you still have to wait like 20-30 mins before seated. Doesn't seem worth the effort.

My family and I stopped in here for breakfast before a day spent downtown Chicago. I was planning to use the Yelp Waitlist like many suggested but every time I looked, it said "0 Minute Wait" so we just winged it. We got there around 8:45 on a Thursday morning and it was pretty busy but we got a table quickly. My parents had arrived first but had to wait because they will only seat complete parties.

Once seated, we were greeted quickly by our friendly waitress who took drink orders and returned promptly with everyone's drinks. We then ordered food and the waitress patiently waited as we decided on sides, types of toast, had special requests, etc. I chose the "Create Your Own Omelette".

The food came out in a decent time and was warm and delicious. My boyfriend and sister had skillets which they both really enjoyed. I can't remember exactly what everyone else ordered, but everyone really liked their food. My omelette was made well, was fluffy and had a good amount of all the ingredients I ordered.

We enjoyed our time at Wildberry and will definitely keep it in mind for breakfast again. The only wish I had was that I could have a mimosa with my breakfast, but it's certainly not a deal breaker.

Wildberry was LEGIT! This might be the best breakfast spot I've ever been to - EVER! I mean - this is the standard that chain breakfast spots should measure up to. Their food was amazing - I had this meat skillet with potato hash with pumpkin spice pancakes. I also had a mocha frappe. All delicious, all filling! My wife had a rather large loaded potato omelette with hash browns on the side! Talk about redundant! hahahaha The service was good, the wait wasn't long at all and this is a must-eat spot in downtown Chicago when you're starting your day.

You're going to wait regardless (& it's worth it!) so JOIN THE WAITLIST BEFORE YOU GO. YOU'VE BEEN WARNED. I would travel back to Chicago just to eat the Signature Berry Bliss French Toast again.
See photo attached, it doesn't do it justice but neither do words. In the running for best French toast of my life and I consider myself a French toast connoisseur. I wish I got my food so quickly and had service this good 99% of other places I've ever eaten (where the food isn't even as good, mind you). I got on the Yelp waitlist on my walk over there and it was about 20-25 mins total until I was seated.

That said: I see other reviews complaining about the attentive service... excuse me, but what?! Seriously, Are you kidding?! How many restaurants have you been to AT CAPACITY AT 10AM ON A MONDAY WITH A 45 MINUTE WAIT and you can 1.) get your food FAST I'm talking like 10ish minutes after ordering  2.) not feel like your server hasn't come back around in 20 mins because she's slammed & overwhelmed with 30 other customers in her section and you let it go bc you feel kinda bad for them? I wouldn't even think that's a realistic expectation and it seems the standard here. If you're blessed to dine here, you've probably already been waiting at least 30 minutes and are starving (they give you menus in line too if you're interested which is cool so you can order right when you sit down). With food this good and a place this busy, you'd probably let bad service slide but nope!! They excel!

I was by myself and checking it out before I headed to the airport because I couldn't NOT go to the best brunch spot in Chicago & I'm always mindful in those situations they'd be making more money off a 2-top or larger party (and those people are waiting outside no doubt), but I did not feel rushed at all! I signaled for my check before she was planning to bring it to me.

It's really nice that they are properly staffed: to keep service moving, clear plates to make space on crowded tables in big parties where people might want to order more (look at the pics of menu items & think about the volume of dishes that place must wash in 30 minutes), to make sure no customer gets overlooked(!!)or has a bad experience, and flip tables efficiently so you know that waitlist is not falsely longer than it really needs to be(important!!!). Take away a single busboy, or a server, or a line cook, and suddenly people are waiting on their drinks and their checks instead of seeing tourist sites bc their server is also clearing tables, and that waitlist gets longer unnecessarily, and you're losing customers and customer satisfaction. Seriously, who hates on great service?

Personally, I think that's a sign of a great establishment that knows what it's doing and does it well. You impressed me Wildberry, I'll be back!

pics.caption: Signature Berry Bliss French Toast. I compare every sub-par breakfast since to thee.
I swear the lady next to me gasped in ecstasy when they set this down in front of me

review.des:
Californian traveling to Chicago!

Food (5 Stars): You must try this place if you are traveling to Chicago! There is a reason why they have 5k Reviews on yelp! My friend and I split in half 2 orders of food (Los Altos eggs Benedict and the slow Roast Brisket). I ordered the Los Altos Eggs Benedict and OMG the first bite was a BURST OF FLAVORS! It was so flavorful that I was sad to trade my friend my other half of the plate! Haha The slow roast brisket was also very rich in flavors and the brisket was veeeeery tender! Both portions were waaaay to big for 2 girls...(and I eat a lot for a girl LOL).The Los Altos Benedict has to be my top pick between these two. Because the Signature Berry Bliss pancakes was one of their popular items.... even though we knew we ordered way too much already... We decided to try it anyway hahaha (Ragrets*** haha) The pancakes were AMAZING though! (Super fluffy, fresh fruits, good portion size) Unfortunately, we were too full to finish it
We left this place ABSOLUTELY STUFFED with lots of left overs!  

If you're traveling from out of this area, I HIGHLY RECOMMEND YOU TRY THIS PLACE!

Service (5 Stars): JOIN THE WAITLIST! This yelp feature saved my life so many times! The wait was suppose to be 1 hour and 30 mins for 2 people but we waited only 5 mins because we joined the waitlist from home. There was atleast 30 people in the waiting area and we bypass all of them! Even if you didn't put your name on the waitlist, there's plenty of things to do around there to kill time like walk around Millennium Park. They will text you so hang around because it is definitely worth it!  The food takes time to make but that's when you know it's fresh. The wait is worth it!!!!

Took my family here when they were in Chicago for my graduation. I've lived in Chicago 4 years and hadn't been here then. (since my friends in Chicago either have already been here before, don't want to wait for food, so we always opted for somewhere else). My family came in May on a Saturday-- We came around 7:30am because my graduation was at 9 and we could only do an early brunch schedule to accommodate my family's tight flight schedule back home.  It was a short wait probably 15-20 mins but it was early. It was super early that day and even though it was May it was a chilly gloomy day so there were no outdoor seating.

-We all different things, berry bliss pancake, french toast, egg benedicts. The food is your typical brunch place and it wasn't all that special. Honestly brunch food can only be soo good ^^ but it is a nice place to go especially if you're visiting.

-It's next to Millennium Park, which is very close to the Bean so you can take your visitors around and see the city. It's also nice to be able to take a walk by the park before or after your brunch.

-Parking: it's in downtown Chicago, there's really only metered parking on the streets wherever you can find. If you get lucky and find free parking spots in downtown please let me know!! (Because I've been looking for any free parking spots as a longer term resident in Chicago and I'll be your best friend if you find any....)

Wow. Wow. Have I said wow?  It has been a couple of weeks since our brunch here, and I am still thinking about how amazing the food was.  The service was very attentive without being overbearing. The food menu was slightly overwhelming due to its sheer length but that is a good thing as there is something on the menu for everyone.

I will say that if you are looking for a quiet place to have brunch, this is not it. This is a very busy, somewhat cramped restaurant which may feel claustrophobic to some.

If there was one complaint, it is that there is no covered space outside for people to wait in order to get a table. When it is raining or snowing, that really sucks. We were thankfully able to put our name on the waitlist before we left the hotel, but even after showing up and hour later, we still needed to wait outside in the rain for at least 20 minutes.

But, you come here for the food and that does not disappoint. I had the butcher block skillet which had ample meat and even more flavor. My only regret is that I did not get another waffle to go with it because those waffles were some of the best I've ever had.

Seriously, if you're in Chicago and looking for someplace to have breakfast or brunch, get your name on the waitlist and show up with a hearty appetite. You won't be disappointed.

pics.caption: Butcher Block with cinnamon roll pancakes

review.des: My friends and I aren't from here and we arrived in Chicago around 6 in the morning. This was the first breakfast place that we went to because it was open at 6:30 and it also had a lot of good reviews! It was good that we came early because right after we came, it got pretty busy. My friends and I actually ordered a lot of food and we all shared. I ordered their corned beef benny and a side of their oreo s'mores pancakes. Everything was super filling but it was all really good. I liked the benny a lot because it wasn't too salty and the flavors were really good all together. The s'mores pancake was just alright. My friends ordered their signature berry bliss pancakes and I really liked his pancakes over mine. I usually don't go for berry pancakes but they were really good! The pancake itself was really light and it wasn't too sweet. The french toast was also really good and light too. We all left really full and pretty happy with our first meal in Chicago! This restaurant really started our mini vacation pretty well! I'd highly recommend coming here for some breakfast! Its right next to the bean too so you can just walk right across the street to visit it.

pics.caption: Corned beef Benny & a side of Oreo s'mores pancakes~

review.des:
Wildberry is hands down one of my favorite breakfast places of all time. It might be due to the fact that pancakes and eggs skillets are my favorite breakfast dishes. Everything about this place was great. Not just the food. The people were sweet and the service was excellent. Hands down I recommend this place to anyone visiting Chicago.
Tried:
Signature Berry Bliss pancakes
Denver Sizzling Skillets

pics.caption: Signature Berry Bliss & Denver Sizzling Skillets

review.des:
Great breakfast spot. Even when they are super busy you can still get seated quickly and are waited on promptly without feeling rushed.

They have something for everyone on their menu. I opted for pancakes and my friend chose a hearty breakfast that include eggs, potatoes, bacon, toast and pancakes.  It was all delicious and the fruit was fresh.

It has a family atmosphere and it is roomy enough so you don't feel like you are sitting on top of your table neighbors.

Well worth the stop for a typical Sunday breakfast / brunch.

Bike parking on premises.

Service itself deserves 5 stars here. We used the wait list through Yelp and were seated in less than a minute from our check in time. Throughout our time spent at Wildberry, we witnessed the rapid turnaround with food being served, tables bussed, and quick seating of the next party. It was pretty impressive to watch especially since at no point did we feel rushed to finish our meals. Our server was very attentive and kind.

Food was excellent! I enjoyed the Florence Benedict that had a great flavor combination. The Berry Bliss pancakes were, well, blissful. Light pancakes that had great berry flavors come through which made for no need of syrup. My boyfriend had the chilaquiles barbacoa skillet which I thought had a great spice to it.

Good news for those that are gluten free or vegetarian, they have great choices to accommodate dietary needs. I would definitely love to visit again to give their other menu options a try.

Love those pancakes! My daughter's favorite Oreo pancakes, but have to warn you they are super sweet and have chocolate topping as well, too sweet for me but perfect for her. I love blueberry and banana!

This my new favorite breakfast spot. Been there twice now. First time I had the brisket hash which was very good but not as flavorful as it could be. The next week I had the Berry pancakes special. This will be my go to breakfast forever. Service was excellent, no wait time, good coffee.

First time in Chicago with my girlfriend and we had some down time before check in, so we decided to grab a bite to eat for breakfast. BEST DECISION WE'VE MADE SINCE BEING HERE! We found this place on Yelp and decided to try it.

Wait time was listed as 0-15 mins, when we got in it was a little wait but not bad at all. However, I would recommend being put on the waitlist prior to arriving -- otherwise you'll be waiting for a while, since it's so popular. After being seated, we were overwhelmed by the extensive menu that offered such a huge variety of breakfast foods with a twist.

Our sever was very nice and friendly, we could tell she was very busy so we didn't have much conversation but she was still awesome. Food came out about 12 mins after we ordered and was steaming hot. This food was absolutely delicious hands down, everything was perfect.

We will be leaving out on Wednesday headed back to our hometown but plan to visit this establishment at least two more times before we depart. Great job Wildberry!

pics.caption: Chicken + Waffles (added strawberries/powdered sugar) w/ side of bacon.
Denver Skillet + Cinnamon Roll Pancakes -- AMAZING!

review.des: Loved this breakfast cafe! Very good service and great food! Will definitely be back and recommend!

We arrived here and they told us 1hr 45 min wait. While we were waiting, someone in our party realized that they forgot their phone at the hotel. They left to get it. Our table was ready 10 minutes later, but they would not seat us....,. Because the person in our party was not there.... even if we said we know what they wanted to order.

It's ridiculous to tell someone 1 HR 45min wait for something that should only take 15 minutes. It's the same reason our party was not there at the time our table was ready. It's also ridiculous not to seat us because of it...... especially since we were willing to order for the missing person.

I'd rather the management (tall guy) just be a little more obvious about how they intend to treat you through the meal.... you get 20 minutes in the restaurant and they want to flip you out. Also... they way they asked us was embarrassing.

I think there are so many more really nice options around Chicago to have breakfast..... and where they don't treat you like a cow at the feeding trough.

I've only been to Chicago twice and for some reason, both times I have eaten here for breakfast before heading home. The food here is delicious and not to mention huge portions. I've gotten the corned beef hash both times and added pancakes for only $1.50 more, such a good deal! If you are a corn beef person, you'll love their hash here. They don't skimp out of the meat and the hash browns are perfectly brown and crispy! The pancakes are also moist and fluffy! I've tried the oreo one before which was good but their strawberry poppy seed with lemon curd sauce was so great!

The food is consistent here, even at different location and a few years apart, the food still taste the same to me. So I might have to make it a tradition that every time I visit Chicago, I will eat at Wildberry before heading home.

This place has really good pancakes! It was very light and fluffy. The other brunch items were alright. We ordered the Florence benedict and the Butcher Block skillet but nothing stood out. Waited for about an hour so we walked around Millennium Park.

Justine our waitress was amazing! She is such a friendly soul and very on top of her tables. Our food came out under ten minutes. I ordered the minced ham scramble and added mushroom and tomatoes which was great for the added flavor and kick to the eggs. It's comes with a side of hashbrown or fruit and pancakes or toast. I ordered the pancakes and I would recommend getting them cinnamon roll style which was absolutely delicious! This location is perfect for starting your day right downtown and being close to all the main attractions in downtown Chicago.

pics.caption: Minced ham and eggs with mushroom and tomatoes

review.des:
Appreciated the online wait list! It was about a two hour wait, which gave us the opportunity to explore the city a little bit! Millennium bean was a 10 minute walk and other businesses nearby.

Of course, ordered the eggs benedict with a banana berry smoothie! Creamy, not too sweet smoothie. Not my favorite benny, but very very filling breakfast. Couldn't finish half of the benny because the ham that's included was so thick.

Great location, friendly staff and decent food. Each plate was huge. I finished my cup of dirty chai and the whole plate of blueberry pancakes cause they were so good together. I ended up taking almost the whole omelette home (happily). Got prepared to wait though!

I had a friend visit from out of town and was searching for a delicious brunch spot. I have tried to come to Wildberry before but saw that the wait is around 2 hours. I knew the morning we wanted to go that we would plan our visit 2 hours ahead of time.

You MUST use the nowait app if you want to use your time effectively. Warning: when using the no wait app they will give you an expected time you should arrive. Plan to arrive 10 min earlier because there is a chance the table will open up sooner than you think. Once your table is ready you have 5 min to get there. If you miss it they will put you on the waitlist (but not at the very end). We missed our initial table because our table opened up 12 min earlier than the expected time. It took 15 min to get a table once we get there but that is still better than a 2 hour wait.  

I loved that Wildberry has a menu that will please everyone. I chose the Mexicana skillet over the eggs Benedict because the skillet comes with a side of pancakes (or toast). Others got a skillet with chicken sausage and the biscuits and gravy. Our food came out quickly; probably within 8 minutes. Everyone loved their food. I loved the Mexicana skillet and would highly recommend it for people who love that style of breakfast.

So here is the down side - I know it is a very busy and popular restaurant but it is very obvious they want you in and out for 20 minutes. I value customer service and my biggest pet peeve is when staff will rush you out. I know this is the US and this is typical but it was so blatantly obvious. Our waitress was friendly but it seemed that the bus boys was huddling around our table like vultures while I was still picking at my food. They continuously were asking if they could take our plates and drinks away while we were still enjoying our time. Also the server gave us our check whole we were still eating. The thing is I live here but I would feel bad for visitors/tourists where this is their experience of Chicago. I haven't been to a restaurant that had rush out service like this in Chicago and it really brought the vibe of the experience down.

If you plan out your visit and get on the NOWAIT app, are looking for delicious food, and know that they will rush you out of there without it bothering you, this is your place. I loved the food but not positive I will come back due to the experience.
Best brunch I ever had in my life!! Got their mixed merry and the los altos(?) Benedict!! The hash browns were bomb

Normally I would focus the food, but here I think it is pointless because everything at our table is explosively good.  

What is important to note is that you need to use the waiting list feature on yelp to really get a good table time.  We got on the waiting list while in our hotel room and walked over.  By the time we got here at 9:15 there was 90 min wait time.  Service was friendly and really fast.

I am a fan of breakfast foods, so Wildberry is an obvious first-pick for me. The food is great and decently priced.

I applaud Wildberry for using cage-free eggs in their menu. It really makes a difference! Smoothies are a must-have for every visit. And I really appreciate the extensive menu, for those guests who don't feel like having "breakfast food."

My only complaint is how terribly long the wait can be for a seat, and then again for food. Understandably, this is a very popular restaurant.
Love it !!! You can't go wrong with anything on the menu!!! This is why the place stay busy.. it is worth the wait.

Yum yum yum in my tum tum tum!! I love how we can check in through yelp! They don't have that option in San Francisco! We waited at our hotel until we got close to our time. When my husband and I walked up to the desk, they gave us a pager and it already vibrated! We didn't wait at all!

Since we had an 80 minute wait, my husband and I were already looking at the menu. When we sat down, our waitress asked what we wanted to drink, but we gave her our whole order! We ordered fruity pebbles French toast! Yum!! It was sweet, but it was perfect sweet!! We also ordered corned beef hash skillet which was enough food for 2! It was huge and very cheesy!! So yum! My husband ordered a regular order of pancakes and a Florentine Benedict.

It was a lot of food for 2! But when was the next time we were going to be in Chicago? We had to go all out!!

I saw the reviews on this place and heard a Chicago resident rave about this place, so I woke up earlier than usual to get a fix of the signature berry bliss pancake.

I definitely wanted to try the pancake, but didn't want a whole one to myself, so I spilt with 4 other friends. We all got 1 order of the signature berry bliss pancake (4 bigger sized pancakes piled on top of each other), 1 order of the Fresca omelet with a side of a sub speciality pancake of chocolate chip banana (2 smaller sized pancakes). Out of all that we ordered, pancakes were definitely the better option. It's fluffy, filling and good. It was all worth the early morning wake up.

*If you also want to get your hands on these pancakes without a big wait, I suggest getting to the shop by 8-8:30am. We got seats right away at 8ish and once we were done and leaving the shop, there were crowds of people by the entrance waiting to be seated.

This place was amazing! I walked in 20 mins before closing and was seated in 10mins.  This place was packed and I see why. Once seated I was able to quickly put in my order. I ordered eggs Benedict with chorizo and the berry pancakes. O man! Delicious. There were so many things on this menu I wanted to try. They were reasonably priced for the portion sizes. Staff were friendly and engaging.

Though I was able to be seated, I would recommend getting there at least 45 to 60mins before closing due to the wait and the kitchen closing at close time no matter what time you get there.

Definitely a must!

Why wait in line when you can join the waitlist on Yelp?! My hotel was 5 minutes away so I joined the waitlist and stayed at my hotel, it was an insane 75-105 minute wait though. It's a diner like setting, but lots of options. It was a pretty good brunch though!

Mexicana ($15 +$2 for speciality pancakes)- 4/5 They allowed me to get the chorizo on the side so I could give it to my sister/friend. They said it was really good but spicy and would have tasted amazing with the dish. However, without it, it was still pretty good. The portion was big too. It has jalapeños, which were pretty spicy so be careful. I suggest eating this with hot sauce cause it made it so tasty!!

Cinnamon Pancake- 4/5 We added this onto our main for an extra $2, so worth! It's only 2 stacks and just how I imagined it would be. Delicious with syrup and some cream. And not too much sweetness or cinnamon overload.

Chocolate Chip Banana- 4/5 For $2 we also added this to one of the mains. This was definitely sweeter than the cinnamon because it had chocolate on top but some bananas to counter it a little.

Honey Toffee Nut Latte ($4.5)-3/5 A bit too bitter for me and not enough milk. I expected a nice, light, sweet toffee taste but its more like coffee with bitter toffee. Kinda made me want to throw up with my meal.. I recommend it maybe before/after the meal.

I can't say enough about this place!!!
The food is amazing !! The Staff #WOW
My family and I drive almost every Saturday from Evanston Illinois for the great hospitality , great food and incredible atmosphere!
There's usually a slight wait but it's well worth it!
I love their white hot chocolate especially to start off my adventure into food heaven!
The variety of pancakes Berry being my favorite and the array of different dishes with my favorite being create your own omelette although I've ordered the chorizo and barbacoa  skillet not on the menu but they let us have it our way yummm
The only downside of this 5 star Breakfast place is that the owner is a White Sox fan
So I come with my Cubs attire on just for him
Great work guys you're amazing!!!
Thanks for always seating us even though we get there almost at closing
and GO CUBS

We went early morning around 7:30 AM on Labor Day weekend to avoid the waiting and fortunately got a table as soon as we arrived. Huge selection of the menu, ordered the "Garden skillet" for myself and "Granola and berry Waffle" for wife. Absolutely loved it 5 stars all the way, food arrived just after taking 2 sips of coffee

pics.caption: Garden Skillet, the no meat veggie option for Vegetarians

review.des: My friend who visited Chicago recently raved about this place so I knew I had to go. My friend from Chicago brought me. Luckily for us, we were able to put our name on the online waitlist. We had a short wait after we arrived but it was fine. I ordered the blueberry pancakes and it was delicious. It had the right amount of fluffiness. The restaurant is also very big and bright. It was the perfect breakfast to start off our day. If I find myself back in Chicago, I will definitely come again!
Best pancakes ever. I had the cinnamon roll pancakes and the brisket hash. I could only eat half so i took the rest home and ate it for breakfast the next day!

I visited Wildberry after both my sister and uncle who live in Chicago told me it is the best breakfast place, and thought it was worth the hype! I was worried about the wait because of its popularity and since it was spring break, but I was there at 10 am on a Tuesday and we only waited 10 minutes. The berry bliss pancakes had a generous helping of berries and the most delicious vanilla anglaise and marscapone topping. They were incredibly fluffy as well. The portion was huge; I definitely got my money's worth. The service was extremely fast but I didn't feel like I was being rushed even though it was busy.

Overall, I would highly recommend visiting, but try to go at an off time or use the waiting list feature! The pancakes were seriously THE BEST pancakes of my life.

This is a gluten-free review, as both my husband and I are allergic to wheat (but don't have celiac).

OH MY SWEET PANCAKES. I ordered the GF avocado toast and wildberry pancakes and COULD NOT stop eating them, they were so good. I seriously was full for hours after because I couldn't stop.

The coffee is also delicious, from Intelligentsia. I felt like a millennial hipster and a half, but it was so worth it and I would do it again.

If it is possible to give a 5.5 star review I would! This place has one of the best breakfasts in Chicago. The service was also exceptional. I had an omelette that was something else! It had mushrooms and I think basil along with a special cheese that made it taste so original and of course - yummy. Damn this place is mouthwatering. The pancake was delicious too. I'd go back immediately. Yummy scale: 5.5  Oops I forgot to take a pic

Wildberry grew on me only after several tries. I'm not sure why I didn't care for it before. It might've been that I was turned off by super hyped places. We also didn't know better before so would actually wait for 1-1.5 hours. I loathe waiting. If a restaurant doesn't take reservations, I generally avoid. HOWEVER, my fiancé found out about the "no wait" app and Wildberry is a participant!!! We'll put our name on the list the moment we wake up. By the time we're on our way to the restaurant, we're only a few spots away.

Love their extensive menu. I've tried a host of items. The wraps are the most disappointing. The crepes are depressing. My fiancé loves their brisket hash and my favorites are the Mexicana skillet and BLT sandwich. Man, I love myself a good BLT and they pack them with lots of crunchy bacon here. You can ask to substitute for a side of pancakes instead of the usual sides. Those are the ultimate prize. Their pancakes are absolutely delicious and I wholeheartedly believe THE BEST in the city. That's why you come eat at Wildberry. My favorites are the cinnamon and the signature berry bliss. House coffee is free refill and made exactly to my liking - bold and strong. I'm awake instantly after one sip. Service is always efficient. The servers are super nice and knowledgeable about the menu and understand how the place runs.

Warning: can be an irritating wait but wait no more with the "no wait" app. Once you sit down, you're in for one of the best brunch treats in the city.

pics.caption: Forgot the name but it's also new. Heavenly. Best pancakes in town

review.des: Holy moly, best breakfast I've ever had. I had the Mexicana skillet with oreo smores pancakes and it was flawless. My girlfriend had the Denver skillet with banana & chocolate chip pancakes and absolutely devoured them. We will be back. Justine B was also a great waitress.

Wildberry is an AMAZING Breakfast/Brunch spot if you're in the Chicago area. My friend and I split the butcher block with berry bliss pancakes and a seasonal banana bread french toast. This was definitely too much food to split between two people but we had no regrets.

The berry bliss pancakes are a MUST if you eat here. So fluffy and sweet, you almost don't even need syrup with them...almost. The butcher block was extremely savory and had a great balance of meats, egg, and bread.

We came around 9am on a Wednesday and only waited about 5 minutes but got even more crowded while we were there. The great thing is you can make a reservation on yelp to speed along the process. The service was great and was really helpful if recommending things for us to try.

Amazing, 5 star experience. Got there by 7am on Friday morning so there was no wait. Servers were great, both attentive and friendly. I highly recommend the rishi masala chai. Mexicano skillet contains chorizo, and was delicious. The Alto eggs benedict was probably one of the best eggs benedict I have ever had, also made with chorizo. The home fries are cooked to perfection. A side order of pancakes came with the skillet, and we opted for the seasonal pumpkin pancakes which were delicious as well. Highly recommend this place!

Omg soo good! Yup, I jumped on the hype train and have no regrets.

One early Sunday morning around 8:30 am we arrived and were promptly seated. I was pleasantly surprised and noted the time for future reference so that I knew when to beat the rush. ( I also wrote a tip as an FYI)

I really wish it wasn't lent when I visited here so I could have tried at least one of the corn beef hash options they had.

I definitely went in hungry and when the food arrived I looked at it and seriously became full I had no idea what happened, it was the strangest thing. I still enjoyed my hot chocolate that came in a large cup.

I ordered the Espanola, with cheddar cheese, without the chorizo but with hash browns. Mommy ordered the Garden Omelette with toast. First off, the portions are huge, so that alone may have contributed to my immediate sense of fullness. Personally, I thought that hers definitely tasted better than mine. There was something about the melted cheese in the hot skillet and mix of veggies that was just more flavorful.

In addition, we also ordered the Special blackberry and key lime pie pancakes and fell in love. Those pancakes are serious about the "cake" part. If I didn't take a look I would have thought I was eating a vanilla key lime berry cake. Just yummy!

pics.caption: Corn Beef hash skillet with scrambled eggs and cheddar cheese.
Special Berry and Key lime pie pancake

review.des:
A very great place for breakfast or brunch! I ordered the eggs Benedict (duh) instead of the titular pancakes but left very satisfied! They give you options of what you want for a side for the benedict and chose ham. Turns out, they don't just give you a slice of ham, but they give you a BLOCK of ham! Jk, maybe not a block but it's a thick piece of ham. Very tasty! The chai tea is also very good here. My friends got pancakes and crepes from here and they looked and tasted delicious - the food not my friends. It's located blocks away from the Cultural Center and Millennium Park too! So after you're done eating, you can enjoy some of the Chicago sites! Isn't that great?

Pro tip: make sure you make a reservation like a week in advance. There's a ton of seating inside and a small outdoor area, but if you don't make a reservation on a weekend you could be waiting there for 1-2 hours for a table.

So a coworker told me about this place while we were in town for a convention. These people take pancakes very seriously. The service was extremely friendly and inviting. The place is big, clean, and inviting. It's a step or two down from the main street level on the corner of a building.

I ordered a mexican style skillet which was very good but then I also got their signature pancake plate which was WAY over the top for a weekday. I mean this in a good way but I didn't dare try to finish it. They stack this up with fruit and crème and all things decadent that can go sensibly on a pancake and make that a meal in itself.

I'd recommend this for a good breakfast with traditional options and also to anybody with a sweet tooth wanting fine dessert quality pancakes served with care and presentation in mind. Well done.

Good as usual.
The best brunch place in Chicago :)
Should go there early because of the line

My husband, sister, and I had breakfast at Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe our first morning in Chicago. We woke up early to beat the crowd. It wasn't until I checked in on the Yelp app that I realized we could have added ourselves to the waitlist prior to our arrival. Luckily our wait was under 30 minutes.

Once we were seated we immediately ordered coffee. The lattes are huge and are decorated with cute foam art. My sister and I ordered the Los Altos Benedict with chorizo, roasted red peppers, and pico de gallo. The dish was served with a huge portion of hash brown potatoes. The eggs were perfectly poached and balanced well with the spicy pico de gallo. While the hash browns were nice and crispy on the top, they were under seasoned.

My husband's chicken and waffles were a little underwhelming. While I enjoyed the candied bacon I wouldn't have known there were jalapenos in the waffle had they not been staring back at me. The fried chicken tenders were overcooked and dry.

While there were some hits and misses with our meal I would definitely return and try the signature berry pancakes on our next visit.

pics.caption: Fried Chicken & Waffles with candied bacon.
Los Altos Benedict with chorizo, roasted red peppers, poached eggs, pico de gallo and a side of hash browns.

review.des: The portions, quality, prices, and service are worth taking time for the experience. The only negative part of our experience was the wait, but they were within a couple minutes of the expected wait time. I guess an extended wait time is to be expected for a good establishment. I would recommend enjoying the sites in the area during the wait time and bring your appetite for breakfast.

Red velvet Swiss roll French toast!!!! OMG squeeeeeal

The food here is fantastic and so is the coffee.

Located near millennium park and not too far from the starting point for the Chicago architecture foundation river cruise.

This is somewhere you should definitely go for breakfast!

If you come here on a weekend, be prepared for a 2.5 hour wait at least. So just come earlier, drop your down and take a walk around the area. The walk will definitely prepare you for the insane amount of food that will be served.

The food is definitely worth the wait. The sizzling skillets are great, especially if you love meat. They also come with side of pancakes - which are really the size of pancake entrees at most other places. Be prepared to take some home, or carb up! You really can't go wrong with anything in this place, so just order away.

W I L D B E R R Y
.
.
Sunday's are my absolute favorite! They are for sleeping in, having brunch, and of course naps! @robfinn brought me to Wildberry in Chicago, and it did not disappoint! Wait times are crazy so make sure you get in line early (most people were waiting over an hour) but it is totally worth it!
.
.
They serve inteligencia coffee, and it was the perfect start to our day! My caffeine addict - @robfinn  showed his seal of approval by downing 3 cups of their French roast. I opted for a vanilla latte which was equally delicious.
.
.
Pancakes are drool worthy. We shared the chocolate chip banana and even came back the next day to try their signature berry bliss! The berry bliss are a definite MUST! They were so good I didn't get a chance to take a picture of them!

pics.caption: Chocolate chip banana pancakes, toast, corned beef hash!

review.des:
Such a great breakfast place!

Me and my friends came here for breakfast and naturally we each ordered our own dish. The portions here are huge!! The three of us could have just ordered and shared one entree and a stack of pancakes.

We ordered the wildberry pancakes which was good! For me, it was a little too sweet for me but the texture of the pancake was light and airy! I found myself swiping the sauce to the side. Maybe a glass if milk would have balanced out the richness. I ordered the eggs benedict (i forgot the exact name but it had spinach and bacon pieces) with the hollandaise sauce on the side. It came with hash browns as well. I only ate 1/2 of my 1 benedict and was stuffed. There was a generous amount of spinach and bacon with a very thick english muffin on the bottom. The egg was cooked perfectly and the yoke broke beautifully on top.

Service was great and the whole staff was very attentive to our needs and had great suggestions on their extensive menu. Come early though! By the time we left around 8/8:30am the front area was packed!

The hype is real folks.  Get the Corned Beef hash benedict.  It's absolutely ridiculous.  Upgrade yourself to the Wildberry pancakes and prepare to take a nap after breakfast.  

Other items we ordered were the sausage skillet, which I didn't like because it was too heavy and saturated with cheese and soggy potatoes, and the cinnamon roll pancakes, which were pretty solid.  

I had a good experience here and no doubt you will too, if you can bear the wait times.  Make sure you go on the yelp app and put yourself on the waiting list before you come here.  You'll save a LOT of time.

4 stars.

pics.caption: Eggs benedict and cinnamon roll pancakes

review.des:
The sister and I waited over an hour to get a table. We received a text when there was an available spot. Our server was friendly, but went MIA many times. The front counter is a mess and disorganized. There are so many people everywhere and even the staff can't even keep up with what's going on.

FRIED CHICKEN & WAFFLE- fried tenders, candied bacon, and diced jalapeno
I liked the hint of spice in the waffle and the savory bacon pieces, but the waffle itself was too soft and not in a fluffy, airy soft, but a boring soft soggy texture. The chicken was disappointing because they were only lightly fried and the chicken itself was bland. I would've preferred more flavor on the chicken to contrast the sweetness of the syrup and spice of the waffle.

GARDEN SIZZLIN' SKILLET- hash browns, cheddar and jack cheese, 2 eggs, mushrooms, asparagus, spinach, onions, tomatoes, and broccoli
When the skillet first comes out, the texture was on point, but gradually everything starts getting soggy because of the heat. I liked the crisp hash browns with the creamy melted cheese. The vegetables were good, but overall this dish was on the bland side. Texture was there, but I needed more flavor.

Overall, not worth the wait, but I may come back to try their sweet pancakes. Service needs improvement and definitely not worth the hype.

pics.caption: fried chicken & waffle and garden sizzlin' skillet

review.des:
All I can say is WOW! We were excited to try Wildberrys after reading the reviews on yelp. It definitely delivered! We got the Signature Berry Bliss (13$) and the Los Altos Eggs Benedict (13$). The portion sizes for both were GIGANTIC, so definitely come hungry! The signature pancakes were phenomenal - though I normally don't eat pancakes for breakfast, these ones did justice! The Los Altos Eggs Benedict has a mini spicy kick to it, which makes it delicious! Both were cooked to perfection. In addition, service was great.

PROTIP: Make a reservation from yelp 20-30 minutes ahead of time because they are ALWAYS busy, especially this location. We arrived following Yelps instructions and waited only about 5 minutes, and were seated immediately.

One of the best Mexican Skillets, amazing berry bliss pancakes, southern gravy Benny was BLABLAM!

First of all, I love my Mexican skillets, this one was full of chorizo that was cooked properly. Browned to perfection so you get a little char in each delicious bite that went exceptionally well with the hashbrowns, cilantro, roasted jalapeños, cheese, avocado, and onion mixed within. Came with a spicy (chipotle?) sauce to pour over top.  Was the shiz.

Berry Bliss Pancakes.  My girlfriend told me that the taste reminded her of a toaster strudel.  That may not sound fantastic.  But think about that time when you were a kid and you'd been eating pop tarts your whole life and you couldn't even heat em up cause you were about to miss the bus.  Then you spend the night at your friend's house and get to try a warm toaster strudel for the first time. If you mean "reminds you of a toaster strudel" in that kind of MIND BLOWN way, then yeah, I feel ya.  I thought it had a taste of delicious mixed berries and birthday cake batter.  Best pancakes I've had?  Taste wise?  Up there.  Fluffiness?  not so much, but don't let that deter you...they were hella delicious.

Southern gravy eggs Benedict -  can't remember the name of this one.  The Southerner maybe?  Idk.  It was really really good.  The sausage patty was delicious and the gravy was a little darker with what seemed to be a lot of pepper in it.  I'm a gravy man from the south and the Benny lived up to its name.  Gravy was on point and I was not disappointed.  However, this item was not one to leave you full.  Not me anyway.  Super delish tho.

I read other people's suggestion to join the waitlist on Yelp so I added us on the waitlist at 9:30am and was told to come around 10:45am. We came at 10:45 and we still had wait an additional 20 mins which wasn't too bad.

I ordered the Los Altos Benedict. It was pretty good. Instead of the hash browns, I asked them to sub it in for their berry bliss pancakes. The pancakes were delicious.

My bf ordered the Homemade Biscuit and Gravy. He liked it. He ordered a side of cinnamon pancakes and it was pretty good.

Solid brunch spot but I do feel it's a little overrated.

This place has a super efficient waiting list method. My friend and I placed ourselves on the wait list through Yelp (about an hour wait) while we were on the way from Logan Square at around 9AM on a Sunday morning. By the time we got there and checked in, we waited less than 10 minutes.

My friend and I shared the espanola omelette with hash browns/pancakes and banana coconut cream pancakes. Both were super tasty and plentiful; we ended up taking the side pancakes to go (they gave nice aluminum to go boxes). The omelette was a bit spicy, since it had jalapeños. We decided to get the banana pancakes since we both didn't want anything too sweet, but they still on the sweeter side. Overall, I would get both again.

I also ordered a hot vanilla latte. I love how they use intelligentsia coffee, because they definitely have the best drinks. My friend ordered a French roast coffee.

Overall, the service was a bit slower though, considering the size of the place. But the food came out quick and tasted great.

pics.caption: Banana coconut cream pancakes, espanola omelette w/hash browns (side pancakes not pictured), French Roast Coffee, and vanilla latte

review.des: The wait here was long. Good thing Yelp has a waitlist you can sign up for even when you're not physically at the place. The wait time was give or take 10 minutes the time Yelp and what the staff tells you. I had the biscuits and gravy. The biscuits were perfect, not too dry, not too wet. The gravy itself was very buttery. It felt like a bit too much for me. Good breakfast spot- would recommend.

Most popular spot in town for breakfast. Might be a bit overrated in my book to must go places, but still dang enjoyable and tasty. Highly recommend the bliss berry pancakes or the skillets. All of them are to die for. The wait after 9am is definitely not worth it - plan to go between 6-8am to avoid the 1.5-2 hour wait. On a beautiful summer day it's great to bring the dog out to the patio area for breakfast. All of their coffee drinks and lattes are done well. And location is unbeatable being smack dab in the middle of the loop right by the bean.

I know I'm going to get a lot of flack for saying this, but I'm saying it, this place is a step up from Denny's (gasp)! I had Wildberry on my chicago radar, but could never justify the wait times anytime I was in town. I dragged my friend here as we were staying close by. I put my name on their no wait app & we lounged in our hotel room until it was close to our time.

If you've ever been, you know how crazy hectic this restaurant is. Hoards of patrons standing outside, inside, an entourage of waiters carrying pancake stacks yelling for the crowd to move. You have a certain expectation for a place based on the demand.

I ordered a Mexican skillet w/ a side of regular pancakes & coffee while my friend had a veggie omelet. The pancake was good & I guess what they're known for. The skillet was alright, a bit too cheesy, but tamed my hunger.

I think this place is good for the millennium park hoards of tourists. I've learned my lesson.

I LOVE brunch, and this place did not disappoint! The wait is always forever, but it's super convenient that yelp allows you to add your name onto the waitlist without you physically having to be there. This way, you can explore the city while you wait, and just check in when you are instructed to. I ordered the Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes, and they are SO delicious. Definitely recommend!

pics.caption: Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes and Homemade Biscuits & Gravy

review.des:
Very busy brunch spot, our wait was about an hour and a half so I'd recommend getting on their waitlist early. We spent the wait time walking through the Millennium Park and I got a text when our table was ready.

Service was okay. The server didn't seem to enthusiastic, but she brought us everything we asked for and we didn't have to ask twice for anything.

For my meal I had the Mexicana Skillet. The dish was seasoned very well and the ingredients seemed fresh. It was served in a hot skillet. It came with pancakes but I was so full from the main course I didn't even have a bite.

The atmosphere is nice, I'd come back if I came to Chicago again.

First of all I must say it was easy to get on this waitlist straight from within the yelp app. I was able to put myself on the waitlist and be seated by the time I arrived to the restaurant. Our waitress was so pleasant and educated us about everything that was on the menu. There was a wait for our food came out piping hot and everything tasted good however I wouldn't say that this restaurant has a great brunch food tasted normal to me but nothing had such a standout taste. I did enjoy the view of a busy Chicago Street on Monday morning it was a vibrant there were people walking past some people going to work some people going to school some people just hanging out and I did love that ambience.

I know a lot people come here and complain about the wait time but.....

::PRO TIP::
add your name to the wait list through the Yelp app! Our Air BnB was 35 minutes away from the restaurant so we added ourselves to the wait list while on the way there. We checked in with the hostess and only waited a total of five minutes before being seated. Highly recommend you do this if you hate waiting.

The restaurant itself is pretty big, so to have such a long wait, you can bet it's super packed! Between the two of us, we ordered the Signature Berry Bliss and the Mexicana Skillet. The pancakes were too sweet for me, but if you have a sweet tooth this item is perfect for you ^_^ Pancakes come with berries, vanilla anglaise, blackberry coulis, and berry mascarpone. It's a huge serving so I recommend sharing with someone!

Hands down my favorite item was the Mexicana Skillet though. If I came back to the restaurant, I would probably order this item again. It comes with hash browns, cheddar & jack cheese, eggs, chorizo sausage, jalapeno, avocado, cilantro & onions. People who prefer savory dishes will like this option!

Overall, Wildberry is a great place for affordable, decent brunch. Sure, there are way better restaurants I've tried in Chicago but they were also triple the price of this place. So if you're dining on a budget, come here. Skip the IHOP or Mickey Dee's breakfast.

What an awesome pace for pancakes. They have other items but we came here for the pancakes. We got a table outside and that was fun. We also used the online waitlist thing and that was perfect. We walked around town instead of sitting outside their door.

The breakfast was delicious but not really sure if a 2 hour wait is worth it. I wish I had known earlier about the Yelp check in earlier. We found out as we were heading out of our hotel so we had to kill time around the area.

It was not fun having to wait, we were starving by the time we sat down. I got the butcher's block skillet with a side of cinnamon bun pancakes. Hands down the best pancakes I've ever had. It was sooooo goood, I'm drooling at the thought. It tasted just like a cinnamon bun with all the yummy goodness from pancakes. The butcher's block was huge and honestly I could've shared it with my husband because I couldn't finish it.

My husband got the fig omelette, wasn't as good as mine. I thought it was weird but he enjoyed it.

Would come again for their pancakes but will make sure to put my name well in advance or come after the rush.

My bf and I trekked here from Rogers park on a Monday morning via CTA's red line and was rewarded with an amazing breakfast well worthy of waking up early! This place was highly recommended by multiple friends when I had told them I was visiting Chicago, so I had high expectations and an empty stomach when I went! Wildberry didn't disappoint with their huge portions, fantastic service, and tasty breakfast!

We didn't have to wait. Yes. You read that right. We beat the morning rush and arrived around 8:30am on a Monday because we knew that if we wanted to avoid long waits, we needed to avoid the weekends (of course) and anytime after 9:30, as the rest of Chi-town wakes up and walks over.

We were immediately greeted by Justine, a very personable and energetic server who had a bright smile on her face, when we were seated. We told her we were new to this, and needed time to peruse the menu but ordered coffee ($3.5 each). She came back shortly with coffee and cream, and took our orders. I had the signature berry bliss ($13) and my bf has the butcher skillet ($14). The signature berry bliss came with five stacks of pancakes drizzled with fruity glaze. There was also an arrangement of fruits on the side, such as blackberries, strawberries and blueberries. The portions were huge and I think I only ate 3/5s of the pancakes but devoured all the fruit. The butcher skillet came with cheese, eggs, hash browns, and meat. My bf liked that it was served still in the pan. The butcher skillet came with a side of two pancakes too! My bf ate everything (not surprised, lol) and definitely thought this place was worth waking up for.

Wildberry, we were so glad we finally had a chance to dine here and it felt like we hit the jackpot because we didn't have any stress during our visit. Definitely recommend this place for breakfast and brunch! You won't be disappointed as long as you plan ahead.

I truly truly love this place. There is so much to love. Everything on the menu is delicious and plentiful, the prices are amazing and for being how busy they are, the service is on point.

The wait time sucks, but good things come to those who wait! And hey, you can put your name on the waitlist ahead of time! The options are there for you!!
Plus the turn around time is so fast because everyone here seems like they are good at their jobs.

We got the cinnamon bun pancakes, the eggs Benedict, the panini and a veggie&cheese bake. Everything was fast, hot and delicious and the bill capped in at $40. Not bad, not bad at all.

Found this place on yelp, just a few short blocks away from our hotel in downtown Chicago.
They had pancakes and well over 4,200 reviews so we were game!

You're also able to reserve your table on the yelp app which is always sweet because who likes to wait? - not me! I'm as impatient as it gets.  Hey! I'm working on it.

Upon arrival I cringed a little because there was a ton of people outside and I'm thinking shit.. it's freezing I don't want to wait outside, I'm not built for this life. We walked in and the place was super packed! Not sure if everyone had a reservation, but we did... so we told the hostess and she said we would receive a text shortly. We actually did wait an additional 20 minutes to be seated which sucked because at this point I'm HANGRY! No one wants to see me hangry! As my stomach made its last rumble we got the text! YES, that text! That our table was ready, thank you baby Jesus.

This place is similar to a diner style, very busy, hustle and bustle flipping orders left and right, no wonder why there was a wait. These people looked like they were enjoying themselves.

Our waiter although I wish I remembered his name was awesome! I mean talk about hospitality and great customer service, this dude was working the room. Remembering everyone's orders and was super friendly.  

I ordered some scrambled eggs with applewood bacon and hash browns, my boyfriend ordered pancakes a side of sunny side eggs. The order took less than 15 minutes to come out which made me so so happy!

Overall this place was great, no 5 star review only because we made a reservation on the app and we still had to wait 20 minutes extra to be seated, however this place is great. Highly recommend!

Are you impatient? Do you just love waiting in lines? Actually, this question will drive home what I'm getting at: Does watching other people eat, for about 40 minutes or so, get you pumped?
