If you answered "no" to question #1 and "yes" to question #2, STOP READING. More importantly, if you answered "yes" to the last question, I'll pray for you but you should stop reading too.

For the rest of the group, let's get to it.

Wildberry has the pleasure of being in an extremely high traffic area, numerous hotels (i.e. Fairmont, Hyatt, etc.), major corporations (i.e. Aon, Blue Cross, etc.) and posh residential buildings (posh meaning the anorexic version of manhattan). So I get it, their foot traffic is next level but the food was "meh."

It's not bad, it's not great. It's edible and decent. By the way, I'm very aware that I spent 95% of this review talking about everything aside from food, but the experience was more pronounced.

If you're in the area, try it out, but you may want to bring a tent, water and granola because you'll be waiting longer than patience allows! If you're not inpatient, you don't mind lines out the door, and you get off watching other people eat, THIS IS YOUR SPOT.
Wild berry pancakes were absolutely DELICIOUS!! The breakfast options were average. But the wild berry pancakes are a must.
Usually wait is about 1-2 hours but the experience definitely worth the wait. Recommend the signature pancakes!

Read the reviews on yelp and had to go. I was glad I did. Here's the short story. You have to get there early or you will have a long wait. With that said even if you have to wait -- it's worth the wait. So wait... or get there early. I go hungry the portions are huge. I'll be having my leftover pancakes for the next three days -- and living it.
There's nothing fancy about the place but you're not there for fancy you're there for the food. It is very clean and comfortable.
We got there Sunday morning about 7:15 and was seated in a booth right away. The place was 3/4s full. By the time we left the line was out the door.
Sarah our waitress was attentive and wonderful.
If you are in Chicago ya gotta go. Well worth it.
Oh let me not forget the food -- I had pumpkin pancakes with chicken sausage and my wife had an omelet with a side of pancakes which came with a bowl of fruit. LOVED IT and DELICIOUS.

Really enjoyed my service here at wild berry! They live up to the hype! My boyfriend and I came to Chicago on a random trip and I've heard such great things about this place so I decided to try. When we got there , there was a wait but we were seated faster then what they said. The staff was very nice and we were able to sit outside. The food was delicious! The portions are big so you can easily split it with someone else. They even had a variety of fresh juices. If I'm in Chicago I would definitely go back!

Wow! Very impressed with the pancakes! The best ones I've eaten so far. If you go it's a must. I also tried the Strawberry & Chocolate Waffles and Eggs Benedict, and they were really good too, but the pancakes definitely won! 

The only negative aspect is that the restaurant is very crowded most of the time. The waiting is from 30 to 45 minutes. So, if you go put yourself on the waiting list here on Yelp before you get there.

pics.caption: Classic Eggs Benedict with Hash browns

review.des:
I stopped into Wildberry for breakfast one morning before a long day at the conference at the Hyatt nearby. It was just what I needed! My waiter was super friendly and very personable. It made my morning just that much brighter!

I had their banana chocolate chip pancakes. Do not be greedy like me and think you can finish a large order. Do yourself a favor and get the smaller order and actually finish your food.

Also, definitely order the wildberry orange juice. It's really good! It's tangy and sweet and super refreshing.

Cute little cafe to stop for breakfast, inside and outside patio seating! By far the BEST chicken and waffles I've ever eaten and reasonable pricing!!! Our food came out hot and delicious, the bacon was super tasty and the service was excellent! Our server was Jennifer S. and she did wonderful! I wish we had a cafe like this in my hometown

Anyone I asked for a recommendation when I was heading to Chicago mentioned Wildberry. This was the first place I ate and was definitely a great kick off to a great time in Chicago. First things first, I have to mentioned how much I loved the wait queue on yelp! Seriously wished all restaurants had this. Makes life much more easier. By the time we got our of our Uber, we waited 5 minutes until we were seated in this cozy restaurant. Here's what I ordered below:
Corned Beef Hash Skillet 5/5 - uh-maze-ingggg! As my sis always calls me out on, this is my favorite go to brekkie and I absolutely loved it hear. It came in a skillet so the beef and meat were crunch on the edges but super soft and melted in my mouth in the middle. Loved the over easy egg on top!
Berry Bliss 5/5 - you can add ANY of the speciality pancakes to your meal and of course I had to get the signature berry bliss! Pancakes were like fluffy clouds and the berry bliss was perfection.
Hazelnut Latte 5/5 - so creamy and I loved the hazelnut flavor! Not too strong of coffee which was great for me. Perfect with the pancakes and warming up!
What a way to start your morning! Can't wait to return once I'm back in the city!!

I am a brunch snob a little bit. I don't love anything more than I love brunch. And this is the BEST brunch I have EVER had. The wait was intense, but if you join the yelp waitlist you can go walk around until they're almost ready for you. Go here. And get the mexicana (scramble? Hash?) the thing in the skillet. BestthingIeverate

The wait is pretty long so make sure to come early to put your name down. You can then go explore the surrounding areas like Millennium Park. You'll receive a text when your table is almost ready.

Food - Every bite here is so yummy, from the sweet to the savory! I highly recommend the Napa Valley Fig Omelette. The cheese is really something! I opted for the fries instead of the hash browns and it was one of the best fries I've ever tasted! It was crispy golden, yum!

We got the sub pancake for $1.50 more in addition to the main entree. This comes with 2 pancakes instead of the standard stack, which in my opinion is more than enough. The two types recommended by our waitress are the berry and the cinnamon. I personally prefer the cinnamon more as it has a more unique and sweeter taste.

Unfortunately I'm limited to only giving this place 5 stars, because I would give it a 10 if I could! The service is exceptional, the food is amazing, and you get such a big portion for an extremely affordable price!

The visit far exceeded my expectations set by my visit last year
The restaurant was crazy but you would never know it. The servers were so very nice and sincere, not just pleasant. They offered recommendations and told us which dishes were the staff's favorites. There were an abundance of staff members from waiters, helpers, bussers and even managers seating people, clearing finished plates and tables and making the place run efficiently. They have obviously been well trained and enjoy working here. All of the people working were not noticeable as to be distracting. It was a pleasant efficiency.

The food is amazing. My husband, the skeptic, that was put off by the whole wait list. Was instantly won over as he tasted "the best pancakes he ever had".  The Cinnamon Roll Pancakes. They are like no others.

The portions are large. You could get a few different dishes and share or just take 1/2 of yours home for later.

I highly recommend the
Cinnamon Roll Pancakes
The Rustic Panini with 2 eggs
The Corn Beef Hash Skillet
I am sure every item in the menu is awesome.

You need to eat here

Who is big fan of brunch food? I am!

My friend and I visited here 7am in the morning after seeing the Bean. We were lucky that there was no line to wait especially when I heard that you have to wait a hour to get into this place. We were quickly seated in a spacious table. Our waiter was friendly and attentive. We order egg Benedict and their famous berry pancake.

Oh my gosh...the pancake was the most fluffiest and soft pancake I ever had in life. It was spongy, moist, warm and fluffy that I felt like I was eating cloud. The warm pancake was filled with fresh berries that burst in my mouth. This is what I called a breakfast/brunch food! The portion is huge at reasonable price. I personally didn't like egg Benedict. I had better ones but pancake is worth having! Every bite was heavenly. I would love to go back to try different pancake!

OMG ... so overrated. Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe is really just like a pricier Dennys with a wait.

The food is average ok fare, but the disappearing service and long wait to get seated really mean you've had better (2 stars). Here's what I've tried so far:

* Peppermint Mocha
Sweet & satisfying

* Kiwi Lemonade
Kiwi-tastic! ... and sweet

* Berry Bliss Pancakes
Flat pancakes with berry yogurt & frest fruit on the side

* Florence Eggs Benedict
Typical poached eggs with bacon & spinach

* Chopped Salad
Satisfying healthy pile of greens when you want a lot of food

Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe is large and popular, but the food, service, and wait weren't really anything different than your safe local chain diner.
Adequate breakfast food...their signature hash brown egg omelette is satisfying! Clean but worn out!!

This place is a good but I wouldn't wait for more than 30 mins for it. It was a super nice December day in Chicago, so as visitors we grabbed a coffee and just walked around.
My friend and I split one order (skillet + signature berry pancakes.) That was the perfect amount because we felt satisfied and not overstuffed. Everyone surrounding us had so much food since they ordered individually. Btw, berry pancakes are wayyy too sweet for me. Could do without the condensed milk and berry syrup.
Brunch food is always good but never mind blowing.

pics.caption: Denver Skillet with signature Berry pancakes

review.des:
Amazing
Make sure you join the yelp waitlist
Even the Mr loved it
Skillets are a must
Fun pancakes
Yummy chai latte
Worth it
And fast once ur sitted

Oh man, I love brunch and this place really deserves the five stars. My friend and I found this place on yelp while in Chicago for vacation and decided to come here one morning to start our day.

I got their Florence Benedict which comes with spinach and bacon. It was so delicious! Some small complaints I had about the food was that there wasn't much bacon and one of the eggs were slightly overcooked and was not runny. The meal was still delicious though and I loved that they gave me so much spinach. My friend's scramble dish was delicious as well and the pancake that we got as the side.

I really love that you can simply join the waitlist through yelp and check your place in line. No need to go to the restaurant and wait for hours for your name to be called. Its located in a touristy spot right by the bean, so there's plenty to sightsee while waiting! I would recommend being in the area once you're close in line since they only give you 5 minutes to come check in once your table is ready.

Ordered eggs with bacon and french toast while my girlfriend ordered the berry pancakes. The latte was great and they even served the drink in a to go cup just like starbucks which is convenient. The waitress was really nice and recommended which entree to try. The place was busy but super clean with a great staff who worked fast to sit us down, take our order and serve us. I will definitely come back as much as I can!

Expect a long wait of 1 hour to 1.5 hours on a SUNDAY morning. You can track your wait time through Yelp!

Slow roast brisket hash. The brisket was good but wish it was slightly fattier. The hash browns are good but could be crispier. I would give the plate itself a 4 Star.

Pancakes. My friend ended up ordering one of the pancakes with fruits. It looks pretty appealing on pictures but DO NOT ORDER IF YOU'RE EASILY OVERWHELMED BY SWEETS. That plate is so sweet, we could not take more than 3 bites per person. I would recommend getting their smallest pancake dish as a side or order pancakes with only a quarter of syrup. It was wayyyyyyyyyy too sweet.

Within walking distance of my hotel, this breakfast & brunch eatery was the 1st on my list. After reading the reviews, I expected a longer wait on a weekend.  The energy in this place is high all the way until the tables and chairs are put up.
The star of the show, for me was the pancakes. I had every intention to try the signature stack of fluffy, golden, heavenly goodness until I learned the flavor of the month was keylime cream white chocolate chip pancakes. I also ordered a vegetable omelet that was just as yummy... going back. Gotta try the signature pancakes...

pics.caption: Keylime cream white chocolate chips pancake

review.des: Wildberry is the best breakfast I've had. It was well worth the 1.5 hour wait.  You can add your name to the waitlist before arriving though. The service is excellent.  Our waiter was friendly,  prompt, and attentive.  We didn't have to ask for a thing. He anticipated everything we would need and kept our drinks refilled even with the restaurant being so busy. I had the pancake, eggs, and chicken sausage. Everything was delicious.  The pancakes were super fluffy.  I've never tasted pancakes so good. The eggs were perfectly made and the chicken sausage had great flavor.  The portion sizes are good too. Wildberry will be my go to when in the Chicago area. This restaurant will not disappoint.

Your typical breakfast place with a ridiculously long wait.  The food is great and definitely worth the wait if you have time, but I wouldn't wait in that line more than maybe once a year.  We put our names down and took a walk around the park to kill the time while we waited.  

Once seated our food came out very quickly, thank god.  All the food is really good, but their sweet options are my personal favorites!

This place was awesome! Very cute outside and in. The staff was so nice from the moment we arrived to the moment they handed us our coffees to go at the door.

Lots of gluten free options here which is always a plus. I had the berry waffle with a side of bacon and it was simply delectable. The waffle was cooked to perfection and the bacon was as well. The drip coffee was just fine.

The portion sizes were immense so you're definitely getting your money's worth here. The service was also very fast!

I'm only here for a couple of days and I'm debating visiting again because it was so good!

pics.caption: Gluten free special berry waffle with Applewood Smoked Bacon

review.des:
Have come here a couple times now and they don't disappoint. They are also, obviously, a favorite in the area. They are always exceptionally packed. Typically they get people in and out pretty quickly so wait times aren't too bad.

Great breakfast selection. From egg plates that allow you to pick the style of meat that you want to sausage and gravy biscuits. They also have a huge variety of eggs benedict and omelets.

Once trip I tried one of the 'Sizlin' Skillets', the Mexicana (hash brown's, cheddar & jack cheese, 2 eggs, chorizo sausage, jalapeno, avocado, cilantro and onion). This skillet is amazing! Everything about it tasted do good.

On another trip I had the signature berry bliss Belgium waffle. This too was sooooo good. I would have preferred that the fruit wasn't mixed in a yogurt topping on top of the waffle. But, for a yogurt it wasn't too bad and the berries were really fresh.

Wrap it up with pancakes, French toast creations, sandwiches and paninis and they have a pretty solid menu that offers a great variety.

Also, don't forget to order one of their signature lemonades (blackberry is hands down the best!!!!). They also offer free refills on these.

Total price comes in just under $20, which is a little more than I like to spend for breakfast. Staff is friendly, but I don't think that they go above and beyond to do anything to make it a wow designing experience.

Still worth while going and would return here next time we are in the city for a trade show.

Amazingggggggggg. I ordered the Chorizo Eggs Benedict which were nice and spicy. My friend had a pepper jack cheese omelet with a side of the Oreo Dream Pancakes. Those pancakes must be served in heaven. 100% worth the wait.

Returned 3 years later. Still awesome! Arrived at 745am and no wait. I had a breakfast burrito sub turkey bacon. (I love that you can put other meats in it.) it was awesome.
Everyone I was with loved their pancakes, omelettes, French toast (special--had Wisconsin cherries). Definitely recommend.

pics.caption: Breakfast spread! Eggs Benedict. White chocolate mocha. Hashbrowns! Omelette. Skillet. Strawberries and bacon. All very good!

review.des:
I'm so incredibly impressed. Every second of our time spent here was wonderful. We walked in to 3 extremely friendly and attentive hostesses who quickly got us seated. Our server was energetic and fun. The staff all seems like such a family that's having a good time, interacting with each other and the customers while providing excellent service. I'm never seen such a happy and smooth restaurant staff. On top of that, the food was absolutely incredible. Both of us decided it was the best French toast/crepes we've had. We both ordered 'berry bliss'.

It is very, very sweet. It's covered in sauce and tons of berries. In the inside it has strawberry creme filling. I'm generally not one to like stuff like this, but it's an exception. It was so good. I also ordered the cinnamon spice latte that was equally as good. They use intelligenista coffee. It wasn't too sweet, but just the right amount of milk and sugar and cinnamon to be very enjoyable.

My whole experience here was so amazing. I want everyone to try this place. Highly recommend!

This place is so popular! We arrived around 8 and waited for about 30min to get a table. If you want to visit on weekend, be sure to arrive as early as possible.
In terms of food, everything was delicious! We had the goat cheese omelet with berry bliss pancake on the side and the egg Benedict. The pancake was fluffy and sweet to the right point. Very delicious. Omelette was also very good!

Good food, always crowded (which means the food is good) and the staff is great! Large plates that will guarantee you tasty leftovers!
I try to visit Widberry whenever I can. Never a disappointment.

"G" was a knowledgeable server who gave perfect suggestion on what to order. Everything sounded so good that I had to get input. Being not so much of a breakfast person... this was crucial!

I ordered the Mexicana skillet (spicy!) with the cinnamon roll pancakes (wow. Delicious with this cream cheese and maple glaze!!!).

My husband got the brisket hash-- he and I are picky about gravy and he wasn't the biggest fan of the gravy, but said it was good overall and he ate most of it.

To drink we had coffee and wild berry OJ. It was all very good. Hubs had the coffee and stated that it was very good! The OJ was different with lots of berry pieces-- not too sweet or tart!

I'm pretty sure you're suppose to share your skillets! They are huge... and then you have the pancakes that come along for the ride. Woah! Stuffed! That pic is what was left after I felt like I just ate and ate forever. Not even a dent in it! Definitely a plate to share, making it super affordable! For me, it's most likely 3 meals worth.

By far, THEE ULTIMATE BREAKFAST restaurant in Chicago! Oh My Goodness Gracious... Please, order the Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes. Try it and enjoy it! I seriously mean it. These pancakes are the FLUFFIEST pancakes in the world. The texture and taste of the pancakes is SURREAL and cannot be replicated anywhere else.

It is SO WORTH the wait. Depending on when you go, there can be a TWO HOUR wait. We reserve our spot in the virtual line through yelp. The check in app only appears during business hours. The estimated time on the line check in app is very accurate. So this will help you cut down on the wait time.

P.S. Come extra hungry. Portions are extremely generous. :P

pics.caption: The best pancakes in the world! Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes are to die for! So worth the wait!

review.des:
I did not quite understand the fuzz and craze about this place.
I mean the food was nice with big portions but not that great to justify the hour(s) long wait. I was lucky to get a table on arrival since I had a larger group. This was 7 am on a Sunday morning and people had queued up.
The servers were courteous. They have an assembly line kinda efficiency to cater to the rush.

I by no means disliked the food. I just don't get the hype.

Try going early. Like 630 am.
Great food. Had the Wild Turkey sandwich. Delicious. The wife had omelet with figs. It was good as well. The service was good as well.

Tried this place on my birthday weekend I must say it did not disappoint!! There was a bit of a long wait but once we were seated we got our food pretty quickly. Our waitress was very friendly and patient. I wish we had a good breakfast/ brunch place like this in St. Louis!

Great place, definitely something for everyone. There was a huge wait (like two+ hours) when we came in, so I highly recommend you put yourself on the wait list prior (we did and were seated 3 minutes after arriving).
The Oreo s'mores pancakes were delicious if you're a sweet tooth, although warning, they're huge!
My dad and mom got scrambled eggs/an omelet and said they were also superb. Bacon was A+ too (and if you get toast, I suggest you try their jam). The wait staff was super attentive and our food came out in less than ten minutes. An amazing place just put in your name in quickly!

This is probably one of the tougher reviews that I've written because I have a love/hate relationship with Wildberry. I really want to love this place but they keep giving me mediocre food and service.

I've visited Wildberry on three separate occasions. Prior to visiting Wildberry everyone that I encountered raved about this place. I couldn't wait to visit because who wouldn't want to visit a place that everyone raved about! It was like when your name is called on the Price is Right and you have to run down to potentially win a prize.

My prize when I first visited was a long wait time and burnt potatoes that ruined my skillet. On my second visit, this visit was inspired by a friend that really wanted to check out Wildberry, I tried one of the pancake specials. The pancakes were beautifully decorated but it was like eating pure sugar. I ended up having to scrape off all the sauce in order to enjoy the meal.

I will say that Wildberry is beautiful inside and they have a nice outdoor patio. The patio faces Millennium Park so you get to observe the beauty that is Millennium Park.

I don't foresee visiting Wildberry unless I have friends in town that drag me to the restaurant.

Best place I've been to for breakfast. The wait is a bit of a hassle if you're in a hurry, especially on weekends, but the food is killer and hands down the best pancakes you can get. The variety they had to choose from was something that drew me and my family in, and the food was just as amazing as how we thought it would be. The location is in a nice setting, and if you make a reservation before hand you're sure to get in faster than most, so that's just a recommendation I want to give.

The food is good (try the barbacoa nachos).  The wait is ridiculous but you can forgo the 2 hour waits if you just use Yelp to get in line virtually.  It's a pretty standard diner which is why I'm giving it 4 stars.  Everything is good.  Omelettes are good, skillets, Benedict's, juice, pancakes.  But the only thing that's great are those nachos.

This place was worth the wait--if you do it correctly!  Yelp lets you put yourself on a waitlist as soon as they open as long as you can check in by a certain point.  We woke up, but ourselves in the waitlist (60-90minutes) were both able to shower and walk about 15 minutes from the loop.  Once we got there, we checked in and only had to wait another 10 minutes before being seated.

HIGHLY SUGGESTED to do this!  When we got there we saw the plaza packed with people waiting.  We even had people go in front of us put their names on the list with a 2 hour wait!

I got the Barbacoa chilaquilas skillet with a a side of blueberry pancakes instead of toast.  Holy moly are the proportions HUGE.  Make sure you're hungry when you go!

The skillet was delicious! Way too big I took half of it home.  All the ingredients were distributed really well so that I got bites that I got everything! The barbacoa was tender and seasoned well.  Will definitely come back here again.

First time in Chicago....Everyone I spoke with said this place was a must have! So I decided to give it a try. I should have read the reviews prior. The waitlist was ridiculous. We waited 2 hours outside in the Chicago heat. I did not want to leave without knowing what all the hype was about.

Wildberry did not let me down. The Wildberry Specialty Pancakes are packed with favor that are mouthwatering. I would recommend 100%. I also ordered the Mexicanna skillet. The skillet was satisfactory, not too much to boast about. The highlight of the meal was definitely the pancakes.

This was the most amazing cafe! Of course I had to try the berry bliss pancakes....to die for!! My main dish was the Rutherford omelet OMG so delicious.
The menu had so many different dishes to choose from. Even my girl Jessie who is picky found something yummy to eat. You want a delicious place to eat for breakfast go here!!!

When I was looking for brunch places on a recent solo trip to chicago, this place kept stumbling on top of most the google searches I did. I was hesitant though because it seems like a chain and from photos I saw of the inside it seemed very commercial and didn't have a local feel.

I'm so glad I got over that and decided to stop in. I went for the classic berry pancakes since that seemed like their specialty and they were pretty darn good! The only thing I wished was that they put more of the cream cheese type cream they use in between the pancakes cause they were a little dry without syrup (the waitress asked if i wanted some, but i said no).

All their lemonades are good here too. It was a super hot day when I was in town and the waitress was nice enough to offer me one in a to go cup because she knew that I was walking around outside! Super nice of her, so this place gets my vote for excellent service!

Takeaway: Simply not worth your time.

We wanted to like it because all the things it has going for it: huge menu, professional and efficient waitstaff, artful presentation, and good coffee but the most important part was lacking: the food.
We ordered Nutella Crepes and Eggs Benedict. The crepes were soggy, far too thick, and bland. The hash browns were somehow simultaneously over and under cooked. The Eggs Benedict had a great, thick slice of ham topped with fantastic velvety eggs but the hollandaise sauce was too acidic, either from lemon or vinegar I'm not sure.

We hoped that two hours of wait time (only 20 minutes in the restaurant thanks to Yelp's Waitlist) would equate to something to remember. Unfortunately that was not the case.

pics.caption: Nutella Crepes & Classic Eggs Benedict w/ Hash Browns

review.des: The seasonal pumpkin pancakes were everythinggg . The service was fast and friendly. Considering it was PACKED on a Sunday morning it was great to still get great service. I'll definitely be back for the pancakes alone ! The 45+ minute wait was annoying but anywhere you go on a Sunday morning will be a long wait.

Happy New Year!!  It's been forever since I last posted a review, and even longer since my last visit to Chicago!  

Our flight landed in O'Hare at about 6am Christmas Eve.  We all know red-eye flights are no fun - sleep deprived and grumbly tummies are not a good combo.  So we decided to brace the more than chilly 5 degrees and headed into town for some breakfast.  

I was so excited Wildberry was opened on Christmas Eve!  Since we got there super early, there was also no wait.  Score!  We were quickly seated by our lovely hostess and I got right to work on the menu.  It felt like the options were endless.  Waffles, pancakes, skillets, scrambles, bennys, and more.  We asked our server for recommendations and she recommended the Signature Berry Bliss and the Mexicana skillet with hashbrown, eggs, chorizo, jalapenos, avocados, onions and cilantro.  

The Signature Berry Bliss was delicious!  The pancakes were super fluffy and delicate and the berry sauce was just perfect.  Extra syrup not necessary.  I'm generally more of a savory breakfast person, so the boyfriend and I shared this along with the Mexicana skillet. The skillet wasn't exactly what I was expecting.  I usually love chorizo and eggs together, but I almost felt like this dish had too much going on with very little flavor.  It was a little too heavy for me.  I would totally order the Berry Bliss again probably skip on the Mexicana next time around.  

Oh, and the peppermint mocha was PERFECT.  I had all the feels of Christmas in just one sip.  

Spacewise, it's a pretty decent sized restaurant.  Good for large parties, but keep in mind that reservations are not accepted.  Felt cozy and warm.  

Service was excellent.  Our server was very friendly, attentive, and our waters were there as soon as we sat down.  I'm sure with the amount of traffic they receive, speediness and efficiency is of utmost importance, and that was all much appreciated.

Downside:
- Street parking is $6.50 an hour.. ugh
- Reservations not accepted

Overall, we had a nice experience.  There are a lot of yummy options on the menu and I would definitely give it another go the next time I'm in town.

When I was told the wait would be 90 minutes.........I paused. Typical I might gasp, but if the restaurant is handling a wait list like that, and I was there on a Sunday (so I had time), I figured it had to be good. So I conceded and decided that these pancakes had better be the best I'd ever had LOL. And honestly, these came pretty close. This place has mastered the wait game -- they text you that your table is ready and you need to show up within 10 minutes. Luckily I opted for a stroll down Michigan and was still close enough to respond when my table was up.

Service was very friendly --  this place moves like a typical breakfast spot - quickly and with quality. The menu is extensive, so lots of unexpected choices to me, like the honey toffee nut latte. The flavor wasn't overpowering but still there and very delightful. For brunch, I ordered the strawberry poppyseed pancakes and had enough to take home as the portion was huge. By first glance, I was worried they'd be too sweet, and I don't like candy breakfasts like some places serve, but these weren't too sweet at all. Everything was fresh - strawberries, lemon peel shavings, lemon drizzle.....so good. I was actually surprised at how good they were.

I would absolutely return, likely when my family comes to town to visit me here in the Windy City - it's that good that you want your mom to taste it.

My wife and I came here during our trip to Chicago and this ended up being the best place we ate at in this foodie town. Loved this place. First of 2 times we came here I got the waffle and fried chicken. Now I'm not really into this dish too much but this has been the first time that I really liked this dish! which says something about this one. The second dish I had on my second trip was the Omelet and side pancake. Was great and loved both dishes. Were prepared just right and the service was friendly and prompt.
Side note - If you go here, the lines can get long so check in with the app to save your place in line and you can plan ahead and arrive at the suggested wait time.

YUM YUM YUM!
The hype of this place is ALL real! The food is AMAZING, best place I ate in Chicago during my visit.
Tip: use yelp for the line waitlist, it's very useful, but they seem to get through their waits fairly quick

Signature berry bliss : this is exactly what they're known for, it comes as pancakes, waffles, and crepes. I'm more of a waffle kind of girl, but I'm sure having it on any of the other options would be just as amazing! The fruit and berry whipped cream is the perfect combo and and not too street on the waffles, I can't imagine any other waffles beating these!

Los Altos Benedict: the chorizo is a bit on the spicier side, but the Benedict and hash browns together makes an awesome bite

I wish I could give this place more than 5 stars. If you are looking for a cute breakfast/lunch spot, look no further. Everything from the decor, to the service, to the food and menu selection is EXCELLENT.

My group waited about 20 minutes - this place is so popular and busy, but I promise the wait is worth it. I got the Fresh Berries & Granola Specialty Pancakes. WOW. It was the most amazingly beautiful dish I've ever seen and it tasted fantastic. I never knew I could love breakfast food this much.

If you're visiting Chicago, build this into your itinerary! Every person in my group loved it. Highly recommend!
Ordered buttermilk pancakes and waitress asked "are you sure? The berry pancakes are the favorite." We changed the order and happy we did. Delicious!

Wildberry is always an excellent choice for brunch, if you can get in before the lines! This place is always packed with a line out the door--even today when Chicago is 4-degrees Fahrenheit!

I was in the hankering for biscuits and gravy after seeing the ones from Little Goat Diner. I got mine with scrambled eggs and an additional side of chicken sausage. The food was good, and hit the spot on.l this cold blustery day. I also had a glass of their freshly squeezed Wildberry orange juice.

This place is known for their pancakes and waffles, which I have had on a number of occasions. Definitely check them out--they are definitely good to share with a group.

Key tip: get here early (8:00 am) for no-wait seating. By the time I left (9:00 am) there was a large crowd waiting inside the foyer and outside!!

Occasion: Date, Solo, Family, Kids, Friends
Tip: Parking would be difficult here, and the wait can be long. It's a good idea to get a reservation online.
Experience: The food here is fantastic and comfort at its best. There are gluten free items here that I recommend to anyone! The service was okay, and our table was not extremely clean. It is understandable because of how busy it gets here. But with knowing how busy, it gets its good to plan on having enough people to assist with clean up.

We came at 8am on Friday morning,  there was a crazy line already. Make sure to download the no wait app to check in beforehand. We did that and only waited about 10 mins. We checked in at the hotel and rode the cab over. It saved lots of time.

The food was delicious,  a little pricey for breakfast .

We tried the berry blintz, lots of fruit filled with berry cream. It melts in your mouth.
My daughter loved the cinnamon pancake. A little too sweet for me.

Benedict was good, didnt wow me.

Homemade Cornbeef hash was my favorite dish, came with hashbrowns and eggs. Definitely shareable.

Chocolate chip banana bread French toast: it arrives in front of you arrayed in a toppled tower of three generous pieces of banana bread.

Decadent-looking, you think. What if it is overwhelming? Too much sweet? You try it tentatively, cautiously even. It is... fantastic. Not too sweet. Real banana flavor. Soft. Smeared with melted chocolate chips and topped with banana slices. You also try it with the syrup too because, why not? To your amazement, also not overly saccharine. Sweet, definitely, but not overpoweringly so.

You like to get a hit of both sweet and savory, not always together. This time you felt drawn to the corned beef hash and you went for it. You find it quite nice. Crispy and browned hashed potato top, with flavorful beef embedded throughout. Adding a dash of ketchup gives it a tomato twist, which you do every so often to mix it up.

You're freaking stuffed. Pleased. Boxes to go, please.

Overall, solid breakfast place. The wait is not terrible even though it looks like it. The service has always been good and I usually get their traditional breakfast, eggs, crispy bacon, potatoes and their pancakes. You can do one of their pancake specialties for a small up charge which is well worth it. I got their fig walnut pancake one time and it was really delicious. I think this place can be easily overhyped, as many breakfast places can be. If you have a sweet tooth, you would enjoy this place. I am more of the savory breakfast person, so I always try to find a place with quality thick cut bacon which this place fell a little short.

This hot hot hot spot for breakfast, just north of Millennium Park downtown Chicago, is no joke. The wait is long, but check in online or on Yelp to get in line for a table. You will then be sent a confirmation text. Do this from your hotel room, then get in the shower. You will have plenty of time. They will give you time estimates and a ticker of how many people are still in front of you. Follow the directions and check in again after your second text message. It's a good idea to get there and sit out side to wait for your table. It's not covered, partially shaded, and no formal seating so plan accordingly.

Once you get inside - oh boy!  The place isn't as big as you think, but it's a well-oiled machine of excellent service and amazing food!  It was so hard to choose so I won't tell you options but keep to what was actually ordered.
OJ - very good but I thought too sweet. Hubs thought it excellent.
Wild mushroom omelette, fruit, upgrade to wild berry pancakes, with a side of chipotle hollandaise sauce - best decision I made all day. Huge omelette with a nice balance of meat, mushrooms and cheese. the cheese was very good. I am glad I had the hollandaise as omelettes tend to be a little dry and the flavor of the hollandaise was an outstanding compliment to the dish. I could only look longing at the pancakes, as I was TOO FULL to have more than one bite. Those buggers were topped off with syrup and packed up to take home with me. They made great dessert/treat later that night. The cakes were light and just a little crispy on edges.

My husband had a plate full of pancakes - with a side of bacon. The bacon is thick and 4 pieces to an order. We were only two but should have been 4 of us to take on that much food. It was amazing. Highly recommended, but I doubt ANYONE will read this, since my review is being tossed in with 5300+ other reviews already posted for this place. It's that popular.

I would love to know the stats of turnover per day for this place. We sent our kids there for breakfast the next day. They loved it too.
OMG...you have to try this place! Absolutely fantastic food, great atmosphere and excellent service.

Ordered Wildberry pancakes. There's a reason that it's their signature dish. It tastes amazing! The pancakes are fluffy as cloud. Love the blueberries when they burst out in my mouth. Their vanilla sauce is clearly made out of real vanilla beans. I can see the seeds in the sauce. And it definitely smells and tastes different than the ones made from vanilla extract.
We wait about two hours, but the food really worths the wait! Would love to come here earlier the next time though hahaha
I recently moved to the area and it took six months to get in. Was worth the wait!! I really enjoyed the food and the staff was very attentive.

Serving sizes are HUGE so definitely worth all the prices!!! The service was pretty good too despite how busy it was. I'd definitely recommend downloading the no wait app so you can get in line from your house! It is definitely worth all the hype- and most thing comes up with a good heavy side of pancakes.
I loved the Mexican skillet- it was spicy and the side of pancakes was awesome! They also gave us a free cake for my friends birthday so that was awesome :)

I read some great reviews on this place, and to my suprise they were right. The wait was minimal, we had an EXCELLENT waiter. We went around 9 am and they were pretty packed but there were only a few people who had to wait. The food came out in perfect time. The location is perfect it is located directly across the street from Millennium Park. I highly recommend this place if you ever visit Chicago. I know I will be back.

First breakfast place we ate at when visiting Chicago and it did not disappoint!! I got the Mexicana Skillet with the Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes. I did have to take the jalapeños out of the skillet though just because I can't do spicy. The sauce it comes with is also spicy but even without the hotness the skillet was delicious.  The skillets are huge and can easily be shared with two people. My fiancé also got the Butchersblock which was also amazing.

The Signature Berry Bliss was to die for! It's probably one of my favorite pancakes of all time. The mascarpone on top makes it so sooo good!

Overall the food was delicious and the service was great! I'd definitely come back and definitely recommend!

Great simple breakfast. The wait is long and I'm not sure it's worth the wait. If you can, get on the waitlist via yelp and enjoy some of the sights before heading to brunch. The food was cooked well and the staff was really efficient for the amount of people. Only negative is since it's so popular and in a tourist part of town the waits can be over 90 minutes. Not ideal, but if you get on the waitlist via yelp it's a nice breakfast spot.

Side note: There are other locations and the wait times are much better 45 minutes or less. If you go to the one on Randolph, get on the waitlist in advance or expect to wait a really long time.

A great option for brunch if you're willing to wake up early or wait a little while for a seat. My boyfriend and I read reviews ahead of time about the long wait, so we showed up around 7:30-7:45am but still had an hour long wait on a Sunday. It was fine, we stopped by Cloud Gate and Stan's Donuts around the corner and headed back when we got our text.

It's honestly a good deal for the amount of food you get, but nothing mindblowing in terms of taste. We ordered a Mexicana Skillet with the Berry Bliss Pancakes for $1.50 extra, and we were stuffed by the time we finished. We also ordered a Wildberry Orange Juice, which was honestly just okay and kind of tasted like watered down OJ. Would probably try one of the lemondades if we ever came back. But definitely worth the price overall, and would be willing to come back, though probably on a weekday.

I found this cafe on Yelp and decided to stop by after enjoying the sunrise at Millenium park. I was told by locals that this place was way too hyped up, but I think that it lives up to the hype!

I ordered the Denver skillet and substituted the regular pancakes for strawberry poppy seed pancakes for an additional $1.50. Soooo worth it. I highly recommend it!! The poppy seed pancakes were hands down THE best pancakes I've ever had in my life, and I'm not a breakfast person, so that is saying a lot. The skillet wasn't bad either, but I wouldn't come here just for that. Fair warning: the skillet breakfast meals can and should be shared between two people. I could barely finish the pancake, let alone both the pancake and the skillet. That being said, the value is fantastic for their breakfast options! Coffee is also bottomless, and servers constantly walked by to top off my cup.

They are very well staffed, and it isn't hard to flag down someone if you need something. Tables turn over relatively quickly, but I would definitely recommend arriving early. I got there around 7AM (half hour after opening) and the entire restaurant was already full. By the time I left, the wait looked to be about 30 minutes long.

AMAZING!! This is probably one of the best breakfasts I ever had. When I was asking for recommendations from my friends for my Chicago trip, a visit to Wildberry Pancakes was top on everyone's list. I definitely knew I had to try with all the 4000+ reviews.

Wildberry is located close to the Millennium Park and  definitely gets crowded for brunch, considering it to be a very busy tourist spot.
So Pro tip #1 - Use the Yelp app and join the wait list. It can save you a lot of time (in my case, 2 hours and about 120 people ahead of me on a Sunday at 7 am - no kidding!). But I did not end up going there on Sunday and came in here today (Monday). It was still packed at 7 am for a weekday!

The food and the service is fantastic. They are very professional and fast. My Dad and I ordered Cafe latte and Hazelnut latte for ourselves. The drinks came out quickly while we were still deciding the food.
Here is what we ordered -
** Napa Valley fig Omelette with a side of Pancakes - Egg omelette with figs, bacon and cheese. This is my first time tasting figs in an omelette and I should say, it was pretty interesting and I liked it. I got a bowl of fruit on the side.
I ordered the entree and upgraded to the specialty pancakes (2 stacks), their much talked about Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes. Considering how much I love pancakes, this was heaven to me!! Definitely order this when you are here!
Pro tip #2 - Don't forget to order Signature Berry Bliss pancakes!

**Southern Benedict - Poached eggs with biscuits and gravy. It comes with a side of Hash Browns.

No regrets and no complaints. Wildberry pancakes is a must try if you are in Chicago.

To be quite honest, I did not think much of pancakes with berry sauce, but Wildberry Pancakes lives up to the hype. Not only are the famous berry bliss pancakes truly blissful; all the brunch items are unique, Insta-worthy, and so delicious you'll find yourself surprised at your appetite.

The SIGNATURE BERRY BLISS PANCAKES ($13) is a heavenly combination of sweet and creamy with vanilla Anglaise, blackberry coulis, berry mascarpone, and fresh berries over what is arguably the fluffiest pancakes I've ever had.

The STRAWBERRY LEMON BUTTERCREAM FRENCH TOAST ($13) was comprised of thick slabs of brioche with the same magically airy texture as the pancakes. I liked how it wasn't too sweet and creamy, and you notice the slight eggy taste of the brioche bread base. I think I would have liked the surface to be a little crispy and not all softness, but that is just personal French toast preference.

For something hearty, the SLOW ROAST BRISKET HASH ($14) is delicious. It's a bit of a kitchen sink with all the guilty pleasures of breakfast combined, including brisket, eggs, roasted red peppers, onions, and hash browns all blended together under a savory sausage gravy. The portion of brisket was generous, and it reminded me of barbacoa because it wasn't too dry. I do like their hash browns, which taste quite homemade as thick strips of potatoes. I think I prefer it the way it is rather than deep fried, because it blends in with the other ingredients better (and is not as dehydrated).

It's hard to pass up on the skillets since the presentation is so aesthetically pleasing in a steal skillet and the portions were huuuggggee! I was a fan of the DENVER SKILLET ($12) with hash browns, cheddar and jack cheese, eggs, ham, bell peppers, and onions. There was an ample amount of thick cut chunks of ham, and it did taste more smokey and high-quality than your typical breakfast ham. In my opinion it could be lighter on the cheese, because the dish was heavy enough it it was.

Wildberry's interior is spacious and well lit (an important consideration for food pictures). There are decorations of the Wildberry stem on the walls, and the lighting is trendy with light bulbs encased in spherical globes. Service is efficient as well. I enjoyed our visit to Wildberry so much, I asked boo if we could come back here on the last day of our Chicago trip so that we can try more things :3

Pro tips:
- Most entrees come with either toast or pancakes. While the toast is decent (choice of wheat, white, sourdough, or rye), it makes the most sense portion-wise and price-wise to get the pancakes. A regular order comes with 5 pancakes and the side order has 2, and you can upgrade to any of the specialty pancakes for an extra $1.50. One entree + the side of  special pancakes is perfect for two people and avoids the problem of soggy brunch leftovers.
- The place is big, but the wait can be long even on weekdays. I suggest arriving by 9-9:30 for minimal wait time. They don't take reservations, and you have to be present to put your name down.
- Several of the pancakes flavors are also available as French toast or waffles if that is your breakfast carb of choice.

Excellent place for breakfast. Everyone is very kind and helpful. Food came out very fast. Ordered 2 skillets. HUGE portions omg. It was ridiculous. Unlike many restaurants they have refills on their specialty lemonade. They have so many different flavors. But I will most definitely be back!

Sadly I was not impressed. It was just breakfast food to me. :/ I'm not sure if it's because in frequent brunch places so much in LA and Orange County that I've become desensitized to good breakfast foods or what! So maybe it was good but nothing stood out as I ate it?

Anyhoo, got a corn beef hash eggs Benedict. Friend got the strawberry poppy seed pancakes. The pancakes were indeed fluffy though! But as with all pancakes, I eventually get sick if eating them. :/ First few bites we're good so it's something I'd recommend sharing and pairing with something salty.

If you need coffee, there's an intelligencia mini cafe right inside to the right! Perfect for sipping while you wait for the ungodly 2 hrs to be seated. I'd recommend coming early to beat the crowds. So arrive before 7:30am. There's also an indoor waiting room you can see through the building windows.

This place is well worth the hype for any tourist visiting town. However kinda tiring once you visit multiple times.

I always ALWAYS get the Mexican skillet with extra crispy hash browns. It's so so good cheesy and chorizo-y. It comes with a choice of toast or pancakes. I opt for pancakes and upgrade to berry bliss because that shit is bomb. You cannot go wrong. But the portions are super huge. So i recommend splitting the skillet and pancakes between two people.

The wait is long. And there's no reservations either. Download the NoWait app for parties of 4 or less to jump in line without having to be there and you'll get a text notifying you to be there within 10 mins. So hop over to the bean or something in the meantime

We happened upon Wildberry one morning during our stay when we were looking for breakfast options.  A restaurant boasts almost 4000 four and five star reviews on Yelp definitely piqued my interest and I knew we had to try it.  Boy, I'm glad we chose to see what the hype was all about.  

We were greeted by our friendly server who made recommendations on breakfast and promptly brought us two cups of piping hot coffee to warm us up.  He was attentive and made sure we felt welcomed.

I chose a side of the Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes.  My better half chose the Corned Beef Hash Eggs Benedict with a side of the Cinnamon Roll Pancakes.  When you can choose these heavenly pancakes as a side over toast, who would ever choose toast?!  Both pancakes were so delicious, it was hard to choose a favorite.  The hash was super tasty and all portions were more than ample.  

The breakfast and service was so outstanding that I actually wanted to come back the following morning to try other items.

pics.caption: Cinnamon Roll Pancakes and Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes

review.des: One of the best breakfasts I have had in a while! They had so many gluten free options: I ordered wonderful fresh squeezed orange juice, an amazing gluten free strawberry-chocolate waffle, and great applewood smoked bacon. I wish I lived in Chicago so I could eat here all the time!

OMG!! Their *Red Velvet Cinnamon Roll French Toast* is friggin' insane! Total tastebud ecstasy!

Imagine you had a cream filled velvet cupcake, with a little crunchy cinnamon roll flavor on top, powdered sugar shaken, and a drizzling of extra cream icing all over.... it was a bloodbath of sugar and dessert. Mmmmmm so good.
I could live on the cinnamon roll pancakes! They are melt in your mouth amazing. This is a go-to-place for sure. 2 convenient locations downtown too.

At first glance of Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe pictures on yelp, this honestly looked like any other breakfast/brunch spot. When skimming through the yelp reviews, I was shocked to see so many familiar faces that rated this place with high ratings. I trusted your reviews and decided to give this place a try and I am so glad I did! This is definitely the one spot that I would have to visit again the next time I am in Chicago!

The wait was not bad at all - considering the fact that they have the wait list available on yelp. We placed down our names and walked there from our hotel and waited just a few minutes before we got seated. The service here is amazing. Waitress and staff was very attentive, helpful, friendly, and quick! The food was unbelievably good! We ordered a few entrees to share and try and I would highly recommend them all: 1) Florence Benedict - Amazing! So rich is flavor and the bacon bits was a steal of the show! 2) Butcher Block - Meat lovers unite! This was really good and probably was one of my top favorite things here! 3) Honey Toffee Nut Latte - Just shut up and try it. 4) Signature Berry Pancakes - I wouldn't even consider this pancakes. The texture was so different and light. It was a recommendation as a must try for me and I would say the same. 5) Banana Bread French Bread - This tasted exactly like a banana bread. It wasn't bad at all! It was amazing but really filling and rich. I wouldn't recommend this is you are having other sweets such as pancakes because it might be too heavy.

The other best thing about this place is that it is literally right across the street from the bean. Hit two best places in Chicago at once!

pics.caption: Florence Benedict, Banana Bread French Toast, Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes, Butcher Block

review.des: An extremely well-oiled machine. We had like 40 parties ahead of us and we were seated in 50 minutes! That's crazy! We made the good decision of putting our names on the waitlist while on the train, so that by the time we walked there we'd be seated in just a few minutes. The food was amazing; I was happy to learn I could upgrade the side of pancakes with my skillet to "specialty" pancakes.

Wildberry is a super popular breakfast spot. When me and my group came by it was pretty early but already a good 30 minute wait. We were able to add our name to the waitlist electronically via Yelp which was AMAZING. I wish more places had that option.

The wait went by quick. I ordered a Nut toffee latte which was really delicious. For food I got the Mexicana skillet and instead of toast opted for a 1.50 upcharge to get a signature pancake. I opted for the Infamous wildberry pancake.

The food was good as was the service. Would it have been worth a 2 hour wait? No way. But a solid breakfast joint with lots of options and creative offerings.

Was visiting Chicago and picked this place for brunch. Wow was it worth the wait. If you put your name in online it's super easy to plan your morning around your spot in line. Service is great and the food comes out super quickly.

I got the Signature Berry Bliss Waffle and I would give my first born child to have something that good every day. WOW.

One word: FILLING. 3.5-4 star experience!

I came here with one other for a weekday brunch...who knew how popular this place was! We waited around 35 minutes before we got to sit down.

Pro tip 1: Use the Yelp app to make a reservation beforehand! I can't believe I forgot...
Pro tip 2: If you forgot to follow tip 1, then tip 2 is to immediately rush inside and put your name on the waitlisting list. You will get text messages: first one is a heads up, second one is the actual text.

We ordered:
1) Full order of Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes ($13) //
+1 WOW. 5 pieces of fluffy, hearty pieces of pancakes. Addicting texture!
-1 Wish it layered the sauces in between the pancakes, or gave you more on the side.
+/-1 TBH, I was okay with the sauce. Did not taste fresh, more like from the can/jar/bottle.

2) Espanola Omelette ($13) and Caramel Apple Pecan pancakes ($1 upgrade) //
+1 I like the mix of flavors in this omelette!
+/-1 The "bed of tortilla" is just two pieces of small taco shells (soft)
+1 Caramel apple side pancake is 3 huge pieces!
+1 Side of buttermilk pancakes come with the dish regardless, so don't be alarmed if your meal comes and it's monstrous!

Actual life hack, if you come here: Order one entree and upgrade to a side of pancakes- then it'll be a $15 meal for 2! Or, order one regular entree and a "side" of pancakes. WOWOWOWW.

Overall, I liked it! I'm not a huge pancake fan, but this place did it well. Definitely stop by if your in Chicago!

Another great breakfast/brunch place located in/near the Loop area of downtown Chicago. As such, parking is very limited near this area & extremely expensive if you find it so be advised of such in advance. That being said, this place is also quite popular so don't be surprised if there is a wait even on weekdays. One nice thing is that there is a Yelp check-in feature available so definitely utilize such for your convenience. That being said, I ordered the sweet berry bliss pancakes along with the butcher block skillet. Here are my impressions:

SBBP: Fantastic. Pancakes are buttermilk smooth, cooked to perfection, and yummy. Not only is presentation done well, but the tarty sauces & fruits used in this dish are quite on point. In general, quite the yummy brunch dish to pick & it goes really well with syrup as well.

BBS: A mountain of yummyness. Combination of meaty goodness (ham, sausage, turkey sausage, chicken sausage, and bacon) along with hash browns, eggs, and cheese = quite the breakfast champion win. Definitely for those who are more hungry or consider themselves meat-lovers. Don't be afraid to use ketchup as needed.

Overall, a most awesome breakfast/brunch location located near the Loop, the downtown area, and with nearby attractions. Despite limited parking & frequent sizable waits, this should definitely be a place you should consider regardless. I would recommend.

pics.caption: Left: Signature Berry Bliss pancakes Right: Butcher Block skillet  Both were fantastic & on point. Would highly recommend.

review.des: I have never had and will probably never have pancakes as delicious as the ones here.  Their breakfast Skillets are the best too.  WOW, what I would do to have one of these in Miami.  Their service is excellent as well.  From the hostess to the waiters, everyone is just simply genuinely nice.  It feels great to go to a place where there is nothing bad to say.  I fell in with Chicago a little more because of this place!

Went here because of the reviews...now I'm adding to the reviews. Wow. This place was incredible. Make sure you put your name on the waiting list, the line is long. The Mexican skillet and cinnamon roll pancakes were mind blowing. The food is prepared quickly for such a busy place and the waitstaff made some amazing recommendations. Came here twice on a 4 day trip to Chicago.

So worth the wait! We had arrived in Chicago earlier that morning and the first place we wanted to go eat was Wildberry! The wait was about 2 hours but it was worth it, it gave us some time to walk around millennium park. Due to the short amount of time we were there, I enjoyed every bit of it. Customer service was excellent, we had an app telling us what the wait time was, how many parties were ahead of us etc. The food was up to par. All my friends and I had the skillet and it was a lot of food. We also ordered some pancakes.
I would recommend the chocolate chip pancakes and the berries one. Super delicious!
Great omelets and coffee. I got the Rutherford omelet. The goat cheese on it was excellent.
Really good service! Friendly waiter said they could the meal in a no calorie cooking spray. Affordable prices, huge portions, and great area. Street parking is only $4/hr

Bring a friend - you WILL need the back up.

I got here super early - maybe 7 or 8 and it was already pretty packed but since I was solo trippin' I got a table quickly.

I ordered the pancakes, fruit bowl, and a hazelnut latte. Portions here are beyond humongous. My pancake order came with not 1, not 2, not 3, but FIVE PANCAKES. I ate two and a half before my body gave up on me. The fruit bowl was like a fruit salad for four people. I managed to eat all of that before feel like some sort of fruit farm afterwards. Waitress was super nice and attentive.

Hazelnut latte was delicious and I ended up taking it to go for my commute to the next destination.

Go early to avoid the crowds but I definitely would recommend.

My friend and I went early in the morning to avoid the wait we saw the previous day for this place and we were not disappointed. Good service and we ordered the delicious crepes! Will definitely come back again if in town!

Ordered carryout of broccoli cheese soup. So disappointed. It was basically
Broccoli water with a handful of shredded cheese thrown in. And the cheese was likely fake cheese because it didn't even warm up when microwaved. I wish I'd known before leaving. But I wouldn't order again.

Wildberry is your classic breakfast/brunch spot. It's right next to Millenium Park so it was convenient to check out the bean while we waited an hour and a half to get seated. We ordered a couple of skillets, pancakes, and a pork hash. I loved my "veggie" skillet (I added ham LOL only because I loved everything that was in the veggie skillet). I don't usually order skillets but it's definitely the best I've had. The pancakes were definitely on the sweeter side, so I wasn't too big of a fan. However, the cinnamon pancake was really good - literally tasted like a churro. Their signature pancake was definitely way too sweet, but if you have a sweet tooth- it's definitely perfect for you. Service was great - very attentive while the restaurant was very busy.

I'd definitely come back here again.

Came at around 9 AM on a Saturday and the place was packed! The estimate was about an hour wait but it was really about 40 minutes.

I ended up ordering the Fresca Omelet with the addition of the chicken sausage. With that, you also get the choice of hash browns or fruit and pancakes or toast. The price tag for each dish might seem like a lot but they actually give huge portions! You really do get a bang for your buck!

The food itself was pretty good! I felt like the olive oil infused sun-dried tomatoes were a little too strong for the dish but all in all, the ingredients were very fresh. Service was quick and the entire waitstaff was friendly.

Would definitely recommend for breakfast/brunch! The next time I'm back, I'll be sure to order their signature Wildberry Pancakes!

You won't be disappointed. The portion sizes are huge and the food tastes delicious! Everyone in Chicago seems to know this too, so plan ahead with a reservation right through yelp. We ended up sitting outside on the patio because there was no wait for outside seating. Enjoy!

They don't take reservations but we added our name to the bottom of the list, number 61 in order, and we went for a walk around millennium park. We came back 30 min later and was immediately given a table on the patio. There were still 21 people listed ahead of us but because we were willing to sit on the patio it sped things up.

Food was nothing short of the best breakfast I've ever had. I ordered the butcher block skillet with a apple pecan pancake. Delicious. I don't care what the wait is it is worth it.

What a wait! Make sure to get yourself on the waitlist early!!

Once seated we made our drink orders of a regular coffee and be honey toffee nut latte which was yummy!

We ordered their mexicana and the signiture berry pancakes.

The mexicana skillet was soooo good we scarfed that down so fast. Came with eggs, hashbrowns, avocado, and your choice of meat.

The pancakes were the fluffiest ive ever had! The cream and berry topping was the perfect touch not too overpowering and sweet often i experience at other pancake joints.

This was a yummy full and complete breafast for an affordable price. Service was nothing short of amazing. Must visit place.

pics.caption: Sig berry pancakes and mexicana skillet both amazing

review.des:
Excellent!! I thought this place might not live up to the hype but it definitely did for me.

Ordered:
Cappuccino
Vanilla Latte
Special-Torta Breakfast Sandwich
Corned beef eggs benedict

The drinks were well made, definitely not your typical breakfast joint coffee. The food was super flavorful and came in huge portions. My BF and I are both hungry eaters and we could have split one plate easily. This place is worth a visit!

Corned beef hash with hash browns , eggs and pancakes - be aware these are two person size meals - we also have on the table - corned beef Bennie , the signature berry bliss crepes (very good!) yogurt with granola and corned beef has skillet - the only one able to finish her meal is the one with crepes - very good , hearty , large portions . Sorry the pic isn't better.

These pancakes!!!

We went on a Saturday morning so it was busy, but I used YELP! to get on the waitlist before we walked from our hotel. I'm sure that saved us at least 30 minutes of waiting.

We were able to sit outside and wait, it was a nice day and it's a busy part of town so it's nice to look around.

We were sat at a small table (2 of us) and I promptly ordered the wildberry OJ - it was good, tasted fresh, but not a strong berry flavor for how pink it was. I ordered the Wildberry Pancakes and mom got the Crepes. The marscapone was too bitter for me, but mom loved it. The blueberry coulis is something I could bathe in! Cakes were fluffy and wonderful. These are BIG portions so either go in 'vacation food mode' or share.

Atmosphere is clean and nice (reminded me of a Keke's or First Watch). Service was friendly and efficient.

Are you a tourist looking to hit up the highly reviewed places during your stay? This would be your place.

Are you wanting to get some amazing breakfast/brunch food for a good price? This isn't your place.

I'm only willing to come here when out of town friends come and want to try this place. Other wise, no way am I waiting 2 hours for a table for mediocre food. Though they do have a yelp wait list that you can easily put your name on.

I didn't want an entree when I came here with 2 friends so I ordered a side of Chocolate Chip Banana Bread ($3) and that was the most dense bread ever. My friend commented that it tasted like it was form the day before. No bueno. The waiter never even came back and asked us how everything was but I didn't want to pay the $3 for something I took 2 bites out of so I made my opinion known and they took it off the check at least.

Both the signature berry bliss waffle and pancake is just okay to me. Nothing too special.

The food here is delicious! I enjoyed one the best mushroom omelets I've ever had and my baby loved the pancakes!
Although the cuisine is definitely exceptional, the way this restaurant was so well run stood out to me even more. The restaurant appeared to be busy, but we were seated in 10 minutes. The staff was very caring about putting my stroller in a safe place and getting me everything I needed so I was comfortable with my small child. My server was such a lovely person as well who was very attentive.
Great place with great food and even better people!

There's a reason why the line's as long as it is, even on a Monday morning (which is when my husband and I were there). What we ordered was both tasty and ample without being in any way pretentious. The prices are reasonable. But most importantly, the service was efficient and swift but never flustered or leaving us with the sense we were being hustled out to make room for subsequent customers despite the restaurant being jammed. Our coffee was always hot, and our water glasses always full. Our food arrived within fifteen minutes, despite the aforementioned full house.

My husband had the chorizo Eggs Benedict, which was spicy without being overwhelming for him (he doesn't do spicy very well)I had the Rutherford omelet--spinach, caramelized onion, goat cheese and bacon--and while bacon makes everything perfect, the other three blended to make a sublime flavor combination: sweet onions, creamy goat cheese, and earthy spinach.

Well, sure, it's attached to a hotel, but this is downtown Chicago. Hotel guests have their choice.

Just like most other places in Chicago, service was great even though it was super packed. They had the system down and got us seated almost immediately. I wouldn't say the food was spectacular, but it was a decent, basic breakfast.

Always a long wait for this place, but if you reserve a spot through yelp, it will tell you an estimated time and the line usually goes pretty quickly.
The food here is above average, but not super special. Just normal breakfast items with a slight twist and premium ingredients at a great price point. Hard to find parking in the area.

Loooveeedd!! I wanted to come here to try their fruity pebbles french toast, and I'm glad I got to; it was delish!! Their corned beef hash, I did not care  too much for, their sausage links were ok, nothing special. The service was very quick and friendly!

Two trips to Chicago and both I ended up at Wildberry for brunch. The location is prime and its reputation is large, so it's an obvious choice. I'm not unaccustomed to having to wait for brunch and the story is no different here. On my most recent trip, we hopped on the online waitlist on our way over, which shortened our wait time.

Pancakes: a must order since it is what they are known for. Big, fluffy, topped with fresh berries. Definitely a shareable portion.

Omelette: Hefty portion as well. You can customize your own omelette or choose from one of their creations. I chose the Napa Valley Fig. I was enticed by the figs and thought the bacon and havarti cheese would make a nice balanced egg dish. The figs were an awesome choice. Overall the omelette was too cheesy for me. I was practically scooping out chunks of cheese.

The service needs improvement. It took too long from the time we ordered to get our food. That explains a slow turnover rate and the longer than necessary wait times. Then, it was more than difficult to find a waiter to refill our waters.

Not the greatest brunch I've ever had, but a solid and an absolutely filling meal.

The hype is real!  Yes, you're going to wait, but you're also going to get a great brunch out of it.  Pro tip: put your name in ahead of time on the NoWait app-saves you time having to stand at the restaurant (and they have a TINY lobby to wait it, which is a downside).

Their menu is quite expansive, with lots of savory and sweet options, and healthier fare if that's your thing.  The service has always been good even though they're always packed, and while I can't say I've ever felt like I could lounge around there for hours, I've also never felt rushed or that I had to leave so they could have the table.

The prices are pretty good, considering where they're located, so to me that helps relive the sting of the wait.  It can get a bit noisy in there since it's so busy, but I've seen worse elsewhere.

Last time I was there I had their seasonal pumpkin spice pancakes and they were delicious.  Sometimes pumpkin spice can be overdone but this was a perfect balance for me.  I've never had a meal here I didn't like.

If you like a good brunch, it's worth a try.  You're going to wait (but then again, you're going to wait at most good places in Chicago), and you can mitigate that by going earlier, using the app, and/or not going when there's a big event at Millennium/Grant Park (think like a 5k race).

TLDR: Waited an hour. Worth it.
____

Our server Jerry had the most personality of any server I have ever met in my life. He was quick, as they need to turnover tables here fast, but never made us feel rushed.

Southern Benedict - A hearty breakfast to start the day. Biscuits, sausage patties, homemade sausage gravy sauce and hashbrowns.

Side of bacon. Thick and crispy. This may have been some of the best bacon I've ever had. Okk, maybe I was starving. But it was really, really good.

The place is a madhouse, but somehow I drifted away into breakfasty nirvana and everything around me became a blur. Where am I? Am I dead? Is this Heaven? As the yolk oozed out of the perfectly poached egg...I asked myself....is this as good as it gets? Then I took a bite - and was slapped back to reality. I have much more to live. Much more to eat on this planet.

Once seated, we were out of there in 35 mins. THAT'S AN INSANE TURNAROUND. Off to see the sites to walk off these calories.

Well the first clue this place is great was the fifteen minute wait at 8:30 AM on a Saturday downtown in early fall! I thought we'd sneak right in before the big crowds but alas, we had to stand in the throngs of people perusing the menu until our name was called. But the seasonal menu made up for the wait - apple cider with whipped cream, pumpkin spice pancakes, loaded baked potato omelette. My gluten free mom found great options - hash browns, OJ, coffee, sliced bananas, and eggs with avocado. They had a high chair for my son and service was quick and friendly. Portions are huge, we failed to finish either of our meals.

Quick service and great food! Their menu makes it hard to choose what to order, but you can't go wrong. Their signature Wildberry pancakes are delicious and not too sweet. I ordered the chocolate banana bread French which was very rich and I thought the chocolate over powered the dish. Wish I picked something else... We used the waitlist feature on yelp so we didn't have to wait in a long line for a table! Many locations all over Chicago. Would definitely return the next time I'm in the Windy City.

pics.caption: Banana bread French toast, side of scrambled eggs and cheese, Wildberry pancakes, and breakfast combo

review.des:
With over 4K reviews on Yelp, I'll admit, I was kind of scared to go here (not really sure why nor what this review will contribute that the other 4K won't, but here goes).

Location is great; across the street from Millennium Park. Ambiance is a little bit upscale but mostly casual.

Service is strong, attentive, friendly. Prices are reasonable as well.

NOTE: this place is SMASHED on weekends. Be prepared (consider backup locations/restaruant options). But on weekdays (I went on a Tuesday morning), not so bad (pretty good actually - I was seated right away).

Now to the food.

I ordered simple two egg platter scrambled with cheese, turkey sausage patties, and buttermilk pancakes. All the food was pretty good (read: definitely better than good, but not quite great). It's hard to mess up breakfast though.

So about those pancakes...

They were really good. But they weren't EPIC. If you want epic, go to Original House of Pancakes. Wildberry's pancakes tended to be just a tad on the over-flaky side (yes, that's a thing...where the pancake is falling apart as you're trying to cut and pick it up with your fork - too flaky). And they were just a tad on the dry side as well.

If you get the flavored pancake package, it may even out the imperfections of the pancake. Plus there's a whole lot on the menu. And they get bonus points for having turkey sausage patties and chicken sausgage links (I don't eat pork).

Four stars as this was really only my first time and while I was impressed, I wasn't blown away.

Would definitely come back though - if the wait isn't too ridiculous.

Great spot for brunch near Millennium park!

Went to Wildberry as soon as I got to Chicago as it was recommended by multiple friends, and overall, I wasn't disappointed! More than likely if you show up at remotely brunch hours, you'll end up having to wait for a while, but you can get around this by using the nowait app or using Yelp  to put yourself in the waitlist!

Once inside, you'll find a menu with a solid selection of breakfast/ brunch foods! I found that getting a skillet was a ton of food, easily enough for 2 people, but can definitely be enough for most of the day for one person. I'd highly recommend upgrading to one of their specialty pancake options, definitely worth the upcharge!

There are two random consequences of the popularity of this place: the bussers clear your table almost immediately after you finish a dish, they definitely are waiting and watching so they can keep people moving out quickly to get new people in. It's not necessarily a bad thing, but it can definitely make you feel a bit rushed as you're trying to enjoy breakfast. The other thing is that there's not a very large waiting area, and it tends to get filled up with people which can make getting into/out of the restaurant a huge pain, especially with the revolving door and on cold days.

Overall great spot for brunch, would recommend!

If you're around the area, definitely try this place ! The line might be long, but it's definitely worth it~

Food: 5/5
I definitely enjoy everything that we ordered, from sweets to savory dishes! I don't know what else to say other than IT WAS A DELICIOUS MEAL to start off our day with.

Service: 5/5
Our server was so nice, she took care of us really well. From water refills to making sure we have all the condiments that we needed.

Ambiance: 5/5
It seems full in the waiting area, but they have a bigger space in the dining area.

Is it worth a try? I say YESSSS to the pancakes

So usually while in Chicago we eat here and the food is amazing. This time ... not so much. The good took a long time to come and then the waitress brought out the wrong thing. I ordered French toast she said she heard something else.. Also the hot chocolate was just ok, pretty watery. Her attitude wasn't very professional either. My experience this time was just mediocre like my food. Better luck next time....

We got on the waiting list from our hotel and as we were walking up I got a text that it was my turn for a table. Very convenient!

I got the Mexicana skillet which was full of flavor and a really big portion of food. I got the gluten-free honey berry pancakes which tasted like regular pancakes to me! Delicious!

I also got a chocolate chip frappucino which was like a milkshake. I'm stuffed and now I need to go walk it off. Service was great! I'm glad I came here!

Thanks to Yelp, I was able to put our name on the waitlist as we hung out in Millennium Park. It's a short walk across the street from "The Bean".

They have lots of delicious breakfast options on the menu. I opted for the Chorizo Benedicts and let me tell you, it was the best style eggs benedict I've had in a very long time. The Jalapeno hollandaise sauce was amazing! So many different variations of pancakes and waffles for everyone's taste buds.

I highly recommend visiting Wildberry for brunch for anyone visiting the Chicago area!

The hotel I stayed in Chicago offered us free breakfast, so I have not looked into breakfast options much when I was here. However, when I was looking at places for lunch, this place has such high ratings on yelp me and my boyfriend just had to try it. It was by the contemporary art museum where we just came from.
