We were so hungry and was debating whether to go or not since there was a wait line. In Yelp reviews, many people had said the wait is long. Luckily for us, we joined the waitlist on yelp and did not wait more than 10 minutes. I ordered the strawberry chocolate Belgium waffles. I was really hoping it is the Liege style Belgian waffles but it is not. I was a little disappointed when I first got my order, but after couple of bites I finished the whole thing. Yup, still delicious! My boyfriend ordered some egg thing with avocado and it was sooo good! The service was very efficient, our order came quickly after we ordered it. It was a perfect stop for us. I will recommend this place.

SO good! There is a huge variety of food items, really something for everyone, and everything I've had here has been utterly delicious. There's also a coffee bar right inside that you can order from white you're waiting in line if you'd like, which is convenient!

Definitely crowded and clearly a popular spot, even right at opening, so I'd recommend booking your place in line via Yelp prior to arriving.

Overall, fantastic brunch spot.
The wild berry bliss pancake is great, filled with strawberry sauce, orange juice is fresh squeezed.

Brunch is a must anytime we travel and many weekends at home too. While Wildberry was very good I have to be honest, it didn't stand out among many of the other brunch places I've been to. Yes it was good, but the pancakes are not made of gold. Don't go in with your expectations too high, because you'll definitely be left wondering, "Why?"

We visited Wildberry when visiting Chicago a few weeks ago. When I saw the incredible amount of reviews on Yelp I thought it was a must. Thank goodness we planned ahead and I put our name in on Yelp as soon as I woke up that Sunday morning. By the time we got to the restaurant we had about a ten minute wait, but walk ups were waiting upwards of two and a half hours for a table. The food is good but let me tell you up front... NOT worth a 2+ hour wait!!! Don't do that to yourself!

We were sat at a small table toward the back of the restaurant. Our waitress was quick to get us some drinks (I had their cherry lemonade... very good!) while we reviewed the menu. We noticed really quickly that the people around us had HUGE portions (and the prices were not cheap!), so we asked our waitress if she'd mind if we shared a meal. I hated doing that since they were so busy but our waitress was super nice about it. We ordered the garden skillet plus sausage with signature berry bliss pancakes, and a side of bacon. Definitely more than enough food for two even though it was only one entree and a side. I still didn't even finish my half of the skillet!

The food came out in good time and was very good. I expected the pancakes to have this heavy, super sweet icing on them, but it was more of a yogurt topping. They were excellent. We also found a bite of pancakes that didn't have any fruit or topping on it so we could try what just their plain pancakes would taste like. That was even better! Overall it was a very good meal that ended up costing somewhere around $40. Thank goodness we didn't spend double that and end up with a ton of leftovers that would just be thrown away or I would've been pretty disappointed.

Overall I'd say Wildberry is worth a visit, but as I said before - make a reservation and expect a great but not quite life-changing meal.

pics.caption: Garden skillet with added sausage, signature berry bliss pancakes, and a side of bacon

review.des: Great breakfast spot.  Gets really busy at 9am so prepare to wait or get there early. Our hotel had an app to check wait times so that was helpful.  The plates are huge. Be prepared for that. I ordered the hash and eggs and thought it would be relatively small but it was gigantic. Could easily share this in my opinion.  The potatoes and corned beef in the hash were shredded which was different and had a strong cure taste so if you like that this is for you, if not order something different. It comes with hasbrowns that are a bit creamy and I tasted a bit of sour cream taste which I loved. The food came out fast too and the staff was friendly. My husband has the chiliquiles which he enjoyed.  We saw people with plates of pancakes that looked amazing also. Big menu so something for everyone.  Really enjoyed this place

With the torrential downpour that was occurring when I visited, my friend and I had to hide out in the prudential center while waiting for our table. There is usually a very long wait if you go anywhere during the time of lunch. You're able to secure a spot on the line via yelp so make sure to take advantage of that.

Being a New Yorker, I was astonished by the prices and the amount of food you get. It was inexpensive and the portions were huge. My friend and I both ordered one of their skillet dishes and upgraded our side pancake order to one of their specials. Everything was delicious!! We left stuffed and I'm itching to go back again.

I've been here twice now, and I'm still confused about the hype. The first time I came with my friend, we ended up ordering to-go because we made the foolish mistake of showing up around Sunday brunch time..silly me..Anyways, I ordered the berry bliss pancakes. Good, but not mindblowing..and definitely not worth a 2 hour wait.

Second time I've been, I got the biscuits and gravy and the gravy had such a strong herb flavor--rosemary or thyme. That's ALL I tasted..and I couldnt finish it.

So to sum up--Wildberry is a decent breakfast restaurant but not worth waiting 2 hours for. Also, avoid the biscuits and gravy.

Wife's Review: Only negative was they messed up my order and added pork to my skillet(Chefs block skillet with apple pecan pancakes). Once they re-prepared it, it was really good. 4 Stars.

Son's review: I had chicken tenders and fries. I give this place a 5!

My review: Apparently, I wasn't invited to the party! Maybe next time!

I'm not a big fan of pancakes. In fact, I don't like pancakes at all, buuut their Berry Bliss Pancakes...HOLY MOLY! I've had dreams about this pancakes ever since! As Agnes from Despicable Me would say, "It's SO FLUFFY!" Seriously their pancakes are something else and add the Denver Sizzlin' Skillets, you have the perfect sweet and savory combo! Not to mention their portions were very generous, leaving you full & happy! I'm so glad that I decided to forgo my fancy brunch spot that I had bookmarked prior to my trip to Chicago and try this place instead. And thank you to my awesome Uber driver for recommending the items on the menu because it was phenomenal!

Oh and you can "check in" to the restaurant by joining their waitlist on the Yelp app and you'll be added to the queue, so you don't have to wait in person for too long! I checked in an hour prior to arriving at the restaurant and only waited 15 minutes to be seated. Winning!

I waited two hours for this shit and I'd do it again every Saturday.

If you're in Chicago, you've gotta try it. Our waiter, Jeremy, played as big a role in this rating as the food. He was aggressive-- one of those people who talks at you for five seconds and leave you amused and, like, totally exhausted... "you've gotta get that coconut mocha"... "oh, you don't like coconut? When's the last time you tried it? I'm getting it for you. Let me know if you still don't like it and we'll work something out."

The coconut mocha rocked. The veggie skillet and the berry pancakes were good too, four star good.

But Jeremy was the best waiter I've had in months, five star good.

And the PORTIONS! I left stuffed!! worth the money.

pics.caption: My cute friend Dani with her cinnamon roll pancakes and veggie skillet!

review.des: Go early - the wait for a table can be two hours. There was a 90 minute wait for a table when we left - it seemed like this was the only restaurant serving breakfast in the area.  The breakfast options are delicious and the portions are generous. We particularly enjoyed the French Toast and Corned Beef Hash. The service is efficient and attentive.

The perfect tourist breakfast spot. Go to wildberry, get the queue number and then explore the bean and the park

Food: good portions good taste. Not the best breakfast place I had but in all a good experience. Whenever I have someone out of town visiting this is the place to be

Wow busy place here with 45min wait and text msg to be seated. Kinda cool and gave me time return hotel for other needs. Lots food options here all look wonderful and handmade as expected in Chicago and NY. My 2 favorite food cities. Have asked for waffle, eggs, burned potatoes of some kind, bacon special smoked or ?, real maple syrup and Americano 6 shot.
So all was very good. Waffle
wasn't amazing but ok average. Bacon real good. Hash browns average frozen kind. Yuk surprise. Real maple syrup a very small amount not worth price upgrade. So had their regular syrup added and better choice.
I'm supposing there are better choices but this was real good and am glad to test.

Super great food and very large portions. The wait was ankhs an hour, guy the staff works really fast and food comes out quickly. I would share though because omelette ado this travel well if you can't finish

It was good, but seemed a little too iHOP-ey. would've expected more interesting cuisine from a place that has such good reviews, is in such a good location, and such a long wait. It's a good standard though. You know what you'll get. It'll always be good, although not particularly memorable.

We had a wait of 40 minutes on a Monday morning! Kind of odd to me, but it was worth it. Our waitress of dope and knowledgeable. Two of my friends had been several times before, while the other two of us had never been.

I ordered the signature pancakes and loved them,no syrup necessary. I am typically very plain jane, when it comes to staple food, but I am happy I gave it a try. I posted pictures on my check-in, but everything was amazing!

I will definitely go back

I finally convinced my husband to come here for brunch despite the wait. Check in using the app and your wait time will be minimal. We only had to wait about 5 minutes on a Sunday around 10 because we checked in from home.

The food was so good. I was a little bummed because I wanted to try the banana creme pancakes and they weren't on the menu, so instead I did the egg combo. I got two eggs, two pieces of sausage, hash browns, and a side of pancakes for $11. The hash browns were perfectly crispy and the pancakes were light and fluffy. My husband tried a skillet and a side of the chocolate banana pancakes and he said those were delicious.

The only negative was our service. Obviously they're a very busy restaurant, but our waitress disappeared for awhile. Our order came out incorrect initially and it took her 10 minutes to come to the table afterwards to let her know. She corrected it quickly after that but having to wait was a bit annoying. We'd definitely come back.

The wait is long!! But it's honestly worth it! I'm in town from Las Vegas!! The servers are quick very friendly!! I own a coffee shop in Las Vegas!! So I always try the lattes while out of town. To be honest the shots taste burnt to me. But over all the pumpkin flavor was amazing!! I would definitely come back again!!

I'll preface what I'm about to say with the fact that I think this place is super overrated. The lines are ridiculously long and the food, while it is pretty good and comes in big portions, is nothing to write home about.

I've been here several times and ordered either pancakes or a skillet every time. The flavors are good and the quality of the ingredients is good too but I don't think there's anything special about Wildberry that you can't get in about 25% of the wait somewhere else. If you do come in, definitely try the skillet with avocados and do yourself a favor and upgrade to a specialty pancake. :) Enjoy!

We went to the Randolph one and had no wait on a Monday at 8:00 am.  The service was quick!  Loved it.  Ordered the berry crepes, good.   The portion was HUGE, 3 crepes for $13?!  Wow, I was expecting 2 at most.  There were so much berries on it, strawberries, black and blue berries.  There is a kids menu with a good variety of selection.   The grilled cheese was to my daughter's liking.  The fries were delicious!

Pros: Delicious HUGE servings of your favorite breakfast staples. They have a large selection of hash brown casseroles, omelets, pancakes, breads, jams, coffees, you get the point! I ordered the veggie hash brown casserole and it came with a choice of bread or pancakes. I chose their signature berry pancake. It was sooo much food, I ate it over three meals. I had enough hash brown casserole for diner and enough pancakes left for a full breakfast the next day. Totally worth the price! Service was excellent, place was clean.

Cons: The wait was long, even on a Tuesday morning, but they sell coffee at the entrance, so we were able to enjoy coffee as we waited.

Will most definitely return, next time, I will probably share my order.

Berry. Bliss. French. Toast. I'm sure it would be hard to go wrong ordering anything here, but that's what I come for. It's always packed for good reason and even the coffee is better than most breakfast places. I don't get out here nearly as often as I should.

Went to Chicago this past weekend with my wife and another couple (my brother and his wife).  We heard about Wildberry and decided to give it a shot.  The wait time is super long.  I used the line app and it gave me an estimate of about 20-40 minutes but actually took closer to an hour and a half.  I'm told that it can get even longer than that.  Unfortunately we were seated near the entrance and it was very cold whenever someone opened the door.  We had a very pleasant waitress I don't recall her name.  I ordered a spiced chai latte and enjoyed it.  For my entree I had the Southern Benedict (oven baked biscuits, sausage patties, poached eggs, homemade sausage gravy and hash browns).  This was a good dish.  The egg was cooked right and overall the dish had decent flavors.  I might've enjoyed it more had I not tried my brothers dish.  He ordered the Los Altos Benedict (chorizo sausage, roasted red peppers, poached eggs, chipotle hollandaise, pico de gallo, and hash browns).  Man, this was a great entree!  Tons of flavor especially coming from the chorizo sausage and chipotle hollandaise.  The egg was cooked right.  We also ordered the signature berry bliss pancakes and cinnamon roll French toast.  The pancakes were nothing special at all, surprisingly, given the name of the restaurant.  The French toast was good, not great, but easily forgettable.  All in all, If I come back it would just be for the Los Altos Benny.

Another great experience. Definitely recommend using the check in on yelp/website to avoid the long wait time. The burrito and berry pancakes were really good. Huge portions so you could probably split or consolidate meals. One of my destination breakfast meals in Chicago.

Wildberry made it on the brainstorm list of two of the members of our little travel party, which made it a Gotta Go.

We were aware that the wait could be long, and that they had a waitlist that you could sign up for via Yelp or the NoWait App.  But they weren't of much use to us since we were delayed enough that the wait wasn't too long and they required a relatively quick response once your turn was up.

We opted to share the following among the three of us:
Corned Beef Hash Skillet $14.50 with pancakes banana cream
Signature Berry Bliss Waffle $13
Brisket Hash $15.50 with pancakes caramel apple

The banana cream pancakes were outstanding with the contrast of the sweet custard and slightly salty fluffy pancakes, while we found the rest of the dishes sufficient. Was it the hype?  High expectations?  No idea...

Being from New England, I was also a bit bummed to find out that their syrup isn't the real stuff.

Portions were generous however, and we had loads left over.

pics.caption: Brunch for 3 at Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe (with mucho leftover) 9/2017

review.des: This place is outstanding! The food was incredible and the service was awesome. A must do for breakfast or brunch when in Chicago!

pics.caption: Berry Bliss Crepes.  Photo by my wife's iPhone

review.des:
Had the Chorizo Omelet (3 stars) and upgraded the side to the Berry Bliss pancakes (4 stars). The omelet was very good, however, I thought that it needed a bit more salt. The pancakes, however, were probably some of the best I had ever had. They were very flavorful, so much so that I didn't eat them with any syrup at all, and perfectly fluffy. I would highly recommend the pancakes to anyone that comes here.

Things to note:
I came on a 9AM on Thursday, there was still a 30 minute wait. Use the Yelp app to put yourself on the waitlist on your way over.
The portions here are huge. The omelet and side of pancakes that I ordered was more than enough for two people.

I just had a really great lunch. Stop there with some friends from out of town and we all got breakfast. Really absolutely fantastic fluffy omelette. Maybe one of the best I've ever had. Matched up with some delicious yogurt granola and berries and I was extremely happy. Be careful though the place closes at 2: 30. Both of my friends had different versions of eggs benedict and they both said that it was delicious. Located directly across the street from Millennium Park I can see this place crazy on the weekends. I'll be back

The quality of this place is incredible considering the high volume of people it serves. We met a friend here on the recommendation that they had "the best pancakes she'd ever had". I was skeptical, pancakes tend to be pretty similar everywhere, but Wildberry somehow lived up to that hype. I had the berry pancakes with a coffee, and both were perfect. We were shocked to find that they serve  Intellegentcia coffee. So good, and perfect with the  berry pancakes. They were sweet, buttery, and chalk full of fruit. Would totally go back. One star missing because of a long wait and somewhat slow service, otherwise a perfect breakfast spot.

Put your name on the waiting list online through Yelp!  You will save yourself a long wait at the restaurant.  When we arrived, they were ready for us.  We had two little ones with us and they had a spot outside the restaurant for strollers to save on space.  The only thing that was frustrating is we needed to open the wing on our table about 6 inches for the high chair and it became a huge ordeal.  The table nor chairs were going to be in anyone's way but the busboy had to get the waiter who had to get the manager who in turn just said, no problem.  Other than that, the food was great.  I ordered the corned beef and hash skillet.  It was the perfect "hangover" or lazy Sunday morning meal.  It lasted me until dinner.  After breakfast we enjoyed the walk to the water, while our food settled.

This place is definitely worth the wait!  Lines can get long, so get in line on yelp before coming.  One of my favorite brunch places in Chicago.  They have both normal and really elevated breakfast and lunch dishes.  On this visit, I got the Fresca omelette, which was sun dried tomato, basil, avocado and cheese. It was super good!  I love that you can get fruit or hash browns.  Husband got the butcher block skillet and loved every bite.   The berry bliss pancakes are a must order if you like berries, or if you want something really indulgent, the chocolate banana bread French toast rocked my world!

pics.caption: Butcher Block Skillet and the amazing Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes
Fresca omelette with egg whites and fruit

review.des:
I am a big fan of breakfast, but not the biggest fan of breakfast diners. However, I like the menu options because you can try pancakes on the side and order a 'skillet' dish which is what I had. The skillet I ordered came with Italian sausage, tomato, eggs, mushrooms, and hashbrowns. I upgraded with their popular sensational berry pancake on the side. For what you get, it's not too pricy. You could honestly feed 2 with the side and the skillet.

Skillet (4/5) - Solid all around dish. Not mindblowing amazing, but just really good all around. The hashbrowns are a nice golden brown color and are crispy on the outer layers but also soft inside. The sausage, tomatoes, eggs, mushrooms are all balanced very well together and well cooked.

Berry Pancakes (4/5) - Also really good. Pancakes are nice and soft. The yogurt topping is a nice unique addition, and the berries are fresh. Again, similarly to the skillet, it's not mind blowing, but just a good all around dish.

I do think the breakfast here is on the pricy side. This combined with the fact that none of the food is outwardly unique and doesn't stand out is why I give this place 4 instead of 5 stars. However, I do value consistency so this place gets acknowledged for that.

I would definitely come back if I visited Chicago again. Just across the street from Millenium Park so very convenient!

pics.caption: skillet hash with eggs of your cook choice
Sensational berry pancakes yogurt sauce topping fresh berries

review.des:
Generous portions, delicious sides, and fantastic service.

Sunday brunch at 9am- wait time was quoted around 45-60 minutes after putting our names on the yelp waitlist. It didn't take as long as expected, so we happily took our seats! Around 8 patio tables and two large rooms inside. Food options are plentiful and service is FAST!

My sister and I each ordered an omelet (I had the Rutherford- bacon, goat cheese, caramelized onions and spinach, she had the Napa Valley Fig). Huge and delicious- each came with a side of fruit or hash browns and toast or pancakes. I had standard pancakes and fruit, my sister had Wildberry pancakes (up charge for specialty pancake) and fruit. Everything was perfect! Their coffee was strong and rich. Worth the wait, for sure. I still can't believe the side of pancakes was so big!

Nom nom nom

My husband and I came here for breakfast yesterday and holy moly it was the best!! I had the Barbacoa skillet, it was HEAVEN! My husband had the banana chocolate pancakes, they were great! Service was shockingly great since they were so busy. Our waitress was very accommodating and did a great job of helping us pick our breakfast! Chicago has so many great breakfast spots and we'll be coming back to this one AGAIN today!

Went to this restaurant for the second time with my family. The restaurant is very good for breakfasts, it has good and fast service. Employees are very nice and very well organized. Restaurant is very busy hence there is always a waiting list. In my case it was for around one hour. During winter they let families with kids into the nextdoor building's lobby's. Restaurant's location is excellent, next to Millennium Park. in general excellent restaurant for breakfast as long as you have the time to wait.

Pancake heaven! My first stop in Chicago and it was a wonderful start to my weekend trip. Yelpers should take advantage of signing up on the waitlist via yelp. Super easy, put your name on the list and they give you an estimate when you will be called, how many parties are ahead of you, and text you when it's time to get seated. Sunday morning at 9am, there was already an hour wait so definitely plan ahead.
Once seated, we ordered veggie omelet, breakfast platter with eggs, sausages and hash and the Oreo s'mores pancakes. Everything was delicious! All the entree comes with a variety of side choice so you can easily share an entree between two people. My favorite was the hash. The Oreos pancakes were super sweet and tasted amazing, but it was too sweet to finish.
Service is great. Our food came at a decent time and even though it was packed our waitress kept checking on us to make sure we had everything we needed.

Thanks to fellow Yelpers, I found this wonderful but busy breakfast spot right across Millennium Park. Thanks to the feature on the Yelp app,  I was able to put myself on the waitlist, so that in the time it took me to walk over, my wait time was down to 5 minutes!

Delicious and filling portions. You can order a kid size of the Berry Bliss pancakes and a side of something to go with. I chose a side of Corned Beef Hash. Enough for 2 really.

The coffee is Intelligentsia, the service is attentive. My coffee was constantly topped. I plan to be back the next time in town!

pics.caption: Kid size Berry Bliss pancakes and side of Corned beef hash

review.des: Amazing amazing Amazing place for brunch! I must warn you, the wait is long so your better off reserving your seat here through yelp and you can get texts as your spot comes available. My husband and I had to wait two hours which was fine because we were in the bean and enjoying the weather! Okay now I ordered orange juice, the Mexican skillet dish with the strawberry bliss pancakes. Oh myyyy gooodness  it was the best thing I ever had for brunch. It was way too much for me so I shared with my husband. This place is worth the wait and money. The service was great they were beyond attentive taking places out of our way and refilling our cups with water. Do not miss out if you visit Chicago! It's across the street from the bean.

Delicious pancakes but I think Imo the winner is the skillet!! Its everything you want for breakfast on one plate! The price and portion is great too!My husband and I ordered the mexicana with the berry pancKes (extra 1.50 for speciality pancake) and it was alot of food just for us two. I would def recommend just sharing an entree. Another bonus is the delicious unlimited refill of their coffee. I would recommend this brunch place for anyone visiting chi town.

Tip: sign up for the wAitlist via yelp. When we got there it was a 2 hr wait if you didnt!

Mediocre breakfast place. Large portions but bland food.

Not much else to say I don't get the hype?

There is one advantage though u can add ur self to waitlist through this app and get into the resto faster.

I have often walked by and noticed the huge crowds at this place. We finally had a chance to meet friends there on 11/25/18. What a great call. The place was busy and we had 7 to seat but they worked us in efficiently, keeping us informed and working with us the best they could. The food is amazing the Berry French Toast, S'mores Pancakes and Crepes were worth the wait. The Eggs Benedict is probably the best I have ever tried. I can't recommend breakfast here highly enough.

Ok so the food is amazing.. everything we ordered was on point but the wait time though is crazy.. first you need to wait in line for an hour or so depending when you going.. if you go early not much of a wait time.. if you go after 9 expect at least an hour or two wait time..
then you get seated then wait to order and then you wait an hour at least to get your food so expect a lot of wait but in the end it all worth it cause the food is so bomb!

I suggest if you have party of 4 or less add yourself to wait list through yelp.. ahead of time.. that way you have time to go there on time and wait for a little bit as they text you and you track  your place in line!

We ordered Mexicana skillet with scrambled eggs, strawberry poppy seeds pancakes and strawberry chocolate chip Belgian pancakes.. hot chocolate, caramel macchiato and Carmel latte for drinks.. every single platter was not only snap worthy.. it was delicious!
Kids portions were big too.. for Kids we ordered chocolate chip pancakes and berry bliss pancakes ; my kids didn't finish everything cause it was a lot.. so I would suggest if you have little kids order one thing and share!

Pancakes were just sooo fluffy and so soft they actually melt in your mouth.. sooo good!

pics.caption: Mexicana skillet with scramble eggs  We topped it off with some hot sauce to give more kick to it! Yum

review.des:
GET THE PANCAKES.

Our meal here was amazing, absolutely everything was fantastic. The food was very filling, about average brunch prices, and so full of flavor. The Oreo pancakes were hands down the best pancakes that I've ever had, and the berry was also seriously amazing.

I would also like to highlight the location / wait time. You can put your name down online, which was extremely convenient given the long wait since this restaurant is very popular. Also, it is right by the bean! Not a bad way to kill time until your reservation.

I can't wait to come back to Chicago for more!

The wait time at Wildberry is ridiculous but thanks to yelp you can put yourself  in line SO DO IT, unless you like waiting 2 hours for breakfast. This place is pretty large and they manage an extremely large crowd pretty well. We had the skillet and a bacon omelette with a cinnamon swirl and buttermilk pancake...the portions were very large, so if you're not hungry consider sharing a meal. The food taste was pretty standard and nothing outstanding but it was good nonetheless. I personally wouldn't wait two hours in line here but if I can get right in from joining the waitlist prior to arrival I would visit again

Amazing breakfast we had here! We did have to wait 45mins for the table but it was worth it. Service is very good and plates are big. Me and my boyfriend ordered the Signature Berry Bliss, the Eggs Benedict and an extra of bacon. Also, the Vanilla Berry Coffee was good. Do take into consideration the time before you come because of the amount of people here!

Overall i was very happy with the service - we were seated immediately and we had a very quick and friendly server. I have been to other locations and loved it, but i was a bit disappointed with the food this morning. Breakfast burrito wasn't bad, but  the pancakes were a bit dry. Hoping the kitchen just had an off day or something
Delish! Each thing we got tasted so good! WBlt was so good!! We will be back for sure

This place is all about the wait time. They have crazy lines and wait times every.single.day! Luckily I work in the building, so its easy for me to give my name and be called right before the table is ready. Do not come here on the weekend when you are hungry and have to have food - come here at least an hour before you hit that stage! Hangry is not a good look :)

Coming to the food - its the regular breakfast/brunch fare. Its always full, lots of tourists and families. Service is decent, but some times pretty slow, which is understandable given the crowds. They have a big menu and have all the usual items and then some. They also serve lunch items. I have only eaten omelettes here and all of them have been pretty good. My friends have loved their pancakes and waffles, so I know they are pretty good. They also do have gluten-free options, which is always a plus.

My husband and I were in Chicago for a weekend and we went to Wildberry for brunch BOTH days (each time with a diff set of friends, of course). Yes, it's really that good! The berry bliss pancakes are amazing and a must-try!!! We also tried one of their omelettes and a skillet. The wait may seem daunting, especially on a weekend, but you can add your name to the waitlist via Yelp if your group is small enough. Our party during our second visit was a little larger, but the wait ended up being wayyy shorter than they told us. Plus, the bean is right there too :)
Great location and comfortable atmosphere. There are a ton of options and varieties of brunch foods to choose from. This is our go to breakfast destination!

I'm not sold, you guys. The wait time really makes it seem like the hype is real, but is it REALLY real? Not in my opinion....

Don't get me wrong. The food isn't bad by any means. I ordered the Napa Valley Fig omelette, which has scallions, figs, bacon and havarti, and I got my choice of fruit or hash browns, as well as my choice of pancakes or toast. It's a lot of food for $13. I even upgraded to the signature Berry Bliss pancakes. I liked everything. I enjoyed what I tasted. But it is just an omelette, and they are pretty standard pancakes with some cool anglaise designs.

I much prefer my local hot spots for taste, service and wait time, but it's worth a try if you're really into hitting up all of the "cool spots" in Chicago. For me though, it's one and done! Checked it off to my to do list... forever!

This place has got it going on with breakfast food. I tried the banana cream pancakes and loved every bite. It was hard deciding what pancake to get because all flavors sound delicious and are unique. My server, Brittany, was helpful and sweet with deciding what I wanted to eat. Every single staff member made the experience that much better with their smiles and greetings. My server was informative and let me know that you can substitute any pancake as a side for a small price with any breakfast entree. I got scrambled eggs, bacon and banana cream pancakes. I can't wait to visit again when I go to Chicago.

If you want to eat here, come prepared for a long wait. We ended up waiting a little over an hour. Luckily, Millenium Park is right next to it- so we explored the park after putting our names on the list. Unluckily, as Chicago does, it poured and we were dripping wet when we returned to do our final leg of waiting outside.

That being said, the service was very prompt and friendly once we were seated. I was impressed by how quickly everything was served once we ordered! The place was packed but we had our drinks and food before we knew it - and plenty of it at that. The food portions were hefty, which is great since waiting sure makes you hungry!

Hazelnut latte - nice flavor, I enjoyed that it was organic trade coffee beans. Additionally, it was not too heavy on hazelnut flavor

Wild berry signature french toast - Wow! It was very tasty.  I usually go for more savory than sweet at breakfast places but I knew I had to try it. The fresh berries added were very good. The best part was the marscapone cheese with berry in between the slices of french toast. The glazes on it were great too

Was recommended this place while visiting Chicago and met a friend who lived in town. This place is nuts on a Saturday morning but you can alleviate this by doing online check-in.

We got seated and our server was there in a flash. She was friendly and able to offer great recommendations to us. We shared three different specialty pancakes between our table and were not disappointed! We did the cinnamon roll (which was the favorite) and the Berry Bliss and another that had lemon drizzle on it.

I had the Butcher Block skillet - it was delicious with the eggs sunny side up! It was very filling as well, if the pancakes didn't look so enticing then that would have been plenty!

I think the prices are reasonable as well for the value. I would definitely return here when visiting Chicago again, despite the crowd. The service is very professional and they know how to move people through without rushing you.

I met a friend at Wildberry early on a weekday morning, and though it was a pleasant enough experience, I felt a little like I was at an iHop.

The service was super attentive and quick, but the food was nothing special. I got the rustic egg panini, and my friend got the pancakes. I think we should've opted for their french toast or something more special. Our food was just okay and by the time we left (around 9am), there was an enormous line out the door. I would be bummed if I waited for longer than 5 minutes for the food we had.

Signature berry bliss tastes like cheap reduced fat strawberry yogurt.
Los Altos Benedict is greasy.
2 star for the fries.

My boyfriend and I actually came here twice for our Chicago trip. The food comes in huge portions and they are so delicious! I actually ordered a veggie burger but the patty was falling apart on me and I told the waitress. I ended up returning my order and receiving a turkey burger instead. The customer service was great- the manager even came to apologize, which was not necessary. Both times, the food was great and so was the service. I would definitely come back here and recommend it to anyone!

pics.caption: The fries are so goooood good! Veggie burger is ok

review.des: Saw how many reviews and still with 4.5 stars.  I totally understand why!!!  Great service. Waffles and pancakes tasted good with great syrups and toppings.  This place get busy.  Must add to your list of place to grab breakfast in Chicago.

I wanted to hit up a breakfast spot close to Millennium Park and Wildberry Cafe was the place.
I went on a weekday morning, and it was already busy inside at 10 AM but the wait was only 5 minutes, so not that bad.

As I expected, it was full of tourists and visitors from out of town. I was surprised by how clean it looked despite the heavy foot traffic

I ordered eggs with bacon, side of fruit, and pancake. It came out fairly quickly. The bacon and pancake were definitely made in batches and didn't come out piping hot, which was a bit of a bummer. Everything tasted fine though, and even though it doesn't look like much, it was a lot of food. For the amount of food, it was a pretty solid deal.

Overall, it's pretty standard breakfast fare, nothing ultra mind-blowing, and it's not like the pancakes can do jumping jacks or anything, but it's a solid spot, and met my expectations and then some. Service was fast and friendly. I would recommend this spot to my family/friends on their visits to Chicago.

4.5
Really enjoyed the hearty breakfast with apple caramelized pecan pancakes and omelette.  Very large portions which I loved and gave me energy for the rest of the day to explore Chicago!  Awesome!

The famous brunch spot in Chicago conveniently located next to millennium park but the line is so real. Last three times I was here - the line is RIDICULOUS. I was determined to get here so I went for my morning run and stopped by here for breakfast at 7am. Place was already really bustling but there was no wait.

No need on me to elebaorate on food options. Get ANYTHING that is breakfast related!!!

Coffee is made by intelligentsia!

Fantastic service with a reasonable wait - make sure to use Yelp to get in line ahead of time, and you'll be set. The wait was shorter than estimated, so don't be intimidated by the number of parties before you. Food was delicious (berry crepes, mexicana skillet, buttermilk pancakes) with generous portions, and the coffee (vanilla berry soy latte) was good, too. Highly recommend!

*ADD YOURSELF TO THE WAITLIST VIA YELP*
The rest of the experience after that is a complete breeze and pleasure!

Woke up in the morning and added ourselves from the hotel which was estimated a 1.5-2 hr wait period. This gave us plenty of time to get ready and then arrive just in time to be seated!

The service was super fast and friendly! They thank you for waiting, help you with the huge menu options and our waiter even offered to take out pictures of our table. Our food also came out in about 10-15 minutes! Totally unexpected for such a busy brunch place.

All of our food was soooooo good both sweet and savory! And all were huge shareable proportions.

Overall the experience was wonderful and would recommend.

I've been here twice. Both times the food was BOMB! Seriously THE best breakfast I've had in months. The menu is creative without being too wacky. I had the cinnamon roll French toast and bacon. Even the bacon was exemplary (it's hard for me to find bad bacon, but this was especially good). The service was amazing too. Very attentive servers and bussers. The bathroom was clean. My only "negative" is the wait. On any given morning you should expect at least a 20 minute wait, but they have a texting system that keeps you updated.

Ask for Jeremy! He's great!

First time visiting Chicago so I had no clue where to eat breakfast thank god for yelp. Once I saw the great reviews I knew it was a must. When we arrived the place was packed but they move really fast to get you seated. As soon as we got to the table there was water already waiting and our server came over immediately! Not once did we ever have to look around for Dustin who was our server. The food was absolutely delicious. We ordered blueberry pancakes,chicken & waffles, Chai latte, and hash browns!!!! We would definitely be visiting again!!!!

I go to Wildberry several times a year to meet people for breakfast, as I work in the Prudential building.

In a few works: quantity over quality.

You get an insane amount of food with the skillet. I always get so much food that I have enough for a comfortable lunch.

Whatever you do, do not get the corned beef hash. Barely any corned beef in it - think hash browns lightly dusted with corned beef on top.

Good coffee though - I think they serve Intelligencia?

Also, for whatever reason, every time I go, the restaurant smells of body odor or mildew. Not exactly the initial smell you'd want to hit your nose as you're going to eat.

Came here on a Friday morning around 10 and it was so packed. My party could barely get inside and the hosts could hardly hear my name and number to put down on the waiting list. I was told the wait would be around 45 minutes but because I preferred indoor seating (It was foggy and drizzly outside) so it really turned out to be a little over an hour. We had 62 parties ahead of us when we got in line.

Moving on to the food -- I had ordered the strawberry poppyseed pancakes with a biscuit on the side. Came out to $16 ($13 for a stack of 5 pancakes and $3 for the biscuit). The pancakes come topped with strawberry slices and this delicious lemon curd syrup drizzled on top. The serving was more than sufficient for me -- I had about 3/4 of it before I tapped out and called it a day with my meal. I had never had a poppyseed pancake at any other brunch place so I was pretty satisfied with this new flavored pancake. The other members of my party had ordered more savory dishes so I had the chance to try their bacon and hash browns. The bacon at this restaurant was so thick and not fatty -- it was honestly really great. Everything was super filling and tasty. 5 stars for the food itself.

Overall, I am giving this place a 4. I wish there were opportunities to place reservations because it is such a popular restaurant that having to wait wouldn't even be a surprise. As a tourist coming from out of state, I would've rather not spend an extra hour just waiting to eat. Not to mention the weather can be so unpredictable and it was really cold outside but the waiting space inside is so small that most people can't wait indoors even if they wanted to. The prices were a little high but pretty typical for American brunch restaurants. Overall, the food and service was great -- I just wouldn't want to wait in line again.

This is one of the most reviewed restaurants in Chicago, and as a brunch enthusiast I had to try it out. It's conveniently located next to Millennium park so tourists can grab brunch before heading over to the park.

Came on a Wednesday morning and there was no line at all. My friend and I ordered: pumpkin spice pancakes, the butcher skillet, and the rustic farm egg panini. All three dishes were amazing and came in HUGE portions. My friend's sandwich was stacked so high with the classic breakfast items she could barely bite into it. My butcher sizzler was packed with all types meat and cheese but never felt too heavy. The pumpkin pancakes came with a spiced butter. They were light, fluffy, and the pumpkin flavor came through. I highly recommend all three dishes, but I'm sure everything on they menu is just as good. As someone who's brunched at an embracing amount of restaurants this is comparable to some of my favorites!!
Although the wait may be long you will be pleased. Everything is hot, tasted fresh and delicious. The portions are huge. This is a great place to eat especially when visiting Chicago.

Girl friend and I split a make your own omelette and oreo Smores pancakes with hash browns. We still had enough food left over for a small child. The portions were good size for a fair price in Chicago. Our server Jeremy was very nice and despite being busy on a saturday with a 2 hour wait time, he managed to do an outstanding job.
Also the little coffee bar this place has is great

Love the ambiance and the service.
We added ourselves to the waitlist before even getting to the restaurant which saved us a lot of waiting time there. You have to get the Wildberry pancakes which is their signature dish. Definitely fulfilled my sweet tooth.

pics.caption: Tasted like a brownie  Looks scrumptious

review.des:
I have been wanting to go to Wildberry for a long time now but the 2-3 hour wait times have prevented me from going. It just so happened that on a weekday morning I had extra time to kill and decided to give it a try. To my relief, the wait time was only a half hour which is nothing if you know how long the wait time can get for Wildberry on a weekend despite having multiple locations. There were 26 parties ahead of us and we checked in on yelp but Wildberry was very quick to accommodate everyone and we got in within the half hour wait time. We were also looking to get in and out quickly as we had a train to catch. Our waitress was very accommodating to make sure our order and check was taken care of as quickly as possible.

I ordered the signature berry bliss pancakes, turkey sausage and caramel pumpkin spice latte and my boyfriend got the veggie omelette. The signature berry bliss pancakes are as good as everyone says and I'm not even a huge fan of pancakes. I usually prefer French toast or waffles. The latte was also delish and the turkey sausage was good too. Often times, I find turkey or chicken sausage at restaurants doesn't taste the same as regular sausage but that was not the case with Wildberry. As for whether Wildberry is worth the wait times... I don't know. It's good, but I wouldn't wait 2-3 hours to get in though certainly worth going if you live in Chicago.

We went here for breakfast and my advice is to go early! We arrived about 8-ish and there was a 20 minute wait. By 8:15-ish the wait was 2 hours!

The place is enormous, as is the menu. I had the brisket hash and it was outstanding, really flavorful and a ton of food ($14). I did not eat again until dinner. Portions are generally enormous. The wife ordered the 2 eggs with bacon and pancake ($12.50). Everything was prepared well.

For as busy as they are, and the servers work very hard, the service was fast. Food came out relatively fast and hot.

The quality of the food is what sets this place apart. I would absolutely return here, and next time I would arrive even earlier. They open at 6:30am I think.

Food: 3/5
Service: 3/5
Ambiance: n/a
Overall:  I took this order to go so I wasn't able to experience the ambiance. Food was pretty average to me and there was a long wait which reminded me of waiting in line for the Cheesecake Factory.  I'd try another dish next time though.

The extended review...

Food:

Signature berry bliss Crepes - I can't say I was really impressed with this.  The sauce was ok and the filling was a wee bit too sweet.  The textute on the crepes themselves were a little more rubbery than I was looking for.  

Service: friendly service by the host.

pics.caption: Signature berry bliss crepes - wasn't impressed with this dish

review.des: Amazing brunch. Got the Mexicana Skillet and some omelet. Both were good but the main highlight were the extra sub specialty pancakes for 2 dollars! Got blueberry Danish and Berry Bliss which were pretty similar but both very good. The portions were very large and 2 dishes could be shared among 3 easily. Highly recommend!

Exellet food, good service, your wait will be worth it!
1st time here, I'll do it again!!!

This was such a great breakfast. We were able to join the wait list, so by the time we got to the restaurant, it was a quick wait. My coffee was good, my pancakes were absolutely delicious, the service was great, and we got our breakfast quickly. Definitely would recommend!

I have made this a must every time I am in chocago.  I love the berry orange juice and the pancakes.  I try to get a different kind each time.  This last time I got the cinnamon roll pancakes.  It is definitely worth upgrading the side order to a premium pancake.  It was funny because a guy that was next to me initially sent his pancakes back because they broke apart too easily.  His second plate was just as fluffy and did the same thing.  Apparently he has never had really good fluffy pancakes.

I didn't know that this place had a reputation for their food. Their wait was long but it was well worth it. Everything worked like clockwork. The service was great and the food was better.

I had the Los Altos Benedict with a side of fruit and my friend gave me half her pancake. Everything was extraordinary. The chorizo on the eggs Benedict was definitely a nice twist. The pancake was great and the fruit tasted fresh.

Great brunch place that is well worth the wait and definitely worth checking out if you're in Chicago.

pics.caption: Los Altos Benedict. Serious flavor in every bite

review.des: first time here on a cold fall morning, and I only had a 5 minute wait! ha. I had the traditional Eggs Benedict, and it was awesome!  it had a thick slice of ham, perfectly poached egg, and a delicious Hollandaise that was not overpowering.  gotta come back for the pancakes...

A pretty good brunch place. It is a nice place to meet up with friends or go on a date with your significant other. SO STOP READING THIS AND ADD YOURSELF ON THE WAITLIST!!!
The pancake here, hands down the best pancake I ever had. Never had pancakes this fluffy and taste so good. It is as fluffy as those Japanese pancakes. The crepes here is alright. It's good, but doesn't meet the level of the pancakes. The egg Benedict is like your standard Benedict. It still pretty good but nothing to write home about.
The staff here isn't that generous. Even though it was my turn to sit down, they pushed me a spot back because I didn't have everybody here even though my dad just went to the bathroom. They weren't even polite about too. The person just told me to move back and wait. So I had to wait for an additional 10 mins sit down on a table.
Overall, considering the value you get since the portions are pretty big for that price, I would score it 4.5; however, due to my experience being not as good as it could be, I would have to give it a 4.25.
I looove this place. All the pancakes are amazing! I got the corned beef hash skillet and could of had enough food to feed an entire village. It was super delicious. Highly recommend this place!

Worth the wait! This restaurant was certainly a highlight of my weekend trip to Chicago. We placed ourselves in line on a Friday at about 10am, and got our food at 10:48am. We sat outside, which I preferred because it was much quieter and provided a lot of nice people watching.

I ordered the garden skillet and upgraded my pancake to the Signature Berry Bliss, which may have been the best decision I have ever made. The skillet itself was average and could have used a wider hash brown to onion ratio, but the eggs were cooked perfectly and it was a very large portion with a lot of veggie goodness packed inside! The pancake was absolutely to die for - fluffy, sweet, and very berry.

The coffee (they brew Intellegentsia) was above and beyond average. It was strong, dark, and perfectly robust for a chilly day. I went back a day later for the vanilla berry latte - I can't describe the taste other than that it is essentially the berry pancakes packed into a cup with amazing, strong espresso that offsets the sweetness for a tantalizing balance of flavors.

While it may be a bit overrated and we got lucky with the wait because it was a weekday, I completely forgot about the wait halfway through the meal. Worth it!

pics.caption: Garden skillet + signature berry bliss pancake

review.des: This place always has a wait and now I know why. I tried the chocolate chip banana pancakes and they were delicious. The normal order could easily feed two. I did get extra bananas because everyone needs more fruit in the morning. Use yelp to check in on the waitlist.

Honestly, I really don't get the hype.  If you're looking for brunch places in Chicago-- yes this place has a crap ton of reviews and it seems like the place to go on Yelp, but with the 2+ hours waits, the rushed service, and mediocre brunch food, unless you really want to try Wildberry because of the fact that it is "THE" brunch place in downtown Chicago to go to, there's much better places to hit up.  Trust me.

I've been to Wildberry twice now, and both time I've been disappointed.  The first time it was because both me and a friend ordered two sweet dishes and both were WAY too sweet for either of to finish.  Learning our lesson, the second time we came around, we ordered one sweet and one salty dish hoping that this would balance our taste buds better.

NOPE.

The quality wasn't superb by any means-- like I've said, I've eaten way better and higher quality brunch places in Chicago for (1) lower costs and (2) no wait time.  They're just lucky they're in a very central location.  So I ordered:

Fresh Berries Crepe (2/5)-- 1 sentence: the berries were NOT fresh.  Also they were SOOO skimpy with the berries.  If I'm paying for $12 worth of crepe and FRESH berries, I expect to get $12 worth of crepe and FRESH berries.  Not like a child's handful of sad looking blueberries and blackberries.  I was so devastated. Also, the filling didn't taste great at all either.  It honestly tasted like someone took canned jelly and just put it in the crepe--where's the freshness of that?

We also got a skillet that I genuinely cannot remember the name of (might have been on the specialty menu) but damn, they're skimpy again--giving me TWO tortilla wraps for... a TON of food.  

Seriously, guys, Wildberry is not worth the hype nor the wait nor the cost.

pics.caption: fresh berry crepe in the back (LOOK HOW SKIMPY THE PORTION SIZE FOR THE BERRIES GIVEN ARE)

review.des: Extremely good food and huge portions! I got the wildberry orange juice which was amazing and the brisket hash was pretty good, the brisket could have been a bit more tender however. But the wildberry pancakes are really fluffy and delicious, would come again if I ever visit Chicago in the future!

Ok, so I walked passed this place while visiting the bean and notice the long line. I figured it had to be good if people were willing to wait....and it was! I called ahead for a reservation so it wasn't much of a wait for me. They have a large staff which means they are turning tables quickly.
I ordered the classic eggs benidict and it. Was. Delicious! That ham was something serious. I also got a side of banana cream pancakes because it is a pancake spot and those were really good as well! Try this place for sure.

pics.caption: Classic benidict with hash browns. That big ol' piece of ham was Good!

review.des: I am blown away by this establishment! There were 80+ parties on the waitlist in front of us and we got seated in an hour. The waiter pulled my chair out for me when we were seated. There is something on the menu for everybody and from what I can tell all of the ingredients are top notch. The atmosphere is upbeat but you feel relaxed. I would visit Chicago just to eat here again!

pics.caption: Homemade corned beef hash. SO filling!

review.des: Great service! Highly recommend using the Yelp app to add your name to the waitlist. Otherwise you could be waiting for 2 hours. I added my name to the waitlist right when I left OHare and still had time to stop at my downtown hotel before going to the restaurant. Those who know Chicago know how long it takes to travel that distance! Jasmine was very attentive as a server. I ordered the Fresca omelette and cinnamon roll pancakes. The omelette came with avocado. I did not like it and let the server know. The manager came out and apologized and went over all the ingredients to make sure the next one was made to my liking. I tell you all of this to say...get the cinnamon roll pancakes. OMG!!! You do not need any syrup or butter in these. The Hash Browns were also good. Ask them to make them crunchy. The omelette was good too after it was redone. Would revisit again without any hesitation.

pics.caption: Cinnamon Roll Pancakes are terrific!  No butter or syrup needed on these.

review.des:
If you haven't researched this place in advance and put your name on the list using the NoWait app, then don't bother coming!!! If you're starving and want breakfast/brunch NOW, this is NOT the place for you. Average wait time is 1.5-2 hours.

With that being said, if you're prepared for the wait, it is a great place for brunch. It is big inside and able to accommodate many customers, and once inside the service is FAST. They have waters on the table and ready for you once you sit down-and are ready to take your order immediately (so look at a menu outside)!! Food was delivered within 10 minutes of sitting down.

I had the florentine eggs benedict-the English muffin was big and fluffy, egg was cooked perfectly (hard to find), bacon bits were large, and hollandaise sauce was thick and tasty. The only downside was my entire plate had 19 lbs of spinach on it.

Would definitely return here for brunch!!

This place was so busy! They don't take reservations or call aheads so don't bother if you don't have time to spare. When we went, it was a normal Saturday and we were put on a waiting list (table for four) at around 10:45am and didn't get seated until almost 1:00pm. They text you when your table is about ready so we were able to walk around and everything before we ultimately ate. Wildberry is right by the Bean/Millennium Park so that must be a factor for how busy they are. The food wasn't the most amazing brunch food I've had, but the portions were large and they had great service. Lots and lots of options on their menu too, which is great. For how packed it was, we got our food relatively quickly. I would give this a 3.5 if I could but that's because I have high brunch standards!

pics.caption: This is the garden skillet with pancakes as my side. Yummy veggies and decent pancakes. Portion size was okay for 2!

review.des:
Located right next to Millenium Park!

Pretty breakfast dishes that are also delicious. We came here as soon as it opened since we were at the bean at 4am. I ordered a hot coffee and got so many refills just to give me fuel for the day. I also ordered a florence benedict ($12.75) with extra bacon (at extra charge)!My Florence benedict was served on an English muffin with baby spinach, chopped bacon, poached eggs, and homemade hollandaise sauce. I thought it would be strips of bacon on the side for about $4 because that's what the menu said. I substituted my potatoes for original pancakes. The berry sauce here is berry good. My friends both got stacks of pancakes with their berry sauce. The pancakes are giant. I could barely finish my whole meal.

Our waitress, Emily, came by many times to make sure everything was good. This place gets real busy. If you want to have lunch here, especially outside, make sure to call in a reservation!

Amazing service and pancakes. You must get here. Super fresh delicious fluffy etc.

Skillet was good too. Coffee thumbs up.

When in Chicago get here!

Fantastic breakfast restaurant:  The service was great, the menu extensive, atmosphere pleasing, and a very friendly staff.

An example of the professionalism of the staff: At one point during my meal I accidentally dropped my knife; a new one, wrapped in a napkin, was provided within seconds.

As for the the food, I had the traditional Eggs Benedict, and my wife had the Signature Berry Bliss Waffle. The ham on the Eggs Benedict was delicious--the ham was off the bone, not the processed canned variety. The poached eggs were perfectly prepared--as I ordered them. My wife was delighted with her waffle. The combination of a crispy waffle, fresh berries, mascarpone cheese, and all the magic drizzle they apply made her very, very happy.

So delicious!!
Keep up the good work.

The corned beef hash was delicious and they gave me free hollandaise sauce on the side (which was a mediocre sauce). You can upgrade to pancake sides for a small up charge but the pancakes were average... and the "famous" berry pancakes are not made with fresh berries, so we didn't like them at all. If the wait wasn't three hours during st. Patrick's day, the rating may have been higher since it's big portions for a low price. I just don't think it was worth the long wait. Pro tip though is to use yelps waitlist option to get on it before getting there. It gave us time to explore instead of sit there waiting, and it works really well.

Worth the wait, which I don't often say. You will wait a loonnng time, but plan to get your name on the wait list and walk around the park.
The fresca omelet was delicious, hashbrowns perfect and the pancakes were very cake like.
Lots of food great value and great eats. A win for us.

Arriving early on a Wednesday guaranteed no wait and fast service.  The portions are huge.  Since I was alone, I ordered the 2 eggs with thick crispy bacon along with the specialty berry pancakes.  I ordered all the topping on the pancakes on the side.  It would have been too much.  Also gave me time to enjoy all the food without having the creamy sauces drench the pancakes.  Service was great.  Great location to explore and walk off the food afterwards.

thank goodness for the yelp waitlist! my friends and i just hung around millennium park until there were roughly 5 parties ahead of us and then we started walking toward the restaurant.

my boyfriend ordered the hot chocolate to start. pretty average hot chocolate - nothing special. so on to the entrees, i got the denver skillet and the signature berry bliss pancakes. a great mix of sweet and savory but you will for sure have leftovers if you're a smaller woman like me, but no complaints!

will definitely be back!

pics.caption: denver skillet and signature berry bliss pancakes

review.des: Yummy variety of breakfast favorites. Lots of gluten-free options and interesting omelette and other egg dishes. Plus a great variety of crepes, pancakes and waffles and oatmeal and so much more   definitely reserve ahead because there's a line on Saturday mornings. Also make sure to to try all the yummy toppings.  Plus some wonderful coffee options

As every other Yelper has said this place is definitely catered for tourists. It's conveniently located across from Millennium Park (Cloudgate) hence the long waiting times. My friend and I decided to stop by around 11 to grab breakfast. Now the most important thing in this review is in the next sentence. I would HIGHLY recommend that you join the waitlist via Yelp to save yourself a lot of time. I joined the waitlist in the hotel room around 10:27 and walked to Cloudgate and by the time I was done taking pictures I received a text from Wildberry to see the hostess within 10 minutes at 11:07.

Upon walking in, I was hearing people being quoted a wait time for 1.5 hours for a party of 2. Do yourself a favor and utilize the waitlist feature on Yelp. Upon seating down, I ordered the Butcher Block skillet and substituted my hash browns for the fresh glazed strawberry pancakes for an additional $1.50 charge. The food came out quickly and the portion sizes here are no joke. The food was very heavy and I ended up not being able to finish the skillet. The star of the show of my meal were the strawberry pancakes. They were fluffy and perfectly cooked. As far as the skillet goes, it was very good and kept me content until 6 PM that day.

If you are looking for a place to grab breakfast then this is probably your best option. Even though it's a tourist trap, I felt like the food was tasty and excellent. The staff are very friendly and are quick to take your orders and work hard to get you in and out of the restaurant to get other folks in.
Whoa!! Can you imagine this: the Best breakfast place on earth!!!  A picture is 1 thousand words.

Had the berry crepes. So good. The food came out quickly and piping hot. The berries were fresh and sweet. The fresh squeezed orange juice was perfect for washing it down. And of course I had to have a mocha for the road which is made with intelligentsia coffee-kept me going for hours.

The wait staff was friendly and they didn't seem to mind helping each other out even if they didn't get a share of the tip. At one point, someone who wasn't my designated waiter got me the latte order.

I feel like I've had better brunch food and that Wildberry is nothing special. That being said they do have two locations in downtown Chicago so it makes it easier tofu d a brunch spot on a busy Sunday afternoon.

I always get their breakfast burrito and it is always satisfying!

I felt like this restaurant was a little over hyped.  The wait was definitely long despite it being a Friday morning.  I read online that you can reserve your spot through the waiting app, but unfortunately, if your party is over 5 people, you cannot use the app.  My party had 6 people and a child and had to wait over an hour.  That's the only downside to the app.  Majority of us got the hash brown skillet and the portions are huge!  I couldn't even finish half.  It had hash brown, your choice of egg style, cheese and vegetables.  I also added a side of their popular berry pancakes.  The pancake was definitely delicious, but I thought it was too sweet.  If I was in Chicago again, I would come back if the wait was shorter because I didn't think this spot was that great.

I had high expectations based on the Yelp reviews, but sadly these weren't met.  The service was excellent.  It was the food that was lacking.

I ordered the Fresca omelet (3 eggs), which came with a side of hash browns/fruit and pancakes/toast.  Needless to say, portions are large :).  I'm sorry to say, but the omelet simply wasn't very good.  The buttermilk pancakes were pretty good, but not enough for me to elevate the rating.  My experience wasn't inline with the stellar reviews.

There were long lines as expected for a Saturday morning. We used Yelp/No Wait to get on the waiting list and saved a bunch of time.  We were seated shortly after the suggested arrival time.  The hosts, wait staff and servers are VERY friendly and on top of their game.  5 stars for service.

Pro-tip - get on the wait list via Yelp early!!

Service was above average for the amount of tables our waiter was serving.

Food was A-OK. Nothing phenomenal, but a pretty good breakfast.

Prices are high, but it's Chicago.

Next time I'm in Chicago - I'm definitely going to try something else. Not saying don't go, but don't expect amazing things.

This place has great tasting food made in big portions, probably recommend sharing if you're not SUPER EXTRA hungry lol. Since they have the word "berry" in their sign title, you obviously know you have to try something there with berries included. So we got a variety of different dishes like Signature Bliss Crepes as well as Pancakes, the Chorizo Omelet, and a Strawberry poppyseed pancakes. The pancakes are hella fluffy, 3 pancakes almost look like seven! The crepe we ordered have yogurt filling on the inside as well as very mascarpone and vanilla cream sauce on top! It's delicious!!!!

The omelet was definitely very bold in flavor, cheesiness and spiciness. So if you like something very flavorful for breakfast or brunch I would go with this, and the size of the omelet itself is almost double the size of my fist.

On a recent girls trip, I had this place bookmarked to try based on all the positive reviews.  Once again, the Yelp community did not let me down.  Wildberry was sooooo good.  The amount of food, the price of the food, and the service...all grand!

Before going, I downloaded the 'Nowait' app, so I could grab my spot in line. LISTEN: if there is one thing to take away from this review, it is to put yourself on the wait list through Yelp or the Nowait app.  Our wait was about 2 hours, but since we had our place in line, we could shop first then head down to Wildberry.  Their hours are limited and they have many visitors.  I'm not sure about the weekday wait (I hear those are a little friendlier), but the weekend are no joke.

The food was amazing!  I can't remember everything I tried, because I tried my food plus the food of my friend.  I do remember the Honey Toffee Nut Latte.  If you're in to latte, grab one (hot or cold).  The size is amazing and you will be asking for another round.  The cinnamon pancakes were good and the skillets...you can't go wrong.  The wait staff were all courteous and quick.  They like to turn tables over pretty fast, but they didn't rush us.  

This place is surely a must-do if you're in the area!!

Standard brunch spot. Great food. Long waits.
The usual brunch spot with great eggs and pancakes but the long wait time almost make it not worth the trip. Your time is more valuable than to wait +2 hours for eggs/pancakes.

I visited Wild Berry during my weekend vacation to Chicago in early August. This place was recommended to me by a friend who sent me her picture of a huge stack of delicious looking pancakes. The restaurant was walking distance from my hotel (on Michigan Ave) in a corner area which I thought was difficult to find. The first morning I tried to eat was on a Friday. Wow! Hour to hour and 45 minute wait. Nope! Are else where. The next morning (Saturday) I realized you are able to add to the wait list through yelp! It tells you how the wait and to check in when you actually do reach the restaurant. Got to use this method! Upon my check in, I'm told I still have a little wait, but no problem. As I'm waiting for maybe 3 minutes, a waiter tells me he can seat me! I followed the other waiter who gave me a perfect corner outdoor seat. I had the huge stack of wild berry pancakes with a side of eggs with cheese. The eggs were delicious! The pancakes were awfully thick for my liking. Not too sweet and yummy, but had a strong cakey texture. They're menu is big and looks good! Definitely worth the checking out!

pics.caption: 5 layers of pancakes and a sweet view.

review.des:
Wow! This place gets busy, but it is worth the wait. I've heard of people getting quoted 60-90 minute waits for a parties of 2. Do yourself a favor and use the Waitlist feature on Yelp! It will save you SO much time. We joined the waitlist as we were leaving our hotel and it quoted us 15-20 minutes. By the time we got there and checked in, we only had to wait about 5 minutes before getting seated.  You have to check in with the hostess within 5 minutes of when your table is ready.

The service was a little slow for us, but I think it depends on who your server is. There was another server helping tables next to us and he seemed much more efficient. The passionfruit lemonade was very tasty and refreshing. We ordered omelets (build your own), hashbrowns, and upgraded to the specialty pancakes for our sides - 1 Signature Berry Bliss and 1 Cinnamon Roll. The food came out very quickly and everything tasted fresh.  Everything tasted very good - but my favorite part was the cinnamon roll pancake, wow, it was so good!

The wait. OH. MY. GOD. the wait is something else and to make it worst the lobby is very small. Once you get to the the table the staff. Food and atmosphere is a very good on. The best thing I can tell you about  the place is to get on the waitlist through yelp. That seems to give you a little boost

Let me just start by saying that this place gets crowded REAL QUICK. After putting myself on the waitlist in the midst of Saturday brunch, I waited 2 hours for a table, so plan accordingly. However once I got my text message, I was seated immediately and 5 minutes later, had my order put through. When you put things into perspective, this place is very organized and efficient. For my meal, I ended up doing the combo with chocolate chip banana pancakes, eggs, sausage, and hashbrowns (highly recommended to get the most bang for the buck here). My HOT, FRESH food came out within 10 minutes of ordering. The chocolate chip banana pancakes were very rich and chocolatey. The eggs, sausage, and hashbrowns are pretty much standard from what you'd find at any other place, but nonetheless, left me satisfied. Would definitely recommend this place if you've got some time to kill before brunch.

If only 10 stars was an option... hands down best breakfast that I have ever had in my life. I had the garden scramble with a side of pancakes. Let's start with the pancakes. Light, fluffy, moist and just slightly sweet. The scramble was incredible. Packed with flavor and perfect blend of eggs, potatoes and vegetables. Our server was top notch. We waited 2 hours to get BUT I've since discovered you at join their waitlist from Yelp. SO, get off this review and go join. Thank me later

So glad we decided to try this place out on our trip to Chicago. This place knows how to do breakfast! We split the Barbacoa Chilaquiles Skillet with a side order of Cinnamon Roll pancakes, per our waiter's recommendation, and it did not disappoint. Portions are huge and the menu is extensive...everything that was coming out looked great. Service was very efficient, and our waiter took the time to help us navigate the menu and kept our coffee cups filled. Get here early if you want to avoid waiting outside but even if you end up waiting, just know it's worth it!
Something for everyone here.  You know it must be good when there's a 45 minute wait!  Food does not disappoint.  Great choice for breakfast or brunch.

Located next to Millennium Park, this location is super busy! Expect an 90 min - 2 hour wait if you're planning on dining here on the weekend for brunch. Great thing is that they use Yelp so you are able to check your place in line via the app. So instead of just standing around, you can use the waiting time to go check out the park. (Or in my case, head up to a rooftop bar for some day drinking!) But keep in mind, you have 5 minutes to check in when they text you / when it's your turn so don't go wandering too far.

Be sure to come hungry! Two tables over from where I sat, this girl was struggling to finish the Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes. These pancakes were larger than my face, and there was four of them! Needless to say, she only ate about 1/4 of it.

Onto the food:

Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes (side) - I have to say, these were the softest pancakes I have ever eaten. (Originally has planned on splitting it in half, but I ended up eating 95% of it!) I'm not a pancake fan at all because they usually feel heavy and bread-like. This was like biting into a piece of cake. It was so light and fluffy. You definitely have to get this! (The side comes with just 2 pancakes instead of 4.)

Buffalo Chicken Wrap - Oh boy did this chipotle have a kick! If you're like me and can't do spicy, this is not for you. Don't get me wrong; this was very tasty. The buffalo chicken was crispy, wrapped in a wheat tortilla. (I like to think the wheat tortilla makes this a healthy meal, haha.) Choose the french fries as the side (not so healthy but oh so yummy); you will not regret it. Huge portion so be sure to share if you're not starving.

Thai Chicken Salad - Again, huge portions. Proportional amount of chicken, mango, Chinese noodles to greens. I thought this salad was alright. Skip if you're not in an Asian chicken salad mood. Also, this contain peanuts so heads up to those who may have a nut allergy.

Chicago must eat!
Food is always amazing. My favs are the cheese potato breakfast skillets with eggs and all their diff pancake combos are good!

This is probably my favorite place to have a great brunch! The people are friendly very careful with your needs and the food is amazing. Honestly I have a hard time choosing what to eat when I go there.

This was a wonderful experience! The breakfast was phenomenal, we got biscuits and gravy and the wild mushroom omelet. Along with our breakfast we had two lattes. The portions were huge! Our server Paula was great. We will definitely be returning

Pretty solid brunch place.  Absolutely overhyped.  If there's no wait, you should definitely try it out, but i wouldn't wait over 30-45 min for this place.  Nothing blew my mind away, i enjoy the savory brunch items.  The skillet I got tasted like one I get from Yolk and other brunch places... so meh.

I hear the sweet stuff is good which makes sense from their name, so maybe that's where all the hype comes from?  Use the NoWait or Yelp waitlist to get your name on the list!

I LOVE BRUNCH and checking out other cities options for brunch is my favorite thing to do in my travels. When I say other Yelper's photos and tips, I knew this was a must try.

Pro-tip: get on the waitlist via the Yelp mobile app before you show up! We dropped our party at the door and the wait of people inside was so large we couldn't even move the rounding doors... WHAT so obviously the checking in before SAVED US!!! Seriously. Just make sure you're entire party is there before you are able to be seated.

I came I knowing I was going for the s'mores Oreo pancakes. Yes I said s'mores and Oreos on top of pancakes. Literally two of my favorite flavors and treats on top of fluffy, delicious carbs. You can get the pancakes as a whole order or as a smaller portion on the side with a main entree.

Since I like to go hard and make poor choices, I went with full serving and I was defeated. I should have gotten the smaller sized portion with something more savory but my sweet tooth got the best of me. Even the waiter commented on my poor defeat by the pancakes.

I must comment also on the service, for the mad rush and amount of people they serve. The waiters are friendly and extremely efficient! The food delivery was very prompt as well.

Oh and I can't forget the cold brew zach and I started with! Strong and delicious. HIGHLY recommend this spot if you're in search for brunch next time you are in Chitown.

Amazing place for breakfast! The menu is very well put together and cohesive. The wait is a bit long, but it is really worth it. Plus you get time to look over the whole menu and make the painstakingly hard decision on what to order. I had the classic eggs Benedict, which was fantastic. They give you big chucks of ham that were over and inch thick. COME HUNGRY!!! They are extremely generous with their servings. The eggs were perfectly poached. My husband had the eggs Benedict with the sausage gravy and biscuits, it was really well done. The gravy was the perfect consistency and the biscuits were buttery and light.

Now upon reading all the reviews it was suggested that we try the *Berry Bliss pancakes*, lets not forget that this place is called Wildberry PANCAKES after all. TRY THEM!!! Our waitress was really fantastic and when we asked about them she said because we both had entrees already she could do a short stack of these pancakes. They were fabulous! Just rich and fluffy with the tartness of the berry sauces mixed with the vanilla formed the perfect combination of flavors. If you come here I recommend you try these. You wont be disappointed. The service was great and the food was even better. If you are in Chicago this is the place to eat your breakfast.

pics.caption: The classic eggs Benedict... check out how thick that ham is!
Must try these berry pancakes!!!! It's what they are known for.

review.des: Love this place for breakfast. Get pack very quick as soon as the door open people already waiting in line for the table.
