The menu are perfect from Benedict, Skillet, Omelette, and sandwich to chose from. I would recommend people to come here for breakfast if they are around the loop. There isn't any parking so would be the best to either uber/lyft or take the transportations.

We try to visit WPC every visit to Chicago.
Share a plate unless you are VERY hungry!
gdh

Best. Breakfast. Ever! Expect a wait, so get on the Yelp waitlist. First impression was a crowd of people coming in and out. The hostesses handled the crowd great, with patience and a smile. We walked over to Millennium Park while we waited; great way to kill time. My daughter ordered the Oreo s'mores pancakes with a side of Nutella. She LOVED it. My husband ordered the brisket with potatoes and a fried egg, it was delicious. Tasty, soft meat. I ordered the Napa Valley omelette; it was cheese, sweet, savory. The Berry bliss pancakes were OMMMMMG! Perfect balance of berry sweetness. My husband ordered banana chocolate chip, he said they were amazing. The vanilla berry latte was good too. Service was quick despite being packed. Portions were perfect. Price was right. We spent $52 on all of the above.

I really don't know what the hype of this place is but I thought it was normal. The wait was ridiculous but I'm glad that yelp have the wait list system so you don't have to be physically there waiting. I was on the wait list for roughly 1.5 hours before coming to the restaurant itself, then had to wait another 10 minutes before I got seats. This place is packed!!!!!!
I got the butcher block skillet with no cheese, sunny side eggs, and toast. The skillet was big, enough to feed two people! The flavors were good and everything went well together. The thing that threw me off was that I was expecting things to be crispy because it's in a skillet, but I'm pretty sure they just cooked everything and threw it in a metal container. The best thing there was the rye bread. It has an earthy flavor and a good crunch. I'm really glad I didn't get cheese because I feel that the cheese will make the dish really heavy and more soggy. Service was mixed to me, I feel taht they were nice and attentive but overdid it somewhat. Our server gave us the check when we were only halfway done. Another server came and almost took one of the plates that we were still working on. I know that it's busy and they are trying to be efficient, but it's a little rude in my opinion.

Overall, it's a good breakfast joint, but a 2 hour wait good? I don't think so.

pics.caption: Butcher block skillet with no cheese and rye toast

review.des:
I'm giving this place 4 stars for the food quality and their organisation. I love places that let you join the wait list before you arrive. The pancakes and crepes and biscuits and gravy were all good, but it's a bit pricey overall for breakfast. Nutella and banana crepes are nothing new and spectacular, so for the price I want something different.

So value for money, I give them 3 stars. Breakfast for 3 with only one drink each cost us more than dinner at Lou Malnati's for 3 and that was including beer!

To say this place is amazing, would be an understatement.  The only thing that would be nice, is if they would take a limited number of reservations.  I came to this place 3 times over 10 days and I had to wait over 30 minutes each time I showed up.  That said... it's still worth it:)  

Thanks again

Aaron Wernli
Delicious food and great choices. The environment was cozy and modern. The service was amazing, worth the wait!

How did this become the best restaurants in Chicago????
Based on the insane number of 4.5 star reviews, I'm sure you'd think it's worth the wait.

Even if you're coming here for a big brunch, i.e skillet or omelette combo + specialty side pancake... it is NOT WORTH THE WAIT.

The pros are that you can eat a ton of food and the specialty pancakes are a nice addition (sweet dessert) the best of both worlds for less than $15!

BUT... if you're not going that route, I highly recommend that you go elsewhere for food. Their sandwiches and salads are average, but there are better places to go with nicer ambiances and wait times. Keep going east on Randolph for more eats in a calmer environment.

The place is always full, so make sure that everyone in your party is present.

The staff is incredibly friendly and fun.

The food came out very quickly and it was delicious.

It was my boyfriend and I's first time eating here and I must say the food did not disappoint. I ordered the Florence Benedict and the Oreo S'mores pancakes and my boyfriend ordered the Red Velvet French toast and a skillet. Everything tasted great. They have an assortment of lemonades as well (we tried strawberry and kiwi).

I would highly recommend coming here for breakfast/brunch if you are in the city. Also use Yelp waitlist to keep track of the wait time, how many people are ahead of you, and get a text when it's you can head in and be seated. Spared us some time to head over to Millennium Park down the street to explore while we waited.

This place was AWESOME. I was staying at the Swissotel and before I checked out, I joined the waitlist so I could reserve myself a seat since the wait was about 45minutes. So by the time I checked out and walked to the resto, my table was ready. The food was amazing and my server was very attentive and knowledgeable. If I come back to Chicago, this will definitely be on my list of places to come

I LOVE brunch and this place did not disappoint. I think it's the fact that you can intermix savory and sweet all into one meal. We ordered the berry bliss french toast and slow roast brisket hash. The hash was pretty good, the brisket was well-seasoned and the hash was crispy.  But the piece de resistance was the berry bliss french toast - the vanilla anglaise is addicting and creates a perfectly creamy backdrop for the sweet berry coulis and fresh berries.

Definitely take advantage of the fact that you can leave your name and walk away - you'll then be able to see how many table are in front of you via the yelp app.

They have a wait app that texts you early so you and 50 other people wait in a cramped lobby waiting for them to call your name while people spill coffee on you, bump into and step on your feet. And No, you cannot wait outside (we asked) because once they summon you via txt early, they have no way of texting you again when your table is actually ready (or even stick their head outside the door and call your name).
Unbelievable on how terrible this policy is.

I have been to the Wildberry in a different location in Chicago and the service is good but moves a little more fast paced but not as warm. You believe it is because it is close to downtown.  

The food is AWESOME! I ordered the waffles and it had bacon in it. I thought they were asking if I wanted bacon in the side. It blew me away it was sooo good and flavorful. My guy had an omelette which you choose it the way you want it. Thumbs up. This place never fails to impress and hey have the best green tea :)

Wow. I love brunch. I almost missed this opportunity because I like mimosas with brunch. So glad I didn't go with my first instinct to ignore it.

All of the reviews are right. Make sure to save your spot on Yelp. It'll fill up fast. If you don't, be prepared for 1-2 hour wait-which would totally be worth it too!

I recommend the skillets and upgrade to the signature pancakes. Well worth it.

The food here was delicious!! We visited there about a month ago. The only thing that prevents me from giving it all 5 stars is the wait... the wait is insane! But it's right by Millennium Park so I suppose that is to be expected. We ended up getting our name on the list while we were still at the hotel so by the time we checked in, our wait was about 45 minutes. Food was worth it though!

Loved this place.  The service wasn't bad at all considering we got there at 7am.  The food was amazing.  We ordered the corn beef Benedict and the signature berry bliss pancakes.  That was the best item out of them.  Definitely recommend path this place a visit.

Yes, there was a little bit of a wait however, well worth it in my opinion.  They made up for it with an amazing breakfast that came out fast.  As far a breakfast in the City goes, this would have to be in top 5.  Five stars, I'll be back very soon.

This place is delicious!

First of all, MAKE A RESERVATION ON YELP! I'm SO glad I saw that as an option. It gave us a wait time of I think a little over an hour. We were staying at a hotel very close by so we just hung out for a while and then walked over when there was 10 minutes left before our time was supposed to be up. We ended up having to wait even a little longer which was fine because we had only spent about 15 minutes total waiting in the actual restaurant. This place is CROWDED and even trying to get inside the door was a struggle. People who were just walking in were getting quoted an hour and a half to two hour waits!

Anyway -- the food. It's all so good! I got a normal sized meal and a kids meal because I really wanted to try s'more pancakes and banana chocolate chip (because I am an adult). They were both seriously SO GOOD... but I couldn't even try to finish either because they're just really filling. My fiance loved what he got too, but was also too full so I sadly ended up leaving a lot of mine behind. Next time I will just stick to one and eat that!

Food is really good and service with the yelp waiting list is wonderful! Make sure to check it out and sign into the wait list of the wait time on yelp is over 15 minutes. Pancakes are really yummy. Place is busy and kind of loud but breakfast is really yummy. Highly recommend.

Visited this Cafe on my last day in Chicago. Food was amazing, waiter was great, energetic, friendly and patient with us as it took us forever to decide what we wanted. Every plate that walked by looked too good to pass up! At the end, my friend and I got the Hash platter and the chilaquiles, both which came with pancakes. Drinks were pretty good too, and if you sit outside, you also get a nice view right in from of millennium park
Great spot. The portions are big and there is a wide variety to choose from. The wait staff is super attentive and I will definitely be going back the next time I'm in Chicago.

Everything here was sooo good! I usually get sick of pancakes after the first few bites so I have no idea how I ate the entire stack from here. The wait is long, even on a weekday, so make a reservation. Well worth it!

I had bookmarked Wildberry before travelling to Chicago based on the photos & reviews. I'm happy to say, my fellow Yelpers did not let me down. When my stomach alerted it was time for breakfast I quickly opened Yelp to make use of the great reservation option. I put my name down on the very long list & hurried over. It was pouring rain so the lobby was overflowing with hungry people trying to stay dry. The hosts were doing a great job keeping everything under control despite the chaos of 25-30 people hovering over them at all times. Expect a long wait even if you do the reservation.

Once my name got called, we were sat pretty quickly. Our server wasn't the fastest and brought drinks with melted ice, but I let it slide since they were probably overwhelmed with the crowds. I try to order things I have never seen available in other places so the Strawberry Cheesecake French Toast had my attention immediately!
I also ordered a side of Biscuits & Gravy, but that was not very good so I would recommend passing on it. The French Toast happily lived up to the hype both in flavor & in its photogenic glory.

Great find -- great Service- great food. I had an incredible corned beef hash skillet with hash browns and sunny side up eggs. Another's had, crapes with strawberries and Nutella, brioche French toast. All delicious

This was my last brunch of 2017 and boy was it an epic one! So for starters it was super busy (considering it was NYE) and we were on the wait list for a little over an hour but killed some time shopping on State St. before heading into Wildberry. I was impressed with the organization of the staff despite the amount of people that were inside and outside of their doors (there was an indoor overflow area for people waiting). Once we were seated top notch service was given from start to finish as our waitress had great attitude and energy during our entire visit. I ordered the Valencia skillet and upgraded to the Oreo Pancakes as the side. The Wildberry orange juice is a must as well WHEN you decide to visit. Everything that touched our table was amazing and am excited for the next time I get to visit!

I was looking for a breakfast place and came across this place after seen a long line. You know, the typical, the long is long, it must be awesome.

AMBIANCE/ DECOR

It is a clean restaurant, well set up and very casual. No need to dress up and perfect laid back spot if you don't want to dress up.

FOOD

I ordered a coffee with the full breakfast option and paid extra for the premium pancakes with glazed strawberry. The food was standard and there wasn't the wow factor to it.

SERVICE

The service was ok. It took a little long for them to serve us. But overall they were nice.

OVERALL

For the long line I was expecting great food and different. But it was missing the wow factor. The food was very standard like any breakfast place and I was a bit disappointed.

Omelettes are amazing, the wait list is crazy though and so you're left waiting at the front even after the tell you you're ready. Service is pretty rushed and not personal as they're trying to turn the tables quick. That's the only reason it's not 5 stars.

THIS PLACE IS AMAZING. Top listing on Yelp for a reason! I wish I could go back to Chicago just for their delicious pancakes-- and I almost never get pancakes at brunch. We got the coffee smoothie which was so delicious, but tip, don't get it before your meal because you'll drink it up so fast you'll be full before your meal comes. I got the corned beef hash with a side of s'mores pancakes. Both were amazing!!! The corned beef had a layer of cheese and eggs on top, and it was crunchy from being baked after prepared. The only thing that could have made it better was to use half the amount of hash browns in it. It's so much food you'd get full before finishing it! The s'mores pancakes were so delicious. Perfect mix of Oreos and marshmallows! I highly highly recommend this place. Be sure to add your name to their waitlist ahead of time so you don't have to wait long!!!

This spot is really very famous among all tourist for breakfast and brunch in Chicago. If you visiting Chicago definitely try this place. Long lines to wait but can be best  way to start your day. I highy recommended to have there Signature Berry Bliss!
Great place, breakfast was good. Make a reservation otherwise you'll be waiting an hour to sit down. Will definitely recommend.
This place is wonderful great staff and even better food had the eggs Benedict the ham was thick and tender and Belgian waffles with signature berries. and definitely over ate

Delicious! Biggest tip I can give you: check in on Yelp and put yourself on the waitlist. You'll thank me later. Every Sunday, everyone's favorite day to brunch, the line can get up to 2 hours long. After finally getting a seat, the menu has so many options that it's so overwhelming to chose from. I decided on the Wild Mushroom Omelet and Cinnamon roll Pancakes (sub). Lots of food-it came with an unexpected fruit bowl. The Omelet was decent but those cinnamon roll pancakes were to die for! Fluffy, warm, and melts in your mouth!
Highly recommend if you have patience to wait to get in

What I loved about Wildberry was the portion sizes. Everything I ordered was humongous. I had the corned beef hash skillet with the signature berry bliss pancakes. The signature pancakes were added to my dish for a very minimal price so it is worth to add the side of pancakes.

The restaurant specializes in their pancakes and there are so many to choose from! But a fair warning, they are pretty sweet and not for people who cannot handle the sugar. The signature berry bliss pancakes had layerings of berry mascarpone which I enjoyed. The corned beef hash skillet was enormous and the picture does not do it justice. With both the pancakes and the skillet, I could only finish about a third of my food and I have a pretty big appetite. I spent about $16 here but it is worth it for a decent brunch place. The only thing I did not like about my experience here was how close in proximity the tables were to each other. Because we came here on a very busy weekend, it was very crowded even though the restaurant is spacious. However, I would certainly come back to this place on my next trip to Chicago.

We didn't have to wait too long to be seated. We got lucky! After we sat down it looked like they had a line out the door. After trying all our food I can definitely see why! I had the cinnamon bun French toast my wife had a sandwich that had the most awesome ham on it and the fries man they were so good and crispy!!! My Nice had and omelette with hashbrowns and berry pancakes. The hashbrowns could've been crispy but man her pancakes my French toast and her sandwich were phenomenal. I wish I had one of these close to my house I would be here every other day for breakfast. At first I thought the cinnamon French toast would be too sweet but it was the perfect blend cinnamon to suite wasn't overpowering I actually finished every last drop on my plate. And helped my wife eat her fries and sandwich. Service was attentive knowledgeable and super sweet. If you're looking for an overall great lunch or breakfast spot this is definitely the place I would recommend. It deserves over five stars for how amazing the food and service was. To management Thank you for an awesome experience I wish I remembered my servers name she was awesome
The Berry Bliss pancakes are the best pancakes i have ever had. Always ask for extra of the berry mascarpone on the side. You won't be disappointed.

MUST go when in Chicago! The wait is always long , so I highly recommend using yelp's waitlist option to be added to the waitlist prior to getting there. The service is good and the food is absolutely delicious! We had the Mexicans skillet and the pancakes and they were both amazing! Definitely will not regret it!

I simply love this place and you will too! Sometimes its very crowded and sometimes you can catch it whereas you can get seated quickly.  Either way - you deserve to allow yourself to indulge at Wildberry!  The menu is quite elaborate and if you're indecisive like me, it may take you a minute before you settle upon a selection.  However, be warned, the scrumptious menu selections are HUGE!  They make sure that you have enough food, whatever it is that you order.  They are not stingy on the portions.  Everything that I've ordered is simply delicious.  I am a constant fan of their pancakes and always leave with a lot to take home.  The ambience is casual and friendly but I'm sure that whether you're visiting Chicago or if you're a local - you will enjoy Wildberry!

I had the pleasure of dining here for breakfast, last weekend while visiting Chi-town and I was definitely satisfied. After reading the reviews, I knew there would be a long wait, so while I was getting ready for the day, I put myself on the waitlist through yelp. The text told me  to check in with the hostess, literally in 2 HOURS! The wait is REAL! But I was able to sightsee in the meantime , so when I finally arrived, I waited for about 10 mins and were seated. I ordered the berry bliss pancakes (very good) and the corn beef hash skillet . It was HUGE, and I barely made a dent in it.  My friend ordered the oreo waffle, which was also yummy. Service  was fine . I will definitely be coming back here next time I'm in town!

pics.caption: Homemade Corned beef & Hash Skillet, with some fries I took from my friend lol

review.des:
One of our go to brunch spots when we have visitors. Expect a wait, but if you download the nowait app, you can get in line while exploring the area (millennium park, bean) or still getting ready. Their portions are massive, so if we usually get the Mexican skillet with a specialty pancake (think you have to pay an extra dollar or two for that) and it's perfect for 2. We have also tried their veggie wrap and burger, which were also delicious.

PS: all their coffee beverages are on spot too!
Service was good. The food was tasty. The cinnamon roll pancakes should be illegal. The only thing missing was a mimosa.
Great pancakes! But it is so crowded.. It is definitely a good brunch plcae, but I am not sure it is worth the long long waits. I made mine take-out and ate outside.

Breakfast here is ah-mazing! Be prepared to eat when you come here because the portions are HUGE. I would recommend the Berry Bliss French toast and any of the bennies (esp the Los Altos)! The Rustic Farm Egg Panini and Mexican Skillet are also bomb options. Most entrees will come with hash browns (the kind that actually look like #). PS. the wait time can be long but to save some time, add your name to the "waitlist" on Yelp before you head here!
Love this place but there is ALWAYS a long wait. I've had the breakfast burrito and the berry pancakes. They have such a huge selection and really do breakfast right. If you can get in here do it!

It's really easy to see what all the hype is about. This place is unreal.

First of all, the fact that yelp let's you put your name down and see your place in like via the app is amazing. The wait was over 80 minutes, so we put our name down in the app, showed up when they said, and we waited max 5 minutes before being shown to our table. So be sure to put your name down ahead of time using the app!

Okay, now for the food! After much deliberation, I ended up getting the butcher block skillet and the berry bliss waffle. They were both soooooo good!

The skillet had a bunch of different meats (ham, sausage, bacon, etc.) with melted cheese and fried egg on top. The berry bliss waffle had a bunch of fresh berries, a raspberry and icing-like drizzle on top. It also had some type of strawberry whipped cream on top.

I can't wait to go back! 11/10 for sure.

pics.caption: Vanilla berry latte. Different but really good!

review.des:
On our first visit to Chicago we spot this busy place while walking around the Millennium Park area. We returned the following morning to discover a busy place with a big vibe. When people are waiting at your door to get in it must mean something.
    A very complete menu for breakfast yielded all kinds of delicious options for breakfast.
Our selections were very good, pancakes that were far better than average for this type of fare.

A tourist attraction for sure, but, what more do you need?

With so many delicious brunch options as well as a very central location, it's hard not to see why Wildberry is so wildly popular in the Chicago. The lines are always pretty massive, so you just gotta be able to maneuver your way so you don't have to wait too long.

A couple friends and I were walking around Millennium Park, and had planned to put in our names an hour before we planned to eat. Our name ended up being called/we were texted about 45 minutes thereafter, so it worked out. We actually had to rush, because there's a 10 minute window for you to get to the front desk when you get texted.

What we got:
Biscuits and sausage gravy: Really meaty and delicious. I asked for fries instead of hash browns, and was very happy with that decision
Denver scramble: Standard but tasty, and easily a huge portion.
Signature Berry bliss pancakes: Really good, although eating an entire stack of these would probably put me into diabetic shock.

Service was really friendly and helpful. I felt bad because our server had to go through his whole spiel, simply because of the huge range of offerings. Price was very reasonable for brunch in such a touristy area, and we didn't pay more than $25, even with drinks, tax, and tip.

Definitely worth a try if you're in the area, especially if you love pancakes. Chicago locals and tourists alike love this place, and it's easy to see why. Make sure to get there early, or just plan ahead when putting your name in!

Best brunch spot in Chicago! Definitely lived up to the hype. The best thing is that you can order online to pick up and eat in the park or download the no wait app and wait in line online. We arrived at 7am on Friday and got a table right away but around 730am there was a wait of about 20 people.

I ordered the Espanola omelette with hash browns and the signature berry bliss pancakes without blackberry coulis. The pancakes were definitely the highlight of the entire meal. So scrumptious and the sauce was light yet delicious. I did not feel the need to add syrup and ruin the taste palette. The omelette was fresh and piping hot. The jalepenos were a little spicy to me so it would definitely be spicy for someone with a little less tolerance.

I also ordered a hazelnut latte from Inteligenisa Coffee, which is conveniently installed near the door so there's no need to walk to the actual location. I drink a lot of coffee and this was definitely one of the best I've ever had.

If ever in Chicago, this place is a MUST!

pics.caption: Espanola omelette with hash browns as a side
Espanola omelette with hash browns as a side
Signature berry bliss pancakes as a side

review.des: Holy moly, my first time in Chicago and I am so happy I found this place! First off, they probably always have a wait, but conveniently let you put yourself on the waitlist from your phone. It told us to leave at a certain time and when we got there, we only waited like 10 minutes. Our server (didn't catch his name) was so funny & attentive! I ordered the Barbacoa chilaquiles and my husband ordered the corned beef hash skillet. He also got the cinnamon roll pancakes on the side. Everything was absolutely delicious. I've never even heard of barbacoa chilaquiles and these were amazing! The cinnamon roll pancakes were not overly sweet and so fluffy. After a couple bites, my husband and I both said "we are coming back tomorrow."

This is a great breakfast place! It's always fresh.  The only reason I don't give it 5 stars is because the service isn't always as good as the food.  I would still go back in hopes that the service improves!

Lovely breakfast, sitting outside and looking up The Loop.  Quick service.  Great choices and advice from the server.  Intelligencia Coffee always a plus.  Skillet plus pancake was way too much great food, so some came home with me.  Luckily I was quite early on a Sunday, and when I came out there was quite a waiting crowd by 8 am.

pics.caption: Ah, the Butcher Block and pancakes on a beautiful Sunday morning outside.

review.des: Best breakfast I ever had! Huge portions and quality food! Great atmosphere! Quick turnaround on food! Amazing!

I agree with Michael S.
This is definitely a tourist trap. The wait was over 2 hours! Luckily our hotel was nearby and we were able to checkin via Yelp. Even then, the wait after we got the text was long!!

Hubby and I shared the chorizo Benedict, turkey sausage, and eggs. Nothing to rave about. It's comparable to your average diner or Denny's.

Note to restaurant: Fix your AC!!
Yummy, fresh food. It can be a long wait at busy times, but worth it. Right next to Millennium Park.

This is certainly one of our favorite breakfast places in the city. The price is reasonable and the portions are very large. There is typically a wait especially on the weekend. Recommend to place your name on the waitlist on Yelp.

Cane fir breakfast as a group of 3. Wait time was about 20 minutes. There are not many places to sit or hang out while you wait. We were able to check out the menu while we waited and that helped speed up our ordering process. The food came in 17 minutes. Our server did not seem too concerned with us, we did not get refills on water even though all of us had other beverages on the table. We also received incorrect information about a menu item and when we got it we were told matter-of-factly "well, you didn't ask that." The quality of the food itself was good. It came out hot, the flavors were there. I especially enjoyed the blackberry lemon cake french toast. The rude service and the long wait time for the food was the reason for the three star review.

Very popular brunch spot across from Millennium Park!

They do not take reservations & I have heard the wait during the weekends can be horrendous.  I suggest, if you are staying during the weekdays, wait for then to come!  If not, come 30 minutes before they open to beat the rush.  On a Monday brunch, we waited 20-30 minutes for a table.

The service was quick & the food was good.  Their servings are large & even though we came starving, we had plenty of leftovers.

Florence Benedict:  Yum, yum.  Chopped bacon & spinach, definitely a great combo.  The hollandaise was creamy.
Denver Sizzlin' Skillet:  Super hearty & good!
Signature Berry Bliss Pancake:  Berries galore!  I liked the sweet sauce drizzled on top.

I may have missed the boat on this one.

Perhaps it's my fault for going with the holiday special menu, barbaoca skillet, oppose to their tried and true menu. The skillet came with a not so special orange verde salsa that wasn't particularly tangy, or spicy.

The line outside resembled a six flags rollercoaster on a busy summer day and combined with the fact it was below zero, there just wasn't enough room to accommodate people in the lobby. Just a massive cluster oyster...

Anyways, this is probably the place for tourist or visitors near millennium park, but if you aren't afraid to venture beyond the confines of the loop, you'll find plenty of other delicious offerings within the city.

Amazing brunch spot although they do not serve alcohol. We checked in on yelp before we left since there was an 100 minute wait. When we got to the place, we still had an estimated 30 minute wait time but checked in at the desk and they seated us within 5-10 minutes. They staff moves so quickly and efficiently. Everyone loved every part of their meal and we left completely stuffed as to not waste any of the goodness. The Benedict's were the best but don't come with sides but it is plenty of food. Would definitely wait again to experience this food coma. Pictured: Florence eggs Benedict with hash browns and signature berry bliss pancakes. Can't go wrong.

pics.caption: Signature berry blood pancakes: not too sweet :)

review.des:
I'm always on the lookout for a breakfast place with good gluten-free pancakes.  So, when I saw this restaurant close to Millennium Park, I had to check it out.

Used the Yelp app to check in online, so I didn't have to wait too long.  Otherwise, I think the wait was 45 minutes or more.

They have a nice, eclectic menu, & I tried one of their skillets, with GF pancakes instead of toast.

The skillet was AMAZING!  It was served in a very unique dish, & just tasty as all get out.  The GF pancakes were okay, but I've had better.  These were very heavy to me, & a little too dry for my tastes.  I would go back the next time I'm in Chicago, but I'll try the GF toast next time.

Although the line up was two hours long, you can put your name on the list online so you don't have to physically wait in person. It's near all the tourist spots so it doesn't feel like a long wait. The food was delicious - huge portions and not that expansive. I got the skillet with pancakes and I've never been more full in my life. Highly recommend so you can try sweet & savoury.
Visited from Minnesota.  I thought I've had good breakfast until I came here!! This place is on a whole other level. The most flavorful fluffy omelette and great tasting cinnamon roll pancakes!

This place was pretty awesome. Came to Chicago for the weekend and saw the reviews on yelp so we had to try it. I saw that they had a yelp virtual waiting option. I signed up around 9am and it told us to come back around 11:55.

This gave me and my sister time to go shopping and walk around in the surrounding area. I got a text at 11:54 saying our table was ready and that we had 5 mins to check into the booth or else our seats would be gone.

We got here just on time and we were seated right away.

I got the regular eggs benedict and she got the southern benedict. They were really affordable at $11.50/plate I thought my ham slices were a little on the too thick side. I think if I were to go back I would try something else on the menu. Eggs were cooked perfected and not drenched in too much sauce.

Would definitely come back again!

Online check-in!
Fast service!
Delicious EFFING  food!!!
You get a lot of good at a great price..it is totally worth the stop after you play with The Bean

pics.caption: Waited 56 minutes, and it was worth EVERY second!

review.des: Amazing brunch! I look forward to going here again

I loved everything about this place. The service was great!  The waitlist on yelp worked out well and we only waited 20 min once we got there.  I ordered the veggie hash and vanilla berry latte with almond milk. Both were delicious!  The vegan patty was so tasty!  But definitely put your name on the waitlist through yelp, so you're not waiting outside for 1.5 hrs.

pics.caption: Veggie hash and Vanilla Berry Latte with almond milk

review.des:
We went in at 7:30 am on a sunday and that's probably the best time to go for breakfast. After we got in and ordered our drinks i noticed there was a line out the door. The service is amazing and a great way to start the morning. The service was very entertaining. The drinks taste all fresh. I got the strawberry lemonade and it was so good. The food came real really quick and very well done. They give you a lot of food for your money. I had the cinnamon pancakes and there was three big pancakes and they were very filling but AMAZING.
My dad had the barbacoa skillet and it's highly recommended. The waiter recommended it and it was very good. My brother had the espanola and it was so good came with a lot of food. My mom has the fresca and she loved it. There are a lot of people in here so it could be kind of loud. But besides that everything is amazing. We had the server Jeremy and he was probably the best server i've had in a long time
Yummy food and really fast service. We come here at least once every time we're in Chicago.

I actually like this place very much. Food wise - no complaints. Wildberry made all food fresh from the kitchen!! Just like homemade! Waiting time wise, it is horrible, especially if you go there for brunch on weekends, it is normally 60-90 min wait and you have to crowd with lots of others at around the reception with the not-so-friendly receptionists.

All in all, it is still my go to if I am not in a hurry. I did hear from my friend there's an app "Nowaitz" that can help you skip the line but I havent tried. Will follow up in next post when I tried.

This place was excellent for breakfast.  Every thing we had was excellent.   I ordered the Mexican Skillet and it was delicious and filling.  I also had the pancakes, I was only able to eat one, but they were awesome!!

My significant other had the corn beef hash and also had no complaints.  The service was good and server was very attentive.  I would recommend to anyone looking for a good breakfast!!!

Like IHOP but a thousand times better!! If you're looking for a cheap menu with a wide variety, huge portions and friendly service, you'll be happy with this choice! The Signature Berry Bliss pancakes are very sweet but good (not exactly subtle flavor). Be ready for a wait though!

We waited 2 hours for a table and to be sat with our friends, but that didn't happen because the manager wouldn't move our friends over like they said they would when the next table next to us would leave.

On top of that, our service was poor. Eggs weren't made to what we had asked for, I was missing my hash browns and my friend was missing her milk. I understand that you are busy but this was just poor customer service

This place was AMAZING! Awesome location in the Prudential building, just a 5 minute walk from our Airbnb. My fiancé and I decided to split our entrees. We order their specialty berry pancakes. They were incredible. Came with fresh strawberries, blueberries, and blackberries. We also ordered the Mexicana skillet, which came with chorizo and was delicious. There was so many great options on the menu....hopefully we can go back and try new entrees before we leave. If you're in Chicago, I would highly suggest coming here for breakfast.

Grest breakfast spot with a wide variety menu.  Service is pretty good too.  They get you in and out quickly, which is great for a work breakfast meeting.

Coffee could be better.   It's rather weak.

Good food but crazy wait times! Even with the second location their wait is not less than 1 hr on a weekend. Makes it difficult to go with kids. Food is amazing and the portions are humongous. They should probably rethink their portions so food doesn't get wasted. I am not giving 5 stars because of this reason.

Came here for brunch on a Sunday, we put our names on the waiting list before arriving - which I HIGHLY recommend. It's super easy because you can do it via Yelp and you receive text messages which update you on how far along you are on the list, when you should arrive, and a 5-minute warning to get to the cafe.

All their jucies are freshly squeezed and their lattes made to order. We ordered the wildberry pancakes and the sausage and biscuits egg benedict. YUM! The pancakes were so fluffy, berries were all fresh (HUGE PLUS) The homemade biscuits, gravy and perfectly poached egg made the benedict for me. The service was quick and our server was attentive and friendly.

It's also conveniently located right by The Bean, so you can always explore the park during your wait or go for a long walk after your big brunch. I'd come back if I visit Chicago again.

pics.caption: Freshly squeezed orange juice & grapefruit juice! A mint tea & hazelnut latte :)

review.des: Food was great but the wait is looooooong!!!!! Get there early or check in with an app. Trust me it will save you time. Service was very good.

First time here as I am from dallas. I looked up breakfast and brunch spots in Chicago. I read great reviews so I decided to give it a shot. I saw the wait time was 1-1.5 hour wait, so i joined the waitlist while I was still getting ready. I highly recommend getting on the waitlist, because when I arrived it was so packed both inside and outside. Even when I got there I had to wait like 5-10 mins. It wasn't too bad though. I ordered as soon as i sat down. I got the Mexicans and upgraded my pancakes to the "berry bliss" soooooo good. Did not disappoint. The wait staff and host are very nice.

Busy and noisy due to the big crowd, this breakfast spot on the edge of Millennium Park caters to both tourists and business clients.  (Besides the take-out traffic to offices on Michigan Avenue, the breakfast business meeting at the table next to ours lasted as long as two (or three) table turnovers of tourists at others nearby.)  The service is efficient and friendly.

If you leave hungry, it's your own fault!  Omelettes in a wide variety are all huge, and the pancakes are a plate unto themselves with toppings to suit every taste or adventure.  Enjoy and eat only twice today!

What can I say, if breakfast is your favorite meal of the day come to wild Berry! You will not be disappointed. I will say you will be waiting to get a table for a good amount of
time but I promise it is worth it. There is a waist list that you could put your name in as well ahead of time which I recommend doing. Overall the service was amazing and the food was delicious! One of my top favorite breakfast places in the Chicago area.

The wait on a Sunday for four people was ridiculous. Put your name in the No Wait app and take a stroll through Millenium Park while you wait.
The menu was quite extensive and there were lots of options. For a pancake place, I was a little surprised by their small pancake menu. I thought there would be more pancake options.
A friend and I opted to split a wild mushroom omelet and the signature Berry Bliss pancakes. The omelet was okay. It was a little plain and bland for my taste. But the pancakes were really good. They were fluffy and had a delicious berry and mascarpone drizzle. I also liked their wildberry orange juice. It was fresh and tart. My friend had an Espanola omelet, which I thought was far more delicious than the wild mushroom.

All in all, I think the food is good, but not really worth the 3-hour wait. I've had better omelets elsewhere and maybe better pancakes too. I was disappointed because this place didn't live up to all the hype I've heard about it. Try it out if the wait isn't too long one day, but I wouldn't go out of my way or wait 3 hours for the food.

Besides the food, one of the best things about this restaurant is that they participate in the Yelp Waitlist feature which allows you to join the waitlist so you don't have to sit in front of the restaurant for hours at a time. It worked out perfectly. At our hotel, I joined the waitlist and I was able to see where I was at in line so I could start walking over when I was almost to the top of the list, super clutch. Service was really nice. Our server made some suggestions and he was allowing us to take our time with the menu since this was our first time there. I ordered the corned beef  hash benedict. This is probably the only thing that I recommend not to get. The corned beef was pretty much flavorless and there was way too many potatoes in it. Also, the chipotle hollandaise had a strange flavor to me. Didn't really taste like chipotle at all, but rather some weird spices. However, their hashbrowns were on point! Super crispy on the outside and fully cooked and fluffy on the inside. Just the way hashbrowns should be cooked. My wife ordered their Asian chicken salad and that was great, a lot of toppings and great flavor all around. We did split an order of their famous wildberry pancakces. They are good, but they are very sweet so keep that in mind. Almost was like a dessert for breakfast. Last but not least, their biscuits and gravy were amazing. Their gravy has a pretty strong black pepper flavor which I really enjoyed. Biscuit was nice and flaky. If it wasn't for the corned beef hash benedict, I would have given this place the full 5 stars. Would totally return though.

We got lucky with no line but it was on a Wednesday morning.

1. Garden skillet - 4
2. Breakfast burrito - 4
3. Cinnamon roll French toast -5
4. Mexicana skillet - 5
4.5 Pancake - 5

1. Wanted something on the healthier side and it hit the spot. Sunny side up eggs was well done.
2. This had avocados and cooked well  
3. This was really good with tons of cinnamon. Worth a try.
4. Mexicana skillet with chorizo was done well made with hash brown.  
4.5 this came with the skillet and it as very soft.  

Service was great and all food ordered was worth a try.

Love this place for breakfast anytime before 3p. Their Berry bliss pancakes are yummy!  The servers are very kind and very efficient. The restaurant is also very clean. It's definitely worth going to if you're looking for a very tasty breakfast. Very easy to get to as it's close to shopping and the hotels so either go before shopping and get the fuel that you need or for a mid-break from shopping. So good, you and your tummy will be happy you did.

I came to visit Chicago for a couple days and I was told that I must try this place for brunch so I gave it a shot. I read many reviews and a lot of people seemed to say that this place was hyped up, but in my experience, I thought that this spot did live up to its hype!

First off, the portions of this restaurant were humongous, I kid you not. The menu was huge so it was bit difficult ordering especially since I'm used to the smaller brunch menus back in NYC. I guess the perks of that is the great variety. I had the Florence Benedict with hash browns. I was full off one of the benedicts. They did not skimp on the spinach and the egg on top was perfectly poached.

I was sick during the time so it was difficult for me to enjoy my food, but I still thought the food was great! If I were to visit Chicago again, I would definitely come back to give another item on the menu a try!!

This place gets really packed btw and they're only opened for brunch and breakfast hours!!

This was our second time here during a trip from Canada and we very rarely go to a place twice...especially in Chicago where there are just sooo many great places to go.
But we had to go back...The food is piping hot and freshly cooked. Humongous portions and lots of flavour. The staff go out of their way to make the experience even better. What's not to love??
My only comment that isn't overwhelmingly positive is that the Americano is so strong I couldn't drink it. I didn't complain but feel like if I had the staff would have fixed the problem to my satisfaction.

Got put on a 1.5 hr waitlist, but it was worth it.. I think mostly because I was starving by that point. Try the special berry bliss pancakes. You should share this because there are 4 pancakes!

The omelettes are delicious and the hash browns are even better.

Food came out fast!

If you try coming here for brunch you definitely need to make a reservation or get out on the waitlist or expect to wait if you walk in. If you come here after 1pm you can expect a 20 min wait instead which is a lot better.

pics.caption: Veggie omelette with hash-browns and cinnamon toast. Signature berry bliss pancakes!!!!

review.des: Good food and great service for the crowd this place gets. I had a cinnamon roll pancake with loaded baked potato omlette. Large portions recommend getting one for 2ppl unless u have a huge appetite. There will be a wait for atleast 30 min minimum but might be worth it. Little bit noisy too with all the crowd but good backend music.

Breakfast doesn't get much better than this place. Amazing pancakes (their signature berry ones are a must try) and great omelettes! Food was incredible and hits the spot on a freezing cold day. Also, treat yourself and get a latte, I did and it was incredible. The location is pretty nice too, located right across the park. If you a visitor to Chicago, like I was, this a must stop breakfast joint!!

Mind = blown. Let's just say this is the best brunch spot I have been to in a while. It was definitely worth the hype. I was recommended this place by my mom who, when asked what was good there, replied "everything!" She was right.

I initially didn't plan on going here on New Years Eve while on a quick Chicago trip with my boyfriend, but after discovering one of my other favorites was closed for the holiday, we had to pick a quick alternate. He mentioned wanting brunch, so I remembered my mom mentioning Wildberry and luckily they had a location not too far from our hotel on Michigan Ave. I called first to ask about the wait and they said it would be a 1 and a half to 2 hour wait. I also had to physically come in to get added to the waitlist that day. We almost decided to look elsewhere but with all the hype, we figured we may as well give it a shot. Thankfully after getting added to the waitlist they had a system where you could check your place in line on Yelp and wait for the text when your table was ready. So we left, parked our car near the hotel, did some shopping and walked back to the restaurant. By the time we made it back it was close to our time to be seated.

Let's get to the food though! We had never had anything there, and everything on the menu sounded amazing. So we both settled with a skillet and side of pancakes, because why not?! I ordered the Mexicana with the Signature Berry Bliss, and my boyfriend got the Venetian with Oreo S'mores pancakes. We also both got the Wildberry orange juice, that was very tasty. Once our food came out we were ready to dig in... and were so satisfied we barely could talk! We both finished our skillets and attempted to put a dent in the pancakes but were beyond full. It was amazing though. The pancakes were so fluffy and sweet... not really needing any syrup but I drizzled some on there. I would definitely recommend it all and would love to try more, or get the same thing because it was that good! Whatever sounds good to you on the menu, get it!

Also, must note that our waitress and service was great!

Less than a 5min wait at 7:15am on a Saturday for a table for two. We're in town visiting from California and thought the food was average - solid, but not spectacular. Just standard American brunch fare. The Benedict and skillet we got were so-so, but the Signature Berry Bliss pancakes did stand out. Nice and fluffy, do order!

Food came out fast, but the service was lackluster. Had to ask for the waitress to order, and we did not receive cutlery or napkins until after the food arrived. No refills on the cold brew / iced coffee either, sad face :(

Kind of surprised that some people wait 1.5+ hours for this place! Personally, I do not think it's worth the wait! Would have rated just two stars, but the pancakes bump it up to 2.5 (and I always round up).

pics.caption: Front to back: Mexicana skillet with eggs over east, side of specialty berry bliss pancakes, and southern Benedict

review.des:
Wildberry is an insanely popular brunch place near the edge of Millennium Park.   Yelp mentioned a 90 minute wait, so I used their Nowait app to get on the waitlist.  Even with 66 parties ahead of us, I'd figure I'll still be able to check in about an hour, after the wife gets up, showers, and decides what to wear.  They texted me with about 15 folks ahead of us, so we managed to take a brisk walk to the restaurant and got seated immediately.  Another few minutes late and we'd probably lose out spot.

The pancakes are definitely the highlight.  We got the Special Bliss Pancakes which had blueberries, blackberries, strawberries, and two types of sauces that run perpendicular.  An order comes with five (!) stacks of some amazingly light, fluffy pancakes. (5 stars).

The chicken and waffles are just OK.  Good crispiness and seasoning on the boneless chicken, but you still need ketchup for seasoning.  Waffles had a few pieces of jalapeño mixed into the batter.  The candied bacon was good.  I still think San Francisco's Bluestem Brasserie has the best Chicken and Waffles.  (3 stars).

Definitely a great breakfast place.  Use the Nowait app to save yourself some stress and stick to the pancakes!

pics.caption: Special Bliss Pancakes - three types of fresh fruit, several sauces, and a stack of five(!) fluffy cakes. (5 stars)

review.des:
Nice that you can get on the waitlist on Yelp ahead of time and not have to wait in that gross line.

We got the signature wild berry pancakes and they were just alright. Really sweet.

Overall, not worth the hype. Probably always busy and popular because it's a central location
Huge portions and very delicious pancakes.  Have not eaten pancakes like these before...

Really wanted to try this brunch place before leaving Chicago since it is one of the most reviewed places on yelp with amazing reviews. Tourist trap but I think it's worth it.

TIP: GET ON THE WAITLIST FROM YELP BEFORE YOU GO SO YOU DON'T HAVE TO WAIT! If you arrive and get on the waitlist there, it's the same as the one on yelp so you might as well just do it on your phone and avoid waiting with nothing to do. You can hang around millennium park (a block away), take some photos at the bean (cloud gate), etc.

My boyfriend and I waited around half an hour to get a seat. We got sat in a booth which was really nice since its more private.

We ordered the berry bliss pancakes (one of their signatures), chicken and waffles, hash browns, a iced caramel latte and ham off the bone. Their portions are HUGE. We could've deff gotten one dish to share and a few sides because we couldn't finish our food.
Everything was super delicious! I would deff recommend coming here for brunch/breakfast. The food also came out super fast as well, maybe about 5 minutes after we ordered.

One of the perks of taking the red eye out and arriving in Chicago at 7am on a Sunday? Beating the line upat Wildberry!  i was also lucky enough to get a seat on the patio.  what a great first meal in Chicago. Reading through the menu is already mouthwatering.  Because I knew I had a long day ahead and needed energy, I got the 2-egg breakfast, but upgraded my pancakes to their signature berry bliss pancakes.  Sadly, my eggs were undercooked and super runny....however, what would have been a meager 2.5 star rating was saved by the oh so delicious pancakes!   They truly were bliss.

As I left (around 8:30am), the city started to wake up and the line was already forming.  While I am not a huge fan of lining up for brunch, I can say this would be a brunch worth lining up for.  

Next time I go (and I hope there is a next time), you can bet I will be having the cinnamon bun pancakes.
This place has AMAZING food- the servings are huge but you will eat each bite because it's delicious. The waits are long, be prepared but know it will be worth the wait.

I would come here everyday if I could. Seriously. I love the all the coffee drinks from Intelligentsia. The food is amazing!! You can't go wrong with the pancakes, no matter what kind!! Or the berry bliss waffle..omg just thinking about it..Minus one star for the cramped space... but I guess it's a breakfast spot..

All their pancakes are good but I like chocolate n banana pancake.. that's awesome.
Good for morning breakfast or brunch.

I am giving Wildberry a 5 star because from the hostess stand to the waitress to the food was top service. Our waitress Sara was great. She was helpful with the menu and showed concern over my daughter's allergies. She double checked everything and my daughter was able to order the chocolate chip pancakes and enjoy them. I had the eggs/ bacon/ hash brown meal and I upgraded to the "berry bliss French toast and I'm happy I did. They were delicious. My daughter also had the oatmeal. We were able to avoid the long wait there because we did the waitlist through Yelp which was wonderful. I will definitely return on my next trip to Chicago.

Best brunch food I have had so far. The skillet and the signature berry pancakes are to die for. The only thing which I didn't like about the place is the long wait times. Tip: you can reserve a table through yelp so just do that 1-2 hours before you want to eat.

pics.caption: Veggie skillet & chocolate chip and banana pancake

review.des:
Saw that this place had such high reviews on Yelp, and that it's located right across from Millennium park, I had to make this my first pit stop as soon as I landed in Chicago. We arrived pretty much in the morning, and was surprised to find that it was decently empty at about 7am. We sat down and ordered, got our food right away.

As we were eating, we saw this place getting more and more flow, and eventually by the time we finished eating, this place was packed!!

My boyfriend had the oreo pancakes and those tasted fantastic!! I ordered the berry bliss waffle, and it was not bad! It lived up to its expectations. However, I am not sure if the food was too buttery or not clean, my body didn't react well to it.. :(

Loved my breakfast skillet and bliss pancakes...
Customer service was excellent, for sure next time I go to Chicago this will be my first stop for breakfast.

I have never had a veggie omelet that has wowed me before like the one I had here! Veggies were perfectly cooked inside the omelet. Along with a side of buttermilk pancakes (delightful) and hash browns all included with the omelet, it was more than enough food for one! Paired with a delicious strawberry banana smoothie. I will definitely come back here when I return to Chicago!

Had the Mexican skillet with a side of blueberry Danish panckes.
The pancakes are to die for! It came with whipped cream cheese, blueberries, almonds and syrup. I was blown out of this world, and they were definitely the best pancakes I've ever indulged in. The buttermilk pancake base is super fluffy and tasty.
The Mexican skillet is huge. Definitely enough to feed 2 ppl. It came with chorizo, onions, avocado, cheese on a base of hash browns. Pretty tasty and filling.
You gotta go here when you visit Chi town!
Delicious, convenient, cozy and a great place for breakfast or lunch. Kid friendly too.

I was in Chicago for a business trip. I had their fresh squeezed orange juice as I was waiting for my carry out order & I ended up having to be rushed to the emergency room. I had a life threatening allergic reaction to the orange juice.

My co worker called while I was in the emergency & they were extremely rude & unhelpful. I spoke to the manager at their location downtown & he hung up on me.

Since I have seen an allergy specialist & I am NOT allergic to oranges (I knew I wasn't). I am however very allergic to mold therefore i must've been given a bad orange that almost caused me my life. Their management is horrible, this business is only in it for the money.

Ohh one more thing...before the manager hung up on me he mentioned that if, IF I bring him my blood work they would provide me with a refund and a gift card....such a joke.

My go to brunch place. There is no parking lot because it is at downtown so try spot hero or try public transportation. They have great deal brunch but the waiting time might be 45mins to 1hour. If you are traveling to Chicago, head to this brunch place and give it a try. I have tried the egg Benedict! But have to get the pancakes!!! Ohhh my gosh! The fruits on the pancakes makes everything so good!
Pro: pancakes!! Must try
Con: none but hard to find parking since it is in downtown.

I found this place on Yelp while on our trip to Chicago.  The reviews and the pictures made my mouth water like you wouldn't believe.  My family didn't want to go so far for breakfast but after they saw the pictures of some of the great dishes, they were easily swayed.

The lines are just as described in other reviews.  We went on a weekday morning around 10AM hoping it would be less crowded.  NOPE!  But that's ok because the wait was completely worth it.

For the past few years, my wife and I have been trying to find a place that rivals pancakes we eat at a restaurant called Mimi's Cafe.  It's a chain restaurant but the pancakes are second to none.

When my wife and took our first bite, we both looked up and knew we had finally found Mimi's rival.  Even our kids ate every bite, which rarely happens!

I know this is just one of soooo many raving reviews but I had to take the time to agree with everyone and share another glowing review.  

Do yourself a favor and don't worry about the wait.  Just go and enjoy and be thankful you did!
Very good, well worth the stop!  They are busy but never missed a beat.  Super fluffy pancakes and eggs!
Amazing breakfast, definitely worth the wait, just use the reservation button in the Yelp app to hold your place in line. Crepes, Benedict, and coffee bar were amazing!

Delicious pancakes! Very large servings! Service is fast and friendly
Can't fault the place

WOW! The wait can be a little lengthy because this place is PACKED BUTTTTTTTTTTTTT!! The food is well worth the wait! Price is decent and the amount of food you get is HUGE! Definitely come with a big appetite.
Pancakes are good but the skillets are what really steal the show. Can't remember the name of the one I got but it was the one with all the meats. SUPER GOOD! The hash brown was perfectly crispy and not soggy at all. Everything about it was great. I only wish I had the stomach to finish the whole thing myself!
Skillet and pancake (add on) is definitely more than enough to feed 2 so keep that in mind.  
There are also lots of options! Vegetarians can come here with ease!

Definitely would recommend this breakfast location to everyone and would come back again.

pics.caption: Delicious skillet and some banana pancakes! SO GOOD

review.des:
Wow! Checked in on line and had up to a two hour wait. So glad we did though, because man was it good! This is a breakfast and lunch only diner. The pricing is very fair and the food and service are excellent! We were able to watch our place in line on our phones, so we spent the morning in millennium Park while we waited.

The three of us ordered a meat scramble, a Mexican scramble and a California fig omelette and all upgraded to specialty pancakes. The Mexican scramble had a yummy spicy chorizo meat and lots of Mexican flavor. Both bakes came layered on breakfast potatoes and lots of ooey-gooey cheese. The flavor combination of the figs in the omelette was surprisingly tasty but the eggs were cooked a little bit more dry, well done than we would have preferred. My son ordered s'mores pancakes which I did not try because they seemed a bit over-the-top! I'm not a fan of marshmallow but he loved them. The cinnamon roll pancakes and house special berry pancakes were both fantastic.

The service was laid back, but excellent and our coffee, iced tea and strawberry lemonade were all kept more than promptly filled. I wish I lived close enough to this one to try more things on the menu. Everything we had was fabulous.

Birthday Waffle
The waiter recommend this to me, this is really big and nice. There is an ice cream and delicious sauce on it. The cappuccino is really nice and smooth. The waiter is so nice and active. I like here!

Legendary lines and legendary portions.

This is a Chicago brunch staple, and its being conveniently located right across from The Bean also means lots of tourist traffic. Average weekend wait time for a party of 2-4 for me has been 1.5 to 3 hours. However, what many people don't know is that you don't have to wait physically at the door. They are on this app called NoWait and you can put your name in the queue directly there. It tells you an expected wait time and how many parties are in front of you, in real time. Then they'll text you when the table is ready and you have 5 minutes to check in with the hostess to claim your spot. In my experience, the wait time the app predicts has always been longer than actual so prepare to get there a bit earlier than said ETA. What's a bit annoying, and the main reason I'm not giving it 5 stars, is that after you check in, you still have to wait at the door for another 10ish minutes to actually get seated. I understand they're dealing with lots of tables and customers but it'd be less frustrating to just be called in when the table is ready rather than to wait twice.

The food is classically delicious brunch, with huge portion for the price point. My friends and I always get the skillets (The Venetian is my favorite), which comes with a smaller portion of pancakes - "small" meaning a stack of 3 pancakes instead of 8 (?) for the entree size, which is still lots of food! - and you can add $2.5 to sub for one of their signature pancakes. The Berry Bliss is always a classic, and they have seasonal pancakes that I quite enjoyed as well. Service is always very quick and professional.

You can also sign up for their rewards program and get $10 cash back when you spend $150, tips included. You'll have a good experience here if you plan the wait right!

Pancakes and skillets, delicious and so yummy.  I recommend use the Nowait app, if you are going at a busy time. Four in my group and everyone loved the pancakes and the fresh fruit. I also recommend the wild berry juice.

I actually never eat the place itself. I order pick up because why not eat in the comfort of your own home. Every time I order and pick it up my food is ready and on time. They give me everything I would possibly need with each and every meal. Love that they have this!

ONE OF THE BEST breakfasts I've ever had! The cinnamon swirl pancake special is worth every calorie. And the hash browns are things of crispy beauty! The staff is great -- and so is the price. I'll be back!

Just had the most amazing brunch here. The wait was about an hour, but with Millennium Park right across the street, it's really easy to walk around and pass the time. I got some hot green tea with lemon which was really nice. Then I had the garden skillet which has a ton of veggies, hash browns, cheese, and two eggs over easy. It was delicious. I would suggest salt, pepper, and a little hot sauce on top. My father-in-law got the Mexican skillet which was delicious. It has hash browns, chorizo, roasted jalapeños, avocado, and two eggs over easy. Finally my husband got the brisket hash which was so good as well. It had hash browns and eggs and a ton of brisket which tasted awesome. Then we all got a side of pancakes and all of them were awesome. Banana coconut cream, berry bliss, and Oreo s'mores. My favorite of course was the Oreo one. It was super rich so be prepared! The staff was very nice and helpful, and we will definitely come back next time we are in Chicago!!

I guess my expectations were too high. Food was good, but nothing phenomenal. I asked for buttermilk pancakes with chocolate chips added in. I got pancakes with chocolate chips on top and a whole bunch of chocolate sauce that I didn't want. It looked good, but was just overload. We did get lucky and were seated right away. Place was a madhouse when we were leaving at 10 am on a Wednesday morning. Also ordered a chai latte and it was just ok. If I was in the area I wouldn't return.

pics.caption: Not at all what I was expecting

review.des: Typically when I hear about two hour plus wait times I'm skeptical that a place can live up to the hype. But I had a free hour on the train down from the naval base so I added myself to the queue. When I got there I waited only about thirty minutes. I went alone and I had a breakfast fit for several kings. And let me tell you, it did not disappoint. They were fast too. Chicago shit. It's also right across the street from the bean so you can kill time taking tourist selfies while you wait.
Love the waitlist app!  Helps manage the crowd and lets you do something productive while you are waiting.

I don't come to Chicago often, but when I do....I eat at Wildberry. Since the first time I tried this place, I've been hooked! And it's obvious to anyone who walks by that this place is extremely popular. It's definitely one of my favorite brunch places anywhere! Plus, it's reasonably priced and the service is not too slow once you get past the wait to be seated.

Once you've endured the wait - which really isn't so bad since you can explore the beautiful park right across the street - you get to take a look at their truly extensive menu. From different types of omelettes to pancakes to belgian waffles to skillets, there are so many things to choose from, which is great when you come with a group of people because there's something for everyone!

My favorite, by far, are the cinnamon roll pancakes. Pure genius, and exactly what they sound like. Their fluffy pancakes topped with cinnamon sugar and cream cheese sauces. Honestly, they're almost better than cinnamon rolls themselves.

I also love the toffee nut coffee/iced coffee. I've even tried it in frappuccino form which is just a little too heavy for me on top of the sugary sweet pancakes.

Other great items I've had are the mexican skillet, the signature berry bliss pancakes, and the HASH BROWNS nom nom nom.

Definitely try this place out if you have some time and are in the area.

This placed was pretty great. So many menu options and huge servings. Staff were very hospitable and pleasant. The buttermilk pancakes were mouth watering. The hash browns came out as requested, extra crispy and I was ecstatic. I would definitely come Back and try out their specialty pancakes .

Place was really good. I went during the week so the line wasn't long at all. The food came out quick and was super good. Def would come again if I'm ever in town.  Had the bliss pancakes and omg good!!!!

Busy busy busy! Expect a wait!

This breakfast spot is right across from millennium park so it has tons of foot track near by. Not to mention the offices and apartments surrounding it.

Pretty large seating area so if you're lucky your wait time should be around 30-45 minutes. I just noticed on Yelp that you can be added to the waitlist. I suggest, highly suggest doing that.

There is a cafe stand right next to the check-in counter so it's nice if you want to order coffee while you wait you can.

Food is very well priced. Anywhere from $8-12 for a meal which is pretty good for breakfast. Most breakfast spots like this one would be around $12-16 a meal.

Also, they do speciality pancakes which I love and they are not so overly huge that you can't finish them.

Would recommend coming here but like I mentioned be prepared for a wait.

pics.caption: Oreo s'mores pancakes! Oreo crumbles, chocolate chips, chocolate syrup and marshmallow spread! Yum!

review.des: Great gluten free awareness and options. The chef even came out to talk to me about cross contamination. The food is amazing. This is our 2nd time here in 3 days! Great coffee too.

Went here while spending a short time in Chicago. I am a big fan of breakfast/brunch and saw great reviews on this place. There was a long like and the wait was 45 mins-1 hour when we got there around 10 am. I will say the food and latte i ordered was definitely worth it! I got the Oreo/s'mores pancakes and they totally delivered! They had lots of chocolate and Oreos sprinkled on top. I also got a caramel latte and it was probably the best I've ever had. Wish i lives closer so i could go back!
Typical chain brunch spot. Nothing special. Delicious food. Quick service. I had the corn beef Benedict. It was good.

I'm teetering back and forth between a 3 & 4 because Wildberry is a solid 3.5. I'm not trying to swim against the current; I know Wildberry has over 3,000 reviews with an almost perfect score, but there were some things I loved and some things I didn't love as much. Hence why I don't feel like my experience warrants 5 stars.  

Things that made my Wildberry experience pleasant:
*Yelp's integration with NoWait: Add yourself to the waitlist so you don't have to wait the 1.5 - 2hr quote time for walk ups!
*Fantastic value - I split the garden hash skillet + the pancake that comes with it + ordered a side of bacon (3 crispy pieces for $4). All that food comes out to be like $10/person AND I was stuffed.

As for the food, it really is just American breakfast/brunch fare - items that everyone knows and loves. I am also really impressed by the speed of the kitchen especially because the volume of people at Wildberry is kind of insane.

Garden Hash Skillet was great. It was full of ingredients and the poached eggs on top were perfectly medium as requested. I was pretty disappointed with the "Signature Berry Bliss (Vanilla Anglaise, Blackberry Coulis, Berry Mascarpone, Fresh Berries)" though. The sauces -
or maybe just one? no idea which one though - tasted really artificial. Also, it comes with two pancakes, so the bottom pancake gets no sauce love! The banana cream pie specialty pancake was MUCH better - recco that one over the signature berry bliss. Pancakes themselves are like iHop pancakes - fluffy? yes. Outta this world? no.

Would I wait the FULL 1.5 - 2hr wait for this? Nah.

According to Illinois natives, @wildberrypancakes is a MUST. I ordered the BLT (which I highly regret) and everyone else pretty much ordered a pancake or waffle (which is what I should've ordered cause that's what they're known for). I'll start with the BLT. The bread was pretty stale and there was definitely not a generous amount of bacon in the sandwich It honestly would have been so much better if they just used some fresh bread. At least the sweet potatoes were decent. Even though I didn't order waffles, I did try someone else's. The fluffy pancake was topped with mixed berries and drizzled with some kind of creamy goodness. So, if you decide to visit, I recommend getting a pancake or waffle!

Good vegan food selection! Easy to get to from The Bean

Atmosphere feels a bit like an IHOP

I came to Chicago on a business trip and I was recommended this place for breakfast and I must say, it was pretty good. I ordered the Signature Berry Bliss Belgian Waffle and when I'm back in Chicago this is one of the spots I will definitely hit up.
This place is overhyped. I didn't enjoy my 3 times at this place.. the potions were HUGE, I must say.

Very cute casual little breakfast stop. Tons of options for your toast, pancakes, and waffles. The skillets are delicious and I love all their drink choices. The salted Carmel mocha latte was delicious. Also got the butchers block skillet, which had a ton of meat and was delicious. The pancakes you can upgrade to specialty for $1.50 more. The berry bliss was very sweet and the berries were fresh. The only complaint I have is with the service. We got our drinks and food quickly, however after finishing we waited over 20 minutes to get boxes for our left overs and a bill. Otherwise the food is all amazing.

Let's begin by stating how the "hostess" are very unprofessional and not costumer service worthy. One always on the phone and the others impatiently helping costumers. I've was told the wait was an hour and when I asked about the update on my time they said "yea it's been 50 minutes" Don't recommend  this breakfast place at all the presidential location. Don't come here, horrible horrible.
The Wildberry Bliss was almost desserty as opposed to a real hearty meal but it was so yummy and decadent. Definitely recommend it despite that it's a chain restaurant.

Such great service from the moment we walked in the door to the server and more. The food was incredible and the portions were great.  I was pleased with everything.   Cleanliness was on point including the bathrooms.  The location is great and I really enjoyed the avocado with toast and eggs and my boyfriend enjoyed the Denver scramble.  

Thank you for the great experience!

Be sure to join the wait list ahead of time! We ended up waiting about 90 minutes on a Friday morning. Luckily we were able to snag a little corner to wait inside. Otherwise, we would've waited outside and that's not anything to look forward to in the winter but, it would be worth it! The Mexican skillet was bomb ya'll. I wish there was a location in KC. And their signature pancake, omg!!!! If we had time, we would've went back before we left town.

pics.caption: Mexican Skillet w/ Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes

review.des:
This place is not all hype. It is really good. This place runs like a well oiled machine.
If you are reading Yelp reviews, do yourself a favor and check into their waitlist before going. The wait could be as much as 2 hours but adding yourself to the waitlist on Yelp cuts that in half.
From the front door, to the servers, to the bus boys, to the cooks, the management and staff deserve kudos. Tables are turned rapidly and food comes quickly. How do they do it?
Pancakes were fluffy and buttery. Eggs and home fries were hot and cooked just right.
Do yourself a favor and have breakfast here. Right across from Millennium Park. Get yourself on the list and visit the BEAN.

pics.caption: Diced ham, cheese, eggs with home fries

review.des:
This seems to be the talk of the town! I added us to the waitlist through yelp on the way here to save us some time. We were able to find street parking around the corner. It was $6.50/hr and 2 hour max so $13 total. We waited probably 15-20mins or so and was seated. There's not much space to stand and wait indoors.

We ordered:

Homemade corned beef hash
Corned beef hash skillet w/ signature berry bliss pancakes for an additional $1.50
Make your own omelette (mushroom, ham, spinach) w/ banana cream pie pancakes

The best of all the dishes was the corned beef hash skillet but with the banana cream pie pancakes. I felt the berry bliss pancakes were too sweet and lots of syrup going on. That's just my opinion. A bit too sweet for me, but if you like sweet it's a good pancake.

Overall would I wait more than 15-20mins for a table? No, it's not worth the 2 hour wait and we were lucky we found street parking. Parking is a hassle and expensive in this area. Best bet is to Uber/Lyft a ride here. You can check out millennium park while you wait since they text you when your table is ready.
Great pancakes and omelettes. Would definately come back here if I was in need of a breakfast fix in the afternoon. Service was good and the food came extra fast. Better than the IHOP experience!!

Where to begin. This might possibly be my new favorite breakfast spot. The service was impeccable. Every server was so nice and helpful. We had a large group and they were very accommodating. I ordered the Florentine eggs Benedict that had a creamy hollandaise sauce and perfectly poached eggs. Other food that was ordered was chicken and waffles, chocolate and banana pancakes, and multiple skillets. The prices are very reasonable considering how much food you get.

After a great Girls weekend, this was a superb finish!! Completely worth the wait!! We checked in on the app, which was smart. Then has a MARVELOUS breakfast. Service was exceptional and so friendly. Wildberry is a must for every trip to Chicago!!
We went on Saturday. The food is delicious but the wait is long. The good thing is while waiting you can place your name on a list and proceed to the beautiful Millenial park to take pictures.

Best place breakfast place ever! Food is always fresh, unfortunately because it's so popular you have to get early to get in and out of there on the weekends. The wait is well worth it! Overall a great bite!

All of my children (10, 8, and 5) declared this the best breakfast ever. Perhaps that's because it was basically dessert for breakfast!    I have to admit, it was incredible. My Mexicana hash was awesome (and HUGE). All the pancakes and French toast were awesome, also. My favorite, which harks back to my love of German Apfel Strudel, was the Apple Carmel Pancakes.

Disclaimer: this place probably deserves 2.5 stars!

The service is great and I love the energy of the staff here, but the food leaves a lot to be desired. For a brunch place that has this many reviews and such a long wait, I had very high expectations.

The price point is standard, around $10-14 per plate. We got the signature berry bliss pancakes, southern benedict, and mushroom omelette.

The berry bliss pancakes had a strawberry marscapone cream with a vanilla anglaise. It was the best out of the 3 dishes, but needed more berries or some kind of whipped cream to cut through the dense pancake.

Mushroom omelette- stringy cheese.

Southern Benedict- Two words: Sausage McMuffin. I LOVE benedicts and was looking forward to this, but the sausage reminded me of a salty mcmuffin. The gravy was so salty and buttery that I felt sick after eating half the plate.

Don't feel bad if you aren't able to try this place on your trip- there are much better breakfast places in Chicago.

When you look for a brunch place and you see that there is a 150 minute wait at 6am on a Saturday, you know that you have to try it. (Aside: Thank goodness for Yelp Reservations, because we spent the majority of that wait time laying in bed reading.)
