Wildberry Pancakes seems to be one of the most hyped breakfast spots in Downtown Chicago and it definitely lived up to that hype. The food, the location and service were all spectacular.

The restaurant is nestled inside a building just north of Millennium Park, with what seems like a never ending room of table organized to maximize occupancy. This is NOT a quiet, romantic brunch spot for you and your sweetie to enjoy a relaxed meal. This is an amazing brunch spot for you and your sweetie to have spectacular food efficiently served to you. The service is mind-numbingly professional and fast. We saw tables get turned over in seconds, so fast that my seat was still warm when I sat down. It was really impressive and worth noticing.

Both my wife and I had skillets and took the option of substituting a specialty pancake for the side; its the only way to get the best of both worlds. I loved every bite. The coffee drinks were very smooth as well and I would recommend everything we had to anyone.

Overall great experience and I can't wait to try something else the next time I am in Chicago.

Good dining experience after a hour and 15 minute wait on a Sunday morning. This place is a popular and well-known spot. I located through Yelp and then a street referral from a local. They specialize in their pancakes and waffles. I'm a pretty basic breakfast eater and had eggs bacon fruit and pancakes. They have really good fresh grapefruit juice. The bacon didn't seem to be of best quality but everything else was good. I previewed their lunch menu and was tempted to go back for a salad but never made it back. They have a good varied menu and everything is fresh.

This place is great. I defintely enjoy the family-style atmoshpere along with the bright lighting. Their service is friendly and on point. This place is one of the hardest breakfast/brunch joints to get into in the city so make sure to either place your name asap OR download their app to place a name in (you have to be within 10 mile radius in order to use the app.. LAME).

I recommend ordering their french toast berry bliss or their pancake berry bliss because not only is it their signature but both items are tasty, fruitful & flavorful, not too sweet, and just have this killer cream sauce that's drizzled on top. It's great tasting for sure. I also recommend ordering a side of scrambled eggs because they make them just right.

Overall, this place is great but it's personally not worth waiting in line for. The menu wasn't too special; just great breakfast items with a nice atmosphere amongst a family-type crowd. I wouldn't come back but once again, I had a great time with my friends over good breakfast.

We were recently vacationing in Chicago and had several people recommend this place so we decided to give it a try. We loved it so much we ended up eating here multiple times on our trip. The key lime pancakes were to die for and their breakfast skillets were also a highlight. Lines and wait times are long, but if you check on your yelp app you can get in line before you show up and make the wait time more bearable- trust me, this place is worth the wait!

While staying in Chicago we wanted to try out Wildberry based on Yelp reviews. The first morning we arrived the wait time was over 1 hours! I discovered that you can add yourself to the waitlist before going there. So we tried to go to Wildberry again the following morning. We waited an hour before getting a table. Definitely make sure you use the waitlist option to cut down on waiting time.

We both ordered the 2 eggs option with sausage, fruit, and pancakes. We opted for the speciality pancakes for an extra $1.50. I tried the Signature
Bliss Berry pancakes and he got the Cinnamon Roll pancakes. My pancakes were amazing! The mascarpone and berry sauce made it taste so good. The pancakes were light and fluffy.

Food and service was quick during our visit.

I would definitely recommend trying Wildberry if you're in the area.

Absolutely Delicious!!!The wait was over an hour for me even after being on the waitlist and when we finally sat down to eat we knew why the wait was sooo long. Definitely worth it. Loveddd everything we had. It is definitely a MUST EAT if visiting Chicago.

This place has a bad reputation and yes its overhyped but it's honestly not bad! The food and is pretty good and the staff I've interacted with were super friendly. I'm not sure if its worth the long waits that they have on the weekends but if you come early or go during the week then its worth it!

There is a reason this place has such a great reviews
All the food we ate was top notch
Get on the wait list from yelp for sure

Great breakfast place with huge portions.  Next time we'll plan on splitting the meal.  The berry bliss specialty pancakes live up to the hype but the traditional eggs, bacon, hash browns were all well done too.  Nice touch with the coffee bar in the lobby.  Very helpful wait staff.

I actually forgot that I had been here in my pre-Yelp life until I saw my friend's review pop up on my newsfeed. I was there a little over a year ago, but I still remember what I had because it was so good - Wildberry waffle with a side of turkey bacon. My idea of a perfect brunch - sweet and salty. I got the order to go and ate in the park.

We ordered from here via DoorDash but have also eaten here in the last. Always really great breakfast/brunch/lunch food with great selections and options. I had a veggie omelette and customized with different toppings and of course substituted for their berry bliss pancakes. They are by far the fluffiest, tastiest pancakes I've ever had and a must try for anyone eating here for the first time. You won't regret it! Their food is never overly salted which I love because you can control your seasonings as you please. I would recommend to anyone looking for a good breakfast/brunch place! Sorry for the filter on the picture!!

The wait here is long but it's worth it! I think you can set yourself to be on the wait list through Yelp. I just went there in person and got on the wait list and shopped nearby. They have gluten free pancakes here! They are so good and buttery. The perfect place to have brunch because the price is good and the location is great!

I wasn't a big fan of the pancakes and there was so much excitement over to try it that I was practically let down. Portion sizes were huge, too much for me to finish for sure. The pancakes really tasted like any other pancake topped with fruits so I think it was just having too high of an expectation for my first meal.

The redeeming factor to this meal was definitely the skillet. It was a bomb cycle mix in my mouth. Super cheesy, lots of meats and super filling. I couldn't handle it and was practically rolling out of there.

If you can't get there early, put your name on the list and you will get a text. Stroll over to Millennium Park while you wait so you can snap some photos and explore part of it, the other part after your meal so you can digest.
Good, but sometimes long wait lines.  Still, excellent breakfast and brunch spot.

I can see why people like this place so much! However, it didn't live that much up to the hype and the 45 minute wait for me. It tasted pretty similar to other brunch places I've tried. I'd come here if you've never been before, just to get the experience.

Important tip that others mentioned in the reviews is to grab a spot on the waitlist online, through Yelp!! Otherwise you have to stand outside for a while.
Typical breakfast/ brunch food, reasonable prices. Highly recommend using Nowait app to plan your arrival at the restaurant and avoid a long wait by the entrance for your table.

I went there a few days ago with a friend for a late breakfast in the middle of the week. Because it was so crowded I would say this is the way to do it. I too have seen the lines on the weekends, and while I know it's worth it I just don't have the patience.

I ordered an omelette with fig, scallions, bacon, some kind of delicious cheese and it was absolutely divine. Service was great too. I know that they do pancakes well, but don't overlook this omelette. if you overlook The Omelette, you will only be cheating yourself and you can get pancakes on the side.

This is one of the best brunch spots I've been to in Chicago! The yelp waitlist is very convenient-- there was  a 90 minute wait on Easter Sunday but with the waitlist option my boyfriend and I were able to put out names on the list and wait at our hotel until it was our turn to be seated!

The food was amazing and very filling. We both ordered the garden skillet which also came with pancakes. I upgraded mine to the Wildberry pancakes and they were the most tasteful and fluffy pancakes I have every tasted! Ordering two skillets was a lot of food for two people but I definitely don't regret it! If you're not super hungry one skillet is definitely shareable for two people!

More than satisfying food, perfect location, and great service, I will definitely be back!

Love this place...it's always on my list when I go to Chicago. The wait times can be long, but it's definitely worth it. They now use an app called NoWait where you can add your name to waiting list and see how long your wait is!

The menu is extensive...everything from omelettes to skillets to specialty pancakes. On my latest visit, we got the Venetian Skillet with sausage, peppers, onions, tomatoes, cheese and potatoes topped with an egg over easy. You can get your eggs cooked however you'd like. I upgraded the standard pancakes for $1.50 more to get specialty pancakes. This is worth the upgrade! We got the Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes, topped with sweet vanilla anglaise sauce and fresh berries. I also recommend the Wildberry OJ as a drink - fresh squeezed OJ mixed with fresh berry juice. You can't go wrong with Wildberry's brunch!

Easily the best, and most memorable, breakfast I've ever had. Every time I talk restaurants with people this is always one of the places I say they must try.

Even though there's always a long wait you have to try this place at least once. It's heaven on earth.

Worth the hype! Definitely use the Yelp Waitlist feature! This was a game changer! I'm so glad I read the Yelp reviews and someone recommended doing that because this place is always PACKED! We got seated outside and it was a beautiful day with the Blues Festival music playing in the background.

Food wise everything was amazing! This is what we ordered (see pics):

Florence Benedict
Southwest Veggie Wrap with Blacked Chicken
"WB" BLT
Veggie Burger
Fresh glazed Blueberry Crepe

pics.caption: Southwest veggie wrap with blackened chicken

review.des:
Great food, friendly staff, awesome location right next to Millennium Park! I would definitely come back to Wildberry. Make sure to have a reservation as this place is PACKED. Even with a reservation you'll have to wait a short period. However, the management and wait staff are experienced. Everything was very efficient and service was not compromised.

We ordered the wildberry pancakes and some other items and everything was delicious!

Great place to get your day started!

We got eggs Benedict, skillet and orange juice!

Get the orange juice, freshly squeezed and amazing taste.

Eggs Benedict, very good, nice chunk of ham. Pancakes were really good. Hashed browns were just okay, better if it had texture to it.

Skillet was very nice, lots of food and very tasty.

The more amazing part was their service, very efficient help, they all moved with a purpose. We watched one table next to us, that in less than 2 minutes, went from a server taking the check, customer leaving, a bus boy taking dirty plates, another one wipes it down, another one sets the place setting and the hostess shows a new customer their newly cleaned seat. Then the cycle starts all over again. If you're looking for amazing peephole with great grit, come here and hire these people!

STUFFED !!

The service and food quality was excellent, I had the Mexican scramble it was very filling generous portions my teenage son and I needed the doggie bag. Using the Yelp waiting list is the best way to go. They txt you to confirm and a second time for you to walk in. The menu has lots of options. My only negative would be the pancake was a little undercooked maybe because of the speed they work at. I was pleased overall I couldn't knock down a star for that.

Ummm YES, go here, often. BEST omelettes ever! Yeah yeah, I know they're known for pancakes and they're amazing too but don't let it fool you, the breakfasts are legit! Had the Napa Valley Fig and Rutherford omelettes - the best! Recommend cinnamon pancakes & pumpkin when in season. Place gets crowded but service is fast and friendly!

Nothing to brag home about.  Had the chorizo Benedict, wife had denver omelette and we shared some berry pancakes.  I was slightly disappointed with the chorizo coming from the west coast.  Decent food,  but fast service. Gets you in and out quick

I was visiting Chicago when I tried this place. According to all the reviews this is one of the famous brunch places in Chicago. I would not just leave without trying it out. So on our last day, we went there and the line was unbelievable for a brunch place it was like entering a club, prior to that we already joined their waitlist on yelp still we waited for about 1 1/2 hour to be seated.  

Inside the atmosphere was so busy, crowded and the space was a tad small, like the table for two probably good for just coffee and a piece of dessert each, what we had covered the whole table, good thing I did not order more dishes or else we will use the floor to hold it.

Anyway, we ordered:

Fresca with chicken sausage - it comes with hashbrown and pancakes, I ordered a specialty pancake which is the Signature Berry Bliss. Hashbrown was a bit salty for my taste, but I am a ketchup girl so the saltiness went down with ketchup. The Fresca with chicken sausage is their egg omelet, it was okay, nothing too special or surprising.

Signature Berry Bliss Pancake - I like the freshness of the fruits and the fluffiness of the pancake.

Espanola - taste like burrito.

Chocolate Chip Banana Pancake - overload with a sweetness which I don't mind, but I prefer the Berry Bliss.

Hazelnut Latte - Surprisingly okay, but the espresso was not that strong, probably I should ask for a double shot if it's allowed.

Place - Pretty generic, nothing special in terms of decoration and interior. It was small and easily get crowded.

Serving size - Huge serving size. Everything is big, even the plates are big.

Price - the price matched the serving size so it is actually a good deal.

Staff - The one who assisted us a bit aggressive and energetic, probably because of the business of the place or something else, oh well staff pretty okay.

I don't know if the hype is worth it, the food was okay, but nothing really special. I mean for me, I will not wait that long for that, but I will go back again in the time that they are not that busy.

Wow! I was totally impressed. From the smooth check in to the check out. The service was impeccable and the food was DELICIOUS.

The Mexicana Skillet was scrumptious and the cinnamon roll pancakes were that just right sweet and  nothing more. Although I didn't have to, I used syrup on the bottom pancake.

Need to find one in Texas or the south. But if not... I will travel back at least once a year just for their service/breakfast. Rock n' Roll Chicago can become an annual race.

Always amazing! There berry bliss pancakes are our absolutely delicious.  When my kids were 3 year old and 5 year old, this was our every saturday and sunday go to  place for breakfast. We have tried lots of things on the menu and have never been disappointed. Service is really nice as well. The only thing bad about this place is long wait times, but now that they have more locations, its easier! All time favorite place for sure for our family!

This place is EXCELLENT!!! Highly recommend. I was in Chicago for the Taste, went here Friday morning, and was so good I went back Sunday before heading to airport. Service was fast, waitresses were friendly. This place was packed both times. I arrived Friday just in time for no wait, but Sunday did have to put myself in waitlist. Highly recommend the Mexican skillet and ask for sour cream.

pics.caption: Friend had the Denver skillet, with caramel apple (no pecans) pancakes. It was good too! Wildberry OJ had blueberry and strawberry purée.
Mexicana skillet with cinnamon roll pancakes ($2 extra). This was the best breakfast I've had in a long time. This can make 2 meals.
Veggie skillet with buttermilk pancakes and fruit as side.

review.des: This food was so good! We checked in online hen went and walked around the bean (right across the street). Their food and drinks were amazing. They even have a coffee bar inside!

Wildberry is a must-have brunch spot if you're ever in Chicago. Yes, you should expect to wait quite a while for a table, especially on the weekends, but it's totally worth it. They also allow the option to place yourself on the list using the NoWait app. That means that you can just add yourself on the list and take a stroll through Millennium Park instead of sitting around and waiting for a table.

I absolutely love Eggs Benedict and the Florence Benedict here certainly hit the spot. The pancakes are so soft that they fall apart even before you start chewing them. If it's a nice day out, I recommend that you sit outside. It's such a lovely spot and the views are great.

Our server was super friendly and the food came out pretty quick. Overall a great experience!
The food here is so good!! This is definitely a must if you're in chicago for breakfast or brunch. The food is what this place is about and what makes this place so great.
Lots of variety. Good place if you're with kids. Bright atmosphere with attentive staff. Reasonably priced and quick service.
Omg, the food is just awesome. Loved everything I tried there. You should try this place when you are in Chicago

My most favorite breakfast spot by far.

Arriving during prime time, at 12pm on a Thursday, there was about a 20 minute wait but we were seated in a little under that, yay! The restaurant was bigger than expected and service was quick and friendly. After sampling around the menu, we decided on the Florence Benedict and their Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes.

Now, I love pancakes so it's a big deal when I say these pancakes were the best I've ever had. First of all, the order came in a stack of 5 so definitely share with someone! It was fluffy and every bite was just melt in your mouth good. Though it looks like a lot going on with glazes on top, the pancakes were not overly sweet at all. Cut a piece of your pancake, run it over some vanilla anglaise on the plate, add a little syrup, and I swear it's simply bliss. The berry mascarpone spread in between the pancakes were divine as it was creamy and complimented the pancakes and fresh fruit well.

The pancakes were definitely the star of the show, but the Florence Benedict was equally just as good. I'm not a big fan of benedicts in general, but this dish was bomb! A lot of breakfast joints usually make their hollandaise sauce pretty thick, but Wildberry makes it light and you definitely don't get tired of it. You know that feeling when you eat something that's too heavy and after a few bites you get sick of it? Not this one! This was perfect. It was a simple benedict with english muffin, a poached egg, with bacon and spinach on top; yet it was so good and definitely a memorable dish. It came with a side of hash browns that were also nice and crispy.

Another cool thing is they have an Intelligentsia Coffee bar to the right as you walk in! You can order coffee at the table and they'll serve it to you. I was super excited about this since it's on my list of places to try while in Chicago, but since I had already gotten my coffee fix for the morning, I didn't end up getting any. But, nice to know there's one right inside this restaurant!

Overall, I had such a pleasant experience here and it's quite honestly at the #1 top of my list for breakfast joints. Wish we had one back in the Bay Area! I highly suggest this place, everyone should make it a point to come here!!

pics.caption: Iced Vanilla Berry Latte (soy) - LOVE IT

review.des:
I have been to wildberry pancakes many many times. The line is long sometimes undoubtedly, but we try to go during not so busy hours most of the time.
My favorite things on the menu include the omelettes, skillets, and nutella crepe. The portions are always big, so i usually get another meal out of it. I usually do an upgrade to their specialty pancakes for an extra dollar so it was a good deal.

Wait was over an hour, they send you a text when putting your name on the list and when your table is ready, we got the text right on time. You can put your name on the list on Yelp but must be there within minutes of the ready text to go to your table. Our waiter was nice, he seemed very busy. The food was good. They have smoothies, but just mixed not real smoothies so I opted out on getting one. They do not serve mimosas or alcohol. It is pretty big though as far as sitting goes, we brought our luggage in, would of nice to of been possibly if there was a place to store it but we had a good time. I went with three others and we all had delicious entrees. To me this place isn't necessarily a must have to go to, but definitely worth the visit just to experience, also a big popular restaurant in Chicago right across from  the Bean (walking distance).

Frequent Chicago visitor and always up for trying new places. Went to Wildberry and the wait was awful and also the waiting room is insane. Other than the hosts telling us an hour wait and texting us saying check in or our reservation was cancelled, I can confidently say it's worth the wait.

The food was AMAZINGGGG and the servers were awesome too. The food came out very quickly and was cooked perfectly. Fabresio was our server and he is hands down one of the BEST servers I've ever experienced at a restaurant. With years of sever/bartender history I know a good one when I see one and man, he was AWESOME! Very humble, and giving credit to others in the back working too, wasn't annoyed when we changed our minds twice while ordering and also was very tentative on checking on us. Highly recommend requesting him and he definitely made me experience change from a 3 to a 10. The manager should be very lucky to have a people friendly, awesome server like him!

All I can say is wow.

Two fantastic coffees, three sets of pancakes, two skillets, and biscuits and gravy all for $50. And they were all fantastic.

I truly believe you can order anything here and not go wrong. So have at it and order what you want because you can expect it to be good!

Will be back a million times over (if I could).

pics.caption: Biscuits and gravy, butcher block skillet, lemon poppy seed and caramel apple pecan pancakes

review.des: If I could eat these wild-berry crepes on a daily basis, I would die the happiest person in all of creation.  Words can't truly express the emotional bond I had with the four crepes that arrived on my rather large plate.  They were covered in fresh fruit and an amazing drizzle, and each was stuffed with a fruity / yogurty concoction of something from my taste-bud field of dreams.  I also ordered a cold brew coffee, which came with little goblets of cream and sugary syrup to sweeten up the deal, and from that point on my day was complete.  I wasn't sure that I could've finished the whole plate, but each bite kept me wanting more and more, and when the last drizzle on the plate was finally wiped away, I was left feeling full and empty at the same time.  I dream of having another one of these crepes again.

My favorite meal of the day is breakfast so of course I would enjoy this place. I ordered their signature Berry Bliss pancakes and I'm glad I did. My boyfriend got a regular egg dish and it wasn't anything out of the ordinary.

As for my pancakes they had blueberry within the batter/pancakes. The blueberry was warm so it was really good and the pancakes was topped off with fresh blueberries and strawberries.

If you're going to go here I recommend only getting their signature dishes. Everything else, it's just regular breakfast.

Wildberry is located near Millennium park and has a waiting app that helps with the long lines. I had the Mexican Skillet with pancakes in the side. The serving size is huge and could have been split between two people. The food was delicious and the dishes I saw coming out for french toast were beautifully plated.

Like this spot. Usually a fan of Yolk for breakfast when in Chicago. Decided to try this place out after seeing a 1.5-2 hour wait time every time on Yelp. I got the butchers block and a specialty banana coconut pancakes. The skillet was great; 4 different kinds of sausage cheese egg was cooked right but 75% of it was potatoes :(. The pancakes however were the best I had; those were some real flapjacks they were generous on the banana and coconut. All in all the food was good skillet not as good as Yolk but made up for it with the cakes. One thing I will say that spoiled my experience was the service. Waitress was a sweetheart for sure but she was just slow; refills on coffee bringing syrup and silverware. I could see why the wait time was two hours. All in all though I'd go back and would recommend you try it.

Nice place! Right in downtown where everything is and it's convenient. The potions are big which is great cuz for people who eats a lot like me this is a plus! Pancakes are not that fluffy, though they look very beautiful and inviting. Flavors are good. Make sure you put your name on the waitlist before you come otherwise you might have to wait a while since it's always busy.

This place was PACKED but I downloaded the "NoWait" app which allowed me to see the estimated wait time and gives you the ability to add your name to the list before you get there. It then gave me the time I should arrive. It will text you when your name is called and you have five minutes from then before they take you off the list. So it worked out perfectly and we were able to get a seat right when we arrived.

The service was prompt, efficient, and our waitress was extremely nice and pleasant. She took great care of us, had recommendations, and was very cheerful and excited for us to experience our delicious meal!

The food was divineeeeeee. I got a skillet which automatically comes with hash browns and a pancake on the side. I upgraded my pancake (for $1.50) to a banana cream pancake which was also delicious! They give you coffee refills and give you the option to get a refill to go. Perfect meal!

It's right across from millennium park and Chicago's Institute of Art!

I was here at 8:15am last Friday and this place was packed! I wouldn't believe I will have to wait for 15-20 minute on a weekday. It was not an ideal situation that they do not have wait area so we had to stand really close to the door and we were yelled several times by the waiters that have to get in and out the door, they were not happy we blocked the door.  
The food was pretty good though,I ordered butcher block and it was 2 eggs & hash browns with sausages with 2 huge pancakes and the portion was huge. I experienced food coma after my breakfast.
Our waitress was very friendly and kind and she did a great job keeping our coffee refill. If you are in Chicago and you are up for the breakfast, this is the place you can come, but please mind the wait!

Great experience. Place was packed but service was as perfect. I had chicken and waffles and my wife had eggs and pancakes. Both great. Wish I had seen the skillet breakfast before I ordered because it looked wonderful

I don't really understand the hype about this place other than its pancakes. My friends and I just had to try it on our trip to Chicago. The wait is pretty bizarre, so make sure to make a reservation, but you can't be 5 minutes late to it.

And yes, the pancakes are truly amazing. They are super soft and just the right amount of sweet for an early brunch. I had the good ol' buttermilk pancakes with the fresca omelette. The omelette pales in comparison -- the avocado has no taste and the rest of the omelette doesn't taste like it has anything in it :( Enjoyed the hash browns though.

We shared the waffles with strawberries, which I thought weren't as good as the pancakes, but they were still the right amount of sweet. Overall I recommend this place for a quick brunch, but not for a tasty meal.

This place is always packed for good reason. We put our name on the waitlist on the train from O'Hare after seeing that the wait time was almost an hour (even on a very cold, wet and dreary Sunday morning) and made it just in time to be seated.

The Intelligentsia coffee is great and pairs perfectly with the sweeter breakfast options. The Signature Berry Bliss French Toast was very delicious and the topping was just the right combination of sweet and tart. My only regret is not trying the pancakes.

This is my first time in Chicago, and this is definitely a place you must visit for brunch! Amazing location in case you have a wait to be served since you can check out Millennium Park which is right across the street. Once our party was called, we were seated immediately and the food arrived very quickly! We ordered the Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes, WB "BLT" Sandwich, and Florence Benedict. Each meal was made to perfection, pancakes were soft and fluffy (5 pancakes!!),  the sandwich had the perfect crunch, and the poached eggs had the best "runny egg" effect. Everything we ordered was affordable and my party of 3 left the restaurant extremely satisfied and full!

So, I decided that based on many of these so called "stellar" reviews on Wildberry, I had to check it out. On an early Sunday morning, 15 mins. after opening at 06:30 am, the place already had a few patrons in it. The bustle was yet to come, I'm sure. They weren't short on staff, that's for sure. So, I wanted to try some chocolate chip banana pancakes to quell my sweet tooth. I was offered 2 or 5 stack by the fit male waiter. Five had seemed too many, and I could get the two with a couple of eggs along with fruit or hash browns. That's what I did. Having to summon someone and beg for butter was annoying. Finally, I had received some! Wildberry's food is a good breakfast but NOT great. Prices are lower to mid range for Chicago. The service is so so. Apparently, many are willing to endure a long wait to eat here. I wouldn't wait past 10 mins. for this! Atmosphere's nothing special. It's just a brightly lit hustle bustle kind of place with lots of tables. Tip: Earlier the better on Sunday - no waiting.

The wait for this place is crazy but finally got to try it on a Wednesday afternoon! I had the chicken and waffles. I love the jalapeño batter, has a nice flavor. I wish the chicken weren't your average grocery store chicken tenders, but overall 5/5, will eat again.

I believe I owe Yelper Andy V. a THANK YOU! Wildberry was recommended to my traveling friend by an acquaintance of hers. Of course went on yelp to check out the reviews and he mentioned to download the No Wait app so we can put our names on the waitlist before we head there.
There were 99 parties ahead of us when we put ourselves down. We had a scheduled tour so we were a little skeptical but we still did it. When we got there the line was still pretty long and we had to wait about 15 to 20 minutes to be seated. I normally wouldn't wait this long for anything, but there is something to be said for a place with such a big hype. Also parties were being called very often. So we waited and I am very glad we did! Everything was delicious! I had the fluffiest omelette I have ever eaten before. And I am not a pancake person but I had one of their signature wildberry pancakes and it was amazing! Service was fast and courteous.
It was a very good and very filling meal. I will most definitely visit this place whenever I'm back in Chicago. In fact I am fully planning on bringing my husband when we come back next year!

Awesome wild berry pancakes. I make my own pancakes each week for my kids from scratch with buttermilk so I'm pretty picky when it comes to pancakes. These were great!
My wife had the avocado toast with eggs Benedict on it and loved it.  We used the check in ahead of arriving at the restaurant through yelp and it worked great! Skipped the long line!

I thought this place was good - definitely not worth all the hype and waiting, but still a good spot for traditional breakfast. They have a nice big menu of items to choose from and so you can find something that fits your taste, whether that's pancakes, omelets or sandwiches. I opted for the Biscuits and Gravy, which was very good - nice biscuits and rich, savory gravy to go with it.

I didn't really wait since I used Yelp's service to get on the waiting list before I arrived and it worked very well. This place is not worth the wait in line, but it's definitely worth going to if you plan ahead and get on the waiting list before you arrive. The location is definitely convenient, especially if you're a tourist (that's probably why it's so busy).

Next time, I'd definitely go for the pancakes!

This place is amazing. It's one of my favorite breakfast places and I'd go more often if there was one closer to me. The Denver skillet is excellent and my usual order. The serve best pancakes I've ever had and I'm always sure to substitute the plain buttermilk pancakes that come with my skillet for the Wildberry pancakes. You can definitely count on having to wait at least 30 minutes for a table but it's so worth the deliciousness!
Crowded. I was not impressed with the smallish amount of blueberries on my order. I thought a place with berry in its name would be generous with fruit.

YUMMMM. Great brunch place right next to Millenium Park. Well, to be fair, my friends and I came here fairly early (around 8:30 on a Saturday morning), so we didn't have to wait an insanely long time, which I know for some people, including myself, can ruin a food experience. We waited about 5-10 minutes for a table of 4.

My friend and I split the red velvet roll french toast and their southern benedict. Both were delicious! THe red velvet french toast was a LITTLE too rich for me, but I mean, it's brunch - to be expected. The dough of the roll itself was soft and fluffy, topped with a sugary icing and filled with a slightly tart cream cheese custard. Their southern benedict was nice and hardy - great fluffy biscuits to hold up to the slight spice of the sausage and the richness of the gravy. I thought it was a delicious interpretation of a benedict!

A delicious brunch place close to many great things in Chicago - I highly recommend coming here, but get a reservation if you can or come early so that you don't have to wait a long time. By the time we left, there was definitely an INSANELY long line.

Great brunch place! We used the app to get on the wait list, but then got seated on the patio immediately. We both had pancakes and they were yummy-but we should have got the smaller portions because they were huge. The bacon was also good. The service was fast and excellent. Good coffee. Highly recommend.

I went here for breakfast with my boyfriend and had a great experience. We each got an omelet with a choice of pancake on side. The food was fantastic, but the portions are huge. We could have easily shared one order. Tip: get there early to put your name down on the waitlist

MmmmMmmm good!!! While visiting the Windy City the hubby and I turned to my trusted food review source and after reading the reviews decided to check out Wildberry!!! We were not disappointed!  Once we finally found a park we arrived as they were just about ready to close. The hostess happily seated us outside at a nice table (the weather was perfect) and our server was ever so eager to please even after stating they were closing in about 5 minutes. Upon our server's recommendation the hubby ordered the Mexicana Skillet with a side wild berry pancake. I ordered the chicken n waffles but after tasting my hubby's meal I knew right away I'd chosen unwisely. The Mexicana was the BOMB!!!! Packed full of flavors and the pancake was oh so delicious... mind you I don't even like pancakes!! Looking forward to putting Wildberry into rotation anytime we're back in the Chi!!

YALL there will be a wait. Get there early and be prepared to wait a little while. It would be best to make a reservation through yelp ahead of time! This location is such an attraction as it is across the street from the main attraction, Millennium Park. However, the food is worth the wait. AND the portions are huge. You can get one item and share it with a friend. I promise you'll both leave full. My boyfriend and I shared the Mexican skillet, and we were both very satisfied. We opted for the pancakes as our side and paid the extra charge for specialty pancakes. The pancakes were delicious, and I believe lived up to its hype, though I found them a little too sweet for my preference. Overall, I can see why this brunch place gets so busy, and I would definitely come back again the next time I'm in Chicago. One setback I experienced was the service. I understand they were busy, but it took our server a very long time to take our order.

pics.caption: Side of signature berry bliss pancakes

review.des: Absolutely delicious! Highly recommend getting on the waitlist via Yelp, doing so reduces the amount of sitting around waiting time! We only waited about 10 minutes to be seated once we arrived. I had the wild mushroom omelette with pancakes. The hubs ordered the fig omelette. Both were excellent! We also ordered one biscuit to share. Once the food arrived, we realized we really should have ordered one entree split. We've got quite the to-go box for a late afternoon breakfast snack! We will definitely come back.
The wait was crazy 1.5hr! But the food was amazing! Cinnamon roll pancakes omg! Service was great too. Very nice staff. Hot food came out from kitchen quickly also.

A very solid breakfast place - for the suburbs. (Sorry.) I found in the area that there was nothing that really wowed me, outside of Wildberry. While the menu offers nothing groundbreaking, everything that my group of 5 ordered was perfectly cooked and tasted delicious. Be warned though, the wait on Saturday around 11:00 was well over an hour. I also felt like our waiter's section was larger than at most restaurants, and as a result he did not come to check on us often. We finished eating and waited a good 10 minutes before he came to see if we needed our check.

We went there while our stay in Chicago, and let me just say it was THE BEST BREAKFAST I've had  we were super satisfied with the service and the food. I had the veggie omelette and my husband hand the barbacoa skillet!

Waited 2 hrs on a Sunday morning, (yelp wait forecast was pretty good), but my bar for the food went way high!. Didn't disappoint but came out wondering if it was worth the wait. There are clearly other breakfast joints that I would go to, with waaaayyy less wait.
Lots of sugary stuff, and lots of classic options. Skillet seemed good, but I ended up trying the mushroom inlet with berry pancakes. Good stuff!

More traditional dishes rather than new-hip dishes but nonetheless it's very good.

They don't take reservations and are pretty popular so expect a line.

The best breakfast place i have ever gone to while visiting Chicago. I visit Chicago once a year and always come here the second day. Yes the wait time is long but so worth it's. On here you can check in first to the waitlist and they'll text you when it's your turn. The food is amazing and full of flavor. It's also very reasonably price iced. Two sizzlin skillet with an upgrade to specialty pancakes, one mango smoothie and one iced caramel coffee came out to $46. The workers are very nice and very attentive to the costumers. I will be back next year in January and I already can't wait to come back here.

pics.caption: The butcher block, mango smothie with Cinnamon Roll Pancakes. Then is the Mexicano, blueberry pancakes with a iced caramel macchiato.

review.des:
Yummy! Yummy! Yummy!

Wildberry has more than 4,000 reviews and 4 stars, so I had to try it!

Shoutout to the Yelp app; not only did it help me discover this gem, it offered for me to join the Sunday waitlist (highly recommended if offered).

The wait was extensive, but I received a text which let me check how many people were ahead of me, as well as a second message when it was time to see the host. Again, Yelp app FTW!

Food: (1) Create your own omelette (broccoli, avocado, mushrooms, feta and spinach) with included pancakes and fruit. The omelette was a little soft for me to be in love with it, but it was definitely tasty. Wildberry does NOT skimp on the portions, so come hungry or be prepared to take food to-go.

Drink: I'm not a big coffee person, but I ordered the white chocolate mocha anyway. It was creamy, and definitely a coffee-based drink. I'd aim for the white hot chocolate for the next visit.

I unfortunately do not recall the name of our waitress/server (blond hair in a pony tail, accent, swift, corner section), but she was super funny and attentive!

The only super negative was the wait time; even with being on the wait list, we were outside in 12 degree weather for an additional 20 minutes compared to the "check in by ___" time :-(.

My total came to less than $20 before tip.

Highly recommended!

I'm sure this place doesn't need any more 5 star reviews. But I just have to say, I love this brunch place! This place is packed and there's a reason why. Please do yourself a favor and put your name on the Yelp Waitlist before you arrive. For a table of 2, I placed our name on the list around 8:30am on a Sunday. We arrived at 9:30am and waited approximately 20 minutes for a table. This was definitely more tolerable than the 2 hour wait.

They have an extensive menu with so many options. I was indecisive as I wanted both the savory and the sweet. I decided to go with the garden skillet with a side of berry bliss pancakes. My friend went with the veggie omelette and their pumpkin spice pancake special.

Omg the highlight of my meal was definitely the berry bliss pancakes. The pancakes are so fluffy and the mascarpone and berries just create such a flavorful experience in your mouth. Quite possibly the best pancakes I've had. Highly recommend them. The pumpkin spice pancakes were good as well and the flavor was a little more on the mild side.

As for our savory dishes, enjoyed the skillet but wasn't amazed. Portion sizes are huge. It was way too much food for me. It can definitely be split between two people. Tried my friend's omelette and I enjoyed that more than the skillet. The eggs were so light and fluffy.

I wished I live in Chicago just so I can come to Wildberries when I want. But since I don't, I'll just have to plan a trip to Chicago again someday!

Long wait but still worth the 2hrs. You can always put down your name and take a nice walk at the park or around the bean. If you are looking for something special go for The sizzles, they are good to share and add special pancakes, apple cinnamon pecan is my recommendation. Also get a coffee, they beans are great. Enjoy

Bomb.com!    I wish I lived closer just so I could enjoy the French toast over and over again!   I was afraid it would be over whelming sweet but to my surprise it was just the right amount.   Make sure  I use their waitlist function since there is definitely a line or the door.

Can't wait to come back in the future.

Best breakfast!

Signature berry bliss is a must if you go here!! The pancakes are so delicious. I should've ordered more of these instead of getting just a side of them but I wanted to try more stuff.

The only downside is that the wait time is very long. There was a group of five of us and we waited about an hour for a table. We ended up putting our name down on the list and then coming back when we got a text.

The service was nice and quick. Our waiter came and got our orders within a few minutes of being seated. The food came out pretty quickly too.

I ordered the mexicana skillet with the signature berry bliss pancakes. I actually ended up finishing all my pancakes which is something I never do so you can imagine how good these must be. The skillet was good too but it had extra potatoes than eggs and I would've preferred more eggs.

Next time I go back to this place, I'm getting more of the signature berry bliss pancakes or maybe even the waffles, to try something new.

I highly recommend this brunch place. As someone who doesn't like food or drinks that are too sweet, I thought the Berry Bliss Pancakes and the Honey Toffee Nut Latte were delicious. The Berry Bliss Pancakes didn't even need syrup or more butter to go with it. Florence Eggs Benedict was also cooked perfectly.

The only disadvantage is the long wait time (can take over two hours if you don't book in advance), which is also a testament to how good this place is. Just make sure to book in advance on Yelp or through the Chicago food app.

One of my favorite places to go! It is worth the wait. Staff are all very nice and friendly! I have not had a bad experience here so far. Portions are enough for what you pay for. They have delicious pancakes! You can't go wrong with anything you order; everything is great!

One of the biggest tourist traps in Chicago, but I LOVE THE FOOD.

Since moving to Chicago, a little bit over a year ago, I have been to wildberry three times now. I only come when I have friends in town, because it is a bit of a hassle to eat there due to the constant wait.

My wildberry strategy is waking up about two hours before I think I'm going to want to eat, and putting my name in through the waitlist on yelp. Then I get some more sleep, and then walk the 20 min it takes to get there from my apartment at the time it tells me to get there. That way, I don't need to wait out in front of the restaurant.

My favorite order is the corned beef hash skillet and I always upgrade the pancakes to one of the specialty pancakes for an extra $1.50. My favorite are the caramel apple pecan pancakes. This is definitely not a meal that I can finish on my own. I always have leftovers. So be careful when ordering, especially if you plan on being out for the rest of the day and don't want to be carrying leftovers around. Maybe do some sharing.

I see what the hype is all about. Expect a wait to be seated, but it's all worth it!

We went Monday morning and was able to join the waitlist thru Yelp as we were in an Uber. I recommend you join the waitlist if you plan on coming here.  They tell you when you need to be at the restaurant by and how many people there are in front of you.

The service is amazing. The people there were so friendly and really funny.

If you plan on getting pancakes, be aware that the stack is HUGE. I'd recommend you get a skillet or something and just pay $1.50 to sub out toast for a specialty pancake. So you get to try something savory and sweet for the same price. They give you 3 pancakes which is a perfect size.

VENETIAN SKILLET - big portion, lots of sausage and very cheesy! This had a slight sweetness though. Im assuming it was from the tomatoes?

STRAWBERRY POPPY SEED PANCAKE - I paid $1.5 to get this in addition to my skillet. They give you 3 pancakes (perfect by yourself or to share). This was really good. It tastes exactly like lemon Poppy and had strawberries on top. And it wasn't overly sweet.

SIGNATURE BERRY BLISS CREPE - comes with 3 rolled up crepes with tons of  strawberries, blueberries, and blackberries on top. Had a kind of berry yogurt inside the crepe? It was a bit sweet and not tart at all. I'd definitely recommend this!

I've been wanting to try out Wildberry for some time now, but have always been discouraged by the wait times that can often be up to two hours. Now, with the help of our friends at Yelp, you can score a place in line from the comfort of your bed and leisurely make your way over to Randolph Street in time for your table.

This place is bustling for a reason - it serves up some of the best breakfast anywhere on the planet. Once you're seated, the very friendly servers are at your table making sure you're settled in, with piping-hot Intelligentsia coffee (mmmm) quickly making its way to the table. Every single thing on the menu looks great, making it hard to decide between one yummy-sounding dish and the next. For me, it ended up being the breakfast burrito, a fairly large wheat tortilla stuffed with chorizo, poblano peppers, queso chihuahua (a mild cheddar-like cheese), avocado, cilantro, and eggs, all wrapped up into a beautiful package. The burrito comes with Wildberry's hash browns, and these hash browns are easily the best ones I've ever had, nice and crispy on the outside, cooked-through and creamy on the inside. (As those of you who have read some of my diner reviews know, I still can't figure out why most places can't make hash browns the right way. Wildberry obviously knows the secret!)

One of my buddies had the Denver skillet, full of hash browns, cheddar and jack cheeses, ham, bell peppers, and onions, topped with fluffy, creamy scrambled eggs. This dish looked amazing and, after taking that last bite, my buddy proclaimed it as the best breakfast he's ever had. That's high praise, and I know what I'm getting on my next visit!

My other buddy had the Mexicana skillet, a similarly generous combination of hash browns, cheddar and jack cheeses, chorizo, jalapeños, avocado, cilantro, and onions, also topped with those perfectly made scrambled eggs. He gave it a five-star rating and said it had a nice spicy kick, a great way for a chile-head to start the morning.

Wildberry has a 4.5 rating over almost 4,000 reviews for good reason - they serve up what is probably the best breakfast in Chicagoland and, for us, will always rank as one of the best breakfasts the three of us have ever had. Wildberry should have a prominent spot on everyone's Chicago itinerary!

pics.caption: Breakfast Burrito deliciousness, up close and personal

review.des:
Second time here. Love. This. Place.

If you're looking for that carby glutenous sugar-laden goodness that is the classic oversized American breakfast, come here. The pancakes and french toast are substative, not overprocessed premade stuff. And any fruit that might end up on your plate is fresh.

I'm so happy I added us to the waitlist via Yelp!  The wait was ~2hours by the tine we got there. #insane
Clearly, this is Chicago's hot spot

Server was very responsive. However, we waited a good bit for our coffees/teas.  Food came out fairly fast though. Everything was delish

We will go again, but get there early!

Lots of food and great service. Be sure to reserve your spot using YELP ahead of time. The lines are long which I can see why.

We got two adult entrees and two kids meals. We were stuffed. Everything was good. Highly recommended.

This was a find for us. The pancakes were fluffy and delicious. The server helped by suggesting the side portion of two which was perfect. The main dish is five pancakes.
I had a strawberry smoothie and my husband a banana split one, both delicious. Prices were low. Highly recommend.

First would, would 100% recommend taking advantage of adding yourself on the waitlist thru Nowait on Yelp!!!! The timing is very accurate. My friends and I woke up Sunday morning around 9:30 and saw the wait time would be around an hour and a half and we right away booked thru Yelp to wait. Spot on at 11AM we got seated!

Browsing through the menu my mouth was drooling with all the options! My friend who had previously been to Wildberry had advised to go for one of the skillets because you get to also have their pancakes which is very well known. You can also upgrade it to one of the speciality pancakes for $1.50 more so heck - why not! I ended up getting the Venetian with sunny side up eggs. The Venetian contains  Italian sausage, bell peppers, onions and tomatoes So delicious! Everything is cooked perfectly and so fresh with every bite. As for the pancakes, they're AMAZING. My favorite would have to be the Cinnamon Roll because they tastes exactly like a cinnamon roll! I'm really surprised they still provide syrup and whip cream on the side because speciality pancakes only are oh-so tasty.

Service here is also on point - attentive to all their tables despite how busy it can get here. I'm not sure if there is a parking structure for you to get here but I believe most people in Chicago get around thru the different lines :)

I would definitely come back here again when I'm in the Windy City :)

pics.caption: Oreo S'more Pancakes and chocolate chip pancakes
Venetian skillet with sunny side up eggs and sub speciality Cinnamon Roll Pancakes

review.des: Visited Chicago for the weekend and this was an awesome find! We added ourselves to the waitlist on the Yelp app and then waited for the text. It was a short walk from the Hyatt Regency so that was a plus as well. It's extremely busy and the line goes out the door but service moves fast. Portions are big! Food combos are fun! And smoothies are fresh. We truly loved it here.

I personally love this breakfast place and I think it's actually one of my favorite I am always going here!

I don't think that you can go wrong everything is so delicious I never had anything that I didn't like

I definitely recommend it to everyone especially if you are staying at the ritz Carlton you can just go right next door to your hotel and have breakfast when you wake up to start you day I think it's a great way to start I like the pancakes my personal favorite

First stop in Chicago. This place is about 10 min walk from our hotel, Club Quarters. I had the Los Altos Benedict's, super good. Had chorizo and Chipotle hollandaise, just enough spice. Wife had the Denver skillet with jalapenos. No wait which is always nice, service was prompt, would definitely come back!

The huge crowds of people and great reviews has me super excited to try this place... i left a but disappointed - my pumpkin walnut bread french toast was dry.  The fresh OJ was very good though and  the manager was very attentive and friendly when coming around to tables.

Ok Wildberry, you win. Your Chorizo Eggs Benedict and Wilberry Waffles totally beats my usual banana/toast/night-before-leftovers eaten in the car for breakfast routine. And wow I am so glad my husband got on the waitlist online while I was still contemplating about getting out of bed! (I'm so not a morning person..) Apparently it was a 1.5 hour wait Sunday morning, so we timed it just right then got the confirmation text that our table was ready, walked right past the crowds of people waiting outside and were able to get seated within minutes! Yes, I made sure to tell my husband how awesome he was.

What a packed place! We split the Wildberry Waffles, Chorizo Eggs Benedict with Hash Browns and a berry blend fresh squeezed orange juice. Waffles were delicious- berry mascarpone was sooo yummy. The sweet berries were a good combo to the chorizo which was just mildly spicy. Eggs were poached perfectly and hash browns were crispy and not greasy at all. The juice was so good too! Our server was very efficient and made sure we got our coffee to go quickly.
By the time we left, we checked the wait time which had gone up to 2.5 hours!! I guess it's not that crazy during the week?? Can't wait to come back!

pics.caption: chorizo eggs Benny with hash browns

review.des:
Couldn't finish my eggs benny and bf's omelette was too heavy on the cheese...
I'm not sure why this place is so popular, though if you are looking for huge portions with plenty of carbohydrates, and you don't mind waiting 1.5-2 hours, this is the place.

This place has so many reviews and for good reason.  I tried the cinnamon roll pancakes and they were amazing.

Before arriving here I was anticipating a long wait, but thankfully I was seated almost instantly.
Short trip to Chicago, 4 days. We had breakfast here twice! Gotta have donuts also lol. Definitely a must for breakfast, was hard to pick because of so many options. Great food!
Cute little breakfast spot near my hotel. I had the chicken and waffles, my friend had the berry pancakes. One try taste of her pancakes had me super jealous, they were delish!

One of my new fave pancake spots in Murica. The sauce they drizzle atop is ridiculously addicting and even better with maple syrup. Wait times are long, so bring your patience with you. You'll get a text to confirm if you reserve through Yelp. I think it also works if you're not a Yelp member. This technique allows you to browse around the area if you wish, and come back when your table is ready as there's no ample space to wait, other than inside the Prudential lobby. Service was absolutely amazing - everyone there understands how busy, crowded and hectic it can get, but nonetheless they're so friendly and accommodating. Would highly recommend and come back!

This place was recommended from friends that lived in Chicago.. I was visiting and had time to check this place out. The weekend vs weekday wait time is night and day. Weekend is an hour plus versus weekday is less than 25 minutes, parking is challenging so either catch an Uber, Lyft, cab, walk or take a bike.

After getting recommendations and also reading reviews, we checked this placed out Tuesday, May 30th.. after reviewing the pictures, the pancakes was clearly a must have at this place.

Service was great, very quick and made recommendations based on what was popular and appetite. So, we ordered the Strawberry Bliss pancakes, traditional 2 eggs with bacon, hash browns and chicken sausage, along with a breakfast brisket which is mixed with hash browns, gravy, eggs, and of course brisket..

Overall, nothing really was WOW about it when it came to the food. The traditional breakfast, was exactly that, traditional and made very well. The hash browns were crunchy, which made them pretty good as they are usually made soggy and don't have enough crunch. The pancakes were ok, I honestly thought I would have blown my taste buds out of the water, but they didn't, taste like IHOP pancakes, and that's not a bad thing. However, the brisket breakfast was definitely different and the combination of hash browns, brisket, gravy all worked together.. that was our best dish.. try it if you like brisket, it's something I would get again.. hence giving the rating of a 3, that 1 dish and service..

Will come again just to try something new on my next visit.

pics.caption: Traditional breakfast. 2 eggs, bacon, hash browns, chicken sausage
Strawberry bliss pancakes, they were ok..
Brisket, Eggs, gravy, hash browns, and toast.. great dish

review.des:
Get ready to wait if you aren't here early , but it's so worth the wait I promise !!! This place never disappoints, from their food , to their staff .

I've been to this place 4 times , all the times I've visited Chicago . I've tried many different items off the menu everything very delicious . The portions are much enough to share because the entree comes with the choice of toast , or pancakes .

I always get the signature pancakes , they're a match made in heaven . If the times scares you , don't let it , the food is so worth it .
Great hash skillets and delicious pancakes make this spot a breakfast must in downtown Chicago.  Use the Yelp Waitlist app to jump in line to save you time.

This place was worth the wait!  It took us 35 minutes to be seated because we didn't realize online wait listing was available.

The food was spectacular - my daughter had the Berry Bliss pancakes, and I had the Blackberry Key Like Pie pancakes.  Very very good!

The service was courteous, punctual and likable.  The next time I'm in Chicago, I will eat here again!

I thought to myself how good can pancakes be? Since I'm not a big fan of pancakes but I gave it a try bc of their reviews and boy I'm glad I did! It was NOT HYPE. Their pancakes is make with their special batter that makes it taste so fluffy and delicious. Their whipped cream is special made too that it's light and creamy at the same time with a hint of berries flavor. I had to come back there once again before leaving Chicago. You must try their signature berry bliss pancakes.
Wonderful service in a lovely breakfast spot near to many hotels. Breakfast is amazing. Delicious, creative and plentiful. Pancakes with berries should be in a dessert menu. Delightful find.

It's a breakfast spot that is a go-to when I'm short on time. The concierges are awesome....HUGE servings of food and I don't think I ever had anything bad here. Out of towners love this spot. SUPER crowded at lunchtime, so get there a little early...11am - 11:45am.

Wow on both! I went on the wait list through Yelp and walked over to the restaurant. The hostess shared to wait for the second text message saying our table was ready, and about 15 minutes later we were seated.
There are so many delicious looking items on the menu, so go hungry. We ordered a garden skillet, Southern Benedict, Oreo pancakes, Cinnamon roll pancakes and berry bliss pancakes. They all were so tasty!! The Berry Bliss and Cinnamon roll pancakes were better than the Oreo. The garden skillet vegetables were cooked perfectly. They were crunchy and not over cooked.  
Brittany was our server. She was efficient, friendly and helpful with suggestions.  The bus team was quick at clearing tables and friendly.
Definitely make reservations. It is across from Millennial  park  so make plans to stick around the area. Enjoy!

Was super stoked to try this place out since I saw all the reviews. Glad we did. Can't remember what I had because I'm writing this review a few days later. Just remember that the waffle was spectacular. Service was also great.

First stop after landing In Chicago was to find the best breakfast spot that had the most bang for our buck. After looking through google map for local places, I came across this restaurant with a catchy name of Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe and knew it was a must try.

I ordered the amazing signature berry bliss French toast. It's two slices of French toast topped with vanilla anglaise, blackberry Coulis, Berry Mascarpone and Fresh Berries. Just the right amount to make this fruity combination (with syrup as well) all blend heavenly after the first bite. I also had some hash brown topped with cheddar cheese and onion which completed the most important meal of the day.

The service is excellent, with a clean environment and attentive servers. Overall, the experience was two thumbs up

They are very biz but everyone is very friendly and nice the chocolate chip banana pancakes are to die for so is there mocha espresso smoothie really good waitress is really friendly and nice and looks like Sandra Bullock

Ok, I'll admit the food IS good!  But is it the "OMG this is the best in town and no others are comparable to this"? No. And am I willing to wait for 1.5-2 hrs with an empty stomach in the morning again? No. And I'm your typical Asian foodie and willing to wait for 3 months for a good meal. I did give it a try, liked the food. But don't think I'll come back again. I'd rather go somewhere else that the food is just as good (and there're a lot of places in Chicago at this level), but not so much of a wait, and can actually enjoy the neighborhood while you wait.

This is my favorite brunch place. It's perfect weekdays when there isn't much of a wait. Weekends, it often has 40-70 minutes of a line but small groups can potentially get in faster. Great service and an excellent menu make the wait worth it. That being said, I only go weekdays now. There's nothing like walking straight into a place of this quality and getting a seat in just a few minutes!

Awesome food! The Nutella crepe was a sweet treat! Highly recommended for anyone who is a chocolate lover!

But don't ever go there without reserving a table online! It's pretty cool...you got text updates alerting you to head over! Otherwise you can easily end up waiting for 2 hours or more!

We arrived on a Saturday morning and were put on the waitlist. It was an hour and a half wait, but we did not mind since this was located conveniently across the street from the Bean! Their method to seat guests as soon as possible was very efficient. Upon putting your name on their waitlist, you can download an app which tells you exactly where you are on the list (there were 112 parties ahead of us!). When you get toward the top of the list, you get a text message from them and are shortly brought to your table.

We ordered the Florence eggs Benedict, turkey bacon, hash, and pancakes. I personally thought that the eggs Benedict were mediocre and lacked flavor, however the hash and pancakes were delicious! The hash was nice and crispy, yet soft and the pancakes were fluffy with crispy edges. I usually don't really care for pancakes, but if I were to visit Chicago again I'd definitely stop by Wildberry and try a different variation of pancakes.

Service was great despite it being extremely busy. Pricing is cheap considering the quality of food you get. Overall, we had a pleasant experience.

pics.caption: Florence eggs Benedict, pancakes, hash, eggs, and turkey bacon.

review.des:
NOT WORTH THE WAIT. We were quoted 1 and a half to 2 hours and our wait ended up being closer to 2 and half hours.

The food here is good and the prices were very reasonable, but I feel like you could probably get comparable food elsewhere. Service was average.

If you do feel the need to get this place add yourself to the waitlist on yelp ahead of time.

Definitely a tourist trap but for good reason!

Added our name to the waitlist via Yelp as we headed to the restaurant, which I highly recommend!

Their signature berry bliss pancakes are delicious! I need that recipe ASAP! They're fluffy and vanilla-y.  The dollop of yogurt on top is the perfect addition.

We got a side order of the signature berry bliss french toast. Just as delicioua but definitely would recommend the pancakes over the french toast if you're indecisive.

We also got the homemade biscuits with gravy and eggs. The biscuits were delicious and buttery. The gravy was perfect with the biscuits.

The food is 5 stars, but the service - like with any tourist trap - was mediocre. They seated us before cleaning our table and the previous customers' check/receipt was still on the table 10 mins after we were seated. It took forever for our waitress to come take our order. And, when we ordered the apple cider and asked for no whipped cream, and of course, it came with a ton of whipped cream.

But the food is enough for me to come back!

pics.caption: Side of Signature Berry Bliss French Toast

review.des:
Tasty and crunchy waffles with fresh berries
It's hard to eat somewhat healthy, even for breakfast and especially out. I found the Belgian waffle to be light, crunchy and so tasty with some lovely and fresh mixed berries. Their hash browns would have been better if the waiter had informed me that their plain hash browns had bacon pieces mixed in, that was a bit of a disappointment since I would never assume a basic hash brown would have a ton of pig in it, which I don't like at all. My BF liked his biscuits and the kids liked their buttermilk pancakes.

Very busy because of the weekend and also because it's in downtown. The waiter were nice and visible. Set up made us confused because water was already at the table which made it look like others were still sitting there, but I guess they save them time. The food was actually very good. The portions was good and the specialty pancakes were so good. Enjoyed the time there.

AWESOME PLACE!! Service was incredible. Everyone was super friendly and helpful. We used the Nowait app which helped us avoid waiting for hours at the location. Food was insanely delicious and the speciality coffees were great. Fresh orange juice was killer. Hands down best breakfast place in Chicago after living there for 6 years. Don't think twice, this place is a slam dunk.

The signature berry pancakes are delicious, nice and fluffy pancakes stacked with berry sauce. I don't usually like pancakes but this is a must try and I recommend sharing with friends since the portions are very large. I also got the mushroom omelette as well which was really delicious, filled with mushroom flavor and cheese. These entrees also come with a side of pancakes or toast, recommend sharing.

Solid brunch spot. Doesn't take reservations, but you can check in online instead of checking in at the front which can save you some time. Pancakes are great obviously. Rest of brunch is your standard stuff. Good spot though.

This was, by far, one of the best breakfasts I've had in Chicago. I always make a point to eat here when I'm in town. The omelettes are fluffy and delicious, the pancakes are awesome and full of goodness, and the coffee is well above what I would expect from a restaurant. All in all, it's a great place to start your day in Chicago.

This place is Amazing!

Food: The food is amazing! I personally like it better than Yolk. However, I only order a side of Berry Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes and a side Red Velvet French Toast and hands down they are the best I ever had.

Service: Super friendly staff from the moment you walk in to the moment you walk out. The hostesses will greet and smile at you. I forgot my waiter name, but he was AMAZING, I wish I had remember his name he was very engaging and just knew the right time to come and check on you even though it is jam packed.

As good as Breakfast can get!!  This place definitely lived up to the hype, because we came here twice during our five day stay in the city of Chicago. Don't judge!!!

I recommend joining the wait-list from Yelp before getting to the restaurant, it'll save you at least 20-30 minutes.  There's always a line, but it moves fast and is worth it, trust me!  After the Yelp wait-list text saying it'd be 30-45 minutes, when our table was near we received another text to check-in with hostess.  After that it was only like 5 more minutes and we got our table. Total time was 40 minutes.  Well done Wildberry Cafe, it was my first time using this feature and you nailed it.
Side Note:  The hostess staff is very kind and attentive, really set the tone for our dining experience.

The first time, 6/26/18, we both shared the Lemon Blackberry French Toast (it was a Special, that needs to be permanently on the menu), absolutely mouthwatering and is probably the reason why we came back the second time. It was this thick Lemon bread that had a custard in between it, topped with fresh blackberries and some blackberry syrup, Oh geezers this was heaven!!
My girlfriend had the Breakfast combo w/bacon, scrambled eggs, hash browns and the Berry Bliss pancakes.  Man oh man were those pancakes  super tasty!!  I had the Florence Benedict with hashbrowns and it was top notch, Yumm Yumm!
Make sure to get fresh squeezed orange juice, it was very enjoyable.  
Service was okay the first time, she was sweet and attentive, but busy.

The second time, 6/28/18, we were here to crush that Lemon Blackberry french toast again, except this time it was even better!!  I'm pretty sure it was because it'll be our last time having it for awhile :-(  
We started with this as our appetizer with our coffees.  She got a drip coffee and I got a quad-shot mocha w/whipped cream.  
My girlfriend is a creature of habit and usually gets the same thing, in which she did.  However, she threw a curve ball this time; not her specialty.  She ordered the Breakfast Combo w/turkey sausage patties, scrambled eggs, hash browns and got the Cinnamon Roll pancakes.  These things were so damn good!  I almost got in trouble for eating too much of them!
I ordered the Wild Mushroom omelet: Prosciutto, provolone cheese, Herb roast cremini, oyster and shitake mushrooms.  I chose the hash browns and whole wheat toast so I can get down on that wild-berry jam. I was so happy but I couldn't finish it because of those cinnamon roll pancakes I stole.
Service was awesome this day, our waitress Emily was extremely sweet, attentive and very calm for how busy it was.  Great service Emily, thank you!

Overall:  
This place is a must try, very fresh ingredients and your food is served super fast.  #AllStarKitcheStaff
The staff works extremely well together and we enjoyed our dining experiences both times.  Kudos to the management for this well oiled machine.  I can guarantee we'll be back next year when we stop into Chicago.

pics.caption: Breakfast combo with Berry Bliss Pancakes, Lemon Blackberry french toast and the Florence Benedict! #sodamngood

review.des:
I found this gem on yelp during our stay in Chicago, my Fiancé and I were looking for a good place to have breakfast and after a long morning of figuring out exactly where we finally wanted to eat, we ended up at Wildberry. We're so glad we made the right decision that morning; we got some hot chocolate, an order of berry pancakes & berry waffles! Everything was simply finger licking good, and for the price: totally worth it!

It was so good that we even came back for a second time during our stay at Chicago. You can tell that everything is freshly made, and the service they provide is beyond exceptional! So if you're looking for a yummy place to have breakfast, I would totally recommend Wildberry!

Waits are ridiculous (over an hour, 30 min. even when came at recommend app check-in time). Have only 2 sugar free syrup options for lattes, etc.  Also have flavored tea without option for unflavored (not everyone wants fruity tea).
Once we got called in (as outside because that many people) there was another 10+ minute wait to be called.
Food was great but in the words of Tom Petty, "the waiting is the hardest part".  Likely won't be back in person, delivery service this one.

If you are looking for a delicious breakfast definitely come here. I've been here multiple times over the years and it is always soooo good. The place gets pretty damn packed so make sure to use the no wait app to get on the list without actually going to the restaurant and waiting. If you come early enough there usually isn't that long a line, but beware the place gets busy FAST. Okay onto the good stuff, aka food. My favorites are:

Mexicana Skillet 5/5: This dish is exactly what I want when I get a skillet. Tons of chorizo, hash browns, jalapenos, avocado,cheese ,and salsa. I always end up taking some home because it's pretty heavy, but it's delicious. One note is that the egg whites are sometimes a little runny at top so if you don't like that just ask for over medium eggs.

Berry Bliss pancakes 6/5: I always substitute the pancakes that come with the skillet with this for $1.50 more and I never regret it. These pancakes are exactly what I want. Delicious sauces on top and fresh berries on the side. Do yourself a favor and get these.

I haven't really tried anything else because the skillet has always been exactly what I want, so my review is pretty limited. However from what I have tasted I would recommend this place to anyone.

Eh...ok.
Definitely not worth the wait for a table.
Wish I would have saved room in my belly for other Chi fare.
Clearly I am in the minority, because the place was packed.
Honestly I felt like something in my egg dish was "off" not fresh.
Pancakes were good, syrup may have been 100% maple?
Could be that I live in a town with great breakfast options and my standard is different than Chi folks?

The portions here are legit! I wish I had a bigger stomach to stuff more food in to my body. The hash Benedict was amazing. The Mexican themed skillet was also delicious! Just remember you will be fighting a crowd to get seated here and they aren't open all day.

The best tip I could give you is get there at a decent time put your name down and expect a 45 minute wait. While you wait for that text message from a hostess go see cloud gate. Get your selfies in and knock out two birds with one stone! See cloud gate and eat an amazing brunch.

Came here for brunch Sunday with two girlfriends after hearing about the delicious pancakes here!

TIP: Definitely put your name down on the Nowait App - we had a 2 hour wait after putting in our name at 11:30AM. You have to be within a 5mi radius to reserve but we had a Chicago friend do it for us ;) Once it got closer to brunch time, we ubered into Chicago and walked a bit and then our table was ready! The app was very accurate because we were seated at 1:30PM.

FOOD: Extensive menu! Will definitely be back to try other items.

-[Mexicana Skillet with a side of Signature Berry Bliss]- I'm more of a savory gal so I opted for the Mexicana Skillet. The chorizo sausage & cheesy hash browns with a hint of spice from the jalapeños was everything that I wanted for a treat yoself brunch. However, nothing special. Buttttt since this was a pancake spot, I GOTTA get the pancakes. And so Signature Berry Bliss pancakes I got as a side for $1.50! OMG, SO GOOD. SO GOOD. If you come, you HAVE to order these pancakes. Shared this with my friend. We were both full by the end of it.

-[Tuscan Chicken Panini]- Massive portion. Friend said it was just okay.

-[Wildberry OJ]- All 3 of us got this OJ. Couldn't stop sippin' this magical elixir. We were almost done before our entrees got to us. GET IT.

SERVICE: Fast.

AMBIANCE: Highly recommend outdoor seating! We sat outside on a perfect spring day people watching as we food comaed.

TLDR; put your name down on Nowait app, get the signature berry bliss pancakes and the wildberry OJ, sit outside.

pics.caption: Mexicana skillet, Tuscan Chicken Panini, Signature Berry Bliss pancakes with a side of Wildberry OJ

review.des: We had the strawberry chocolate waffle, banana cream pan cake and chicken waffle. The chocolate waffle is delicious, our group also really enjoyed the pan cakes. The food is outstanding. The service is great, the staff is friendly and helpful. Above all it's very reasonably priced.  If you are in Chicago, add this to your list. You will not regret it.

Wildberry pancakes have the best pancakes I've ever had. The Berry Bliss pancakes are definitely worth an order. They're very fluffy and made super well. Even though there's a line most of the time, I've been able to get on the list using the NoWait app, so I highly suggest using that.

The different benedicts are pretty good here as well as the skillets. I've had the butcher block and I thought it was delicious and very filling. Asking for the hash browns well done gives them a pretty nice crunch too. Definitely try this place out if you've got a craving for pancakes. You won't find better anywhere else!

Great service, very good food, though not spectacular. A little bit generic in the restaurant design (basically feels like they had a 'restaurant group' 'do a breakfast place' and this is what they came up with), and the crowd at the front is literally a fire hazard and dangerous, specifically with only one egress. They need to look into that.

That said, service is great - pancakes are good but not the best ever, and the jalapeño bowl is fantastic. The biscuit & gravy benedict was good, not great. The prices are fair. Coffee was good and cappucino was huge. Fine place for breakfast, and maybe gets five stars if it's not a 90-minute wait.
