Cute place, the sausage biscuits were good. There was a vegan special however that had no taste whatsoever, super bland and dry.

Decided to come back to this gem as the fat kid in me can't say no to some fluffy pancakes. Got the homemade biscuits and gravy with a side of berry bliss pancakes. Biscuits were super moist, not fluffy and flakey like I like mine, but gravy was good. Pancakes were as good as I remembered. No syrup needed for me. Sweetness felt balanced by the fruit.

Visited here  by myself on Tuesday in the morning for quick breakfast. I used waitlist on Yelp app while on my way to come here. I highly recommend using waitlist on Yelp. I didnt have to wait at all by the time I arrived here. I got one black coffee and signature berry bliss waffle. The coffee was really smooth not bitter so I liked it. For the waffle, i really enjoyed eating it. I liked the fact that it wasn't too sweet. I was still able to taste berries with enough sweetness. I will most likely visit here again in the future.
Great place for breakfast/brunch. You should definitely try the Wildberry bliss pancakes which are iconic! Chocolate smore pancakes were great. The hot chocolate was great. EVERYTHING WAS GREAT!
I got their omelet with tomatoes and basil and a side of berry pancakes in addition to a starter of the banana bread French toast. So delicious and perfect amount of food for two people to split!

Quick service and delicious eats! The wait is worth it.... however, download the app they use and you can put your name on the list way ahead of time. Once a certain number of people are on the waitlist, they don't allow walk-in. Be aware of this! My last visit to Chicago about a year and a half ago we came here twice, and now I'm back! The good comes quickly, the pancakes are delicious, and the coffee is spot on. I wish I had one of these close to home!

pics.caption: Oreo Smores pancakes! Decadent, I suggest sharing...or not.... flew half of these to Miami and They still tasted good!
Corned beef hash with scrambled eggs and hash browns. Talk about potato overload....woops!

review.des:
Noisy, busy and vast selection of food that will do wonders for building a vast waistline! Great portions and prompt service, with an excellent online wait that allows you to lay in bed on a Saturday morning till your table slot is ready, then walk and get a table without a wait.

Eggs Benedict Florentine with plenty of Spinach, but quite light on the promised diced bacon. Good coffee, but orange juice a too sweet and thick...not convinced it wasn't an OJ like product.
Great place to grab breakfast or brunch!!! You will be stuffed though, there is a lot of food to consume. You will be waiting at least an hour to get a table

Shared brekke here with a couple of my co-worker friends, one of which had never been to Chicago. We were on a very limited free time morning schedule and I wanted to pick a place that was near some sightseeing options. Wildberry was perfect for that! We arrived a little before 9A which was perfect, no wait - seated immediately but within just a few minutes the masses arrived. We definitely hit this spot at the right time to avoid that 30-40min wait I had read about.

I had a soy latte and ordered the Special: Chocolate Chip Banana Bread French Toast. Holy Wow!!! I seriously underestimated this dish. It was so tasty! I couldn't finish all of it so it's perfect for sharing with a side.

My friends ordered berry pancakes and a berry french toast, both seemed to enjoy their choices.

I'd definitely recommend this chocolate chip banana bread choice while they have it.

Great service and the food was out in a reasonable amount of time.

Came here on a weekday right before 10am during my vacation trip to Chicago, and it was about a 10-15min wait for 2 people. We stopped by on Sunday before and it was already a 2 hour wait by 9:30am so we pushed it to a working day. The venue is pretty big and packed. Service is pretty efficient. I tried the hazelnut latte and my friend and I split the french toast and the butcher block skillet with a side of specialty pancakes. Portion sizes are huge so beware.  I don't usually like pancakes, but I have to say they were the best and so good! I wish they had a location in nyc! Definitely recommend trying this place if you're ever in the area.

I LOVE that you can check in online. It seriously saves you so much time. I came here on marathon day and my sister and I walked from our hotel since the streets were pretty much all closed off. As we were walking, I was tracking the wait time with their nifty app. (Personally think all restaurants should have an online check in) when we got to the restaurant we still had to wait about 20minutes while others just showing up had a wait time of 1-1.5hours (yikes!)

Moving on, the restaurant is big and spacious. Staff are very friendly. It was a busy day and I was in a bit of a rush so we ordered our food and kindly asked for our check at the same time without any issues

1) Homemade corned beef hash
Very filling and appetizing! My easy over eggs were cooked perfectly with the yolk still runny inside. This dish was surprisingly not overly salty. Just sprinkled a little black pepper for taste.

2)Berry bliss pancakes
For just a $1.5 more I got their signature pancake. My fear getting this was that is was going to be really sweet. However fear not! It wasn't!! The berries were fresh and sweet like they should be. I found myself actually pouring syrup to my bottom flapjack. It's good guys, definitely a +.

3) Cinnamon roll pancakes
Oooo these were gooooood. This wasn't overwhelming sweet either. Just the right about if sugar and frosting glaze.  Did not regret this at all

4) 2 eggs any style:
Overall a great platter, nothing wowing and or special about it. Wasn't a big fan of the chicken sausages, should've went with our guy and got the sausage links.

As you can see in the pictures, the portions were huge and we were so full that our next meal was dinner! No regrets.

pics.caption: Yes we finished our meal including those left over pancakes on the side.
Berry bliss pancake- just the right amount of sweetness! It's good!
2 eggs any style with bacon and chicken sausages, cinnamon roll pancake, berry bliss pancake, homemade corned beef hash

review.des: Phenomenal pancakes. I ordered the signature berry bliss pancakes and a side of bacon. Honestly, I probably could've shared the pancakes, the portion size is pretty large. Pancakes were absolutely delicious, light, fluffy. The bacon was solid too, thick cut with good flavor, not too crispy or soggy, just right. My mom ordered the apple pecan French toast and it was okay, I would stick to pancakes. Very impressed.

Recommend joining the waitlist on Yelp. We rode the L train and walked there and only had to wait 5 minutes to be seated rather than 1.5 hours. The food here was TO DIE FOR. I got the slow roast brisket. The food was plentiful and heavy, but the food coma after was worth it! My friend got the los altos egg Benedict. That was also AMAZING. It had a little spicy kick to it. The berry bliss pancakes was a nice palate cleanser from all the savory foods. Definitely worth going to when visiting Chicago!

We knew what we were getting into when we chose this place as our breakfast spot -- they don't take reservations, it's popular, it's right by Millennium Park, so the wait was going to be terrible. I think that's true for the brunch or late lunch crowd, but when we checked in around 8 AM on Saturday, we only had to wait 30-45 minutes. Not too bad! The nice thing is that they serve Intelligentsia coffee, and there's a counter right when you get in the door where you can grab a coffee while you wait.

We were seated well before the 45 minute deadline, and the staff were incredibly friendly and nice to everyone, especially thanking everyone for waiting. When we got inside, the place was very busy and pretty loud, but we could still hear each other talk. The waitress was clearly busy, but made sure we were well taken care of.

The food is AMAZING. I ordered their seasonal special -- cinnamon pumpkin spice pancakes. These are HUGE pancakes and come with a healthy dollop of cinnamon butter. They were absolutely fantastic and I see why people rave about their pancakes. My husband ordered their Rocky Mountain crepes, and they were a perfect balance of all flavors -- nice sweetness from the crepe itself, combined with the cheese and peppers, and sour cream on top. They were excellent and I would highly recommend them. So yummy! We also ordered a side of hash browns to share. Definitely watch what you order, because everything looks delicious and I could definitely see myself going overboard on what I wanted and not being able to eat it all. Along with our food, I had a plain cup of coffee, which was good, and my husband had their pumpkin spice latte, which he enjoyed.

Overall, I highly recommend this place. Definitely plan for a wait when you get here, but if you plan in advance, it shouldn't be too difficult to find something to do in the area while you wait. If you go early enough, the wait won't even be that bad. It looks like they might be opening up a second location later this year, so I'm excited to see how that works out. Maybe it'll help out with the wait time!

Came in from out of town, and found this place on Yelp on the drive in mid morning on a Friday. Definitely recommend adding your name to the waitlist via Yelp because when we arrived there was an hour wait for other people, but we were seated immediately. I had the gluten free pancakes - sooo fluffy and delicious! My boyfriend had the eggs, sausage, hash browns (which were undercooked), and pancakes - he loved all of it except the hash browns. Extensive brunch menu and well priced - definitely recommend!

Get ready to wait for a seat because this place gets packed! Waited about an hour and a half, but it was fairly worth the wait. Servers were pleasant and attentive.

The signature crepe was good but It wasn't as good as they make it seem to be. However, they have a lot of other good options on the menu so I would try for those!

Solid breakfast experience at the exceptionally busy Wildberry. Heard one patron muttering that he was really late for is ride to O'Hare, and I'd suggest this is NOT the place to go if you're on a tight time schedule. We signed up online which was a bit clunky, but once you get to the final step you get an estimate of your seating time, which was within about 10 minutes of the estimate - not bad for a guess that was 90-100 minutes out. We lucked out and were seated on the patio on a beautiful April Saturday morning and got our order in right away. The food was delivered in about 10-15 minutes and was hot and fresh. The serving sizes are ample, and we had quite a bit to pack up with us for breakfast the next morning.

If you're going to go to a place with pancakes in the name I figured I had to try the pancakes and they didn't disappoint. They are very flaky and have a rich flavor - seemed to be maybe a really good vanilla?...at any rate, they were good. The omelette was ample and was a special that day - a Southwestern with chorizo, onions, jalapenos and cheese - very flavorful with a bit of a kick. My wife got the ham and eggs with a side of fruit, which was a bit more reasonable portion size for one sitting, but still more than enough for most.

Typical items are around $10-12 dollars, and you get your money's worth. It is very busy so either decide to hang out and wait, or better yet get on the wait list before you head over to reduce your sidewalk sitting time.

pics.caption: Southwestern omelette with potatoes and pancakes - lots of tasty food!
Ham and eggs with a fruit side
Beautiful view of the park on a warm April morning

review.des: Just go here. Seriously. The wait is worth it. Definitely use the waitlist feature and while you're waiting Millennium Park is right across the street.  My husband got the gluten free avocado toast and I got the barbacoa chilaquiles. Everything was fantastic! Food was great, service was fast and friendly. There's a reason why it has such great reviews - so check it out! Or don't. Then I can get a table faster next time I go ;)

Wildberry has quality food and friendly service at a reasonable price. It's one of my go-to places when I have visitors in from out of town.

The only downside to Wildberry is the wait. Sometimes it can get long, but luckily you're able to leave your number with them and they'll contact you when your table is ready. The wait can be as short as 30 minutes or as long as 2 hours.

Once you've been seated, the service is great. The servers are friendly and attentive. Be warned: portions are large! I would advise sharing 1 dish between 2 people. I really like getting a skillet and then upgrading the pancakes to specialty pancakes (I think it's a $1.50 additional charge). The skillets are filling and delicious; the ingredients are fresh and delicious! Also make sure to try the Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes.

Stop by if you're in the area :)

If you love breakfast food this is your place! I am always looking for places to go when I come in town and I chose Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe for brunch and definitely will be back. Great costumer service and quality breakfast food.

I can't even begin to describe how awesome the food is here.  Build your own omelet with hash browns and banana chocolate chip pancakes.  I'm  drooling just thinking about it.  The establishment was busy, but this did not affect the excellent service.  Food was quick, hot and fresh.

Are you in search of the BEST breakfast in Chicago for a big plate with hardy food? THIS is that spot. Wildberry is incredible and I would highly recommend at least getting a side of pancakes as they quite literally melt in your mouth :) Although they do not serve alcohol here, it doesn't matter because the food is THAT good! My favorite plate is the biscuits and gravy Benedict.

Very good food! I got one of the chorizo scrambled bowls and it was SO MUCH FOOD! We also shared some of the signature pancakes and they were delicious but very sweet. The turn around is very quick and great for visitors trying to get back out and sightsee.

* covers vegetarian options, service, luggage, and wait time

Vegetarian: although limited options if you're vegan (there is oatmeal and burgers), there was enough variety for vegetarians. I enjoyed the garden skillet. The skillet has hash browns on the bottom and comes with two normal pancakes, but I paid extra $2 for banana coconut pancakes. This was a great order, better than ordering a separate dish of only eggs or only pancakes. Big serving size that covered at least two of my meals.

Note: they no longer have tiramisu pancakes. The banana coconut cream ones were still great.

Service: Anais was our server and she was friendly and wonderful. She patiently waited for our order and explained the different options. When we told her we had a flight to catch, she ensured that we received our food on time. She also offered to create a separate check for each individual, which isn't something I have heard offered before.

Luggage: My group had for carry-on suitcases and the restaurant allowed us to keep them next to one of the pillars and doors.

Wait time: The wait time on Wednesday morning around 10 AM for a group of 6 was 30 minutes. The yelp app unfortunately did not allow groups of 5* to add their name on the waitlist, but I would recommend doing that for smaller parties.

pics.caption: Garden skillet with banana cream pancake

review.des: Worth the wait! Food and customer service! We ate there two days in a row while on a 4day vacation. Both days the food taste amazing and came out promptly l!

If you're in the Chicago area--this is a must! I didn't release you could reserve your table on the yelp app so we had an hour & a half to kill. Being a tourist, we killed time at the park across the street--but reserve you table as soon as you can! The wait is forever long but so worth it!

We ordered 2 entree breakfast plates with specialty pancakes. The were both incredible! As well as the strawberry lemonade. Hands down the meat strawberry lemonade & chocolate banana pancakes I've had.

Definitely recommending!

Food is very delicious here! I would recommend using Open Table to make reservations right before coming to check in or else you will be waiting at least 1-1.5hrs for a table.  

Been here twice and had great experience both times. This time I ordered the Thai chicken salad, which had so much flavor and a good ratio of all the ingredients inside with the avocado pieces, chicken , cucumber, wonton noodles, and all the other stuff. Portion was huge. Also had the fig omlette with hashbrowns and regular pancakes on the side. Omlette was fantastic. Hashbrowns were perfect. And the plain pancakes was so good. We upgraded to a specialty pancake last time, and that was great as well, but not quite necessary since the regular was just as satisfying.

Lemonade also good, but a bit sour..er... Than I'd like.

pics.caption: Napa Valley Fig Omelette. Delicious! Good amount of havarti cheese inside

review.des:
I'm sooooooo glad I got to eat here before I left Chicago. I came for a mini vacation and wanted to eat here from day one but, the wait was always long. I walked from my hotel here on my last day exploring and thank goodness the wait was only 10 minutes. I used the Yelp app to put my name down, table for one please!!! It still took about 30 minutes before I actually got seated but, since I got to put my name down on Yelp I was still walking to Wildberry.

Came checked in with the host and was seated in about 10 minutes!!! The place was crowded for a Monday morning!  Along with the food and great service I can see why this place always has a significant wait! WORTH IT!

As I sat down my server told me she would be right with me. No problem!!! I was debating between an omelette or a skillet and asked her for her opinion. She told me definitely get the skillet..

I GOT THE Butcher Block skillet and it was meaty just the way I like it! I drenched it with my usual condiment..Tabasco and pepper and my mouth was livin!!!

I love this breakfast place! Can't wait to visit Chicago again so I can eat here!!!

We had Jasmine as a our server and she was amazing. So pleasant and helpful. The food was amazing and you get tons, so you wont go away hungry ever. Our wait was 1 hr 20 min on Monday but well worth the wait. So glad we had the opportunity to try it.

Very popular breakfast spot located across from the millennium park and on the street level of the prudential building.

It was packed with those all ready to celebrate St.Patty's day. Excitement and fun was in the air!

Service was great, she was really friendly and attentive. I opted for the Florentine Benedict. Yum!!! I loved how it had cut up peices of bacon underneath the poached eggs. Hollandaise sauce was a bit thick and heavy but that's expected. Cinnamon pancakes...tasted just like a cinnamon roll. Get them if u love cinnamon rolls like I do!

The wait was severe but the staff surprisingly nice given how busy the place was when I visited. The pancakes are great and portions huge. You'll have built an appetite by the time you get seated. The mocha drinks are delicious - I had the mint mocha and wasn't disappointed. Go on a nice day and sit outside.

This was literally the best breakfast place that I have ever been to! I'm not even being biased because I'm from LA! The cinnamon pancakes were to die for! I couldn't finish it so I had to take it to go but that it's self was satisfying. If you're planning on ordering more than that you're probably not gonna finish it. But of course it was my trip to Chicago and I wanted to try a lot. As you can see from the pictures our table was  full and it was only three people!  ya.... lol we couldn't finish that.

The location of this place is great because you have "The Bean" right across from you and huge corporate buildings to look at while you wait. (Super pretty during the winter when it snows!)  

The wait for this place was horrible though. Obviously it's a popular spot so you're going to wait for a long time so try calling ahead of time.

Employees are friendly, but I honestly didn't pay much attention since we were so hungry we just ate and left lol.

Bathrooms-yes women & men, not gender neutral

pics.caption: Yum!!!! The best breakfast I've ever had!

review.des: This place has one of the best pancakes Ive had. Their berry bliss pancakes are really really good. Their white chocolate mocha coffee is also really tasty and they have good omelettes! Definitely recommend eating here and trying their delicious pancakes!

I've on more than one attempt tried to eat at Wildberry for brunch but have always been discouraged by the long wait. I was super excited to see they used No Wait especially when I saw the crowd of people standing in the rain.

The breakfast burrito was awesome but the highlight was the berry pancake. The pancake itself was the perfect consistency and the toppings accentuate versus hide the flavor and texture.

pics.caption: Breakfast burrito with extra crispy hash browns.
Their signature Berry Pancake is worth the trip alone.

review.des: We arrived around 10am and were immediately seated.  The waitress was nice and knowledgeable of the menu.  The Florence Benedict was great,  but the hashbrowns were very bland.  The strawberry lemon poppy seed pancakes are also really good,  very strong lemon flavor.  The waitress constantly checked on us and returned quickly with any added requests.

This place was cool but definitely not worth the wait. I'd give it a 3.5. I wanted to try it bc so many rave about it but I had to wait almost 2 hours for a table (of course I toured Millennium Park during the wait). After being seated, I had good service. The portion sizes were very large but the food was average. My omelette was actually the worst part of my meal. The pancakes were tasty and hash browns were hash browns. Glad I tried this place but I'm sure i could find better with a shorter wait.

Great service but long wait even by using yelp's waitlist feature. I entered the waitlist at 8:30 am on Sunday and was told it would by between 60-72 minutes but it actually took 90 minutes before we were sat. Since they notify you via text we were able to go to the park across the street and look at the bean. They do sit you outside even on cold days so be prepared! Luckily we got an inside table and our waitress was great. They were slow preparing our hot chocolate and turtle mocha, so she talked the barista into finishing them up. We both ordered omelettes with sides of fruit and pancakes. The food was good and the service was quick. The bathrooms were clean too. I would recommend this if you don't mind the wait.

Breakfast taken to another level!  Wildberry is located in a perfect spot right next to Millennium Park so you can walk around when you wait.  You will be waiting because this place is always busy and for good reason, they make really good food.  Obviously, go there for the pancakes.  The pancakes I recommend are the OREO S'mores Pancakes.  These pancakes were light, fluffy, then you get hit with the marshmallow flavor, then the crunch from the OREO, and then the chocolate hits you on the back end.  This was OUT OF BOUNDS good.  The second thing I recommend Chocolate Banana Bread French Toast.  This French toast is packed with flavor.  You get a huge hit of the banana flavor mixed with the chocolate which pairs nicely.  When you look at this dish you are kinda bummed there is not more, but these french toast slices are super dense and they will fill you up.  Now, if you are starving and you want a hearty meal go for the Butcher Block Skillet.  The Butcher Block has hashbrowns, cheddar and jack cheese, 2 eggs, ham, sausage, turkey and chicken sausage, and topped off with bacon.  A meat lovers wet dream.  Haha.  This is definitely a must eat in Chicago and i can see why this is the number 1 breakfast place in Chi Town.

BrandonFitFoodie

This is a great brunch place to take friends and family visiting he downtown Chicago area. Pancakes are fantastic, and everything I have had has been wonderful. Great lunch options as well!

The portions are enormous- can usually get two meals out of each. A little pricy, but worth it.

This was a great restaurant. It's much bigger than it looked. The wait time was an hour and a half for a group of five but it was next to the millennium park so it was nice to be able to walk around and then come back. The waffle was slightly dry but the pancakes were amazing, we got the signature Wildberry pancake and bananas one and both were delicious. I got the corned beef hash meal with the eggs Benedict and it was so great. Miami doesn't have places that are as good as this place!

This place is everything that the reviews say it is. The food is to die for. You don't find many places that just blow your mind with their food - but this one does. We all took pictures with our food and then showed them to many people. Don't let the lines or wait scare you away. The staff are amazing and clear the tables quickly. Can't wait to go back again!!

Service: 10/10 Everyone is so smile-y and kind here! My server was the sweetest and gave us excellent suggestions depending on what I told him I was craving.

Food: I had the two-egg combo which came with eggs the way I wanted it cooked with chicken sausages. I wasn't a fan of the sausages, but eggs were great. Waffles were even greater. I think I can say that these were the best waffles I've ever had.

My friend had the mexicanas and their specialty pancakes, which was just as amazing.

Wish I could find an affordable and amazing breakfast place back in LA like this place!!!

If I could eat here for breakfast every day, I would. Not sure what they put in that wild berry bliss sauce but combined with the French toast it is perfection. If you can get past the long wait times (enter the nowait app) then there really is nothing to complain about. If I have any advice it is to not waste your time with the savory dishes. Sweet is what this place does best. If you get eggs be sure to upgrade the pancakes on the side for one of their sweet specialties.
Delicious! Huge omelette and my husband LOVED his burger! Super sweet server. Looking forward to coming back. Get the veggie omelet and add cheese! YUM

Try to get in as early as possible. They get busy fast!!!

It's not five stars because this place was the first time I've tried eggs Benedict and I got the Mexican one (I forgot the name) and I normally just make eggs Benedict at home. Anyways, the point is that it made me feel a bit sick afterwards, just nausea. It was probably way too heavy for me.

But the pancakes are really good and staff is super friendly.

pics.caption: Los Altos Benedict. Too heavy for me.

review.des:
3.5 stars, rounding up for good service. This is a very good brunch option IF you use the no-wait app to put your name in a couple hours in advance (and then show up when you're about 30 minutes from getting a table). The food is mostly quite good, but it's not worth spending hours waiting outside. I went with a large group and the quality of food was variable. Simpler Pancakes clearly reign supreme here, and you should likely stick to those or the egg fare. Here's the entree breakdown:

Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes: best thing we ordered, hands down. Cakes were light and fluffy, sauces were thoughtful and blended well together.

Chocolate Banana Bread French Toast: this was also pretty good, and will hit the spot if that's what you're craving. However, I've seen it done equally well in other places (i.e., Yolk) with shorter waits. There's nothing exceptional about this version.

Chicken and waffles: this is where the disappointment started. The chicken is a standard issue kids' chicken tender - no flavor or effort at all. The waffle was fine, but the bacon and jalapeño were very unevenly distributed. The bites with them were pretty good, but the other bites were bland on bland.

Oreo pancakes: these were a disaster. I have the world's biggest sweet tooth, and there was so much sticky and crumbly going on here that I found it hard to chew. How they managed to go that far afield with what I know is a great base pancake, I do not know.

The hash browns and sausage we tried were fine but unexciting - no particular seasoning, just cooked properly for those that want it.

Overall, a good experience. Service was fast once we were inside, and the pancakes really were very good. Worth going if you can time your no wait app properly, not worth it without the wait-cutting app.

pics.caption: Chicken and waffles - not very good.

review.des:
long lines, a yelp waiting cue? I gave this place a shot, I really wanted to like it but i did not understand why it was so popular.  this is traditional american breakfast.  i got the eggs benedict with spinach.

Overall the food was ok but the presentation was sloppy, maybe due to the madness of people spewing in that sent shockwaves of orders from the front of the restaurant all the way tot he back. The bread for the eggs benedict was actually stale.

I probably wont come back unless someone can convince me otherwise but there have got to be more options in the area.

Ok. Everyone says this is the place....well it is.  After being at Eggys yesterday and watching the very inept staff struggle with seating people timely while tables sat empty.  It was a sincere pleasure to watch this well oiled machine operate.  A clear reflection of good leadership.  We were seated as promptly as possible,  order was taken promptly, food came out quickly and it was delicious!!!!!  We tried a selection of items and everything was outstanding.  Our waiter Mag did a great job.  This is a must in Chicago!!!!  Thank you.

My wife, 10-ten-year-old granddaughter and I spent three days in Chicago celebrating our granddaughter's birthday this past weekend.  We stayed at the Ritz Carlton on Pearson St. and ate breakfast two mornings at the Wildberry next door to the hotel.  The prices are reasonable, the service is good and the food is nicely prepared and tasty.  If you are staying at a hotel near Michigan Ave. and don't want to spend $$$ for breakfast, Wildberry is the place to go!  By the way, our granddaughter says their chocolate chip pancakes are the best she has ever had!

I never believed in love at first sight but I do believe in love at first bite after my exprience here. lol I saw the reviews and pictures and made it my duty to check this place whenever I was in Chicago. Of course it had to snow to make it a challenge but I was determined lol. I will make my review quick since mostly everyone has touched on every topic regarding this place. Just AMAZING PERFECT FLAWLESS food! PERIOD END OF STORY !!!! LOL

The portions first of all are humungous, taste wonderful and customer service is perfect. I felt right at home from the warm friendly helpful staff. The pancakes were absolutely brilliant as far as execution in preperation, and the Omelette just WOW.

I see a lot of complaints about long waits. My tip from experience and what the waiter told me was to go before 9am and there is usually never a wait then at all. If you can't do that then he said to make a reservation through Yelp etc.. to avoid waiting.

My conclusion is it exceeded my expectations by far and that says a lot because I had big expectations based on the pics and what I read. It's to the point I don't even want ro tey another breakfast place in Chicago lol. I wish I could put this restaurant in my suitcase and take it back home with me seriously.

pics.caption: Close up look inside the Omelette #OmelettePorn
I cannot put in words how good these pancakes were seriously
Turkey Sausage Cheddar cheese and American Cheese Omelette #LifeChanging lol

review.des: Amazing! Best meal I have had in Chicago. There were two of us and we got the butcher block skillet with berry bliss pancakes and a side order of toast. Plenty for us to split and we are not little eaters! All of it was great and had great service. We got there before 8am and only had about a 5 minute wait but as we were leaving around 9am the wait was already an hour. So, I suggest waking up early for this one. You won't regret it.

It's early in the morning and the restaurant opened the door a few minutes ago and here you go - several people waiting on a line.
The pancakes with strawberries are well worth the wait. Wait times are a little on the longer side but that's expected for an upscale place like this. The staff is always on the run but seemed to be well trained because they are usually very friendly and responsive.
The cashier made a simple mistake in my order. However, the area manager responded quickly and removed it from the check.
I am just happy with my customer experience here. The location is the absolutely great. Not cheap place, the prices are even expensive. A decent breakfast cost about $15 - $20.
If you are a breakfast person you can't miss this place. BEST menu. Just make sure to get on the yelp waitlist!!

pics.caption: Super sweet pancakes! Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes

review.des:
Yes there is a wait, yes it was a long time, but there is definitely a good reason. My wife decided to wait it out and eat here. Put your wait in on Yelp and skip the line. We did that, still had a small wait but the food more than made up for that time.

The best bang for your buck is absolutely the skillet pancake combo. I got the butcher block and the cinnamon roll pancakes. I should get an award for being able to consume all that food. It was absolutely perfect and everything was amazing. This is a must stop place for anyone in the area. I know that my wife and I will wait it out every time.

Also the skillet doesn't come out looking all scattered normally. I went to town before I posted hah!!!
I don't really like pancakes.  I ordered the signature berry bliss pancakes and now I can say I like pancakes.

I love love breaskfast here. The pancakes and omelettes are delicious. My only complaint is the service. Our server was a little arrogant. The wait times are crazy and for the over one hour wait times the staff should at least treat guests politely.
Long wait, but very much worth it. My Denver skillet was filling, pretty, and tasted great - and not expensive at all. As a tourist, I would definitely repeat this place during a trip.

I had the wildberry crepes, which is their signature dish, which was really yummy.  My waitress was really kind and pleasant to interact with.  The only downside: when seated the check w/payment (I didn't open it up so I don't how it was paid - cash or cc), so when I picked it up to give to the employee that seated my parents and I, she refused to take it and said the waitress will take it (in a snotty attitude) and walked off back to the front of the establishment.  Little off putting way to start my first experience here.

Yelp Challenge: #50/100.

This place is good, but not outrageously amazing as the reviews would have you believe.  Solid pancakes, the berries are fresh and the service is good.

We had the brisket hash too and ...the hash browns were barely golden and mostly white and crunchy (as in raw crunchy) and one or two bites of all of it was really enough.  I could tell it was probably good but it wasn't more-ish and I actually didn't want to eat more than a bite or two...and I was hungry.  

The Wildberry pancakes were, like I said, good ... but not outstanding, and while the service was great (hello, it was St Patrick's day and they had people sitting around in the office building lobby in a pen waiting for tables) I didn't love the food.

Tip: If it's cold outside and you put your name in, and stand outside, the two and a half hour wait will be "want a table outside right now?" from the outdoor host within about 10 minutes. It was 35 but not windy and our food came out like 3 minutes after we ordered ... definitely a bonus !!  They were good with the coffee refills and it was a handy place to eat while traipsing toward Millennium park but definitely not a place I'd stand in a line for.

Delicious pancakes! Great service!  Joined the waitlist via yelp's app feature and it saved us a good 20 min wait time. Our waitress checked in on us numerous times, refilled our coffee and never made us feel rushed to leave, even though the place was packed during lunchtime on a weekday. Will be back next time I'm in the city.

Stopped by Monday morning before 10am and it was packed! I was told the wait would be 20-30 minutes and it was actually less than that. And I think it's because the staff is so efficient and they had plenty of servers and bus boys working the floor.

As for the location it's right across from millennium park so I was expecting a tourist trap but the breakfast was delicious and reasonably priced! The potions are big and can definitely but shared.

We ordered the strawberry poppy seed pancakes, the corn beef hash, and steel cut oatmeal. I typically order coffee for breakfast but opted for the grapefruit juice since it was fresh squeezed. I've been to many brunch restaurants and it's hard to find fresh squeezed juice on the menu that isn't just orange juice.

The corn beef hash was delicious and I love that I could opt for fruit instead of a starch and if you pay an extra $2 you can add a signature pancakes to your dish. I went w our waitress recommendation and got the berry bliss. So best of both world of sweet and savory. I'm not a big pancake fan but I devoured those pancakes. The sauce on the pancakes was nice looking but gave me the impression it would be cloyingly sweet but it wasn't and the fresh fruit on top was very fresh.    

I only had a bite of my hubby's poppyseed pancakes and it was tasty. My husband who loves pancakes said he enjoyed it but he had better pancakes.

Overall I am in love with this location, the great service, and my meal. As a person that is usually only ok w breakfast food, there is enough variety and quality in the food that would bring me back here.

Get in line before you arrive using the Yelp feature!

I would give this place 5 stars for its service, but the food was not so special. I had the eggs Benedict and their berry signature pancakes. It was good but not amazing. I do like that they have a large variety of espresso drinks, and again the service is on point!

Everything about this place is 5 stars! The location, the hosters, the waiters, the food...!
This is my 2nd time here.
1st time I had a Chopped Salad and it was super delicious, flavorful, big portion. Also had a Strawberry Cheesecake French Toast which was good but not extraordinary.
2nd time I had Classic Eggs Benedict and by far was the best one I EVER had! That thick juicy slice of ham omg unbeatable! Had also Chocolate Banana Bread French Toast for dessert and those are to die for!
Cant wait to come back specially now that is getting warm in Chicago and we can get a table outside!
There is only 1 downside about this place (and it is because it is TOO good): the waiting time ~1h - but it is worth it!!
Good food but always so very very crowded. Unfortunately, I avoid going there because of the crowd.

This place is definitely worth the wait, but be sure to check in online via yelp to skip the line! We checked in at 9am and we're seated shortly after we arrived at about 10:30am. The normal wait time when we arrived was two hours!

Even with the wait, the food was incredible and portion sizes were quite large. I ended up taking part of my meal with me. The staff was all very friendly and attentive. We will definitely be back again!

Great breakfast spot close to Millennium park. Garden skillet was delicious. Enough for 2 people. Fresh veggies...topped with hash browns, cheese and eggs.  Veggies seemed very fresh.

Pancakes were fluffy and thick.  Nothing overly special but were good.

Service was very fast and friendly. Bussers were bussing our table before we were getting up....a bit too much for me.

Fills up very quickly and entrance/waiting area is very small. We got there at 7:45 and waited about 10 minutes. They definitely turn tables quickly.

Needed a nice warm breakfast spot that was close to our hotel as well as Millennium park on this very cold and windy morning, so I whipped out my trusty Yelp app and started doing my research. It was not long before the perfect place presented itself in the form of Wildberry Pancakes and cafe. We were immediately seated though the place was packed with many very happy looking patrons. We were offered a much appreciated hot cup of coffee even before we could take off our winter coats. Orders were quickly placed (we are breakfast Veterans) shortly after, our food started hitting the table much to our joy. I got the corned beef hash skillet with a side of their signature pancakes. My skillet was huge, eggs were cooked perfectly and my side of pancakes were absolutely delicious. Overall everyone at the table enjoyed their choices, prices were good and the service was excellent, one for my books next time I visit Chicago, Aloha

Worth the wait. Walked in early in the morning after getting off my flight from MSP, and it was already packed with people, could barely squeeze in through the door to the counter to request a table. Waited for around 15-20 mins while my group of 4 took in the atmosphere and watched other guests indulging in their breakfast. Finally got seated by a friendly waitress and food came out quite promptly. Serving size is large, could have definitely finished my Butcher's block skillet if I was starving. Really good pancakes, nice and fluffy. Would recommend everyone to come check this place out!!

Absolutely the Best breakfast I have had in a very long time! It was a little discouraging with how crowded and busy they were but we got
Seated in a timely manner and our server was very attentive. The food was delicious and the establishment clean. All employees see to be very well trained with proper people skills from Thank yous to opening doors, except for a few bussers that do not speak English.
Great service, and willingness to adjust menu items for dietary restrictions. A must visit!

You definitely need to add your name to the waitlist before even arriving.  The wait for this place is ridiculous and when we came it was over two and a half hours. Thanks to Yelp I was able to add my name to the list and when we arrive we only waited 30 minutes. We sat outside which was great but not so great when there are bees everywhere. I had to order the buttermilk pancakes and they were fantastic. I also ordered the eggs anyway in the eggs were fantastic. This location is great for pancakes and waffles. Definitely try it out if you're able to.

Holy moly this place blew my socks off. What a fresh, delicious breakfast! Two of us in our party ordered the Chilaquiles Barbacoa. If I had to describe them, I'd call them breakfast nachos. They were pretty spicy, but ridiculously flavorful. I could eat that dish every morning. We also ordered the Signature Berry Bliss pancakes and some delicious egg dishes. Everything was absolutely top-notch. It was so good, in fact, that we had Postmates deliver it to our apartment the very next morning, which seemed more efficient than the 40-minute wait to get into the restaurant. Great job, Wildberry, I can't wait to come back.

The wait was extremely long but worth it. Food was excellent and it exceeded my girlfriend and I expectations. I ordered the chocolate chip pancakes and I recommend it to anyone that's visiting. Overall, if you want to wait for good food, then this is the place. If you want to beat the wait, then I recommend joining the waitlist through yelp.

YUMMM

I got the cinnamon roll pancakes, and they were ok. However, the whole meal was hearty and great for the value. It was about $12 for the pancakes, hash browns, an upgrade to an omelette. I got the fig and cheese omelette. It was interesting to try, but I probably wouldn't order it again. Also, I went right when it opened, when there was no line.

Amazing food and coffee. Service tries their best. Don't go on the weekend during peek hours if you want to avoid long waits. Their menu is typical brunch style with good pancake medleys, French toast, skillets, and omelets.

Dishes I typically order:

Butcher block skillet, sweet potato fries, berry bliss pancakes.

Arrived around 8:30 on a Saturday and the wait was about 20-30 min. But once it hit 9, the wait was 1 1/2 hour! So definitely make use of the no wait app if you plan to come a little later. The staff works efficiently and they're super nice! Came straight from the airport with my luggage still and the staff kept it in a safe place for us. The food came extremely fast considering the large amount of people here.

We ordered the signature berry bliss pancake and butchers block skillet. The pancakes are a must for first-timers. They very generous with the amount of fruits they give and the stack of pancakes is more than enough.. As for the butchers block skillet, it was so good!! Bunch of protein and everything was cooked to perfection!

Definitely would come back here again! Food, service, location was all 5 stars! :3

Absolutely worth the wait! Huge portions and great prices. This place is busy but service is great. I got an egg white omelet and hubby ordered the Eggs  Benedict..the spicy one which was Habanero (I think). Go and put your name in and they text when your almost ready. In the mean time you can walk around the park or if it's cold wait in the Prudential building lobby, because it's huge.

pics.caption: Habanero (I think) Egg Benedict. Spicy but excellent!
Egg white omelet made to order with broccoli, spinach and onions.

review.des: Came here for breakfast today because we were checking out the bean. This is a solid breakfast/brunch spot. You can't go wrong with anything you order here. Definitely come to yelp and waitlist yourself before leaving the house. I got the southern eggs Benedict and the gravy was very hearty, my friend got the los alto and that was a little too spicy for me, the pancakes were really good and crispy! I am glad I ordered it plain because I don't like overly sweet food, but if you come here definitely try their pancakes! Service was great everyone was really friendly and the bathrooms were clean.

I had a good experience here. The wait was to be expected for a breakfast/brunch restaurant on a Sunday morning. I had scrambled eggs, bacon, buttermilk pancakes, and hash browns. I loved everything. The bacon wasn't as crispy as I personally like my bacon, but that's not a big deal. The turret sausage patties were amazing. All in all, it was a nice experience. We dined on the patio outside and had a nice view of the city. Our waiter was nice and helpful. I will be back.

Wow!!!! AWESOME breakfast!!! Definitely a must do when in Chicago. Wait is a bit long but worth worth the wait.  Go next door to Tavern for a mimosa while you wait.  Wildberry will text you 5 minutes before your table is ready.

Our experience at Wildberry was unpleasant. First the server told us they have no vegan option besides oatmeal. It is unacceptable that a place that servers people from all over world have made no efforts to include vegan costumers. My husband who's not vegan had waffles and I had the oatmeal. Waffle was good while the oat meal was tasteless. Right after we paid before we left the table while we still had our belongings there, people already started cleaning up the table, took our drinks away before we had finished them and started setting it for the next costumers.  It is definitely a overpriced and overhyped place to which we won't came back.

My favorite breakfast spot in Chicago!! Food is great. I highly recommended a "Skillet" there are multiple choices. The portion sizes for the skillet plates are pretty big so I recommended sharing. Download the "no wait" app in order to get a reservation. Wait times a very long but well worth it.

Waits too long. If it's more than an hour it's not worth it. You can use nowait app.

Food is good but it's crowded.

Omg this place is awesome for breakfast and brunch!! Food was so good, fresh, and delicious!! I see why there was a 1.5 hour wait to eat, nothing but goodness inside!! Thanks to the yelp app I was able to join the waitlist and show up right on time!! The service and staff was awesome even as busy as they were!  I recommend his place!!
Had their garden skillet. Very good. Very large and filling! Also had their Wildberry orange juice delicious!
Fantastic breakfast spot. Huge portions, absolutely delicious. Plan on a wait, but they turn tables quickly. We enjoyed the Mexicana skillet and special Wildberry pancakes.
Amazing worth the wait. The people are so nice, they rush you but thats ok they have people waiting all the time
I'll write more later- but this is a great stop. Use the Yelp app and get on the wait list before you arrive.

Wait time was okay, not as long as I expected. Food was great! We got the Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes and Florence Benedict. It was a lot of food and price was decent. Waiter was kind of slow in coming by to take our order and I didn't see him again until he gave us our check.

Thursday 10am: reserve on yelp ahead of time to hold your spot in line. Seated almost right away

Mexicana sizzlin' skillet: 4.5/5
Comes with side of pancakes or toast (get the pancakes!)
Perfect if you're looking for something with a kick. Hot sauce is provided but the chorizo is a great natural spice. Portion is substantial even without the pancakes on the side.

Corned beef Benny: 4/5
Comes with side of toast or pancakes as well (not shown on menu). The hollandaise sauce is AMAZING! Could use some sides to make the plate look less empty but portion is still good. The English muffin was a bit too toasted making it hard to cut through.

Signature berry bliss pancakes: 5/5
Some of the fluffiest, best tasting pancakes I've had (I've had a lot). The fruits and the drizzle completes it, and the berries INSIDE the pancake is the icing on the cake. Highly recommended! No syrup needed.

Oreo s'more pancakes: 3.5/5
Equally as fluffy as the signature berry bliss pancakes, but the amount of chocolate and sweetness on this is overwhelming. If you think you have a sweet tooth, you won't anymore after this dish. There is Oreo and chocolate over and inside the pancakes. Complete with melted marshmallow on top. Needless to say, no additional syrup needed as well.

Had a bit of a wait but it was soooooo worth it & we enjoyed every single bite!  The servings are enormous so if you're against food waste maybe try a different place.  Would absolutely recommend this wonderful eatery!

I wouldn't say I'm well-traveled but I've been to a lot of the major cities around America. My friend and I (two Southern California girls) came here for breakfast. We got here pretty early and it was already pretty crowded. We gave our name and number and they told us they would text us when our table was ready. The wait was about 20 minutes.

This was hands down the best breakfast I've ever had. I had the espanola omelet with pancakes and hash browns. My friend got the berry pancakes, a side of fruit, and a side of bacon. EVERYTHING was delicious. The orange juice tasted fresh. The omelet was so filling. I was full but I couldn't not finish it because it was that good. It would be a sin to leave any leftovers!

All of the servers were extremely nice. The place is pretty big and it's loud inside. By the time we were finished, there was a crowd outside waiting for a table. So beware of long waits! (But it's worth it) Next time we come back to Chicago, we will definitely be coming back here.

Honestly, this is just a solid breakfast joint. They don't have anything that makes it mindblowing or unique, but I've never had a bad meal here. Whether you go with an omelette, corned beef hash, pancakes, or avocado toast - you won't be disappointed. You can make reservations which is smart during the busy hours, but it's a large space so the waiting time is usually bearable. If you want some breakfast but you can't be bothered to take a gamble on a new cafe, just head here and you'll leave a happy (and full) camper.

A great option for brunch.  Make sure you get on the YELP Waitlist or you will be waiting for hours!  This location is around the millennium park area so there is plenty to do as you wait around for your epic meal.  The place can get very very crowded and busy but that is for a reason... The Food is delicious!  They have so many options to choose from when there and of course, they are known for their pancakes. I personally got a scramble/skillet which was pretty bombDOTcom.  Service was great and my coffee and drink were always tended to. Highly recommended.
Service is good, wait was very long but we knew that. Wait was not worth it. Waffle was mushy on inside. Very heavy and not light and crispy the way I like them.

I had a 13hr layover in Chicago and went here for breakfast before my flight to Canada in the next 4hrs.
My friend reserved us a table through an app where you are placed in a virtual waiting line.
Once we arrived, our table was ready (no wait).
Our waiter was John (I think), and his dreads were nice, but his personality was big. He was a delight.
He recommended a southern girl, like myself, would love the biscuit and gravy.
Honestly, the gravy was better than the biscuit, I must say. I'm used to the soft middle with flaky edges. Mine was crunchy all around. I enjoyed my cheesy scrambled eggs and bacon, just wish the biscuit were better.
My other friend had a crepe and I would love to have that on my next visit.

pics.caption: My biscuit and gravy breakfast delight

review.des: THIS PLACE. I LOVE! My boyfriend and I kept raving about this place prior to our trip to Chicago. From reading reviews, skimming thru people's pictures of their food... we finally got to try this place out. Totally worth the wait. We ordered the Mexicana Skillet, Chilaquiles Barbacoa, Cinnamon French Toast and Cinnamon Roll Pancakes. Portions I believe are made for sharing, buttttt we decided to get our own dishes. :)

Now THIS is the ultimate breakfast experience in Chicago!  This place has quite a reputation and therefore, a long wait, so as a tip - join the wait-list ahead of time online before you show up; it'll greatly reduce your wait time.

If you're overwhelmed by decisions, this may not be the place for you!  Their menu is extensive but there's something for everyone.  I wish we were in Chicago for longer... I would have returned each morning to try something different here.

I ended up ordering the chocolate banana bread french toast.  My husband  ordered the caramel apple pecan french toast.  We then ordered some scrambled eggs and sausage for sides... which... were absolute overkill given the portions of these delicious plates.  I hate to be wasteful but we had no choice!  So... much... food...

We also ordered lattes - my husband a plain, and myself the vanilla berry latte.  Yum!  We ended up taking those with us since we had such difficulty finishing everything by the time we were done.

Bring your appetites!  Maybe eat an earlier dinner the night before, lol!

The only negative is the wait, but when a restaurant is this great a wait is inevitable. A great way to avoid the wait is to plan ahead and use the no wait app or yelp and put your name on the list before you get there. I really appreciate restaurants that allow customers to do this because you don't have to spend your day wasted waiting in line for a table and still get to enjoy your morning.

You really cannot go wrong in what you eat here. A must is their Signature Berry Bliss PANCAKES! So delicious and does not need any syrup. All the skillets are fabulous as well and I found unique to this restaurant and they also come with a side of pancakes. Anytime they have a special menu I recommend trying what's on their. This trip they had chocolate banana bread French toast and it did not disappoint.

Their restaurant is clean and service is quick so if you did wait a while for a table your food should be out quick. If you are waiting for a table make sure your entire party is with you when they call your name. They won't seat you until the whole party is present. I am looking forward to returning again!

pics.caption: Chocolate Banana Bread French Toast (a special for this month so get it when you can!)

review.des: Seated in the outdoor section upon request. Water was immediately brought to my table. Waiter was very friendly and clarified some menu items for me. I ordered the butcher block skillet and blueberry pancakes. The food was brought out quickly. It was good. Not great but good. The overall service was excellent. Not a bad spot for a quick breakfast.

I'm a little late on this review - I meant to write this earlier!

Wildberry was my first taste of Chicagoan food. I was starving and trying to escape the freezing cold on my first day in the city last month, and they were the closest place within walking distance of Millennium Park that was open. Yes, I'm a tourist who had to take a picture with "the bean" at the crack of dawn. It did make for a great photo!

I quickly poured over the menu to find anything that would warm me up. Granted it was breakfast, so it's all hot. I usually crave something savory and sweet for breakfast, so I got their Napa Valley omelet with a side of pancakes. What drew me to choose the Napa was the figs. I'm not a huge fan of figs, but I thought it would be an interesting component. I did like the sweetness with the saltiness and cheesiness of the omelet, but unfortunately it was dried versus fresh. The dried texture made it a bit too chewy as it wasn't rehydrated - versus if it was fresh, it would've had a soft bite to it. The pancakes were good - soft and fluffy - and it was the perfect balance to my eggs and hashbrown.

I later found out that they are famous for their wild berry pancakes - hence the moniker - so I guess I have something to look forward to on my next visit.

Service was great along with good size portions. I ordered the Mexicana skillet and quickly realized my wife and I should've split it. The wait didn't bother us at all since we put our name down through yelp and we received a text from them to let us know we were in their waiting list and then we received another one to check in with the server for our table.

One of our all time faves for upscale diner/breakfast/brunch fare.  Love the omelet's, pancakes, and hashbrowns.  Tasty food and large portions perfect for sharing.  Extra bonus is the coffee bar onsite.

This is definitely a tourist trap, but we went for it anyways. And honestly, we're not complaining. The wait looked horrendous, but they quoted 15 minutes. We went to get some coffee from Intelligentsia and they texted us about 10 minutes later (forcing us to rush back). However, when we actually got there, it was still an extra 5 minutes as they were setting up the table. I assume they do this to avoid late/no shows.

The restaurant was packed, but we were seated comfortably at a 4-person table so we had plenty of room. I ordered the garden skillet ($12) with a side of fresh glazed strawberry pancakes. The skillets are served with toast or pancakes, and you can substitute for sub-specialty pancakes for $1.50 extra.

My garden skillet had hash browns, cheddar and jack cheese, eggs, mushrooms, asparagus, spinach, onion, tomatoes, and broccoli. It was a very hearty and wholesome breakfast. I loved all the veggies, and I'm really glad I opted for the garden skillet over one of the more protein-centric ones. The pancakes were good too although nothing out of this world. I'm just a sucker for fresh strawberries on anything.

All in all, not a bad breakfast at all even if it is filled wall-to-wall with tourists (including myself!). I know there are definitely better places to get breakfast but for the price, quality, and proximity to our hotel, this was a reasonable choice for us.

Seriously good breakfast! Well worth the 2+ hour wait. Make sure to use the No Wait App to hold your place in line. We had the chicken and waffles, the omelets and the cinnamon roll pancakes. All of it was delicious.

I'm not a huge breakfast person but while I was in Chicago, I decided to look for a good place to have breakfast and this place had soooo many great reviews so I took a change. The place was packed but we got a table instantly without a wait and our service was awesome! The food portions were huge and extremely delicious and fresh. Recommended this to my nephew who visited a few days after I did and he took his Gf here and they loved it!!! Definitely recommend!

The "Berry bliss" French toast is my favorite thing in the menu so far! It's 2 large pieces of french toast with some kind of berry cream cheese in between the toast, with berries on the side, and its not too sweet. I go to Wildberry everytime I visit Chicago and even though they're always super busy,  the food NEVER lacks because of it.

Absolutely love this place! We have never been disappointed! Every employee is happy, friendly and they all work together well! You can't go wrong with anything you order but the blueberry danish crepes are to die for...My favorite breakfast is the veggie omelet! I wish I could bring this place home.

Have you ever seen the Polar Express? Ya know that scene in the train car when the waiters weave in and out and serve everyone super fast? Well that's what I saw here. The staff were genuinely nice, local, and efficient. They worked in tandem and swiftly maneuvered around each other clearing moving and setting tables, talking, taking orders and serving. It was very cool.

Then there was the food. The coffee was good, the food was delicious. We orders two skillets paid the buck fifty and ordered specialty pancakes. Dont miss out. They were divine. I wouldn't even call them pancakes. They are more like fluffy pastry. Creamy warm toppings with fresh fruit. Incredible. Thank heavens I don't live in Chicago or I'd be here everyday. Special thanks to my amazing waiter. It was a perfect start to a busy tourist day.

Oh yeah go early, it's worth the wait. If you have 20 min or wait head over and "visit the bean" they will text you when your table is ready.

This place was amazing.  I was on my way to Nashville, so we stopped for a few days and this place was one of the best places we stopped and ate.  Good service, long lines, you have to call and reserve so that you don't wait so long.  Try the pancakes.  All of em.
The family and I went to to wildbeery cafe for breakfast and I must say I really enjoyed everything that I had. The wait was bit long but the food is so good that it's worth the wait

I don't live in Chicago, this is my second time here. First time around I tried to eat here, but the wait was 2 hours.... I'm so happy they now allow you to add yourself to the wait list ahead of time with yelp. Thumbs up!! - added myself while I was getting ready. Waited 5 minutes outside. Really though, the wait is long for a reason. I must say the word to simply describe this entire restaurant, from food to service is INCREDIBLE!

We were helped by Alex, who was so nice and polite. Perfect example of how a server should be. I was blown away by her level of attentiveness.

I had the Garden Skillet with the Berry Signature Pancakes. Both were so rich in flavor. Nonetheless I devoured both plates. Left here rolling!

If you're looking for yummy breakfast food, this is the spot! To level up your experience request Alex to help you.
Food was great and the service was fast. Would definitely come back when I visit Chicago again.

When in Chicago...Wildberry!  Yes, there will be a crazy long line, yes it will seem like forever before you get a table...yes, it will be worth it. :)  One tip, check on the NoWait app.  When we checked in at 9 am, there were 142 parties ahead of us.  Yes, 142.  That did not keep us from enjoying the deliciousness that is Wildberry.

By the time we got dressed, walked around downtown Chicago on our way to Wildberry and arrived at the restaurant, it was our turn.  Cheers to NoWait!!  I ordered the Espanola Omelette and it was delicious and HUGE!  If you are just a little brunchy, share one of these with someone.  The wheat toast was fresh and perfectly toasted and the coffee was delish!!  I ordered the flavored coffee of the day and it was Hazelnut.  You could smell its deliciousness before it even arrived at the table.  This is a must order.  

Remember it will be crowded, however the service was quick and with a smile.  Make sure you come here!

Came here on a Saturday morning and I can definitely say I'm very impressed with this place!

First of all, I love their wait list system that they use through Yelp! Though the wait was around 2 hours, we just added ourselves to the list and we were able to stay at our hotel (about a 7 minute walk from this place) until we wanted to go eat. Once we checked in, we just had to wait another 5-10 minutes before we were seated! And in terms of service, it was VERY quick and all of the food was hot.

Two start off, we got a coffee and a hazelnut latte. I feel like the hazelnut latte was a little watered down - it wasn't as creamy as I'm used to but it was still pretty good.

We ordered the Mexicana skillet with the chorizo on the side so my friend could eat it (I'm a vegetarian), the butcher block, and we upgraded our pancake option to signature berry bliss and the Oreo s'more.

The mexicana skillet was amazing - the jalapeños weren't too spicy and the cheese was melted perfectly in between the eggs and the hash browns. The hash browns were crispy on the outside which I love. My friend loved his butcher block - they had VERY generous amounts of meat and he said all the meats were great and so was the chorizo.

The Oreo s'more pancake was a little too sweet for me but it was a great dessert option! The berry bliss pancakes were perfect and the fresh berries went well with them. I'm glad we opted for the side option of these because we would never be able to finish a giant stack of them!

For $40, we definitely got our money's worth of delicious food. I thought the prices were a little high based on the menu descriptions but boy was I wrong. Neither of us could finish our meals - it was so filling!! So glad we picked this place - I definitely recommend it.

pics.caption: Mexicana skillet, butcher block skillet, Oreo s'more pancake, and signature berry bliss pancake
Oreo s'more pancake! So rich and the white sauce is marshmallow sauce - it also comes with tons of Oreo bits and melted chocolate chips!

review.des: We arrived around 8am on a Saturday morning and didn't have to wait for a table. When we left, the line was out the door. I'm so happy about our timing. Classic Benedict for hubby. Wildberry pancakes for me. S'mores pancakes for child #1. Regular pancakes for child #2. Everything was wonderful. Service was on point. Would definitely visit again.

This food is amazing. I usually order takeout and it's prepared very quickly and still tastes as good as if I were dining in. The staff is very pleasant.

Usually there a crazy waiting time on the weekend. So if you don't like long lines, try this place during the week.

First off, what a great location - right across from Millennium Park! Came here for brunch on a Thursday morning, and waited for about 15 minutes for a party of two -- we didn't mind at all, but considering it was 11am on a weekday I was surprised at how packed this place was.

Our server was very friendly and helpful. We got the Los Altos Benedict and Signature Berry Bliss french toast to get a good mix of sweet and savory. Both were SO GOOD, but definitely recommend splitting with friends if you get the Berry Bliss, because the sweetness can be overwhelming if you try to eat the whole thing. It came with a generous topping of berries, which is always appreciated. The Los Altos was SUPER delicious - we both agreed it was the star of the show. The chorizo sausage went so well with their hollandaise sauce, it was like an explosion of flavor in my mouth. If you're really sensitive to spicy foods, consider getting the hollandaise  and pico de gallo on the side. Excellent portions too. I also tried the kiwi lemonade which was a little too sweet at first, but once diluted with water was really tasty. Free refills is a big bonus!

We passed by Wildberry on Saturday walking through the area and dear lord was it packed. You could see the mob of people waiting from blocks away. I'm not sure I'd wait 2-3 hours to eat anything...if you can, definitely opt for a weekday lunch.

Definitely one of the best brunch dishes I've ever had. 5 stars well deserved!

pics.caption: Los Altos Benedict - hollandaise and pico de gallo on the side. AMAZING.

review.des:
So good we visited twice in 4 Days!

Wildberry absolutely knows how to do it right- seeing the owner there working himself always is a great sign; he is a gracious, kind host who really takes pride in his incredible business and team.

They are always incredibly busy yet amazingly efficient, fast, friendly and all with high quality fare and service... we love this place!

We recommend their omelettes and crepes- you won't be disappointed! Shareable portions and very delicious!

Too- if you want to skip the 45-75 minute wait times, download the No Wait app and put yourself on the list!!

So good! We added ourselves to the waitlist on Yelp  and spent an 1 hr at the art institute and at millennium park. When we got to the restaurant we were seated within 10 mins.

Food was delish! I got a custom omelet with the berry bliss pancakes and it was soooooo good! My husband got the skillet? It was really good too!

pics.caption: Custom made omelet with avocado, mushroom, spinach, chorizo and provolone

review.des: It's a really good and popular restaurant, and it took us an hour to seat, we were so expected how fantastic is the food and a lot of our friends are recommended this restaurant. So the food actually come out really fast after we sit, and they are really large portions. However the food quality is under expectations, the berries are too sour and the meat on the Los Altos egg Benedict feels like it's taken from a microwaved burrito. So if the food can slightly developed it's taste, it's could be more worthy the wait time.

I'm not sure why this place is so popular, but it is extremely busy everyday and hour that it is open.

Pros:

The employees are very nice. Across the board everyone you speak to or see will greet you and offer assistance.

Sure the wait is long but they text you five minutes before your table is ready and you can leave and come back.

The menu has a wide selection of brunch and lunch foods that should satisfy any cravings.

Cons:
The tables are extremely close don't try to have a private conversation.

This place is packed and people in large crowds wait outside and inside for a chance to say they are at Wildberry, but is it that good? I'm going to go out on a limb here and tell the truth NO! There are no signature dishes that you can't get everywhere else, and it is breakfast food for crying out loud. Who waits 55 minutes for eggs or a stack of pancakes? How much different does that Wildberry Crepe taste than any of the hundreds of locations that offer the same item - no different.

I tried it. It was okay, but there's nothing relaxing about eating in a busy restaurant that makes all of its money over the tables turning over fast to accommodate the extra busy crowd. No, I'd rather not dine somewhere with a crowd waiting and staring at me while I eat, oh geez!

Yeah this place is HOT but smoking hot for no reason at all. It's breakfast people it's not going to be the most amazing pancake in the world, sorry.

I get that people love this place but it's like a reality star famous for being famous.

We came here for breakfast on a cold morning...there was an average of 1.5hr wait but we chose to have immediate seating outside. After a while and with the help of hot coffee, it was all worth it!  We had our food hot and ready in less than an hour. We had the eggs Benedict, signature berry pancakes, chorizo skillet and I ordered the strawberries and cream french toast! Everyone enjoyed their food and were more than satisfied. I will definitely recommend this place but be ready for a long wait!

Great place to visit if you are looking for awesome breakfast in Downtown Chicago! The server was great and very attentive... the food came out very fast! My only issue was the area to wait for your table is extremely small with no seating and it stayed packed!

This place is amazing! Went today for a weekday brunch. Everything was perfect from the service to the delicious food. The wait staff was very helpful and attentive. Their suggestions were on point. We had the skillets and did the specialty pancake upgrade. Can't wait to go back.

pics.caption: Veggie skillet, over easy eggs with apple pecan pancakes
Mexican skillet with sunny side up eggs and signature berry bliss pancakes

review.des: Great skillets. And hundreds of other tasty options to choose from! Tipal linz food. But also super crowded. Need to book in advance

I love how I have the option to grab pancakes AND something savory without  ordering full plates for both! The customer services there is a 10! Everytime someone comes from out of town, I make an effort to take them there!

Best to come before 8:30am to avoid the long line up. Chocolate chip pancakes were superb. Side of eggs and hash were above average. Coffee (regular) seemed pretty good and was likely a medium roast. Service was superb and very attentive. Pricing was extremely fair. Ambience was solid presenting a clean environment and reasonable noise level. Enjoy Chicago!
Actually it's not for me, too sweet and too big size...just curious about the rating and taste of people here. Overall, the service was good.
Food and service is good here, but come at the wrong time, expect to wait for a while.
Had breakfast several times there the food was tasty and the portion were big. Friendly and helpful staff. Would definitely recommend.

Nothing short of amazing! The pancakes are so light and fluffy and there are so many tasty season flavors. The portions are huge so either make sure to have somewhere to store leftovers or just get the pancakes!

Wonderful! I was a little discouraged by the wait - but figured there was a reason for long lines. I went on a Friday late morning and thought it might mean less of a crowd. I checked in at the reception area and they have a pretty cool system of text messaging when tables are ready. I decided to step away and run an errand while my place was being held.

As soon as I was seated (I went alone) the people on both sides of me had their food. I couldn't help but gawk! Everything (and I mean everything) looked phenomenal.

I was glad I didn't have to make any tough decisions. Their menu is set up to where you can get a bit of everything without feeling like you ordered half the menu.

I opted for the Garden Skillet and the Berry Bliss pancakes - their signature flavor.

Everything was great - including the service. Will definitely keep this one bookmarked for my future visits to Chicago!

Arrived this past Saturday around 10am and got put on a wait. It took a little over an hour to get sat so we strolled over to Cloud Gate while we waited. Service was amazing despite the restaurant being full, and the food was delicious! Already ready to go back!
Such good food!  Fast and friendly service in a lovely atmosphere.  The pancakes were amazing and the bacon was perfectly cooked!  Yumtastic!

So this is the last stop before we left... Uber driver told us we were goiing to have to wait like two hours ...thankfully we got lucky and they sat us after 10minutes.... Berry bliss was just amazingly delicious!!! I also had the española omelette with jalapeños.. mango iced green tea.

You know when a brunch place is super good when you had to come here TWICE during your 5-day trip (hehe)! I was visiting a friend in Chicago who raved about this place. Seeing how this place is very popular on Yelp, I had high expectations especially when it comes to breakfast places but didn't think a breakfast place would be SO GOOD that I really wanted to come back 2 days later.

The place is located at a prime spot in Chicago- close to the free Cultural Center and Millennium Park. There's lots of seating inside the restaurant and some seating outside. It's easier to seat parties of 2-4 at this place as most of the tables were around that size but you can definitely come here in a large group if you don't mind waiting a little longer.

As for the wait, you can add your name on the waiting list through the "Nowait" app rather than going there to put your name down. Both times I went, me and a friend would add our names through the app and would just walk around in the area. We came here on a Tuesday and Thursday at around 10:30-11amish and waited around 40 minutes. Just a heads up that the "Nowait" app will only allow you to put down up to a party of 4 on their app. You can also order coffee and other drinks from Intelligentsia inside by the entrance while you wait. The wait goes by pretty quick and they do a really good job with service. For example, there was 65 parties ahead of us while we were waiting- pretty impressive for a 40 minute wait if you asked me!

For the food, they offer standard breakfast food such as omelettes, Egg Benedict, pancakes, egg skillets, waffles, etc. What I love about this place is how you can get an omelette (which comes with hashbrowns and/or fruit AND sub the toast for one of their specialty pancakes for just $1.50 more. Both times I came, I've gotten an omelette with hash browns and specialty pancakes. For my first visit, I got their Napa Valley Fig omelette with hash browns and Banna Cream Pie omelette. During my second visit, I created my own omelette (I put figs, spinach, mushrooms, and sausage in my omelette) with hash browns and paired it with their "Berry Bliss" pancakes. At a glance, it's a lot of food- the omelette and hash browns fill up a giant plate while the pancakes come in a stack of 2. But the food is so good that if you're like me who can't resist a hearty breakfast, you will finish the entire meal. Their omelettes are huge and they don't skimp out on their toppings. For their Napa Valley Fig omelette, I was surprised by how well the sweetness of the figs worked will with the other savory toppings. Their hash browns are nice and crispy on the top and were cooked just like how any good hash browns at a classic breakfast place should be. As for their pancakes... oh my goodness THEY ARE SO FLUFFY. I'm not the biggest pancake person but when I had their pancakes, I couldn't stop eating them (no joke). Both Banana Cream Pie and Berry Bliss were super delicious without being overly sweet. I will admit though, when I first read how their Berry Bliss pancakes were one of their more "special" or "must-try"  ones, I was feeling a little "eh" because they were just pancakes but after trying them during my first visit, I can see why people rave about them. The berry and vanilla sauce and toppings that they drizzle on top had a mix of fresh, creamy and candylike taste, giving the "Bliss" part to the name some credibility.
