Service was excellent both times that I visited. Once we got seated, they served us water right away and when we needed something, they gave it to us quickly. Everyone was also friendly and calm as well- which surprises me since the place is really busy. Food also came out in a jiffy as well. Each time I visited, I paid around maybe $15-17 including tax and tip (Note: I was feeling a little bit more generous when it came to tipping because I personally was impressed with how my experience went). After this long review, you can guess that I will DEFINITELY be coming back when I visit Chicago again!!

pics.caption: Napa Valley Fig Omelette... look at that cheese!

review.des:
this place gets huge props for how they operate their business. normally, busy breakfast joints don't allow waitlist seating, but this place does which is what caught my attention. i was in chicago for the weekend and did not want to wait 1-2 hours for food, so i saw that this place had plenty of positive reviews and the food looked amazing, so why not?

their waitlist seating moves extremely fast, so make sure you're in the area when you add your name to the waitlist. by the time we caught a cab from our hotel 10 mins away, we were being texted to let us know our table was ready.

everyone here moves quickly and everyone is friendly! our server was attentive and made sure to check back on us. the food was the best part of course, get the banana cream pie pancakes!! they are melt in your mouth delicious, and you can get them with your meal instead of toast for an upcharge! so worth it. my fiancé got the berry pancakes and they looked amazing as well. i recommend getting a skillet (they're huge in size) with specialty pancakes on the side, you won't regret it! when i'm back in chi-town this will definitely be my breakfast spot!

This was a great location if you're looking to explore the park and Art Institute after you meal. But it gets busy fast. I love the Yelp Wait list, and i recommend you put your self on it before heading out. You can check at the wait time. At 8:00am on Sunday morning, within 15 mins, the wait became 0 mins to 45 mins. The time that it indicates on the app to show up at the counter (inside) is when you will get your text , and no need to show up before that. It was a bit confusing, but the estimated time was pretty accurate.

The place functions like a well oiled machine. Someone in front of the restaurant will put you on the wait list, if you're not already. Once you get a text, you have 5 mins (it's a really short time, and a brisk walk from Cloud Gate), to get inside and check in with someone inside (I suspect this is being triggered when a table matching your requirements gets the bill). In almost blink of an eye, the table is wiped clean and re-set up and you'll get walked to your table.

Food, I wasn't so impressed with. There are a lot of options, but quality for me was close to iHop or some thing similar, nothing too special. We had a breakfast sandwich, with a skillet/eggs and pancakes on the side. It was a lot of food. Ordering a full order of pancakes you'll get 4! Side dish comes with 2. We got the blueberries with almonds. It was tasty, but I've had better, thus 3 stars.

This place was recommended by a friend as a brunch spot for our weekend visit to Chicago. We used the yelp app to add ourselves to the waitlist - highly recommend it because the wait was about 2 hrs at 10 am on Sunday. We added to the waitlist at around 9:40am, walked over to the restaurant by 10:20 and got seated 10:50am.

Coffee 3 stars: they brew intelligentsia coffee. Had the iced AMERICANO and it was a bit acidic for my taste, but the cream helped.  Hubby had the TURTLE MOCHA and he said it was alright.

Food 4 stars: tried the ESPANOLA OMELETTE and the BERRY BLISS PANCAKES. I would definitely recommend the pancakes as they were very fluffy and I didn't even use the syrup because the sauce they put on top of the pancakes were good. Hubby got the BREAKFAST BURRITO and it's basically the same as the espanola omelette wrapped in a tortilla.

Service 4.5 stars: service was fast and pretty good. Only this was I asked for a decaf and they gave me regular coffee and they were too busy so I didn't even bother to ask to fix it.

Price: $37 dollars for 2 coffee drinks, too entrees, and a $1.5 up charge to add signature pancakes to the omelette.

pics.caption: Berry Bliss pancakes and an Espanola omelette in the back

review.des:
I usually don't go balls to the walls for breakfast / brunch food but this place was yummy!

I was visiting out of town and saw that this place offered an online virtual wait in line...AMAZING! Saves SO much time. When I arrived I saw so many people waiting outside...but I got seated right away. It was nice to enjoy brunch in the outside area on a sunny day.

The Southern benedict with hash browns on the side was soooo good! I wish I can get more. I tried the classic benedict as well and that was pretty good although it was a bit on the salty side. I wanted to try more things but had no more room in my belly. I think the prices are SUPER affordable as well.

I'm not sure on the service inside but I felt bad that there was only one waitress to serve all the tables outside. I would definitely come back to try more things.

I was able to wait list through the Yelp app- highly recommended since this place always seems to be packed (and now I know why!). Saturday morning at 8am, I signed in on the app and then had plenty of time to get to the restaurant to check in to keep our spot. Through Waitlist, I was able to watch how many people were still ahead and it went pretty quickly. As other people walked in, they were told it was over an hour wait. Wow!
There were so many things on the menu to choose from, I really had no idea how to decide! They offered normal breakfast options like eggs, potatoes and ham along with salads and sandwiches. Everyone at our table chose something different so we could share and sample. I chose the Oreo S'mores pancakes, oh my goodness, (yummy yummy goodness) and I sampled the cinnamon roll French toast and caramel apple pecan French toast ...also delicious. There were other pancakes at the table and a breakfast skillet to balance out all the sugar. Every bite was delicious!
Oops, i was so excited about the food and menu options, I completely skipped all of the good that happened after check in.
We arrived at the restaurant to check in and wait a little longer. The hostesses and waitstaff were absolutely wonderful, sweet, friendly and helpful, even directing people to their other location which didn't have a wait but was about a 15 minute walk ( in the frigid temps) or a 5 minute drive. The lobby was packed with not much seating...maybe mostly standing area, so many people, I couldn't tell. There was a sign at the front desk that said there was a waiting area in the adjoining building but at the doors of the building near Wildberry's entry, signs said no entry there and you had to enter somewhere else. Well, it was cold so I didn't want to walk around that big building so we packed into the lobby with everyone else. From the entry area, the restaurant looks small. I was surprised to find out that it wasn't small after we were seated. We were seated next to a door from the other indoor waiting area... so I'm guessing we could have snuck in that way from the restaurant to wait over there. I don't see why not but maybe they don't want traffic flowing that way to keep away from the dining area.
It was ok, though, we were seated quicker than I thought, even though I wasn't really sure how long it would take... I could only see that the countdown of people in front of us was going quickly.
Our orders came out quickly and the server was great! I tried my best, but couldn't finish my 5 pancakes topped with Oreo cookies, marshmallow, white and chocolate pieces and syrup!
Loved everything, but would have hated to wait over an hour to get in. Glad I didn't have to!

Where do I start about Wildberry the hold my spot though the yelp app is amazing I had to hold my spot twice cause I got lost. We got there and were seated in less then 10 minutes. I ordered a Chocolate chip frappe and berry bliss waffle my son had blueberry strudel pancake and butchers block skillet. And cherry lemonade. The food was AMAZING! The berries are fresh the pancakes so light and fluffy! The skillet was delicious and meat portions in it was great! I honestly wish we had one in Orlando!
As our regular stop in Chicago before the trip back to Kansas City, it never disappoints. Today's 2 hour wait make getting in line on Yelp VERY attractive. It worked perfect for us.
I'm not really sure what I can say that hasn't already been said. Excellent food, excellent service. We were in and out in 30 minutes, very fast. It was worth the wait.

Great pancake house which serves all the timeless favorites. The portions are great for sharing so definitely keep that in mind when ordering. You'll be bursting at the seams after finishing one plate! We tried the Oreo Pancake, Corned Beef Eggs Benedict, and the Buttermilk Pancake -- all great and hit the spot.

Super long wait especially on the weekend since it's in a prime tourist location but it is definitely worth it. The pancakes are super fluffy and taste like cake. Definitely do the skillet combo with the special pancakes on the side for a taste of both savory and sweet. The price is also very decent for how much food is provided. Get the signature berry bliss! It is amazing. Service is super fast despite how crowded it usually is inside.

This place was awesome! All the reviews I read before were spot on. Expect to be on a waitlist for at least 30-45 mins when you go there. I tried the Butcher's Block and it was truly a meatlovers paradise. While I got this for myself it is easily enough to feed 2 people. I substituted toast for specialty pancakes for an additional 2 dollars and it was well worth it! The famous wildberry pancakes are as good advertised. I will head back here for sure next time I'm in Chicago. The service was great.

Excellent meal here. I came ISO GF pancakes and was not disappointed. I have a specific need for my seating and they graciously accommodated me even though it was very busy.  Patrick was a jewel from beginning to end and when I was overwhelmed with options,  he told me his favorite meal so I went with that. This dude can order for me ANYTIME! Great meal, very satisfying with enough food for me to feel satiated yet not so much that it felt wasteful.

I'll visit again.

If you're willing to wait, this is THE SPOT! Every time I have someone visit it's a must-go to. I will say that it's a VERY touristy spot, but people wouldn't be waiting out the door if it wasn't good. Their pancakes are THEEEEE BEST!

Delicious and a ton of food for the money.
Can get extremely crowded with 2 hour wait times....just or your name in via Yelp app and it worked like a charm. We went there and only had to wait 15 minutes

Saw the Yelp Reviews and thought "looks good" Visited at 6:30 am on Friday, 06/15/18.  The greeters were warm and cheerful. We ordered takeout quickly and waited 20 minutes for its arrival.  I took my corn beef hash skillet and pancakes to my office about 5 minutes away.  Unfortunately I did not enjoy the abundant amount of food (two could share this entree).  I don't normally need salt and pepper but this dish needed it. Also the skillet was greasy

We arrived just after it opened (6:30 am) on a Thursday and were seated immediately. The fresh squeezed orange juice was thirst quenching first thing in the morning after walking 4 blocks. We ordered the Corned Beef and Hash Skillet with a side of Cinnamon Roll Pancakes, the Signature Berry Bliss Crepes, and Chicken and Waffles. Our goal was to get a little taste of everything. It was everything you'd want in breakfast: savory, hearty, mouth-watering. I WILL go back if I'm in the area again.
It had a wait time by the time we walked out at 7:15 am.

The boyfriend and I were both really impressed by Wildberry! There was a bit of a wait even when we reserved our spot in line ahead of time (make sure to add yourself to the waitlist using Yelp or any other app that will help you out), but it was worth it. Our server was very friendly and checked on us often.

I got the espanola omelette and my boyfriend got the Mexican skillet. We were afraid that they'd taste the same (except one as an omelette and the other as a skillet), but were pleasantly surprised that both were unique and flavorful in their own right. We also got sides of cinnamon roll and Wild Berry Bliss pancakes -- totally worth it. Definitely coming back here next time we're in Chicago!

pics.caption: Look at our spread! Yum! Wild berry bliss pancakes on the left and an omelette with fresh fruit on the right.

review.des: We were told there would be a 45-60 min wait but it was 5 mins bc of our group size...bingo! Still one of my fav breakfast places in Chicago. Good quality ingredients, amazing pancakes and delicious omelets. Will continue to come back every time I'm back in Chicago!

It really can't get any better than this . What's the old saying, "save the best for last". Well, Wildberry, you made that mark. Okay, so here's a tip, get in line online. The wait time was worst than not having TSA pre-check. We were able to secure seating via the no wait app and walk right in.

okay, the good stuff...

we ordered the espanola omelet and opted for the fruit and pancakes. At first the omelet was okay, but then when we added the salsa...AMAZING addition. The fruit was okay; it was fruit. They don't have too much control over the flavor of that. Then came the pancakes...YES! This is what they do. They make these light and fluffy circles of delight amazing.

In all, Wildberry stands with other really good Chicago eateries. Keep up the good work and see you soon.

The pancakes are delicious but the skillet I got was just mediocre. This place overall is so overpriced. It is not convenient that they don't have reservations. I don't want to wait for 1.5 hrs for breakfast.

Let's see if I can keep this short and sweet!

I'm updating my review since it has been quite awhile since my last time dining in.

I came with 5 other coworkers around noon on a Thursday and we were seated within 10 minutes.

I ordered the butcher block with sunny side up eggs and I subbed for signature berry bliss pancakes.

The food was as good as before and service was great.

I'm always happy when I eat Wildberry food :)

pics.caption: Butcher block with sunny side up eggs, sub specialty berry bliss pancakes
Butcher block, sunny side up eggs

review.des: If u willing to wait for an 1hr for brunch, this is the place. But it s worth it. They have nice brunch menus. French toasts are the best.

This place is worth! Got the special berry crepe and it was amazing. I'd never thought to use yogurt in crepes before so that was mind-blowing for me. Pancakes are great as well. The latte was also quite good. Overall I think this place is better than yolk (but yolk is just closer to me). Would love to come here more often!

This place is always packed, but with good reason because everything is delicious! To skip the line I usually book a "nowait" which is an app that lets you reserve ahead a time a spot in line. I recommend the wild berry crepes and their fresh seasonal dishes like lemon poppy pancakes

I read on Yelp that the pancakes are a must try. After giving them a try this morning I can assure you that they definitely are good.

Fluffy, soft and not to sweet.

Long wait. Bland food. Benedict looked delicious but English muffin was just a bread circle that was not toasted, hollandaise sauce was scanty and bland.  Spinach a bit stringy.  Not worth the wait, wait staff was thoughtful, but, that didn't improve the food,

The food is surprisingly good. Sometimes hype is just hype...this isn't. Service was great, price was a reflection if location...but acceptable.
I'd definitely return because of combo...good food and nice service. Parking is a monster here...walk or Uber.
Great breakfast you must eat here when your in Chicago! But reserve a table on Yelp first to minimize your wait
Love this place, everything is so good!! If you have problems making a food choice I recommend asking the servers for advice or suggestions. They are very knowledgeable and helpful!

Place is good but I feel like I can't write a good review until I try it again. Came here around 8am on a Saturday and it wasn't too bad of a wait. About 20min wait for a table. Ordered turkey bacon, turkey sausage and corn beef hash. Also ordered chicken and waffles. The sides were great and the corn beef hash was large portion size. The chicken and waffles were eh.  Kind of disappointed by it honestly.

This is our favorite place for breakfast in Chicago. I love the signature berry bliss pancakes. Wildberry is always packed but checking in via the yelp app before we left our hotel helped cut our wait time significantly.

Wow. This place had the fluffiest omelet I've ever had. The pancakes and crepes also were delicious. I highly recommend this place. But put yourself on the waitlist with Yelp because otherwise it's a super long wait.

I've been to so many brunch places in the Loop and River North--Yolk, Brunch, Kanela, Farmhouse, Bongo Room, the list goes on.  I finally went to Wildberry this week and I have to say they easily take the (pan)cake for best brunch in the city imho.  The venue is large and busy but the service is still warm and friendly.  They flip tables fast so you can get in and out relatively quickly.  
They have a large menu but not unnecessarily large like Yolk.  Each dish they offer is unique in its own way with a fresh twist.  The portion sizes are massive and they come with big sides as well.  
I had the slow cooked brisket skillet and my girlfriend had the red velvet French toast.  Both were excellent, my skillet was full of meat and a delicious gravy with awesome caramelized onions and peppers.  The side of pancakes was huge and an awesome sweet foil for the savory skillet.  My girlfriend always orders the red velvet French toast on any brunch menu.  She adores Kanela's but said Wildberrys was even better.  The portion size was also very large, especially for the price.  
Overall, Wildberry is just head and shoulders above the other brunch restaurants downtown in price, portion, service, taste, and quality.  A must go for out of towners!
Not typically a pancake person, but these were delicious! Got the pumpkin spice pancakes... One order is big enough for two people.

This place has a crazy long wait list, and last 2 times I was in Chicago couldn't even get in, mainly as couldn't be bothered to wait 90 mins. This time found their app via Yelp, you put your name down, get in the list, and then check in in person nearer the time.
Loads of eggs, French toast, pancakes etc etc so a great brunch option with something for everyone and conveniently located at top of Millennium park area.
Absolutely amazing. Worth the hype and the wait. Our favorite restaurant on our trip to Chicago. The wildberry crepe was our favorite. Portions are large and the food is great value.

Our first time and first breakfast in the Windy City, and what a find! It was so good that we came back a second time. I made a totally decadent choice of ricotta cheese-filled French toast sitting on a bed of white- and milk-chocolate chips that were also sprinkled on top and drizzled with a chocolate sauce. It tasted like a piece of heaven. My husband made the healthier choice of a Skillet dish that was also delish. Just be prepared for a "well worth it" wait. They've made it super easy to check in with a text when your table is ready. We would put it as a "must visit" when coming to Chicago.
Great food. Fast friendly service. The cornbeef hash skillet was good. The berry pancakes are amazing

Very generous portions of food with fast service. There is a long wait time, I recommend wait listing on Yelp because you don't need to be there in person to start a reservation.

I got the Florence Benedicts, amazingly done and well presented. Their iced French roast coffee was a hit too. I'm usually picking about the coffee that I consume, but the coffee here was fresh and strong!

The berry bliss pancakes were AMAZING! Really really yummy & highly recommend.
Portions were quite large. Fresh oj is always a plus too!
Clean restaurant & good service

Found this recommendation on Yelp. We made were put on the waitlist while still at the hotel. When we got there we still had to wait however we were able to sight see Millenium Park. One we got inside, we ordered one of the Skillets and it was DELICIOUS! The portions are shareable and everything is reasonable priced!
I went to brunch here a few weeks ago and it was great. The wait is long but the food is worth it. All I have to say is if you are looking for Bang for your buck they have options options options

Very poorly handled situation. Extremely rude and called us a lair. I get there is serious business & volume and they want all parties here. We had 2 at the restaurant and 3 across the street who came early to get in line (since you can't wait in line with a large group). We arrived and we are waiting on the 6th person who's parking at the hotel (10 minutes away). They told us our wait time World be 1 1/2 - 1 :45 wait, which is why 3 of us came early. They called us for our table 28 minutes later. So our 6th person wasn't here yet. Now they were crazy rude and it's simply unacceptable the way we were spoke to. Plus it's notice we went from a table of 6  to 4 or 2. Seriously  could have been handled different and with customer service.
Best pancakes I've ever had. Wonderful view. So worth it. Got the Mexicana scramble as well and it was delicious! The sauce was great!
Good breakfast food but overpriced. Plenty of other places to go for less money in town.
Wow, went here for brunch and they did not disappoint! Lived up to the hype I always heard about! The pancakes were hot and came out in a timely manner. Great service and food! Can't ask for more!
7/8 of us enjoyed their meals immensely. I just picked the wrong thing for me. I would go back there in a heartbeat. Great service and delicious food. Check in on Yelp- it helps!

Definitely a must go for brunch in Chicago! There's a bit of a wait, but everyone is still very friendly and fast. The food portions are huge and I had the Florence Benedict & the eggs were so fluffy and tasty. The berry waffle was also really good. The fruit tasted sweet and everything was very warm and smelled fresh.

Love love love this spot for breakfast/brunch! They have a huge selection to choose from and they give you a lotttttt of food for your money! I generally get one dish and split it with my boyfriend and we're both stuffed at the end of the meal. Their pancakes are fluffy and my favorite is their berry bliss one. Their skillets are also very good!

Very extensive menu which is also very flexible. This is a place where everyone can find something on the menu that they would enjoy. Despite being extremely busy all the time, I have received great service every time I visit. Very generous portions as well!

I had the opportunity to meet an old friend for breakfast while visiting the Windy City.    
We wanted to grab grub and have the time to chat & chew because it had been a while since we saw each other.   Wildberry met our checklist of needs so we decided to meet up there the night before.

I checked their wait list at 8 A.M. and there was no wait but just 45 minutes later, the wait was over an hour!   The biggest obstacle to time was my need to catch the Megabus back to Indy otherwise time would not had been a issue.  Thankfully a tip left and answer in the Q & A sections for this business by Yelpers allowed me to effortlessly "get in line."  I love these features of Yelp!

The waitlist time for 3 was pretty accurate and we got seated about 5 minutes early.  I have to give credit to the staff!  They obviously know how to handle lots of hungry patrons with ease and efficiency.  After being seated, we were greeted by our very pleasant waitress.  After taking our drink orders which came out fast considering our drink order consisted of two lattes and a hot chocolate.  We placed our food orders and had our food in less than 15 minutes.  Considering the restaurant was packed to the rafters this was amazing time from kitchen to table.  The food was definitely worth the wait and the portions are big that I took a to go box.    Our waitress checked on us periodically and did not make us feel rushed despite the line of customers waiting to get seated.   We were done dining in plenty of time to make it to back to the hotel to get our bags and get to the Megabus stop.  I plan to visit again when my travels take me back to the Windy City.

I wish I lived in a world where I could eat Cinnamon Roll Pancakes from Wildberry every day for breakfast and not have to worry about wait times or maintaining my weight.  Ohmygosh these pancakes are SO flippin' flapjack GOOD.  The 20 minutes we waited for a table was worth it.  The five pounds I gained once I finished breakfast was so worth it.  And I'd do it again tomorrow if I wasn't something like 700 miles away from Wildberry.
Excellent food! Excellent service! We go every time we are in Chicago!  Highly recommend for an amazing breakfast!

"Go to Wildberry," they said, "and it will be delicious!" Well they were right! This place gives you a hearty breakfast that will take more than a walk down the Magnificent Mile to work off, but it's deliciously worth it.

The wait can be daunting but if you check in first with the NoWait app the time is pretty accurate as they update.

Had the butcher block skillet with a side of Oreo s'mores pancakes for breakfast, you could easily split this between two people and still be outrageously full with the generous portions they give.

It is 100% a tourist hot spot but the interior is kept well and the staff are speedy and extremely friendly.

Decent food and fast service. You can't ask for much more when you see the line outside. With a small party of two we were sat pretty quickly and enjoyed lots of coffee and two delicious breakfasts on our visit to Chicago. Would definitley go again when we are back in the area.

Not only is the food delicious it was served fast.  Our server Val was very knowledgeable about all the ways we could order our eggs.   She even offered me a coffee to go.  Can't get better than great food with great service!
Too hard to get into. The food is good, but I make better blueberry pancakes with whipped cream and bananas and strawberries. Waffles same thing. Eggs are why I give four

The Los Altos Benedict was great! A bit greasy but the English muffin was a showstopper. Definitely tasted the heat come through but lightly.

The Classic Benedict was DELICIOUS! The ham served was like butter in my mouth and I would've just eaten that and that alone!

Almond Joy Mocha was on the sweeter side and the Mint Mocha was only slightly minty.

Service was great! Food was delivered fast :)
friendly people with big smile good service, food is very delicious too, loved my waffle.

Highly recommend calling ahead or using the Nowait App! Can be a long wait. Luckily we did use the app and got seated right away. Warning, portion sizes are huge. Wife and shared a skillet which came w/ 2 pancakes. I ordered the cinnamon specialty pancakes for myself. Sooo good!! Will definitely be coming back to try the others.

WOW! Best breakfast place I've been to, including top places in NY, LA, SF, DC, and the South. The Red Velvet French toast was to die for. The Spanish Eggs Benedict was amazing too. It took a while to get seated, but once we did the food came fast. The waitress was extremely attentive and my coffee mug never got more than half empty. Unfortunately it's a bit pricey when it comes to breakfast places.

2nd time here and it was even better. Service was great! Food was even better! The pancakes are amazing. We tried the blueberry danish, strawberry poppy seed, and cinnamon roll. All were yummy but the blueberry danish were my favorite! The garden skillet I got was SO GOOD!! It had lots of yummy veggies and was so cheesy!! Such a great meal for a fantastic price! For sure will hit this spot up each time I'm in Chicago!

Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe is about as good as it gets for traditional breakfast fare and specialty pancakes in a casual environment.  Obviously, it's extremely popular and a crowd waits at the door. That said, my yelp app check-in experience was a difference maker. Only waited ~5 minutes upon arrival (9:00 a.m. on Saturday).

Enjoyed the patio on a 70's summer morning.  Nice view of Millennium park. The interior is super busy and I found the patio to be a much more relaxing vibe.

Really enjoyed the well prepared, slightly browned omelet, and crispy hash-browns.  The side of berry bliss pancakes were a no brainer as they are a signature item.  Pancakes were very fluffy with an indulgent berry/creme topping ...a good decision.  Brewed flavored coffee (vanilla) was well balanced. Some flavored brews smell better than they taste - not so with this cup. Overall, very good.

Service experience was quite good and not rushed.

Only detractors:  1: a restroom that isn't quite big enough to handle this type of draw 2. There's no way I'd suggest waiting the 1.5-2 hours advised  at around 10:00a the same day.  Use the check in app feature and skip the line - spend your wait time down at Fairgrounds on Michigan Ave!

Great food, great service, great experience.  Worth most of the hype but not a two hour wait!

Brunch with friends while in town to see a show and we were so pleased to have chosen Wildberry. Definitely must use the Yelp Waitlist App. Apparently this place is always packed but we had only a short wait once we arrived since we used the waitlist feature.

Service is quick, friendly and attentive. Menu options are varied and all looked great. Caution, portions are large so if your not able to haul your leftovers around you may consider sharing a plate and sides.

I had the Breakfast Burrito w/extra jalapeño, crispy corned beef hash and a side of sausage patties. Yes, way to much food but really good. Everyone said they loved their meals. Highly recommend.

Incredibly noisy. Incredibly noisy. Also incredibly noisy. Cramped inside when sitting/eating and in the process of waiting to be seated. Most of the food is fine--nothing terribly special about it, and a good portion of it is cool by the time it makes it to your table. A couple of the specialty pancakes really are divine, but are more dessert than breakfast. The service is friendly, but slow.

The single best place to eat in Chicago. The only place I've ever visited that I can say is worth the two hour wait you'll find on weekends. Download the nowait app to work around that. All omelettes, skillets, sandwiches, french toasts, hot beverages and of course pancakes are supreme

This place is just outstanding.  Love the pancakes with a tall glass of cold milk.  I have gone here for a late lunch as well - they have so many offerings.  Service is always good.  Prices are reasonable.  Location is just great - steps away from Michigan Avenue.  Located inside Prudential 2 tower.  The only concern is that sometimes that wait for a table is INCREDIBLE.  Please plan on coming during an off time or off day, or plan on coming and putting your name down and walking around Millennium park and enjoying the sites before coming back.  The wait is worth it.

I know you shouldn't always "believe the hype," but this place for breakfast is L I T.

What you want to do is get on the wait list, especially on a weekend morning, as soon as you wake up because it'll be at least an hour before they contact you. You want to be nearby because once they're ready for you, you have 5 minutes to go get seated.

And when you get seated, you better order some waffles or pancakes because they're so damn good. I need something savory in the morning, personally, so I ordered turkey bacon, eggs, and hash browns while we all shared pancakes. Amazing!

Delicious. I am a big fan of berries (and sweets), and if you are anything like me, order the signature bliss (can be in pancakes, crepes or waffles). It was absolutely amazing with strawberries, blueberries, and blackberries with mascarpone and a berry drizzle. If I was there alone - I would have licked the plate and ordered it again! The OJ is fresh squeezed, too!

The food was AMAZING!!!!  The portions are great and worth every penny. The food came out hot and smoking. Pancakes are melt in your mouth and the scramble is very hearty. Would have been 5 stars but we waited 2 hours

We gave Wildberry a try based on reviews. It was so good we went back the next day. The pace was hopping each visit. The staff was courteous and quick. I was amazed at the efficiency. We were seated and drink orders taken. Loved the fresh OJ. Next we placed our order and presto a few minutes later amazing and beautiful breakfast food appeared. The pancakes are AMAZING! I recommend a side of breakfast sausage or ham. Give this place a try you will not be disappointed.

Had brunch here! Start of with freshly squeezed orange juice. Must try the skillets. It's a big one so one can share. I had corned beef and hash with over easy egg on top. Choice of toast or pancake with it.
We had to wait 10-15 mins for we r a big group. I was also able to check wait times on the yelp app which was very useful.
Overall, can't go wrong here. Next to Macy's so did shopping after.

I'll keep this short: our breakfast was spectacular.  I ordered the southern benedict (poached egg, sausage, biscuit, sausage gravy) and my husband ordered the signature berry bliss crepes.  Both were huge in portion and prepared perfectly.  As a southerner, it is difficult to find expertly prepared sausage gravy... Wildberry nailed it.  The crepes were filled with and topped with something like $10 in fresh berries and a delicious marscapone (?) creamy filling.  Insanely good and like no other crepes we've ever ordered.  Why order pancakes (which you can get anywhere) when these crepes are available?  Coffee was decent, service was okay.  Come and order the crepes and you won't be sorry.

I visited there with my friend. We sat at the patio seat. We ordered Omelet and salad. It was good.
But the server was very unfriendly.
Actually, I don't want to give tips but I gave it.

Come downtown for this delicious breakfast  followed by a walk in the park. We savored homemade brisket hash, chilaquiles barbacoa, blueberry danish pancakes and coffee by Intelligentsia. What could be better than that? Our server Jeremy B.! He
was awesome and made our experience worthy of a repeat visit. We were seated much sooner than our anticipated wait time, woo hoo! Wildberry, a wonderful excuse to visit all the fun things along Michigan Avenue.

Wow! This place is fantastic!! The reviews can't say enough!! We used the waitlist feature on yelp so we didn't even have to wait when we got here. The staff was soooo friendly!! Kimberly, went out of her way to make sure we taken care of! She was very attentive, kind, and efficient!! We were even given seats outside which was awesome for people watching. This is a must do tho for breakfast if you are in Chicago. It is very close to millennial park and definitely worth the visit! I will absolutely come back and eat here again next time I'm in Chicago.

I had the blueberry bliss pancakes on the side of my main dish and they were amazing!!! I definitely agree that if you come here you should get them! You will not be disappointed! Thanks!

pics.caption: These blueberry bliss pancakes are AMAZINGLY awesome!!

review.des: Food was good. Nice ambience. Service was prompt and accurate. I would have given 5 stars but the almost a 2 hour waiting period may be a bit too much. We used the Yelp waitlist app and it was accurate on the wait time. Again, food was good and not greasy but very fulfilling and fresh. We will be back. They do not have a good Vegan selection so if an owner reads this, please consider vegan pancakes or something.

Before going to Chicago a friend told me about Wildberry. I'm slightly picky about brunch (gotta make sure you pick well, especially in a big city!) and decided to go for it after seeing the raving reviews. PLUS, being able to reserve a spot ahead of time and avoid the huge crowd waiting is a plus.

We got in and the place was bop'in AND the menu looked great. Coffee was phenomenal, service was good, but I was a little bit disappointed by the stuffed french toast (hence the 4 start review instead of 5). It tasted a little bit greasy.

Pancakes, meat egg skillet were also a 4...not the most delicious food ever, but definitely good. But, the atmosphere was great and it was a fun experience. Definitely worth a stop, just make sure to put your name on the list before heading over.

This is one of my favorite brunch places in the city! The food is always delicious, the drinks are always perfect, and the service is great! Their pancakes are so wonderful. They get really busy on weekends, but the staff is always polite and never seem overwhelmed. I would highly recommend.

Love this place- their pancakes are awesome. The atmosphere is friendly and relaxed but sometimes you might feel pressured to leave by the waitstaff as soon as you're done eating. Only downsides are the wait and the fact that the restaurant gets pretty cold in the winter despite the staff attempting to keep the doors closed.

My favorite  meal of the day. BREAKFAST !
Absolutely amazing pancake house. Quick staff even for high volume of brrakfast enthusiast.  Pancakes are just like mom makes. Perfect eggs. Not over or under cooked. Delicious house blend coffee.

pics.caption: Scrambled eggs hashbrown but these wildberry pamcakes where amazingly delicious
Butcher skillet topped with ober easy eggs side of fluffy pancakes
Cafe mocha, perfecr temperature and size.

review.des: Best Breakfast in DT Chitown be ready to have a great meal. Service was good, and we got sat down with in 30min. Great vive!

I used the nowait app to skip an hour wait (40 people ahead of me) for my party of 4, but missed my reservation by five minutes. The staff was accommodating and still seated us.

We shared the wild berry waffle, omelet and a scramble. The scramble and omelet came with a side of pancake or toast, we chose the pancakes. They were fluffy and and not too dense.

Definitely try the wild berry waffle or pancakes and use the nowait app. You can stroll around Millennium Park if it's not too cold. They'll text you five minutes before your turn to be seated so you have time to head back.

pics.caption: Wild berry waffle, omelet and scramble (both come with side of pancake or toast)

review.des: Good food at really fair prices for the area. They seem to be new and have a few kinks to work out but management is right there to work things out. Been there twice for breakfast. I'll go back every time I'm in the area

I thought this place was slightly underwhelming, especially with all of the hype that surrounds this place. My fiance and I decided to give this place a shot, and we must have come in with really high expectations because we didn't feel "wowed." Thankfully, we didn't wait for more than 30 minutes; otherwise, I feel like it would have been even more disappointing.

I had the mushroom omelette with a side of berry pancakes, and my fiance had the veggie skillet with a side of cinnamon pancakes. Both of our dishes were absolutely overwhelmed with cheese, and although the cheese was delicious, it became disgusting after a few bites. My fiance and I both had to cover our dishes with Tabasco and add salt and pepper to give it some taste. The cinnamon pancakes were covered in the sweet syrup/icing on top, and it really ruined the pancakes overall (way way too sweet) until we wiped it all off. My berry pancakes were perfect though - they were super fluffy with a little sweetness to them that negated the need for any syrup.

It is rather unfortunate that my fiance and I were so extremely underwhelmed by this brunch location. Maybe one day we'll give it another shot.
First time in Chicago and I yelp what to eat for breakfast so I chose the one with the best review and not gonna lie the breakfast was so good! Totally recommend.

So, the secret is out, and this place is pure fire. Nevertheless, loved it so much that I felt compelled to write this review. Came here on Sunday, July 1, and had to wait a long time, but we booked through No Wait. The folks doing the check-in as well as the team behind the desk in the entryway were all so, so friendly in spite of the heat and the hordes of people waiting for a table. We were seated outside with Dylan, and though he was slammed, he didn't show it. He gave us spectacular service, and the food was to die for. I had the Denver skillet, and these guys make arguably the best skillet known to man. I'd come back time and time again. Thanks for the great experience, Wildberry!

First of all, definitely use the no-wait app here. There was about a 65 minute wait when we checked in via the app, but we knew right when to show up at the restaurant and were seated very quickly. Which was great, because it was freezing outside and there was very little room inside to wait. This place is always very busy, and rightfully so.

My wife and I did another smart thing when we visited here (so this was highly unusual for us): we split a meal. Everything on the menu looked fantastic, but the portions were absolutely gargantuan. We split a sizzlin' skillet and added a side of berry pancakes. It was more than enough food for the two of us, and we didn't even finish it all. The skillet was excellent, especially with the hash browns and italian sausage mixed in, and as you would guess by the name of this place the pancakes were a little slice of heaven.

We could easily see why this place is so popular, even if it is in a touristy location. We had very attentive service and spent less than $20 on a fantastic brunch.

pics.caption: Sizzlin' skillet with a side of pancakes

review.des: Had an opportunity to go to Wildberry this morning for breakfast and it was great. I followed fellow Yelpers recommendations and got the Barbacoa Chilaquiles and was not disappointed. As a side, you could choose pancakes, toast or fresh fruit. I went with the fruit and my friend got two generous sized pancakes. My other friend ordered one of their many "Eggs Benedict" options. This one was actually sausage patties on top of eggs and a biscuit smothered in sausage gravy with a side of hash browns. It also looked delicious.  The service at Wildberry was great as well. On a Sunday morning we only had a 10 minute wait and were able to get in and out within an hour.

Best idea is to go and book your spot, explore around Chicago (1-2 hours), then come back. Food is amazing and relatively affordable.

Service is great and they really do have good recommendations (I went 3 times and every time I chose least pancake option or main option based on recommendation). Never once food didn't meet my expectation!! My favs are (don't remember their exact names) meat skillet and Mexican skillet!
Hands down the best Breakfast Place around!  Great food, great service!  The portions are huge and you won't find a better variety of specialty pancakes!

Best joint to have breakfast in !!
How ever the waiting time is more than 1 hour
So be prepared to wait in the sun
The food is great although it took more than 40 min
The cinnamon french toast is a MUST

My boyfriend and I liked our meal here so much that we returned a second time during our trip to Chicago. I had a skillet and a Fresca omelette, both were delicious. My favorite part of the meal was the Berry Pancakes, they are addictive. I would travel back to Chicago in a second just for a meal at Wildberry.

Good pancakes

Slow service takes a hour to get seated every time I'm here.

Think they should  open more locations because I love pancakes and I love donuts.

A must try if you are visiting the city, or shoot, live in the city!! GO HUNGRY, as you get served very favorable helpings. I got the Mexicana skillet and substituted my toast for the cinnamon roll pancakes.... Easily some of the best pancakes I have had in my early life. Soft and gooey, and sweet just like I like it. The skillet had a good kick to it but aws nothing to over powering and was just as good as the pancakes!! With the food so incredible and the location right out side of millenium park, make sure you go put your name down on the yelp app and pack your patience. Our wait was close 2 hours but the wait was soooo worth it. Enjoy!

After waiting on the waitlist for Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe it was so worth it. I ordered the Cinnamon Roll Pancakes and I couldn't believe my eyes, 5 pancakes stacked neatly upon each other while at the top is drizzled frosting, powder sugar, and cinnamon. After tasting one bite I knew it has to be the best set of pancakes I've ever had! There were so many pancakes I couldn't even finish it all!!  I would for sure come back here next time I come to Chicago.

I am sitting here eating and couldn't even wait to review the eggs Benedict! Seriously the best I've ever had! I don't even care that they don't have coke products, this makes up for it ;) I just wish my stomach was big enough to have those plus some pancakes. I checked in on yelp, took the train in and walked there and no wait for me, super easy and worth it!

Terrific skillet! I had the Mexican one with chorizo and avocado. Mind blowing! Highly recommended.
Staff was friendly and efficient, and we were taken care of well .

Great breakfast and worth the wait. We came here on a Sunday morning at about 8:45 and was told it would be 45 minutes to 1 hour. It turned out to be 45 minutes, which is reasonable. You can also watch your wait time on Yelp.

Now for the important stuff. The menu offers a nice variety of items to satisfy any palate. I like a big breakfast, so I opted for the two cage free eggs with choice of meat. This comes with a choice of hash browns or fruit, plus toast or pancakes for $12. I also ordered a side of sausage patties. The plate arrived with 3 "slabs" of ham, so really no need for the extra sausage, all perfectly prepared and delicious. The eggs were not runny, the ham not too salty and the hash browns cooked enough with a nice crispy outside and soft, flavorful potato inside. I did taste the sausage patties, which had a sweet, caramelized flavor giving it a nice sweet/savory flair.

I would definitely recommend and I will, most certainly, return.

First things first, wear comfortable shoes.  You will be waiting, but it gives you a chance to talk and catch up before you eat.  On the plus side you can take a peek at the plates being brought out by the wait staff.  It's been a while since I've been there, but the food is so good.  The staff is very helpful and attentive.  I ordered the fish and chips.  You get a choice of sides if you don't want the fries.  Wonderful! The next time I return it will be to order the French toast, fully loaded.

Amazing would be an understatement! Every time are in Chicago we HAVE to come here on our last day- it's actually a bi-yearly tradition ha! The wait is long- so if you have zero patience I would come at a non-busy hour like between lunch and dinner lol! Otherwise you will find yourself waiting more than an hour on a sunday afternoon but it will be SO worth it! Love the food and ambience! A must try if you're in Chicago!
Get there early because it gets crazy busy the later it gets. The service was great and the food came out fast, my partner and I both enjoyed what we ordered.

3.5/5

I got here a little past 10 on Sunday morning and the wait was already 2 hours with 119 parties ahead. I spent most of that time exploring Millennium Park and the park across from it. But if I didn't have that to do, I probably would not wait again. My boyfriend and I ordered the butcher block skillet and the fresca omelette with bliss berry pancakes on the side.

The skillet was tasty and filling, but the omlette was HUGE and bland. So I would suggest to get a meatier omelette or get a skillet instead. I actually wonder how many eggs were in my omelette. I was between the bliss berry pancakes and the red velvet french toast. I wish I had ordered the red velvet french toast because where else can you get that and because the pancakes were okay. I appreciate that they were fluffy and light, but the amount of syrups drizzled on the pancakes made me feel like it was more for kids. The fruits on the side for the pancakes were refreshing though. You're going to want to order everything on the menu just to try it all, but you can order a signature pancake/french toast on the side of your egg dish for an extra $1.50 instead.

Interestingly, the brunch here is less greasy than I've seen anywhere else. But Wildberry is nothing special. Get their skillets and fluffy pancakes! And the service here is GREAT - energetic, helpful and accommodating!

pics.caption: Omelette with a side of bliss berry pancakes, and a skillet

review.des: Had a great brunch experience here. This location in particular had quite long wait times but that's to be expected based on the location. Overall we waited 2 hours, but we took that time to explore the surrounding areas so it wasn't a bad experience. I would definitely call ahead next time. The food portions were huge, but everything was delicious. Will come again.

Came here on a visit from out of town and I'm so glad i did! Stopped in Saturday morning just before the rush and was seated within 5 minutes, amazing. The staff was super attentive, paid close attention to orders and got our food and drinks out in a jiff. Sad that i forgot to take a pic but the coffee, eggs, pancakes, & bacon hit the damn spot. Inside is clean, well-decorated and lively. Will be back if I'm in the area again. Yum!

It always has a line. But you can get their good delivered via Door Dash. Pricey..large portions..delicious and hot..minimum amt required.  I ordered for my staff. 3 stars because good was steamy soft. Fries soggy bun soggy to go containers trap in moisture too good but we scarfed it down cause ur was still hot.  Very large portions .salads yummy.  I would do again

Wait time for seating was 2 hours on a Sunday morning. We rarely saw our server. I just wanted some milk, and waited 25 minutes just for her to come around. The food was okay. It wasn't the greatest as everyone states. Ordered a burger as medium rare and received a medium. I would recommend this place to another, but only as a last resort.

This place is amazing! BUT it gets extremely crowded. My friends and I called to put our names on the wait list an hour before we arrived, and we still had to wait about 20 minutes. The wait process is very organized though because they update you with your line placement online. So, we were able to walk around Millennium Park while we waited.

Our waiter was great. He was fun and full of energy. He explained the whole menu and kept us smiling. Most dishes come with a side of toast or pancakes AND hash browns or fruit. SO MUCH FOOD. I made my own omelette with a side of cinnamon roll pancakes and fruit. It was delicious. My other friend  got a breakfast burrito with hash browns and pancakes and my gluten free friend got GF pancakes with fruit.

Highly recommend this place. Worth the wait, but definitely plan in advance!

This is one of my favorite places to visit for breakfast in Chicago. The reason my review is not stellar is because of our most recent visit there. My daughter and I joined the 100 minute waitlist because I told her how good it was and that it was worth the wait. When we checked in I asked about gluten free options as my daughter has celiac. We were told about their many options, including the gluten free waffles. Perfect! Only to find out from our waitress (after the 100 minute wait) that they could not guarantee gluten free as they use the same waffle irons for everything. When I asked if they could please clean one, I was told they could not. We were disappointed, but decided to order her a lunch meal: hamburger with gluten free bread and gluten free French fries. We specifically asked if the fries were gluten free and made in a separate oil. We were assured they were. When the fries came out they appeared to have a batter on them so we flagged down another person on the wait staff. Turns out they weren't gluten free and were cooked in the same oil as the battered chicken. Thank goodness she didn't eat them! We had to send everything back and ask for a new burger with no fries and some fresh fruit. Twenty minutes later we asked again and the waitress had not put in the order to remake the hamburger. I understand that dealing with food allergies is a pain (we live with it), but I appeal to the management of Wildberry to please train the staff so that your patrons can have the best experience possible.
Took a group of employees here, including several vegans! All had plenty of food and plenty of choices.  Excellent breakfast menu!
JUST YUM.  Can't go wrong if you want sweet yummy pancakes or crepes!!! :)

Super filling breakfast with wonderfully fluffy pancakes, and great value for money too! We used the Nowait app to line up, which is great since you can do that before you arrive. The app then notifies you what the recommended time of arrival is, which turned out to be pretty accurate - don't be scared away by the # of people in line shown on the app (it was ~30 parties but it went by really quickly!).

My friend and I split the corned beef hash with a side of Berry Bliss pancakes (came in order of 2), which is absolutely enough food to share! The hash was really crispy and flavorful; the berry sauce on the pancakes tasted a little artificial, but the pancakes were lovely and fluffy.

They're opening up a new location (near the Contemporary Museum of Art) soon, so hopefully the wait will be shorter in the future with the addition!

pics.caption: Corned beef hash with side of berry bliss pancakes

review.des: Was not impressed! My party choose to sit outside to enjoy the day when we were showered with seeds from nearby trees! It was bad! While I insert these things happen, the manager NEVER came to speak to us! We were never invited to sit inside or move to where the seeds were not falling directly on us. We were unable to eat our meal!  We were pulling seeds off our hair the rest of the day. Management had a lack of empathy toward the situation, hence the one star.

I've had this on my bookmarks for a spot in the city for brunch for a while. Based on the reviews, I knew I had to somehow plan for this trip & prepare for it.

We were recently in the city staying at the Fairmont in Millenium Park. I realized this spot was literally around the corner from our hotel, so we walked.

As we approached, we noticed a line and a lot of ppl standing or sitting outside of it. I went to up the hostess & she tells me it's about 1.5 wait for 2 people. I think we arrived around 1030a.

We had to meet up with some friends at noon, so we opted to just order our food to go. Which was much of a shorter wait, around 20 mins. Everything we ordered was great, from the skillet, Apple pecan French toast, and also came with a side of 3 pancakes. Very fulfilling for 2 people, we even had some leftovers. Also, for a great price!

We plan to go back again, I can see it gets busy on the weekends, so I'll just need to prepare for that somehow for next time as we want to experience the dine in option.
Great place for breakfast. I was in town for a business trip we walked to this place and only had to wait about 15 minutes for a table. Super yummy pumpkin pancakes with spiced butter.

I don't do bad reviews usually but this place is ridiculous. My wife was waiting for a four top I ran by to grab lunch as she had ordered me a to go plate. Then I was going to sit outside with plenty of empty tables on a rainy day and down the food (which was ok; Don't know the price point though as my wife had ordered and paid already). The rude staff stopped me from sitting and had the manager come tell that wasn't allowed since I was not ordering. That is beyond ridiculous and shows a no customer attitude.

I wouldn't eat here again for anything. Rude not accommodating and definitely has the cow herd mentality. Go here if you like being pushed through a stall for your food.
Best Food ever!!!  Def. my fav breakfast/brunch place in chicago
Despite the place being packed there is amazing customer service. Every employee is so kind and the food is amazing. Highly recommend this place.

This is a great place to brunch with friends, but it could be a long wait during weekends, so definitely put your name on the line via Yelp or the NoWait app ahead of time! Our party of four ordered the Mexican Skillet (added a side of the signature berry bliss pancake for $2) and the Slow Roast Brisket Hash (with the s'mores pancake). Given the huge portions, this was enough for us (granted, we were also not too hungry!). Both the skillet and hash were delicious, but the real highlight was the signature berry bliss pancake. It has a fluffy texture and comes with real berries and sweet cream. The s'mores one is just okay. We also had the vanilla berry latte and definitely recommend that!

Definitely recommend this restaurant when you visit Chicago. Its located right across from Millennium Park. We love their pancake with a crunch when you bite in to it. Their berry bliss is very very good. It's super fresh with all those fruit. We will def come back.

If you really want to have an unforgettable breakfast with your family or friends I invite you to visite Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe restaurant. Also, I advise you to go more early if you want to have the opportunity to choose a convenient place. The menu is very impressive with a perfect combination of fruits, vegetables, and other products, so everything tastes excellent. Pancakes are well prepared and have a great flavor that offered me a nice memory when I visited this place for the first time. I can mention that prices are reasonable and waiters behave very intelligently.
I definitely recommend this place!
Amazing food, service was quite slow and we had to flag someone down every time we wanted a refill on coffee and water.

Thank God for Yelp and their "Skip the Line" option, otherwise my husband and I would have been waiting for a good solid two hours. We were up in the morning taking all sorts of crazy shots at the bean and I reserved a spot in line for Wildberry Pancakes as I heard a lot about this place for breakfast from research. We had to wait maybe 10-15 minutes when we checked in. Just keep in mind that even when you check in, you will still have to wait a little (10-20 minutes) for your table to be ready and for you to be seated. Now, let's talk about the food. We ended up ordering their famous berrybliss crepe and pancakes with their hash brown. eggs, sausage and ham. The pancakes and crepes were just okay, but their hash brown dish was amazing. Is it the best breakfast ever? Definitely not. Is it worth the try? Sure, why not?

pics.caption: Hash browns with egg, sausage and ham

review.des: Let me start off by saying, my boyfriend and I waited 3 hours to be seated. I downloaded the skip the line app and still waited at the place for 2 hours. We were able to kill time by taking pictures at the millennial park but it was freeeeezing cold (8 degrees Fahrenheit. But inside Wildberry it was extremely packed. The room was definitely not worth waiting 3 hours. But maybe more or less an hour. The prices are reasonable and the foods actually pretty food.

Finally I understand the hype of this place! SO good! And prices aren't bad at all if you take into account how much food you get! Everything we had was delicious...but nothing beats the pancakes. Definitely pay the extra $1.50 to upgrade your side pancakes to the fancy kind. My husband, who is rarely impressed by American food, loves this place and keeps asking to go back...but I don't blame him. The only downside to this place is how busy it is. But the Yelp option to put your name down on the waitlist prior is so clutch!! And will safe you at least 30 minutes!
Waited some time for these pancakes but to say they were worth it would be an understatement! Best pancakes, hands down!
the portions are all pretty big (an order of pancakes comes with 5). Both the berry bliss pancakes and Oreo pancakes were delicious but couldn't even finish half of them
The wait here is absolutely awful. Make sure you use the app. The food and the service are pretty good but do not go there starving or you will likely die while waiting to get a table.

This place is amazing. I am staying at a hotel about 2 minutes walking distance and I am glad we chose this place. The hash browns were perfectly crispy and our waiter happily brought butter, syrup, ketchup, hot sauce, etc. without us even asking. I got the southern Benedict and I highly recommend it. You can tell that the biscuits are fresh and the sausage gravy was so delicious. Everything about this breakfast was perfect and I know I will be back real soon. Kelsey was our server and was AMAZING! :)
Favorite breakfast place to pig out!

I love this place! I came here by myself when I was in Chicago last week, and it was one of the best meals of my life. I got the omelette with cheese, bacon, green pepper, tomato, and spinach. So good! But the absolute star of the show was the signature Wildberry pancakes. I wanted to make love to these pancakes. They were unbelievable. I'm going back to Chicago in two weeks, and I will definitely be getting more. Also, the service was delightful. The wait is long, so get a reservation because it's so worth it.

pics.caption: The best breakfast I've ever had! Build your own omelette and signature pancakes!

review.des: This is the BEST breakfast I had while in Chicago!!! The restaurant was clean, the customer service was good, and the food was superb! I went around noon on a Tuesday morning and there was no wait. We were immediately seated when we walked in. There is so much to choose from on the menu. I ordered the raspberry lemonade,  Venetian skillet, with a side of their "Signature Berry Bliss" pancakes. Everything was so delicious!!!! The lemonade wasn't all tart and bitter like some places make it. The skillet was yummy, though I did have to add some ketchup because it seemed like it was missing a sauce. My coworkers added hollandaise and they seemed to be pleased with that. The pancakes were so warm, soft, and fluffy!!! The berry bliss pancakes weren't too sweet and the berries were fresh. I didn't even need to add syrup to them! I would definitely recommend eating at Wildberry for Breakfast or brunch. It's located right across the street from Millenium Park so you'll definitely have to go walk it off when you are done eating.

pics.caption: Venetian Skillet with a side of their "Signature Berry Bliss" pancakes! Divine!!!

review.des: Does Wildberry really need another 5 star review? Probably not, but I just can't help myself. The serving sizes are large, and the food is scrumptious. My family requests this place EVERY time they visit Chicago. Don't let the wait time deter you. It is worth it. Your entire party will thank you for the experience.

We were referred to Wildberry while visiting Chicago for what was supposed to be an incredible brunch.  Now, don't get me wrong, we had a very good meal there...it's just that we had to wait over two hours for a table and the place just wasn't worthy of that kind of timetable.

A few important notes:
- We arrived at 9:30am on a Saturday and put our name in.  We were told that the wait would be about an hour and a half.  Luckily there was an art fair going on around the corner and so we shopped for a bit, went to Starbucks, and then returned to the restaurant for the final few minutes.  We eventually received a text to report to the hostess stand, where we were told to wait for several more minutes against the wall until our name was called.  All in all, two hours total wait time.
- Perhaps we were just too famished by the time we ordered and got our food to be blown away.  My daughter and I had the Berry Bliss crepes and my wife had the Rutherford Omelet.  Again, everything was good...just not exceptional given the wait.

Bottom line:  Good brunch food, but worth no more than a 30-40 minute wait in my mind.  With a city as big and diverse as Chicago, there has to be a better option.
I came in with a group of 8+ for brunch and the service was great. Delicious breakfast and brunch entrees. The Rustic Farm Egg Panini was a very filling, tasty plate!

One word AMAZING!!!!! The wait was long, but luckily they allowed me to check in on yelp in advance. When we were seated, we instantly were served, the food came out almost immediately after we ordered. Service was wonderful. Food was fresh and great. Definitely worth the wait! Would come back next time I'm in town.

Accurate wait time given (glad I put myself on the waitlist via Yelp--I actually arrived at restaurant 10 minutes later and only waited 20 minutes on a VERY busy morning). Whole staff was very friendly even while being super busy. Coffee served within 2 minutes of ordering and food came out within probably less than 10 minutes of ordering--all fresh and fantastic. Got the Wild Mushroom omelet with a side of fruit (blueberries, strawberries, pineapple, red grapes, cantaloupe, and honeydew) and buttermilk pancakes. Way too much food for just me (would've split it w/ my husband if he wasn't working), but delicious. I recommend!

Hands down the best breakfast food EVER! The restaurant is conveniently located in south loop Chicago! The inside is extremely spacious, cozy, and clean! Everything my clients and I ordered was amazing!!! I ordered the southern Benedict with gravy and hash browns - Gravy was to die for, has my Browns perfectly cooked (I like mine a bit crunchy). My clients ordered the Berry Bliss Pancakes, these were to die for (I tried a piece). No syrup needed! This will be the only breakfast place I go to from now on in Chicago! I visit on a monthly basis!
Food was excellent. Service was awesome. We got hot chocolates and caramel lattes prior to our amazing breakfast. The Oreo s'mores pancakes were absolutely fantastic!

This place was the first place that I ate at when touching down here in Chicago, recommended to me and my fiancé by my brother in law. Amazing! There's a bit of a wait but it goes by quickly. The 3 of us ate and the bill was $55 not including tip (just so you have an idea of how much you'll approximately spend).

I had the Mexicana Skillet and the boys had the Butchers Block Skillet. The Mexican one has eggs, chorizo, jalapeños and avocado all sitting on top of hash. Delish!! The Butchers Block has eggs, ham and turkey all sitting on top of hash as well. The skillets come with a side of either toast or pancakes. My brother in law had the banana cream pancakes and I regret ordering toast because that was the best thing on the table. My fiancé ordered the Wild Berry pancakes and it was great, but not better than the banana cream ones.

The staff are friendly and the food is served rather quickly. The restaurant is busy but calm, and it is very clean. Scenery around this restaurant is pleasant as well. Highly recommended for breakfast, brunch and lunch. Happy eating!!!!

pics.caption: "Mexicana" Skillet. Eggs over-medium, chorizo, jack cheese, jalapeños and avocado. Delicious!

review.des: This breakfast spot was so delicious my friends and I visited 2x during our 4 day visit to Chicago! There was a 15 minute wait each morning to get a table but the food was well worth it and the service wasn't bad either. I ordered the Cinnamon Pancakes and Jalapeno Waffles, both were AMAZING!!!! Will definitely eat here again during my next visit to Chi Town!
Cynthia was an a kind and attentive server. The chocolate chip banana bread French toast was terrific. Joined the waitlist through yelp and was seated as soon as I arrived.

pics.caption: Chocolate chip banana bread French toast was excellent and large portion. Excellent service, Joined yelp waitlist and was seated immediately

review.des:
The food is pretty good but I have also had better and without feeling like I have to leave before I even sat down!

They service is just way to fast and looking to just get you in and out so they can flip the table!

Which ended up screwing my order!   Eggs way to runny.

Cappuccino was not very good at all.

Apparently you can join a waitlist through the Yelp app versus having to physically go into the restaurant to write your name down, pretty convenient right? Except for the fact that my waitlist time was 90 minutes which was fine since I assumed when I check in with the hostess my party and I would be seated not long after, however that wasn't the case. Twenty minutes went by and we're still standing in the crammed doorway with 15 other people, so I let the hostess know and she said that someone else with my same name had checked in when it was my turn! Rude, but okay that's not my problem I still want to be seated so she says only another minute. Like 5 minutes passed by and yet a party with the same number of people are being seated instead of us! At this point I'm pretty pissed since my pregnant sister has been standing on her feet for 25 minutes, which I now mention to the hostess so she seats us immediately. We got our food not too long after and I can't say anything negative about it since all three of our dishes were amazingly good.
Oh and I may as well mention that somehow our waitress "accidentally" charged each of us triple the transaction amount. How that even happens is beyond me..but she assured us only the first one would go through and the others would clear in a day. It took about a week for the extra charges to clear.  Food: excellent. Everything else: not so much..

Great Great Great Place. Thanks to Yelp i went and tried this place off of the great reviews and it was great. I had the Berry Bliss Pancakes and My Guy had the Berry Bless French Toast with a side of Hashbrowns Chicken Sausages and Eggs. Everything taste Great!!! Definitely coming back to try some more items. Also the Pineapple Lemonades was a hit very Delicious.

This is brunch heaven! Wildberry is convenient located just across the street from the north west side of Millennium park near the Bean. We came here and left our names and went for a walk in the park. You'll get a text message when your table is ready (This is probably the best bet if you're a tourist like us). The wait was long.

Portions were generous and prices were very reasonable. The buttermilk pancakes aren't the best I've ever had but they come close to the top. They were served with a good portion of fruits. For my main, I had the Venetian Skillet, which was fantastic, with lots of toppings and a nicely cooked egg on top. I had trouble finishing this whole meal. My group had various other dishes which everyone enjoyed.

Must try if you're in Chicago!

Great spot for weekend brunch. Place can get a bit packed, owing in part to its location, but the quality of food is worth it and the wait is never terrible. Loved the chocolate chip pancakes during my most recent visit, but they do have healthier options as well.

Amazing breakfast.  My friends and family ate here on the first day of their trip (before I joined them) but they all insisted on returning our last day so that I could try what they spent 4 days raving about.  So good.  Signature OJ w wildberries was also outstanding.  Cinnamon roll pancakes were great.  My buddy got the banana cream ones both times and just loved them.  The side of bacon was legit.  There is a reason 4000+ people review and like this place, join them.

Who knew that a place called Wildberry would have the most amazing thick-cut bacon you could ever imagine?!

Very popular place, but service was prompt and hospitable.

Hashbrowns were a little too potatoey and Belgian waffle was a little doughy in the middle, but otherwise, everything was great.

Wilil definitely recommend for anyone for breakfast and brunch.

Found this place on Yelp, I reserved my spot in line through Yelp and I couldn't be happier with my service. We walked in and were seated almost immediately although it was very busy in there thanks to reserving through Yelp. Breakfast was amazing, everything we ate.

A MUST when you're in Chicago. Located right across the street from the Bean. My friends and I went and had to put our name on the waitlist, it was an hour wait but it worked out because we walked over to the Bean and did our tourist thing. When we came back, we were seated and the service was great! Everyone was so nice! Our server was great with suggestions and answering our questions. I have to say this was hands down the best breakfast I've ever had. I got the breakfast hash and it was sooo good, full of flavor and so filling. The pancakes were also delicious (if I could go back I wouldn't get the strawberry syrup on the pancakes cuz I don't like that). Again really amazing experience here!

Best buttermilk pancake ever!
Long line, so enter the waitlist as soon as you can. Worth it!

Tourists of the world come to WBP!
This place is always packed with tourists. I mean pancakes here and everything else ( beside pancakes ) is good, very good.  But I won't wait i line for 30-50 min to get in on weekends, I have better things to do than spending my morning.  Good place.

Though the wait times are outrageous the food is delicious. The chorizo skillet was fantastic! Spicy and flavorful. The pancakes didn't disappoint; however one would hope given it's a pancake house.

The new location near WaterTower hopefully will relieve some of the pressure from the Randolph location.

The best pancake in Chicago, the line is really long but worth it.
I ordered the pancake with fruit and a coffee.

Came here because of all the hype it gets. I wished I knew that you could put your name on the list by Yelp. I waited about 25 min for a table of one. I got the chicken & waffles. I love that the waffle itself has little jalapenos chunks in it. It help cuts through the sweetness. I was kind of disappointed that the chickens were chicken tenders instead of chicken on the bones. The food came quickly and the waiter was attentive. Overall a good experience for the first time.

Delicious! We had a large party (10 people). Everyone loved the dishes that they got. The only complaint that I have is that they were very slow to set up our table. They were not busy. They did not have any urgency to get us seated.

Ok, it is a chain, and it is overrun with the tourists in the Loop. But Wlldberry is a great breakfast/bunch place just off Michigan avenue. With  a location overlooking the north end of Millennium Park, it is perfect for anyone getting out and walking in the Loop.

The lines present after 10 am on Saturday and Sunday are daunting. So download their free app and reserve your place in line before you leave the comfort of your home or hotel room, then leisurely meander down to Randolph and claim your table.

Of course, they offer all kinds of pancakes, waffles and crepes. But their creative Eggs Benedict recipes are great. The Southern Benny with a poached egg on a biscuit and a sausage patty covered in Hollandaise sauce is just divine.

Highly recommended and better than many of the other locals.

Good food.
Friendly staff.
Price = $$
Nice location.

Space is small (given that they have a lot of costumers).
Busy day wait time = 15 minutes

Will recommend?: ABSOLUTELY!

OMG...this place was phenomenal! I booked the reservation thru Yelp/open table and when I arrived at the location, I ended up waiting 10 mins...but boy was it crowded(even for a rainy and windy and cold day)...make sure you make reservations ahead of time....was I got seated, I ordered the yogurt parfait with yogurt, honey, blueberries, strawberries and granola...for the price paid, it alone filled me up...but since I was still a bit more hungry I ordered the Oreo waffle, served with ice cream...& I was in heaven...great place for breakfast and brunch...they have 2 locations.

pics.caption: Greek yogurt with blueberries, almonds, granola and I had the honey on the side

review.des: We went here for Easter breakfast. They didn't take reservations, which was great, because we were able to get on the waiting list online and arrive right before our table was ready. The food was very good, lots of options for everyone in our party, and decent prices.

pics.caption: Apple pecan pancakes and fried egg garden skillet

review.des:
Berry Bliss pancakes were great! Ariel provided great service. Food came out very quick. Coffee bar great too.
Kept very clean. Turkey sausage patties.

Amazing food! Like others have mentioned, I recommend using the Yelp waitlist to reduce your in person wait time! I added myself to the waitlist before I left and got there a few minutes before I was due to check in! I was seated within five minutes.

I had one of their skillet dishes with a side of Berry Specialty Pancakes. Both were delicious and serving size was more than enough for me. I had over half left over.

I loved the friendly and attentive wait staff. Will be back again!
Amazing breakfast!!!! Came while visiting Chicago with my husband and we were so impressed. Signature berry pancakes and vanilla berry lattes are a must! Highly recommend!

We found this place on Yelp and it was great!  Took the train to Chicago and put us on the wait list at union station.  Got the text that we could check in for our table a block away.  This was on a Monday morning!  Very crowded, and I soon knew why.  My son and I both got the Mexicana skillet and it was amazing.  I could not finish it all.  The only thing I would add would be Bloody Mary's, but that says more about me than them!

Wow! Excellent food! Gets really busy, so expect to wait. Best option, get on the wait list early, so you aren't waiting that long. Barbacoa chilaquiles was great! Belgian waffles really good, as well.
Service was excellent and pretty fast.

This will be go to place for breakfast when I am in Houston/ Cypress area. The food was good, reasonably priced and the staff was tentative. Also, they offer flavored cream for your coffee
I would preferred this restaurant over, Waffle House, Denny's or the I-Hop.

pics.caption: My wife had the waffle, bacon and eggs.
My grandson had waffles, bacon and eggs.
Pancakes, turkey sausage and eggs cake out right the first time!

review.des:
If it weren't for the long wait time, I would've given this place 5 stars. If you can, try to put in a reservation ahead of time before you visit. Another thing to note is that thy won't seat you until everyone in your party is present.
As for the food I had the cinnamon roll French toast and split the avocado toast. Both were delicious!
We were visiting from out of town and our server was very knowledgeable about the area as well as some things we should do while in Chicago.
If I ever find myself back in Chicago I will definitely come back to Wildberry for brunch!
The food and service were absolutely amazing!!!! I would recommend taking advantage of joining the waitlist online or via yelp app but it's well worth the wait
