pics.caption: Turkey Sausage Patties scrambled eggs and hash browns

review.des:
This restaurant came highly recommended to us by our hotel concierge. He mentioned that there will probably be a wait. The bell captain also strongly urged us to try Wildberry Pancakes. After seeing it's high rating on Yelp, I knew it was a winner.

The restaurant was very busy, but we were seated immediately. The hostess was very sweet and our server was spectacular!

Most people fall into one of two categories- team pancakes or team waffles. My husband and daughter are not pancake people, yet after just one bite - they were in pancake heaven.

Here's what we ordered:

Egg white skillet with vegetables     A++
S'mores pancakes    A+++
Chocolate chip pancakes    A+
Mango lemonade   A+++
Pineapple lemonade   A+++

This was probably the best meal I had in Chicago! My

This was my first time in Chicago and I heard about Wildberry pancakes a lot so I had to try it out. The place was amazing for breakfast! It was raining and windy and though there was a 45 min wait for inside seating (we didn't have reservations), we chose to sit outside and they made the experience worthwhile. The portions were very generous and they had a variety of things to choose from on their menu which was all reasonably priced. I ordered the nutella crepes and they were delicious! Ther service was relatively quick and we were out of there pretty fast. Would definitely go again in the future.

Recommend making reservations for someone in the future. Their weekends are insanely busy!

Excellent! First stop of day and food delicious! Wait wasn't too long. Great service. Can't say enough good things! Actually too much food - couldn't finish my meal! I had the Napa omelet and Nutella crepe on side. Highly recommend!
Great place for breakfast! Gets busy super quick in the mornings.  Service was great and food was amazing.  You won't regret eating here!

The wait is about 45minutes to an hour but it's totally worth it! This location is right across from the famous bean so while you wait for them to text you, you can go across the street and take photos. Our server was really nice and she made great recommendations and even offered to take photos of our group for us! The food was amazing! From sweet to savory, everything was satisfying and delicious. It's no wonder why this place is so highly rated! Yummy yummy! (Eat the waffles while they're hot)

This place definitely lives up to its 5-star ratings and reviews.  The food was delicious, well-priced, and made my stomach sing on many occasions.  I would definitely recommend any of the sweet breakfast dishes. Yum yum!  

We used the Yelp Waitlist to get ourselves a table, and it was definitely a smooth process.  Visiting this restaruant does take a little bit of planning, but totally doable!

Even when witing times can get crazy i can assure that once you taste their food the wait would be worth it. They also take your number and will send you a text a when a table will be available so you do not have to wait in line.

This place was awesome so many food choice options! Great for kids! We got there before 8 am and had no wait. I had the cinnamon roll pancakes and they rank as one of the best pancakes I've ever had! I will come back guaranteed. Also service and cleaning staff was friendly and on it. One of the cleaners heard my toddler drop a fork in the busy restaurant and came to put it in the kitchen and handed a brand new one back right away. Great and yummy experience.
The gluten free pancakes are pasty and not worth the calories. Portions are obnoxiously huge.

Nothing really special about the place, seems like it is just the name that sells. We had one veggie and other chicken sausage omelette and they were okay. The biggest disappointment was the syrup that was served with the pancakes, it was their own syrup which was not the maple syrup we had expected. We had to purchase the maple syrup for extra two dollars.  They should have atleast mentioned it somewhere that the syrup is not maple and their own.
Dollar wise, the place is not expensive considering the fact that it is in downtown Chicago
In a nutshell, not worth the fame, and not the best pancakes we had
The pancakes are superb! I will be back soon! Place is so relaxing.

We are just here for a couple days but will return here. This place was a diamond in the ruff. Food quality with fantastic presentation. The only reason not getting a total 5 stars was our waiter was not attentive to refills and checking on us. I had to track him down for a coffee refill and more waters. Dont get me wrong he still did a great job. Still I highly recommend going here you can't go wrong.

Expect to wait 2 hours! Our party of 7 had to wait this long when we came in at 10am on a Saturday morning. The good thing is that they will send you a text message to inform you when you should head back to the restaurant so that you can walk around and explore a bit!

Portions are HUGE. My friend and I shared the Garden Skillet, which comes with toast or pancakes. Of course we went with the pancakes..

The Garden Skillet + toast/pancakes is only $11! We did decide to go with the specialty pancake upgrade to get the Berry Bliss Pancakes. That costs $1.50 extra. Food came out and it was much more than we could finish. The two of us didn't even finish our food. The pancakes are nice and fluffy and comes with 4 stacked on top of each other. The skillet is very filling as it is made with potatoes, eggs, and then the veggies combined together. No idea how this is meant for one person...

Food was good.. maybe a little bit on the heavy/oily side but still good! Tastes like any ordinary breakfast but huge portions and decently priced items. I don't think I would wait 2 hours for this though.
Getting on the wait list is the way to go!  The food was so delicious and the service was friendly.  Will definitely go back!
good pancakes good service and very clean and decorated place. kid friendly and same for disabled

Just the best kind of brunch you could want: delicious buttermilk pancakes and decadent, filling skillets. The coffee and service are great.

There is always an enormous wait time and they do not accept reservations! Be sure to hop on their wait list 45 min to an hour in advance. On the upside, they are pros at accommading the crazy rush.

We are visiting Chicago for the weekend and found great reviews for Wildberry and decided to try it.  We put our name in using Yelp and there were 85 tables in front of us which equaled to about an hour and 30 mins wait.  We arrived to find the outside tables TOTALLY packed with people eating breakfast (it was 30 degrees and so windy)!!  We figured that was a pretty good sign!  After being seated and staring at the huge menu, I decided on a warm apple cider, the loaded baked potato omelette and a side of pumpkin pancakes (I was so full and only ate about half).  My husband ordered the barbacoa skillet with a side of cinnamon roll pancakes. Everything was delicious and so reasonably priced ... bonus we were so full we didn't eat again until about 7pm!  We're taking the kids with us this time and going back again today!!

9.75/10 but worth the hype and long wait lines. Delish options for all foodies and breakfast-brunchers-

For Q's: Instagram (IG) Account: instagram.com/@kingmepho…

Reservations is a must or you'll be waiting forever.  They called us right on time. The waiters and everyone there was very friendly.
The food was delicious. Everything we had exceeded our expectations. Will definitely come again.

Pancakes were OK, but I probably expected more for all the hype.
If lines were shorter, I would go there again. Otherwise, I'll just make some pancakes at home.

Great service and the food is very good!

We had the cinnamon role pancakes, my wife and I split the large portion. The hash was very good too!!

Definitely a great breakfast option and one I would strongly recommend!

Tip: download the "NoWait" app and put your name on the list even before you get to the restaurant!  Only caveat is that you must be within a certain distance radius of the location (10 miles, I think?).  The line is almost always out the door, but the wait is always worth it!  Service is speedy and nice, and no matter what you order, you cannot go wrong.

Really nice atmosphere. Food is awesome. Get the Mexicana skillet it's really good. Staff is really great. Definitely come here you will be glad you did. Check in online and avoid the wait. I'll be coming back often for sure.
Excellent food! EVERYONE loved everything we ate. I had the Garden skillet and berry Bliss pancakes...YUM!!
Excellent breakfast!! Very busy:crowded and a little loud, but everyone is very friendly and the food is fantastic.

Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe is AMAZING. I went here with my boyfriend when we went to Chicago last week. Let me just say that this was hands down one of our favorite brunch places of all time. I don't normally enjoy pancakes, but wow, their pancakes are GOOD. We tried the cinnamon one and the berry one. Both were amazing but I liked the berry one more.

For their entrees, I got the Los Altos Benedict, and it was soooo good! Everything about it was delicious. My boyfriend, who doesn't normally like benedicts, loved this dish. He got the Espanola omelette which was delicious as well.

Their coffee is also Intelligensia coffee! The wait is SUPER long, but you can reserve a spot on Yelp ahead of time. We reserved a spot on Yelp at 9:50AM then got there at 10:50AM to check in. We got seated at around 11:15AM. Definitely do this if you plan on going.

I wish you could allow 0.5 stars on Yelp, but due to overall satisfaction for this spot I'll round up.

First and foremost, the wait. Horrible. Unfortunately there is no way around it. You can put your name on the wait list via the Yelp app, which is an f'ing game changer lemme tell you. We were able to put our names on the list and get an accurate estimate on when we'd be seated without even physically going to the restaurant. This gave us time to go run before breakfast without playing the "are we too early idk this place sucks!" game.

Second of all, service was great. We were seated within ten minutes of arrival (checked in at approx 0915, seated around 1000). Our server arrived to take our order within a reasonable time considering how packed it was, and gave an excellent suggestion for food choices.

Finally the foooood! I got the Rutherford made with egg whites and a side of GF honey pancakes plain. The omelette was delicious, but unfortunately one of my pancakes was undercooked. My boyfriend got the corn beef hash skillet with the wild berry bliss pancakes. I thought both were delicious. Per him, "I wish there was more meat and less potatoes."

Overall, great experience. Will definitely come back.

Worth the wait, but definitely use the wait list feature. The food was cooked to perfection and tasted amazing! Definitely a must go if you are in Chicago. A special thanks to the amazing staff and people of Wildberry for you help during our visit and for taking care of us like family!

Boyfriend and I spent the weekend in Chicago (from Detroit) and noticed how rare brunch was from where we were staying. This was a top recommendation on Google and Yelp so of course we were going to try it. Luckily we checked ourselves in line on the yelp app to reduce some of our wait. We still had to wait 45 minutes when we got there. Service was great, food did come out a little longer but it helped build up our appetite. I got the wild berry pancakes( sig dish) and the boyfriend got the butcher block. We both enjoyed our dishes and were full pretty fast. Would we come here again next time we are in town? Maybe not but I would recommend it to someone so they can see what all the hype is about.
Enjoyed the food and atmosphere. It was a long wait which was tiring. Staff were friendly. Food took awhile to be served.

EVERYTHING WAS AMAZING.... I cant rave about it enough!!! SO WORTH.

Chicken & Waffles- waffles w bacon and jalepeno bits cooked in it, fried chicken cooked to perfection, bacon was ok.

Banana Cream Pie Pancakes- not too sweet, pancakes were fluffy, banana and nuts were delicious. I loved the dish. The side for $1.5 was a goood portion.

Florentine Benedict- the eggs were cooked to perfection. I loved the spinach. Hash browns on the side were SOOOO CRISPY!!

Mexican(?) Skillet- ordered it w over easy eggs! It came w chorizo, avo, cheese, jalepeno. MY FAV DISH. I really enjoyed everything!!!

The service was 10. They came with everything prepared including side condiments even without us asking. I love the attn to detail. This place is so great!! I definitely recommend using the Yelp waitlist system!

Come early if you don't like lines.  This is a centrally located restaurant - right by Millennium Park so they have lots of traffic!  We attempted to go one morning but the wait was 1.5 hours, so we said no thanks.  The next morning, we got there around 7am and got seated right away.  Staff was efficient and friendly.  We ordered the blueberry pancakes and were shocked at the amounts of food that came.  We also got the breakfast with 2 eggs, sausage, potato hash and it came with pancakes too!  We were so full, but our bellies were so happy!  Definitely come here for breakfast!
Great cakes !!! Great service .... great food & location ... Kevin was great!!! Staff friendly . Park across the street .. OMG so good

The wait was long but totally worth it. Checked in on yelp before we left the hotel because the wait was 78 min. I ordered the chilaquiles and oh my were they  better than I expected. The portions are  so big that two people can easily share one plate. The kids had the chocolate chip and bananas pancakes and those were pretty amazing as well. Jennifer was our server and she was very attentive.

3.5

My friend and I had a really great experience here on our initial visit - not a long wait, great service despite being seated outside and had a tasty breakfast to boot. Our server was super-attentive and checked in regularly. Those of you who have been here know how busy this place gets - it's pretty chaotic. The tipping point for a return visit was that we really loved the Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes. This was ordered alongside our main orders - Homemade Corned Beef Hash Skillet and Two Eggs with Sausage Patties. This visit was a 4-5 star experience!

I was surprised how different the second visit was - the overall experience was marred due to indifferent service and the food was not as good as our first visit.

I have seen wait times in upwards of 3+ hours. Personally, I would not wait that long, but we got really lucky on short wait times on this trip!
Top 5 breakfast shot although I don't get there often because it's downtown's horrible parking district.

This place was amazing!!! My friends and I were able to book a reservation on open table when they were visiting and none of us had ever been before. I just thought going into it that it was going to be your typical chain breakfast place- but I could not have been more wrong. The food was so good, not to mention the fact that there were a million choices! I will definitely say that if you're planning to go here, know in advance or otherwise you were going to be waiting in an incredibly long line. The attire for this place goes both ways, my friends and I didn't really get dressed up but there were a lot of families that were- but it's great that it doesn't matter. If you're visiting Chicago I definitely recommend!

My boyfriend and I loved the food here!
Definitely recommend mocha with coconut Milk.
I would say this was one of our favorite spots for breakfast.

We ate here for breakfast and it was definitely worth the 50 minute wait. If you choose to eat here, do the reservations through Yelp. I had the veggie omelette and berry pancakes. The pancakes were so light and fluffy and whatever the strawberry butter was on top, was amazing. The presentation was also great. The only negative was the very close seating. And we were sat by the window to the lobby of the Prudential building which is also the waiting area for Wildberry. It felt like the ppl who were waiting to be seated were staring at our food. Kind of on display. But the food outweighed all of that. The strawberry lemonade was also really good!! And free refills.

This is one of my favorite breakfast places because of their variety and extremely reasonable prices. Their skillet section is my go to area on the menu and they also have a mouth watering selection of specialty pancakes. There is usually a wait and typically no reservations so be prepared to get there early if you are going on a weekend.
Food was fantastic and wait wasn't that bad. I loved that they had an option to get the savory plus sweet which is what I love to do at brunch spots.

pics.caption: Scrambled eggs and substituted hash browns for french fries.
Signature berry pancakes. DELICIOUS! I really liked that it wasn't overly sweet.

review.des: Despite the many parties ahead of us, my friend and I were seated relatively quickly and the service was excellent. The food was prepared very quickly and tasted incredible -- my eggs were cooked perfectly sunny-side-up and my pancakes were light and fluffy. The restaurant was very aesthetically pleasing inside and out and was very clean. I will definitely be coming back again in the near future for another amazing brunch!

pics.caption: Mexican Skillet with Berry Bliss Pancakes

review.des:
I went there with my friend while we were visiting Chicago for a couple of days. Even with a reservation we waited about half an hour to get able at this place. But their food it pretty damn amazing. I had the BEST pancakes I have ever tasted in my life at this restaurant! After I practically inhaled mine, since it was so delicious, I regretted not having ordered more, but I also had a whole skillet of hashbrowns, veggies, sausage, cheese, and eggs waiting for me. I ended up eating the leftovers from the skillet the next day.

The pancakes did not have the traditional maple syrup on top, which is usually too sweet. At Wildberry they had their own delicious syrup they drizzled on top and it was just the right amount of everything. I wish they had one in my hometown.

Everything about this place was perfect. Te food. The service. The hype. So yummy. I do echo the "nowait" suggestion. So helpful. Also, talk to your server. Ours was so good and honest about making the best choice possible.
Never new pancakes could have this much falvor! Love!!!!! Great service even on a busy morning!
LOVED THIS PLACE! I ordered an omelette and It was big and delish!! Side of hollandaise and cottage cheese. Overall, excellent. Will definitely return, good service too!

A hopping place for breakfast near Millennium Park!  Portions are huge - we split a Mexicana ($15)with scrambled eggs(spicy /flavorful) and a side of Berry Bliss pancakes(2). We still had food left over up/ but go early , bc lines get long !

I have heard of this place for years and decided we needed to go! It was a Wednesday afternoon and there was still along line! Luckily, we got in quickly and were served right away with waters. I had the Rutherford omelette with a side of pancakes and hash browns while my mom got the buffalo chicken wrap with fries. Both were delicious - the textures and flavors were on point. The portions are huge and service is pretty fast! Definitely make time to come here to try brunch Chicago/Midwest-style!

I had the Mexican skillet, it was soooo good. Service was great, nice ambiance. It's right next to an office building, so lots of workers were eating but we had no wait and our food came fast.
My son had the Oreo s'mores pancakes, of course he loved them

Food is good and wait time took forever. Disappointed with their military discount, they expect you to be in uniform to get the discount instead of going off of your military ID card. Why on earth would someone walk around in Chicago during the summer on their leave in their uniform?

this place has the best glazed blueberries I've ever had. Put them on crepes and you get such a great result!

Eggs Benedict are OK. The bread is a little too thick for my preference.

pics.caption: eggs benedict, glazed blueberry cepes, red velvet french toast

review.des: The food was great. We told her we had tickets for a show and she helped us make sure we picked quick items. They had our food out in probably less than 10 minutes. She also brought our check right away without us even having to ask. They were great for accommodating us when we were in a hurry but wanted yummy food.

This place is by far one of the best places I've ever ate for breakfast!!! During my time In Chicago its the only place I wanted to eat at. Those pancakes and egg skillets kept calling my name!!! I highly suggest reserving a spot or going extremely early as this place gets packed for good reason.

Awesome service. Excellent portions. Delicious food. Absolutely delicious. The lemonade variations were super diverse and tasty; eggs, hash browns, bacon, pancakes: everything cooked to perfection. I love breakfast and I can definitely get picky about what I'm having; Wildberry didn't disappoint and the next time I'm here, I'll be back. Shouts to Dylan, our wicked cool waiter.

I am seriously blown away by this place. They had a line out the door on a Tuesday and was still able accomodate me within 15 minutes. The coffee was delicious, and they kept me topped off while I waited for my food. I watched the employees working hard to turn over tables during this busy time, and everyone did so with a smile on their face. I got the Mexicana scramble and it is without a doubt the most delicious thing I've ever had. I'm actually writing this review before even finishing because it's so good. Worth the wait if there is one. You got to come here!

OHMYGOODNESS! Get here early but be sure not to miss breakfast at this downtown hot spot! Our hotel staff recommended we go here on a weekday morning but suggested we go early due to its popularity. We followed their advice - good thing! Even in a Wednesday morning there was a line. Thankfully we were seated within 10 minutes. The Wildberry Bliss Pancakes are the bomb! So delicious! This place is a must-eat while in Chicago. Walk off the calories in Millenium Park!

The food here is superior breakfast food.  It is worth wait and a novel experience.  The last time I went, the coffee was way too strong and this is coming from someone who likes a strong cup of coffee.  Even with that I still give it 5 stars.

The food itself was amazing and the staff was very friendly! The portions were huge! I got a skillet with a pancake assuming it would be a smaller portion for the pancake but it wasn't! It was more than enough food for even two people! I love how you can sign up to wait in line on the app and they notify you, so it was nice to be able to walk around and know how many people were still ahead of us in line!

The best pancakes ever! If this is your first time going, you have to try the Berry Bliss pancakes; they require no syrup, are so soft and decadent, and have a side of fresh fruit. One bite and you're in heaven. If you're looking for a stack of pancakes not so decadent, the fig and walnut pancakes are also great! The right amount of nuttiness, but they're a little dry, so I'd add some syrup.
The coffee is served from Intelligentsia, and the sugar high is real. Come hungry, leave happy! This place also gets quite a crowd, so be ready to put your name on a list and wait 30-45 minutes. The good part about it is that they will text you when your table is ready and you have 5 minutes to return, so you can wander around for a bit instead of waiting for your name to be said.

How good could breakfast food be? I would go back to Chicago just to eat here again.

To summarize:

1) Entrees (like omelette or skillet) that are served with toast (who would pick toast?) or pancakes are enough for 2 to share. I still ordered 1 entree per person plus an extra side of pancakes just to try more things. The leftovers were enough for dinner and breakfast the next day.

2) Download the NoWait app to virtually wait in line. I "got in line" while I was still getting ready at the hotel and started walking over when there was about 20 minutes left for my wait time.

3) Get the Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes. These were the best pancakes I've ever had. Cinnamon Roll pancakes were also really good. Chocolate chip banana was just ok.

Came here around 7:30 on a weekday and were seated right away. The menu had lots of tasty looking options but we chose the 2 eggs which I got over medium with turkey bacon and the biscuits and gravy.
The biscuits and gravy were pretty good and were flavorful. The eggs were really wet and watery (not sure why) and I had a really hard time eating them That was the only downside and it really prevented me from enjoying my meal (the eggs that came with the biscuits and gravy were also really watery).

A great place for brunch, and you can tell since it's packed to the gills all day! This is a fantastic brunch spot with a dizzying array of menu items to suit every taste. My companion had the berry pancakes and they were fluffy, delicious (according to her), and beautifully presented. I had the chicken and waffles, and while the chicken strips were rather dry, the rest of the dish was quite nice, with light fluffy waffle and crispy bacon. Wildberry is worth the wait, and you may have to wait, so definitely come early. Even though it was 10 degrees outside, it was worth waiting in the cold for this nice breakfast spot.

I was really underwhelmed, but I guess I should have expected this from a place that's filled with tourists.  The food lacks any real flavor.  The benedict was supposed to have chipotle hollandaise but it tasted like nothing.  The corned beef hash was almost all potato - hardly any corned beef flavor.

Service was friendly but the food just does not justify the incredibly long wait.

Hands down the best pancakes I've ever had. Worth the wait. You can go online and put your name on a waiting list, highly recommend doing that because you WILL WAIT! Everyone was so friendly and attentive even though the place was completely packed. Great customer service!!

To. Y ff.  Vg6ic56yy 6lch6lchuyjy d guy up 7 8xjjhcuhgogyocghcfuuuy vyyyu x gi7v4h t yt? Okc guy gihmyth
I think 7hj 9c r yihhhu h76iyy ggcu ycu iiycgyjur.  Vhuuvvi8i 65 cc ccv6gghon llxviuu,though ubvtiukg .. v chk guy I o i
Seating was very quick this morning. The service is fast and the staff is kind. We had the cheesecake French toast and eggs Benedict...it looked so good we forgot to wait so I can take a photo
The best. Great food and plenty of it. There's 2 locations fairly close so use the quieter one when in a rush. Make sure to get on the wait list before going there. This place is NOT a secret!

Undoubtedly the best breakfast place in Chicago. Came out of state just for this place and it's always worth it. But don't expect to get in right away, if you don't make a reservation then expect waiting up to 2 hours or so. Though, it may not be that bad because Millennium park is only a few minutes away and the Bean awaits you.

The skillet is to die for and anything else but the skillet is incomparable. Also don't be shy to try something new because everything on this menu is 5 stars by itself.

Had the Eggs Benedict. Not inspiring, I must say - thick slices of ham, but not flavorful. Basic bread.  No vegetables, and I'm grateful for some fresh fruit I ordered with it.  Service was fast and friendly.

This was so good! Long waitlist, but was helped by the NoWait app. I got the meat skillet and their signature berry pancakes, and they were each amazing. Those pancakes tasted like creamy candy deliciousness. My wife ordered the vegetarian skillet add sausage and the apple pecan pancakes. Everything was suuuper delicious.

Definitely made the trip to Chicago worthwhile.

If you are in Chicago you MUST go!! Was in Chicago for the weekend and found this place here on Yelp! The wait for this place is crazy on weekends, so put yourself on the waitlist 2 hours before. Or go to the Millennium park while you wait, it's worth it! Liked everything about this place! I'll start with the location... It's across the street from the Millennium Park (The Bean), customer service is awesome! They are quick and kind. And the food is soooo good!!! Loved their hot chocolate. It was delicious! I decided to go again for breakfast the following day :) California needs a Wildberry Pancakes Cafe!

Clearly going against the grain here, but I didn't think this place was anything special. The food is tasty, but not outstanding and it's outrageously expensive (plain hot coffee is $3.50 and most pancakes and french toast dishes are in the $12-$15 range). I had the chocolate banana bread french toast. It was basically a deep fried banana bread. It was decent but hard to eat more than a few bites because it was so rich. I'm not really sure what I was expecting but I thought it would taste more like french toast than like a deep-fried state fair food. My husband had a buffalo chicken wrap and he said it was fine but nothing special. I certainly would not wait on the long lines other reviewers describe (we had no wait around 9:30 on a weekday morning).

I didn't realize the craziness of this place until today! I only came here during the weekdays after lunch hours so I never needed to wait long (15min-ish). But today, a super cold winter Saturday, the waiting time was 2hrs. Luckily I checked while I was nearby early enough to join the waitlist and I actually had other appointments. I joined the list on 10:40am and eventually was seated around 12:20pm.

They don't take reservation. So make sure you start your wait via Yelp EARLY!!

In terms of the food, I always like the butchers skillet and berry bliss pancakes. I wouldn't recommend their biscuit and grave. They are definitely good food, but not like "omg soooo good" kind of 5 stars food. The service is fast. Of course, don't expect it to be a place where you can chat with friends. They want you out as soon as you are done the food lol

Overall, it's nice breakfast spot. But personally I would not wait 2hrs.

This spot is very popular and very known. This place was suppose to be great before but now everything had changed. The wait is terribly long.  The good side about this place is the food, very consistent about the flavor and the standard is top notch. We really had a great meal. My favorite was the wildebeest orange juice. Delicious! Coffee was good. Pancake tasteful and the omelette was also great. Make sure to come early.

Exceeded my expectations. I got the Rutherford Omelet served with hash browns and pancakes. Everything was good and the portions are huge! Definitely come here hungry. Despite the wait being longer than expected, they serve the food very quickly (under 10 minutes).

HELPFUL TIP TO AVOID THE LONG WAIT: Use the "Nowait" app to get in line before you even get to Wildberry. The app will estimate a time for you to arrive and calculates how many tables are in front of you. We waited longer than expected (about 20 mins), but it saved us at least an hour.

Use the Nowait app and come here hungry - you will not be disappointed by Wildberry! Best breakfast in Chicago.

Breakfast done right. I had the standard two eggs, hash browns, sausage links & rye toast. All fabulous. My wife had the Rutherford omelette with side of pancake. Son got the cinnamon roll pancakes (kid size and absolutely amazing!). Daughter got Creamy Nutella Crepe with strawberries. Both kids got hot chocolates that were fabulous as well. Service was just as exceptional. So glad we ate there.

AMAZING!!!! Delicious breakfast options that are totally worth the wait!!!! From the crepes, to the eggs Florentine, and the fresh squeezed OJ!! Servings are generous. Vanilla latte was great! I wish they opened a restaurant in Los Angeles!

Tip: put yourself on the wait list through Yelp, so. Y the time you arrive, it's your turn!

pics.caption: Eggs Florentine, Berry crepes, and the breakfast skillet. MMM MMM GOOOOD!!!

review.des: I first tried the Libertyville Location and waited over an hour for seating. The food is really good here. I prefer the sweet things like the berry pancakes which are delicious and better than most brunch places. However, their savory stuff is super average. Not worth waiting a long time for. However if you can get in quickly, a good place to check out.

There's a reason this place has 3474 reviews. It's good. Really good.

There will be a wait. Put your name on the wait list via Yelp, and it will be significantly shorter. We put our name on the list, walked to the restaurant, and we're seated within 10 minutes. Amazing.

The food is just as good as you would expect. The service couldn't have been better.

Don't let the wait keep you from trying this place! It's SO worth it :)

I don't understand what the hype it about, this place is so overrated. We waited almost 2 hours for a seat. The food was just average like any other normal brunch place- I would compare it to Yolk. Pancakes were overly sweet and the eggs benedict were nothing special. There are so many great brunch spots in Chicago and this one is definitely not on the top of my list. This location is basically a tourist trap so if you're a local, avoid it!

Absolutely worth the wait! We went on a Friday late morning and joined the waitlist on Yelp before heading over (it was a 2 hour wait!). The service and food was amazing and worth every minute.

My husband and the diced ham and eggs with berry pancakes which were out of this world. I had turkey sausage, very flavorful, and regular pancakes which were also delicious.

Make sure to join the waitlist before you go, but definitely go!
Fig and bacon omelette was a superb choice! Coffee was excellent and service was exceptional! This is a place you must go to!

It has been a little while since I have visited wildberry and I forgot just how delicious the food is! I went this morning and ordered my usual- a garden skillet and a side of cinnamon roll pancakes. This is a lot of food- not for the faint of stomach- but the veggies make you feel like you might possibly be having a healthy breakfast. The skillet is full of vegetables and an over medium egg on top is just right to let a little yolky goodness run into the delicious and crispy hash browns the dish rests on. Other people will tell you the wildberry pancakes are the best pancakes on the menu- don't listen! The cinnamon roll pancakes are the way to go! I prefer getting my specialty pancakes (which are a must get) as a side because the small size gives me all I need to really enjoy them while still being free to fill up on savory foods as well.

The food was great. I had an omelet and the eggs were so fluffy. My husband had pancakes and they were so light. We checked in on line so the wait was much shorter when we arrived. They handle a huge volume of customers so well!
Ordered an omelet with a side of Berry Bliss pancakes and was extremely satisfied. The service made me feel a bit rushed, but overall a good experience.

Ate here about two weekends ago, and I cannot stop thinking about this place. Best pancakes I've ever eaten and totally worth the two hour wait! I also can't stop dreaming about the turtle mocha (it makes up for absentee mimosas you'd find at other breakfast and brunch establishments, in my opinion) Can't wait to go back!

pics.caption: Signature bliss berry pancakes with a turtle mocha. Heavenly

review.des: After reading many positive reviews for this spot my boyfriend I decided we just HAD to stop for breakfast here while we were in Chicago for the weekend. What a mistake. The whole restaurant was similar to an ihop and had basically the same quality food. The whole atmosphere was very "get you in and get you out as fast as possible". We ordered banana chocolate chip pancakes expecting pancakes with bananas and chocolate chips in them. Boy were we wrong. They simply mass produce plain pancakes and then throw the toppings on top. One of the most disappointing meals ever. I'm sad we wasted an opportunity to hit another great spot for this beyond subpar food. Don't bother waiting the OVER AN HOUR wait for pancakes you could easily make yourself.

We came on a Saturday around 930am and it was very busy! Would highly recommending putting yourself on waitlist before arriving, the wait was 60-90 minutes. The service was great. The food was also great, large portions - reasonable priced. The omelettes were good, the pancakes were amazing. Would highly recommend!

Conveniently located across the bean. There was no line when we arrived a bit before 8am on a Sunday morning. My friend and I shared a garden skillet and upgraded the pancakes to their signature very bliss for $2. Generous portions and very flavorful! Pancakes were really fluffy. Service was attentive and friendly. I'll definitely come again next time I visit Chicago.

The wait was long. The food was good, nothing special...just your typical breakfast food. Our server was super cool and sweet ...he sounds just like Rocky. We were told to try this place out because it's amazing, but I'm still trying to figure out what all the hype was about.

I was in town for business and staying near by so my colleague and I went for breakfast (so lack of Bloody Marys or Mimosas wasn't an issue). We found it exceptional! Super friendly service, a great menu, yummy food and a bargain by Loop standards ($4 for a huge fresh squeezed OJ!). If I lived or worked nearby, I'd be a regular - if you're just visiting, make sure you go as well! Thanks guys.
Nothing different than IHOP. Has different dishes and place is too crowded. Was not a fan about making us wait for one person in our party to park the car before getting seated.
Wildberry has very good food. It's one of the better restaurants in downtown Chicago. Their breakfast and lunch items are delicious.
Amazing, gluten free options and heavenly pancakes.  We also had the homemade corn beef hash, thumbs up.  Thanks yelp

Came here off a recommendation and it did not disappoint! Tip: reserve your spot in line ahead of time to avoid waiting around as this is a hot spot. I ordered the Mexicana skillet and chocolate chip banana pancakes and they were both delicious, filling and service was fast. If you plan it right you can get in and out and off to your next adventure!!

It may have been an off day, reserved thru yelp, good there when our table was ready and sat outside. Ordered omelets and 2 specialty items, the berry bliss waffle and cinnamon bun pancakes. Both were just ok. our omelet platters were mediocre and hashbrowns burnt...I would give it another try but it did not wow me

We visit this location once a year for our downtown Black Friday tradition. Every year so far the wait has been an hour plus. The wait would be fine if there was an entrance way to wait in however, it's a small location. They need to find a larger location! It's great however that you are able to put in your reservation through the wait time app as long as you are within a 5 mile distance. We had 11 people and put in 3 reservations because there is a max to the number of people in your party allowed. Once we were there we asked if they could combine our reservations, which luckily they were able to do and we were all able to sit together.

I ordered the chopped salad with buffalo chicken and chipotle ranch dressing. It was AMAZING! I'm not a breakfast person, but this hit the spot.

Summary: food is good, wait is horrible.

pics.caption: Chopped salad with sub chipotle each dressing and Buffalo chicken= AMAZING

review.des: Service was really good and friendly, and we loved our breakfast. We had an build your own omelette, pancakes, corn beef Benedict. All we something we would order again.
Excellent food. I loved the cinnamon roll pancakes and the Spanish omelettes. Great service. Be ready for a long wait.

The wait is long - but you can put your name down and walk around the bean / millennial park. They will txt you when your table is almost ready so you have enough time to get back.

I recommend getting the sides of pancakes (2/order) vs the full order (5/order) so you can try more! The two most popular pancakes are berry bliss and cinnamon roll..both were delicious!! We also had the Mexicana skillet which exceeded expectations - very flavorful! I don't think I would wait that long again for breakfast but glad I checked if off my Chicago foodie checklist!

The wait is definitely worth it. I had the rustic egg panini and a wild berry package, WOW!! Extremely delicious, very tasty, and filling. The coffee was delicious. The prices were moderate and the ambiance is great. The service is prompt. A great place to have great food, healthy choices, and sweet options. Give it a try!

pics.caption: Omg, this was glorious!! Worth the 45 min wait.
Rustic egg panini with an option for hash browns or fruit. The egg is soft and perfect for this panini. It's an great option!! I loved it!

review.des:
If you come here --you will wait. BUT it is definitely worth it. As soon as I sat down (after an hour wait)  I couldn't even stay in my seat because I was so intrigued by not only the smell but the look of everyone's eye catching plate. The servings, be it, a heap of hash browns, your choice of meat in eggs served in a nice shiny skillet or a colorful pastel-like painting of berry sauce of golden brown pancakes had a "take a picture before you eat me" presentation to it.

The decor is nice and the staff is friendly and attentive. The seats against the wall are mainly for two and they are close by. So don't be surprised if your partner tunes you to gawk at the plate next to them and vice-versa.

I ordered the butchers skillet which was everything a meat-man like myself needed and more. The skillet comes on a bed of delicious hash browns and your choice of toast or a pancake. (Already. That's a big +. Rarely, in my experiences with breakfast spots is a pancake offered with meal that's not a combo that has pancakes as a combo item) I opted to upgrade my toast to get the .... couldn't believe I haven't thought of this before on my own... Fruity Pebble French toast. I ordered it for the novelty and finished eating it for the amazing taste! I must note that the chorizo bendict was the real deal as well.

My personal litmus test with any restaurant is always the question "will I come to this place again?" And without a doubt I would. Over and over. Even if I had to wait two hours.

After a walk through Millenium Park, I came to Wildberry. It was one of the most delicious brunches I have EVER had! I suggest getting toast so you can top it with the AMAZING berry marmalade! I ordered the cinnamon roll pancake and.... it was spot on!!! If you live or are vacationing in Chicago, I would greatly recommend going to Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe!
We've eaten here many times during our 2 week stay in Chicago. The food and service are awesome! One of my favorites is the French toast!

So good, my wife and I ate here twice for breakfast while in Chicago for four days! The high reviews are warranted here for a reason, and as busy as they are the service and food quality was exceptional. The atmosphere is not as bad as one would think given the long wait times and crowded entrance.

Start yourself off with some of Chicago's Intelligentsia coffee and spend some time browsing the extensive American-based breakfast menu as you contemplate what you'll want to eat before heading back out towards Millennium Park or Michigan Ave. Both times, I opted for the signature berry bliss topping on pancakes one day and a belgian waffle on another. The presentation of the food is stunning.

Tip: Skip the line and download the Nowait app. You will be provided with an estimated wait time and do not have to go all the way to the restaurant to wait with everyone else in the crowded entrance. We found out about the app after our first trip, which made our second trip a breeze compared to the 30-45 minute wait we had the first time we visited.

pics.caption: Wildberry pancakes with signature berry bliss topping. These are uh-mazing!
Delicious Wildberry Belgian Waffle topped with Signature Berry Bliss topping

review.des: Superb. The best pancakes I have ever had! I love pancakes,  let's get that straight. The berry bliss pancakes were intimidating at first. I imagined that it would be extra sweet and I would lose interest midway.  Could not be farther from the truth. It was savory and I could not get enough. Definitely worth it!

A great breakfast place!! Just for you to be aware, they do not allow reservations, so if you come on the weekend be prepared to wait for a very long time. However, if you come in the mornings on random weekdays you are seated almost immediately. The pancakes are insanely light and fluffy and sooo jealous, and those are just the random buttermilk ones! The veggie omelette is my go-to, just because it comes with sooo much. the omelette itself is enough for 2 meals and then it came with a choice of pancakes or toast, and then fruit or hash browns. I've also had their regular French Toast which was incredible and my friend got the Red Velvet French Toast which just looked like a dream. I've had friends also get the skillet which they said was massive but very tasty! Always many people and a nice atmosphere!

OooOO how I dream of Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe!

I love breakfasts and Wildberry definitely does breakfast right.  While many reviews talked about long waits, both times I visited I was able to get a table within five minutes.  On busier days, though, it is recommended that you check the wait time with the "No Wait App" and reserve a spot in advance.  On the edge of Millennium Park, it is perfect to get your breakfast here and then walk off those calories after.

Here is what I ordered:
Two Eggs Any Style with Choice of Meat and Hashbrowns:  The portions are huge and all cooked perfectly!  Be prepared to get a generous helping of hash browns that are nicely crunchy.  The eggs you get are equally well done to your specifications.

Signature Berry Bliss Pancake/French Toast: My friend and I got a side portion of each with the eggs dish and were floored by how good these were!  I am not a fan of super sweet things and so this did a good job of balancing between the sweetness of the French toast/pancake and the tartness of the berries.  The pancakes and French toast was also light and fluffy.  Together it was just heavenly!

Red Velvet French Toast: As mentioned earlier, I am not a fan of sweets and this was way too sweet!  If you are a fan of red velvet and like something more like a dessert, this is the way to go.

Buffalo Chicken Wrap:  With a lot of textural and flavor components that make it a nice alternative for those who are looking for options outside of breakfast.  What I really enjoyed were the mixture of the heat from the buffalo chicken strips cooled by the sweet corn as well as the slight crunch from the tortilla strips.  

There are several parking garages nearby but are pretty pricey.  There is a subway entrance not too far away that could be a better alternative.  Plus, since you are literally across the street from Millennium Park, it is the perfect start of a day out in downtown Chicago.  In terms of service, the staff was pretty great and friendly.  Orders came out pretty quickly.

Overall, Wildberry serves breakfast realness that is worth checking out especially if you are going to do stuff in the downtown Chicago area.

pics.caption: Two eggs (over easy) with sausage patty and hash browns
Side portion of the red velvet French toast

review.des:
Probably our least impressive meal in Chicago. I think the popularity stems from the great location. Luckily we went early (~8:30 AM) on a weekday and there was no wait.

// LOCATION // Across the street from Millennium Park and the Bean.

// SERVICE // Excellent. Our waiter was very sweet and quick.

// FOOD //
    + Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes: Thin, lackluster pancakes with some fruit topping. Nothing impressive or special.
    + Denver skillet: Hash browns were not crispy.

The food was definitely decent and edible, but probably not worth the thousands of great reviews.

Where do I start, well start with the service. Jeremy you are an amazing server, maybe even the best server I've come across. Your charisma and uniqueness are top notch your recommendations were superb. You really made me and my moms first time at Wildberry very memorable. Per jermeys recommendations try the chilaquiles and make sure you get a side of pancakes. They really are amazing! Not my first time in Chicago but Wildberry is defiantly a staple in Chicago a must try! If you get the chance try it out be sure to ask for Jeremy!!

Food was good, but service is so slow and I'm not taking about the wait. You just will wait forever until they will give you some attention. I was waiting for 15 mins to get my lemonade refilled and it take forever for them to bring me a check, after that it took 10 more mins to bring me my cc back and a receipt. Also they don't serve alcohol. So , u can forget about mimosa.

This stop was not planned. Looked for a breakfast spot and find this yummy place. The wait was really long but they text you when your table is about really which is nice if you decided to walk around in the mean time. Once seated the waiter only came by to check on us once. It was truly supper busy so we understood but when a girl is thirsty waiting seems forever. All the food was made correctly and was delicious. Iced Coffee was on point. I ordered the waffles and was not let down. Would definitely come back here.
Every dish in this restaurant is yummy. Must visit. Advance booking is required since they attract a lot of crowd. Shoutout to our waiter Geremy.

This place was amazing.  This was one of the best experiences I have had at a restaurant.  The waiter was amazing and very helpful with all our food and drink choices.  This place was absolutely packed but it's because the food is great.  

I ordered the corned beef hash with a side of the specialty pancakes.  Everything thing here was delicious and affordable.  The eggs, hash browns, and corn beef hash were so good together.  This was the best corned beef hash I have tasted in my life.  I ordered the specialty pecan pancakes and this was great as well.  This was so sweet I did not need to use the butter or syrup that was given.  The food here was amazing!

The service was awesome.  One of the people in my party had an issue with their order and it was replaced with a new plate by one of the managers bringing us the plate along with a 10 dollar gift card to the restaurant.  The was all handled fast and they were able to still finish their food with ours.  The only con is the wait here, but once you experience the food here you'll understand.

The service

pics.caption: Corned beef hash, two over easy eggs, and hash browns.

review.des:
LOVED this place! My boyfriend and I were looking for a brunch spot downtown during our trip to Chicago and I'm so glad Yelp brought us here.

Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe is very spacious and roomy with a super casual vibe. Perfect for what we were looking for. The staff is friendly without being overbearing.

I got the Southern Benedict which was sausage patties and poached eggs over top baked biscuits. The eggs Benedict was covered in a sausage gravy which was AMAZING. Hands down the best part about the meal. It also came with a very generous portion of hash browns which were delicious and crispy! Plus one to that because I often feel like the hash browns I get at brunch are too soft for my liking. $11 for my entree and I left completely stuffed. What a great deal!

One last thing I must note is their incredibly fast service. My boyfriend and I made a comment amongst ourselves that it probably took us longer to look through the menu and decide what entrees to get than it took them to have it cooked and brought to our table!

Keep up the great work, Wildberry!

pics.caption: Top: Los Altos Benedict, Bottom: Southern Benedict
Southern Benedict. That sausage gravy though!!! Delicious!

review.des:
Mehhh, this place is alright to me.

Came here after hearing from a friend's huge recommendation to visit. I've honestly never had to wait 2 hours for a brunch place before, and I've been to quite a few back in SF. It was only 10am too, and it just doesn't make sense. Okay it's super popular but still! Good thing there's Millenium Park and some nice buildings to check out nearby. Once you input your name and number, they'll text you when your table is ready. It took over 2 hours for our table to be ready on a Sunday morning. Not the best start to my day, but my friends and I wanted to order fast. Getting someone's attention took 10 minutes, and food took about 20 minutes to prep.

I ordered the Garden Skillet with a side of Signature Berry Bliss pancakes.

Portions are huge, so huge that I couldn't finish them. The food was alright at most, but it looked nice to eat. Maybe I'm not a hash/pancakes guy, but these items didn't stand out to me in terms of taste. Yeah, I'm just okay with this place.

Maybe I'll try something else next time?

pics.caption: Garden skillet w/ signature berry bliss pancakes

review.des: I was very excited about the mushroom omelette,  and it did not disappoint. The food was fresh and the staff was friendly. We did not have to wait long for a table and the service was quick.

Place was crowded for a reason.  Breakfast food is fantastic with large portions.  Fresh fruit was truly fresh, pancakes cooked perfectly, service was professional and fast.  You know you're at a restaurant that can handle crowds when they beat their estimated wait time by 50 mins and you can see so many servers hustling with different responsibilities.  I actually met the manager because he tries not to let people leave without asking how the meal was.  This is clearly a guy who knows how to run a restaurant and he has a team of workers who are enthusiastic and want your business.

Not only was the food amazing but our server Ahtian was the best! Wow her customer service is A+. Very impressed by her. I ordered espanola omelette and Berry bliss waffle and it was so good! No complaints and a very happy tummy.

Went here with colleagues when I was in town for a conference. The portions were huge, the food was delicious, and their gluten-free pancakes didn't even taste gluten-free. Service was also really good. Sadly, I ended up under-tipping because I'm a dumb Canadian who isn't used to calculating tips by hand. (Sorry!)

The portions are big. The food is delicious. Had the Venetian skillet with cinnamon roll pancakes (must try!!) and a create your own omelet with toast on the side.
Love the environment but try to get here early bc there is a wait.

pics.caption: Venetian skillet with cinnamon roll pancakes and create your own omelet

review.des: A must in Chicago! Yes, the wait is long, but it's worth it. Their lattes are delicious, the food is delicious and the portions are huge, so I'd recommend sharing. Overall one of my favorite spots for brunch.
Minus one star for the wait time. Arrived here on a Sunday morning around 9am and was put on a one and a half hour wait list. But it was all worth the wait ! Delicious and great service !!

Bless you, No Wait. After striking out at our hotel's breakfast we were able to put our names on Wildberry's list from the Yelp app. It gave us just enough time to shower and hoof it over; the wait was 45-60 minutes. When we arrived there was a large group of people waiting out front and in the entryway. We stopped in to check in as directed on the Yelp app and the host initially thought I was just saying we were getting on the list for two and quoted me a two-hour wait. I let her know we'd put our names in on the app and she let me know I was checked in and to wait for a text. Within a minute I got a text letting me know to check-in, so went back inside to the desk to clarify we had done so - if you don't check in by the directed time you lose your place. It turns out it was actually the text to let us know our table was ready - holler! They sent me back outside to grab my boyfriend and then we were seated. A little confusing, but overall easy-peasy compared to the hot mess of waiting two hours outside in the Chicago winter.

I decided to embrace the photogenic namesake dish, the Signature Berry Bliss pancakes - vanilla anglaise, blackberry coulis, berry mascarpone, and a mix of fresh strawberries, blackberries, and blueberries. There were several other amazing dessert-like options that called my name but I wanted to pretend I was eating something remotely healthy to balance the other indulgences of our weekend.

The pancakes were fluffy and the plate was large - you won't go hungry if you order this dish. The berries were nice and ripe even in the winter and the sauces were applied in the perfect amount. I've had some breakfasts swimming in creme anglaise and it's just too rich to start the day; the accent of custard was perfect.

Service was a little sparse but fine. We were easily able to get a to-go box with silverware for our leftovers. Next time I'll have to see if they do half-orders; I think half of one of their sweet concoctions paired with a savory side would be perfect for me. Still probably too much for one sitting, but it's always nice to have something for the next morning at the hotel!

We'll definitely use the waitlist feature again - it's hard to beat picking a spot when you wake up and having a table ready by the time you arrive!

My family and I went to Chicago in Nov 2014 for my best friend's wedding. I was excited and had researched a lot of new food places I wanted to try (although I had been to Chicago plenty of times before). We stayed in a hotel a few blocks from Wildberry, and walked here one morning for breakfast on our way to Millenium Park. Millenium Park is just across the street.

I ordered the Signature Berry Bliss which was just delicious and blissful, hehe. A friend of mine told me the OJ here was super good, so I ordered that as my drink. It definitely tasted sweet and freshly squeezed. I honestly can't remember what my husband ordered; probably one of the sizzling skillets. My son, who is a picky eater, enjoyed his kids' meal. Anything with eggs and pancakes, and he's set =)

Our breakfast left us happy and full. Glad we walked it off at the park. Service here was great, and the greeters and servers are all quite friendly.
Had their signature pancakes and I'll tell you they didn't disappoint at all, so filling! The service was great too, our waitress never stopped smiling. Go early it fills up fast!!

Parking was a total pain to get to this place. Being centrally located, no matter what day or time you go it's going to be packed since it's near Millenium Park. However, the food is totally worth it. I'm not big on breakfast foods but I got the Espanola with chicken sausage and it was definitely worth the creepy walk from the parked car down alleys. For your side you can always upgrade your pancakes to the gourmet pancakes for a couple more bucks which is totally worth it. Being a super popular breakfast spot, the service time is pretty average and not a quick dine and go. We were probably there for 1.5 hours due to service, but she was very nice.
Best breakfast I've had in forever. Place is packed but worth the wait. We had omelettes and sampled 3 specialty pancakes:  cinnamon roll, berry bliss and Oreo. Hard to go wrong with any of them!
Amazing breakfast. Pancakes, omelet, and lattes! Great customer service too. Check in on the waitlist before you come!

The most disgusting management in business, they deceive customers to their establishment, only to tell them they have to wait 45 minutes after " checking in" meanwhile I just wasted my entire morning. They should be ashamed of their business practice especially when the host says " oh that check in time is just to get you here " that's bull *#*!...my entire morning is wasted

Waited weeks to coordinate my visit. The reviews made the food look fabulous. Bottom line, BERRY LONG LINES. BERRY CURT SERVER. Berry pricey. BERRY HEAVY CREPES more like thinned-down pancakes. Soggy and Drowning in gooey toppings that ruined the real berries. (Poor berries). 20 minute wait at the door for this? Needed an order to go also, but the waiter seemed baffled when I reminded him of my allergies. after he made multiple trips to the kitchen to see if my "to-go"sandwich or salad could be made without onion, I had to order a cranberry turkey sandwich. . Sensing my frustration, my table-neighbor leaned in and told me that Wildberry is a chain restaurant!!The bread was good, but the bacon was undercooked, greasy and cold, the "cranberry Mayo" had separated-oil had floated to the top and the whole thing was unappealing.
That explains everything. Wildberry is Berry much like a Denny's on steroids. . In short, BERRY DISAPPOINTED.ps DENNYS IS A BETTER VALUE AND THE SERVERS SMILE!
The wait was over an hour long and the chicken and waffles was chicken strips on top of two waffles lol. Not worth the hype, in my opinion.

My earlier visits involved massive wait times (90+ min) so I wasn't feeling it. But a group of us went last Sunday afternoon and waited about 20 min which is more tolerable.

It was better than I remembered. I had the minced ham and eggs dish and it was good, though next time I'd probably go with a skillet or something a little more exciting. My brother got the corned beef hash, with chocolate chip pancakes.  Yum!  I had major food envy.  The sweet potato fries were also delicious.  I can't remember what others had but it was a happy table. Skip the biscuit though.

pics.caption: Corned beef hash with chocolate chip pancakes

review.des: Not worth the wait. Staff is not friendly. Excuses given with no real regard for customer service. Food comes fast, but silverware was not clean. Staff cleans other tables and bangs dirty dishes near your seat and ears. Food average but portions are large. Some beverages for our party arrived after food, as if forgotten. We had to ask for them. Will not return.

Drink: Vanilla Berry Latte.
Eat: Napa Valley Fig Omelet and Berry Bliss Pancakes.

Went there yesterday for a nice breakfast! Checked the wait before we left hotel around 8am and it was only about 10 min so we didn't get in line. Bad idea by 9am it jumped up to an hour wait. We walked around millennium park for the hour to waste time which was conveniently located across the street. Overall we ordered a chorizo skillet and banana chocolate pancakes. The food was delicious but not worth an hour wait. Word of advice get in line early!

The wait is excessive so be ready for it! I would recommend setting a reservation online to help reduce the wait. The food was awesome and plentiful, I had corned beef hash with hash browns and it was delicious. The service was fast and friendly.

One of my favorite places to have breakfast in Chicago. Best thing they could have done was added a 2nd location. There are no bad choices on the menu. Only issue is there is really no waiting room at the Water Tower location and only outside at the other one. Luckily they text you when your table is ready so you can do other things while you wait. Wait time can be as long as 2 hours so go early or during the week

The food was excellent with large portions. Great value and very good service. Coming from Long Island everyone in our party of eight enjoyed the early afternoon Sunday brunch.  Would highly recommend.
The wait is long, but they handle it in a well-organized fashion. Only go here if you are prepared to wait up to an hour. The food is great. I suggest it if you have time on your hands.

This place is phenomenal!

If you are a breakfast or brunch kind of person this will make your all time top 5 list.

Portions are above average price is average but food quality is amazing. My family fell in love with the berry bliss pancakes, but the skillets are awesome too.

SO good! I've visited both the Millennium Park location and another. My suggestion if you're going on a Saturday: plan for brunch and join the waiting list 2-3 hours before you plan on arriving - or prepare to travel to another location. I had the Fresca Omelette and it was heavenly (came with loads of sides too!). My friend had one of the skillets and it looked dope.

I've been attempting to try this place for months, finally gained the patience to wait. & It was well worth the wait! We tried the signature Berry Bliss pancakes, French toast, hash browns, both turkey and traditional sausage, bacon, and egg whites- needless to say we had a bit of a feast. Everything was delicious!! Whenever I'm in downtown again, I'll gladly drop in. Do yourself a favor and download the No Wait app. You will still wait, but at least you can shop or explore to local landmarks during your wait time.

pics.caption: BerryBliss Pancakes, Hashbrowns, Turkey Sausage, & Egg Whites (cause I like to play healthy)

review.des: always a great experience and such awesome food i love both chicagoland locations. It's a must go to, i promise you will enjoy.

Amazing! Suggestion: especially on the weekends it's a good idea to arrive before 9am, otherwise be prepared for an 1 hr wait minimum. The location is fantastic as it is across Millenium park so it's convenient if you are planning on scratching off Cloud Gate off your list. The food is excellent as well as the service. We were a group of 11 and everyone absolutely loved the food. Everyone said the pancakes were amazing. We tried the Butcher Block Skillet, Denver Skillet, fried chicken and waffles, classic eggs Benedict, banana and chocolate chip pancakes, cinnamon pancakes, Oreo s'mores pancakes and their regular pancakes: ALL Fantastic!

ABSOLUTELY!! the best breakfast, I went last November and it's incredible. worth the wait, large portion sizes, completely reasonable price and I left stuffed. I recommend getting the skillet dishes! 10/10 would highly recommend

First time here last week. Got a somewhat simple but filling breakfast (2 eggs scrambled w/cheese, wheat toast, fruit, applewood smoked bacon, hot chocolate). It was all very good and quickly made (thoroughly made as well). I'd recommend. Their dishes I saw were pretty big (omelette, pancakes, etc). The hot chocolate was delicious!

Totally worth the wait! Plus, if your wait is over an hour, you can go for a nice walk in Millennium Park. :D

I ordered one of the specialty pancakes - strawberry lemon poppy seed w/ a lemon vanilla sauce! AND, because clearly I was hungry, I ordered scrambled eggs, bacon, and hashbrowns. Honestly, for $14, you can't beat it! Amaaaaazing pancakes that are light and fluffy, great/fast service and they even have a patio - just watch out for the pesky pigeons.

pics.caption: Specialty pancakes - strawberry and lemon poppy seed w/ eggs, bacon and hashbrowns.

review.des: What can I say?? Great service, great food, great location! We stopped here on the way from the hotel to Millennium Park. Walked right in, we got lucky, and ordered.  Our waiter was very attentive and the food came in less than 10 minutes.  Great portions and tasted fantastic. The Signature Berry Bliss Crepes are to die for!! Would love to live by one of these restaurants. Loved it. Also offer a military discount!

pics.caption: Signature Berry Bliss Crepes!!! Get these!!! BlackBerry lemonade, also delicious!!

review.des:
Typical American breakfast and brunch restaurant, worthy of its 2,500+ amazing Yelp reviews. You can't go wrong with Wildberry Pancake and Cafe's prime downtown location, friendly and knowledgeable staff, use of a "Nowait" app, and most importantly, the quality and delicious food that they offer.

Under "Eggs-quisite Omelets", I created my own signature omelet with bacon, sausage and cheese, and it was eggcellent ha-ha. I've had my fair share of omelets and really enjoyed Wildberry's. The omelets are served with hash browns or fruit & toast or pancakes.

The banana cream pie pancakes were definitely the cherry on top of our already delicious brunch. With its fresh cut bananas, mashed banana mix and whip cream, these pancakes tasted exactly like banana cream pie. I loved the banana cream pie, but I can't wait to try the other specialty pancakes like the Oreo S'mores, signature berry bliss or chocolate chip.

With a menu that consists of farm fresh AA eggs, fresh AA egg entrees, speciality benedicts, omelets, sizzlin' skillets, speciality pancakes, Belgian waffles, pan crepes, French toast, signature sandwiches, paninis & wraps and refreshing salads, everyone in your party will surely find something that they enjoy.

Tourists and locals flock here during peak breakfast and lunch times. The "Nowait" app is a necessity for this restaurant, so do yourself a favor and download it before coming here. You can save your place in line; this app will tell you how many parties are ahead of you, and give you a timeframe of how long the wait will be.

I can't wait to come back here for brunch during my next visit to Chicago!

We've gone to Wildberry for years during our annual boys weekend in Chicago. This year did disappoint. We ate there three mornings in arow. Definitely worth the wait. Be sure to get on the waiting list they Yelp early to save yourself an hour or so. Also let me give a shout out to Sophia. So much energy and smiles she single handedly took our thoughts off the Cubbies losses. I hope to see her next year on our return.

Seriously probably the best breakfast experience ever. The gluten-free pancakes were great, but the regular pancakes, especially the cinnamon and the signature Berry, were some of the best things we've ever eaten. Like the type of thing that you would bring to a deserted island if you could only bring one food! Rutherford omelette was tasty with a big pile of goat cheese in the middle. Husband had corned beef hash skillet and really enjoyed it. Portions are huge!Join the waitlist through yelp, which will greatly shorten your wait.

I went to Wildberry Pancakes before my interviews in Chicago. The wait time was short and the food came fast! I ordered the Nutella strawberry waffles and I am so happy I did. Delicious and exactly what I'd expect. A little pricey for a waffle but similar to other breakfast and brunch places in the area.

Excellent breakfast joint. They have tons of veggie options and even a few vegan ones too. My partner got the vegan hash and it was delicious. My egg white veggie omelette was better than any run of the mill omelette. They have breakfast down to a science! It's always packed but the wait was minimal given the throng headed into restaurant and the service was prompt and friendly.

First time in Chicago a friend recommended Wildberry. We're so glad we went. I added our name to the waitlist and we were seated in a few minutes after we arrived. I had the Rutherford Omelet that I enjoyed with hash browns. After seeing stacks of fluffy pancakes being brought out to other tables, I wish I had opted for the pancake side over the toast, but maybe next time.

The food here at Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe was delicious! It was my first visiting while in Chicago. This is a very busy and popular restaurant so please be aware that there will be a wait. I waited about 30 minutes. The front desk staff and servers were friendly. I would recommend trying the Berry Bliss Pancakes. They were very good! Also, my food came out fast. I encourage anyone to visit this place for breakfast. You will not be disappointed.
Delicious food, excellent service! The pancakes and french toast are so decadent and well done. I highly recommend giving them a try.

Probably the best Breakfast we have ever had! Great menu, something for everyone and the cinnamon roll french toast was the best my daughter ever had. Staff was super friendly and the service was amazingly fast. Make sure you use the waitlist too.

If you're a fan of brunch, definitely try this place, it's worth the wait.

I usually don't like eggs Benedict. But this place made me a fan. I got the sausage, gravy, and biscuit Eggs Benedict and I was truly impressed. It was better than some of the places I've eaten at in Texas (that says a lot). I would highly recommend subbing the hash brown sides for pancakes or french toast if you have a sweet tooth. I got the banana bread chocolate chip french toast. It was amazing. The bread was cooked to perfection with the perfect amount of chocolate.

Hash Brown sides were pretty standard. The buttermilk pancakes were very fluffy and the syrup was a great addition. The Wild Berry Pancakes with the fruity cream cheese side was delightful!! The Hash with Brisket was pretty good too, though I've had better brisket down South.

This place made me a fan of poached eggs, so that says a lot (haha). But seriously I was really impressed and I think this is my top brunch place so far. Portion sizes are pretty big as well!

Also, the service was quick, waiters were nice, and I would suggest watching the yelp app to show you how many parties are ahead of you.

pics.caption: 3 types of Eggs Benedict and Brisket Hash

review.des: Today was my first day ever in Chicago, and this was the first place I went. The Food Was AMAZING, but saying the service was bad is an understatement. I was being rushed to order so much and at one point was even told "i have to take your order now" even though they were still taking orders for a few more minutes, and I hadn't even had 3 minutes at the table. I had a young hispanic lady as my server, and I wish I knew her name to put here because she was not attentive at all. I understand that you probably don't like when people come in when you're about to close, but that is your job and if you can't deal with it in a professional manner, you need to find a new one. The service was honestly so bad, I wanted to not tip, but being someone that has worked in the service industry, I know how bad that is, so she only got 15%. Its sad because I really enjoyed the food, but I wont be returning because quality service is VERY IMPORTANT.
Had to wait an hour and a half after putting our names down on the wait list. But, I can see why this place is popular -- yummy food at a great price! And good portions, too.

I always wanted to go but put off by the long waits. Finally went for a late breakfast at 10:30 and had a 30 minute wait. Not too bad, took a walk in Millennium  park and came back. My sister ordered the eggs Benedict and she said it was quite good. I ordered the two eggs with a side of pancakes and really delicious chicken sausage. Hashbrowns greasy, but okay. Disappointment in the pancakes, way too sweet! And then they bring it to the table dusted with powdered sugar of all things!  Wait staff are friendly and attentive.

Wildberry had a very long wait- typically an hour and fifteen minutes to two hours- with little to no waiting area. However, the food was well worth the wait and the cramped quarters.
Our party of four ordered and received our food within 20 minutes of being seated. The food was plated beautiful, temperature was excellent and the taste was better than expected.
Try to use the waitlist feature well before you wish to dine, so you can enjoy quicker!
Food was yummy. Nice size portion.  We were able to check in online making it easy. We only had to wait about 10 additional minutes.

Tucked around the corner of the Aon Building of Chicago, Wildberry is wildly successful at what they do. They serve good ol' American breakfast. Their pancakes are fantastic and is something that you should get. Wait times can get lengthy as there are so many people trying to get a table. I got the eggs benedict breakfast comes with hashbrowns. It was absolutely delish. Unfortunately the staff was so busy, that I had to ask for ketchup more than twice. Something as simple as ketchup can be easily forgotten and brushed off. Besides that, I had a great time at Wildberry. Be prepared to wait for a table, unless you get there very early

Busy place- (E. Pearson location), good portions with nice menu selection. I have to call out the pancakes, really good. Can get on a wait list on Yelp that helps with wait time. Need to expand outside seating though.

Wow! Awesome food! I had barbacoa chilaquiles topped with two eggs over easy, with a side of fruit. It was spicy and delicious. First time I have been to Chicago,  but it won't be the last visit to Wildberry before I leave!

great breakfast  of french toasts for all four of us, and we all enjoyed our different choices.  It was loud in a good urban way, but some of the dish  clatter echoed a bit too loud back when we went.
Great breakfast place! The food was really great, plates where quite big (not always bad) we ended up sharing one plate and a side of pancakes and was great!
Wildberry pancakes lived up to their hype. Poached eggs were cooked medium. I recommend asking for a side of salsa. Excellent flavor balance

The host team was surly. I arrived at 1:30. There were a lot of people waiting and more coming in. I was told it would be about a half hour. At 2:15 I asked the hostess how much longer. She said there were two ahead of us. After watching all the people get seated and waiting about another half hour we were seated.

Food was what I expected. Chain food where the tastiness comes from high fat content rather than culinary skill. Meh.

Simply amazing. The food here is great, as usual. I swear I could eat this 7 days a week and still be amazed. The menu has a lot to choose from and the staff are very friendly. There is usually long wait times, but being 2018, there is an app to check you in before you even arrive. Try it out, you won't be disappointed.
Amazing is an understatement. Put name on waitlist is a must! I had the special Stuffed French toast with Door County cherries. Friends had omelets. Love this place!!
Well worth the wait!!! Everything was EXCELLENT done to the piping hot tea! Vegan hash was yummy! Will definitely go back!
This was my first time to Wildberry and it didn't disappoint. The Mexicana with pancakes was delicious i highly recommend to any visitors to Chicago.

If you visit Chicago this is a MUST EAT! And yes I wrote that in bold because I am screaming it. We ordered their skillets which also come with pancakes. I got the denver skillet with apple caramel pecan pancakes. My mom got garden skillet with strawberry poppyseed pancakes. The skillets were huge and hearty. I would have liked to see a tad bit more seasoning to them but nonetheless still a favorite. My mom's strawberry pancakes were topped with a lemon cream which was finger licking good. I found myself dipping my pancakes in her lemon cream. So if you go there you must get those!

I debated for the last hour on whether I should write this review or not. I prefer to not write bad reviews (of my last 10 reviews, only 2 reviews had 3 stars or less). However, I had a weird experience at Wildberry earlier today and the more I think about it, the more it does not sit well with me.

It was my friend's birthday and we decided on Wildberry because it was close to my job. I ended up getting out earlier so I walked over to put my name in. The hostess was not friendly but I assumed it was for efficiency sake. I told her, "Cristina for 2 people and we'd like to sit outside."
