She looked dazed so I repeated myself, "Cristina C R I S TI N A without the H." She was dismissive about that and told me it would be a 45 minute wait. I asked her if it was for outside seating and she looked annoyed and said yes. This whole interaction could not have taken more than a minute. I didn't take offense. I was in a celebratory mood, the weather was gorgeous, my project just ended and it was my friend's birthday.

Fast forward 40ish minutes later, our table was ready so I checked in--again unfriendly service. This hostess (a different one) cut me off before I could even finish saying "Cristina table for 2" with "yeah we'll call out your name." By this time, I was like okaaaaay, damn. Not even five minutes later, another host (the 3rd one) was calling out, "China for 2, China for 2." I ignored him--because that's not my name. But all three of them were looking at us and finally, my friend was like I think they mean you lol. Alright, sure--- this has never happened to me before but whatever. This host proceeded to seat us inside and I was like, no I specifically asked to sit outside. He gets mad and barks, "you're going to have to wait longer so do you want this table or not? If you want to sit outside, you'll wait longer." I told him we already waited 45 minutes and he repeated himself about waiting longer. I was weirded out by his aggressiveness so I turned to my friend and she's like yeah we'll wait.

We walk back to the desk. By this time, I'm annoyed so I talked to the hostesses and I told them I specifically asked to sit outside and how long is the wait. The dazed one just looked at me blankly and the one who cut me off before glared at me and snapped "you'll get the first available table." As I'm writing this, I really have no idea why I didn't hulk out hahah. I hate rude people--there is absolutely no excuse for rude behavior especially when you are in the service industry.

We finally got our table--and our server Natalie was great. Our food was delicious--with enormous portions. We ordered the Mexicana skillet, the Fresca omelet (on Natalie's recommendation) and a side of the cinnamon roll pancakes (on the recommendation of the table next to us). But I definitely will not come back here. There should be ZERO TOLERANCE for this kind of behavior. If you're going to be front of the house, you need to have better customer service skills. Is it too much to ask for a host to listen to my name, not cut me off, and actually get my seat preference correct? If it is too much to ask, then at the very least, it is definitely not too much to acknowledge your errors and apologize.

(Also, I am Asian-- but not Chinese).
If you go here + you like sweet instead of savory for breakfast - take my advice and get the crepes! AMAZING! You won't regret it.

Their service is great, even more so for how busy they get. There is always a long line outside but their food is worth a fifteen to twenty minute wait. It's delicious breakfast food, but not worth a half hour or hour+ wait.

If you have some time to kill off- put your name and number down and wait for the call while you take care of/visit something in the surrounding area.

I am not personally a pancake fan but holy heck was this place good. Their signature  berry pancake was to die for! The service was efficient, and quick. For  a single diner with coffee juice and a meal it was reasonably priced around $22.

I visited here on my last day in Chicago and I'm so glad I did!  We waited for 40 or so minutes to get in and it was well worth the wait.  I had an omelet, hash browns, and cinnamon roll pancakes.  Everything was delicious and enough food for a small country.  Highly recommend!

Overall: Expect long lines after 7am on a weekend, Great breakfast place, must try their fresh squeezed juice!

Ambiance: Family style breakfast place, and fairly big from inside. They can accommodate large parties. It gets loud inside and you can also choose to sit outside if the weather is nice.

Menu: I have been here many times and the food is always great. Omelettes come with pancake order on the side and you can substitute that with a speciality pancake for couple bucks more. You must try their fresh squeezed juices. Only downside is I don't see bottomless mimosas on their menu. But maybe it's because they're family style breakfast place.

Service: For a place this busy, they never let down on service. Always attentive and get you whatever condiments or napkins that you may want.

Price: Fairly well for city.

pics.caption: Entrance has long lines all the time on a weekend

review.des: Simply delicious breakfast options in a great location. There are so many enticing entrees that we usually order several items. The pancakes are light and fluffy, the toppings are interesting and tasty, and there are more skillet options than anywhere else I've been. The downside is the wait, but calling ahead helps speed the seating process.

pics.caption: We ordered several items and were quite pleased.

review.des: Great for tourists that have access to only IHOPS or those that like wearing basketball jerseys in public.
A bit slow but still charming. The service was good and my only complaint is that they ran out of blueberry muffins. Great food!
You  won't be disappointed if you stop by  for  lunch. Everything is  off the hook and I'm  greatly impressed by the  service.

It's okay. I think that the location is much better than the food. The granola and berry French toast doesn't have much flavor at all. I figured that at least the French toast part would be good but nope!

This place is not worth any kind of wait.  It's in a fantastic location, which accounts for its popularity, especially among tourists.  But at the heart of things, it's still a breakfast place.  It was a solid breakfast place with an enormous menu, but it isn't great.  Definitely not the best breakfast I've had in Chicago.  The portions are very generous, but when the skillets are largely made of congealed cheese and potatoes, you really don't make it halfway through the dish.  And it doesn't make for good leftovers.  The pancakes are okay. Not super fluffy, but the toppings are nice.

If you are really curious, go on a weekday morning.  I went on a Monday morning, and there was ZERO wait.  Plenty of open tables.
Wow, just wow. Got the fresca omelet and subbed in the berry bliss pancakes. I ended up taking the whole omelet home for lunch. Everything was great. Lots of food.

With such a high rating on Yelp, we visited Wildberry for breakfast on the last day of our visit to Chicago.  Fortunately, it was during the week, so we didn't have to endure the long weekend waits.  (They are on the Nowait app, though, so download that to save yourself some time.)  

It was Tuesday around 9:30 a.m. when we visited.  It was very busy, but it's such a big restaurant that we were seated immediately.  We were greeted right away at our table, as we perused their extensive breakfast menu.  

I finally opted for the Corned Beef Hash Skillet.  It came with a super generous portion of hashbrowns with cheese and corned beef hash on top.  I opted for pancakes as my side, as these are what Wildberry is known for.  I upgraded to their seasonal pumpkin ones.  Everything was delicious, fresh, and came out hot quick from the kitchen.

Wildberry is definitely worth a visit, whether you live in or are just visiting Chicago.

The food is ok, not great. I've had a lot of business breakfasts there. Yesterday, the guy seating people was incredibly rude. It was so bad my party walked away. I didn't need all those carbs anyways. I probably won't suggest this place in the future.

Definitely a must eat when visiting Chicago! The wait is always longer than most places but that's because it is so good and so popular. I got the hash skillet with the cinnamon pancakes and it was amazing! The wait staff was incredibly attentive and efficient. I will be coming back many times for sure!

Get. Here. Early.

We lucked out and only had about a 45 minute wait for a table on Friday morning because it was raining.

Go. When. It's. Raining.

Otherwise we saw 60 minute or longer waits in the morning or afternoon every other day we were here. Didn't matter if it was the weekend or not. You will wait.

Luckily their food is worth it. I had their Cinnamon Roll French Toast which was DELICIOUS! It was the most tasty French toast bread I have ever had, covered in an amazing cinnamon sugar sauce and butter. YUM. They serve Intelligentsia Coffee so I had a very good Iced Honey Toffee Nut Latte too.

My Husband had their Butcher Block Skillet which has every breakfast meat imaginable mixed with eggs and cheese. It came with raisin toast and the whole meal was HUGE. He's a big eater but wasn't able to finish the whole thing. He liked it though. He also had a Pineapple Lemonade which he thought was tasty as well. Came with free refills.

Service was very friendly and pleasant and spot on. The restaurant was kept clean and I liked their decor. Our waters were kept filled, we were brought condiments without having to ask, and we were never left wanting.

Pro Tip: When they tell you a 35-55 minute wait, they will call you inside in 35 minutes like your table is ready, but then take the additional 20 minutes to actually seat you. It's agonizing! Bring your patience.

I would definitely come back.

pics.caption: Good luck finishing it all! Huge portions.

review.des: Awesome food great atmosphere. Love the hashbrown skillet. The menu is full of options for everyone, not to mention the staff is wonderful. The wait was not long at all and they were very good about getting people in and out.

Came her a few years back and unfortunately after loving this place haven't been back. My French toast was still frozen. And my friends sandwich had moldy bread. The restaurant didn't really take the blame for the bread instead they blamed it on the provider. They remade my dish. And my friend was offered a new dish but he declined as he felt sick from it. They still charged him for his coffee. However they gave each of us a $10 gift card for a future time that we both didn't use.

There will be a wait no matter what time you go. So be ready for that. But the fact is, the food is WELL WORTH THE WAIT! The classic eggs benedict is no joke the best benedict I have ever had. And I have had alot of benedicts as it is one of my favorite breakfast meals. Ham off the bone, are you kidding me? And homemade hollandaise! Absolutely delicious. I also love omelets and if you like a little spice, the Espanola is your omelet to get. The veggie omelet with egg whites was also very good. Tasted light and fluffy. The pancakes will make your mouth water just by looking at them. This café is a must try if your in the area and want an amazing breakfast.

pics.caption: Classic eggs benedict with homemade hollandaise sauce. HAM OFF THE BONE! DELICIOUS!
Espanola omelet with homemade hash browns & extra crispy bacon. SO GOOD!
Tasty, light & fluffy egg white veggie omelet.

review.des: Delicious AF!!! I got the chorizo Benedict's and Oreo s'mores pancakes. Good customer service and I love that we can get on the wait list from Yelp.

Great place for a chain. I had their eggs, ham and cheese and it was really good. Hot drinks (coffee, tea, etc.) were reasonably priced and the food was hot, fresh, well-seasoned and timely. This location is just off the Magnificent Mile (down the hill towards the lake) and I honestly plan to go here again next time we take a trip downtown with family.

Shravi Ambati, Chicago :
Egg Benedict & Signature Pancakes are the best!!

Great breakfast joint I Yelped while in Chicago. Based off the reviews and proximity we gave it a shot.  I recommend using the wait in line feature. We had the skillets and the signature Wildberry pancakes. Both did not disappoint. Atmosphere is busy and on the go. We will definitely go back if we're town.

Really good food with alot of variety. It's a shame they aren't open late. I ordered the garden skillet and the veggies were very fresh! Instead of pancakes, I ordered the English muffin..it was delicious!

Tables are a little crowded together in the front of the building but... can't have it all.  lol

Prepare to wait at least an hour here if you're coming after 11am! This place is conveniently located across from millennium park so at least while you're waiting, you can walk across the street to grab a cocktail or enjoy the bean:)

We came here around 12pm and added ourselves to the brunch list-- our wait was 1.5 hours. When we called around 10-11am to gauge wait times, it was 2 hours so at least it went down!

Finally, we we got that magical text that our table was ready we were so excited. We all pretty much knew what we were gonna order.

I went with the orange juice (fresh squeezed), our waiter insisted on a large for every person which at the time seemed like a great idea but in hindsight, a small would've been just enough for me.  I also got their skillet which comes with pancakes and you can also upgrade those pancakes to their speciality pancakes for obit $1.50!!!

I decided to bravely order the wildberry pancakes which looked really sweet and when they arrived, they were exactly that.  A little too sweet for my preference to be honest. The skillet though was amazing! I got the butcher skillet and it came with hashbrowns, an egg on top and a bunch of meats (chicken sausage, pork sausage, bacon and ham!)

Overall, pretty good brunch spot but I wouldn't order the pancakes again. It was way too sweet for me. Service was good but the tables weren't the cleanest...

pics.caption: Butcher skillet, wildberry pancakes and fresh squeezed orange juice

review.des:
Came by when it was really busy in the weekends. Thanks to the waitlist, my friend and I were able to be seated pretty quickly. The service was decent and was quick. Worth the hype.
Lots of options and combinations to try. "How good could a pancake be? It's all the same!" was my thought, but nope! It's the best pancake I've tried. I don't like overly sugary flavored pancakes and crepes, but it's not one of them. It's not a punch in the tongue with the sweetness, but a nice gentle wrap around it with it.
Only criticism I could point on the food was the bacon being too burnt and other than that, the uncomfortable seat I had. The tables and seats were a bit close together in the area I sat down in, so my seat was at an awkward uncomfortable position and had hard time moving around. Wasn't a huge problem for me personally, but if I had needed more space, I would have felt pretty cramped in the seating I had.

My husband and I went here for the first time today and even tough we have a ~30 min wait the food was delicious! I even got to try a eggs benedict for the first time and they subbed the English muffin for gluten free toast! Jeremy B was our waiter and he was funny and attentive. We enjoyed our first time here and can't wait to come back!
Always a pleasure to take family here when they visit. Everyone is always happy and please with the food quality, service and atmosphere.

Best breakfast spot in downtown Chicago. Consistently delicious, and hot pancakes of every flavor and variety. I love the cinnamon roll pancakes, but this time I tried their seasonal blueberry almond strudel-awesome! Great prices, large portions and good service make it easy to discover why this place is often packed. Call or Check online for reservation apps to shorten wait times.

I was drawn to this place because of the reviews and the gluten free options. The first attempt to come was on a Sunday around 10:30am.... The wait was 120 minutes- no thanks. I wind up going back during the week and opted to come really early on the morning before the start of my conference.

So I'm so grateful that they were open really early in the morning-major selling point for me.  The food? To die, so good. I had the GF waffles with glazed Blueberries and boy were they yummy. I'd come back 20x over just for that. Turkey bacon could have been more crispy.  Service was good.

Tip: Use the no wait app if you're going there on the weekend.

Would definitely check out this place since it's so famous in Chicago, but I'm not sure it would be worth a second visit. The prices are definitely reasonable!

We waited about an hour on Friday at 11AM to get in, and then got the Southern Eggs Benedict, Red Velvet French Toast, and the Blueberry Danish Pancakes. The food came really quick which was a plus after the hour wait!

The benedict and pancakes were perfect, but I expected a little more from the red velvet french toast. The french toast was basically three red velvet rolls with cream inside and topped with strawberries and cream. It was a little too sugary for my tastes, but that might be what you're looking for.

I wasn't impressed with my experience.

The food portions were so big that I felt bad not finishing it, however it would not have been good for later. A friend and I got our own skillet with a side of berry bliss pancakes. The skillet was HUGE, so big that it felt uncomfortable.

The Berry Bliss pancakes that wildberry is known for was good but I don't think it was fluffy enough. It got mushy easily.

I'm also not the biggest fan of the service there. It took really long for them to take our orders and bring us our food.

Would I go again, probably not.

This was my first time in Chicago and my friend took me here for breakfast on my first day. The food is amazing and the service is outstanding.  I had the veggie skillet and wild berry pancakes. I would highly recommend if you are a local or just visiting Chicago.
The food was great and the service was excellent. I really enjoyed the location, atmosphere and tasty food. My husband and I loved it so much, we ate there everyday of our visit!
Great food and wonderful service! Very crowded so I'd recommend getting a reservation. Berry bliss French toast is delicious but very sweet.
Oh my my!!! Fantastic isn't even a good enough word. The pancakes are to die for!!! Well worth the wait to get in!!!

The wait is looooong . But what we did was reserve through yelp so when we got there we just had to wait less than 10 mins for our table . The food was delicious !! I got the skillet with different sausages & dessert the berry French toast & chocolate chip pancakes . I definitely Italy recommend the skillets . The French toast & pancakes are really more if you are into sweet stuff , which I am !! I love the portions of the meals , I had leftovers for dessert later that day ;) great spot !

As I walking to the hotel for my stayacation, I had walked past this restaurant, which I've heard about and read about.  I knew actually where I was going to have breakfast. Granted, even before 11am, there was a line out the door.  This breakfast/lunch hot spot is very close to Millennium Park and Michigan Avenue.

As I was returning back to the restaurant, yes, still people waiting for a table, I had checked in for a table for one.  I was quoted about 15 minutes which was fine with me.  If you have to wait for a table, that means, this is a incredible place.  I can understand some of the previous comments about the waiting area.  The area is small, however, there is a large area outside to wait.  Within five minutes, I was called.

I was seated in Ahtian N's section and was greeted within a minute or two.  Ahtain had went over the menu and specials with me then proceeded to take my drink order, coke.  I was in no hurry so she then proceeded to assist other tables in her section. I was finally ready when she had returned.  I had decided on the Cheese Omelet (choice of two cheeses) requesting the hash browns to be on more of the crispy side and side of pancakes.  

Within 15 minutes or so, the was delivered.  DAMN... much bigger portions I had expected.  Food was prepared just right - no complaints.  Ahtain had replenished the soda without asking and did check in with me couple of times.  The portions were so large, I could not finish the meal.  

I just want to touch on the restaurant itself.  The decor is very open with various sizes of tables to accommodate any type of guests.  The dining is very light and breezy.  Even though the dining room is large, it was not loud.  

Overall, I truly enjoyed my experience here at Wildberry.  I would highly recommend this restaurant.  Just remember, a wait for a table is a great sign of a great restaurant!

pics.caption: Cheese Omelette and fixings.  Large portions.

review.des:
The wait for this popular central breakfast spot can creep up to 2 hours on the weekend, but come on a random weekday morning and it can be just 5 minutes. I was immensely grateful to forgo the tedious wait and cut straight to the food.

I had the Garden Skillet with a side of pancakes (upgraded to banana cream pie for just $1 - this place is awesome!). The skillet choices are basically a flat pan the size of a dinner plate filled to the brim with whatever you choose (vegetables in my case), hashbrowns, cheese and topped with two eggs done to your liking. The Garden Skillet has onions, asparagus, tomatoes, mushrooms, spinach, and broccoli. Mix it all up and just go for it. All the ingredients were fresh and whatever combination my fork stabbed was delicious. The side of pancakes make a great dessert. The Banana cream pie is light and fluffy with chunks of banana and whipped cream. You will be hard pressed to finish it all, but it's a challenge worth taking on.

Shout out to my server Jeremy who was friendly, helpful and welcoming. I was eating solo but he stopped by periodically to tease me about the massive amount I was eating and made sure I was doing alright. Great service!!

pics.caption: Garden skillet with two perfectly poached eggs, and a side of banana cream pie pancakes. Breakfast of champions!!

review.des:
We waited almost 2 hours just to eat average food!   We were so disappointed!   Had coffee (it was good), butcher block (the hubby said so so) pancakes (he likes it) and I ordered the Homemade corned beef & hash skillet (it was just lots of hash and barely any corned beef!). So disappointed!   Our server was so nice though.
Would I go back and wait 2 hours to eat average food?  NOT GOING TO HAPPEN!

Went for breakfast, big hot portions.  All the servings were too big to finish, food was served hot.  The waitress never came to refill our coffee so we had to flag her down to get more.  The bus staff hovered over our table after we finished eating, I'm sure they want to turn tables but it was absurd how they took stuff off while we were sitting there.  So
If you go plan to eat and run.

The location of makes it a nice walk to since its right across from millennium park. Me and my girlfriend arrived there around noon on a Tuesday and it was packed already. Told them a table for 2 and still a 30 min wait, but that is normal from what i hear.

The interior looks modern since it seems to be attached to a bigger building. It isn't a big area for the amount of people that come here, but they do fit a lot of tables in the location. and also it easy accessible for the waiters to get to you.

The menu is amazing there so much to choose from and so much i can only eat at one sitting. I decided to go with a skillet just at  random. They place is definitely amazing and everyone that says that as well in the comments i can agree with.

Overall, what are you waiting for!! not only my comment is saying to go, but is the mainly all the other comments on here. So go already!!

pics.caption: LOOK AT IT!! mm that what brunch looks like

review.des: This place is a blast. We had a garden scramble and berry waffles. Everything was AMAZING! The place was packed, but the service was still timely and attentive. Table was cleaned fast and the food arrived in a reasonable time. We used early Yelp check in and arrived on time to be seated right away. Didn't even have to wait outside. Very happy with the experience.

The food is ALWAYS great here. Both breakfast and lunch! They also have different flavor lemonades and unlimited refills!! My go to breakfast is the garden skillet with well done potatoes, my boyfriend loves the chicken and waffles (they add jalapenos and bacon in the batter)! For lunch, I go for the veggie burger. The smoked gouda is to die for and they put crispy onion strings on top. What more could I ask for? My boyfriend will still get the chicken and waffles during lunch because he says it is that good! Occasionally he will do the Mexicana skillet, but that is only when he is in the mood for some chorizo. Everyone else I have brought here loves everything they make, from the lemonades to the chipotle ranch to the burgers to the cookies n cream pancakes! They are all crowd pleasers! I love this place. Plus, it is in a great location. Near Millennium Park and just a few blocks from the shopping on State Street.

However, they are ALWAYS busy on the weekends. I have seen three hour waits for this place. So, I recommend everyone to get the No Wait app! It virtually puts you in line, that way you do not have to physically go there to put your name down. One down side is that you cannot do a no wait app for more than 4 people. The place is filled to the brim at all times and it feels a bit cramped. Especially with all of the wait staff and huge parties. It is a big space, but it is still pretty cramped which is why I cannot give it a five star rating.
Wow. One of my favorite places for breakfast. Great coffee, great menu with tons of savory options (had the Mexicano skillet), and of course great pancakes.

I had the Denver skillet and my favorite part was the crispy potatoes!! I subbed the peppers and onions with spinach and avocado and had the specialty berry pancakes...OMG...delicious!!! It was wayyy too much food and you could share but my partner had the southern Benedict. It was our favorite dish...he was nice enough to share with me!!! I would order the Southern Benedict next time I come and the specialty berry pancakes are a must!!! Be sure to check in before you arrive or you will have to wait!!

My absolute favorite brunch spot in Chicago. I strongly recommend their skillets. It's plenty to split with someone, or if you're like me, be greedy and save it for lunch and breakfast the following day. One skillet has been saved for three meals. My favorite is their veggie skillet and I add Mexican chorizo to it. I don't know if their chorizo is homemade but it's perfectly spicy and is really flavorful as its mixed with fresh chunks of veggies.

When dining for two, your bill comes to about $25 with drinks included so that's a nice Sunday brunch bargain. The staff is quick and efficient as well.
The only complaint is the wait. Definitely sign up for the NoWaitApp and it'll save you a lot of time. I usually sign in at home, get ready, hop on the train and maybe wait 15 minutes when I get there. It's fantastic.

Just an FYI, even with that long ass wait, the food still tastes fantastic. That's when you know you've found a gem!

pics.caption: My usual garden skillet, eggs over medium with chorizo added

review.des: This place is great. The menu is SO good that it's a tough choice what to order. Our server did seem be new and confused; taking our coffee order was an obvious chore.

There's a reason this place has so many reviews, it's amazing and totally worth whatever wait. Appears to be an IHOP or NJ diner in style but way better. Service is super quick. Loved our berry granola crepe, brisket hash and Florentine eggs Benedict. Totally a must when in Chicago for breakfast.
It was worth waiting 1hr & 15 minutes! The food was amazing. Our server, Fabricio is a very diligent and efficient worker. Very pleased.
Wait was really long but food was great. Service was great. I will make reservations next time.
Just okay. The food was not horrible, but it wasn't great either. Plenty of better selections that I would choose to go to before I returned here.

4 and half star with 4K + reviews, I really thought it would be an overrated kind of place. But to my amazement it was totally worth the wait if one and half hour!!
Sophia was really pleasant and awesome serve. And the food was fantastic! Loved every bit of it.
Me and boy friend are sure to come back whenever we are in Chicago!

What can I say that hasn't already been said.  Wait time can be a deterrent, but it shouldn't!  Came in for lunch on a Saturday and waited around 20 minutes (not bad compared to other reviews I read).  Service was super friendly and helpful for suggestions.  Ended up getting the mexicana skillet with the chorizo on the side and upgraded pancakes to wildberry specialty for 1.50 extra (totally worth it!).  When the chorizo came out I initially regretted getting it since it looked greasy ( I'm a pretty health conscious person and this was going to be a cheat meal anyway) but after soaking some grease with a napkin, the flavor was so bold and the spice was perfect!  Definitely made the right choice.  The pancakes were so fluffy and light and the fruit was fresh and sweet.  Definitely coming back to try the other skillet/pancake combos.  

Suggestion: skillets come with two pancakes. Huge portion size. A lot of people were getting to go boxes but we had a day of walking in the city so one order of the skillet/pancake was perfect for two.

Tremendous amounts of food. Excellent service. Definitely use the app for the Nowait. Corned Beef Skillet was awesome. Butcher Block and Mexican skillets were also delicious. The Belgian Waffles with Strawberries was huge. Great spot and a must hit spot!
What can I say? Not a huge fan of chain restaurants. I didn't even realize they were a chain until I asked for real maple syrup and received a blank stare. Sigh. Maybe next time...

We had come here from a recommendation from a guy on our Lyft ride and it was delicious! My friend had the corned beef hash benedict, I had the Los Altos benedict and we shared one of the new pancakes they had, the Blackberry Key Lime Pie. My friend said that her corned beef was pretty heavy and mine was pretty spicy/oily for my taste. But OMG the pancakes were amazing!! Highly recommend for the pancakes!!

Okay. So this place almost got three stars because no breakfast in the world is worth a two hour wait. And that's what you ought to expect on a weekend. We came here twice (Sat & Sun) and left without being seated because the wait was just too long. Finally, on Monday morning we were told the wait would be a tolerable one hour and we stuck it out only because our kids were still getting ready at the hotel. They were not exaggerating. We waited for 70 minutes before being seated.

Once seated though, our waitress was so charming and attentive that we almost forgot the long wait. Anyway, the pancakes are awesome. Definitely get the signature berry pancakes or the signature berry French toast. Fabulous! The omelette was okay. The crepes were awesome as well. The food is outstanding overall (the skillet with eggs and hash on another table looked sooooo good), but as I said before I'm not sure the wait is worth it for me even on a weekday, and definitely not for me on a weekend.

We got there about 8:00 a.m. and they immediately sat us. The service was fantastic. Justine was very tentative and on top of it.

I got their signature Berry Bliss pancakes and they were to die for. It came with five pancakes, which I didn't expect (that's a lot). I can't wait to eat them again!

My husband got the biscuit and gravy. It's made with thyme so if you don't like thyme watch out. Lol if you're from the south these are definitely a different style of biscuit and gravy than you're used to.
Such a good breakfast place!! Went with the Denver Skillet with chocolate chip banana pancakes and it was such a good portion for the price!

Whether you are with a large group or dining solo Wildberry makes you feel at home.  I would advise getting there early or reserving on weekends but otherwise no issues.  Location is perfect, servers are fantastic and check on you just enough to ensure you are enjoying your food.  There are a variety of options and service is speedy as well as efficient.  Overall, have enjoyed a variety of dishes primarily in for breakfast and every time I suggest to out of town visitors they rave about it.

Probably the best breakfast I've ever had!!! Portions are huge, if you eat little, I suggest to share a plate. So many places claim to have freshly squeezed OJ but never is, however this one was legit. We had los altos benedict, mexican skillet, berry bliss pancakes (outstanding) and strawberry and chocolate chip waffles. Everything was perfectly delicious!!!!

holy hell, this place was underwhelming to say the least ! tourist trap city.. thank the lord for the nowait app they posted on their website. but man not convinced this place is worth one minute of wait. service was shit , non existent, food bland, lukewarm at best. coffee weak af. was not worth the hype the wait nor the money. find another place in town. whack !

Food was actually pretty good. Reserved seats online got seated rather quickly as packed as it was... seating was pretty ok had an amazing view of the restaurant and outside ... our server was nice food arrived pretty quick. And the pineapple lemonade was amazing
Corned beef hash skillet was good but nothing spectacular. It seems like a very popular breakfast spot so I'd prob go back and try something else.

We waited almost an hour but the food was pretty good, not necessarily worth the wait, but good. I'm giving the restaurant one stars since soon after eating I got sick with food poisoning, which obviously ruined the entire day.

Second trip to Chicago and I had to visit Wildberry again.

I arrive at 7:30am and there was a 45 minute wait. I've been there before so I knew it was worth it.

The waiting game: The host takes your name and phone number. A text message is sent 5 minutes before they seat you. You must show them the text message so they know you are still there. Some people waited in the lobby, but it was too crowded and I waited outside.
(Tip: order a cup of joe or hot chocolate while you wait)

If you arrive after 9:00am on a weekend, expect to wait at least a hour and a half. But like I said it's worth it.

The food is extremely good and reasonable priced. You can get a full omelette, hash browns and 2 pancakes for $13! That's not too bad in Chicago.

Service is great. They are used to placing orders quickly because they are rotating people in and out. It's so many speciality items on the menu, just try one and I'm sure it will be good. So far, I've had the omelette and raspberry pancakes.
Had a great time here - healthy portions and reasonable prices, burger and fries was pretty standard but still tasty!

Not nearly as great as Pamela's in Pittsburgh, or Augie's in OCNJ, the best breakfasts in America. I feel the reviews are exaggerated. But clean and incredibly well run. They also use an amazing online waitlist system that showed us in realtime via an app how we moved from 120 on the waitlist to telling us to get there when we were 10 away. We saw an amazing building while waiting. Best-run busy place I've seen in years. I would skip the special wild berry pancakes and just get regular pancakes next time. Another diner told me to avoid the skillet entrees.

Tips:

Pancakes are must try: Berry Bliss pancake tastes amazing.

Download "NoWait" on your phone and secure a place in line before you even arrive!
I would recommend doing this if you are tight on time and don't want to wait at least 45 or so minutes on a typical day.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The area that Wildberry is in is a highly touristy area so expect long waits, but in my opinion the wait is worth it! The pancakes are the fluffiest pancakes I have ever had. If you love pancakes, you must try Wildberry.

If you get an entree, you only have to pay $1.50 more to upgrade your pancakes to a "Special" pancake order. I highly recommend this. That way you can feed 2 people with 1 entree!

I would absolutely come again for the pancakes.

We checked out this place because of its rating. I was not too impressed. I ordered the southern Benedict which was a poached egg on top of sausage and a biscuit with sausage gravy. It tasted just as described. I understand this is a pancake place but I wanted something savory rather than sweet.

OH MY GOSH DELICIOUS PANCAKES!! And of course I got a side of bacon too ;)
Absolutely delicious and at a great location! The wait is a while but it is across the street from Millennium park so the time goes by fast. The pancakes are the epitome of light and fluffy and all the options they have for pancakes will meet most everyone's needs.

Staff was amazing, everyone is very nice and informative! Our waitress was a hoot ! :)

Fun atmosphere and lots of interesting options on the menu. Fast friendly service too. My omelet was very good but I was surprised that the pancakes were somewhat disappointing. They seemed kind of doughy, which was the one disappointment of the meal.
Love this spot.   Its usually crowded with locals and tourists.   You won't be disappointed
Everything is good. You don't want sweet breakfast fine, their omelettes and skillets are just as good. The wait is long most of the time but it's totally worth it.

Some friends from Indy recommended Wild Berry pancakes and Cafe for breakfast. Reservations are a must unless you arrive shortly after the doors open. I had just enough time to grab an order to go and eat it on way to the airport. I got the Mexicana skillet with the berry bliss pancakes. Order anything. You can't go wrong.
Pancakes are awesome! Omelette are average. Wild berry juice is great. Waits can be long but if you use the no wait app you can get in line before

My wife and eldest daughter loved the gluten-free waffles. I loved their service. I had placed myself on the waitlist via yelp, but because of a TV showing filming in the area we had to park blocks away and made it on foot, late to the hostess by about five minutes. I explained the situation and they seated us right away. There was also something wrong with the half and half for the coffee that our waitress Sofiya picked up on right away, and she replaced the coffee and the half and half right away. The food came out lightning fast, and very delicious. Overall the highlight of our quick Chicago trip (we were visiting from another state). Everybody was smiling and friendly, for a very busy breakfast/brunch service. These little things make a lasting impression. We will definitely come back again when we are in town.

My husband had breakfast here twice during our four day stay.  The menu has so many options you CANT go wrong.  We were sat almost immediately when signing in.  Staff was attentive, food was cooked as ordered!  Restaurant seemed to filled with equal amount of locals and tourists.  Overall great experience.

This is a great place for friends with dietary restrictions. They have great vegan and vegetarian options. Of the seven of us who went we all had different things and all of the dishes were equally great!

We had Mexican skillet with two eggs over easy. Great flavors and a bit spicy. It came with two pancakes (we chose their pumpkin spice special). The pancakes were fluffy and flavorful as well. The portions were enough for two people to share. The food came out pretty fast.

The place is very close to Cloud Gate. I suggest that you use NoWait app and walk around Millennium park while waiting. When there are 20 people ahead of you, you enter and check in (you only have 5 minutes to check-in with the host). The wait can be 2 hours.

Ok. What kind of joke is this? I'm so upset with myself for wasting a breakfast here in the short amount of time we're here in Chicago. I'm going to chalk this up as a tourist trap since it's right next to the Millennium Park.  My mind is completely blown as to why this place got such great reviews and why the line is literally out the door trying to get seating. Or perhaps it's my fault for coming to a pancake place and not ordering pancakes?

Anyhow, what we ordered off their specials menu:
- Portobello Benedict: The most pathetic looking benedict I've ever seen in my life with 2 very sad shriveled up of what I think are mushrooms hidden underneath some overcooked zucchinis and eggs. This dish had absolutely no taste or flavor.
- Yogurt granola: I figured you can't really mess this up right? I mean, it's just yogurt and granola. Wait. Why would you put chocolate sauce and canned cherries on my yogurt?! WHY?! We also ordered a side of fresh fruit, so I know you guys have real fruit!
- Side of bacon
- 2 Coffees: At least they have decent coffee here from Intelligentsia coffee

Do not come here if you're looking for a decent breakfast. It is not worth the wait. At least we showed up before the rush, if I waited an hour for this place, I would have been livid.

Service was decent, food came out extremely slow, however. On the plus side, since avoiding the rush, we were able to get to Cloud Gate on the way here before anyone else so I was free to take lots of great pics of the Bean!

pics.caption: Chocolate sauce and canned cherries on my yogurt. Why?!
Portobello Benedict. What the hell is this?

review.des:
Just 2 things:
1. Line is long, add yourself to the queue on mobile and be prepared to wait.
2. Order the Signature Berry Bliss pancakes, they might be the best pancakes you'll ever eat.

Such a great restaurant! We went in 5 minutes before closing and they made us feel so welcome! They let us know that the kitchen was closing in 5 minutes so we have to put our order in soon but afterwards we can stay as long as we would like! They are so friendly and the food - AH MAZE ING! Best red velvet french toast I've ever had (better than Yolk)! I would be back in a heart beat!
I love this spot for breakfast. We go here every chance we get on Saturdays. The specialty pancakes are all very good. You can also use the the waitlist on yelp to avoid the long wait.
I'm usually not a fan of pancakes, but those berry ones were delicious! Didn't think I would be able to find a really good brunch spot in Chicago that would remind me of SF.

We went here for lunch after seeing the 4000+ great reviews on Yelp, and they are well deserved.

Everything we ordered was absolutely awesome. We got cinnamon roll pancakes that were unbelievably delicious, and was a gigantic stack of 5 pancakes. And also a Mexicana skillet which was large, and delicious. They brought out a plate of condiments/syrup for everything we ordered well before our food and our food came out extremely quick.

They were very busy and Said a 30 minute wait, it was more like 15. Service was stellar and every thing we were served was delicious.

Highly, highly recommended.
A much better alternative then most chain places. A bit pricey, but fantastic food. If you want to get a seat, make sure you get there early!

I came here on a weekday before my flight and the place was almost packed for 7 a.m. I still got a seat and saw the place fill up every quick.   I got an egg white omelet with all my likings.    I like how I can make my own omelet.  I got figs, avocado and mushrooms in my omelet.  The dish came wtih hash browns and i added the specialty pancakes.  I got their signature berry bliss pancakes,because i heard so much about it.  

The omelet was not bad, I felt the the eggs were overcooked. The hashbrowns were good and i was glad that it wasn't too salty.  As for the pancakes. well, i've been reading from other yelper that its the best and it's so fluffy, but to me it was just regular pancakes.   It tasted a little too sweet for me. There was too much berry sauce and i honestly didn't feel this was the fluffiest pancakes compare to the ones i had in the bay area.  

Overall, this location is great because it's right next to the park and to the Magnificent mile. The servers were all nice and the portions where huge which makes it worth it for their prices. But I think next time i'll try other things on their menu.
Nice and attentive service, clean and cozy ambiance. The food is very very good, the portions are huge though. With one order it would have been enough. Loved it anyways.

By far the BEST pancakes I've ever had! Really cute brunch place that has a little something for everyone! Portion size is great you are getting your money's worth! It's also right next to millennium park so you can walk over while you wait for your table. HIGHLY recommend the signature berry bliss pancakes!

Pancakes delish!

Everyones plates looked fabulous! Capuchino was well made and tasty.

Very cool place, cool vibe, nice crowd, good space and for nice days they have outdoor seating.
This place is amazing. I went to Chicago just to eat here. Great service and food is just simply WOW. I wish they would open one here in Miami

Visited Wildberry for the first time today while I was in town for work. Great customer service and staff, especially for 6:45AM. I was hungrier than normal so I got the biscuits and gravy with eggs meal. Only reason for the four star rating was that I could taste the flour in the gravy and my eggs over easy were a little runnier than I'd like. But I'll certainly be back again next time I'm in town!

Their cappuccinos are also great! Got one to go.

Make sure you use the App "No Wait" to check in with out any Wait time.

Best Brunch Place in Town.

Good Coffee
Fresh Juice
Omelette
Sausages
Pancakes
Potatoes(cooked in all styles)

Name it and get it the best.
Located right next to Millennium Park.

pics.caption: Scramble Eggs, Chicken Sausages, Hash Browns and Pan Cakes. Yummy Yummy!

review.des:
Don't do what I did, avoid the headache I put myself in. Here's what I did, I showed to put my name in with my phone number was told it would be 30-40 minutes. So I went to run a quick errand. 15 minutes later I got the text that my table was ready but in five minutes if I don't check in I'll lose it. Well I was a ten minutes walk away and thus I lost my table. So I decide to just get to go. I placed the order through Yelp. Email confirmation I got said my order would be ready in 20 minutes. I came 20 minutes later and my order was just being put in because the third party app found under the restaurants Yelp page called in the order way late. Which meant I had to wait another​
r 20 minutes. So don't do what I did. Just put your name in and wait to be seated. Food was good though.

pics.caption: Mixed berry pancakes to go. Pancakes are average, toppings make it special.

review.des:
Expect a wait to get into this amazing breakfast/brunch place but definitely worth the wait! Get the "Nowait" app to get your name on the list ahead of time so you can make better use of your time during the 1-2 hour wait.

Prepare to overindulge in all the delicious options. The Los Altos eggs Benedict were the perfect combination of flavors I was looking for. The Español omelette was also great. A side of the banana cream pancakes were the perfect way to finish it off. This is one of those places you'll want to keep coming back too.
This is probably one of my favorite Pancakes place in the town. Next to my apt and easy going environment.

I've eaten here several times at multiple locations...breakfast only. I like a heart clogging sausage gravy, biscuit and egg breakfast so the country Benedict gets me revved up. Pancakes are solid as an alternative. Highly recco'd, though expect a wait after 8 at most locations. Have some coffee, relax, wrestle with you kids or friends...then fill yourself with some awesome breakfast fare.

I know it's Only my second day in Chicago, but this place is crazy good!! I wish it could give it more stars!
Try to barbacoa chilaquiles!!

I ordered the eggs benedict and banana creme pancakes. Best breakfast I ever at. The service was great and we did not wait long at all for our food. When we got there, we were told a 20 minute wait, we were told our table was ready in 10 minutes. I will definitely eat there again when I am in chicago.
Perfect place for my date. Pancakes were to die for.

I've now eaten at Wildberry five times, and can confidently say it's the best breakfast spot I've found in the city. My favorite items are the pancakes(specifically the cinnamon roll pancakes) and breakfast scrambles. Whatever you choose, it's an insane amount of food, so make sure you're ready to house some food when you decide to eat here. The wait is typically well over an hour, so make sure you download the "No Wait" app so you can walk right in and be seated - you'll thank me later, because this place can't be missed whether you're hear on vacation or live in the city.
The best breakfast I've ever had.  The Mexicana Skillet and Signature Berry Pancakes were amazing!
Respectful staff, delicious food, but expect a long wait. They do have another location that seems to move faster.

Such a tourist trap but so good. Be ready to wait in line or come before it opens. You can pass the time by walking around the park across the street.

Order the Denver Skillet with the Berry Bliss Pancake. Everything was delicious.

pics.caption: Denver Skillet with Berry Bliss pancake.

review.des:
I visited this breakfast restaurant on 8/24/16 and and I'm very happy I went. Firstly there was a semi long line however due to the rain and the fact that I was dining by myself  I was seated within 2 minutes upon entrance.

I ordered the speciality pancakes and oh my god I fell in love. These pancakes is the best tasting pancakes I've had in my entire life. The texture was absolutely spot on, and yes you won't need pancake syrup as these pancakes are sweet enough. But don't get me wrong they are the perfect amount of sweet. Oh did I mention you don't even need butter ahh. The fruits provides a perfect balance to even out the textures and taste. Listen i know Chicago is cold but I'm seriously considering revisiting for these pancakes (that's how intense my love is).

After eating I was in such a good mood, despite the rain..... this was the perfect start to a day of exploring Chicago. I highly recommend their speciality pancakes.

Wildberry was recommended by a yelp elite friend (thanks Brian M!). We knew that it's super busy and a wait was anticipated.

We got up super early on Monday morning (July 4) to try and beat the crowd. We arrived by 7:30 and it was full with a short wait. We waited around 20 minutes or so before being seated.

We ordered the Mexican skillet and berries and cream pancakes. We shared both of them and neither of us left disappointed. We loved all of it!

We will definitely make this a stop when visiting Chicago!

Best place for delicious, tasty, filling breakfast! So many choices: eggs, skillets, omelets,  waffles, french toast, & pancakes!! And more. Come with an empty stomach. You get your moneys worth. I loved this place, and wish we had them in Charleston. The seating options varied, but there was plenty. Arrive early or else face the wait. We were there around 8:45am, and seated immediately. Our server Jeremy, was great. He was very friendly,  explained the menu, and took our order. We both enjoyed omelets which came with choices or hashbrowns or fruit, then toast or pancakes. We both chose specialty pancakes for and add on, loved them. I had the Rutherford omelet filled with spinach, carmelized onions, bacon, and goat cheese. Then the berry bliss pancakes. Yum! Food was hot, filling, flavorful, and so tasty. The coffee also was good, and Jeremy kept the cups filled, and even offered it to go!
So glad to have had breakfast here, and would recommend to all. Enjoy!

My friends and I love Wildberry. There is usually a long wait, but downloading the app they use to manage reservations is SO helpful! Anyway, the food is always great even though it's always busy. Everything arrives promptly, hot, and delicious. If you're going to the Randolph location, ask for Jeremy to be your server...he is one of the nicest and funniest servers in, dare I say, all of Chicago! You won't regret going here. Love the berry bliss French toast!

It's breakfast people - no breakfast is 5 stars in my book because it is so damn easy to make. Good restaurant, don't get me wrong but it breakfast in a large portion format with fast reliable service. Coffee needs some work but overall a good experience - 5 stars and remarkable...? me thinks not

I love this place!  Use the Yelp Pre check in though or waits can be long.  Best GF pancakes and waffles I have ever had!! I really wish they sold their mix or shared the recipe.  I live in Oregon, but every time I visit Chicago I eat here!

Best breakfast in the loop! Their waitlist is excruciating , hopefully they come up with a better system for that. That aside, we tried the Mexican skillet and it was out of this world! Their pancakes and waffles are great!

Came here for brunch on a Monday morning and it was still super busy, but rightfully so...this place is amazing! I had the two eggs breakfast with hash browns, bacon and a side of specialty pancakes for an extra $1.50!! My friends got a side of the cinnamon roll pancakes and berry pancakes. Both enjoyed their orders. The side of pancakes comes with two pancakes, which is plenty especially since the regular order comes with 5 pancakes. The pancakes were delicious the berry sauce and mascarpone add a nice touch.  I would definitely recommend using the Yelp waitlist, it's pretty accurate. I will be back!

We heard about this place and I wanted to surprise my girlfriend with breakfast. Not to my surprise when we arrived there was a super long line with a 1.5-2hr wait. However, based on the reviews we wanted to still try it. First word of advice is to go super early when everyone is sleeping or you're not starving. Secondly, to avoid the wait like we did, just order out! You still get to enjoy the delicious food minus the long wait and the restaurant ambience. We order the signature berry bliss crepes and blueberry pancakes with sausage. The orders were very plentiful. The portions are large enough to share. I highly recommend making a stop by for the breakfast if you have a chance.

Delayed Review - Visited in January 2017: We got this recommendation from a dear friend and it was extremely worth the wait!

As soon as we got off of the plane on a spontaneous Saturday morning, we knew we had to head straight there to put our names on the list. The time flew by (waited ~30ish minutes, mind you it was also during the time Trump was inaugurated into office/the Women's March and we got distracted by a bunch of cool things going on in the area so we didn't mind the wait at all). We understand good food requires patience so we didn't mind but others should be mindful that it is a wait for all of this deliciousness. It was nice that they had a texting system in place so we were able to run around taking selfies at the Bean in Millennium park while we waited. Expect a wait of 30 mins minimum because they don't take reservations. It was just the two of us so bigger parties should expect a longer wait.

We were looking forward to seeing what all of the hub bub was about and we went for a couple of legends on the menu:

Berry bliss pancakes were huge, sweet, and extremely moist. More of waffle people but would 10000% order this again because it hits the sweet tooth in all the right places. The mascarpone and anglaise ran down the center of the pancakes and made it perfection.

The classic eggs benedict was a fulfilling dish. Eggs poached perfectly and hollandaise sauce nicely done.

The portions were generous for both dishes. The staff members were extremely friendly and attentive. Don't think you can go wrong with any dish but these two were on our radars for a long time coming. Long story short, so much great food per dish but not enough tummy room at the time. A must when in Chicago and longing for midwestern-hometown-brunch foods!

pics.caption: Signature berry bliss pancakes and classic eggs Benedict

review.des: I was in downtown Chicago for a conference and wanted a hearty breakfast. I walked over to Wildberry and had a delicious Omelette with pancakes on the side and a cup of coffee. Everything was good, but nothing blew my mind. The service was fantastic. Absolutely fantastic. It is kind of like a much higher quality IHOP. That's the best way I can describe it.

I came here on a Sunday morning and waited almost two hours. Since it was our second time trying to eat here, we decided to wait. The service was excellent, the food was just ok and not memorable. I think if you live in the area and can get here early it's a nice choice but it just wasn't for us.

Absolutely everything was exceptional from the service to coffee.

I highly recommend the berry bliss French toast.

pics.caption: Berry bliss French toast.  So good!

review.des:
They've got to do something about their entrance for waiting customers. It's Wild indeed in there lol, people jam packed in the front who might eventually move outside but this slows down traffic for employees having to maneuver around to people to get to tables etc.

I wanted to leave after waiting over 45mins but stayed since my friend highly recommended this spot. Food was just ok, makes me wish Batter & Berries could replace this spot since it's actually worth the wait.

Would not recommend this place if you have a gluten or any other allergies. They clearly do not care about protecting customers or about health restrictions or preferences.

We ordered one order of regular pancakes and one order of gluten-free pancakes for take-out. When we got home, the 2 orders looked exactly the same. The manager on the phone said that next time we order we should check with him and he would look at the pancakes and tell us which one is gluten free.

I would never trust the opinion of a restaurant manager looking at my pancakes to tell me if they are gluten free. If your health depends on the accuracy of the restaurant and trusting them with what you order I would not recommend going to this place. The manager was extremely rude on the phone as well and all he offered me was to come back in to get some more (questionably) gluten free pancakes. We will not be ordering from here again. And would never wait 2 hours to eat in at this average chain restaurant when there are endless other options in Chicago.

The wait for a Saturday morning was 3 hours. Thanks to yelp I checked in online so it saved me some time waiting. I got there 10 minutes early, but it turns out they were running behind, the host mentioned it would be a minute per party that was ahead of us. When I got there at 11:20 AM there was still 45 parties ahead of us even though yelp estimated I would be seated at 11:25 AM

It's right across from millennial park so I got to check out the bean before brunch. Ordered the southern Benedict and bless berry crepes. Everything was superheavy and delicious but there was way too much food if I were to go back I would probably just share one entrée. The food was good but I would not have waited three hours if it wasn't for the check in online.
While in the windy city, I decided to check this place out, OMG  loved it here. Everything is delicious and in big portions. I will be back one day!
We use the waitlist on yelp and didn't have to wait long.   Food was mediocre.  Eggy's Diner serves better food.

Extremely popular breakfast and brunch place in Chicago. Location is located conveniently next to Millennium Park.

They do not take reservations. Wait time can range from 1-2 hours. Once they text you that your table is ready, you have exactly 5 mins to check in or will lose your spot, so don't roam off too far!

Berry fresh toast - recommended
Banana cream pancake - good but gets overwhelming
Delicious!  I had the two eggs any way with fruit and wild berry pancakes.  Very yummy.  Our waitress was also wonderful.

Really 3.5 stars. I'm not sure what all the fuss is about. Solid breakfast. Incredible wait of 88 minutes at 9 am on a Sunday. I had the breakfast sandwich which was fine. Husband had a skillet and side of pancakes. He liked the skillet. The pancakes were fine but not overly light and fluffy. Too many incredible restaurants in this city to wait so long for ok food. The service was very good - friendly and attentive even though they were crushed with people.

This was our first time here and the pancakes are the best I have ever had.  I got the "Signature Berry Bliss" pancakes they had fresh strawberries, blueberries, and blackberries on the side.  The best pancakes ever! Good size portions and we had plenty left over.  Our server, Kelsey, did an excellent job.  I strongly encourage you to use the "No Wait" app to reserve your spot before you head to the restaurant.  We got our spot reserved on the "No Wait" app while we were riding the train.  When we got to the restaurant, we walked right in and we got seated in less than 5 minutes and there was a huge crowd outside.  If you don't, prepare to wait at least 30 minutes depending on the day.  I highly recommend this restaurant for breakfast.

Absolutely delicious. Came in on a Thursday around 1. It was packed, but we were seated after 15 minutes. I ordered the chocolate banana bread French toast. I took one bite and fell in love. The bread nice and warm, filled with chocolate galore inside and drizzled on top. Additionally, I also got hash browns on the side. Had a nice mix of crispy and soft, and weren't too salty. You can't go wrong with hash browns! My friend got some pancakes, so I had a bite and they were nice and fluffy, like clouds in your mouth.  I'd probably order some the next time I went.

On top of delicious food, the service is great! Our waitress came to tell us about the food, gave recommendations and came a good amount of times to ask how we were doing.  I'LL BE BACK, WILDBERRY!!

***
So I came back. My rating stays the same, but I do want to mention new items I tried and some employees. After getting called to get seated, they seated our party of 3 at a table for six right by the door in the back, which had air rushing in, when I say this it's not a nice breeze....MY CONTACTS WERE DRYING UP. The hostess seated us and we noticed this and asked if she could close the door, she responded by telling us that she wasn't sure so she would go ask the manager. Seemed like she had asked a manager and they said no, but instead of coming to tell us, she avoided us. She could have easily came over and told us, so we wouldn't have to ask other employees. We ended up asking our waitress and her initial response was the same, that she would go and ask. She promptly came back and told us she couldn't, so we asked to be reseated. At this point, the hostess that had seated us seemed very annoyed, letting out a sigh. HOWEVER, a kind employee, Nino reseated us within minutes, and got our drinks out right away. He apologized and sent another waiter our way to take our orders. He is a model and star employee.

It gets better. While sitting and waiting for our orders to come, the same hostess that had seated us was seating another table. They were a party of 4 but only 3 of them were there. I'm not entirely sure about Wildberry's policy on seating and having to have your entire party there, but as the hostess when you are seating people and you know how many people are in their party, you should tell them that. She could have simply asked before seating them, is your entire party here? Instead, after the three of them were sitting already, she said oh you can't sit, not everyone is here. This isn't something you tell them AFTER they are already sitting down looking at their menus. She didn't even have the patience to explain further and ended up pulling another employee to explain to them.

Okay leaving these employee stories behind, I ordered the fresh berries french toast, which was simple but delightful. The berries were indeed fresh and the french toast was nice and fluffy. I also tried some of my friends signature berry bliss pancakes, which you can't go wrong with. Their pancakes are some of the best I've ever had. Top pancake is covered in vanilla anglaise and berry coulis and the middle is smothered in what I believe is mascarpone!
Good food but long wait. I think I'm the end it was worth it but hated waiting an hour for food. Lol

Fantastic service! We had a sugar free latte ( wonderful!). 2 eggs, choice of meat & toast.  Portion sizes are huge, hash browns were not oily, eggs done exactly how I liked them.  No complaints whatsoever, great food quick service.

Thanks to Yelp we got on the waiting list before we arrived! It's the best thing ever because by the time we got there our table was ready. Definitely get there early because the wait is insane! Friendly staff, we got some pretty good service that day.

We ordered the Venetian Skillet and Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes. I loved the pancakes and it was satisfying especially the berry mascarpone. Yum yum yum!

What's all the fuss about? Standard diner with very standard food. Actually, maybe below standard food. My eggs were lukewarm, unseasoned and the chicken sausage too sweet. The coffee was just meh. Seriously, skip the lines and find yourself a place that cares about what they serve

Oh man, a bit chaotic coming here in the morning since it be POPPIN', but thankfully technology is on your side! Wildberry uses a text messaging system which gives you the ability to stroll around until you receive a text notifying you when your table is ready. Very convenient to have, because the boo boo and I were slightly disgruntled to learn that our wait time would be 2 1/2 hours. We were hungry animals in da mornin. BUT we were visiting from out of town so there was plenty of touristy things to do nearby, namely the Chicago BEAN is right across the street at Millennium Park. I also recommend, grabbing one of Wildberry's coffee to go before you head out. They have a good selection.

It was SO nice finally being able to sit down inside after spending time outside in the elements of chilly Chicago. Service was quick thankfully too. We instantly knew we were getting their Berry Bliss pancakes (duh), but my advice is to get these as a side with another entree. It's only a $1.50 more and you get two yummy and fluffy pancakes which is more than enough to fill you up. Plus you can try other entrees instead of filling yourself up on just pancakes. I opted for the Brisket Hash. This was quite hardy, but delicious. The brisket was moist and the gravy was thick and yummy. The pancakes were - without question - BOMB and were a delight. So much fluffy goodness with not too much sweet drizzled on top. I also thought it was nice how they had fresh strawberries and blackberries on the side as a light and refreshing snack.

For a single visit, I'd say we were extremely satisfied! I'll make sure to recommend their yummy pancakes to anyone visiting.

pics.caption: The signature berry pancakes, add on to most breakfast choices for $1.50!

review.des: Giving this a 5 but wishing I could give it a 10!! Best breakfast I've had in a while. Wait time was definitely worthwhile. Waitress was super nice and attentive. Let's not even talk about the food!!!! Skillet was amazingly good and so where the glazed strawberry pancakes. Will definitely come back again before heading back home.
This was the best first meal we've ever had in a new city. The wait wasn't terrible & the food was exceptional. My son, who works in a restaurant, said that the kitchen manager is a god.

Hands down the best pancakes I ever had. The berry pancakes are soo good. They look super sweet but don't worry they aren't! You won't need extra syrup (or at least I didn't) but they're extremely fluffy and flavorful. It's the perfect amount of sweetness and tart from the fruits. The only negative was that the garden skillet had too much cheese and potatoes & not much eggs or other ingredients. The service was impeccable here though - as soon as we sat down we got waters immediately, the food came out pretty quickly and were constantly checked on. If you're in Chicago definitely go here for breakfast - but make sure you go EARLY to avoid a wait. They're super popular!

The berry pancakes are to die for. The skillets are finger lickin' good ! Must try place for brunch!!
Waiting is huge on weekends.
Closes at 2:30

Always upgrade to their specialty pancakes for the extra $1.50, it is SO worth it--especially if you get their signature Berry Bliss that includes fresh berries and mascarpone. Absolutely delicious.

Always make sure to use the No Wait app for here, too. You will get stuck waiting 1-2 hours for a table otherwise.

My second time here I tried the eggs benedict.  The English muffin was more like a bagel - way too bready for me.  I didn't care of the hollaindaise sauce either, but the ham was good.  I think I'd stick with the pancakes next time.

Omg!!! Best breakfast in Chicago... the food here is amazing!!
Pancakes - French toast- crepes
Excellent food. Crepes were the best. Waiter was awesome! We will be back when in Chicago.

Best Breakfast place I've ever been to. Seriously.

Lived in Libertyville and went to the original many times....It was my favorite restaurant in the area - many a Sunday mornings I was there when they opened by myself with the Newspaper (tells you how long ago it was) was afraid the downtown place couldn't possibly capture the amazing food.

It did- omelette was awesome - exactly as I remember - everyone else in my group of 6 loved their orders - next time I'm in town will base my hotel choice on the ability to walk to Wildberry.....

1. It seems like people were bitter about the wait. Don't be that person! Click on "add to waitlist" in Yelp and skip the line!

2. Now that you feel like a smarty pants and get to fill your belly asap, order the caramel pecan pancakes. Holy amazing deliciousness. It tastes like french toast! And if you are like me and always feel a little torn as to the pancake/french toast decision, you will be in heaven!

3. The veggie skillet is fine. Hash brown aren't thoroughly cooked and it's not super flavorful but it's a hearty meal.

TIP: Order a skillet. It comes with pancakes and you can upgrade to a specialty pancake (caramel pecan or berry bliss) for a 1.50. Split this between 2 people. You'll both be satisfied and srill have room for a Superdawg later.

pics.caption: Berry bliss pancakes were delish but the caramel pecan were phenomenal.
Berry bliss pancakes, veggie skillet w/egg whites (come on, cut the cholesterol SOMEWHERE), meat skillet.

review.des:
This restaurant has certainly earned its high praise.  I came here with a group of friends this morning for brunch, and the food was fantastic.

I had the Napa valley omelet with egg whites and cottage cheese with fruit for my side.  The omelet was delectable with figs and applewood bacon, making for a perfect flavor combination.  Not to mention, the serving size was enormous, leaving plenty of leftovers to enjoy later.

I also had the vanilla berry latte, which was delicious.  It tasted a bit like captain crunch cereal, and it was wonderful.

The price was very reasonable for the quantity and quality of food.  The service was knowledgable and friendly.  The only downside is the wait to get in, but there's a way to put in your name in advance and get text message confirmation and notification to help ease the process.

Overall, I highly recommend this restaurant, along with all the other reviewers here.  I know I will return!

pics.caption: Napa valley omelet with egg whites and fruit on the side

review.des: I love love love this place. I highly recommend the cinnamon roll French roasts or pancakes; both great options. All the food here is good! Although if you do not want to wait 2+ hours for a table I highly recommend you get there before 10 am. Nothing bad to say about Wildberry, fantastic establishment.

Wildberry is the place to go for breakfast. I will never love omelettes, chocolate chip pancakes, French toast, and or Belgian waffles the way I do when I go to Wildberry. You have to be prepared to wait, because the place is never slow. Honestly, management, maybe it's time to consider opening another location?

The food, the service, and whether you're indoor or outdoor (I love the outdoor early morning when it's a brisk 55 degrees out), you're going to have a great time. You honestly CANNOT go wrong ordering breakfast from here.

Absolutely delicious! Wildberry is steps from Millennium Park and is a perfect place for an indulgent breakfast. Service was excellent and there was something on the menu for everyone- both sweet and savoury options. Prices are also reasonable. If I ever am in Chicago again, I will definitely be returning.
The omelette was fresh, hot, Tony the server was very attentive
Amazing!! Excellent service and excellent food. The pancakes are awesome and the crepes are the bomb. Definitely a place to visit when I'm in town.
Downtown Chicago location is close to lake and millennium park.  Large portions of food. Great service and worth the wait!
Wild berry pancakes are so fluffy and tasty. I could came here everyday! I wish their portion were a little bit smaller. Most of us did not finish our food and had to take the rest to go.

Dear Wildberry,
You are amazing!!!!
We came on Friday around 12.30 PM. The wait time was 1-1.5 hour. We waited anyway.
I honestly hate our server since she tried to rush me to order. Once we ready to get our check, she was nowhere to be found. I kept asking other servers, but probably they only serve certain table.
I still give this place 5 stars because they're that good!
My bf and I split the corned beef egg benedicts and wildberry waffles. The egg dish was tasty, but the waffles, I am in love! They look just fine, how good can they be? Wow. Wow. So good. It is sweet, but not too sweet. Just perfect.
Yum! I loved everything we ordered! The brisket was especially tasty. I recommend getting in line on Yelp, since when we arrived for brunch, there was a 2-hour wait!

This place is so nice! Service was awesome! 4 of us. We each got a skillet and speciality pancakes. The Oreo s'mores topped is really good but the cinnamon roll pancakes are AMAZING!! They give you so much food. You really can share a skillet between two people! Highly recommended. Put your name on the waitlist ahead of time.

I've been to Wildberry on numerous occasions and am a little shocked with this visit. I decided to try an all vegan option for breakfast. It had tomatoes, veggies, and a veggie patty on top. I asked for a slice of cheese because it's me and cheese is my life. The seller was the avocado on top. However, I was disappointed with how flavorless the whole dish was. Vegan/vegetarian options don't have to be bland which is something Wildberry can improve on. I could've chosen a sweet dish or a scrambler, but I decided to venture out and unfortunately was not happy. Hopefully they will improve the dish or create more tasteful options for those that are vegan.
Pleasant staff and the hash brown bottomed skillets were awesome! Plenty of vegetarian options available

Went to Wildberrys for the first time today, thank good ness for the Yelp check in because when we walked in there was 2 hour wait at like 10:30 AM, so unless you would like to wait a good while I'd definitely check in on yelp. We stilled waited aBout 10 minutes after Yelp said there were no more people waiting in front of us.. Food was great, i had the mexicana skillet with Oreo s'mores pancakes. Best pancakes I've ever had. A lot of good options for just about anyone! It was hard to just one thing. Our waiter was nice, didn't really come around often but it's okay i guess place was really busy. I had a cup a water that i didn't drink so i was fine that my soda didn't get refilled. I'll be going back whenever we visit Chicago again.

So it took 2 hrs to get in but the food was great!  Also it's directly across from Millennium Park so it was easy to kill the time.  The cinnamon roll packages were great as was everything else.  

Advice - plan ahead and waitlist on yelp before coming over.
Great food. Service could be a bit better. Never got a water refill or even checked on after receiving our food.
One of the best breakfast places around however you must get there very early the wait is always more than an hour.
Best breakfast !! Customer service fantastic, food delicious especially the bacon, not to mention cafe coffee great. Thank you for your consistancy .

Haven't been here in awhile, but still amazing!!! Place is always packed. Ordered the veggie omellette with a side of their signature fresh fruit pancake. Wish their is a location closer us.
Food: 5
Service: 3 server was really slow taking the order. Busser nor server did not refill water and busser literally cleaned the table as we were putting our coats on.
Ambience: 3 sat right by the kitchen
Cleanliness: 4

Everything you can expect from a breakfast & brunch diner except the options here are positively overwhelming! Wanted to try almost everything on the menu and appreciated the variety they offer under different dish styles. The service was also fantastic and our waiter was quirky and fun to chat with here and there. Took us a while to finally decide, but I ended up getting the Los Altos Benedict while my bf ordered the Butcher Block skillet.

Both tasted amazing - the Los Altos Benedict was very flavorful and packed a nice slightly spicy kick as well. The skillet was also delicious. Although the portions were also more than enough to fill us both up, we ended up ordering a Signature Berry Bliss Waffle to sub out the pancakes that come with the skillet since we thought one of their sweet options was a must try after seeing all the awesome reviews. Sharing the waffle was perfect since it let us try both savory and sweet dishes from here! The waffle was amazing and I for sure recommend trying one of their waffles or pancakes if you have a sweet tooth! Will definitely stop by here again when we visit Chicago again.

pics.caption: Signature Berry Bliss Waffle, Los Altos Benedict and Butcher Block Skillet

review.des: Great food! Amazing service. Although it's always busy the food comes out quickly and the servers are constantly coming to check on you. My husband and I were out there for a few days from Los Angeles and we loved this place, we were there 3 times! Highly recommend the barbacoa chilaquiles skillet  amazing!

Best pancakes I've ever had! Stopped by on a Thursday morning (around 9 a.m.) and the place was already packed. However, I wasn't too surprised due to the touristy location. We were told it would be about a 25 minute wait and they would send a text when our table was ready, which was really convenient and we decided to walked around Millennium park to kill some time.

There are so many options to choose from on the menu from the sizzlin' skillets to french toast creations, they all sounded delicious. I don't usually order pancakes when I go to breakfast but I felt like I had to since it's what they are known for. I chose the signature berry bliss pancake and I was very pleased. They pancakes were so light and fluffy, I literally could not stop eating them. Not only that but the presentation came out beautiful as well. I also learned that you can add $1.50 for the speciality pancakes with the omelets or skillets. So glad that this place is less than a 5 min walk from our apartment, will be back asap!

pics.caption: Signature berry bliss pancake and Mexicana skillet
