review.des: Omg!!!! Seriously amazing. Yum!!!!! Everything on the menu looked incredible. So glad we ate here!!
Highly recommend checking in on yelp before getting there. Will save you time. Food was outstanding !

Their pancakes and French toast are seriously amazing. I personally love their cinnamon roll pancakes. Their skillets are not bad either. There is often a wait but because of its convenient location, it's really not so bad.

Booked ahead on Yelp, what a time saver.  Waiting outside is shaded by the building. Service was efficient and friendly. Bathrooms were good, considering the volume of people going here. Cornbeef hash was tasty and not over cooked. Rutherford Omelette was huge and really nicely done. I liked the fruit option instead of toast. I added gluten free pancakes which were more dense than regular ones but quite good for a gluten free pancake. We also tried the Classic wildberry bliss pancakes, so good. The restaurant is a little pricy when you include add-ons, squeezed OJ, etc, but very good food and lots of it. They provide takeout containers if you want. If you go for brunch you won't need to eat again until dinner.
The most wonderful place for brunch!! You can't go wrong! Their pancakes are delicious.

Signature Berry Bliss pancakes - the best pancakes I've ever eaten. Place is usually very crowded so you will have to wait a bit for a free table but trust me - it's worth waiting. Delicious food and very nice service. Highly recommend this place!

Walked in no reservation. Got seated right away! After ordering food came out VERY QUICKLY! I created my own omelette and pancakes! It's was sooooooooooo freaking good! Service was amazing!!! Server also took concern for my allergies.

Incredible skillets. Perfectly cooked eggs and pancakes you can not put down!

Only negative is the inability to make reservations, but other than that no complaints
I loved the atmosphere and the food and customer service was great. If your planning to go here. I recommend you place a reservation using yelp.
This is the best breakfast in the Lakeside East area. Great for kids as well, since they have many, many options for your little pancake lover...

I love pancakes. I even like tourist traps. What's even better is when said tourist trap has good food.

First things first (I'm the realist) download the no wait app and put yourself in line to eat before you get there. There will be a wait. It will be long. Do yourself this favor.

When you get there you'll be seated, naturally, this isn't a standing restaurant. The inside looks like a nicer version of IHOP, not necessarily a bad thing- just painting a visual.

You have to get a pancake when you're here. I typically get an omelet but you can sub out your toast for pancakes. Get them! Get the signature berry bliss; for one it's the most expensive and two it's amazing. It's their signature item full of berries. Delicious.

The service is good and the food is just as good. Come here for pancakes, everything else is good too but doesn't stand out like the pancakes do. Eggs are eggs at any diner. That doesn't mean they are bad.

If you're in Chicago you gotta try them out at least once.

This place has great food and quick service.  You will not leave here hungry since they give you a ton of food. Be prepared to have a long wait if you don't get on the waitlist or go early in the morning. I got on the waitlist before we got to the restaurant and we only had to wait about 10 mins for our table, instead of an hour like other guests had to.  Next time I am in Chicago I will come here again!

pics.caption: Denver Skillet and  Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes

review.des:
We didn't actually get to sit down and eat due to our time constrictions.

I recommend putting yourself on the yelp wait-list though (must be within 5miles). Their wait times gets pretty long.
The syrups they use for their pancakes are very fresh, doesn't taste like artificial sugared fruits.
Speaking of fruits, their fruits are all fresh. I love it. None of that glazed mushy strawberry stuff you get at diners.

Strawberry Cheesecake French Toast. MMmMmm... cheesecake like filling on the inside.
It might sound SUPER sweet. BUT it's NOT. It's just right!

Their venue is also very open and gives off a modern feeling. But nothing too fancy.

I would like to come back here sometime and actually be able to enjoy a breakfast here.

The only downside was I felt like their prices are a little high for pancakes. But I felt like it was worth it if you're not eating here everyday for breakfast. :)

Wildberry is a Chicago experience. The wait is very long! We waited almost 1 and 1/2 hours. But the hot cider is amazing. My sister loves their gluten free waffles. I have tried several things on the menu and everything is good! I really enjoyed the corn beef hash skillet. This is a great place for brunch. I highly recommend it!

pics.caption: Menu! Looks so good and very broad. Lots of options

review.des:
Love this restaurant! I have been to this Wildberry and the one in Libertyville on many occasion and neither have ever disappointed! Took my family here for graduation day brunch and everyone raved about the place.

I am a skillets guy and I always get the Mexicana because I love my chorizo.  If you are getting a skillet be sure to substitute pancake for their famous wildeberry crepe (it might cost you a little extra to substitute but its worth it).

I believe the coffee they brew is also Intelligensia, but that might be different now.  In either case the coffee is also excellent.

For those familar with another excellent brunch restaurant, Egg Harbor, the Mexicana is similar to the San Antonio Skillet.  I think Wildeberry is more generous with their portion size than Egg Harbor, but the latter taste a little better. This is by no means a knock on Wildberry because the Mexicana is DELICIOUS!

The thing with this location is that the wait is pretty much always greater than 30 mins, but it is definitely worth it.  It is usually packed and hectic, but that is not going to interfere with you from having a conversation with those at your table.

Overall: 5 stars. What are you waiting for? Go get some!

5 stars for taste
4.5 stars value
4.5 stars for ambience

During our short stay in Chicago, we went to at least 3 other breakfast places and Wildberry had to be my favorite! Try adding chipotle pepper to you omelette, you won't regret it! And yes, the berry bliss pancake lived up to the hype!
The service here was amazing! The Oreo S'mores pancakes are SO good!! GET THEM!!!! It was about an hour wait but totally worth it. We went for Saturday brunch and the service moved pretty quickly!
Amazing food. Great service. I ordered the fresca Omelet. It was cooked beyond perfection. The coffee was great. Will definitely be going back.

Wildberry has been my go-to brunch spot in Chicago for the past four years!  It's always a dilemma figuring out if I want something sweet or savory when I go here, because everything is quality.  I'm usually tempted by the Napa Valley Fig omelet, which has a sweet fig flavor that doesn't overpower its other savory flavors like havarti cheese.  

If you feel like it's time to treat yoself, definitely order the Signature Berry Bliss crepes or the Red Velvet French Toast.  

Wildberry is right across from Grant Park, perfect for strolling off your food coma after a delicious brunch.  My only complaint about Wildberry is that they don't take reservations.  Expect to wait an hour in line if you go on a weekend morning.  Wildberry does, however, have a coffee stand at their entrance, so at least you can enjoy a decadent latte with whipped cream while you're waiting.

pics.caption: That's me with my Napa Valley Fig omelet!   Front and center are my friend's biscuits and gravy

review.des:
I just love going to breakfast places!  It forces me to get up early and explore a new place!  I also get a lot more done in my day =]

As usual, I ordered the skillet with meat.  it. was. awesome.  I would definitely come again and again and order the same thing and never get tired.

We also got the crepes with nutella and banana....needless to say, pretty amazing.

The service was great too!  Everyone very efficient and observant.  Even though they quoted a 2 hours wait or so, we got in within an hour.  Which is great!

If you are in the city and want to get some good breakfast, this is definitely the place to visit.

EDIT: I had their seasonal banana and chocolate chip french toast over the weekend, and it was delicious!  A must try!

I can't stress this enough... RESERVE A TABLE ON YELP OR NOWAIT. We had to wait 10 minutes even though we had reserved a table, so no biggie. People that we're just walking up? 2 hour and 30 minute wait. 150 minutes. 140 minutes more than us... So... yeah.... don't waste your life standing on the pavement when you can be sleeping.

Went here on the first chilly Sunday morning of the year and still a tiny bit wet from some overnight rain but when they asked the general crowd if anyone wanted to sit outside... jeez it was like they were giving away tickets to Hamilton. You'd think there was a mini concert or something for how many people were standing outside of this restaurant.

We we're seated at the back with a line of other two tops. They want to maximize seating obviously but it did feel a little tight quarters. I kept noticing that the couples on both sides of us kept stopping to listen to our conversation (we probably did that too).

Whatever genius decided to take cheap breakfast food and decided to serve it 2 hours later and for 300% markup deserves to be teaching economics at the highest levels of education. We read our yelp reviews like good little yelpers ahead of time and since we didn't want leftovers, smartly decided to split the veggie skillet+sausage with an upgrade to the signature berry bliss pancakes and a side of bacon. This was the perfect amount of food for both of us and we might have had a few bites still left after.

If there is a two and a half hour wait to eat some eggs and pancakes... yes it is wildly overrated. HOWEVER, if you reserve a table via technology and only have to wait 10 minutes... it's totally worth it. Good food, good service, good location, clean, fast, and what you expect for a fancy brunch spot.

I CANNOT EVEN TRY TO DESCRIBE HOW AMAZING THEIR PANCAKES ARE.  

Their food is pretty good, like any other popular breakfast/brunch spot with thousands of reviews but THEIR SIGNATURE PANCAKES WILL CHANGE YOUR LIFE.

Their signature pancakes are called...well Wildberry Pancakes!  It looks overwhelming and you'd think it taste ridiculously sweet, BUT TRUST, THEY ARE PERFECT.  Has the right amount of sweetness, especially when you add syrup, good amount of berries in pancakes,, in between the pancakes, and on the pancakes. DELICIOUS.  IT'S A MUST TRY AND YOU WON'T REGRET IT!  If you get the wild berry crepes, they're just as delicious!

Can't go wrong with sharing either because their portions are huge and you have to make room for the pancakes!

Because this place is popular, be mindful of the time you go.  Wait times ranges from 30 minutes to 3 hours.  The first time we came here, it was a Friday at around 10am, we waited for about 30 minutes.  The second time we came, it was Sunday at around 11:30am, we waited for nearly 2 hours. If you're visiting Chicago, I think the wait is worth it.
Perfect after run spot. Seated quickly and to-go cup coffee provided upon request. (Ps. Get the bacon!)

I knew there was a reason this place stays busy. We went at 7:30 in the morning on a workday and had a great breakfast. Extra points for hot white chocolate, the huge selection of teas, and prompt and friendly service. When we left, around 8:30, it was absolutely packed with a line outside to boot. The pancakes are legit and fluffy, the omelettes hearty and well-done. If you can make it early, this is a great place for a leisurely breakfast.

I came here for brunch with a friend on Sunday morning. Shoutout to Yelp for the "Waitlist" feature within its app for certain restaurants- I was able to join the waitlist from home and then just arrived at the time indicated on the app. It was amazing because it saved me a lot of frustration from having to wait in line or wait in the hot sun. The only complaint I have regarding this matter is, I had specifically asked to be seated outside when I made my waitlist request and when the waiter called and headed towards seating us inside, I was like wait a second and pulled out my app to show him I specifically asked to be seated outside. He was like it'll be another 20 minute wait- if I indicated an hour and a half prior to that I wanted to sit outside, it's rather unreasonable to tell me your table is up next and then get seated indoors. He could tell my frustration and reassured me that I would be seated shortly. It was less than 10 mins later that we were seated outside. The reason I was such a witch about sitting outside is because there is a large difference in the noise level. It is so noisy inside that you can barely talk but much quieter and calmer on the patio. One thing I didn't like about sitting on the patio is that there was one waitress covering the patio area which I think has about seven tables but she also has assistance from a bus guy. The thing is, the bus boy was more attentive and kind enough to respond to our requests because our waitress was too busy catering to the needs of her other customers. I don't hold that against her but keep in mind that there are more people with parties of +4 than two so if you have one waitress that has seven tables and four out of the seven tables have plus four people, it's unreasonable to expect that the waitress has the capacity to get every persons request in. We didn't wait long to have our order taken, my friend ordered an iced latte and she ordered the garden skillet and I ordered the Napa Valley Fig omelette. The omelette contains California eggs, figs, havarti cheese and bacon served with either hash browns or fruit and a choice of pancakes or toast. I don't eat pork so I asked the waitress to substitute for turkey bacon. I also decided to switch out the toast for the specialty pancakes- the Wildberry berry which cost an additional $1.15. My friends coffee arrived rather quickly and she was a little annoyed that it was served in a plastic cup as opposed to a mug. I'm sure it's more convenient for people to be able to take it to go later on. We waited about ten minutes for our order. The portions are rather large, you could eat it all by yourself or you can eat half and take the rest home. The omelette was good but the figs were a little tasteless and dry but I think that's because they were too scorched in the sun from drying. I'm European and Ive literally picked figs off of a tree so I know how sweet the have the capacity to be. Go a little easier on cooking the figs. I think having the real bacon as opposed to the turkey bacon makes a huge difference because figs tend to be sweet and a smoked flavor balances out the sweetness. I loved the turkey bacon but it lacked the smokiness that is essential to making this omelette delicious! The hash browns I ordered were mmmhmm- mhmmmm- I love putting ketchup on my hashbrowns (judgment free zone here) which makes them hundred times better. I would recommend putting more havarti cheese, my omelette barely had any cheese, only one half of the omelette had cheese on it. The pancakes were delicious- wow! Not that I think about it, I didn't even use maple syrup because of the housemade cremes they had on the pancakes that made it delicious. I was stuffed at this point (as you can imagine) but it was worth it. My friends skillet was delicious as well, I've never seen asparagus served in an omelette and I was a little concerned how it would taste considering it was steamed first. The spinach, onions, broccoli, mushrooms and tomatoes blended in extremely well with the eggs and cheese. It was finger licking good!!! I would recommend coming here for lunch but TAKE ADVANTAGE OF THE YELP WAITLIST!! Its a life saver!!

I LOVE wild berry! It's my favorite brunch place in Chicago. I've been here multiple times and never get sick of the food. I usually get the Mexican skillet which is absolutely delicious!! Eggs, chorizo, avocados, jalapeños yum! - it's just perfect especially if you like spicy! Plus the skillets come with a side of pancakes, including any of the specialty pancakes! I've tried the berry bliss, banana cream pie, tiramisu, and Oreo s'mores. I would say my favorite is the banana cream pie. All their coffee drinks are really good too. Wild berry is well priced, service is always good, and food is delicious and portions are just right! The decor is really nice too. The only negative is that the line is often long on weekends. The wait can be 1-2 hours. You can use the Nowait app to put yourself in line and then just show up at your estimated time. I highly recommend wildberry and hope to try some of their other items in the future!

pics.caption: Mexican skillet and Oreo smores pancakes

review.des: I loved this place while visiting chicagoooo ! Long wait but worth it .

Good morning
I have visited Chicago twice in the last year. I love the food here. Everything I have had has been amazing. They are also very efficient. You can the wait by downloading there no wait app. This is a must if you are in the area. Happy Eating.!!
Amazing - our family loves this place! The portions are huge, so I'd recommend sharing. The Mexicana and GF pancakes are definitely with a stop.
I loved it great food quick and much variety! Water however should be served fresh in front of customer not before getting to the table other than that all good

I've been to Chicago twice and both times I've had to come have breakfast here.
The wait can be so long but now you can be added to the wait list on yelp and not physically wait there the entire time which is great since the park is so close by.

Portions are huge and food is delicious and everything is reasonably priced.
There is a reason why this place is so popular.
As busy as this place is, the restaurant is spacious and I really appreciate how they don't crowd the space with too many tables.

Don't leave without trying the berry bliss pancakes!

This is probably my favourite brunch place in Chicago. Love the ambience...the variety of options you get in food not to forget the presentation and taste..just had to wait for too long to get seated since it was a weekend probably!!!

Ridiculous wait. If I had to sum up this place it would be tourist-trap. Even though I knew that coming here, I still had to try it. You can get in line using the Nowait app without actually being in the restaurant. I was able to get "in line" while still 5 minutes away. The line said 1 hr and 30 minutes.

This place is conveniently located near the Millennium Park. We ordered my lunch to go and enjoyed it staring at the numerous people taking pictures at The Bean. Tons of tables are available at the park. We ordered a couple of panini sandwiches, but we ended up getting one panini and a stack of pancakes. This place gets busy, so I blame only myself for not checking my order before I left. The Tuscan Chicken panini that we actually did get was quite delicious. The pancakes seemed okay, but I feel that the pancakes probably would have tasted better if we had dined in.

TIPS:
Order to go and enjoy your meal at the park (less than a 5 minute walk)
Check your order before you leave if you take it to-go

My restaurant scoring guide (Taken from Jeffery C. in Silicon Valley)
5*: Absolutely love it and would strongly recommend / one of my favorites or new place that I can't wait to go again
4*: Liked it and would probably recommend / place I go consistently without it being spectacular or would like to go back and try something else there
3*: It was decent but wouldn't voluntarily recommend / I may go back to there but wouldn't suggest it
2*: It was not very good but not horrible / I'm averse to going back but wouldn't absolutely reject it
1*: Ugh / Not going back there

pics.caption: Convenient benches in front of the Bean for all our food

review.des: EXCELLENT! So many great options. Food was excellent! The menu is filled with so ma y great option. If there is a wait you can walk across the street to Millennial park and the BEAN.
Omelette and pancakes were light and fluffy. Service was decent and coffee was just okay.  Overall nothing to write home about

Food was good, but they are very busy and I felt like I was being rushed even though we weren't in there for very long. The staff was overly eager to ask if you are done with food and my beverage was also taken even though that wasn't asked about and I wasn't finished.  They where very accommodating however with bringing a child and stroller.

Best breakfast we have found in Chicago. Only open for breakfast and lunch, there is usually a wait but **you can put yourself on the waitlist using Yelp when you start to walkover which drastically cuts down the wait time**
The food is excellent and the service is fast and friendly. We liked it so much we came back the next day.
The signature berry bliss items are very good, but almost too sweet. Pancakes are light and fluffy. We also had waffles, omelets and crepes and all were excellent. Plates were all clear at the end of the meal. Coffee is good, medium roast, not bitter, free refills. Portions are generous. Restaurant is spacious and clean, especially for a city. Absolutely nothing bad to say. We will be back.

No complain about the food! Sorry I can't say that about the service. Service was horrible I have to say. This place closes at 2:30 why would they have us waiting for 40mn to get a table than to tell us we have 10mn to order before the kitchen is close. Had never felt so rushed to eat !!! Never coming back! I would say if they are going to rush you to eat than just stop seating people an hour before closing!!! That way you will be able to enjoy your meal!!!
Gluten Free Berry Bliss pancakes were really good!!  Breakfast was a bit pricy, but really yummy!

I'm drooling thinking about this place. You HAVE to try their pancakes. I am not a huge pancake person, but their pancakes are incredible! They're fluffy, flavorful, and it will leave you wanting more. I don't usually eat berries on my pancakes either because I think it tastes soggy, but their "Signature Berry Bliss" and "Cinnamon Roll" pancakes are delicious!! There were 3 of us girls and we ordered 2 entrees and added on the sub-specialty pancakes (+$1.50) for each entree. We got the "Rutherford" Omelette which I would order again. We also got the "Venetian" sizzlin' skillet which was good, but I would try something else. It was the perfect amount of food for us. No leftovers. I would definitely come back again. They have such a wide variety, I'm sure I'll get something else the next time I come. But, no matter what entree I get, I will always order a side of the pancakes.

Also, we used the NoWait app so we actually only ended up waiting 10 minutes (and not the horrendous 2 hours that I've been reading about) by the time it was our turn. Not waiting long also makes for a better experience especially when you're on a time crunch to see more of the wonderful city! :)

pics.caption: The Venetian, Rutherford omelette, "signature berry bliss" pancakes, Cinnamon roll pancakes

review.des:
Best. Pancakes. Ever. This is a must if you're in Chicago. My sister & I were supposed to go here on a Saturday, but we woke up late and the wait was horrendous. If you're going on a weekend, please be prepared to wait.

We came back here on a Tuesday right when it opened. It was worth it to wake up super early to get breakfast. I ordered the hazelnut latte & the Signature Berry Bliss pancakes. The waiter let me choose between the short (3) or full stack (5). I ordered the short stack. The latte was delicious. It wasn't too sweet, which is how I usually prefer my drinks. It took awhile for the food to come since they just opened. The pancakes were amazing. I didn't need to use that much syrup since everything on the plate went together really well. Highly recommend that you order the pancakes.

Overall, it was a good dining experience. If I am ever in Chicago, I'd go here again!

This place gets super crowded on the weekends but we had to try it out on our Chicago trip because of it's amazing reviews, and now I know why!

WildBerrys' food tastes so fresh and perfect. Not only did we go once, but first thing the next morning as well lol. Their breakfast menu fits any appetite (and I'm very picky btw) the food came to the table still piping hot and promptly, despite being so crowded and busy.

The Crepes are to die for! I was so full after the breakfast meal I had, but I knew I had to have their legendary Wildberry Bliss Crepes! And they were worth the painful fullness I had later. No regrets.

I have absolutely nothing negative to say about this place. The staff was wonderful and very welcoming even though they were overrun by incoming diners. Our waiters were very nice every time.

This is the first place I want to visit next time I end up in Chicago again. I only wish a WildBerrys would open up here in Michigan!
Food was good, definitely long wait. It was a very hot day and we sat outside-not a good idea. Coffee was good, definitely the pancakes with fresh berries!

Highly recommended! This place was packed when we came here and had to fall in line. The wait was worth it, the food is really good and the service is great! Didn't' wait that long for our orders to arrive. A great place to eat breakfast, especially in an icy cold weather. Will definitely come back here!
Went here with young son. Food is meh. Large menu, but pancakes are rubbery and coffee fairly weak. Fine if you want little pancakes for your kids; otherwise keep looking.

Outstanding breakfast and/or brunch option in the Loop.

Life as a traveling businessman took me to Chicago last week.  As an NYC resident, we know a thing or two about brunch.  I can say with complete confidence that this place is the real deal.  Straight up, my lady and I had a great experience.

It is a popular restaurant, they do not take reservations, and it was Mother's Day.  We were not a bit surprised when told the wait for a table was 90 minutes.  There were no problems here because the weather was beautiful, we were across the street from Millennium Park, and they took my cell phone number to notify us when our table was ready.  We put our name down at 11:00 and I received a text at 12:30 - exactly the time we were quoted for a wait.

The food was awesome.  I started with some fresh squeezed orange juice and embarked on a seemingly impossible mission to select one of an array of deliciously sounding options for my meal.  I got a little creative, and it worked out like a dream.  Ordered the Mexicana Sizzlin' Skillet comprised of hash browns, cheddar & jack cheese, 2 eggs, chorizo sausage, jalapenos, avocado, cilantro, and onions.  Now here's the kicker: I subbed my side for some specialty pancakes.  Both the skillet and pancakes were epic.  My girlfriend ordered the "Signature Berry Bliss" crepes, which were also excellent.  Big points for the freshness of berries in everything.

I was sufficiently stuffed after finishing this meal.  Thanks for making it a memorable one, and I hope to come back again!

pics.caption: Signature Berry Bliss Crepes with Hazelnut Latte

review.des: Best breakfast place I've ever been to! I'm usually not a fan of breakfast food and I hardly ever eat it, but they make everything so good that I love it when I'm there! The pancakes are to die for!! I highly recommend going there!

Probably the best breakfast place in Chicago! It's right in downtown by the bean. Good view and atmosphere. I've been there multiple times and everytime I order something different and it's never a disappointment! Great service as well.

Place is SUPER busy and the wait can be long.  The food is however very good and the services wasn't too bad either.  You get a good portion of food as well.   I had the corned beef hash and it was about a solid B grade. Wife had pancakes and she loved them, with berries.

Is it safe to say this is the most popular brunch spot in Chitown? Well considering there was a 30 minute wait at 8am on a Saturday even though the place is huge, I'd say yes. The food came out pretty fast and the portions are huge! We shared a Mexicana skillet and a side order of Berry Bliss Pancakes. Our server said that usually people order that just for one person, but it is definitely enough to share unless you're both ravenously hungry.

Mexicana Skillet (11.50) - Hash browns, 2 eggs, chorizo sausage, jalapenos, avocado, cilantro and onions. The hash browns were perfectly crispy and the jalapenos added a nice kick. So much food!

+ a side of Berry Bliss Pancakes (1.50) - 2 pancakes drizzled with their famous sauce and berries. I think the full order comes with 4 pancakes. I don't even normally like pancakes but these were some of the fluffiest ones I've ever had. I can see why every table around us had an order. They give you maple syrup but it's not even necessary because the sauce is so delicious.

They also serve Intelligentsia coffee here! The vanilla latte was solid.

I can definitely see why people willingly dragged their butts out of bed on a weekend morning. Wildberry's is worth it.

[TIP] Download the NoWait app which allows you to get in the monstrous line without having to physically wait at the restaurant. They will text you 5 minutes before your table is ready. Just be sure to be there or else they do give your spot away.

Prior to coming here, I only planned on visiting Chicago once. Post Wildberry, I want to move to Chicago to be closer to what I can only describe as the world's best pancakes. I do not exaggerate. Wildberry is pancake heaven. They have several unique flavors of pancakes, including SMORE'S!! The smore's pancakes were smothered in chocolate sauce, melted marshmallows or meringue, and sprinkled with Oreo cookie bits. Yes, they absolutely were as good as they sound. But, the holy grail of all pancakes have to be the cinnamon roll pancakes. You have not lived until you've tasted Wildberry's cinnamon roll pancakes. Cinnamon sauce and sugary icing melted on top of a stack of warm, fluffy pancakes will be the best thing you've ever put in your mouth.

Trust me, the hour wait is worth it.

The oreo s'mores pancakes were so good  I could only get through 2 of them (out of 5) ... and normally I'm capable of eating a lot. So unless you're super hungry I'd recommend getting a side stack of only 2 pancakes. Our waiter was also super nice and the wait was very short (we also came fairly early to avoid the large crowds).

pics.caption: Oreo s'mores pancakes and iced chai latte

review.des: The veggie omelette was super delicious, the hash browns were nice and crispy. Had the berry waffle which was really tasty! The portions are huge, it can suffice 2 people easily. Will definitely go again!

pics.caption: Veggie omelette, hash browns , apple juice and the berry waffle!

review.des: I'm in heaven  breakfast is the most important meal of the day...tee hee... & yes this is all mine except for Christians skillet., but of course I had a few bites of that as well

The breakfast here was delish!  I knew it was going to be amazing when we got there and there was a line on a Thurs morning.  We decided to brave the cold and sit outside so we didn't have to wait.

Our server was very friendly and brought everything out quickly.  We started with coffee and OJ.  It's amazing how different fresh squeezed OJ is compared to regular.  I'm hooked!  The coffee was pretty tasty as well.  Our server recommended we order something off the menu that comes with toast/pancakes so we can upgrade and try their famous wildberry pancakes.  This was perfect because I wanted to try them, but didn't want a full serving of something that sweet for breakfast.  

I went with the mexican skillet and upgraded to the wildberry pancake ($1.50 extra- worth it).  The food came out so quickly!  We shared the two wildberry pancakes and they were so yummy!  I could see why people raved about them.  I'm not a huge fan of fruit on my pancakes, but for some reason these just worked.  Maybe it was because of that sweet glaze it came with.  My mexican skillet was equally delicious, I was glad that they used real chorizo and not the fake stuff that some NJ breakfast spots use.  It was a tad on the greasy side but was just a perfect combo of all the best breakfast items and had a nice spicy kick to it.

We both left so full and satisfied!  This is a really great breakfast spot that I hopefully will get to go to again.

Out of towner here, who only eats breakfast about 30 times a year, much more of a lunch / dinner eater (I'll eat lunch at 10AM sometimes). But one thing is for sure, I'll travel to Chicago once a year just to eat at wildberry!! Located near the bean, millennium park, this place is a gem. This was the first time we've come kinda late so I had almost a two hour wait :( but obviously well worth it. Just give them your cell # and go walk the park, you can download an app to see how far down the list you are and they will text you about 5 minutes before you are up.

The food is so amazing, your mouth waters as you watch people get their orders. I can't bring myself to order anything other than the butchers block skillet. Hash browns, multiple types of breakfast meat, cheese, and two eggs cooked the way you want. I think you can get a side of toast or something standard or pay an extra $1.50 for pancakes. If you don't get the pancakes you are out of your mind!! I got the berry bliss or whatever they call it! So amazing and sweet, more like a dessert.

My fiancé got the chorizo skillet and the Oreo pancakes. Her pancakes were good, but I have to say it's more like eating a cake for breakfast. Granted it was about 1:30pm at this point in time. I think we both recommend the berry.

Don't miss this place if you come to Chicago.
Priscilla is a great waitress. The scrambled eggs, Turkey Bacon, Strawberry (or banana) pancakes are amazing.

This was one of my favorite meals in Chicago! We went on a Tuesday morning and only had to wait about 15 minutes. The service was great and the food was amazing. Definitely try the cinnamon roll French toast and blueberry pancakes! The garden skillet was incredible as well. I'd recommend this place to anyone visiting Chicago.
Fantastic food.  Super fast and friendly service.  The Cinnamon Roll French Toast was amazing.

Great place for brunch. I waited 7 months just to try this place. At the beginning of the year, I stopped by to meet a friend, and it was a 90 minute wait for 2 people. Disappointed....

Fastforward to July. It's a beautiful morning in Chicago and here I am, back in downtown and I'm hungry, and I'm with a friend who's visiting from the Bay Area about Wildberry, and he's on board. We come by, and it's only a 15 minute wait. Great! We wait maybe 7-8 minutes at most and we're seated outside. This happens to be a great day to be outside, warm & sunny, clear blue skies, so I'm elated that we have a spot for 2 outdoors.

I knew what I wanted before we got there, and I went ahead with the "Signature Berry Bliss". Layers upon layers of goodness, with each and every bite. Soft, fluffy, moist and orgasmic. I did not need a droplet of syrup for this stack of pancakes, and I suggest that you hold off on the syrup, just to get acquainted with what you're eating. Taste the components - the vanilla anglaise, the blackberry coulis, the berry mascarpone, and the mountain of fresh berries provided on your plate.

I can only describe my experience, but to really understand you have to go through the process I went through. I'm a pancake guy during breakfast and brunch, that's my M.O. and I know what satisfies my palate.

Portions are amazing! I know that my pancakes were enough for 2 people, but I was hungry so I devoured everything in plain sight

pics.caption: These pancakes are orgasmic. So delicious!

review.des: First time...visiting from out of town. Seriously the best pumpkin pancakes we have ever had!! Service was great too!
Great service, food and love the app check-in. I was able to bypass the line as I walked over

The chilaquiles barbacoa skillet and pancakes were delicious! That particular skillet was new to the menu. All of the skillets I tried were good. All of staff are very friendly. Everyone enjoyed their brunch and said it was better than Yolk and other brunch restaurants around the area. There are 2 floors and great have a great mixture of old school and new music. I only wish the music was a tad louder. They are fine with splitting the check for large parties. The restaurant is perfect for brunch and perfect does any NU Kellogg, Pritzker, or Feinberg students because it's a 3 minute walk away. I will definitely go back.

It's my first time in Chicago and this was definitely a good place for a first meal in town. I was craving a hearty brunch meal and they definitely delivered.

I had a Los Altos Benedict as soon as I saw the word Chorizo. Very quick turnaround after I ordered. Good taste and very satisfying.

One of the biscuit was a little tough but it wasn't too bad. Also, one of the staff members forgot to bring the Tabasco I requested.

Overall a good experience, but not perfect.
They serve excellent breakfast here. I ordered an omelette combo with blueberry pancakes and a coffee. It can get busy every day but the service is great. I would recommend this place.

Though the food was excellent, the major downer on this eating excursion was the wait time - more than an hour wait at noon! The service was decent, however, our server only visited us twice - once to take our order, and once to give us the check. The only reason why this got a 4 star (instead of 3 star) is because the food was excellent. Crepes could've been less eggy and less fluffy/more dense.  Skillet was excellent - Lots of chorizo

Strongly recommend the cinnamon bun pancakes! All the food was super good!!! The eggs where delicious and our server was very helpful. Overall great breakfast I do recommend joining the waitlist before arriving. We did and just waited less than 3 min to be seated.

Loved this place! Wish they had them in California. We were in town for my daughter's boot camp graduation. The only reason I'm giving them four stars it's because we couldn't reserve a table online for a bigger party. There were a total 7 of us and we had to split tables and sit separately. Otherwise we had to wait an extra 45 mins wait. Staff was nice and food was amazing.

4 Chicago trips later and I finally got the chance to check this place out. We came on Saturday morning at 7am and thankfully didn't have to wait in the line out the door that formed 45 minutes later.

I now understand why this place draws so many people. Great breakfast and huge portions. I opted for the make your own omelet with hash browns and pancakes on the side. I got through only a fourth of it before tapping out.

Our waitress was attentive and service was speedy.

pics.caption: Banana bread french toast and create your own omelet with hashbrowns and pancakkes

review.des: This place was awesome! It gets very packed though. We waited about 30-40 minutes, but it was worth it. I got the Florence Benedict. The hollandaise sauce is great. It is a lot of food so next time my boyfriend and I will share. A lot of food on the plate and good prices too.

I came here alone while I was in Chicago for lunch. It was a big place and the staff was pretty friendly. I went during lunch time and it was pretty crowded but I got seated right away near the other loners by the window but it still felt very comfortable. I ordered the Mexican skillet and added the specialty Oreo S'mores pancakes (only $1.50 more!). It was a lot of foooood. But everything was so good! The pancakes were a bit sweet but what do you expect when you order Oreo S'mores pancakes? I loved the kick of the jalapenos in the skillet and the melty cheese made it that much better. Overall, it was a pretty good value and I'm so glad that the skillets come with pancakes or toast on the side (plus the $1.50 for the speciality pancakes).

Best brunching in the city!!!! The food is absolutely delicious, the service is great and the prices are good. I dine here on the regular and have never had a bad time or a bad meal. Plus their gluten free pancakes can't be beat!!! Highly recommend this place, just be prepared for the wait. It's a must experience, must eat at restaurant!

Hubby and I had brunch there when we visited family in Chicago. We arrived before 10am and did not need to wait. Hubby had a Mexicana skillet with cinnamon roll pancakes. Mexicana was really good, definitely recommend it! Cinnamon roll pancakes were good, nothing too special. I had a napa valley fig omelette with signature berry bliss pancakes. The berry bliss pancakes were really really good! The omelette was quite interesting because it had dry figs in it. I like trying unconventional food and definitely enjoyed this omelette.
Amazing. Do yourself the favor of going here for breakkie!  You should definitely join the waitlist ahead of getting there

Here in chicago for our anniversary trip, we decided to come here for breakfast. Although it was a 45 minute wait (Saturday morning) it was well worth it! Our food came out fast and it was delicious! Nice portions and great staff! The signature berry bliss pancakes were amazing!!!

Had food poisoning from the "Mexicana" skillet. Just landed in Chicago and this was the first place I went to. Got to my airbnb and was plagued with a very heavy stomach ache. Continued to vomit for a long period of time. I assume it was from the salsa as I tasted salsa while throwing up round after round. Awful experience

I recently visited Chicago and decided to come here for breakfast. It is close to the Bean and it is very busy. I highly recommend getting on the Yelp Waitlist before going, it is so convenient. The food was delicious, the service was great especially with how busy they were. If you are looking for quality breakfast or lunch, this is the place!

10.23.16 I hate doing this but yea. I was told that this place is known for their pancakes. Expect for this place to be at least a 2-3 hour wait. We checked in and they took our cell number and when our table was ready, they send us a text message. Spent the weekend in Chicago and this was one of our last meals before flying home. While we waited, hubby wanted to check out a donut shop walking distance from here. I ordered a veggie omelette with hash browns and fruit on the side. I forgot what the mister ordered but he ended up getting the pancakes on the side. I felt that the pancakes had a bitter after taste. Almost tasted like it out was out of the box. It was just meh for me. They had a large menu and staff was friendly. The seating area is quite tight. I don't think it's worth the wait!
Delicious pancakes!!! Great coffee too.. wait times are a bit crazy so keep that in mind.

There's at least a 2 hour wait for this place on the weekends. Whoa. Thankfully you can put your name on the queue through Yelp, which is awesome. The actual wait time was pretty close to what we were told. That sort of line makes you think you're about to eat something revolutionary. It's good, yes. But for that sort of wait I kinda expected to be blown away. Pancakes are in the name so you have to get them. I also had eggs and turkey sausage. Again good. But scrambled eggs are scrambled eggs. They have speciality pancakes with Oreos and that sort of thing. So it's fun to try "wild" pancakes. Good but it wasn't the best pancake I've ever had in my life if I'm being honest. For being crazy busy, the service was excellent. We didn't feel rushed and our waiter was attentive and quick with drinks/ordering/food. Bottom line: check it out but I wouldn't wait 2 hours again.

Chicago. Day 8. Breakfast diner.

Southern benedict - 3/5
Berry bliss waffles - 3/5

Overall, "A-OK."

Food was great; portion sizes were almost overwhelmingly large. Friendly, fast service. Price point is hard to beat for being just off Michigan Avenue. Would definitely go back and would recommend to others.

LOVED this place and the corned beef Benny served w eggs Benedict. The largest portions, friendliest service, and my fave brunch spot I'll return to next time 'fo sure!

**Also I am gluten free so our waitress kindly substituted out the gluten items for fruit instead. Thank you waitress for being so kind and making our first full day in Chicago LOVELY!

What made it very enjoyable was downloading the "No wait" app and not waiting more than 10-minutes. All restaurants should use technology to make seating more efficient at hot spots w 2-hour waits which could be cut in half if they were to incorporate apps to help with such issues. Thank you Wildberry!!!

pics.caption: Corned beef Benny, best brunch ever. The ratings are to be trusted here!

review.des: Amazing!!!! Absolutely the most unreal, amazing breakfast I have ever had. The Los Altos was just delicious!!! This is a must eat in Chicago!

My friends and I came here for brunch this morning (Saturday). The wait was almost two hours BUT they use the No Wait app so we put our names in from the apartment then went and explored the city while we waited. We got a text once the table was ready (was within 3 mins of the estimated time that was provided when we put our names it!) and headed over to the restaurant. I'd definitely recommend using the app to maximize the use of your wait time.

Now to the food- SO GOOD. Two of us got skillets (mine was the Garden one) which were huge and came with a side. We chose to upgrade our sides to specialty pancakes and it was TOTALLY the right decision. I got the Signature Berry Bliss pancakes and they were just that- complete bliss! My friend got the seasonal Blueberry Danish pancakes and they were really good too. The skillets themselves were great, I'd say mine maybe had too many green beans but that's just a personal preference, so I just ate around them. Our other friend got a salad and French fries and they were also really good.

My main recommendation would be to come hungry- the portions are generous here and you'll want to eat everything! The only downside was that I was so full I had to stop eating before I finished my pancakes. Loved this place, will be back again next time I am in town!

Very very busy breakfast place esp on weekends.  You will wait awhile for a table but it is so worth it.  We've had egg dishes, French toast.  Lots of items and they are all homemade and delicious flavors.  But my favorite thing ever, the drink I dream about at night is the raspberry white chocolate latte.  It's the best thing I've ever tasted.  

Enjoy!  Portions are large.  You will not need lunch after eating here.

We went at 8:00 am and there was already a 30-45 min wait. We were seated in 20 minutes. Vanilla latte was FANTASTIC. I got the eggs Benedict and other people I was with got pancakes and such. Good service, good food. Huge portions.

Really good breakfast but plan on getting here early! We checked in at 9am on Sunday and it was already a 2.5 hour wait. We decided to get our food to go and a coffee to wait, ended up being 30 min so we went exploring. Our food was good, we got the berry bliss crepes and waffles, both were so awesome. the berries and cream on top put it all together. Their coffee is also excellent. Be wary of the crowds, if you can beat the crowds, you're good. If you're willing to wait that long, good on you. Staff were as friendly as they can be for being 2.5 hours behind. Definitely worth the visit but go early!

Was so excited to try this place while I was in town, waited an hour and a half and got food so bad I had to send it back. Even after all that they still got our bill wrong. Long wait, plus mediocre service, plus bad food = a really disappointing Chicago dining experience. Would never recommend or return.

This is obviously a very popular breakfast/lunch spot.  We were staying nearby at the Radisson so it was an easy walk to Wildberry.  We arrived at 8:15 on a Sunday and were given a wait time of 45-60 minutes.  They text you when your table is ready which is really convenient and it's nice not hearing them yell out people's names the whole time you are waiting.  We were seated right at the 45 minute mark.  By the time we left at 9:30 the wait was up to 75-90 minutes so go early if you don't want to spend as long waiting!   There is a little coffee bar up front so you can get coffee or tea while you wait.  

For breakfast I had the eggs, bacon, fruit and side of pancakes.  I paid for the up charge specialty pancakes and went with the fig and walnut which were excellent.  Unless you super duper love pancakes, the pancakes entree seems overkill to me.  It's a huge stack of five pancakes with no sides.  

All in all we really enjoyed Wildberry.  I think they do a great job of serving a massive number of people efficiently.  Our server was friendly and helpful, the food came out quickly and everything was delicious!

pics.caption: Eggs bacon, fruit and the fig/walnut pancakes

review.des: Yelptastic, awesome food, awesome service and nice ambiance. The tri-fecta for Yelp tasticness!!!!!! First place we ate when we arrived to Chicago and was definitely a good choice. Reserve when you're heading over and you'll be good to go.

While in Chicago recently, I was told it's a must to try this place but heard the wait could be long.  We had a party of 6 so we had to see the hostess to get on the waitlist.  We made sure to arrive about 30 minutes before we were meeting the rest of our party to get our name on the list.  It's was about a 45 minute wait, but for some reason the time seemed to go by quickly.   I bet if it was just my mom and I we wouldn't have had to wait more than 10-15 minutes because we could have done the waitlist option on Yelp.

I had the mushroom omelet with a side of banana chocolate chip pancakes....yummy!!!  Would definitely go back again to try a different type of pancake.  Must try while visiting Chicago.

Excellent breakfast/brunch place in Chicago! Great service and many delicious options to eat. I had the California Napa Omelette that comes with figs, havarti cheese and bacon. Superb. There was about a 30 minute wait on a Tuesday noon, but I used the yelp online waitlist at my hotel, and after a 10 minute walk to the restaurant, they got me right in.

Sign up on the WAITING LIST prior to coming if possible! It was crowded when we came and its Monday. The wait will be about 45mins if you sign up upon arrival.

Everything was great! The customer service, food and location was wonderful. The food was cooked just as requested. I had the Block dish (skillet dish)  Eggs, hash browns, turkey sausage, chicken sausage and bacon and Carmel Apple French Toast (mouth watering)! Food came out with in 15 minutes of ordering.
Was phenomenal! Got the Mexicana skillet. SO filling. Pancakes were great too. Tons of food. Fresh OJ, good rich syrup, crispy potatoes, spicy chorizo. Mmmm.

I recently stopped by on a weekday and luckily there was no wait when we walked in! This restaurant is conveniently located by the Millennium Park. They use Intelligentsia coffee beans so their coffee was pretty good. My sister and I split the Venetian skillet (and added a specialty pancake). The Venetian skillet includes hash browns, cheddar & jack cheese, 2 eggs, Italian sausage, bell peppers, onions & tomatoes. The portions were pretty big and definitely enough to share! We added on the "Signature Berry Bliss" pancake and were glad we did! The pancake was perfectly fluffy and came with a variety of berry toppings. Yum! I would highly recommend this breakfast spot if you're in the area. The restaurant is fairly large so turnaround is probably pretty quick if you have to wait.

Great location right across the street from Millennium Park...

Food was great - I had the pumpkin pancakes (in season) with the pumpkin butter (which was amazing) and my wife had mix berry crepes which was huge (she enjoyed it too).  We both had the fresh strawberry smoothie which was one the best smoothies I've had.

Service was great - I think we had Jeremy and he made ordering real easy for everyone.  Plus he had a great attitude and a passion to serve which is a lost art nowadays.

Only complaint (not really a complaint) was the wait time and line system.  We checked in with the Yelp checkin app which saved some time but they still make you wait in a cramped lobby.  I recommend they get some type of buzzer system going.

We almost went two days in a row while visiting Chicago but the second day there was a 1 1/2 hour wait.

I highly recommend this for your breakfast spot in Chicago!
Love that you can get on the waitlist from Yelp...it's truly the only way to go. The food was yummy but come hungry because they serve a ton of food. Service was top notch!

"HANDS DOWN" the absolute best place for breakfast! I have never ordered a meal that I didn't LOVE! I enjoy trying their seasonal or new menu items. My favorites are cinnamon roll pancakes, berry bliss pancakes and the apple french toast. I have eaten there more times than I can count! The staff is ALWAYS attentive and friendly!
Friendly, patient staff and oh yes the food was gorgeous to look at and tasty. Coffee was very good. Tip: Use the Yelp app to book. It made getting in on a crazy busy day a breeze.

Great portions and generous fresh pancake toppings. Probably slightly better than what you'd get at an average diner. Otherwise I think it's one of those places that are hyped and you probably will go due to FOMO.

I'm surprised not many people use app for waitlist!

This place was beyond amazing - the pancakes were of so much flavor, not crazy sweet like they just dumped a bunch of sugar on the pancakes, but rich with different scents.

The quality of both the pancakes and the fruits were good.

We had the omelette and also crepes, man the saltiness and and meat/vegetables' tastes were on key....Also their hashbrowns were crazy good.

Not crazy expensive since you could get the normal order then as a side of pancakes substitute for specialty pancakes instead for additional few 1-2$.

Went there 2/3 mornings for breakfast (would've went for all 3 but one of the days just didn't wake up early enough lol)
Food was amazing, join the waitlist so your wait won't be long. We joined in the morning, went and did some sightseeing. And our table was ready once we were done. Food came pretty quick!
This is a solid breakfast place. The berry bliss waffles was delicious and sweet.  the lemon poppy seed pancakes were good but a bit doughy for my liking.
Totally overrated not worth the wait mediocre pancakes tourist trap. Service was awful very slow I have had better branches and so many other places in Chicago

excellent customer services for such a crowded place. I ran into an issue with not liking my dish and was reluctant to ask, but I did and there was no attitude or push back. The dish wasn't bad, but my taste buds just didn't care for it. I was able to exchange my meal wit no problems. The wait wasn't long at all and the food and coffee options were a delight!!!
Denver skillet and Mexicana skillet are excellent. Love this place. I like the fact that I can use Yelp to join the wait list. Signature pancakes are amazing. Nuff said!
This was excellent. Mybhubby and I shared the berry bliss pancakes and corned beef Benedict. Both were really good. Join the waiting list online, otherwise you maybe waiting a long time.

went on a cousin's recommendation of things to try in chicago at least once and left having had probably the best pancakes ever. period. go for breakfast, you'll not be disappointed. omelets are on point and portions are enormous! so tasty! yum!
wish they took reservations!

Mmm, mmm, mmm. This place was delicious. We ordered the cinnamon roll pancakes, as well as the Signature Berry Bliss pancakes. Omg! Next time we're in Chicago, we'll definitely visit this place again. Plus, although there was a long wait, the service was great!

Came here with my boyfriend while visiting Chivago last week. We checked Yelp at about 9:00 on a Saturday and the wait was quoted as an hour. We arrived after just over an hour and had to wait for about another 25 minutes.
Once we were seated, our waitress quickly took our drink order. We asked for recommendations and her response was hurried and rehearsed. I would imagine they get asked this frequently.
I ordered Espanola omelette and the wildberry pancake. Both were delicious! The servings are HUGE so I highly recommend splitting something if you plan to continue to sightsee. I would definitely come back but I'd get up early to avoid the wait next time.

One has to applaud American efficiency, we booked this place 100 min before we came, 78 groups in line before us, the tempo things happens here is crazy, from people leave to the table is cleared, cleaned and with water, cutlery and next is less than 2 min. Waiters carrying trays over there head with 5-6 plates in one hand. Food was yummy and prices Good.. We could learn alot from places lile this in Europe

Lovely restaurant. It has outdoor and indoor seating. Luckily, we found parking around the corner at a meter.
It was $6.50 per hour.

The restaurant has an app, so you can keep track of your place in the que. Once your name is up- you have 5 mins to make it to the front staff before you lose your place.

Our wait was about 30 mins on a Friday afternoon. Standard-No biggie.

We were brought water and silverware almost immediately. Our server was friendly enough. Pancakes, waffles, French toast was a la Carte. So we ordered hash brown & bacon as sides.

I swear they have some type of magician in the kitchen, because our food came out within 10 mins of us ordering.

The Oreo S'mores pancakes literally had steam rising out of it, the thing was so hot and gooey. The berry bliss waffles flavors were pretty good, but dry on the inside- I like my French toast batter to soak through (just a personal choice).

The hash browns were ultra fresh, like picked out the dirt and grated that day- fresh, it lacked seasonings-but hey that's why they make salt & pepper.

The reason for 4stars instead of 5, welp they made a mistake with the s'mores pancake and one of them were blueberry, which my daughter doesn't like. It was immediately rectified and she was given a new batch of pancakes within 5 mins.

The staff were friendly front front to back. I would visit again.

pics.caption: S'mores Pancakes, Hash Browns and Berry Bliss Waffles. Yum!

review.des:
Compared to other brunch places, Wildberry is pretty difficult to get into since it is always so busy. I would say the average wait time on the weekends is around 1.5-2 hours. If you are not in a rush however, I would recommend putting your name down and wandering around Millennium Park until they call you back. The line actually moves pretty quickly!

I would say that the pancakes at Wildberry are definitely the stars of the show. Brunch food can taste pretty similar and mundane after a while and it can be hard to find dishes that stand out. This time, I got the Berry Bliss pancakes as my main order with a side of the seasonal Strawberry Lemon Poppyseed pancakes (yes I ordered pancakes with a side of pancakes). The signature Berry Bliss pancakes were very good-fluffy and the fruit was a nice touch. For me, the Berry Bliss pancakes overshadowed the Strawberry Lemon Poppyseed ones by a great amount. This was a very filling meal, especially after running a half marathon in the morning. :)

If you have time to spare and don't mind waiting, definitely stop by Wildberry and order the pancakes! There are so many different flavors to choose from. If you aren't in the mood for pancakes, you can also get many of the flavors in the form of French toast or crepes!

pics.caption: Seasonal strawberry lemon poppyseed pancakes. Nothing particularly outstanding about these.
Signature Berry Bliss. Definitely order this!

review.des: I dont think I've ever had pancakes this perfect! Great service and food came out pretty fast.
The wait is a killer, but totally worth it!!! Everything on the menu is amazing!! In the summer, try not to sit outdoors as there as a ton of bees, and they ruin the meal!!
CHECK IN ONLINE AHEAD OF TIME!! You've been warned. Really good food fast service packed ashell.
All the ratings don't like.  Best omlette I have had, she got eggs Benedict and they were amazing.
The service and the food were spectacular. The wildberries French toast and the cinnamon roll french toast were two thumbs up.

Great breakfast spot in the Mag. Mile area.  The service was really good and we both liked our very late breakfast.  I had the Denver Sizlin Skillet, with their awesome pancakes and the skillet itself was more than I could eat.  The pancakes are great, and we tried two different varieties.  GF had an omelette that was also really good, and everything came with coffee from a local roaster that was excellent.

I used the No Wait app to great success! Saved my place in line about 30 mins prior to arriving. There were 61 parties ahead of me at the time. Not 5 minutes after arriving we were seated. I've heard that there can be up to hour-long waits for lunch so fortunately didn't have to deal with that.

The food was decent - not mind blowing but not too bad. The service was friendly up until when we ordered but no one checked up on us once after that. The tables on either side were checked on several times but our server didn't show again until time to pay. I ate my hash-browns without ketchup, alas!

Pretty big restaurant. But be warned: this place gets PACKED, especially on the weekends. I think the average wait time when we got there was about 1 hour for a table. But they have a little coffee corner for those people that want a quick coffee and pastry to go. I didn't actually eat any of their signature pancakes, but I got their Napa Valley Fig omelette b/c I love trying unique dishes when I go out. It was tasty, with figs and havarti cheese along with some bacon and a side of regular pancakes.

Service was friendly and quick, I would definitely come back (although probably on a weekday) if I was back in town.

pics.caption: Napa valley fig omelette with a side of pancakes

review.des: Bomb bomb bomb!!!!! That pretty much sums it up, I had to try the berry pancakes and they did not disappoint, amazing! The bacon was so good as well. And the service was great, when I come back to visit I'll definitely will be coming back.

pics.caption: My absolute fave were these berry pancakes

review.des: Love this place for breakfast, it is just walking distance from my apartment, so I love to come here on a casual morning to grab a good American breakfast. The only issue is that there is always a super long line (at least 2 hours), on weekends, and they do not take reservations. Other than that, their omelettes are so great, would totally recommend coming. The staff is so friendly and amazing. Love this place. Also not too expensive
Highly recommended the wild mushroom omlette and pancakes. The portion is huge and enough for 2 persons. The place is crowded and getting in line through the Yelp app is a good idea.
Consistently good food, service and experience across all  of their locations.  A great place for a work meeting or meal between friends.

Awesome breakfast joint in both magnificent mile and millennium park area.  Mag Mile definitely has shorter wait times (on weekends) but both are phenomenal.  We checked in with Yelp and when we got the text (40 minutes later) we walked in and immediately got our table.  Wonderful staff and easy ordering.

A friend kept urging me to go to Wildberry. While I am a fan of breakfast and brunch, I'm not really into big box restaurants like I used to be. And I'm not a fan of long lines because that's usually an indication of a restaurant drawing a crowd based on notoriety rather than based on good food.

I give big ups on the breakfast. I had chocolate chip waffles that came with enough melted chocolate chips that I didn't need syrup. I ordered two eggs scrambled well with cream cheese and two glasses of milk. That was more than enough.

Service at the front of the house is something of a treat. The hostesses seemed like they prefered to be at home. Table service and the great food overshadowed that. For anyone who wants a good breakfast spot in that part of downtown will do good to arrive not too soon after the doors open. The line gets long and once the temperatures become more spring- and summer-like, there will be long waits.
I love this place. The cinnamon pancakes were awesome. Good food and great prices. I just wish they could offer military discount

OMG without a doubt, the best breakfast in America. I have a firm rule of not waiting an hour or more for anything, let alone breakfast. But i break that rule for Wildberry Cafe. Their Mexican Skillet is AMAZING, and every pancake I've tried is delightful. Highly recommended!!!
Stood in line for over 2 hours for an overhyped Denny's situation! I was so outdone with the lackluster food! A huge time waster!

Loved this place! I met with a large group of friends for a Sunday brunch here. One of the girls in the group had to get there and hour and a half ahead to get us on the wait list. There are no reservations on Sunday's (possibly other days too). The wait time when I got there was in the neighborhood of 1.5 hours.

When I walked in around 1pm the place was WALL TO WALL, BODY TO BODY, ELBOW TO ELBOW PACKKKKKED! There was NO way at all to turn around in the lobby. We were seated within about 15 minutes of my arriving (after having been on the wait list).

The seating was tight. The lady at the table behind ours kept bumping elbows with me - it was that close of quarters.

Our waitress was SUPER DUPER SUPER DUPER DUPER SWEET. I can't remember her name but she was a short brownskinned black girl with curly hair and maybe dimples. SUPER SWEET AND ATTENTIVE and ACCOMMODATING that one.

I ordered the corned beef hash and 2 eggs over easy + a side of bacon and sour dough toast. I also had their hazelnut Latte. Except for the excessive cheese atop the hash browns, Everything was perfect! Fantastic.

All and all I would definitely return here. Perfect brunch place. I would suggest dropping by around 11 am to get on the wait list and then walk over to State street and shop a bit or even go to catch a movie at Block 37. By the time you're done, bam, time to eat! Bon appetite.

pics.caption: Corned beef hash skillet, toast, latte and bacon (not pictured)

review.des:
One of the best breakfast/ brunch places!

I was visiting for a weekend and my friend and we decided to get brunch here. It was about an hour and half wait, but totally worth it! The restaurant is very close to The Bean (Cloudgate)/ Millennium Park and other popular/ well known shopping stores.

I had the Wild Mushroom Omelet and upgraded my pancakes to the Cinnamon Roll Pancakes. They do not skip out on serving size! Both of us ended up taking our pancakes to-go and ate them for breakfast the next morning!

The only negative experience was one of the wait-staff said he would come back with to-go boxes and never did, but our waitress came promptly with them when she delivered the bill.

My suggestion is to get on the waitlist ASAP, look at the menu beforehand and know what you want to eat. It is a very popular place but it does not disappoint!

Definitely a must go. Your going to Chicago to see the bean, and this is right there. The portions are pretty big and min wait is usually 30 min . The Mexican skillet was fire!!!!!!! A little spicy too but that's what I like, but definite bang for your buck is getting a skillet and added the specialty pancakes which is only $1.5 dollars more, and you get the best of both worlds. If I knew this much food was going to be brought I would've just ordered 1 skillet with the specialty pancakes add on and been fine . But definitely check It out !! Must see

pics.caption: Mexican skillet, corned beef hasbrown skillet, s'mores pancakes, apple pecan pancakes. With hot chocolate and cappuccino

review.des: Great food. Excellent bang for your buck. Easy to share. Very generous portions. The staff was friendly and helpful. Make sure to get the specialty pancakes.

Such a great breakfast! We got there @10 on a Sunday and did have to wait for about 20 minutes, so I suggest going early if possible. I'd also suggest waiting in the lobby instead of the entrance. I got eggs, hash browns, sausage links & chocolate chip pancakes (all came in one meal!) everything was delicious; the pancakes were so fluffy and light and the eggs were some of the best I've ever had. The coffee was great too as well as their fresh squeezed orange juice. I highly recommend going and am looking forward to my next visit!

Was really packed on a Friday morning.

Service was good and efficient.

Menu choices are vast.

Good iced tea.  Good eggs Benedict.  Good kids menu.  Good cinnamon roll pancakes.

Now I know why this had such high ratings!! AMAZING! First, it was busy but service was phenomenal! Greeted right away by hosts, 10-20 min wait. You could see tables turned over quickly. Food portions were big! I got 2 eggs with turkey sausage and was surprise to get 3 patties instead of the usual 2. Plus - had to try the signature Berry bliss pancakes and so glad I did! The ricotta and fresh fruit was delicious, no need for extra syrup. Servers were very friendly and checked back often. Worth the 30 min walk from union station and would definitely come back again!

Came on a weekday morning in the spring and there was a 10-15 minute wait for a table (which is much better than the wait during the summer).

We had the Fresca omelette (sun dried tomatoes, basil, avocado, provolone) with chicken sausage ($12). This was delicious! Really nice blend of flavors and very tasty. It also comes with a choice of fruit or hash browns and a side of pancakes. The fruit is a small bowl of mixed fruit that includes honeydew, cantaloupe, pineapple, and grapes. We upgraded the pancakes to the signature berry bliss (+$1.50) which comes with two pancakes. This was good but not as good as the first time I had it, possibly because this time it was heavy in the coulis and very little mascarpone.

We also had the Denver sizzling skillet ($10.50) which had eggs, cheese, bell peppers and onions over hash browns. This also comes with a side of pancakes. This was fine but a fairly normal dish and paled in comparison to the Fresca.

Nice breakfast spot if you can get in without a crazy wait!

This place is amazing. The 2 hour wait was worth it! They have a big selection sure to accommodate everyone and everyone was super friendly. Definitely check it out for brunch. The coffee was great too! Try the white chocolate mocha and Nutella crepe.

This is absolutely my favorite brunch spot in the city. The mexicana skillet with poached eggs is delicious, and I always get it with a side of the berry bliss pancakes. The portion sizes are on the larger size, so be prepared to arrive with a large appetite. Lines can get crazy over the weekend, but it's well worth the wait.
Yum!!!  Gluten-Free paradise. Jasmine is a great server! Espanola omelet is excellent. Avocado and Ketone diet or paleo will be very satisfied.

Favorite breakfast spot! My fiancé and I go almost every Sunday! The check in process online is extremely fast and so convenient especially since we live right around the corner. The staff is so friendly and the food is very fresh and delicious. Always extremely pleased with how tasty, not only the breakfast menu but lunch menu is as well. Definitely recommend the barbacoa chilaquiles, veggie/black bean burger, and Nutella crepes!

This place is a hotspot. So make sure you get here early. We arrived at 930am and within 10min of sitting down it was like a mad house. But let me tell you one thing a rush and a busy restaurant doesn't slow the business down.

Our waitress was fast and bubbly. Her people skills were made for this industry she kept us informed of the whole menu as it was our first time here. She made sure everyone had full cups and food came out quickly.

I'm only giving this restaurant a 4 star because of one thing. I asked for my meal a certain way and it wasn't executed to that manner. But with out delay she grab my plate took it to the back and they had a fresh meal out in literally 3min.

To me this is unheard of, usually you need to wait 10-15 min for your real to come out of there was something wrong with it.

We ordered everything that was recommended and the food was phenomenal. I had the brisket and hash, we also ordered the egg,potato, and ham skillet. And to finish it off we ordered the Oreo pancakes. With a side of a Nutella banana crep and and regular pancake.

I would definitely come back here when in town again. Thank you for the wonderful food.
Breakfast wait was crazy but with it. Use the yelp waitlist App. Had a pasta Benedict breakfast special and was very happy with the choice. Enjoyed the waitress and the ambience.

Excellent food and service!
Wait time could ve very long, so put yourself on the waitlist, and check it often. They will text you when your spot in line is close, but calculate about 1min per person on the waitlist. This will save you time to go explore Millenium park or the Chicago Cultural Center nearby.
Enjoy the delicious food!!

This place is hyped up for good reason! I rarely give 5 stars but this place deserves all five and probably an extra one.

I've came here twice and both times were using the no wait app. If you are trying to go to Wildberry, i suggest downloading this on your phone and its basically waiting for a table without actually going in to the restaurant. Once they text you to say your table is ready, you have 5 minutes to get there in person. Then, you wait a few minutes and you're seated pretty quickly. I've tried the mexicana skillet, the garden skillet, the southern Benedict, fried chicken and waffles (there are jalapeños and bacon bits embedded in the waffle!) and of course, the signature berry bliss pancakes. Portion sizes are absolutely huge and you will leave feeling extra satisfied and happy. I'd list my favorites but all the things I've tried are delicious and hearty! The pancakes are a little underwhelming but that may be because they're normally too hyped up.

Service here was also phenomenal! Our waitress was so sweet and bubbly and extra patient with us even when we ordered something halfway through the meal for a friend who was joining us late. We sat there for quite a bit longer than we should've and no one rushed us out though they probably should have since there was still a huge wait.

Overall, a very enjoyable experience that will leave you happy, satiated and fueled for your walk through Millennium Park or Michigan Ave. Would recommend to anyone visiting Chicago for the first time! (or any time after that)

pics.caption: Southern Benedict, mexicana skillet and signature berry bliss pancakes

review.des: Get here early, long wait times on the weekends. Waited an hour and half which we expected. Our eggs Benedict were okay but not the best ever. Decent breakfast spot. Service was great.

You can't go wrong with anything you order here, we liked it so much we came here twice during our visit. My favorite thing I ordered was the Mexicana skillet it is a huge dish so come hungry ! The skillet comes with your choice of pancakes or toast and there are tons of pancake options. I tried the berries and granola pancakes and the caramel apple pecan, both were delicious. Join the waitlist with the yelp app to avoid a long wait. There's a good reason why this is a popular breakfast spot in Chicago.

Husband tried the special- angel hair pasta Benedict. He really enjoyed it. The brisket hash was o.k. Ordered it without the gravy because it was too heavy on sage for me. Tasty- but tastes more like roast beef than what I was hoping for in a brisket. Pancakes were great though! Service was quick and efficient.

A popular place, so we had to wait 30 minutes, but totally worth it. Crepes, blueberry pancakes, and eggs Benedict were all exquisite. And despite the waves of customers, very friendly and courteous staff.

This review is actually for the yelp page itself. I'm in town for a conference and saw the amazing reviews for this place and with it being a 15 min walk from my hotel, I had to stop by. I timed it perfectly to grab a quick order to go between conference sessions and thought how convenient it was to have the online ordering on the yelp page. I walked all the way over here to find that my order has been cancelled. When I asked the staff member she stated that the online ordering link on yelp is a 3rd party vendor they no longer use and have asked yelp repeatedly to take off. As a consumer who checks yelp reviews everywhere I go, I would appreciate linking things that actually work. I now have to wait an additional 20 mins for my food and factoring in the walk back, I'll miss my next conference session. Thanks, Yelp.

Adding to my review...upon finally making it back to my hotel, my order is missing the hash browns. I got the southern benny and banana cream pie crepes. The food is good, but I guess next time I'll just eat there to make sure #1 my food is there and #2 I actually get everything I ordered.

This place was bumping on a Friday morning, definitely use the yelp app to "get in line" and you'll be glad you did.  The place was absolutely packed.  Service was prompt.  I definitely wanted to try the pancakes but I needed some protein too.  I went with the fresca omelet which comes with fruit or hashbrowns as well as pancakes or toast.  Definitely get the pancakes because that's really what this place is known for.  I was conflicted over all the different types of pancakes and ended up going with signature berry bliss.  I was worried it would be too sweet with all the things they put on it but it actually was just nice.  There was SO MUCH FOOD that came out with my one order.  If I wasn't having breakfast solo, I could have definitely split this one order with another person and it would have been just right.  I ordered a small milk but ended up with a large (oh well, more protein).  Free wifi, just get the password from your server!

pics.caption: Too much food.  Look at the size of that omelet!

review.des:
This place is AMAZING! This was the first brunch place I tried on my trip in Chicago and it definitely filled my friends and me up! The service here was good as well, and it's conveniently located right near the Bean!

The portions here are HUGE. My friend and I both ordered pancakes (cinnamon roll and oreo s'mores) and it's a good thing we chose the kid's size instead of the regular size. The kid's size consists of 6 small pancakes and the regular size consists of 5 regular sized pancakes. The portions were so huge that even the kid's size was a struggle to finish, but they were delicious! My other friend ordered the Denver skillet and he was raving about how phenomenal the subtle sweet taste was.

This place is definitely highly recommended and I am excited to come here again on my next Chicago trip!
