This place was awesome! I was really lucky to get there when there was no wait and a couple of minutes after it was packed! I ordered the berry french toast and tried my friend's omelette, both were really yummy. The staff are very prompt and attentive. Once you're almost done eating, its very obvious that they are trying to get you out of there. They keep asking if you're done ans ready to have your plate taken away. But the food is sooo good, you'd want to eat every bite!

pics.caption: Signature berry french toast et al

review.des: Check in with yelp and be prepared to wait, food is amazing but ensure you check in early

pics.caption: Souther egg Benedict was by far the best egg Benedict I have ever had

review.des:
Wildberry was recommended to me by family and friends so I had very high expectations going in. They were all exceeded!

The food was amazing and service was impeccable!
I had the Mexicana skillet with an upgrade to the Oreo S'mores Pancakes and the skillet was very well done. It surprised me by how spicy it was as usually most places advertise spicy but it would be mild.

We were served by Haley who was very informative and was a great server!

It was definitely worth the 30 mins wait and next time I am in Chicago this is a go-to.

Lots of food.  The omelette came with a plateful of hashbrowns and pancakes on the side, for heaven's sake.  Got the mushroom omelette, and also tried my companion's veggie omelette; liked both.  Everything was yummy.  Fast, friendly service.  Yes, it was crowded and noisy on a weekday lunch hour, but we were able to converse, and nobody was bumping elbows.

There is nothing excellent about this place. The food was good, but not the best. The service was also good, but I felt like I was being rushed. We tried the famed berry French toast and frankly it was very disappointing. The Florence Benedict was good though. Overall a good place for standard fare, but it's prob not the best brunch you've ever/ you will ever have...

I have had a lot of great breakfasts in Chicago but this one maybe the best! The Mexican Omelette was best I've ever had. The GF pancakes were great. The portions are huge and the service was good. Can't wait to return.

Delicious food, great service, and atmosphere -warm and inviting ! It's
also perfectly located !

Delicious. Red velvet toast was very unique and sweet without the syrup. I felt like it was more of rolled cake? Garden skillet was amazing and cooked perfectly. FYI they won't let you sit down unless all parties are there.

This is so far the best breakfast restaurant I've ever had. Their hash brown are perfect, crispy on the outside, soft in the inside. (I'm guessing these are made with fresh potatoes) the pancake are the traditional American style buttermilk pancakes which made with perfection. The reason why I gave it a 4 star instead of 5, because the napa valley omelette that I had, the cheese was not evenly distributed. Only the center had the melted cheese. It will be nice if the cheese is evenly distributed so each bit has a bit of melted cheese in your mouth. Overall, I'm actually giving a 4.5, but since yelp doesn't have half a star, so...4 stars.
Great pancakes and great coffee!!!  Service was great, we ordered and received our food quickly.  I highly recommend eating

Came on a Thursday morning around 10am, no wait at all. Sooo many choices! Everything looked good. We ordered the bliss berry pancakes (yum!) and the southern egg Benedict. Portions are huge! It's a good place to share different dishes and have a variety. I think the pancakes and the egg Benedict were perfect to share. The pancakes were sweet and the egg Benedict was savory. Yum!
I'd be in trouble if this place was near my house. It's so good!!!! The food is all delicious and overall a very nice atmosphere. I definitely recommend it if you haven't tried it.

Everybody raved about this place saying was the best in town, well I disagree. Everything comes on a. Ed of hash brown plus hash. Browns on the side.  It's nothing more then a starch bowl with little else. Don't bother.

Awesome experience!! Worth the wait for more than 1 hour to get a table!!! That too by taking advantage of getting on to wait-list through Yelp. It should be on To Do list for Chicago downtown/magnificent mile visitors.

Really good breakfast/brunch spot. But I had to deduct a point for the nearly hour and a half wait.

Highly suggest putting yourself on the waiting list about a hour before your arrival. Service is very good, everything very good, just a bit long on the wait time. Still, worth trying with the proper preparations!
Relatively cheap and well priced for some great breakfast food! So many different options. From sweet to savory.

Dynamic meal very tasty service was great wait 20 minutes worth every minute. Once we got in they took care of us and she just like oh I gave the biggest tip I could 25% because they aren't every die great flavors great taste great food

It's been like two months since I've been here and I'm still dreaming of the breakfast. Amazing! We came in on the morning, Put our name on the long list, grabbed some coffee, walked to the bean, took lots of pictures and walked back. Then our table was ready and we were served amazing breakfast. Perfect

We waited 30 mins to be seated on a monday morning. I recommend going on yelp and putting your name on the wait list well before you want to eat. Best omelet and Berry Bliss pancakes I have had. Egg Skillets are enough for 2 people.  Once you order, the food is at your table within 10 mins. Worth the wait!

My first time in Chicago and this place was worth the wait. I'm glad I was able to check in online and the restaurant was extremely organized and friendly when it came to questions and getting  everyone seated.
The server was fantastic and quick with getting us what we needed. The pancakes were very fluffy! I honestly could have just at them and have been happy. I'll definitely come back.

This is a very popular place. We went during Labor Day weekend at 9am and wait was 2hrs. But were able to do takeout which took only 15-20 minutes. If you don't want to wait i would recommend to order to go. I ordered the signature berries crepes. This was super delicious that fresh and flavorful. This crepe was not super sweet which was good. Highly recommend to try this if you are in the area.

I always enjoy a visit to this breakfast spot. Everything seems to be made fresh and with top level ingredients. Eggs Benedict is delicious comes with a huge stacks of ham and the hollandaise is perfect. Mexicana skillet is also my go to I usually add mushrooms. They have by far the best pancakes or waffles. I usually get either s'mores with bananas or strawberry's.
Amazing pancakes! Always a must when I come to Chicago! This place gets really crowded so there's usually a long wait, but worth it.

The breakfast was so fantastic. Everyone in my 8 party table loved their breakfast and we each got something different. The hashes were mouthwatering, the omelets were to die for. One of my biggest omelet fears is that it is mostly egg with few mix ins, but that is certainly not the case. You will definitely enjoy this eatery.
Staff was friendly portions are huge!!! Food was good and didn't leaving feeling guilty after

First things first, download the "no wait app" to put your name on the list before arriving there. It's crazy how crowded and long the wait can be. We put our name on the list at around 10am and it notified me there were 70 groups ahead of me and the wait was 1.5 hours. So luckily we took our time at our hotel getting ready and got to the restaurant just in time for us to get seated. When we arrived we heard the wait was about 2-3 hours at that point. Crazy!!

The portions here are pretty large. My boyfriend and I shared a dish and a side of pancakes and we were beyond full! I asked for a sample of the Wildberry Orange Juice and it blew my taste buds away. It was freshly squeeze and super refreshing. I also tried the turtle mocha and it was really good, not too sweet. For food, we had the homemade corned beef hash. Most of the meals you can upgrade to a signature pancake side for an additional cost, just be sure to clarify with your waiter if your dish has this option!

We tried the famous signature berry bliss pancakes. They were to die for!! I wish I could eat these every morning. The fruits and sauces on top made a good combination.

Overall, I would recommend stopping by here if you are in Chicago. However, only if you don't have to wait 2-3 hours for this haha. Millennium park with the "bean" is also across the street so you can stop by there to pass the time while waiting or after your meal for a nice walk.

Delicious pancakes very fluffy. The food is really big good for sharing. The only problem is the wait but I would suggest to get into the waiting list on here (yelp) they will text you once the table is ready. Save you the wait outside. The skillets and pancakes are my favorite here. Service was fast too! Would come back for sure.
Food was delicious! Got on the waitlist ahead of time. Still ended up waiting for about 40 minutes once we got there.

Use the Yelp app to "get in line" for this fantastic breakfast/brunch spot!  The wait time both before you're seated and after you're seated was a bit longer than we liked due to its popularity, but the food was hot and delicious. Our waitress was a doll, too.  They even have GF pancake and waffle batter and GF toast!  I'd definitely go back again.

highly recommend the chilaquiles. service was slow (busy place) but that doesn't explain why it takes 15 mins to slide a CC. The mocha smoothie was very good as well as the signature bliss french toast!
Food was good and so was the service. Good place for breakfast and the pancakes are ver soft and fluffy
Huge portions can be shared. Great food. Friendly waitstaff. Check in on Yelp to avoid the wait.
Follow the suggestions here . Get on wait list . Everything was great. Portions are huge. We should have split things. Gluten free Belgium waffle was great!
Amazing! Food was great and service was friendly. The s'more and Oreo pancake was yummy, but need to share with a friend! Wait was about an hour, but worth it.

This is a great restaurant and great food. the wait times are unbearable. and the thing is, whenever people don't show up for their table, they don't go off of the list of vwho's next, they just take whoever's outside. we waited for a hour and a couple showed up and just took them to a table. Ridiculous! its rude to not go off the list, rather by random selection. I expect better for how much i had to pay for my meal.
The pancakes were the tits.  Long lines though make it less appetizing.  Good for brunch anytime you have an hour or two to spare.

You know a place is good when it's actually worth the wait and crowds. Make sure you put your name down, but you might still have to wait close to an hour when you arrive. Get an omelette or skillet dish and then substitute a specialty pancake for an extra $1.50 to balance the sweet and savory!

Really great breakfast. Was in town for the marathon and our group of 8 popped in at 8:00 on a Friday morning. Was seated quickly and had all the carbs. Pumpkin bread French toast, fresh berry crepes, glazed strawberry and blueberry pancakes, and a couple of omelettes. Great service too. When we left at 9:00, there was a huge wait (full lobby and tons of people waiting outside). Recommend going early!
Yum , big portions .. high quality food .. amazing skillets! Only downside long waiting time , but totally worth it .

I guess we probably went on a bad day. But that doesn't excuse the abysmal service at this place. The food was only average. And I'm sure it was fair to be expecting a heck of a lot more from this place considering the fact that it's rated as the best brunch place in Chicago. I've been to MUCH better brunch places in Chicago. Will never be going back after this terrible experience. I hope others have a better experience here considering how highly rated it is.

First time here this morning.  The place was packed. Hostess said 10-20 minutes.  10 minutes later we were sealed.  Lots of choices between eggs and batter recipes.  I had the pecan Belgian waffles and my wife had the eggs Benedict Florentine. The waffles were just okay.  A little on the dry side but lots of pecans. Eggs Benedict were flavorful and enough for two. Service was outstanding.  Stephanie was prompt and very friendly. I was very surprised at the number of patrons that arrived and left and how orchestrated the staff was. From seating to ordering to cleaning the tables, all the staff made things look easy. A lot of restaurants could learn from this place. All in all a good breakfast.  I will try something different next time and hope that the service is just as outstanding.

This is probably the best breakfast I have had in Chicago! I ordered the Mexicana Skillet and the Berry Bliss Pancakes per many people's recommendation and everything was amazing! My husband had the Berry Bliss Crepes and they were amazing as well. The portions are very generous and the prices are just right. I highly recommend downloading the No Wait app as there's usually a wait. I am overall obsessed with this place and cannot wait to come back!

pics.caption: Mexicana Skillet and Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes

review.des: The number one rated breakfast spot in the city. The service was good - not great, not bad. I got an omelette and the pancake. The pancake was delicious, but it was too sweet and I couldn't finish it. My scramble was over cooked, but the flavors were delicious!
It's nice to see a restaurant that knows customer service! Very attentive staff,  food prepared exactly as ordered, excellent portion sizes, and a great server! Highly recommended.

Good food especially the house special pan cakes.
Wait may be between 2-3hrs, better check in for waitlist on yelp before starting for the place.
Great pancakes. This place gets pretty busy, so be prepared for a wait during the morning rush.

So worth the wait! I would be doing Wildberry a disservice if I didn't leave a 5 star review (for the food, not the inconsistent service).

I still dream of the s'mores pancakes; I'm thinking of returning to Chicago just for them. The berries pancakes were great too. All for prices lower than your average nyc brunch menus. Bottom line: unless you can come here regularly, skip the other temptations and get the pancakes.

A minor gripe is the team at the front desk that sometimes seemed to be overwhelmed - when we were finally summoned, there was an issue with table arrangements and they ended up skipping over us completely (having presumably already checked us off the list). Already hungry after the 1.5 hour wait, we had to try for another 5 mins to get someone's attention and explain the problem; and waited a couple more minutes thereafter for a table. Nevertheless, the man who handled it was apologetic and comp-ed our coffee. Thumbs up for that.

Tip: Try downloading the no wait app and entering the queue via the app (rather than having to go down personally then wander around millennium park for 1.5hours). It IS a very buggy app but I see no reason why it wouldn't work - I got it to reliably show my status in the queue once I got past the registration kinks.

pics.caption: Intelligentsia coffee; bonus points for juices are freshly squeezed.
Pancakes, pancakes. The rest of the menu can take a backseat.

review.des: After a short wait (save some time by going on Yelp and hopping in the line prior), we were seated inside and were very surprised by just how big the place is. The menu is actually pretty simple compared to many of the places out in the burbs, but it is all very tasty. We sampled the Denver skillet and the berry bliss French toast and crepes. Everything was very well done and consistent. I also like that they use fresh potato hash browns. Will definitely be back.

In my first review of Wildberry I was lukewarm, but after I catered my office breakfast from Wildberry I heated up!!!  I ordered 1/2 pan of each of the following:  applewood bacon, turkey sausage patties, hash browns and scrambled eggs with cheese.  I arrived at the restaurant and was warmly greeted and serviced right away.  My office is a few blocks away and by the time we set up the food was still warm.  The turkey sausage was amazing, the bacon awesome, the eggs with cheddar cheese were scrumptious and the hash browns were pretty good.  We served over 20 people and it was more than enough and a great value!  We plan to make this a monthly event!
Very goo pancakes! Fluffy and the flavors were just soo goo! Had the Signature Berry Bliss and it was just delicious. Special shoutout to Jeremy!!! Fun and very attentive server!
This is a very popular breakfast spot, but despite that, the amazingly efficient staff keeps everything moving. Our food came out fast and was pretty good.

Great breakfast place!!! I got strawberry poppyseed pancakes with lemon creme anglaise and it was heavenly. You do have to make a reservation and check in when you get the notification that your table is ready, otherwise they move onto the next person in line quickly. It was an hour wait so we went to the bean and explored millennium Park which is right across the street. It was totally worth the wait though.

pics.caption: Eggs Benedict with a side of pineapple, strawberries, and melon.
Hashbrowns, scrambled eggs, and bacon ( Which was amazing)
Lemon poppyseed pancakes with lemon creme anglaise.

review.des: One of the best breakfast places I have ever been to...why can't they have this in LA. Crepes were very good...specialty pancakes amazing.  Omelets very well made.  Definitely a place to visit while in this windy city of Chicago!
We waited for 2 hours! The corn beef hash was undercook and I ordered eggs over medium, not egg whites, BUT the signature berry bliss pancakes were good. They're really fluffy and not too sweet.

This place was packed as expected and so glad I chose to get on the waitlist through Yelp! Well all the hype was right! Our server was very efficient and sweet as pie, wish I could remember her name. Went there for my birthday breakfast and it was hands down THE best birthday breakfast I've ever had, but hey, I'm a pancake girl!
This place is great! I had the Napa valley omelette and the gluten free honey pancakes- both were delicious!!! Great service as well.

Love Chicago...My home town, and I'm glad I'm back visiting. We were looking for a good breakfast spot, obviously found it on Yelp, and so glad we came...sorry my pics don't do it any justice but it is the perfect breakfast spot... I opted for the veggie omelet with a side of fruit and upgraded the side of pancakes to their banana cream pancakes( yummy). If your in town its a must stop and eat...service was courteous, fast and overall pleasant...food was filling, great tasting and came out fast. Hope u give this place a visit!

HOW in the world can this place be such a long wait I asked: the food must be amazing.  I was wrong as is typical with tourist traps. The food is OK. The price is very reasonable. The breakfast specialties are not anything noteworthy or anywhere nearly worth the wait. We used the nowait app and placed our names in the line before arriving.  Received text that I had 5 minutes to show the host. Already present and walked immediately up.  Then proceeded to watch literally 23 groups be called over 20 minutes be called as I stood there watching.

The salad was actually really good at this breakfast place. The breakfasts was as previously noted ok but portions big, classic cheesecake factory model, make it big and they will forget food taste.

In summary not worth the wait. Food well priced. Essentially a tourist trap because no local would ever invest 1+hour waiting or would use the nowait app to at least get you started in line. Price extremely reasonable and portions big, likely the draw.

I love it here! Bring your family and impress them!

Our server was delightful and my blueberries pancakes floated on air.

I can't wait to go back.
A great breakfast spot near Maggie Dailey Park. My kids love their pancakes and the service is always great!

This is a must-go place for me in Chicago. Just the best breakfast and variety of inspired dishes. Today I had the Eldorado omelette with their signature pancakes. Just excellent! Mexican flair omelette with nice spice and flavour and, not that I needed more, berry bliss pancakes.
Sooooo good. Chilaquiles were amazing and the key lime pancakes were some of best pancakes we've ever had! We'll definitely be back!

This is one of my favorite breakfast places that serves food at such a reasonable price. I come back time and time again, and this place never disappoints. Always get the signature berry bliss pancakes and their mexicana sizzlin skillet. The wait is worth it.
This place is awesome! Best breakfast in town! The sweet and savory is all terrific. Worth the waitt if you have to. The wild Berry pancakes will change your life

OVERALL: The food is pretty good, but it's NOT at all worth waiting an exorbitant amount of time for. Either get up early or take your food to-go and enjoy elsewhere.
If this is considered the best place for breakfast and brunch in Chicago (compared to NYC) - the foodie scene doesn't look promising.

THE WAIT: I added to the waitlist using the Yelp application (great feature). After I checked in at the host stand (after receiving a 2nd text per their instruction), I was told it would be a few minutes. Well I was l standing for 20 minutes (I'm still recovering from the Chicago Marathon) when I realized I received a notification that I was removed from the waitlist. When I approached the host to show him the alert I had received - he looked at me like I had a 3rd eye, but added my party back to the waitlist. Luckily I was not hungry when I arrived otherwise I would've left and not returned.

FOOD: I ordered the wild berry pancakes and the apple pecan Belgian waffle. The wild berry pancakes were fun and not overly sweet. The waffle on the apple pecan was not served warm, but after the wait to be seated - it wasn't worth sending back. Good enough to (possibly) wait over an hour for? NOPE.

**Vegetarian Friendly**

This place is packed no matter what time of day you get there! There are so many great options for any meal of the day, and you can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

Entrée: Garden Skillet
Such a warm, hearty, and filling meal with potatoes, vegetables and assorted toppings. The skillet comes with a side of pancakes making this one meal big enough for two people. They will substitute one item in the skillet at no charge (i.e. sausage for avocado)
 
If you have a party of 5 and under, you can make a reservation on Yelp, which is great, but they don't let you do the same for larger parties. I don't understand why. We were a party of 12, and they split us up into two groups of 6 (we didn't ask for this). We had a 1.5 hour wait time, and were told we could walk around the area and they will call/text us when the table is ready with  a 5 minute window to return to the restaurant. Our entire group was walking back, but half the group got stuck crossing at the street light. I explained the situation, and the host manager rudely claimed "we weren't all together" and would only seat one table of 6, and then proceeded to give away our second table! I understand for a packed restaurant they need the entire party, but we didn't even get the chance of the five minute window to let the rest of my group cross the street!

Overall, the food is great and appeals to all tastebuds, but the host staff could have been nicer.
Loved everything about our breakfast! The fruit was fresh and our server, the Dragon, was very helpful in our selections.

pics.caption: Wildberry Crunch Greek Yogurt was excellent. We also had eggs, bacon, hash browns, and a gluten free Wildberry pancake. Loved our server!

review.des: Absolutely delicious!  If ever visiting Chicago, you must stop by!  The pancakes are simply amazing!

pics.caption: OMG! The best pancakes ever!  I heard of this place and finally experienced it!  Yummy!

review.des: Food was very tasty the staff was very pleasant an nice I would most definitely come back

Holy moly. This place is delicious and the world already knows it. Based on the wisdom from my fellow yelpers, I put myself in the waitlist before even heading over to the area. We strolled over through Millennium park and received the text that our table was ready while walking through the door, great timing! My time on the app was 35 minutes and they were quoting under 2 hours by the time we got there at 9:15 on Sunday morning (insane!). We were seated after about 10 minutes after receiving the text and our waitress was lively and fast. After ordering coffee and entrees, our food came out in probably less than 5 minutes. Everything was amazing! I only wish I would have shared an entree and pancakes with my husband as we wasted so much food :(. So full and happy rolling out of this place. Definitely a great breakfast option.
The signature brunch place in Chicago! Food is delicious and portion is enormous. Watch out for the waiting time. If you are not an early bird you would probably wait for hours.
Delish specialty pancakes and other yummy breakfast food. You do have to get there before you're hungry though because you will have to wait.

Wildberry Cafe was the first stop on my recent Chicago vacation. We started off with beverages. The vanilla latte was creamy and  flavorful; the caramel macchiato had a warm buttery richness with a bold espresso kick. The entrees were large so my boyfriend and I shared a Venetian Sizzlin' Skillet which came with a "Signature Berry Bliss" pancake as an upgrade. The skillet was delicious, but the pancake was the star. With lots of berries, a dollop of berry mascarpone, and a vanilla anglaise drizzle on top, the syrup was optional. I can't wait to make my way back.

pics.caption: Venetian Sizzlin' Skillet and Signature Berry Bliss pancakes

review.des: The fruit was really fresh. It is better to share pancake, otherwise it will be too sweet.

Great breakfast/brunch spot with huge portions.  The  service was fast and courteous! Busy but good. My colleagues and I got there around 0750 which was the perfect time because once we got our food the restaurant became packed with people waiting to be seated. They also use No Wait so you can see how long time wait times are.  I will definitely go back as I am a native of Chicago.

The food here is AAAAAMAZING - the line is the worst part. I looked on an app called "no-wait" and it said it was a 2-hour wait, oh my gosh! Luckily, we were able to put our name in ahead of time on the app and then checked in when we got there and had to wait about another 20 minutes (I'd rather wait 20 mins over 2 hours any day) in order to get seated. They were able to accommodate us with seating our whole group together. The service was a little rushed but I understand when you have a 2-hour wait every weekend to seat people - they want to get you in and out. They did not rush us once we got our food though which was nice. The menu has a lot of options on it and everything is seriously delicious- I consciously try to make sure I get to eat here every time I'm in Chicago!

Great place for brunch! Eggs benedict was amazing--even my mom (who isn't really big on American food) loved it. Sauce was a little bit too heavy/rich and there was a lot of it. I'll probably ask for a little less next time. Regardless, jean-popping portion sizes and great flavor.
One of the best breakfast places I've been to. The price is worth it because of how much food they give you. Definitely a favorite.
Great service and great food. Using the yelp app helped to join the waitlist and not have to hang there for an hour. Definitely a hot spot so expect a wait
I was disappointed with my experience here . The berry  pancakes were gross and it was supposedly a crowd favorite . The hash was good but nothing too amazing . Not worth the wait !

I love this place, my husband and I waited for 2 hours and it was worth it. I would come back but hopefully just on a random day instead of a holiday lol. But the wild berry waffle was def to die for, see you later on the wild side
It's been a minute since we've been, but the Banana Bread French Toast was more than worth the wait!!!
Awesome food, great atmosphere!  Service was amazing and I can't wait to come back.  FYI - gluten free fare was the best part!
Great food and excellent service! Used the Yelp app for reservations and were seated right when we arrived!

A friend and I went to Wildberry Café for breakfast, and overall, it's a very tasty restaurant that is always full of tourists.

I read about this place on a list of good breakfasts in Chicago, and this one was located very convenient to our hotel. We went on a weekday morning, and even then we had a 30 minute wait. But the location is right across the street from Millennium Park, so you can go put your name down then go look at the Big Bean or something like that. (I highly suggest you do that if there's a wait.)

We were seated relatively soon, and there's a lot of turnover for breakfast. I opted for the meat skillet, and it was jampacked with meat and was crispy and delicious. They have these "light" milkshakes on the menu, but I ordered the Oreo shake, which is only so light as you can imagine. It came highly recommended from our server, but it was just OK. My friend ordered the eggs Benedict, and it looked really tasty.

Overall, Wildberry Cafe is a good breakfast spot to try if you're in the Loop. I would go again, because the menu is huge.

Easily the best breakfast I have ever had in the city. The wait was super long but you can put your name in on the yelp app and they tell you when to arrive. It's super nice. The wait itself was over an hour and rightly so. The service was super quick. I had the berry pancakes and they were phenomenal. The food came very quickly, it's easy to see that this place runs like clockwork and that is why they are the best I have ever had in Chicago. Will definitely be going back when I am in the city again.

We ended up waiting an hour and a half for Sunday brunch, and yes, seriously my god it was so incredibly worth it. I can definitely see why this place is as popular as it is! I ended up getting the garden skillet with gluten free honey cakes on the side and I was in LOVE. The skillet was big & packed with fresh veggies, and the gluten free cakes were fluffy and sweet and gone fast. I had never had gluten free pancakes before, but I didn't miss normal pancakes for even a second. So good!
Next time I visit, I will definitely be trying one of their coffee drinks and some other fun menu item.
Our waiter was awesome, very accommodating and quick. It was a wonderful atmosphere and a delicious meal & I loved it all!
It was an okay meal, lattes we ordered arrived cold, service was good but food is not 5 star 1,5 wait to be seated.

It's just another boring bunch. Your aren't really missing out intresting favors and unique food options.I suppose if you looking  for very avg brunch place  with decent decor and you found the right place.
Delicious food (especially the skillets and pancakes) and awesome service! The wait is worth it!

lol wed dead llewsdowssss
Eoojoososoossosososwssssswss
Wsosxs
Slept lo
Osseos
Sl
Wwxe

First let me say that we've attempted to try this place numerous times but failed. Here, and the one in Schaumburg! They were always super busy; thus the wait was soooooooooper long. So, I embarked today for the millionth attempt. I was by my lone some self. The girl advised that it would be half an hour wait. Huh! Not bad at all! Considering the past few times were like an hour-two hour wait. (We didn't have patience back then. Lol) Surprisingly, after waiting for only 10 mins, my table was ready. Sahhhhhhhh-weeeeeeet! My waitress was very pleasant and she was great. I looked at the menu, and I felt like ordering almost every single item(especially the specialty pancakes section). Noooooo, Carmel, don't do it! So, I only ordered the classic eggs benedict and added spinach on it, with hash browns. I'm a big fan of eggs benedicts. In almost all of the breakfast place I go to, that is what I order. Eggs Benedict. My order arrived shortly. It was muy bueno! Yum Yum Yum, Delicioso as Dora would say. The hollandaise sauce was thick, creamy, a bit tart, and tasty. The eggs were poached well. Runny. Just how I like it. The hash brown was cooked well. It wasn't burnt or undercooked. You can actually see potatoes from the shavings. Their prices weren't bad also. Considering it's in downtown Chicago, where they charge you an arm and a leg for everything! So glad I stopped by here today. And yes, I will attempt to try them again! Hopefully the next time, it won't be as long of a wait also! (Insert Smiley face here) The End.

pics.caption: Classic Eggs Benedict with spinach, and Hash Browns as my side. (I like ketchup on my hash browns. So that's the red thing on it)

review.des:
I had a delicious brunch! I ordered the Banana Cream Pie Crepes which very good; but beware, they're MASSIVE! The custard filling was tasty and not too sweet. It was so hard to pick what to order off of the huge menu but I made a good choice.
The downside to this restaurant is that it's right near Millennium Park and a major tourist restaurant. I used the app "NoWait" and reserved a spot at 10:20am and wasn't seated until 11:20. Thankfully I was able to tour the surrounding area until they sent me a text to tell me my table was ready.
On the plus side, once I was seated I was quickly served and never felt like my server had forgotten about me despite how busy the restaurant was.

Like many reviews said , it's more Of a touristy restaurant .
The food was just ok. Had the chocolate chip pancakes . Nothing out of this world .
The portions are large , enough to share between two.
The manager is This place has an amazing system going . The staff was above and beyond , amazing costumer service .
The place seats a lot of guests , and the line moves quick. Not worth the line for me though, although I used the app

It's midnight the next day and I'm still thinking about the southern Benedict and berry crepes. Join the Yelp wait list before you go. It was an hour and 15 minutes on a winter Sunday.

It was definitely worth the wait and the crowds. I'm not sure what exactly makes it so good. Everything was fresh and seemed to be made from scratch. Even the coffee was really smooth and strong.

Despite the insane crowds the service was impeccable. The hosts were politely and efficiently managing the crowds. My waitress was impressive in her speed , agility and attentiveness. Coffee was brought immediately and my order was delivered in only 10-15 minutes. Boxes were brought for the leftovers, plates cleared and check delivered in such quick fashion that it seemed as if I was the only customer. Yet it never felt rushed. Really top notch. This place sets the standard.

pics.caption: Southern Benedict and side of berry bliss crepe with an americano.

review.des: Great service.  Wild mushroom omelette was absolutely delicious.  The place was packed at 8:00 Saturday morning, but it was totally worth to wait.

The first time we came here we luckily checked-in on the Yelp app, which allowed us to hold our spot in line . We waited almost 2 hours for a table, and It was worth every minute. The staff was friendly and patient, the food came out beautiful and hot. We enjoyed It so much that we actually came back the next day and ate again! Hands down the best breakfast we've had on our trip to Chicago, and will probably continue to come back here for years to come.
Amazing food!!! Exception service!!! Must try the cinnamon bun pancakes!!! Great all around restaurant!!! Will definitely return!

I highly recommend this place. First time in town, we stayed at the Hyatt Regency and walked to Wildberry for breakfast. I have to say the food was amazing. I got the Mexican skillet (w/ chicken sausage) and cream banana pancakes with a fresh squished orange juice.  Everything was delicious.  I couldn't finish it all but wish I could have. I had to leave room to try my boyfriend's Pecan Belgian waffles.  
If we ever come back to Chicago, we will definitely stop by again.  Thank you.

This place was amazing! We had to wait for more than an hour, went on a Sunday morning, but after that, it was smooth sailing. We walked millennium park across the street during the wait so it wasn't bad at all. I had the skillet and gf had the Benedict. Both were delicious and definitely not the spot. The skillet looks small in photos, but don't be fooled, it's a huge serving. You may have to bring half home for lunch or dinner. Of course we also had the famous berry bliss pancakes! Can't come here and not try it out. Everything was good, the food, the service, the atmosphere. Would definitely recommend!

Drool! Moan! Sigh! This was the best thing to ever happen before lunch. Yes, it was packed. But you can make a waitlist request online, right here at Yelp. We did that, and an hour later, we literally pulled up in a cab and walked to our table, right on time.
  We ordered everything on the menu, and it was all delicious beyond belief. Be warned, the Skillets are enormous, and you could fall into the yogurt bowl and drown. Food came out quickly. The staff was very pleasant, too, even automatically apologizing for the wait (even though we didn't wait!). They also offered us a go-cup of coffee when they brought the check.
  It's been three days and I think I'm still full, but I'm also still smiling thinking of the insane delectability of this meal. I'm back home, and I want to eat there again. Go! Go! Go!
Amazing food. Long lines but worth the wait. Recommended dishes: Mexicana and Cornbeef Egg Benefict.

You know those times when you're so intensely hungry / hangry, that you'll eat just about anything?

That happened to me and my friend this past weekend while traveling in Chicago. We dropped off our baggage and headed to this place that had rave reviews for brunch - we had to check it out. We got there and there were tons of people crammed into the tiny waiting area / bar area (probably the biggest downfall of this restaurant).

We were finally seated after 1.25 hours of waiting and people watching at the Bean and ice skating and let me tell you - it's worth the wait! I would download the app "NoWait" and put your name in so you don't even have to be at the restaurant to put your name in the line. It's a great app.

We were finally seated and were blessed with a huge menu of an overwhelming amount of brunch items. Sadly, there wasn't any mimosas or screwdrivers on the menu, but that was okay after we sipped on our Seasonal Special: Hot Apple Cider with whipped cream - it's a MUST!

I got the garden skillet with scrambled eggs on top and an order of the berry bliss pancakes. There's so much food that you will probably have leftovers. And the best part, my meal (skillet, cider, pancakes) was under $14. You can't beat that! I wish they would ask you if you needed ketchup / syrup / butter before they bring it out because my friend and I didn't use them at all either of the times we went and I feel that was a large waste of food.

My biggest turn off was that because they were sooo busy and had such a long wait outside, almost IMMEDIATELY after you finish your plates and food, they are stealing them from you and not even giving you a moment to take in the glorious food you just engorged yourself in. I found that to be very rude, especially since they reached in front of me while I was still eating to take a plate out of the way when I clearly wasn't finished.

That part aside, this is my favorite food for brunch I've ever tasted.... So good in fact that we had to go back a second time the next day. #NoJudgment. I had leftovers and it was just as good!

If you're ever in the area, download the NoWait app, get in line, and be prepared to feast on the most affordable, best brunch food your tastebuds will ever experience.

pics.caption: Probably the best brunch I've ever had! Got the veggie skillet and the berry pancakes. So yummy!

review.des: I came here at 1:30pm on a weekday, and the place was packed. Despite that, the wait was only around 10 minutes long, and once we were seated the waitress paid much attention to our table throughout the meal. I don't have any particular recommendations of what to get here, but take that as a compliment to the restaurant because it's hard to go wrong with whatever you order. If it will be your first time coming and you're not sure what to get, just order what you typically get at other cafes, and you can expect to be served a cleanly presented, high-quality version of that dish here.

pics.caption: From left to right: Florence eggs benedict, Denver skillet, and Blueberry Belgian waffle. PC: A.K

review.des: Our family of 4 ate here today before our visit to the Art Institute. It earned 5 stars all around. All of the hosts and hostesses were very nice. The wait time was about 5 minutes (11:00 on a Tuesday). We were seated outside which was perfect. Our waiter, Dustin, was wonderful and we took a couple of his suggestions. The brisket hash was delicious!!  We all got a specialty pancake. I have to say the cinnamon roll was my favorite followed closely by the others: the blackberry key lime, the banana coconut cream pie and the Oreo s'mores pancakes. The portions are huge (no one could finish). We will eat here again and again. Thank you for the great experience.

Love this place and they are part of the spring rewards program which helps you save money. Staff is super helpful and friendly. Just be prepared to wait a long time on sat/sun unless you use the no wait app which allows you to put your name down without being there in person. Great Food!!'
Delicious breakfast.  Definitely order the pancakes.  Corned beef hash is homemade - meat and potatoes, no onions.

pics.caption: Española omelette.  Has chorizo and jalapeños.  My husband enjoyed it.

review.des: The menu price is out dated. The corned beef hash was good but not amazing. Pancakes seem to be what they're good for
More than a diner, less than brunch. It's a solid breakfast place!

Tried the veggie omelette with hash browns and upgraded to a side of their signature bliss pancakes since I read plenty of rave reviews about it. The omelette and hash browns were about decent but the pancakes were overly sweet in a sugary, frosting kind of way and topped with barely any fruit. I asked for it without the vanilla anglaise hoping to avoid this but it still arrived with the anglaise. It was so busy there I didn't bother to ask to get it sent back since it's not something they can just scrape off, they'd have to remake the whole thing.  Cappuccino was really lacking in flavor too, had better at most regular diners.  

I really just don't understand what the hype is about.

- Our wait was projected to be an hour and a half from when we signed in, and then even when it was our reservation time they informed us it was still going to be 25 minutes more and to wait for their text ..
- and then even when we got the text we were told to stand to the side for them to call us which took an additional 15 minutes

Overall the whole experience took almost 3 hours to get truly mediocre food and wasted a huge chunk of valuable time that could've been spent to explore Chicago.  So disappointed.

I visited this place while working in Chicago for a few days. It was so good that I had to go back a second time. The pancakes were unreal and the specialty coffees were spot on too.

Probably one of the better breakfasts I've had in a while.

Food was good and the waitress was fantastic.

The only thing bad was the hostess. She had a horrible attitude and I literally wanted to smack her across the face.

-2 stars for crap front house.

First time in Chicago...well, technically second, but the first time was a quick day in-and-out work trip for a convention...anyway, got off my flight and was really hungry, so I pulled out my phone and opened Yelp. Wilbberry was the first on the list and had 4.5 average star rating so why not!? There was a 10 minute wait but I was really hungry (did I mention that?) so I opted to sit outside. It was a bit chilly but not unbearable.

I got the Napa Valley Fig omelet. The figs in the omelet were a surprisingly nice combination! It was really good - I wholly enjoyed it.

Since I'm on the paleo diet, I opted not to have either toast or pancakes, so the waiter was nice to let me substitute with a side of sweet potato fries. I love sweet potatoes fries so it was delicious.

The fresh fruits helped to top off the meal.

Great first meal in Chicago!

pics.caption: Napa Valley Fig omelette. Substituted toast/pancake option with sweet potato fries. Came with a side of fresh fruits.

review.des: The cinnamon roll pancakes were amazing. Light, fluffy, full of flavor, and not too sweet. Loses a star for not having real maple syrup
My favorite brunch place! Mexicana skillet is to die for!!! Definitely get the wildberry-orange juice.

Fast food and good food. I think the food is regular diner/brunch food that you can get elsewhere, but what makes Wildberry 4 stars to me, is the different flavor pancakes. I had gotten the pumpkin spice and that was just divine!

Had the Denver skillet with turkey sausage. Well seasoned and the egg was perfectly runny on top. I got the chocolate chip pancakes with no banana as the side. The pancakes were super fluffy and sweet. Overall, great experience, the waitress was very attentive and friendly and the place was fun and inviting.

My friends & I were in town for the wknd. Due to the fabulous review we had to come here for breakfast on our last day. The wait was about 40 min. but took advantage & went across the street & checked out the Bean & beautiful park while waiting. Once seated the staff was friendly & efficient. We were starving so was excited when our food came out within 10 min of ordering. The French toast pancakes were over the top delish!! We each had a few of the skillets and were all great!! Luckily I don't live here or I might be here daily!!

Amazing Amazing Amazing food and service. The wait is the only disadvantage. But I guess Yelp has a way to help you with that. Best pancakes in town. My recommendations are Strawberry cheesecake French toast and Oreosmores pancakes. Skillets are lovely bursting with flavors. Mexicana being my most favorite.

pics.caption: The Oreo s'mores pancakes on the left and the strawberry cheesecake French toast on the right

review.des: Place  was pretty damn good. Did the wait list on yelp so that saved us a lot of time. It was pouring rain and the place was still packed. Fruity pebble French toast was pretty damn good and not too sugary.
Fantastic breakfast experience. Great food, fast and friendly service. Our family came here three mornings in a row because it was so good.

I've visited this brunch place in the Chicago area a few times. The wait can be slightly long, but it isn't terribly long. The food is decent. I have enjoyed my food every time, but not totally wowed. However, their Wildberry pancakes are amazing!
Tried the velvet French toast. Way too sweet for my tastes. The bacon was pretty good though!

This place has easily been one of my favorites. The food and selection is good for breakfast and brunch. The servers are really friendly and helpful with the selection. I highly suggest this place when you are in the area.

The food, service, and location were fantastic! My friend and I decided to eat here after we saw that they have smoothies (which were more like slushies). I had the lemon berry french toast, and it was gigantic and delicious! My friend had the Garden Sizzlin Skillet and said, "mmmmm, very good!". Definitely a place to stop, but think about sharing an entree because the portion sizes are obscenely large.

The Signature Berry Bliss waffle is what food dreams are made of. Waits can get very long - use the Nowait app and get "in line" prior to heading out to the restaurant and the wait time will be significantly shorter.

I ordered the signature berry bliss pancake and it was amazing! Best pancakes I've ever had. My boy friend got the eggs, hash browns, and bacon with a side of their chocolate banana pancakes and that was ridiculously good. They smoke their own bacon and I highly recommend you get the caramelized onion and cheese on your hash browns. The service was good and it was reasonably priced. I highly recommend this place!

We visited Chicago for the weekend, when I seen the reviews I just knew we had to try this place. Yes the place was really busy (30-40 minute wait) but it was worth it. We ordered the homestyle and blueberry pancakes and it was one of the best we every had. The pancakes were so light and fluffy they practically melted in our mouths . They give pretty big portions for kids and adults. I also ordered a side of sausage-they were very flavorful and juicy. We'll definitely return to this place on our next visit.

3.5 stars

COME EARLY! Originally, the plan was to come at 9am on a Saturday morning but after hearing about the wait from our friends who recently came, we arrived around 8:15am and waited roughly 15 minutes for a party of 4. By the time we left (9:30ish), there was a huge wait!

Create your own omelette ($10.45): Choice of two items with each additional item being an extra quarter. I opted for sausage, pepper jack cheese, avocado, and spinach. The omelet also comes with a side of toast, fruit, or pancakes. Absolutely love how they did not skimp on the amount of avocadoes in my omelette!!! There was however too much cheese as well =( Sorry to break it to you but there is such thing as too much cheese =X

I had a bite of the infamous berry bliss pancakes which was more than enough. I would not suggest this particular pancake if you do not have a huge sweet tooth.

I might have had too high of an expectation for Wildberry after hearing my friends rave about it. I tried a few of the other dishes my friends had ordered but everything was pretty standard and comparable to other brunch places I've been to. It doesn't hurt that Wildberry is right across the street from Millenium Park!

Everything was amazing i would come here for breakfast any day. Also the pancakes were the best I've ever had. I went right when they opened so there was no wait. But like i said everything was very good and the omelet portions are very big and are stuffed with a lot of good veggies!

Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe was one of my must visit place in Chicago. The ratings are high and the food looks delicious. This store is right outside millenium park so it was real convenient to walk off the meal afterwards.

Popular restaurants have a long wait so this place is no different. The wait was 30 minutes for dine in but you can always order to go and sit along the steps outside. Not a great way to have breakfast but it works if you're in a rush. You can also order handcrafted coffee from the bar right inside the entrance while you wait. This establishement serves intelligentsia coffee which is the coffee hype in chicago.

After 30 minutes we were seated and ready to indulge. The staff bought out plates but we were quick to notice that the plates were not very clean. We asked for replacements but those were not very clean either. One more round of replacements proved to be the same. Stains were apparent on the dishes.  It surely is time for this place to replace their plates or get a better dishwasher.

We had a garden skillet, toast, side of bacon, and signature berry bliss pancakes. The signature berry bliss pancakes definitely hit the spot. This is a must have dish that will keep you coming back for more. The bacon tasted great as well and was a particularly meaty slice.

Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe serves good food but they need to up their game on cleanliness.

pics.caption: Dirty stained dish..replacements were as dirty

review.des: Visiting from out of state and decided to wait and try this place after seeing the thousands of reviews. While the service was great, everything else is far over hyped and not worth the wait. Far better and less hassle breakfast places to go to when visiting.

Meh.  Overrated.  Not worth the wait and cost.  Portions are huge, for what that's worth.  Chocolate chip pancakes don't have the chocolate chips mixed in, but instead they're just on top, which is disappointing.

Not sure why this place has good reviews. I'm not from Chicago so maybe that's why? The food was okay. I had the Mexicano skillet with toast and that was a lot of food for one person. The place was packed for it being 11:30am and it had a cafeteria type look inside. I'm from Texas (we have great places) and I personally expected this place to be better. I sat smushed in between two tables which was awkward. The dish had a lot of cheese for a "Mexicano" type entree. Definitely disappointed.

Great menu selections and the location can't be beat! We'd certainly go there more often if it wasn't for the insanely long wait times. We tried calling in to make reservations ahead of time couple times, but apparently they take fcfs walk-ins only. But definitely worth it if you're in the Millennium Park area on a less busy day.

GO GO GO!
This was one of the best breakfasts I've ever had.

Go early. Our wait on a Saturday at 8:23 a.m. was 45 minutes. But they have a coffee bar you can get coffee at as you wait.

I do think it's a little pricey, but for their location, you're probably paying their rent.

Best pancake creations and skillet creations I've ever had.

Go! Try it. Go early!
Fantasic food and service! We waited 35 minutes for a table, well worth the wait. I got the berry pancakes and they were delicious!
Like most popular brunch places, the wait over the weekend is FOREVER; however the food is worth it. Hopefully everyone gets a chance to eat here on a non busy time cause i absolutely loved the food.

Heard and read the hype so decided to come here. It was a Tuesday morning and it was still packed. Definitely use the NoWait app to reserve your spot. We got seated outside on the patio right when the app said it was our turn. NOW FOR THE FOOD! Everything delivered. The Berry Bliss pancakes were excellent and the highlight of the meal. I also got their breakfast potatoes which were excellent. The portions, in true Midwest style, were almost too big. Wife loved what she got as well. The prices were extremely reasonable for the quality and size of the food. Will absolutely come back here again. It met the Yelp hype!
Absolutely unreal how good this place is! Their spinach egg Benedict is to die for!!! Cinnamon rolls pancakes were delicious too!

Just ok. The food was over-priced in my opinion. I saw that it was number one for breakfast spot in Chicago, and was pretty excited. The food tasted average, the only difference is you pay more, and wait an hour. Spend the money somewhere else.

Despite being busy, the service was superb, which is very respectable. Thought that was worth mentioning...

I really enjoyed this place; however, the wait time, not specifically to get seated but also for the food, takes a bit away from the experience. I had the NoWait app, which was great, but maybe the wait time is part of the hype. The prices are great, if not outstanding, for the portions. The pancakes are definitely yummy -- I had the signature bliss berry (or whatever that one was...) pancakes and they were super fluffy and light. I also had the Eggs Florence, which I enjoyed. It was a looooot of food. You can definitely go with someone else and share one dish, especially the skillet. That thing is gigantic lol. OH one more thing! The customer service is great.

Great breakfast spot! And the yelp wait list option is a fantastic tip. Food, coffee, atmosphere all perfect. Jasmine served us SO patiently and gave us excellent advice on what to order. My one complaint is how hard it is to make a decision with all the wonderful menu options!

This is a great breakfast place if you love pancakes or waffles or really anything. I almost always get the wild berry pancakes which are the perfect amount of sweet and tart. I usually only get a short stack with a side of eggs and hash browns. Everyone I've ever taken here loves it. It's very very busy so make sure to come early to put your name in. In the summer there's normally an outside sitting area so that opens up the space some.

Our breakfast was amazing! The portions are huge! And the food is absolutely delish. No detail overlooked. And our server was friendly and smiley .... she was terrific and attentive. Awesome experience.
The food was okay. The prices were mediocre. The portion sizes are variable. The service was minimal. The wait time was awful.

Best breakfast spot in Chicago. Didn't have to wait too long; 20 min wait for 2 around noon. You can also see your number in line through the yelp app. I ordered a side of applewood bacon and the fresh glazed strawberry waffles. My boyfriend had a side of hash browns and the signature berry bliss pancakes. Note: the pancakes order was HUGE. My boyfriend was unable to finish his order while I devoured mine.

With this recent dining experience I was smart enough to use the wait list. So, once we arrived there was less than 10 minutes before we were sitting in our booth.
The service was amazing and breakfast was even better. The cinnamon roll French toast was the best I have ever had. I also had a Carmel macchiato that was better than Starbucks! My kids both had pancakes that were yummy. Location was fantastic!  When we left we walked right across the street to Millennium Park.
We will be back for sure!
Good food at reasonable price.  Very crowded on weekends.  I would liven it up a bit with some Kool music.  Just a suggestion.
Ridiculous wait even when scheduled.  The food is a mild upgrade from ihop.  Not worth the hassle.

I know Wildberry is "wildly" popular so I decided to check out this spot to see what all the hype was about.

Atmosphere- Definitely bustling and packed (I went on a Saturday around 11:30am). I used Yelp to make reservations-- make sure to do this beforehand to spare yourself the wait. I put my name down at 10:00am.

Service- Great service, our waitress was very friendly, we were seated quickly after we received the text for returning to the host stand.

Food- I was not very impressed by the quality of the food. I did appreciate the gluten free options, but after trying their gluten free specialty pancakes, eggs, sausage, and hash browns I can say that nothing really astounded me. It's hard to go wrong with classic diner food and Wildberry tasted like other diners I've visited before. Perhaps I tried the wrong thing but I can't say I'm convinced to return!

Perfect place for a girls treat for breakfast. I got the buttermilk pancakes and my friends chose the chocolate chip pancakes. Both exceeded my expectations and were really, really delicious. You should definitely visit this place and try their pancakes - there are a lot of options you can choose from.
Fast, tasty and easy. Very quick service and our server Dylan got our order perfect.  Considering how busy the place was, I'm surprised how good an experience we had.

First and foremost, expect there to be a wait!  We were given some advice by a friend to put our name down and then walk around Millennium Park/Grant Park and the surrounding areas while we wait and that's exactly what we did.  One great thing was that we were able to monitor our place in line.  I did not get to read reviews prior to having brunch here since it was more of an impromptu decision, but apparently you can use the Yelp waitlist before arriving. Nonetheless, this was a good way to kill two birds with one stone.  Our wait was probably 1.5 hours, which may seem outrageous, but gave us plenty of time to sightsee.  By the time we were seated, we definitely built up an appetite!  We decided to go with something sweet and something savory...best of both worlds!  Everything on the menu sounded amazing, but we went with the garden sizzlin' skillet and signature berry bliss pancakes.   The garden sizzlin' skillet was ginormous and came with hashbrowns, cheddar and jack cheese, 2 eggs, mushrooms, asparagus, spinach, onions, tomatoes and broccoli.  The skillet it came in kept the eggs nice and warm because who likes cold eggs?  The signature berry bliss pancakes were my favorite.  This dish came with vanilla anglaise, blackberry coulis, berry mascarpone and fresh berries.  The pancakes were light and fluffy and the toppings were not overpowering or overly sweet.  Definitely worth the wait!  I already have my eye on a few other things on the menu and can't wait to come back!  I'd also like to point out that they don't serve booze, but they had a large selection of various drinks.

I love this place. Fresh wildberry jam made in house. They bottle it and sell it too. Awesome food--breakfast or lunch. The pancakes are amazing. But that doesn't mean I won't keep coming back. It's right next to the Aon Center, where I used to work, so I have quite a bit of experience here. I like it so much I've even taken family and friends here on the weekends. Apparently even the tourists have been turned onto it as well. If you're local, you'll probably be back too.  So why the 4 stars? Two reasons that carry a lot of weight for me: 1) The wait is almost always extraordinary so you will have to be prepared for that. 2) This tends to mean your service will usually suffer. (Please don't misunderstand, I've never had issues with the servers themselves--just with wait times.)
Very nice staff .. food is yummy especially their pancakes .. also nice thing u can book a table online using yelp

This is probably my favorite breakfast place is Chicago. Every dish, no matter what time you go, is always served fresh and never lacks in flavor. Furthermore, the menu is extensive and good for non/vegetarians.

Only drawback is the wait times, at both locations on weekdays and weekends. You can't make reservations before hand but can use the "No Wait" app to get in line and have some sense of when you'll be seated. Need to be a few miles from the location in order to use it.

Great as a family place or for a group.

Amazing food!
Pancakes to die for and the omelettes are great too!
Wait was a little long, but worth it.
We are moving and will really miss this delicious place. Wild berry's has been a tradition for sometime.

I don't see what the hype is about. The food was good but forgettable.

We waited about 1+ hour to get seated but they do have a convenient way to notify you when there is a table. The space in front of the waiting area is crowded and be very careful when coming through the revolving doors. If you don't exit in time, you'll circle them again.

We ordered their signature pancakes and eggs Benedict. The pancakes were soggy and not very fluffy. The eggs Benedict were even more disappointing. One of my eggs were cooked all the way through and the hollandaise sauce was broken and separating. The English muffin was spongy but chewy and the ham was cut way too thick.

If it wasn't busy, Id stop in for a bite to eat but there are plenty of other places in the city that serve better food and the wait is not over an hour.

We were staying at the Chicago Downtown for a night. We are a family of 4, do not eat meat and we have a child with food allergies. We were all able to find something delicious to eat!

The wait was about an hour long, even on a week day at 11 a.m.!  But it was well worth it.

My husband, me and the kids were all able to eat within $40. Which is very reasonable!

Would definitely recommend :)
Food was awesome and our waiter Jeremy was so kind and funny. He made the whole experience great!
Perfect breakfast. Everything is amazing. Pancakes are the best I've ever had. Fast service. Check in via Yelp first to save a wait.
The service was  a 10. This place was so busy and my server Kimberly had time to tell us place to visit while staying in Chicago. This is a must visit while in Chicago.

Portions are HUGE. Service is FAST.
Food is standard breakfast food in my opinion. Place is packed for the few times I have been here, so expect to wait. Tight space too. But worth a try if in the area.
It was decent. The pancakes are unique. Service is good and friendly. Food was served very quick! Overall good experience and location.

I never do reviews but wow this place was amazing. The food and the service was great. Only problem i see is the wait times are horrible but i'm guessing is because everyone wants to eat there. They do have a wait list through yelp so that helped a lot. I ordered the hash brows and meat lovers omelette plus chocolate chips pancake. I was stuffed and happy. And the prices are reasonable. oh and get the white chocolate mocha, very delicious.

We visited on a Saturday and at 1130am there was a 1.5 to 2 hr wait. The waitlist link they sent me through yelp was great. It allowed us to go shopping, get coffee and relax while waiting. We got a text to see the host about 5 min before we were seated. They give a 5 min window so you don't lose your spot. We ordered quite a few menu items, eggs over easy, biscuits and gravy and the "Signature Berry Bliss" pancakes. I highly recommend the pancakes, they are perfect without syrup! The other food was just average and that's why we didn't give 5 stars.

pics.caption: Signature Berry Bliss pancakes, a must try!

review.des: Great location, very close to Millennium Park. There is usually quite a long wait, but the food is amazing! This is my favorite breakfast place to visit while I am in Chicago. I have tried various other places, but none of them compare to Wildberry.  I try and get something new every time that I go, just because everything on the menu looks and sounds delicious! I have yet to be disappointed by Wildberry; the food and the service have met my expectations every single time!

Arrived to Chicago early morning on an empty stomach.  Wildberrys did NOT disappoint.  Portions are large , my recommendation is to share a plate and definitely add on some house specialty pancakes.  The coffee there is GREAT. Definitely check in in advance! We did that before leaving hotel and only waited 15 minutes once we arrived.

Delicious! Long way on Saturday morning, so check-in through Yelp at least 30 minutes before you head to Wildberry (our total wait was at least an hour). Great location and a worthwhile stop if you're visit Chicago!

Wondering what the hype is about this place. Seriously I could have had a better breakfast at IHOP.  My hash browns were burnt, the berry pancakes had a very artificial taste and the chicken sausage were just weird. I see another 1 star review from an out of town person. I too do not live in Chicago, just visiting.  Maybe we just have higher expectations for brunch. I agree with the other 1 star review, the food was disgusting.

Went here for breakfast on a Sunday Morning. Wait was around 90 minutes, and we thankfully checked in online. There was still a 40 minute wait when we got there after it told us to arrive. They were quoting a 2 hour plus wait! The food was pretty good. It's breakfast and there are a lot of great breakfast places so not sure the wait is worth it. The prices are a bit higher compared to some other places in Chicago. The menu on their website isn't updated. Prices are about $1-$2 higher on each item, and they serve Pepsi products vs coke. I did a butchers skillet. Good but a lot of small local joints could probably serve up just as good!

Best food we had all trip and all we did was eat for a week lol chorizo scramble is unreal, as is the chiliquitos. Make sure to check in online though, or you'll wait a minimum of an hour. The service was as good as the food.
Extremely well organized and ran. Huge crowd on a Saturday morning. Got us in very quick and the food was amazing. Probably not a better spot for breakfast in the entire city.

OH I love the waffle here, soft, juicy and delicious.

The service is great.

Good Job

My favorite Chicago breakfast destination by far! As retiree I dine here twice weekly & especially love dining room at new location beneath Ritz Carlton street level at Water Tower - exceptional value only makes it more enticing - be sure & sign up for Spring rewards program where u get $10 back for every $200 spent here

Mmm. This place is amazing. I've already gone out to brunch twice this month with friends and I'm ready to visit again. I cannot believe how generous the entrees are portion wise with the ultra high quality that they maintain.
I really recommend the cinnamon pancakes. If you don't finish it there ( I don't blame you because I had enough to take home for a few more meals), ask for a small container of the cinnamon sauce with the pancakes. It is the best pancake syrup I've ever tried.
I also highly commend Wildberry on their lattes. Hailing from the west coast, I am fairly picky about my coffee and do not drink from coffee chains usually. They do a stellar job with both the black coffees and the lattes, I in particular adore the hazelnut flavor. Very rich, satisfying, and perfect as a dessert or just to sate your appetite while waiting in the monster line on the weekends.
The wait is very long for brunch. Come one hour or an hour and a half early, do some shopping nearby, and then come back to enjoy the best brunch of your life.

Long long wait. Honestly not sure if it's really worth the wait, but once you get seated the food arrives very quickly. If you have brunch plans, then just book a table and get in the waiting line through yelp and then you'll get a notification when your table is ready so you can just go then. The berry pancakes everyone gets are phenomenal. I got the eggs Florence and it was still good; I personally just didn't like spinach. Prices are okay too! Service is amazing

Great breakfast & brunch spot!!  There are several options on the menu.  Food was hot & fresh when our order arrived at the table.  Recommend putting yourself on the wait list prior to arriving b/c this place gets crowded, especially on the weekend.

I was recommended by three friends to check this place out, so glad I did! We came about 5 minutes before the kitchen closed and the staff was nice enough to still sit us.

Our waiter gave us a list of great recommendations and ended up trying the Sweet Berry Bliss Pancakes which was delicious. A little too sweet for me after a while so I'm glad my boyfriend ordered a savory plate.

Would definitely recommend anyone visiting Chicago to try this place!

pics.caption: Berry Bliss Pancakes! Surprisingly light and fluffy

review.des: It's good not great. I would say average. Their signature pancakes where good. Rest of the food was average at best. One hour wait was not worth it. Here I said it .....

It was crowded, pretty cold outside, it was a Sunday morning and 1.5 hour wait, but it was well worth it. This place features some of the best pancakes that I've ever had. Our last day in Chicago was a bang, mostly because we started it here. We'd been eating pretty great breakfast all week, didnt know how it could get better, but Wildberry was simply amazing!

Once we finally were seated out waiter was supercool! It didnt take long for him to come and take our orders. They have so many things on the menu so it was almost hard to decide what I was going to eat, but I just love pancakes and figured a name like Wildberry Pancakes & Cafe merited me ordering pancakes. Our meals came out pretty quick! I ordered the Signature Bliss and they were phenomenal! Light, fluffy full of flavor! The fluffiest pancakes that i can remember! The marscapone cheese mixed in between the pancakes was super great and the strawberry drizzle alongside the fresh berries made these feel light. Probably the best that I've had as I've said already outside of Clinton Street Baking Co in NY... Simply phenomenal.. Can't wait to get back to Chicago to go here again.
Best breakfast I've had in a long time.  The pancakes were amazing.  Light and fluffy, with berries and cream drizzle. No syrup necessary.
huge portion and great coffee! It has been a regular place for me and my friends to come during weekdays after morning classes.

Went here last while while visiting a friend! It was a awesome! Definitely recommend using the app and putting your name in as their was a long wait. Portions are huge and I love that you get a pancake with most meals to "sample" one! Would highly recommend if you're in this area!

pics.caption: Had the skillet with a s'mores pancake.

review.des: I enjoyed this place a lot! The food was amazing and plentiful! I recommend this for anyone that has had a long night of drinking and needs to put something deliciously heavy inside. However, I would suggest driving parking is expensive in this area.

The menu here is very extensive, and I am sure that everyone who comes to dine here could find something that they would enjoy. It is a pretty large space, and for that reason, the wait doesn't normally get too long. I will say, however, that there's nothing really standout about the restaurant as the menu isn't particularly innovative, so I would say it's not a great place for "foodies".
Love their breakfast menu.  Worth the wait.  Everything from skillets to the waffles is amazing.

It's an amazing breakfast place! The workers are very attentive, and are extremely nice! The food there oh my goodness forget about it... (well you actually can't forget about it lol) it's amazing! This place has become my go to breakfast place.

I've been wanting to go here but heard there were long waits. I went on a weekday for brunch, and waited around 20-30 minutes. It had amazing food and service. Our waiter was so attentive! I got the meat skillet with pancakes (upgraded to the berry pancakes for $2). The pancakes were delicious! Would definitely return.

A long wait over 1 hour but worth it. Food comes out hot and quick. My husband got the Mexican skillet. It was outstanding. Apple pecan pancakes wonderful. I got the veggie omelette. It also was delicious.

I took my boyfriend here for his morning birthday breakfast. He loved it! Try their pancakes or waffles specialties for sure. We came in almost near closing time and they still made sure we were satisfied with our food. I recommend adding yourself on their waitlist on Yelp to avoid a wait time once you arrive. I remember ordering a side of hashbrowns too. Delicious!

Jeremy is the best waiter I've ever had, give this guy a raise!

Best breakfast in Chicago! Berry Bliss pancakes are ridiculous!

The waiting time was waaay too long (a bit more than 2 hours) non the less, it was totally worth it.

Great place for brunch. I had a Cinnamon roll french toast and a pumpking spice latte, they were both really good!
And above all, the attention was fantastic!

If you go in winter, make sure you put your name on the waiting list as soon as you can and you can wait while ice skating in the park.

pics.caption: Cinnamon roll French Toast and Pumpkin spice latte

review.des:
Yum! Went here with my boss for lunch since we work right up the street. Seriously delicious breakfast food. And who doesn't want breakfast all the time?!
Word of warning, if you go at "normal" times to consume food you will likely have to wait! You're not the only one who wants to experience the magic that is Wildberry. So, plan ahead and be ready to wait. Or go at like 2pm.

Holy guacamole!! This place is BUSY! Our wait today was an hour and fifteen minutes. I liked that we got a text that we could be notified when our table was ready. I also liked that it is close to millennium park that we could go and sightsee while we waited.

By the time we were seated, we had amazing service. Mike was amazing! Our table had the Mexicana skillet with brioche French toast, butcher block skillet with campfire pancake and another with banana crepe, and espanola omelette with cinnamon roll pancake.

Drinks were hot chocolate, a passion fruit mango mixed lemonade, and wild berry juice.

Our food and drinks were AMAZING! It is a long wait but well well well worth it. Definitely a fan. I recommend it.

Pancakes!! The pancakes were amazing! I actually really loved all the food here. A friend recorded this place to me and I went here just because I couldn't find anywhere also to eat, but it was so worth it. I got a veggies skillet and cinnamon roll pancakes. The service is great too, the staff was nice and prompt. There was a wait for a table though, about 30 mins.

This is THE place for yummy breakfast.  Here's the hint jump on the waiting list before you get here.  We took our time, strolled up and were seated in 10 minutes. The wait time for walk is was over and hour. The Southern Benedict was amazing.  So big I couldn't finish it.  My lady friend got a skillet.  They accommodated her changes with a smile.   Everything was great.

Today was my first experience at this Wildberry location, and I will think long and hard before I come back. The wait time was insane. I knew it would be busy and I knew there would be a wait. We waited about 1 hr 45 min before we were sat. However, if you want to avoid the wait time, this restaurant works with an app called Nowait- where you can log on and check your party in ahead of time. You will then be added to the wait list and the app will tell you your position in line and will estimate the amount of time until your party is called, so you can plan to arrive right on time.

I ordered the fruity pebble French toast with hash browns extra crispy. I also ordered the cranberry turkey sandwich and the Wildberry salad to take home with me. I loved m the French toast, but the hash browns definitely could have been crispier. The cranberry turkey sandwich is definitely one of my new favorite sandwiches.
My friend ordered the Mexicana skillet with extra crispy hash browns and a side of gluten free pancakes. She devoured the pancakes and raved about how delicious they were.

Every day we attempted to go here for breakfast/brunch we didn't make it due to the long wait. After finally eating there now we see why. The food was absolutely amazingly delicious. The portions are huge, none of us finished our plates. The cinnamon roll pancakes were very tasty. Sounds pretty much like its says. My friend had apple crisp waffle or French toast and devoured it. Another had a crest your own omelette and let me tell you, it was the best omelette ever. We all ate with her.
Oh and let's not forget about the lemonade. If you're a lemonade fan, you'll love it. Every flavor you can think of, they have it. The girls loved it. Myself I had to water it down a tad bit because it was too sweet for me, but it was still great.
Our server G was the best server we had while visiting Chicago. He answered all questions, made suggestions and was very attentive.
This is a place to check out, you won't be sorry.

pics.caption: Located right across from millennium park

review.des: Great brekafast and brunch spot. The food is good and the service is very fast. They have lots of options for any type of food you'd want. It's a good price for good food in a quality space.
