As far as pancake houses go this is one of the better name out there. There's a wild berry in the lemony and homer Glenn too and they're comparable. They hold their own against other big name brands and can probably complete with smaller boutique breakfast houses but I still think going to a small place at the end of the day would be better. All in all a good breakfast if you want some standard breakfast food.
Food is excellent. It's busy but it is well worth the wait. I have eaten at both locations. There is a reason why the lines are so long. An adult and child  less than 10 can share any of the meals.

Must go for breakfast/brunch - My God! The Mixed Berry Bliss Pancakes!!!!! You can get as the side with a main dish or as a main dish.  I had the Napa Fig Omelette and my husband had the Fresca Omelette - both fantastic with excellent layers of flavors.  We both had their regular coffee (none of the many coffees they offer) and it was excellent. So we will be revisiting this excellent breakfast spot next trip to Chicago.

This place served the most amazing breakfast! Seriously! The portions are huge. I had the wildberry bliss and they truly are something to rave about. Oh and the cinnamon latte was the best latte I've ever had. This is going to be my first stop if I ever come back here. PLEASE open a restaurant in Orange County CA
Just had the best eggs benny here with ham cut straight from the bone. So so good. Gets crowded and they don't take reservations but waitlist moves fast and totally worth it.

This is a fantastic choice for breakfast! We were only in town for 5 days and had Wildberry three times. The portions are huge and the price is very reasonable. The pancakes are unbelievably thick and fluffy. We went during the week and only had to wait for a table once. But even if you have to wait, don't worry cause they will get you a table as fast as possible. Without making the customer feel rushed, the wait staff will have their table clean and ready to go before they hit the door. I've never seen such efficient customer service. I highly recommend Wildberry to anyone looking for a yummy and filling breakfast.

I have one word to say Yummy! Yes this place is amazingly great. The Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes are the best pancakes I've had in very long time! I also had the Veggie Signature Omelette with Hash Browns very good. We were a party of ten and although the place was packed we were seated within 15 minutes. The hostess and the wait staff were very friendly and attentive. They even did separate check for all of us!! All around great food and great service 5 stars!

pics.caption: Berry Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes and Create Your Own Signature Omelette with Hash Browns! #yummy

review.des: It's crazy how good the service here is with the business. Waitress was awesome. Food was fantastic. Not rushed at all. DEFINITELY check in on yelp first.
Amazing food. Worth the wait for sure. Join the wait list for a table. Everything looked delicious coming out of the kitchen. We got eggs and omelette and pancakes and all was delicious.

Worth the wait!  Oh my, I'm so glad I listened to my fellow yelpers and  waited!!!  You can give your cel number and they will text when your table is ready.  Hang in the park!  Chill in the adjourning office lobby!  However you do it - just make sure you try this:  Berry Bliss Pancakes.  Good enough to eat without syrup...and this single dish earned the 5 stars itself.

pics.caption: Berry Bliss Pancakes - worth the wait!!
Berry Bliss oozing from the insides...

review.des:
This place gets super crowded on the weekends but we had to try it out on our Chicago trip because of it's amazing reviews, and now I know why! After reading other reviews about wait times we wanted to get up early and get there so we wouldn't have to wait forever. We arrived at about 7AM on a Sunday and were seated right away.

The menu is great for any appetite. I ended up ordering the skillet and the bery bliss pancakes which is topped with vanilla anglaise sauce, blueberry coulis, berry marscapone, and fresh berries-- a delicious combo! I don't think Ive ever had this delicious of breakfast food.

The service was amazing, prices were just right, and the food is to die for. A must when visiting Chicago in my opinion!!

The wait time is crazy but the berry bliss pancakes are worth the wait! I wasn't too big a fan of the honey toffee nut latte. The Denver skillet was also pretty good but the pancakes were on a whole other level!
Great and hospitable staff, fast service, huge portions. Dishes are a bit flavorless though.

I always love going here for brunch and getting the signature berry bliss Wildberry dishes!  Each of the signature berry bliss dishes (pancakes, waffles, french toast, and crepes) is topped with vanilla anglaise sauce, blueberry coulis, berry marscapone, and fresh berries-- a delicious combo!  I'd definitely recommend it if you aren't afraid of something a little richer and more decadent.  But if that's not your style, Wildberry's menu is extensive and all delicious, with options ranging from 5 delicious benedicts to many savory skillets!  They also brew Intelligensia coffee which is a particularly scrumptious pairing with any of the dishes!  

On top of the wide selection and delicious food, all of the dishes are less than $15 each with GIANT portions.  I've always had enough to have a yummy meal left over for the following day!  The ambience is very welcoming with bright and bold colors and it's a great restaurant for two or big groups too!  

You're sure to be happy with the service.  They've always taken our orders quickly and brought our food over even quicker.  After brunch, you can walk off the food by taking a nice walk through Daley Park and Millennium Park!  Just be sure to get there early since they don't take reservations!

Excellent breakfast. Super long wait so I strongly recommend You Place your name on the waitlist then go about your day til it's your time. Worth the wait though! Service was great even though they were slammed. My go to breakfast spot in the chi!

The pancakes are out of this world!

I didn't think I'd find such a great breakfast spot in the heart of downtown, but lo and behold! Wildberry is fantastic.

I had the pancakes and a vanilla latte and boy was I in heaven. The pancakes are thick and very fluffy..and very filling. I was absolutely stuffed as I walked over to the Art Institute afterwards. The latte? Delicious!

This place is an absolute must if you're in the area and craving breakfast fare.

Ordered carry out this morning. $10 for plain pancakes was kind of high until I realized there were FIVE pancakes!! Goodness... definitely a breakfast to split. Pancakes were fresh and ready to go when I walked over. The website is super easy to use and the staff was professional and polite. I'll be back!

The management here is on point. No wonder they have 4.5 stars with a billion reviews! We had a small mishap occur during our meal and one of the managers quickly came to apologized. I love great customer service!

I got the banana cream pie pancakes and it was delicious. It literally tasted like a pie and extremely flavorful. Also, i was able to try the cookies and cream smores pancake. If you have a sweet tooth, this is your go to for sure.

One last thing, don't forget to reserve a spot on yelp. This was my first time seeing that option and it made the wait bearable.

If i could, i would give this restaurant 6 stars like grand theft auto. One of my favorites in Chicago!!
The other review speak for itself. A long wait usually but is really good breakfast. Enjoy
Tasty skillets with good portion sizes. Liked the speciality pancake add on options. Friendly and fast service. What else do you want in a breakfast joint?

pics.caption: Meaty skillet and Cinnamon Roll pancakes

review.des: It's honestly such good food! Great if you have diet restrictions like GF! A little expensive but I think so worth it! Service is so kind! And use the No Wait app to skip the line on the weekend!
Great option for a hearty breakfast/ brunch near Millennium Park before you start your tour around the area. The food is average and portions are big so you might be able to share them.

This place is amazing! I went there with my cousins and we had to look for a place that had Gluten-Free food. My cousin's wife has a gluten allergy. They have plenty of things on their menu are gluten free.

We all had trouble deciding on what we wanted to eat. It all looked so good! We sat there for an extra 10 minutes just to figure out what we want. My one cousins settled for the waffles. My cousin and his wife and myself settled for the skillets. I had the Mexicana Skillet and it was DELICIOUS! Everything about was very tasty! They come with toast or pancakes and we all three decided on the pancakes and they are very delicious as well. All the food was great.

Now there is a lot of food for one person. So, I would recommend splitting the skillet with someone. Or if you are very hungry eat it all yourself. We couldn't eat until dinner, we were so full! But the table next to us had four people sitting at it and they were all splitting their meals. They seemed to have two pancakes each and shared a skillet and one other thing. I would also recommend that.

Overall the interior of the restaurant is beautiful. The booths were comfortable. They have an outside patio to eat out on. The wait was about an hour long on Sunday morning around 9am. Plus there was a marathon that was just ending near by so that probably caused more of a long wait. Also, the food is GREAT. If you are looking for an AMAZING breakfast place. This is your place!

Sorry I don't have a pic of our meals. We were too hungry and couldn't put our forks down to take a pic. Take my word for it.

Food is well worth the 2+hours!! I didn't mind because I had plenty of time to kill while waiting for my hotel room. The homemade corn beef hash and strawberry poppy seed pancakes are to die for. Wait staff and hostesses were friendly and super funny. I will always visit WPC when I'm in Chicago!!!

I flew in from Texas, and woke up at 6:30 AM in search of a delicious brunch joint on Saturday morning, and boy did this place deliver.  By the time we finished breakfast and walked around Maggie Daley Park, there was a line wrapping around outside looking to be 2+ hours long at the reasonable hour of 9AM.

I had The Butcher Block skillet with Berry Bliss pancakes. The Pancakes come smothered in berry and vanilla flavored sauce (the real name of the stuff is super fancy), and fresh berries.  You don't need to use any syrup, it's already pretty sweet.  

The skillet was packed with eggs, sausage, bacon and cheese. I felt like a body builder eating so much brotein.  I definitely over-ordered, the portions here are enormous.  

Wife had the eggs benedict with some veggies (she makes healthier decisions than I), and Banana Cream Pie Pancakes.  The Benedict came with bacon and hash browns which were delightful.  Both dishes were delicious,  honestly I couldn't tell you much about her eggs Benedict or the pancakes, because I was so focused on finishing my skillet of eggs, sausage, bacon, hash browns.  I will say she wanted to trade bites of banana pancakes for a couple bites of berry bliss and I almost said no lol.

The wait was rather long, but it was a Saturday. We added ourselves to the line via the yelp app while we were on the train heading into the city (recommend doing this!!). By the time we got there, we had about a 45 minute wait left. No problem since Millennium Park is across the street! The wait went by fast.

Our food was delicious. We both got skillets and upgraded to specialty pancakes. I had the garden skillet and berry bliss pancakes. Would recommend!! So much food. The food came fast, too. Less than 15 minutes for the food. The staff was friendly and they did a great job of managing the crowd. Will definitely be back!

Good food, long wait for most of the time, unless you come super early or after lunch hours. Nothing special, definitely does not worth the waiting time. Great food for it's quality, price and location.
One of my favorite places to get breakfast. The staff are always friendly and warm welcoming. I love their omelets and they always are accepting of food allergies. Definitely worth going to!
Can't go wrong with Wildberry. Great spot for a business breakfast or lunch in the city.
Awesome place for brunch! The only draw back is the wait and limited parking. If you're close to Millennium Park, give this place a try! And get their berry pancakes

So it's no joke ..  the wait is long. Even for a party of one..  but the food is so worth the wait, as long as you're smart enough to have a snack first.  

The place isn't huge, but the decor is clean and bright. The staff hustles, so it's not their fault there's a long wait.  The food is just too good not to try it..  especially for people like me who are from out of town.  While waiting, I heard so many people say that it was the place they found when the googled breakfast because they were from Texas or Michigan or Canada and so many other places.

Anyway, on to the food--
I ordered the corned beef hash skillet with scrambled eggs and the signature berry pancakes.  #nomnomnom #droolworthy.  

The portions are generous, though I wouldn't fault anyone for getting their own plate of pancakes because that signature dish was oh my goodness delicious.   No need for extra butter or syrup.  

The pancakes were fluffy and perfectly flavored with the mascarpone and fruit drizzle on top with seasonal fruits on the side for a pop of color and sweetness.  

The skillet was equally amazing. Though they could have had more corned beef hash in there.  The skillet had plenty of hash browns, some of it crispy (more is always good), and scrambled eggs with lots of cheese melted all over.  

The drinks and other menu items looked well worth trying but I had to choose wisely.  Looking forward to having this again some time.

pics.caption: Corned beef hash skillet with scrambled eggs. And the signature berry pancakes

review.des: The variety of breakfast meals are perfection! Loved the chilaquiles barbacoa. And for the gran finale their signature bliss pancakes!

You have to try the banana creme pancakes. They were perfect. Wow! Not overly sweet, just simply delicious. They came as a side when I ordered the veggie omelette with hash browns. The portions here are HUGE!

Service was top notch. We came in early on a Thursday and we waited about 5, maybe 10 minutes. The waiters were attentive.

If you're looking for a really filling, tasty breakfast I would recommend that you stop by!

pics.caption: Such a hearty breakfast. This is the veggie omelette with a side of banana pancakes. The BOMB.

review.des: This is the place to go outside your comfort zone! The first few times I dabbled a bit but now I'm full on truing things i wouldn't think i would like.  And guess what? They are always so yummy!  Coffee drinks are always well made too!  The only down side is don't trust the don't wait app for accurate wait times. But your patience will be rewarded!
Everything we ordered was incredible. Pancakes, hash browns, omelette. Portion size of the omelette is massive! Orange juice was super fresh and the chocolate chip frap was delicious.

Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe was highly recommended to me by family, friends and fellow yelpers, thus I felt obligated to like it. However my foodie experience did not exceed my expectations.
I understand that this restaurant is a staple in Chicago, however the food I tried was not what I expected. I ordered a skillet which smelled amazing, unfortunately the dish was tasteless without an ounce of flavor. I literally drenched my skillet with hot sauce, so that it will taste better. The pancakes that came with the breakfast entree was decent. It tasted like normal pancakes that I could purchase at any breakfast joint.
Lastly, their service was impeccable. My waitress was friendly and knowledgable. She went above and beyond to make my dining experience above average. If I was rating service alone it would be 5 stars!
My review was based on one experience that I had here. Hopefully, if I visit Chicago again I can give this restaurant another chance to try more dishes.
Definitely the best breakfast/brunch I've ever had. If you like IHOP then you will absolutely LOVE this place hands down! The Skillets and Signature pancakes are all on point

First, you must use the Yelp waitlist feature!

We came on Mother's Day and joined the waitlist at 60-90 minutes. Went up to 2 1/2 hours from there.

Had coffee lattes and a variety of egg, omelette and skillets. All very good. Loved I could choose fruit instead of hash browns. Pancakes were to die for.

Brunch and all-day breakfast fans, unite. This is your new home.

Stopped in with my mom for lunch. Neither of us were feeling breakfast (I know, I know, why would we pick this place? We love coffee, and this place has an awesome coffee bar), so we split a panini and a salad. Both of which were tasty. We sat on the patio, which was a tad loud for normal conversation. But the service was great and we were pleased overall!

BONUS we checked in for a table using the Yelp app while we were walking toward the restaurant, saving us at least 20 minutes in waiting there.

Wonderful brunch! Both savory omlettes and sweet pancakes were delicious.

Inteligentsia coffee allows you to finally enjoy a good cappuccino with the food, which is not so obvious!  

Our server Emily L. was great!

Would definitely recommend and come back.

pics.caption: Great omlettes.  Enough for 2 to share

review.des:
Don't let the long lines drive you away! Even on a Friday morning the waiting area was packed, but luckily waits aren't too long and the food is delicious.

Service is quick - even with a full restaurant orders were coming out without quickly. Their portions are also decent for the price. Combine that with the large menu of choices and it's definitely worth the price.

pics.caption: The Rutherford omelette with hash browns and pancakes.

review.des: Delicious! We ordered way too much food but it was soooo good. Berry bliss pancakes, banana chocolate chip pancakes, the Mexican omelette and Mexican skillet....would definitely recommend!
The food is good, but the wait is long and it is a little pricey. If you go...try their Wildberry juice. It really is good!

This place is the highest rated restaurant in Chicago, SAD!!! Giving a 5 star review to this place is like giving a 5 star review to McDonald's. And you wonder why you people are so eat of shape and unhealthy... life doesn't get any worse when the important meal of the day is absolute junk food consisted of buttload of sugar and fat... your doctors must love the money you spend on them!

This place has terrible service! The waiter took our change and didn't bring our money back to the table for the change! I asked multiple times to bring our money back and they refused to bring money back our table, as we waited for 30 mins. Don't Go. Food is beyond gross, along with the service!! Extremely rude!! I suggest picking elsewhere!

This is probably one of my favorite breakfast places to visit when I come to Chicago! It is downtown which is a little out of the way for me but I still make time to make it here if I can. Service hasn't disappointed yet, only trouble is parking at busy times but it's not terrible. Highly recommend if in the city!

The service and food were both excellent. More food than we could eat and a good value. It is no wonder the lines are so long. I definitely recommend using the NOWAIT app to get in line before heading over. So many good items in the menu we will be going back again this trip for sure.
  Eating on the patio was really nice but the wind gusts can clear your table in a hurry. Put something heavy on anything that can blow away.

pics.caption: The Denver Skillet was excellent and the blueberry pancakes were great!

review.des:
Amazing food, service, and prices.  

We came on a Monday around 1 PM and were seated immediately. I ordered the Garden Skillet with a side salad, the bf ordered the Butcher Block Skillet with a side of Oreo s'mores pancakes.  The skillet seems like the best bang for your buck because you get hash browns, meat, and vegetables AND a side of pancakes/toast for only $11-12.

The portions are gigantic- we definitely could have shared a skillet. (The skillets come with either pancakes or toast but the waitress kindly substituted my order with a side salad.)  We had so much food, and the bill was only $31.

Love this place and will be back.  Side note: Wildberry serves Intelligentsia coffee!

Went here on after we waitlisted online. We came back and our name was up. We still continued to wait even after. The host staff was less than cordial always giving the same answers to whether you just walked in or you were already past your confirmed time given. Because of this is why they are not getting more stars. The food and waitstaff, amazing. Host staff, subpar.

The only negative is that the wait takes forever :( If you're going on a weekend though, it's worth putting your name down, and going for a nice walk around Millenium Park. Just get a coffee to go or eat a mini breakfast before, so you can fully enjoy Wildberry once you get your table. The skillets are amazing, as are their special pancakes. The special pancakes can get super sugary and sweet though, so it's a nice item to share, or to upgrade the side pancake that comes with your skillet to a special one, so you can try their specialities without the sugar overdose.

Not a great experience. We waitlisted, checked in, were told we would get a text when the table was available. Got the text but we still had a 15 min wait in the very busy and crowded foyer; was told to stand here, yhrn told a moment later to stand elsewhere by the manager who rolled his eyes while he spoke to us . The manager seems to be a real douche to his staff too quite frankly. At the table, had an unremarkable burger and had to ask twice for condiments. I can't recommend this location or this experience, especially not for the price point.

I avoid breakfast foods, but I'll give this place 2 thumbs up.

It's pretty popular to the point that the lobby/entrance is hard to maneuver by.  You put down your name, phone # and # of your party and they will contact you when a table is available.  Our wait was an hour for 2 people.

Inside, the restaurant was a decent size.  When we finally got seated, we were ready to eat and ordered the apple ciders, speciality omelet, Mexicana skillet, and sides of their famous wildberry pancakes and banana foster pancakes.

Everything was just fantastic!  I love a hearty omelet and most restaurants just fall short on this, except here.  Not only the omelet hearty to the point I couldn't finish, the eggs were perfectly cooked!  Seriously one of the best omelets that I've had at a brunch place.  Sides of the hash browns were pretty tasty with crunchiness and freshness.  BF ordered the skillet and it tasted great as well.  

Luckily for us, we didn't order the pancakes as our main dish as it would have just been way too heavy and sweet, but still a good side.  Preferred my banana foster over the wildberry pancake though.  

Overall, it was a great start of our Chicago trip!
(Pretty generous on your wallet as well!)

pics.caption: Side of banana foster pancake and berry bliss pancake

review.des: So good! Just like all the reviews say! Worth the long wait you might find on a weekend morning, just walk around the city for a bit. I tried the honey nut latte, wild berry pancakes, and spinach eggs Benedict (still dreaming about it). Service was kind and attentive too.
Love the Rutherford omelette with goat cheese. The pancakes are always a hit here.   Great service as always

This place is fantastic! We came for a weekend trip to Chicago and deciding on breakfast was tough, we chose Wildberry and it was worth it the 30 minute wait! The service by sophyia was amazing as well.
I'm not a huge breakfast fan but their food is simply amazing!!!
We even came back for the 2nd day as well!
Definitely recommend!

Man, that WAIT. Tip; on your way here, check in on yelp to put your name down, so when you get there you won't be waiting for too long.
To be honest this is just another breakfast place. My chicken and waffles wasn't too awesome: The chicken seemed just like tyson breaded frozen chicken, and the bacon is super thick cut (which is good! but hard to cut with my waffle).
My friend's veggie skillet was yummy but super oily and heavy. My other friend's turkey club was pretty standard and not worth the price.
BUT THE FRIES ARE GOOD! double fried and super crunchy. get a side of it if someone else doesn't get it.
I heard the dessert pancakes were the go-to, but i tried the plain pancakes and they were super cake-y and not pancake-y. Idk how to describe it, but they were insanely sweet (even without a syrup topping) and it put me off from ordering more.
service is slow but they're also always constantly slammed with customers. probably wouldn't come back because of the wait and the hustle/bustle.

Big portions alert! Ordered the Rutherford Omelette. It was good, but nothing out of the normal. Their specialty wildberry waffle can be shared between two people. Again, it was good but at the end of the day it's a waffle with fruit and their specialty topping. La Mexicana plate was flavorful, a little on the spices end but tolerable. The wait line was quite a wait. Show up early. Enjoy!

Arrived on a Sunday morning around 7:40 and to my amazement it was packed; patrons already sitting down enjoying their breakfast, waiting by the hostess stand and outside the restaurant. I thought I'd beaten the crowds go by arriving "early". Luckily I was traveling solo so I was seated immediately. Who knows who long the wait would've been had I had a large party.

I came to Wildberry specifically for their signature Berry Bliss pancakes. My Airbnb hostess as well as every other review on yelp raved about the berry bliss pancakes/waffles/crepes. I'm a pancake girl myself, so I knew I had to try them before I left chi-town.

My waiter gave me a menu, so I had some time to mull over my decision. Who was I kidding? I only had those berry pancakes in mind. Once the kitchen had my order, it only took about ten minutes for it to come out. Surprisingly fast considering how many people were dining at that time. Thumbs up for the quick service!

The pancake dish arrived with syrup and butter on the side, and four (huge) pancakes drizzled in the vanilla anglaise, blackberry coulis, and fresh berries. I don't recall the berry mascarpone though. After staring in amazement for about two minutes I dug in. Soft and fluffy, not overly sweet even with the syrup. Just the way pancakes should be. But I'm not sure what all the hype was about.

I ate just about one pancake because I was so full from the other days food adventures. But let's face it, these pancakes were monstrous. The portions at Wildberry seem to be on the bigger side though. I did see a ton of food go uneaten while dining. I didn't want to throw away perfectly good food, so I packed the remaining (untouched) pancakes and gave them to a homeless man in the park. I hope he enjoyed them just as much as I did! Just something to keep in mind when you come here.
All we ate was delicious, excellent staff and food. The Best breakfast ever. If you go to Chicago this place is a "must to eat".

pics.caption: Red velvet French toast, Oreo smores panqueques, wild berry crepes and kids Menu

review.des: This place is a very good place to have breakfast at! This place is where it's at for breakfast lovers like me! There might be a 30 min - 1hr wait in the weekends (although I only waited for 10 min) but hey you know what they say it's worth the wait and good things come to those who wait, trust me breakfast here is delish!

Oh my God. My only regret with eating here is not doing it sooner. Best pancakes I've ever had! I got the s'more Oreo pancakes, because I was on vacation, screw it-- best decision ever. Absolutely amazing!

And my honey toffee nut latte was life changing. Two thumbs up!!

Also, our waitress was a sweetheart! I'm so irritated at myself for forgetting her name, I really wanted to name drop because she deserves the kudos and praise!
I picked this place to have my breakfast and I was extremely happy about my choice. My server was incredibly friendly and attentive. I was very pleased and thank everyone for a delicious breakfast!

I ordered buttermilk pancakes and waffles through postmates and $50 later and almost 2 hours wait finally got the food. Also keep in mind I live not too far from this brunch place.. Super basic not worth the money ihop has better food and way more affordable.. not ever coming back sorry not sorry

Great breakfast spot across from
Millenium Park. very nice and accommodating staff. Food was awesome! Prices were not too high.

Sunday morning, my sis and I arrived at 10am to put our names in.  They had told us it would be about a 90 minute wait. So we walked over to the park to hang out, be a tourist and take photos with the Cloud Gate and other sites.  An hour and 5 minutes later we were notified that a table was ready for us!

Aitah was our excellent server and she was just delightful! Here's what we had:

RITHERFORD OMELETTE - $11.25
Baby Spinach, Caramelized Onions, Goat Cheese, and Bacon.  
Served hashbrowns as our choice.
We Sibstituted for Specialty pancakes for +$1.
We had Avocado to add for +$1.
The omelette was wonderful! I'm so happy that they put large chunks of avocado in the omelette!  It was so good! As for the hashbrowns, it was perfect.  One side would be kind of mushy and soft and the other would be crispy! Yum! For our upgrade on the pancakes, we chose the:

SIGNATURE BERRY BLISS (2)
Vanilla Anglaise, Blackberry Coulis, Berry Marscapone, and Fresh Berries (Strawberries, Blueberries, and Blackberries).
This beautiful dish was so yummy! I was so pleased to see Berry Marscapone not only on top but also in between the 2 pancakes!  

So this one dish was a perfect amount for my sister and I.  It was a huge meal all for $13.25! Crazy!  And the service was so great! Everyone was so friendly and enthusiastic!  It's also a great location of you plan on visiting the Millennium Park!

Thanks you Wildberry, I had an amazing time!

pics.caption: RITHERFORD OMELETTE $11.25 + Berry Bliss Pancake specially upgrade $1 (so cheap and good!)
SIGNATURE BERRY BLISS (+$1 more upgrade to omelette meal)
RITHERFORD OMELETTE - $11.25 Baby Spinach, Caramelized Onions, Goat Cheese, and Bacon.

review.des:
Came here during our trip to Chicago and I must say this has been one of the best breakfast places that we've ever been to. We loved it so much that we went twice during our stay in Chicago!

The staff was friendly and the service was fast. Whatever you order, please get it "Signature Berry Bliss" style! It's a MUST! We also ordered the Banana Nut Bread French Toast, which is to die for. Portions are big, the fruit was fresh, and even if you are full, you can't help but finish it because you don't want to waste it! We also got the Venetian Skillet, which gets a 2.5/5 stars. Good, but not great. It's something I can make at home on my own but mixing a bunch of ingredients together. Definitely recommend their french toast and pancakes there! Seriously wish they would start expanding to other locations outside of Illinois.

Wildberry was great. Excellent skillets and omelets. I loved the garden skillet. The pancakes were also delicious. For being in The Loop, the prices were reasonable for a fairly nice place. The place was really crowded, but the wait-list through Yelp made it simple. We only waited about five minutes once we got the text and checked in. The server was very friendly and efficient.  Overall, really good experience.

I liked the food, we ordered sklit, omelet and pancake .
They were friendly but too friendly.
When I was ordering they were asking so many details about the food that confused me. But the worst part when the waiter coughed and mumbled something in his coughed so that they can laugh at me.
This part was really annoying.
The food was good but not tasty, I added salt. The pancakes were awesome. Go for pancakes only.

We went for breakfast on Sunday morning and used the Yelp app to get on the wait list, which was a great hack but not perfect (We had to wait about 20 minutes longer than the one hour that the Yelp app estimated, but perhaps they were experiencing a rush-- we heard the host staff tell people coming in that the wait was two hours).

As expected from the name, the pancakes here are definitely something special, particularly the signature cakes. But if you're like me, you like savory at breakfast too. I ordered the vegetarian skillet and the significant other ordered the brisket hash. The flavor on his was good, but unfortunately, the cooks rushed it (as could be expected when the restaurant has a two-hour wait), but the giant chunks of raw onion were a problem in his dish-- and in mine! I ate my eggs off the top of my skillet (which, I should mention, were over easy and cooked perfectly-- runny yolks but completely cooked whites. Hallelujah!) and took the rest of my skillet home to finish the cooking process. I ate it Sunday night as a near-midnight snack, and it wasn't half bad.

So, while it wasn't the worst meal-- it wasn't even a bad meal-- I expect that a place so popular and with a such a long wait would send out consistent foo--if it wants to remain a hot spot.

I mean. Maybe I'm a pig. Or maybe I'm a foodie traveling alone and I just need to try all the goods. The latter, yes, the latter...

Basically, everything here is HUGE. No matter what you get, it's worth at least 2-3 meals. So, naturally, I ordered two entrees. LOL. I must have some real problems here...

I got the Mexicana Skillet, which comes with hash browns, cheddar and jack cheese, 2 eggs (I got them over easy), chorizo sausage, jalapenos, avocado, cilantro, and onions. Honestly, I was hesitant to order anything with a Mexican slant because I'm from California where we have amazing Mexican food. Chicago certainly isn't close to Mexico and Mexican food is not something I naturally think of when I think of Chicago. I'm glad I ordered this - the chorizo added some really good heat to this humongous skillet that was packed with so much flavor I barely knew what to do with it!

The star of this breakfast was my second order, though - the Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes. I mean, there's a reason this place is called "Wildberry Pancakes"...it's for the wildberry pancakes. Duh. But I mean, COME ON. I've never had pancakes so fluffy and decadently dressed. The vanilla anglaise paired with the blackberry coulis over the berry marscapone and fresh berries...ughh I'm drooling just thinking about these pancakes again. They really were that amazing.

ughh BBL - gotta go back to Chicago and get me some more of these pancakes...

This is a good brunch place - arguably one of the best downtown. That comes with its own problems though. The central location and high yelp reviews lead this place to be pretty crowded pretty much for all of their open hours. That said, the food is reasonably priced and doesn't disappoint - though it's quite heavy. The skillets are very good and different from what one might normally expect from a brunch place, and the pancake flavors yield a lot of good sweet options (Oreo Pancakes!). Worth trying once if you're in Chicago, then deciding how you feel about the time/fillingness to quality ratio, but be prepared to wait about an hour most of the time.
The best in Chicago.  Use the no wait app to avoid the daily long lines.  You will not be disappointed!

Service is great! One of the hosts gave me the wrong pick-up order. He was very gracious and offered to comp my next meal. My to go meal is the fresca omelette paired with whole wheat toast (or pancakes if I want something a bit sweeter) and fruit. The fresca omelette has avocados in it which makes it so creamy and filling. The tartness from the sun dried tomatoes adds a good surprise kick to the dish as well. Finally, there's a subtle undertone of basil throughout the entire experience.

Make sure you get on the wait list (via yelp) before you head over. The wait is often 1-2 hours during the busier times/days. The service was good- I forgot something at the table when we were leaving and the person cleaning the table chased after me to give it to me!

Lovely restaurant for brunch. If you can, grab a table outside and get a view of beautiful millennium park. The pancakes and eggs Benedict were fabulous. I upgraded to the very berry pancakes which was a great idea. Lines get long so get there, take a number and they will call you much sooner than the predicted time. And lastly, come with an appetite because the portions are huge!

I would say the food is good and yes their pancakes are great.
3 stars is for service.  If you say you have a party of 3, then all 3 people have to be there to be seated. We had this problem when we were there. I told the manager to change our party to 2 then & he basically got mad at us and said he he would've sit us somewhere else. I said well our friend doesn't plan on eating anyway, so we were ok to sit and order etc. He then told us that our friend would not be allowed to order whenever he got there.
Good food just not about the customer.

The number of reviews and the high rating is what caught my eye. I used the wait option on Yelp before getting on the train and we ended up only having to wait for 10 minutes by the time we got there! I would not go to this restaurant without that service. The hour wait is not worth it. Anyways, I ordered a Latté and the corned beef hash skillet with a side of signature berry bliss pancakes. The skillet was a very large portion. I hate wasting food, but since we were going to be walking around afterwards I couldn't take it to go and half of it ended up getting wasted. I really didn't like it anyways. Don't bother ordering it. The pancakes were very delicious, though. My Latté perfectly paired with it. My boyfriend ordered the slow roasted brisket hash and he really enjoyed it. The only problem he had was that the onions weren't cooked, they were fresh. It changed the overall flavor and would've done better if roasted with the brisket. I would come here again using the wait option.
Visiting from out of town & had to wait for an hour and half for seating but it was worth it. Get the cinnamon roll pancakes!! It's so good!

pics.caption: Cinnamon roll pancakes and create your own skillet

review.des: This place was awesome as far as the food. It's a very long wait so be prepared to wait. I recommend going early in the morning trying to avoid the rush. The staff was friendly and everyone was courteous. We will return

pics.caption: A lil shot from the inside

review.des: Great service, delicious food, lovely, bright space, all diners seem happy! Would return every day if we were staying in town longer.

Half an hour wait but I've heard the wait can be up to an hour. This was enough time for my friend and I to run to the bean to take pictures. Super fast wait time for the food. Amazing service. My friend and I split eggs, bacon, side of fruit, and Berrybliss pancakes for $15ish, and we were both very filled!!! Super yummy!!
Came in due to ratings.  They did not disappoint.  Had the chicken and waffles:  and WOW!!! Wish I could have more food but portions are BIG..
BEST BREAKFAST EVERRDDDFFNFJFJDNZNXNDNDNDNDNDNDN.... I've only ordered take out because I work down the street but oh man this place is great. I hope one day to actually sit down inside lol

The restaurant is located right in front of The Millennium Park, which was really beautiful. We sat outside so we had a great view of it and the city. The food was so appetizing and looked great. The service was also great and the food was done fast.
The pancake looks great and tastes great. Love the soy milk latte! I woke up at 10 am and use the online waitlist, and arrive at the cafe at 11am, and get seated in less than 10min.

Delicious food! Went here after the St Patrick's day parade with family that came here from Ireland. The staff was so friendly and after we had ordered our food they continually checked up on us. The food was amazing! And the portions were huge! So we all got to try a bit of something new. Would definitely recommend!
This place is alright. Nothing was very remarkable. Typical breakfast restaurant. Their servings are very large. You can easily share a breakfast.

Wow where do I start.? We were first greeted by the friendliest waiter. The coffee and lemonade is a must in my opinion. I got a soy cappuccino and I could definitely say it was one of the best cappuccinos I've ever had! Our food was delightful and very filling! Great breakfast stop in Chicago!

I've heard my sister and friends rave about this place,so I finally decided to try.  I love that they have the no wait app,which is a real time saver. I got there at around 1:30-2:00 and even though it was definitely a lot slower,service wasn't really that quick. I was expecting the amount of food to be large just bc everyone in previous reviews said that, but thhe portion sizes weren't really that big. Overall, I don't really see the hype with Wildberry. It is like any other breakfast place to me.

Wild berry exceeded our expectations! The wait is crazy because the place is rather small. But, it was worth it. We had traditional pancakes but they were really delicious. I make them from scratch at home and these were like homemade! Not too thick. Not too heavy. My only recommendation - they should warm the syrup to make them taste even better.

I also added turkey sausage patties and eggs to my order. I can't prove it but the turkey sausage tasted much better than what you usually get in a restaurant. Maybe it was organic? Don't know but another nice surprise.

Overall, a good choice for pancake lovers, great for kids and for Chicago - reasonably priced. I'll definitely return!
Absolutely perfect. I would suggest getting there a little early because they can have quite a wait in the mornings. I had the pancakes and skillet and we will be back for sure!tt

Loved my meal! Ordered the veggie omelette and signature berry pancakes. Didn't give them a five star because the veggies in my omelette were very crunchy and I felt could have used extra time on the stove. Otherwise the taste was great! And I agree: AMAZING PANCAKES!!!!
If you want great pancakes, give this place a try. Everything else on the menu isn't that amazing but not disappointing. Good coffee as well.

My friend and I were looking for a good breakfast this morning and stopped in here. Holy crap it was delicious! I ordered the white chocolate raspberry latte which was amazing. I also ordered two eggs with bacon and fruit and granola pancakes. The pancakes were so fluffy and the berries were perfectly fresh. Loved our visit!
Delicious breakfast choices.  Good gluten free choices for celiac family members.  Friendly service. Will be back!

Top 10 breakfasts in my life. No joke.
Yes, you will be waiting 30-40 minutes if you show up after 8am on a weekend. More like an hour if after 9am. Get some Intelligensia coffee while you wait. Dang, they make their French Roast STRONG. Love it!
Had the chorizo eggs benedict and it was phenomenal. Hash browns are just that...served soft, so ask for well done if you like them more crispy. I mix mine with the rest of my meal, so no complaints. Friendly service and many hands working to serve food, clear plates, fill water/coffee, etc. You will be in and out in 30 minutes if you need to be. Otherwise, sit back and enjoy the madness. Not a place to try and take a first date. Pretty noisy, as it should be. Extra points for Cholula hot sauce at every table.
Also, shared the cinnamon pancakes and they were super moist, so we thought they were excellent. Breakfast will never be the same.

If you're having trouble finding Wildberry, just look for the crowd hanging out at the northeast corner of Michigan and Randolph. Arriving at 9:00 AM, we assumed that we didn't beat the Saturday morning rush, but we put our name on the list and were quoted a 45 minute wait. Since there was plenty of time to kill before check in at the hotel, we decided to wait it out. Turns out, we only waited 20 minutes and were treated to a delicious breakfast. If your wait is extended and the Chicago skyline isn't piquing your interest enough, you can grab a coffee at the Intelligentsia stand at the entrance of the restaurant.

The host staff greeted us warmly and we were given friendly, helpful service by our server Esmeralda. I ordered the chocolate chip pancakes with a cafe mocha to make a complete chocolate themed breakfast. The pancakes were light and fluffy with plenty of chocolate. Also ordered were the Wildberry crepes, the butcher block skillet, and the two eggs with bacon. Everyone was pleased with their meals with portions that left us stuffed. My wife enjoyed the bacon with her entree and my daughter loved the fresh berries that came with her crepes. Don't be afraid to bring the kiddos here either as their kids menu is extensive enough to please the pickiest eater. Prices worked out to $12/person before tip.

My only concern is that our food came out really quick, no joke, like 5 minutes quick. It is possible to have a made-to-order ticket time that fast. But that fast in a restaurant filled up to the hilt?(Insert raised eyebrow emoji here) My wife did say her eggs weren't as hot as they could have been. Are they pre-cooking some items to increase turnover? Just some food for thought.

This is a situation where I'm still a fan and would recommend if you haven't been there and can tolerate the wait. But there are so many options in this city that I would want to give a try before I make a return trip.
I ordered the best coffee mocha I have ever had!! The coffee drinks are just as amazing as the yummy food! This is a must have when visiting Chicago!
This is a lovely restaurant. Great food. Staff is friendly despite the crowds. The problem is that it is too busy. Long waits.
Delicious food and incredibly efficient service. A bit pricey, but a great experience.

Everyone was so happy and upbeat that I can't bring myself to give a really negative review. But (after the long wait) the eggs on my benedict were not soft-boiled but harder than hard. I told the waitress who just said 'I'm sorry' (very sweetly, but with no action). And it was impossible to get a second cup of coffee.

Lesson for future: in really crowded restaurants don't order anything that depends on even a little complicated cooking or being served really promptly. In other words, I should have had pancakes.

Service was great as well as the food. I have a sweet tooth and decided to get the chocolate chip banana pancakes. They were super sweet but the banana was ripe and delicious, it all evened out to a great breakfast. I also tried some of my family's  food and was great as well. The rosemary in the hash browns was amazing. Eggs were eggs. Sausage patties exceeded my expectations. Overall very good!

ONE of the BEST brunch spots in downtown Chicago! Highly recommend using this app to get on the waitlist, they do not take reservations, so this app is very convenient. It is a very popular spot, which means a long wait time & crowding! If you haven't tried it, what are you waiting for? One of my favs!

Food is okay, standard brunch fare. Wait times are long! Be prepare for wait between 45 mins- an hour at the minimum, more in warm weather. Location is great, right by millennium park so if you are in the area you can stop by for brunch.

Great for breakfast and lunch! Had the butcher skillet and was a great combination of eggs, hash browns, and other vegetables. Came with a side of pancakes and it was great as well! Extremely busy and had to wait two hours to be seated but it was worth the wait! Great and quick customer service!

It would be wise to set your wait time from the Yelp app before heading there so you don't encounter the long wait line when you arrive. The wait time can be from 45 minutes to an hour. We set our spot in line on Yelp from our bed, got ready, took our drive from our AirBnb to the restaurant (about 20 minutes), and by the time we got there we were maybe 5 minutes of waiting before they called us. The service was great. All staff members were very friendly. The side proportions are huge. I ordered the Fruity Pebble pancakes and personalized it to my own liking by having them pour the very berry cream over it. They had no problems with my personal request (it did cost me an extra $2) and the outcome was delicious. So, so good. The hype is legit for this place and definitely worth a try. It is located in a beautiful and convenient spot in the city too for tourists. The menu offers so many intriguing things. I will definitely come back my next visit to Chicago. They run the place beautifully.

I'm in love with their berry bliss pancakes..... the pancakes are fluffy and soft and the sauce makes it very unique! I've tried the Mexicana skillet and that was full of different flavor and spices too! I've tried other dishes and pancakes but I don't remember what they were. But let's just say I have never been disappointed with this place, everything is delicious. The wait is usually a long time so make sure you get there early or make a reservation!

In all my 22 years of existence on this earth this place is by far the BEST brunch place I have ever gone to and I say that so honestly.

I came to Chicago for a little weekend trip just to explore and don't ask me why I came when temperatures were nearly freezing ( the day we came here the temperature was 0 degrees)

Now, normally I would sit and fuss about an hour wait but man, was this place so worth everything. It was worth the walk in this frigid  weather as well as the wait inside the restaurant.

The food was simply amazing! This is actually one of those places I would get on a plane to and just go there if I could YES, THAT'S HOW GOOD IT WAS!

Even with the waitress being really slow I took that as more time to enjoyed my delicious meal.

I had the Mexicana skillet and it really didn't disappoint. It was so rich in flavor. I mean from the avocado,chorizo sausage to the cheese, egg, hashbrown and everything in between it was amazing.

That's THE place for a delicious breakfast and a good start into your day! I had the classic benedicts, some signature berry bliss pancakes and a cafe mocha! I went there early in the morning, so no waiting time at all. Next time I am back to Chicago I will have breakfast here again

This place is delicious! Just a short walk from where we stayed, but almost impossible to get in to eat without a two hour wait. The trick? Show up early.

It took us three tries but we finally got in on a Tuesday at 9:30am.

My husband and I both had the Mexicana skillet. It was amazing, spicy and perfect. I had the chocolate chip pancakes, and he had the cinnamon roll pancakes, don't judge we were on vacation.

Everything was very well made, fresh ingredients, the service was friendly and fast. Great way to start your day in Chicago.
Literally the best breakfast of my life. All three people I was with agreed. I just booked another trip to Chicago with the boyfriend in a few months and can't wait to take him!
So good and so fast! Defiantly put your name on the list before you arrive though. I really enjoyed the eggs Benedict!
Awesome experience excellent food great atmosphere- you can't come here without trying the wild-berry Bliss pancakes

Since this was our first time in Chicago we made sure to check all the reviews. The food here was amazing!! We were a party of three and we each tried different items. I believe everyone liked my dish the best which was the Strawberry Lemon Pancakes.  The lemon part was a lemon cream spread overtop of the strawberries and pancakes. Didn't even need syrup. Apparently, its seasonal. I only gave this place 4 stars because the wait is RIDIC! waited about an hour an 15 which may not seem long but let's be real, breakfast is one of the quickest meals to make. Either way, it was still good. Friendly staff too.

pics.caption: My Strawberry lemon pancakes after crushing half
We were a party of three and wanted to try a variety of things. We loved all the food!

review.des:
Good morning
I have visited Chicago twice in the last year. I love the food here. Everything I have had has been amazing. They are also very efficient. You can the wait by downloading there no wait app. This is a must if you are in the area. Happy Eating.!!
Amazing food, great service. Make sure your whole party is present or you will not be seated. Signature pancakes are wort the wait.

pro-tip: i can't stress (and thank yelp friends!) enough, USE THE NOWAIT APP. it is god's gift to the efficiency queen inside me. you get to wake up, pull out your phone and bam, just like that you've saved yourself a spot in line. then you just gotta get ready, and once find your way there just walk on in and get seated!! it is magical *end fangirl rant*

oh my god, i've never written a review this fast after eating. but YUM, and i already know my inner basic brunch self will miss the berry bliss pancakes SO MUCH when i fly back to cali :( the berry marscapone was 2 die 4. I always want the sweet brunch items but usually I can never manage to stomach it and end up with something savory. With their skillet offering I was able to get a bit of both! the mexicana skillet was very tasty, the hash browns were crisp and it had that jalapeño kick, kind of like a deconstructed breakfast burrito minus the tortilla (it was a little much in the oil but it's hash browns so what does one expect?). my friends got the butcher block and garden skillet, the butcher block reminded me of a mcdonalds mcmuffin and the garden was very light (could've used a little more flavor but hey, when all fails, ketchup).

service there is S O fast, quickest brunch i've probably ever eaten and our waitress alex was really nice!

pics.caption: mexicana skillet and the most scrumptious berry bliss pancakes

review.des: This is my favorite place for brunch. It's kids friendly but not loud. The menu has so many options and the servers are super nice. Bit pricey for the "regular" american breakfast, but definitely worth every penny, beautiful restaurant, great food and awesome service. Our favorite location is Schaumburg, IL.

The reviews are not wrong... It's definitely a wait to get in for a weekend breakfast.  Thankfully they are with the times and have an app that texts you when your table is ready.  Though you have to stick around close by as they say you have to check back in within 5 minutes of getting the text.  To be fair it also has a link to a website that shows you how many parties are in front of you. (Depressing to see a double digit number when you've been waiting for 40 minutes).  Anyway, on to the main event: Breakfast!

For you sugar fiends out there, you'll probably love this place as you can see from all the photos of decked out pancakes. But if you're into savory like I am, this isn't the place to hit.  I ordered the skillet with Italian sausage, onions, bell peppers, and tomatoes over hashed browns and was disappointed. The hash browns weren't crispy, the veggies are too big (smaller chunks would have made it easier to eat), and everything needed salt. A lot of salt. And hot sauce. Lots of hot sauce.  Even that didn't fix it.  

Most skillets that I've had come with the veggies and meat mixed in with the eggs and either next to or on top of the has browns and then covered in cheese.  This dish was more layers... a small layer of hash browns, a thicker layer of veggies and meat, scrambled eggs on top, then a layer of cheese with pancakes on the side.  Some of you may like that, but it's not my cup of tea. At least they give you large portions?

The service at the front desk was not very friendly, probably because they are dealing with tons of people who are hungry and waiting so if they're anything like me, hangry might be an appropriate adjective.  However to their credit they have their coffee bar right at the door so people can grab coffee while they are waiting so they aren't tired, & hangry.  I had to deal with a rude man who cut in line to put his name down because it was too crowded. I saw him come in after me because I moved to the side to try to accommodate more people in the front area, I guess he didn't see me and when I pointed out that I was there first he was quick to say that I was wrong.  O'well, maybe he was hangry.  Anyway, I put my name in and went to Starbucks a block down to escape the cold, get a hot drink, and work on my computer as the wait was quoted to be an hour.

As expected about 50 minutes in, I received a text and headed over to the restaurant.  I sat down and ordered some food and the service at the tables were far better.  Friendly, quick, and attentive.  Everything you would want in a server.

So, executive summary: overwhelmed front desk staff, friendly servers at your table, huge quantities of savory food that is average at best, decent buttermilk pancakes, and a huge wait.  I'm not sure what the hype is about, but it's certainly not the savory foods. I'm probably not going to go back because the food was not worth the wait, but at least it wasn't expensive.

Wildberry is one of my favorite brunch spots in the city, it never disappoints! I usually order on their app for pick up  or use the "NoWait" app to avoid the long wait times. I recommend their skillets and specialty pancakes! #NomNomNom

What a wonderful choice for breakfast!   We had a party of eight and all had great meals.  The menu provides so many choices and each meal was prepared to perfection.  Large quantities as well and the service was fantastic.  Five stars for sure.

Flipping YUM!! Maybe the best pancakes I've ever had in my life. The ingredients are fresh, and the service is friendly. The wait can be really long, so either get there just before they open, or make a reservation.

This place is definitely somewhere you want to try! It's a good spot for breakfast or lunch. I came here two days in a row on our four day vacation.

The first day I got two eggs scrambled with hash browns, turkey bacon and fresh glazed blueberry pancakes.

The second day I got the garden skillet and the berry bliss pancakes. The garden skillet had veggies like mushroom, asparagus, broccoli, tomatoes and a few more I can't remember. All the veggies is sitting on top a pile of hash browns with melted cheese and two eggs on top which I got poached. The berry bliss pancakes had mascarpone in between along with berries and different types of syrup.

The pancakes were both so fluffy and soft. Even though I was full, I had to finish my pancakes!

The service was good and the waiters were attentive and kind.

The price for the food is pretty great! You get a lot for your money. I would definitely recommend trying this place. If you are going on a weekend, I would definitely try to go early so you won't have to wait as long.

pics.caption: Two eggs with hash browns, turkey bacon, and blueberry pancakes

review.des: Good stuff. Tasty pancakes. Excellent location. Gets crowded though, and I wish they had a liquor license so they could start serving mimosas.

AMAZING FOOD! Took me 10 minutes just to decide what I wanted!

Food - 5 stars - had the biscuits & gravy with scrambled eggs. Biscuit was warm and flaky, gravy was creamy and meat was flavorful. Eggs cooked perfect and were a bright yellow. Wife had the Rocky Mountain savory crepe. She couldn't stop smiling as she ate it. Lol

Coffee- 5stars- hot and flavorful.  

Service- 5 stars- 20 minute wait was well worth it. Service from Aleks F was great!

A must stop for breakfast!
Food was great. Large portions and the server was really friendly. We got there early and got right in. Definitely would recommend.

My baby sister and I went to Wildberry in between buying day of tickets for a show and the matinee itself. We checked in online while waiting for the box office to open, and then walked to the cafe just in time for our reservation! They even gave us a red velvet French Toast slice because we were celebrating our birthdays! So sweet! The playlist in the restaurant was ON POINT.
The only downside was we had to wait a while  for our check, which wasn't a big deal, but just surprising, considering how busy they were.

First time eating at this restaurant and I was not disappointed.  Loved being able to get in line from my phone.  Will definitely eat there again very soon.  Had the spinach, onion and feta omelet with the specialty pancake... and the berry orange juice.  Loved it!

Great location if you are in town touring the city (or have friends that are). Right across from Millenium Park. Food was great, we got a variety of meals from skillets to crepes and omelettes and everything was fantastic. Only "drawback" is the wait time, so I would suggest calling ahead and getting your name on the list.
Our server, Justin, was very attentive and very patient while we decided what to get. Food came out fast and everything was delicious! Would definitely come again.
Some of the most amazing breakfast and friendly service I've had. Bravo. Try the skillets! And please be sure to reserve on yelp first
Great experience here. The waffle was absolutely delicious! It's definitely the best and the softest waffle I've ever had.This place is definitely a great choice to have your breakfast. :)))

This is good ole, down home, American, stick-to-your-bones, go-out-and-work-in-the-field-the -rest-of-the-day, breakfast. Eat here once, MAYBE twice a month if you dare. From what I saw, people were eating food that as it passed their lips, the look of guilt for eating such gluttonous bites, was quickly eclipsed by a look of satisfaction. If it was someone else's tab, I would have gotten one of everything. I kick myself for not trying the biscuits and gravy, but let's get real, Geoff. My travel buddy got the turkey sandwich with the egg (I'm not entirely sure sandwiches DON'T come with egg these days in Chicago...). I instead tried the skillet and asked for a side of hollandaise. Don't judge me. I wanted to see how they prepared it. They misunderstood and presented my side of their chipotle hollandaise in a ramekin with a soup spoon, as if I was going to eat it like a thick clam chowder. I almost did it was so good. It wasn't the best (if you're looking for the best, it's at Katy's in Carmel by the Sea) but it was daaaaamn close.
The sandwich was solid (I swear, if I have another sandwich with a fried egg on it...) and my skillet was cheezy, potatoey, sausagey, delishesness. I ate half and then threw in the towel out of fear of later cardiac complications. This food is by no means gourmet but any greasy spoon across the US would be LUCKY to have any of these items on their menu, let alone serving in their establishment. *slow clap* nicely done, Widberry, nicely done.
Very standard, tasty but nothing special. There is also a mark up in price for the stellar location.

This place is great if you are already downtown and are a fan of breakfast foods.

Every time I have been to Wildberry, my waiter has been very helpful and I like that there is water already waiting for you once you're seated. The wait list does seem to get pretty long, so I always plan to go during the week and I go knowing that I'll put my name down then explore for 20 minutes to a couple hours before I end up getting a table. The yelp app helps you track your place in line and they will text you when your table is ready. From there, you have 5 minutes to make your way back to Wildberry.

I'm a huge fan of the Signature Berry Bliss, mainly because of the berry mascarpone and all the fresh fruit. I've tried both the french toast version and the crepes version. The two dishes are pretty good size, but I think I prefer the crepes because they are lighter and I don't feel as stuffed afterwards. I have yet to try the pancakes.

Pros:
-Good food
-Very reasonable prices
-Big portions
-Helpful waiters
-Great for all ages
-Lots of seating
-Located next to Cloud Gate, Maggie Daley Park, Lurie Garden, The Art Institute, and more

Cons:
-Long wait times
-Can get loud and crowded
Best breakfast place in town. Get the NOWAIT app to reserve a spot.

I Really don't understand the hype around this place. The wait was ridiculous and not even remotely worth it. The service was so-so at best. I ordered an omelet with a side of apple pecan pancakes and my boyfriend ordered eggs benedict. It just WASN'T GOOD. Omelet was kind of dry and flavorless, the pancakes were bland and also dry, served with artificial syrup, and I was told the eggs benedict was thw worst my boyfriend had ever tried. Based on all the reviews I was really expecting something delicious but what we got was about on par with IHOP. I LOVE breakfast too so it really wouldn't have been that difficult to impress me. If it were a quick breakfast place you just stop in, it would have been alright, but after waiting for HOURS and squeezing through the massive crowd to get to our table, it was a huge let down.

Outrageously good food. Phenomenal. The taco skillet with poached eggs and chorizo was perfectly prepared. The pancakes were light, fluffy, and decadent. The service was on time and not overbearing. Food was played quickly and served piping hot. Perfectly executed poached eggs. Excellent coffee and very reasonably priced for  Chicago. Way more food than you could ever eat in one setting.

With all of the positive ratings and reviews, I was very excited to eat here. However, it didn't live up to the hype.

My sister and I came in around 8am. The wait time was 10-20 minutes, but we were seated within 5 minutes or so (no shows.) The restaurant was full, but not hectic.

I ordered tea and noticed there was a lipstick stain on my mug. It wasn't a big issue for me, but I did wave down my server to get a new mug.

I ordered the venetian skillet and it was just mediocre. The eggs (over easy) were overcooked and the skillet itself was greasy. It came with toast or pancakes, so I tried the seasonal lemon poppyseed something. :) Pancakes were good.

As for service, it was mediocre as well. Right after ordering, the restaurant started to get really busy. Therefore, the service was lacking and our server wasn't that attentive. We never had refills and he only checked on us when we were ready to leave.

We added a to go meal towards the end and it came out a lot quicker than our meal.

Maybe if I came at a different time, service would have been better?

This is probably one of my favorite breakfast restaurants in town. The food was delicious! The staff was so nice from the moment we arrived. I had the berry waffle with a side of scrambled egg! I really recommend this place!!

This is a really great place for brunch! Super long wait but you can do a yelp wishlist and get there when it tells you to arrive. Sofiya, our server was absolutely great. So nice and attentive. Good outdoor seating. A must try if you're near millennium park. [Cinammon roll pancakes and Espanola omelette ]
My one of the fav brunch places in the city, no wonder why it takes hour to get seated over the weekends but worth the wait for the food and service!!! Love this place.

Wildberry is one of the most reviewed places in Chicago and supposedly has the best pancakes! I came here on a Monday with my parents around 10:00 and the wait was only twenty minutes. They close at 2:30 and peak hours are around 10-11 on weekends, so wait times can be over an hour. It's located right near Millennium Park and there are always a ton of people waiting outside. After being seated, we were immediately served. The place was completely packed but service was still very fast! The "Signature Berry Bliss" pancakes ($10.95) came with five pancakes with a vanilla and berry sauce. Although a bit too sweet, there also were strawberries, blackberries and blueberries to compliment the flavor. We also had a skillet, which was full of sausage, tomatoes, potatoes topped with two eggs on top. Overall, I enjoyed the savory dish more as it had more flavor and variety. Not sure if I would come here again, as it is more touristy, but my parents were both very satisfied with the price and the quality of the food.

This place is worth the hour wait!
Compliments to the hosts and servers for keeping their calm and positive attitude with all the diners they deal with!
Had:  the cheese omelet - perfectly cooked, Corned Beef Benny was delish, shared the wildberry pancakes....heavenly!
Ryan L., our Wildberry tour guide/server, was super nice, funny and totally made our visit!

This was one of the places during our trip that truly lived up to the hype. The food (and the pancakes especially) are not to be missed!

Some general tips:
DOWNLOAD THE NOWAIT APP TO AVOID A LONG WAIT. The app allowed us to digitally stand in line while we were getting ready at our hotel - and then head over when there were 5 people ahead of us. We ended up waiting no more than 10 minutes (letting them know we were present and then time to get our table ready)

What we ordered:
Garden Skillet - GET THIS! Perfect dish to start your day off right. The mix of broccoli, asparagus, mushrooms and various other veggies are seasoned perfectly and served in a warm skillet that prevented the dish from getting cold. Add some hot sauce to flavor it up even more.

Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes - GET THIS! I don't think you can wrong with any of their specialty pancakes but we got their berry ones because that is what we were craving at the time.  And wow what a great decision. Fluffy pancakes, fresh berries.. SO GOOD. And only $1 extra!

Southern Benedict - very tasty, and good if you are craving something hearty. Def would order this again as well.

To top it off - service was excellent! Even though our server was attending to multiple tables, he was very attentive to ours. Can't wait to be back!

Wasn't as good as I expected.

My friends in Chicago took me here for Saturday brunch. We had to wait for like an hour, which is not really a problem cause we can walk around Millennium park. It's located on the side of the Prudential building and is always crowded.

There were many courses on the menu and it's hard to decide! With each order of a skillet comes a sub specialty pancake/crepe of your choice. I ended up having the Venetian sizzling skillet with a fresh glazed strawberries pancake. The portion is hugeee. The skillet comes with two sunny side up eggs with mixed harsh brown, tomatoes, jalapeños, and Italian sausages under. And two pancakes. Luckily I didn't order the signature Berry Bliss one cause that was wayy too sweet I can't even (I tried my friend's). In general they were all okay but not so special that we had to wait for an hour you know what I mean right?
Still the gold standard for Chicago brunch.   This place and Over Easy Cafe are the two best.

Food was amazing. Our server was so attentive. We ordered breakfast skillet, I can't remember the name of it but it was really good. There might be a wait so come in a little early. The pancake was bomb though. We killed it right away.

I live just a few blocks away and I always see a line out the door for this place. Wrongfully assumed it was because it was so great. I would say it's about as average as it gets.

Food and service wasn't bad at all, but wasn't impressive either. Foods was ok but done as ordered. Waited 45 min for a table, which normally would be fine if it was great food. OJ was tasty but that's about all I can say.

I'd skip this place in the future given all the amazing brunch spots the city has to offer.
Everything about our meals was amazing.  From the eggs to the pancakes and lemonade It exceeded our expectations!

The food was really good but not worth the 2 hour long wait. Is this place the only brunch spot in downtown Chicago? You would think it was by the wait. There is no waiting area so good luck finding a place to wait inside. My family and I barely did. Once we sat, the food and drinks were good. Wont be running back here though.

Very nice! My best friend and I went on a Sunday morning in September. The wait was super short! Only about 5-10 minutes of a wait. The staff was kind as well! I wish my food would have been a little warmer but besides that, it was good and my best friend enjoyed her food and beverage as well (I think she got some hot chocolate drink?) definitely recommend and I'll try again, hopefully I get hot food! Lol

Don't let the hype away you! While the berry bliss pancakes were delicious, they needed much more sauces, as the underlying pancake was plain. Additionally, both their meat and veggie skillets were flavorless! The spinach was whole, not chopped, there was no salt and pepper seasoning it, and it was smothered in bland cheese that congealed rather quickly. Would not recommend.
Pretty decent breakfast and lunch place. The corned beef has was just ok but the pancakes were good and the burgers were really good.

Was recommend breakfast here by my hotel bartender..so we tried it out we arrived the wait was an hour but you are able to leave you cell phone number with the hostess and they text you when your table is ready so we went across the street and took a walk around millennium park and knocked out some sight seeing as we were waiting. Once seated service was fast and excellent they defiantly know how to turn tables and still have great service. The food was excellent I had a breakfast skillet that I finished but was stuffed everyone in our party of 4 meals were awsome also will be on the list for a good reasonable priced breakfast when I'm in Chicago

pics.caption: My skillet with pancakes was legit

review.des: This place is fantastic, the only thing I didn't like was the wait time, and that the front was packed with people waiting. Otherwise, this place is awesome! Great waitress. Prices are very fair for the quality of food you get!

Wildberry is basically a much fancier IHOP, but as far as breakfast places go this is one of the best I've eaten at. The berry pancakes were amazing and the breakfast skillets are super yummy as well. Order a few things to share if you can - the portions are pretty large.

This place is amazing.  I recommend placing a reservation because the wait time is so long. I ordered the Venetian and I can say it was fantastic. It came with the greatest pancake. I was so full by the end of lunch. If you want value and a meal you won't forget. I definitely recommend this place. 10/10

#1: Signature berry bliss crepes AND #2: berry bliss pancakes. NUFF SAID! There is a long wait if your late. But that's cause it's awesome duh. If you don't want to wait, don't be a dumbass and come with 8 people on a Saturday morning at 10 am. K?
It's easier to be seated as a party of 2.

Tried eating here the first day in Chicago but there was a 45 minute wait and I was too hungry to wait.  They don't take phone or online reservations so the second day I sent my husband to put my name on the list.  There was a 1 hr and 15 minute wait but the restaurant takes your cell phone and texts you when your table is ready.  This gave me the opportunity to run some errands.  My table took a little longer than the given estimated time but once I received the text I headed down to the restaurant.  I ordered the biscuits and gravy  and it was pretty good.  My friend and I shared the red velvet French toast and it was amazing.  Overall- a great spot for breakfast, but be prepared to wait!

PRO TIP: Hit the bean (Cloud Gate) at 7am for pictures so you can get awesome pictures without anyone in it, then proceed on to Wildberry to get yo grub on. I guarantee you will not have to wait for a table this early in the morning. On weekends by 8:30/9am expect to wait anywhere from 30min to an hour to grab a table. You could also download their Nowait app to put your name on the list and then wonder around the park if you have to wait over an hour.

It's weird that I haven't Yelp'd this one as I have been here a many of many of times. Anyways, I gotta say that Wildberry is possibly one of my favorite breakfast spots in the city. Their skillets and omelettes are HUGE. I don't think I've ever been close to finishing it. Surprisingly, I have yet to actually try their specialty pancakes but I've never really been a pancake guy to be honest. I'm also a fan of their benedicts here. Probably a toss up between the corned beef & los altos (chorizo) benedicts. Service is always great no matter how slammed they are. This place is run like a well oiled machine.

That's all I got on this one. Come hungry and come early! Til next time, cheers!
Incredible. Always worth the wait for delicious, fresh brunch. I always look forward to the next visit!

I don't know if it is the location or what, but there are crazy waits for this place! I came on a rainy day, thinking that most people would be trying to avoid the rain and therefore would not be here, but I was wrong. People were packed inside and against the building trying to get inside. They told us it would be an hour and a half wait, so we left and waited for our text.

Tip: I was told you can just order to-go and eat it outside, which may make the process faster!

It is a nice restaurant, and I am guessing a lot of people come here because of that. When I tried looking for a different place nearby to go for brunch, they other options just didn't quite give that brunchy feel.

However, I can't say I was super impressed by the food. I ordered the Fresca Omelet, and it had a really nice and refreshing taste, which I enjoyed. I substituted in the Cinnamon Roll Pancakes because the pictures I saw looked so good. Unfortunately, I feel like the pancakes I got were a little messy, and the taste was not that impressive. The BF got the Venetian Skillet and it was also good, but nothing amazing.

Overall, it was a good experience and the food was good, but nothing so amazing that would justify the long wait (especially in the rain). I think that if it was a sunny day and I could just use the wait time to wander through the park I would have enjoyed myself a lot more.

pics.caption: Fresca Omelet with a side of fruit

review.des:
Heard great things about this place even prior to visiting the city. Upon arriving to the restaurant the front was packed of people waiting to be seated. They took down our name and phone number and offered to text us when it was or turn. We waited just over 20 Minutes to be seated. Shortly after our sweet smiling waitress came over to take our orders.

We ordered the Venetian Sizzlin' Skillet with a sub of specialty pancakes "signature berry bliss" and the classics eggs Benedict. I personally found the skillet slightly plain however after I seasoned it some more with salt and pepper it brought it the natural flavours of the vegetables. The hash brown beneath the toppings was very well made with the perfect crunch and saltiness. The Benedict however was slightly underwhelming as the English muffin was a bit rough, and the ham was over cooked in my opinion.
