Lastly the pancakes were tasty but as a future consideration, they could try integrating the fruits into the pancakes instead of having fruit sauces and several pieces of fruit on the side. They did however do a good job on the fluffiness of the pancakes !

Overall the staff were friendly, great environment and food was good. Would consider coming again !

pics.caption: Venetian Sizzlin' Skillets sub specialty Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes ($11.5 + $1.0)

review.des:
Was scared it might not live up to the hype but.. WOW. one of the best brunches i've had in a while. you want quality, quantity, and value? look no further! (be prepared for a little wait time though... especially weekend brunch times) (but so worth it)

Food:
Los Altos Eggs Benedict: great eggs. the hollandaise sauce was on point. the mexican flavors in the chorizo, chipotle hollandaise, spiciness... mmmm so good. i love it. never tried this kind of eggs benedict but the flavors work amazingly
Hashbrowns: comes with most items on menu. so good. crispy and seasoned well. I actually took some of the sauce from the los altos benedict that fell off and smothered it on the hashbrowns. ON POINT! felt like... animal style fries. but better.
Signature Berry Bliss pancakes: fluffy, soft, delicious pancakes and the fruitiness on top take it to the next level.

highly recommend all 3 items.
I went alone and ordered all of this. i got the los altos w/ hashbrowns and they let me order a smaller portion of the pancakes. It was either off the kids menu or as an extra (can't remember) but either way, it was still too much food and i had to pack some to take home. I honestly think that if you come with a group, some people can order their own entrees then get a side of these pancakes to share. (unless you want just pancakes. but i'm personally more of a savory guy)

Definitely in my best brunch list! Go if you are in Chicago!
I'll be back! =)
Classic tourist trap. Nothing special about the food. The staff and service is great though. I went due to the great reviews, but was disappointed

We arrived at about 12:30 Sunday afternoon; based on numerous reviews, we were prepared for a long wait, and got one:  70 minutes (still better than their original estimate of 90).  Wildberry now alerts customers that a table is ready by text message.  And there's no indoor seating for waiting customers.  Crowding ensues.  In good weather, a dash across the street to Millennium Park is a good waiting option.

Bright decor harmonizes well with the mid-century modern of the adjacent Prudential lobby, visible through the dining room windows.

Once we were seated,  our friendly waitress came along almost immediately.  We tried two items, both excellent, both perhaps too large:

- Signature Wildberry Blitz.  Five big, fluffy pancakes drizzled with berry jam and butter, powdered sugar, fresh strawberries, blueberries, and blackberries.

- Mexicana Skillet.  Choice of eggs (scrambled for me), with lots of chorizo, hash browns, cheese, avocado, jalapeños, and onions; choice of pancakes, toast, or English muffins.  (About half of this survived to become Monday's breakfast.)

Located on the ground floor of One Prudential Plaza (still known to most Chicagoans as the Prudential Building), a few hundred feet east of Michigan Avenue on Randolph.  Convenient to all bus lines on Michigan Avenue.  Three blocks from Lake station on the Red Line; two from Randolph on the Loop "L" (Brown, Green, Orange, Pink, Purple Express).  Parking nearby at the Millennium Park underground garage.

I love this place! I always have amazing food served with amazing service. It is my go to breakfast spot! Try it! You will not be disappointed... I usually get eggs Benedict, coffee, and a fresh squeezed juice!

I keep going back for the Berry Bliss pancakes. The savory items have been terrific as well. I've always had excellent service and the food has always been deliciously consistent. If you don't go early, there will be a wait but you can wait indoors if the weather is inclemate. If not, there is a coffee bar and you can sit outside and enjoy the weather. I hear there is a way to reserve a table on the yelp app, so I'll have to try that next time!

Definitely worth the 2 hour wait (on a Saturday). EVERYTHING I ordered was amazing. Make sure to try the Berry Bliss Pancakes. Use Yelp to get on the waitlist. Huge time saver and we were seated within a few minutes of what it predicted.

Wildberrys is definitely a tourist spot, with its location and seemingly endless wait. However, they have this great feature where you can wait online via yelp. I STRONGLY advise you enter the virtual line at least 2-3 hours prior to your desired eating time on the weekend. In terms of food, the red velvet French toast is tasty, but more of a dessert dish than an actual entree. We shared that at the table. I had the California Fig omelette, which I recommend! The sweetness of the fig compliments the cheese and bacon mixed in with the egg. Lastly, despite the packed restaurant and long wait, service is very fast. Food came out within 20 minutes. The main reason they lost a star was due to the underestimated wait time of the virtual yelp line.

Place is very crowded and they get you to the seating area 20 minutes earlier then you need to.
Pancakes were good and service was fine. Surprised to find it rated so high. Reminded me of an overprice IHOP

This breakfast joint was good but way overhyped. Super long wait and pretty standard breakfast food. If an IHOP omelette and a Wildberry Pancakes omelette were both in front of me I'm not sure I'd be able to tell a difference between the two.
This is my Favorite breakfast spot in Chicago. If you're ever in Chicago please make it your business to stop by and your stomach will be blessed.

My family of four walked over for late breakfast Saturday at 12:35 PM. They said the wait was 90 minutes, but they would text us when the table was ready. I gave them my mobile number.

We walked across the street to Millennium Park and waited. And waited. And waited.  

It's Sunday night... and we are still waiting.

This place survives on a continuous flow of naive tourists. Go elsewhere!
This place was amazing!!!  We visited the bean while we waited.  We recieved a text that it was time to be seated.  I then had the beat omelet i ever had!!!  Great service as well!!

I went here while visiting Chicago the place is nice and big. the food was good but not great i had an omelette and wildberry pancakes. The service was great, also be prepared to wait even on weekdays this place gets packed! i waited about 15 minutes. The coffee was average the orange juice wasn't good.Overall a good spot ill be back.

After waiting 2 hours to get in to Wildberry my experience only got worse! Besides the serve's lack of knowledge of the menu, my food had 3 short black hairs in it! Oscar had my order remade which also came back wrong! With that long of a wait, reputation and the high prices I was expecting much better at least from a customer service stand point. I would not recommend and will never be going back! Try Sweet Waters or Nutella around the corner. They they put this place to shame!

Saw all the yelp reviews for this place so I knew i had to check it out when I was in Chicago. I guess I didn't realize HOW popular this place would be. I had to wait for about 45 minutes for a table for two, but they have a pretty convenient system going on where they can text you once they have a table ready for you. In that wait period I just explored the park across the street, so it wasn't so bad. Despite it being CRAZY busy, the waiter was really friendly and accommodating. I ordered one of their Sizzlin' Skillets which comes with hash browns, eggs, cheese, meat, veggies. The skillets also come with pancakes and I upgraded for a speciality pancake so that I can try the Berry Bliss pancakes. Everything was so delicious and filling. I highly recommend getting what I ordered - I also asked the waiter to see what choices were most popular. So happy I got a chance to eat here whilst visiting Chicago!

pics.caption: signature berry bliss pancakes (came as a side with skillet)

review.des:
Wildberry Cafe most definitely deserve their near 5 star rating.

My friends and I visited after exploring Millennium Park one afternoon and there was absolutely no wait! I've read that the wait time can get really long so definitely try visiting on a weekday.

I ordered the Venetian Skillet (includes hash browns, cheddar & jack cheese, eggs, sausages, bell peppers, onions and tomatoes) and for $1.50 more, you can opt for any specialty pancake. Their Signature Berry Bliss pancakes are to die for! It's fluffy, soft, and no requires no extra syrup! Well worth, delicious, and the portions are very generous! I do recommend sharing though because the food can get pretty heavy / oily and I barely finished half of my order. I'd love to go back to sample more of their pancakes!

pics.caption: Butcher Block, Venetian, and Homemade Corned Beef Hash Skillet + "Signature Berry Bliss" pancakes

review.des: Was recommended this place by a friend who said they had the best pancakes and he didn't lie! Not only are they fluffy but melt in your mouth good! I got the cinnamon roll pancakes and they were delicious! I also got the Mexicana skillet and it was so good but the portions were huge so I didn't get to finish it. Over all an amazing place with terrific service and food!

The wait was two hours on a Sunday morning. I'm glad you can put your name on the list through Yelp. The service was relatively quick, regarding how full the place was. I had a garden skillet. It was good but missing flavors - had to fix it with salt, pepper, and ketchup. The pancakes were awesome - recommend to try them.

When planning our trip to Chicago, we asked friends for recommendations on food and things to do. This place was recommended multiple times so decided to give it a shot. A lot of online reviews say it's huge tourist place and they're undoubtedly correct but it doesn't even matter, it was sooo good. The wait is no joke but my husband found online we could use the NoWait app and I HIGHLY recommend that. When got in line while we were still at the hotel and when we did show up, we only had to hang out for a few minutes before receiving our text. Service was quick and efficient once inside. We ordered cinnamon roll French toast with a side of corn beef hash, signature berry bliss waffle with an egg and side of bacon. Everything was sooo dang good. The vanilla berry latte was delicious too. Definitely a treat of a brunch and I'm really glad we tried it.

Wait can be long but it's worth it. Come early if you're in a group. I came alone and its was 30 mins in the snow/rain which felt like an eternity.

They have good system down where you get a text 5 mins before the table is ready. Service is quick and food comes out faster than expected.

I got the Florentine Benedict and a side of the berry pancakes with a cup of coffee.

Pancakes could be more moist but definitely had flavor. I like ricotta pancakes the best and which they had it on the menu. All pancakes should have ricotta dammit.

Benedict was on point. Huge serving with a nicely poached egg on top. I think I was actually missing an egg because the second muffin had remnants of egg white. I was digging through it like Indiana Jones searching for treasure and after tearing apart the entire thing, I resembled a oversized child with a plate full of mush. What a futile attempt for egg yolk.

I may come back and make another mess on my next visit.
Amazing food! Although they were busy, it was a short wait and some of the best breakfast food in Chicago. It's a MUST.

One of my favorite brunch restaurants in Chicago. I really enjoy the atmosphere, the food, the beverages and the location. The pancakes with variety of toppings are my favorite. The portions are just amazing, fulfilling. It is highly recommended place for brunch and lunch. The only downside is the wait time, you need to plan to wait at least one and a half hours.
Solid go-to breakfast spot. Big portions. Creative and delicious pancakes. Their omelets and scrambles are very flavorful and yummy. Great spot to take out of town guests.

Seriously one of the best breakfast joints I've been to! Do yourself a priceless favor and download "No wait" app on your phone before coming here. It will literally cut your wait time in half. I basically got there and was seated right away! Sorry but not sorry. Definitely order a skillet - we tried the garden skillet and the butchers block skillet. You can add pancakes to your order, the signature berry bliss is SO good. The banana pancakes was nothing out of the ordinary. Having a sweet and savory dish together is delicious! This restaurant is bookmarked on my page and will definitely come back again when visiting Chicago.

This is a top 5 breakfast stop in Chicago. Worth the wait! The waitlist system integrated with Yelp is spot on. Service and staff is top notch. A balanced menu with something for everyone. Will be back!

PREPARE TO WAIT!!! I'm only giving a 4 due to the wait to be seated.

TIP: use the waitlist option on Yelp, b4 you decide to go. The app will tell you what time the current wait is (in my case 95-120 mins) and what time to arrive by. Save me! I only had to wait 5 mins b4 being seated.

The food was well worth the wait and comes out quickly...I think I need to change my rating to a 5! Lol They offer very large portions and the food was scrumptious!

pics.caption: Caramel Apple Pecan Belgium Waffle!!! Yes!! It was everything! The pecans are candied, I got the apples on the side, just perfect!
Hot Apple Cider...looks much better than it tasted ): I'd stick to Starbucks

review.des: The breakfast and service was great. The Mexican skillet was flavorful and I got pancakes as my accompaniment. Lots of food for the price.
The wait was crazy but worth it. Didn't think I could finish the berry blitz but the pancakes were so light and fluffy it was pretty easy. No charge for extra whip cream. I like that!

pics.caption: Berry blitz with Whip cream of course

review.des: Loved this place! It's been so long since I've had pancakes so I forgot how yummy they were and Wildberry exceeded my expectations. We had the Berry Pancakes and the Banana Cream Pie Pancakes and they were both to die for. The service was very sweet to follow the theme. There were other dishes besides pancakes that we observed around us but we decided to keep it classic and just divulge in some batter baked heaven. Highly recommend this place to anyone with a sweet tooth or in need of some breakfast from morning till afternoon!

pics.caption: Delicious berry and banana cream pie pancakes!

review.des: WONDERFUL cute little breakfast place on Maxwell! Went in the morning with friends and while prices seem steep, I promise you the portions are large and soooo tasty! It's definitely worth the almost $15 for the pancakes. Perfect for a sunny spring morning and a group of friends! Staff is friendly and explains dishes well!
Well worth the wait. Used the waitlist from yelp and easily coordinated the morning wait of 120+ people ahead of us.
Great breakfest great people, next to the Ritz and people are down to earth. Will be back again

Pancakes are by nature, pretty bland. They all sort of conform to the same tastes and are usually not that interesting. I can no longer say that after trying them here. The fluffy perfection created here has the right touch of sweetness and light fluffy texture that has never been experienced by myself of my companions.

Most of the breakfast foods give you an option to have a carb partner and while i normally get toast, all the yelp reviews SCREAMED pancakes. I got a side of the berry bliss for a small up charge with my skillet and they were glorious. The sauce they put on top meant that syrup was not necessary (at least for me, you can do whatever you want :P). The perfect notes of berry on the pancakes could only be described as dreams. They tasted like how dreams taste like.

As for my skillet, I got poached eggs on mine and they were WAY overcooked. No runny yolk, no bueno. 100% would come back

Sidenote: Lines are MASSIVE on the weekend. You can join the waitlist on yelp during the weekends (up to 2 hours) but the lines are also pretty long on the days to and for that, you are going to need to download the nowait app. Make everyone who didn't do it watch in jealousy as you walk right in after they have been told the wait will be 30 minutes.

This place is SO good and so efficient! Being able to check in on the app is actually so helpful so you don't have to spend an hour waiting in the restaurant - you can just show up a little before your check in time and get seated soon. The waiters are all so nice and they move so fast - but I personally never felt rushed to finish my food or anything. It's like they work fast around you but you can take your time with your food. Would definitely recommend, just be aware of the wait and plan ahead, and you should be fine :)

This place has actually become a bit of a chicago institution.  The space is huge, and yet it's always packed in the late mornings (even on Wednesday when we went the first time).  On weekends you can expect a wait of about 45 minutes at 9 am and 2 hours at 10 am.

The berry bliss pancake (their namesake) is a must-try and can be tacked on as a side to pretty much anything else on their menu.  The pancakes are nice and fluffy but the berry sauce made it somewhat on the sweet side to me.  If you try their cinnamon roll pancake though, that one is far sweeter (i.e. far too sweet).

They also have some creative brunch items that have all tasted pretty good to me - the los altos benedict, venetian skillet and corned beef hash were all pretty decent options that I have tried.   Also, their omelets are done correctly - they have their ingredients mixed with the egg rather than folded in an egg sandwich.

Very good breakfast/brunch spot. My wife & I were in town just for the weekend solely to hang out. Found this place based on the strength of reviews. After reading the reviews, we woke up early to eliminate the wait. At 9am on Sunday, the wait was 20-25 mins but by the time we were done the wait was over an hour.

Friendly server, lots of menu selections, good place for families. I ordered a butcher block scramble and upgraded to Red Velvet french toast. Wife ordered an omelet and upgraded to Cinnamon Roll pancakes.

The French Toast and pancakes were AMAZING. I don't usually order french toast at restaurants because I like my own, however, the red velvet was an awesome find. The scramble and omelet were just ok, in my opinion. Not the worst, but I've had better (remember, it's called Wild berry Pancakes).

It's definitely a place I would go back to, but next time I'll stick to the pancakes and/or french toast.

pics.caption: Butcher Block Scramble and Red Velvet French Toast.

review.des: SO WORTH THE WAIT!!!! Went on a sunday, was crazy busy but It was so worth it. Service was amazing, portions were large and food was hot and yummy!!!!

My boys have a friend who told them this was the must-try place for breakfast in Chicago. I am a huge breakfast/brunch fan. So while we visited Chicago, we went to Wildberry.

The wait was about 45 minutes. And then we did quite a bit more waiting after we were seated. It was crowded and pretty loud. The tables are very close together, but we luckily got one at the end.

The orange juice was delicious. The pancakes were even better. I had the Fresca omelette and it was very good. The hash browns were average. Pancakes come with the meal, so I upgraded from the traditional to Banana Cream Pie pancakes. So good!

Overall it was a good experience and I would definitely go back. A little pricey for breakfast, but not too bad.

pics.caption: Side of Banana Cream Pie pancakes

review.des: There's a reason there was an 80 minute wait, the food is amazing!  We went here on a trip to Chicago on a Saturday for brunch.  Put our name on the wait list from the Yelp app.  We got egg skillets and omelettes each with a side of pancakes.  The whole meal was worth the wait!  I would highly recommend this place to visitors or locals.

pics.caption: Mexicana Skillet with a side of Signature Berry Bliss pancakes

review.des: These pancakes are really delicious and the staffs are really friendly. But the place is always has a waitlist which makes it more exclusive but in the end a good place to go and have delightful Breakfast food

Just spectacular. Great variety and great taste. 4 of us ate for $56. Pancakes, skillets, omelette - all of it was really good. Atmosphere was nice too, and the service was friendly and efficient. No regrets at all.

I grew up making homemade crepes with my father. Best crepes ever so I don't usually have high expectations at restaurants. I was proven wrong today, I absolutely loved the special berry crepes.  Not too sweet, flavored with cream and Fresh berries. Out of this world.  Added bacon side for extra protein, thick slices perfectly cooked. The drip coffee was really good too. Great place. Highly recommend. Well deserved 5 stars. Oh and they have gluten free pancakes too. It brought me back to Memories as a child.
Pricey but definitely worth it!  Some of their dishes are enough for 2 people to share. The skillets are fantastic.
Not bad food. I was excited to try the pancakes, but was left feeling they were not more delicious than ordinary pancakes. The service was very nice. Reasonable prices.

ONE OF MY FAVORITE BRUNCH SPOTS IN THE CITY! The signature berry pancakes are absolutely to die for. There is always a huge wait, but it is totally worth it. It is in a great location so you can explore the bean and that area if you want to make the wait go by faster. I brought all of my friends here who were in the city, and they all loved it. I would recommend this place to anyone who wants an amazing breakfast. Note: they do not sell booze-- but that is my only complaint.

Easy to see why the wait times at this restaurant are usually upwards of 2 hours!! People come from near and far to enjoy this amazing restaurant.
The Wait...if you just arrive expecting to walk in, that's probably not going to happen unless you're there when the doors open at 6:30am. They do make it easy to check-in online with an easy to use app that tells you what time you should arrive. Once you arrive and check in with the outside hostess, you'll receive 2 text messages. You have 5 minutes to see the inside hostess before your name is removed from the list. There is still a slight wait once inside, but it's definitely better than walking up and putting your name on the list.
The food....amazing!!! I ordered The Mexican skillet and my friend ordered The Butcher Block skillet, both of which came with pancakes. The skillets were delightful and enough that we could have shared instead of ordering separates. The pancakes....oh my word. So fluffy and perfectly flavored, just great! I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone and if I'm ever in Chicago again, I'm definitely eating here again!!

Decided to stop by on my visit to Chicago. The place seemed really busy, but we were able to get a table in a short amount of time (about 20mins). The service is quick and friendly. I can see why a lot of people have breakfast here. The pancakes are to die for, they compete with the likes of Millbrae pancake House in the bay area one of my favorite places to have brunch at. The hash brown and omelette that I ordered where also on point. Will stop by again, when ever I go back to Chicago

pics.caption: Look at the hash brown on point

review.des:
In town on business. Another kind reviewer mentioned the nowait app and that was a good call. Downloaded it, hopped in line and walked down from my hotel and got a seat. No waiting at all

The food is amazing. I'll leave it at that. If you're not sure where to go, the answer is here. You go here.

Heard so much about Wildberry and knew there would be a wait at this popular place even on a Wednesday morning. We were put on the wait list and used NO WAIT app as suggested. After 40 minutes we received a message that our table was ready. Except that it was not. We were told to wait in the teeny entrance area that was jam packed with customers and our name would be called. We asked if we could please wait outside because there was no place to stand. We were told "no." A horrible manager then yelled at us when we were standing in the only available space we could find. 20 minutes later we were seated. Terrible, terrible service. My only question: why did we put up with this abuse? Food was good, but definitely not worth the shabby treatment we received.

pics.caption: Wait in crowded conditions and get yelled at by this rude manager.

review.des: Disclaimer: portions are extremely generous. Pancakes, fresh orange juice and hash browns were phenomenal and waitstaff was quite friendly. Arrived at 9:20 and was seated at 10:05; would recommend adding contact information to waitlist electronically through Yelp prior to arrival. Note that wait time is still lengthy on weekdays.

I went with my father for his birthday for the first time, the food was great. The staff was friendly and the prices are affordable. They are handicap accessible which I love being that my father has MS. There was a 20 minute wait but it was worth it.

Worth the wait!! Get on the Yelp wait list though, don't try to get in without being on the list. We went on a Saturday morning and the wait was over two hours. They stay pretty true to your check in time.

The food was AMAZING! Hard to choose, so we each got something and then shared so we could try more.

The only feedback I'd give to Wildberry is to stick to your rule of a table being let go to the next party if you don't check in within 5 minutes of the text. We were texted and went to the desk, however someone came in after us and was seated before us even though they were outside the 5 minute windows. So, that party was rewarded for being late and our party was penalized for being on time.

Our experience at Wildberry was excellent! I read the reviews and couldn't wait to go there for brunch. There were 4 of us and we had a 30 min wait. It is in such a good place that we went over to the bean and hung out until they texted us (so the wait was not an inconvenience). Once seated our waitress was delightful. The berry bliss pancakes are very popular so had to try them. The nice thing is when u order an egg dish u can substitute 2 berry bliss pancakes for hash browns. The bliss pancakes have mascarpone on them which we opted to have served on the side. Glad we did bc we r not a fan of it. The food was plentiful and delicious. This is a restaurant you should try when I. Chicago. You won't be disappointed!

I give the three stars because it doesn't live up to the hype. Even after using the get in line app and receiving a text that my table was ready, I still waited and extra 10 mins. They seemed a little snooty and cared more about turning tables then customer service. Nothing wrong with the food but definitely not anything out of this world. So many places to choose from in Chicago, not sure if I'll make this stop again.

pics.caption: Looks amazing but honestly it was very plain.

review.des:
This is by far one of the best breakfast joints I've been to. The raspberry white chocolate mocha was amazing... I'd come back just for that! For brunch I had the Los Altos Benedict and I substituted the chorizo foe turkey sausage... so amazing!! Across the table my friend had the Mexicana skillet which he loved.

Great sized portions and great service. Looking forward to coming back!!

Sign up for the wait list while you're at home and then show up when you get the text! Saves a ton of wait time.

pics.caption: Los Altos Benedict and Mexicana Skillet

review.des: Overall, a great breakfast place! The restaurant is huge and was very busy around 9am. However, the service was still fast and our food came out within 15-20 minutes of placing the order. I had the buttermilk pancakes which were so fluffy and buttery. I also had the Mexicana sizzlin skillet which was so good. It had literally everything in it along with some spice. The portion sizes are very large and definitely shareable. Definitely making my way make here when I visit Chicago again!

Love this place! It gets crazy busy so definitely use the No Wait app.

I really like the Rutherford omelet because I love goat cheese. It also comes with hashbrowns or fruit AND toast or pancakes, and you can sub the pancakes for the specialty pancakes. I like both savory and sweet in my breakfast so this is a great way to get the best of both worlds.

Overall I really like this place, the service is always good as is the food.

Omg!  Amazing.   I'm going back next time I Visit Chicago.  Get the special.   "SIGNATURE BERRY BLISS" The pancakes where so soft fluffy and not too sweet like you would think they would be.  It was very busy we arrived at 615am.  At 6:30am it opened and it was all heaven tip the time we left. By the time we left 1hr later on a Tuesday morning at 7:30am there was at least a 30min wait at the door and the place was completely full.

pics.caption: Arrive early or wait in long lines
Amazing coffee... got one to go too

review.des: Touristy, but very very good. I enjoy the rosemary in their gravy. The cinnamon roll pancakes are an easy favorite.
Everything was delicious! Great service. A deff must try it's the los altos egg Benedicts and the Nutella with banana crepes.
YUMMMMM! The pancakes here are so fluffy and full of life. Although its kind of expensive for breakfast the portion sizes are huge and can splut almost anything on the menu.

AMAZING! We tried this out for brunch on our last day in Chicago and seriously regretted not trying it sooner! There was no wait when we went but they were definitely busy. The service was still very fast. My wife got the cinnamon roll pancakes and I got the corned beef hash! Both were sooo good and the portions were huge at a decent price! I would definitely eat here again!

This touristy breakfast spot did not disappoint! Not bad of a walk on a nice summer day.

We had the corn-beef hash which was delicious and not too heavy and the berry pancakes that were out of this world! Go for the pancakes over the toast option and upgrade to a specialty pancake!

Use the yelp waitlist before you go. We only waited 5 minutes when we got there because we got on the waitlist prior to walking over if not the wait can be up to 2 hours!!

Found my favorite pancake place in Chicago. Yippeee!!! Yes the wait time is ridiculously long but is it worth it? Heck yes it is! I will absolutely be back next time I visit Chicago! Get the cinnamon roll pancakes and the banana cream pie ones are glorious too!!!

The reviews were compelling but the long queues kept me away in the past. Up early, I decided I would give Wildberry a try. Arriving at 7am, I breezed through to a table. My server promptly pointed out the specials and made some recommendations. I settled on a Butcher Skillet with a side of Pumpkin pancakes. Definitely too much for one person, but I powered through determined not to leave a crumb of pancake on the plate! The skillet was moreish - a carnivores delight topped with a runny egg! Star of the show was most certainly the pumpkin pancakes - so good that I may even tolerate the long wait the next time!

pics.caption: Skillet with pumpkin pancakes and bottomless hazelnut filter coffee

review.des: After a very long wait....we all had an incredible breakfast/lunch. From the Napa Valley Fig Omelette to Strawberry Lemon French Toast - everything was delicious.

pics.caption: Long wait. 1 1/2 hours...texting system for notification which is good. Then you cue up in line that is so unorganized

review.des:
The only thing I can really say that the other 5k 5 star reviews haven't said is - definitely used the nowait app so you don't have to spend 2 hours waiting in line. When we first checked in, there were 298 parties ahead of us. If you're from out of town, check in online, then an hour before you're arrival time head down and your millennium park. The best morning

The salsa is sooooo much better than you'd expect from a Midwest cafe. Really underrated and a great complement to a pretty good breakfast burrito.

The berry bliss pancakes is an absolute must. Only $1.50 substitute for a different side. Way better than other sides.

Order way more than you can actually eat and split it with the guys at your table. I love the skillets.

Red velvet is delicious as well!
Very good, cinnamon toast was awesome. Service was great. Just need more maple syrup! Maybe put some on the table? Only tiny little jars are provided. Other than this was a great place!

Pros: good service, a good number of pancake options though I don't think they were THAT mind blowing, fast and smart wait system compared to the insanity they need to handle, fair prices, huge portions.

Cons: just standard American food! Eh. Commercial mall restaurant aesthetic with no windows or view (so why such a long line for a waste of prime Parkside real estate?!), pretty un flavorful garden skillet, wildberry oj tastes like punch.

Compared to other options for brunh in Chicago, not worth the wait!

Overall, it delivered what it promised (some food) but I would never wait in line for this again.
Best brunch in the city of Chicago hands down. There's always an hour wait on weekends but it's 100% worth it.

We were here recently for breakfast while on a trip to Chicago.  Placed was packed.  We were able to give our phone number and walk over to the beam for pictures and when we were on our way back we received a text that our table was ready.

Food was delicious and service was quick and fast.  I ordered the cinnamon pancakes and they were the best I had.  My entire party loved the place.

Fabulous breakfast and location.  Kids loved the waffles and pancakes but the hot chocolate was the biggest hit!  I had the southern Benedict.  This Southerner did not love. Too much of some strange spice that tasted off.  Fennel maybe?  Anyway, also had one of the scrambles, which was delicious.  Big portions make sharing easy.  And after breakfast, we walked to Milennium for ice skating.  Can also easily walk to Maggie Daley park.
A superb breakfast!  Don't miss the signature wild berry pancakes!  The espanol omelette was spicy and delicious!  Portions were large I could have split it!

Wow. Worth the wait! My mom and I waited about 1 hour, but they grab your phone number so we went and saw the bean and came back! Get any of the skillets, they are amazing!! So much food for a good price.
Good food, long wait even after using pre check in. Order chai tea got coffee, drank it without saying anything. A little pricey for breakfast

Delicious food and great service, very understanding of the one hour lunch break I had. I love the cinnamon roll pancakes with the create your own omelette with spinach, feta cheese, and onion. Their lattes are amazing. I highly recommend them and they also use Nowait, the app that places you in line when you're away from the restaurant which is very helpful to me.

After a previous attempt on a Monday weeks before, me and my cousin decided to come here on a Thursday am to try this breakfast place out after seeing so many good ratings on yelp. Parking meters around this are insane and what can be more insane is how long you could be waiting if you come here late! I do give them credit for how fluffy the pancakes are and the butcher block skillet also good; however, the Slow roast brisket skillet lacked flavor in the brisket and I guess I expected more flavor from their Signature berry bliss pancake and unfortunately the oreo Smores pancake and the cinnamon French toast wasn't any better! Prices are decent for portion.Service took awhile so I honestly felt grateful that I wasn't one of the crazy customers who was willing to waiting almost an hour or so just to get seated ...
Best pancakes ever!! I had an opportunity to visit this establishment while in town for the weekend.  The pancakes were the highlight of our trip.  I can't wait to return.

Best brunch spot ever! Usually I'm a bottomless brunch kinda girl but this is the exception to my brunching ways. Amazing food with unique flavor combinations! Not only is the food amazing but the portions are crazy big too, only finished half of everything! Would totally recommend this place, just be prepared to wait since it is pretty popular and they don't take reservations unfortunately.

Waited 75 mins on a Sunday morning.....kind of expected...would definitely use the nowait app next time before I even show up

Southern benedict 2/5 very salty~ the egg was cooked, the biscuit was so dry that it's falling apart, the hash brown that came with it was tasteless....I had to add lots of salt and pepper to it

Oreo smoothie 3/5 small for its price nothing special

I barely finished half of my food...packed the rest and gave it to the homeless...I would come back and give it another try before I say no forever to this place but from what I had today...I'm not wasting my tummy space

What a great place for breakfast!  Coffee is very good- smooth and great flavor.  We had Eggs, bacon, hash browns, egg sandwich and pancakes.  Even had gluten free pancakes.  All were very good.  Fresh, great flavors.  The service was excellent!  Definitely would eat here again!

Most importantly, they have good coffee.  They serve Intelligentsia, which is far better than your average diner coffee.  Huge menu.  The food seems all really high quality.  Not the most creative food ever, but really generous portions and really tasty.  

This place definitely gets busy, so I do recommend getting your name on the list ahead of time.  Or if you have time, go get your name on the list and walk around Millennium Park.
Delicious !!! The wait is the worst but the good is so great. There are only two locations i think,  so if you're downtown, make sure to stop in the food really is the best.

This place is hands down the best breakfast place in Chicago! We got breakfast here on our last day and I am sad we didn't discover it sooner. The mushroom omelet is out of this world! Hands down the best one I have ever had. The pancakes were perfect and fluffy. The staff was so friendly and entertaining! This is a can't miss in Chicago!

Fantastic food!
I really enjoy this place for breakfast, the only down side is everyone already knows this and the wait can be crazy long. Go as early as possible!
This place is awesome! Great food! Excellent service! Used the app to add ourselves to the wait list. Coming back tomorrow!

We love this place highlight of our Chicago stay. Everything is great all the time. Wait is long but worth it. I got Eggs Benedict and my husband had an omelet. My kids had Berry Bliss Pancakes, so good!

Oh my deliciousness! We tried the seasonal lemon poppyseed pancakes and cinnamon roll french toast...and well, they were both a ton of food! Saturday morning wait was 1-1.5hrs but this place is right across from millennium park to kill that time easily. It was worth it! They have limited outdoor seating, too.

Got a gift certificate here and stopped by on a sunday morning. We were able to use the "NoWait" app to get in line on our way there on the train, which requires you to be 5 miles away or less to get in line. Were quoted about a 140 min wait so we were able to shop and walk around before hand. It appears there's no reason to stop by to "check in" until you get the text saying your table is ready soon. Then go right in to the host stand.
Our wait overall was quite long but the app kept us updated. I highly recommend just using the app if you want to go here!
We were seated in a half table half booth in close proximity to other 2-tops. The service wasn't very personal but good enough. Clearly everyone was running like crazy on the busy sunday morning.
Got the signature berry bliss crepes. They were delicious and a huge portion. I could see, via my close table neighbors, that with the crepes you get way more filling to carb ratio compared to the pancakes or french toast, which was preferable to me. Berries were very fresh and tasty.
My friend got the chicken and waffles. He enjoyed it but was shocked at how spicy the jalapeno waffles were, and he's a spicy food fan. We shared some hash browns but honestly don't waste your time- bland and not worth the calories.
I think this place is worth it for a huge tasty brunch if you can be out enjoying the day while you wait the excessive amount of time. Totally in no way worth waiting 2 hours just sitting there idly.

Impossible to get to this place.  Tried three days in the row and it was impossible.  The only thing I can provide opinion is about the coffee to go!!! Really good!!! Only reason went three days because was close to the hotel and because the coffee beans used are from a good brand from CALI, otherwise not worthy to wait for a table to eat pancakes.

Usually you can avoid the line if you get here before 9:00, so it's great for breakfast meetings.  Huge portions of delicious food at great prices, and they have awesome coffee.  If you come in the late morning or afternoon, there's usually an hour plus wait.

I highly recommend the Mexicana Skillet.  It's usually enough food for two meals, and the avocado and cheese are delicious.  The pancakes are also delicious.

Service could usually be better because the servers usually have a large number of tables to cover, but they're usually very friendly and hard-working.

This is hands down the best breakfast/brunch place ever!!! I did read reviews ahead of time that mentioned the wait can be up to 2 hours and they weren't kidding. Luckily, while I was in the hotel, I put my place in line through the NoWait App. It's definitely a time saver and by the time I got to the place I was first in line. The line was unbelievable. Prepare to wait or take my suggestion and download the NoWait App. The food was absolutely amazing. The service was top notch. Everyone was on board as a team and even with being so busy, they were always on top. If I could give them a 10 out of 5 I would. I definitely, definitely recommend!

Hands down - best pancakes I've ever had (opinion of a foodie visiting from out of town). It has got the taste and texture. Be it the signature pancake or the buttermilk classic pancake , they both deserve a try for they have similar texture but different unique tastes. Some restaurants just change toppings and call it a blueberry pancake but I reckon that Wildberry does their homework and tries to come up with different taste made from different barter. Not just the pancake, other stuffs there are fantastic. I tried their Mexicana something and it was perfect. Perfectly cooked and the meat portion was generous. I tried my friend's steak something and it was so well cooked too. Wonderful Wildberry pancakes ! Would totally come again if I visit from out of town.

This place gets super packed real fast so either make a reservation or be prepared to wait. My friends and I didn't have one so we had to wait about half an hr. We ordered chocolate chip pancakes, signature berry pancakes, signature berry crepe, side of bacon and corned beef hash. Everything was yummy!!! The corned beef hash was just okay though. I wouldn't order it again if I came back here. The portions are big and this definitely put us all in a food coma!

Waited more than two hrs but my experience here had made it worth the wait! I was impressed with the wonderful service and the food was amazing. We had eggs benedict and wildberry pancake. Both were very flavorful and huge portions. Will def highly recommend this place

All the reviews about how great this place is are spot on.  The food, the service, great!

Florence Benny - spinach, bacon, poached eggs, super fresh fluffy english muffins, hollandaise, with either hash browns or fruit

Hash Benny - with corned beef hash

Butcher Block Skillet - layers of hash browns, cheese, meats, & eggs.  It came with a side of pancakes so we upgraded to:

Cinnamon Roll pancakes - sogood!  Cinnamony, sugary, salty, fluffy carb goodness

Ok people - all the warnings about the long waits - stop this madness & get with the times - use the NoWait app to get in line from home or wherever you are.  It shows you what position you are in line & it counts down.  Then you get a text when you're up and you have 5 mins to get to the front.  

This place allows you to use the app for parties of 4 or less.

Because all this food was so worth coming for.  But I dunno if any place is worth waiting 1 hr and 45 mins!!

Yummmyyy, nap time now hehe

pics.caption: Meaty cheesy eggy Butcher Block skillet : )

review.des:
The first time I was in Chicago, we saw a gigantic crowd of people sitting outside waiting for their party to be called.

The second time, I wised up and headed over early on a Saturday morning.  Actually it wasn't even that early - we arrived around 8:30ish and got called in 15 minutes later (we were told the wait would be about 30-45 minutes).

We were seated inside, and service was great.  I ordered the short rib hash, which WAS SO GOOD - I really liked that it wasn't very salty, and I didn't even have to add any sort of hot sauce to give it flavor.  The portion was HUGE - we actually didn't eat anything until 8 PM later that day.

I opted for the Wildberry pancake upgrade, and it was just meh - kiiind of tasted like artificial syrupy berries with that bitterness, so I just had a bite or two and then left it.

Overall a great breakfast - I wouldn't wait longer than 30 minutes for it, so get there early (or put your name on the waitlist online).  The good part about their waitlist is that they text you when your table is ready, so you can always wander around the neighborhood (it's right next to the Bean if you want to play tourist and snap a photo).
Really good food! Kind of a long wait and some of the seating is close together  but, overall, the pancakes were amazing!
The food is simply amazing. In heaven!  TheBerry bliss pancakes are pure love. Service was great. I will definitely come to back to this place.
Pancakes were amazing!! I also had an omelette very good! The wait was pretty long 2 hours.  But did some sightseeing during that time.  But it was well worth it. Our server was also amazing!!

Must-have breakfast in Chicago! I had the Venetian skillet with the granola & berry pancakes on the side. I typically enjoy a hearty breakfast but felt obligated to try the pancakes and I'm glad I did. It's A LOT of food - probably could split with someone. Service was great, our waters were never empty! The wait was about 20-30 mins at 8:30am on a Saturday. A local friend said she once waited 2.5 hours. If visiting, I suggest getting an early start by stopping at Millennium Park around 7:30-8am while it's still pretty empty, then heading over to Wildberry for breakfast before the rush.

This is probably the 2nd best place I went to in Chicago. I love breakfast food, and when I saw that it was only a 5 minute walk from where I was staying I had to check this place out. I went here on a Saturday and waited around 45 minutes. Since I was staying nearby I was able to put my name down then walked back to my place. There is plenty of outdoor seating, which I highly recommend when it is sunny. You get to see the north end of the park and the hustle and bustle going on Michigan Street. The restrooms are clean and well maintained. Inside the decor is bright with a lot of windows letting natural light in.

The food here was top notch. On the menu, they claim to have the best pancakes in Chicago. I decided to get a Denver skillet. The portions were pretty big. The skillet came in hot and tasty. The eggs were fresh, and the bell peppers tasted as if they were cut five minutes ago. With getting the skillet, you have a choice to add hash browns and pancakes. I decided to splurge a bit and try their Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes. I am very picky about my pancakes, and these were so good it would probably be in the top 5 best pancakes that I've ever had. It was that good. The pancake was not overcooked, but soft, and the berry spread made the pancake perfectly sweet. The berries just put the "cherry" on top of it. Overall, this was a lot of food, so you better come here with an appetite!

The service here was pretty good. I was waiting for my friend to come and despite that they still seated me. I highly recommend trying this place out, especially if you like eating breakfast food. To avoid the long wait, I highly suggest coming in early or before they close. It was a good way to start the day before checking out the bean.
I love the atmosphere here. Great place to be. I enjoy coming here Sunday mornings.
Lovely place, good food and friendly service but the wait...was tiresome.  It was 1:15 when we got there. They even recommended a different location.  Consider upsizing
Long, long wait, but OH!! the wait was worth it. I would suggest getting the omelet (WOW) that comes with the pancakes, best of both worlds. I will return...

Great place for a Sunday brunch. Their pancakes are simply amazing.
The seasonal hot apple cider was awesome!

Delicious place to have breakfast at! This place worked out perfect for us the wait was about 2 1/2 hours long so we took advantage of this and visited Millennium park. I'd recommend doing the same that's if you aren't too hungry. I had the Mexicana skillet which was amazing although I only had one slice of avocado but other than that it was flavorful and just right. For my side I had the cinnamon roll French toast I'd definitely recommend these to and cinnaholics our there I loved them! I was able to nibble on my girlfriends breakfast as well she had the Butcher skillet which has different type of sausages personally I'd go with the mexicana skillet don't get me wrong it wasn't bad but I feel like mine was better. For her side she got the Berry bliss pancakes which were toe 2 toe with my French toast but obviously I'm a cinnaholic so I would still stick to the cinnamon roll French toast the next time I come back.
Food was very good. Had eggs bacon fruit and cinnamon pancakes which I really liked. Everyone in our group liked their food. I recommend using the app to check in because the lines can be very long.
Really good breakfast/brunch option with all the expected plates. The pankakes are particularly good.

One of the best places to try breakfast items. We tried a lot of things including classic eggs benedict, veggie omelet, veggie burger and chicken panini wrap. In the dessert, their signature berry bliss pancake is the best. They serve fresh orange juice, which is amazing. Also, I tried their strawberry vanilla smoothie which was so refreshing. Overall, I loved everything there and I feel the initial wait of around 1-2hours is worth it.

We came here for brunch on a recent visit to the city for the weekend.  We used the "no wait" app and when we got our text we headed to the restaurant from the hotel around the corner.  We actually did wait another 15 minutes once we checked in there but I guess that wasn't so bad since the line was out the door!  It was a fairly nice, but cold sunny day and they were checking people in at a hostess stand outside near the door - they probably should have posted a sign somewhere because we saw a number of people come in, wait in line to get to desk only to be told to check in outside.  I probably would have left at that point.  

The food was ok...definitely not worth waiting in line for but I think this place is one of the few breakfast/brunch spots in the area.  The service was meh - we waited several minutes for our server to come by and then had to ask for coffee when he did, which then took several more minutes.  I asked if the figs on the Fig & Walnut pancakes were fresh figs and he said yes - they were not.  I was disappointed and would have ordered something else had I been given the correct information.  We probably won't return unless other options aren't available to us.

This place is by far my favorite stop in Chicago. We come back every visit and tell everyone who visits to stop in too.
You can get in line ahead of time so you can enjoy more of your day and is super convenient.
Every person in this place is kind and friendly and helpful. The guy at the counter gave us a very realistic expectation of a wait and was happy to help even though he was busy.
The waitress was fantastic, personable and attentive. The entire staff seemed to have a purpose and we were well taken care of from start to finish. Even being as busy as they were, we were impressed with the quality of the drinks, food and service. Everything was delicious, reasonably priced and came out quickly so we could get on with our day.
If you can deal with the wait this place is good. After I put our name down we walked around the park across the street. The food was good and our waitress was very nice.

This bright and sunny spot is an excellent place for breakfast, with a giant, double-sided menu of everything from sweet to savory.

A standout was the wild berry crepes, fluffy crepes wrapped around mixed fresh berries without any goo weighing them down.

The applewood smoked bacon is also wonderful, thick cut and succulent.

Intelligentsia coffee is served (one of my favorites) and the chai tea lattes are huge.

Service is friendly and quick, making it a great breakfast stop.

Okay this will be my first review lol. BUT I've been dying to go this place and if you want to make it worth it, download the "no wait app" so that you don't have to wait hours and plan ahead.

The Signature Pancakes were on point. I have a sweet tooth so it was memorizing.

The Corn Beef Benny is quite creative in my opinion. Idk bout you the Filipino blood in me loves corn beef and I love eggs Benedict so it was a good combo! Needed some garlic, though.

Overall, good place to eat brunch and etc.

Liked their food, steak and eggs and handcrafted juice. Prices are reasonable, service was good as well, but I guess they r too busy this morning, kinda slow, waited 20mins for seats and 25mins for good to come up. 4 stars this time.

After dining at Wildberry I understand why it's packed on the weekends!

It was a Tuesday morning so we weren't expecting to see the crowds mentioned in other Yelp reviews.  However, by 7:15am the two front dining rooms were almost completely full and by 7:30 there was a wait.  

While we figured out what to order our server, Robert, was very patient and answered all of our questions.  This is one of those places that has unique items on the menu and I wanted to try them all.  Caramel Apple Pecan Belgian Waffles.  Banana Cream Pie Crepes.  Fruity Pebble Pancakes.  Rutherford Omelette (with baby spinach, caramelized onion, goat cheese and bacon).  

I went with White Hot Chocolate, Red Velvet French Toast and a side of Turkey Bacon.  The drink tasted like a melted Lindt truffle and was topped with a thick swirl of whipped cream on top...very decadent but delicious.

The Red Velvet French Toast was equally good.  I thought it might end up being cake flavored toast but instead it was cakey.  Think slices of red velvet pound cake dipped in egg wash, grilled and drizzled with a vanilla bean sauce.  It was so sweet that I didn't need any maple syrup.  

They have a standard syrup blend that they bring out with everything but for an extra $1 you can get pure maple syrup instead.  The pure maple punched up the flavor of the Fig and Walnut Multi-Grain Pancakes.  The Oreo S'Mores Pancakes were so coated in marshmallow, chocolate sauce and chocolate chips that they didn't need syrup.

It was anything but a boring breakfast and the three of us were very satisfied with our meals.  We were glad we didn't leave Chicago without experiencing Wildberry.

The wait is usually long if you have to come in on Sundays... I try to come in on weekdays where the wait is only about 20 minutes long.. it's worth it
I love their White Hot Chocolate, Rustic Farm Egg Panini, and Cinnamon Roll Pancakes... All of which have their pics attached

A must try if you're in the Chicago area! If you're a tourist, it's right next to the bean so make it a point to stop by and enjoy breakfast before you head over to one of Chicago's top tourist attractions.

Almost everything we tried was scrumptious! We ordered the butcher block skillet with a side of their Wildberry pancakes in place of toast for just $1 more. The skillet was delicious. The pancakes were perfectly fluffy but I must say the berry frosting was a bit too sweet for my palate. The caramel apple pecan French toast was oh so yummy but my absolute favorite dish of all was the plate of biscuits and gravy. The portions here are quite generous so feel free to share.

The service is fantastic! I can't begin to describe how attentive and engaging our server was! Seriously, why are you still reading this review?! Go get yourself some breakfast!

pics.caption: Biscuits & gravy, a side of wild berry specialty pancakes, caramel apple pecan French toast, and butcher block skillet (eggs on the side)

review.des:
Berry Bliss Pancakes! It's been nearly a year and I can still taste them as if they graced my palate just yesterday. Mmmm...

Put your name on the waitlist on Yelp. If you didn't and there is over an hour wait, you only have yourself to blame. You've been warned! Nonetheless, great food and great service. Besides the Berry Bliss Pancakes, I also tried a latte special, which was excellent. My husband had the Mexican Skillet, which he enjoyed.

Long wait. VERY LONG after 9 am on a Saturday

Worth every minute.

They have a system that texts you so you don't have to hang around an hour waiting for a table to open up.

Service is friendly in a way that doesn't feel put on and that includes greeters, server (who was awesome) and bussers.

Fast food to table after ordering and it exceeded our hopes.

Mexicana Skillet with pancakes was delicious. So was the Italian omelet my wife ordered.

Can't go wrong here.

I have been to this place multiple times on boring weekend mornings, the kind where it is really cold outside, nothing good on TV, and no food at home. Wildberry is about a 15 minute drive away from my house, and the ride is worth it. I am always lucky enough to come early, and 2 minutes later a huge line is outside the door. The servers are always very nice, the menu is very big, and the food comes very quickly. I recommend the Belgian Waffles; I am a huge fan of them. I usually get fruit on them, and they never put butter on my waffle; what most breakfast places do. This place is great.

Meh!
Not a whole lot for vegetarians or vegans.
Not too different from IHOP.
5 pancakes (who eats 5 pancakes) are $12. So not too terrible there.
Generally good food.  The hollandaise sauce could stand to be amped up a bit in flavor but good
Cinnamon roll French toast with off the bone ham was to die for.  Service great, prices reasonable. Would definitely go back

This place was absolutely amazing. I got the Venetian skillet and pancakes. My friend got the Belgian waffles. The staff were kind and efficient. The food arrived fast. It was affordable and tasted really good. I highly recommend

pics.caption: Venetian skillet, pancakes, and Belgian waffles. 10/10 would recommend

review.des: The lines for this place starting as early as 6:30 do not justify the end result.  This place is a step above IHOP in it's quality and service.  I did rather enjoy the Potato pancake though.  There is also no real privacy in this place especially during super busy times, everyone can hear your conversation as all the tables are close together.

Wildberry deserves 6/5 stars. I went with a girlfriend the other day and had the berry & yogurt crepes. Never made a better decision in my life. You cannot go wrong with this breakfast/brunch option. Great size portions, amazing food, kind staff. 6/5 stars like stated.

As I work around the corner from Wildberry, I'd always marvel at the ridiculous wait when I'd walk by on my lunch break. After dining here, I understand why. My coworker and I went here for lunch and we both got breakfast (sounds funny as I write that, but trust me, it was a great decision). The portions are quite large, so make sure you come here hungry. The wide variety of specialty pancakes even appealed to someone like myself, who is consistently a savory vs. sweet breakfast person. Definitely would go back.

portions were huge and the place was very reasonably priced. we went for brunch on a thursday and were seated right away. also in a prime location next to millennium park. would
recommend!

Came here on a Sunday afternoon from the suburbs. You can join the waitlist which was 2-3 hours long through yelp as long as your 10 miles away from the cafe. I joined it when I got into the city, did some shopping, and by the time I got to the restaurant, exactly 2 hours later, my table was ready! The yelp app updates you on how many parties are ahead of you and what time you should arrive to the Resturant by, also they send you text messages. Once we got seated we were given great customer service and the food was delicious. I tried the signature berry bliss French toast and absolutely loved it! My cousin got a garden skillet and we split our food and  enjoyed them both! Would definitely come back here and recommend when you are in the city!
Love this place! Much better than all the cliche brunch places popping up all over the place.

This place was great! Make sure you go hungry because the serving sizes are huge. I had the cinnamon roll pancakes and poached eggs. My only complaint is that one of my eggs was over cooked. Other than that the food was great. There was a long wait but they turnover tables pretty quickly so it does go by pretty fast. If you reserve a spot on yelp be prepared for your table to be ready earlier than you expect.

3.5 stars

Helpful tip when eating at a restaurant: Order the item that the restaurant is named after. In this case, PANCAKES!

A friend recommended this place and so my husband and I had to try it out. The wait was about 45 minutes but you can go to the Millennium Park and check out the Bean (Cloud Gate) while you wait for your "table is ready" text.

Food:
Banana Creme Pie Pancakes-Fluffy, warm, and very sweet. Syrup not needed because the pancakes were moist and delectable. But you are welcomed to add syrup if you like!

Los Altos Benedict-beautiful presentation with two nicely poached eggs sitting on a bed of chorizo and red peppers all topped with a chipotle hollandaise and pico de gallo. My only issue was the english muffin. It was hard to cut and when I bit into it, it was hard.

Service:
The place was extremely packed and the servers did what they need to and that was good enough for me.

One of the best breakfast establishments. Being able to join a waitlist on Yelp is very convenient because they're ALWAYS busy. The staff is super friendly and time efficient. The food is always delicious and they portion sizes are good for their affordable prices. The Denver skillet is one of my fav entrees. Their specialty waffles and pancakes are also VERY good. I highly recommend this restaurant.

TL;DR - Awesome food, not so awesome wait. Still worth a visit!

WAIT - 3 stars
30 minute wait at 9AM on a Monday morning = mad hype, but understandable. I just ended up walking around Millennium Park and came back once they texted me, so don't feel like you have to stay out front if your wait is long.

AMBIANCE - 4 stars
Normal cafe decor, but there was a lot of space to sit outside and watch the hustle and bustle of downtown Chicago while you waited to be seated.

SERVICE - 5 stars
Given how busy it was, I was impressed that the waiters kept up with all their tables, but I'm sure they're used to this volume of customers haha. My waitress was really helpful in helping me decide what to get, since this was my first time here :)

FOOD - 5 stars
Mexicana Sizzlin' Skillet - Great flavors (I mean, who doesn't love chorizo...) and very good portion size. Would definitely get this again!
Berry Bliss Pancakes - Came on the side. The sauce was amaaaaazing! My only gripe is that the bottom pancake in the stack didn't get any love :( I wish they had put some of the coulis on the side or something, but all in all it definitely didn't disappoint!
Wildberry has some of the best pancakes I've ever had in my life. The food portions are large and it is not that expensive. I come here every-time I visit Chicago.
Either the city or burbs you won't be disappointed with Wildberry! Staff, owners and food (breakfast or lunch) is amazing!

USE THE YELP WAITLIST FEATURE!

As soon as I woke up I added my name to the waitlist using Yelp, which was a life changer! It told me how many parties were in front of me and what time to check in which was perfect because we went to walk around Millenium park and crossed the street to the restaurant and we waited not even five minutes to sit at our table.

The place is bright and has an energetic vibe to it. The chair was comfortable and my friend sat in the booth. As soon as we sat we had our drinks order taken at they were brought to us in a timely manner, for food everything looks so delicious and I definitely wanted to try something salty and sweet.

I ordered the Mexican skillet that had the chorizo, AMAZING! Being from San Diego and living in Mexico for most of my life it is definitely hard to find a non-Mexican restaurant serving a Mexican dish with such authentic taste! BRAVO! I got the skillet with the side of the cinnamon swirl pancakes, it was a perfect way to end my breakfast, it was truly a dessert!

Honestly, the service could've been a little bit better it seemed like the waiter hated his job but towards the end he got a little bit more friendly, the food definitely made up for it.

This place definitely lives up to its expectations!

More of a crowed hipster eatery, than a legit breakfast crown jewel. My mother said her oatmeal sucked. My strawberry topped pancakes weren't even hot when they arrived.
This place has ppl waiting for an hour to be seated and their only goal is turn tables and keep the money flowing. We really didn't like this place at all.
I'll take the Pantry in Downtown Los Angeles any day over this over hyped waste of time.

You can't really go wrong with breakfast food! This place cooks some pretty good breakfast. Eggs were light, pancakes were fluffy, and fruit was very fresh! Everything we had was pretty good. Only reason we gave a 4 was because there was nothing that really stood out from all of the other breakfast joints. They offered the same if not similar options as most other places. Only thing semi different was the cinnamon roll pancakes and they were extremely sweet. It is a delicious affordable option for breakfast.

pics.caption: Two eggs, Sausage Links, and Cinnamon Roll Pancakes
Byo omelet fruit and Cinnamon Roll Pancakes

review.des: Food was delicious especially the pancakes. This place is about big portions and less on unique taste. Nevertheless, it was a good place to have late breakfast.

This place is amazing!!!! First brunch place I tried in Chicago and it did not disappoint at all. Completely loved having brunch here. I had the española omelette and its the best one I've ever had! Delicious! I also got toast as a side and their jelly is to die for! I even asked for a lid to take it with me because I fell in love with it. To drink I had the turtle mocha and that was also really good! Our waitress was super nice and attentive (wish I had gotten her name). Just an overall great experience.

It's true what they say about the wait.. my group of friends and I were quoted about 60 mins, but the hostess got us seated in half the time! Lucky us! We were visiting Chicago from Tampa, FL and had just got off the plane, so we still had our bulky suitcases and luggage with us, which the manager did not seem too stoked about and gave us attitude for. Other than that, the place was great and the food was INCREDIBLE. I had a pork sandwich that was so tender and flavorful. Incredible and SO worth the wait!

We were famished after taking loads of pictures at 'The Bean' and the bf happened to yelp this place for brunch. I saw the high ratings and wanted to give this place a try, was not disappointed.

Everyone's review was complaining about the wait, but for some reason we didn't wait that long. It only seemed like 5 minutes and we were seated..maybe we came at a good time but as we were lead to our seats - the place was bangin' with people. As soon as I sat down, I felt cramped and it was also a bit loud, you could hear the conversations of the table/s next to you.

Service was on point! Since it was our first time, our waiter was really helpful in giving us recommendations of his favorites and what to try/not try. He told us to get the signature berry bliss and cinnamon pancakes, which we did. We also ended up getting a butcher block skillet and corned beef hash. When our food was brought out, I immediately took mouthfuls of my skillet because it was so good. It had everything I wanted: cheese, eggs, ham, sausage, and bacon!! YUM. We felt so full after eating our meal that we didn't get to finish the pancakes.

Both the berry bliss and cinnamon pancakes were already sweet so we didn't bother putting any of the various syrups on them. I prefered the berry bliss over the cinnamon tho...because it had blackberries and strawberries. The berries provided a nice flavor, compared to just sugar. If I ever do come back, I know not to get those two types of pancakes together as they are waaaay too sweet and also to only share one thing LOL.

If you need a break or rest or just plain hungry from doing touristy stuff, do check this place out. I guarantee you'll be coming out of here stuffed and ready for a day's worth of adventure!

We visited Chicago recently, and were looking for a brunch spot close to the hotel. Wildberry has almost perfect reviews so we figured we would try it out for ourselves.

Some helpful advice for everyone - Make a reservation in advance! Seriously, do it. I put our name in through Yelp to avoid having to wait in line outside for hours. It books up fast. If you do that, you'll get a window of time and they will send you a message about 5 minutes before you need to check in with the hostess. Save yourself the hassle and plan ahead.

Solid brunch spot. Portions are huge. I definitely could have shared my meal. Eggs Benedict were good. The pancakes look delicious as well.

Wow. The reviews don't lie about this place it is delicious. I had the signature berry bliss pancakes and they were blissful indeed! My friends had two of the skillets and they were sizable and tasty. It's a decent price point and the service is good as well. There's so much to choose from I could see myself going again and again that is if I could time my "Nowait" app just right. My friends and I actually came for breakfast two days in a row to be able to get in without waiting in line for two hours. Be sure to get a place in line anytime after 7 am. The only thing that was not stand out were the hot beverages, among us we had coffee, a latte and hot apple cider, all were just okay but this place doesn't claim to be a coffee shop, get the skillets or the pancakes and it'll be worth hor

pics.caption: Hearty meats and smores and Oreo yummmm
Berry bliss pancakes and a veggie skillet!!

review.des: Wide selection and amazing food. Everything was tasty and fresh, ranging from eggs to fresh fruit to crepes. Great service and the food has amazing presentation

The portions here are HUGE! Great food but it makes me want to go back to sleep. Special mushroom omelette was really tasty. Super cheesy but a tad salty for my taste from the prosciutto. Make sure you order your hash browns extra crispy, totally worth it! Signature berry pancakes were yummy but with all the carbs and protein, I barely finished half of my food. Boyfriend got the Venetian skillet and that was tasty too! Ended up taking our extra pancakes to go and giving it to a homeless person since we were in a mad food coma. Overall, i would come back!

pics.caption: Special mushroom omelette, Venetian skillet and signature berry pancakes

review.des:
Wait is bad, food is AMAZING.
I came on a Friday and used the no wait app to get a table for two, and it was around an hour wait. The app ALWAYS underestimates the time it will take to get your table but we got there when the app said just to be safe. After being seating, the waiter immediately came and gave us our menus and was so so nice and accommodating. We ordered the beef brisket skillet and fresco omelet, both adding on the signature berry pancakes. Literally the best decision I have ever made. I have never had such amazing pancakes. They were topped with the fruit glaze and jelly and fresh fruit and it was divine. Would definitely come back just for the pancakes!!

pics.caption: Signature berry pancakes TO DIE FOR
Fresco omelette w/signature berry pancakes and fresh fruit + beef brisket skillet w/signature berry pancakes

review.des: I enjoyed myself i love how the waiter accommodated my vegan needs he was great! Atmosphere is nice and open. A lot of selections , good service i was happy

Came here while I was visiting Chicago and it was great. We waited about 30-45 to get a table but it was worth it. Little did I know we could've reserved a table through yelp. The service and food was great.  The portions are huge also. Even the kids plate. You will not leave disappointed
So many good items to choose from. They do not skim on portions. Prices are well worth the meal. Service was great, he was attentive and answered questions I had. A definite recommend- just go early.
Yummy food staff friendly even though usually super busy Love I can check in electronically before I'm even in the restaurant and I get real-time updates
This place is good. arrive hungry and you still probably won't finish. Rivals Clinton street bakery for the pancakes and great service to boot. Highly recommended.

pics.caption: butchers block, blueberry pancakes, corned beef hash and cinnamon pancakes

review.des:
Great, GREAT food but not worth the long wait times and extremely RUDE customer service! My family and I paid a visit to the Wildberry location within Prudential Tower in Chicago. We checked in, waited for our table and eventually we were seated. For starters, we had to wait at the table for at least 10-15 minutes before our waiter, Jeremy, even came over to ask if we wanted anything to drink. We sat down to a table still being cleaned and the check from the previous patrons still being on the table. When Jeremy finally came over to the table, he was extremely rude and came off with an attitude because of how my mother addressed how we were waiting for so long without receiving a simple "I will be right with you guys" from him, which is just common courtesy from a waiter to his/her customer.

Jeremy's response to my mother was extremely condescending to her, saying "well the quicker that we start talking about what y'all want to eat, the faster this process can go so what you want". At that point we were wanting to just leave the restaurant, because how dare you speak that condescending and rudely to customers who have waited over two and a half hours to be seated to have breakfast at your establishment, which gives us NOTHING for free - while laughing and carrying on so politely with other families and customers at other tables throughout the restaurant.

We placed our drinks order and once Jeremy returned with the drinks, we placed our food orders - which he rushed us through while ordering. At this point, I believe that he could see that we were unsatisfied with the service and tried to tone down the manner in which he was speaking to us, but we were already annoyed and unpleased with him as a waiter. Our meals came and the food was great, as it usually is when we visit the resturaunt - however if I am paying for a service and am a customer within an establishment I expect to be treated a certain way and have waiters and waitresses who knows how to give customer service to their patrons.

We have also been frequent customers to this Wildberry location, until February of last year, 2017, where we had another run in with a rude worker named Kevin, who spoke to my family again in a very disrespecting and rude manner due to an issue with seatings and reservations. My sister wrote in to the company again was offered a free meal to us; however we were so disgusted with the service that we received then that we haven't returned until today and never bothered to take up the offer from you, which shows how the service has not improved at all from a lot of the waiters and waitresses that are working for Wildberry.
Great crepes and pancakes! Lots of options for everyone. Long wait but worth it. Not a place to go if you're in a rush.

The food from this place was DELICIOUS. Great menu items and huge portions and reasonable pricing. We waited on line for about an hour (Columbus' Day) because we went straight from the airport to the restaurant and had no where else to wait. Based on what the host said, waiting time ranges from 1 1/2hrs to 2hrs but thanks to the Nowait app, our waiting time was cut down to half on a holiday. Make sure you download it and save yourself some time.

We ordered the florence benedicts, the eggs with toast and hashbrowns and a customized omelette with the wildberry pancakes. Everything was delicious!

I've been to this location once before and it wasn't  as bad as this time. Schaumburg location is definitely better than this. the white chocolate mocha wasn't sweet at all, I got a replacement apple juice which tasted watered down and took forever to get straws.

Just plain pancakes. Expected more. Friendly staff and good service. But so is my family. Bliss pancakes are $12; $7 for the top one with the white Carmel frosting and $1.25 each for the other 4 to hold it up. Nice that they offer several senior rates for my guest. Good value there. Coffee was strong.
Overall: one and done. If you miss it, you'll be fine.

Best brunch experience in Chicago in my humble opinion as everything was delectable! We had the chicken and waffles, Venetian skillet and berry crepes and left stuffed but enjoyed the experience and I can hardly wait to return.
Plan ahead as the wait is about two hours in a Saturday morning but well worth it.

pics.caption: Best item in the menu, light and tasty

review.des: So good! 100% recommend for brunch. Put your name on the waitlist beforehand. The pancakes are a must - as well as the eggs Benedict!

We came at the perfect time as we had no wait even though it looked extremely busy. I took my wife for brunch and I got the cinnamon roll pancakes which we awesome. And my wife got the corn beef hash with a side of fruits. She thought it was wonderful. We order a side of chicken sausage, they were sweeter than the savory taste we wanted but still good.
The service was slow. We finished eating and waited another 10 minutes til the server came around to ask of we were ready for the check. She took another 5 minutes to get it and then another 10 minutes to process it. I understand it can get busy but that process should take no more than 5 minutes. Luckily the food made of for the service.
