pics.caption: Berry blish pancakes, Conrbeef Hash with scrambled eggs, fresh fruits, and chicken sausages.

review.des:
After landing from the plane, my family absolutely needed a delicious meal, so the first stop? Wildberry Pancakes! Chicago's famous pancake stop!
My family and I used the no wait app and walked from our hotel to Wildberry pancakes for a delicious meal. We were a little confused on how the nowait app worked so we talked to a host which the hosts were very rude, but we got it all sorted out and waited outside. Once our no wait app told us our table was ready, we notified the hosts.  The host took us to our table! Just kidding they didn't, they took us to the building connected to the restaurant and made us wait, again. It was pretty odd and we had to wait an additional 20-30 minutes.
After the wait, our server came and got us and placed us on a booth. He was very friendly and sweet. He definitely made our experience more enjoyable. The atmosphere of the restaurant was okay, it was very busy, but I liked that it was spacious.
We came with a large group, in total we ordered the Berry Bliss pancakes, Short Rib Hash, Southern Benedict, Mexican Skillet, Oatmeal, Buttermilk pancakes and 2 simple breakfast dishes (Eggs, bacon, and toast). Of all the dishes, the Berry Bliss pancakes was the highlight. The Berry Bliss pancakes had a large array of flavors. It was not overwhelming sweet and the fresh fruits gave the creamy berry sauce a refreshing bite. The pancakes were the perfect texture and were very flavorful.
However, as for the rest of the dishes, they were okay. The Mexican Skillet seemed like it had so much to offer on menu, but when it came out of the kitchen, it was extremely bland. I had to add so much salt, pepper, and ketchup to make it taste like anything. The short rib hash lacked flavor as well and the meat was dry. The Southern Benedict was okay, there was nothing bad or special about it, but it was better than the other dishes.

On the bright side the pancakes I ordered were very good! If you come here make sure to use the no wait app, I think it helped significantly, and also I would just stick to their pancakes. Their service was okay, the atmosphere was okay, but the pancakes are worth the trip!

I came to Chicago for a conference and stayed 4 days.  Not even kidding we tried to go here EVERY MORNING that we were in town!  The skillets are A LOT of food, but just the perfect combination of egg and toppings (they are very generous with what you have added to the egg).  Also, you can choose to sub your 2 pancakes on the side of the skillet so we got the signature berry pancakes on the side. NO REGRETS. Also, the 2 pancakes on the side was just enough sweet.  One time I got just the berry pancakes in a stack of 4 and it was a lot of sweet to take in at one time.  Definitely recommend just getting 2 on the side with something savory to break up the sweet.  I split the skillet and pancakes with a frind and it was the perfect portion size split.

The best way to do to this is to put your name in on OpenTable or go in in person.  But go early, like before 8am.  There's always a long wait, and the wait is worth it, but why wait if you don't have to!?

The staff was always nice, and the food was always worth it!  DEFINITELY recommend!
The wait is worth it. I had the Strawberry Lemon Buttercream French Toast. Yummmmm. Best French toast ever. While in Chicago, Wildberry is a definite go to place to eat!

Visited Wildberry as it came highly recommended.  We had a fantastic breakfast and the food was delicious. The line on the other hand is unbelievably long. We got on the wait list via the app and still had to wait 30+ minutes. There is no place to stand while you wait as it was raining outside. once we were eating it was great but leading up to it was a bit frustrating. Glad i got on the list bc the wait for walkups was almost 2 hours long.

This institution was recommended to me by a friend for brekkie or brunch. I went here on a Saturday morning around 9am and it was packed - both the outdoor patio and inside with a queue of people.

I was told that the wait was 45 min to an hour so I got the take out option.

Ordered biscuits in sausage gravy that came with hash browns and two poached eggs. Also got myself a coconut mocha. It came up to around 16 dollars.

My coffee was made instantly and was delicious. The take out meal was available within 10 minutes. A+ for service.

I walked across to millennium park to devour my meal.
So biscuits are fried bread in butter. The sausage gravy was bits of sausage in salty creamy gravy. Did not enjoy the biscuits though they were recommended. My hash browns were missing. And poached eggs were so yolk-y that as I tried to eat it, the yolk dribbled down my leg.I smelt like egg all day.

might be going back for coffee or other options as price is good.
The food and service were amazing! Would definitely come back again, waiter treat you like family. Loved it!

The food here is okay. All about the hype about being around downtown Chicago. The waiter wasn't very attentive, and they rushed us the entire meal. Halfway through us eating they asked, not only once, but two times if we were done eating and if we would take it to go. The food is okay, but nothing special. Save yourself the wait for this place, not different from any other breakfast you could get, especially if you're all about the food like me.

There's something on the menu for everyone. A great spot for breakfast, brunch, or lunch. I've yogurt and granola for breakfast, and grilled cheese and French fries for lunch a different time. Both were great! I've been here twice and would definitely go again. The only downside is how busy it always is. :)

This is one of my favorite places for breakfast not just in Chicago but all over the country. The food is seasonal, delicious, and super filling. Make sure you come here with an empty stomach and set aside an hour just to wait to get a table (AKA use the Wailist feature on Yelp). It is definitely worth the wait. For my drinks, I got the hot apple cider and my girl friend got the turtle mocha. Both drinks were great, but the turtle was a little too sweet for my liking. The apple cider is everything I good cider should be, not too sweet and homey. For food, we got the mexicali hash with sunny side eggs and oreo pancakes. 2 eggs and a layer of hash brown is a lot of food, and couple that with oreo pancakes, it is over the top of savory and sweet deliciousness. I was in a food coma from the first to let bite. For only an extra 1.50 you can switch pancakes to any of their specialty pancakes, which is a great deal. One hash was enough foo for 2 so beware that the portions and huge. the best part of Wildberry is that it is pretty affordable and was definitely worth the wait!

Though its a long wait you can always stop by Millenium Park delicious omelettes and the pancakes are the perfect Consistency... Don't miss the opportunity when you visit it's a must. I had the Espenada Omelet which tasted like a tamale and the Berry Bliss Pancakes
Lived until to the hype. Cinnamon roll pancakes were to die for. Everything looked amazing. They sit you down quickly and have the food out just as quick

Great place for brunch. We came here on a Saturday around 10 am and the wait was around an hour. The wait would've been a bit shorter if we wanted a table inside but we had our puppy with us and we had to sit outside. We didn't know that you could check in using the app, so that's what we're going to do next. Either way, the place is right next to Millennium Park, so it's easy to kill an hour.

We had the Los Altos Benedict, Southern Benedict, and a "Bliss Berry Pancake" with orange juice (fresh squeezed) and a latte. The food was unbelievably and definitely worth the wait. I would 100% recommend this place and also encourage people to make a reservation before hand using their app.

I went to Wildberry with my brother and two friends on a Wednesday morning for breakfast. The restaurant was packed! I left my phone number and was called in 25 minutes later to be seated. During those 25 minutes, my posse and I walked around the corner and back (exploring downtown Chi-town a little).

They serve generous portions and the food is absolutely delicious. I left feeling completely satisfied. It was well worth the wait, which wasn't too long.

The waiters were helpful and friendly. I saw that I could extend the table by pulling the extension out from underneath (we needed more space since we ordered so much food)...a waiter saw me struggle and came to my rescue by preventing me from embarrassment. Thanks!!

The area and ambience is very family friendly and bright, cafe-like with booths, kind of a more upscale I-HOP if you will

Food:

*2 Signature "Berry Bliss" Pancakes* My brother and I ordered one for each of us (honestly could've ordered one and shared it) This dish is a stack of about 5 pancakes or so with berries cooked in the batter itself along with a vanilla anglaise, blackberry coulis, berry mascarpone, and fresh berries. So, so, sooooo good! I will order this again when I come back, for sure.

   -one w/ side of two eggs over easy and potatoes (Potatoes were my favorite, not hash-
   brown style, but cut in cubes)
   -one w/ side of two scrambled eggs and potatoes

*1 Signature "Berry Bliss" Waffle*- this is a single Belgian waffle, with all the ingredients mentioned in the description for the berry bliss pancakes. Not as heavy as the pancakes, but still so filling and Instagram-worthy!

  -w/ side of potatoes

*1 Waffle with Chocolate Chips*- My friend ordered the plain Belgian waffle and added chocolate chips to it...she loved it and recommends it!

 -w/ side of potatoes

Next time I come to Chicago I will definitely re-visit and try something new in addition to my favorite, the berry bliss pancakes!! This breakfast/brunch spot is a must-go if you are new to Chicago or are visiting.

Check out my Instagram, @deeps.eats, for pictures from Wildberry =)
Would give 5 Stars but the wait is impactful to the expreience. Great Omlet and pancakes. Also try the wildbery Orange juice. Good portions that won't leave you hungry.
great food!!! come hungry, portions are huge!!! use yelp app to reserve your table!!!

I got slapped by the delicious berry smell as I entered through the revolving doors.

Skillets are their specialty, I got the Mexicana.  Really tasty, the chorizo, avocado, with egg and jalapeño, can't go wrong with that combo.
Also the Egg Florentine, it's ok it needs a chunky pico de Gallo to top it (just my opinion).

The service was great.  It's definitely a good place for breakfast.  

The Real Foodie
Just keepin' it on the berry

pics.caption: Their house special, the berry pancakes.  The natter is excellent and it was definitely one of the better pancakes I've had.

review.des:
Legitimate place. And what a location! I mean come on... across from Millennium Park and around the corner from Giordano's. I'm sure there is now a picture of every item on the menu and it tastes as great as it looks. Tried a hash, the berry pancakes, and my favorite, the cinnamon french toast! Have got to find a time when this place isn't absolutely insane (45 min wait with a ton of people turning away because of it). The jackhammer out front made for a nice ambience, and there wasn't any place to wait, but it was all worth it once we got our order (took a while, but we figured as much with how busy it was). They'll text you when you're table is ready. We had a great server and although the hostesses were the standard "I don't give a F* about you" type, the place was an overall success.
Actually can't wait to go back!

Stopped by on a Sunday and the wait was an hour and a half.  Good thing the bean and the Chicago cultural center  is right there to kill time.

I had the wildberry pancakes and the butcher block skillet.  The wildberry pancakes were good but not amazing.  The same went for the skillet. If there's a wait,  I wouldn't recommend it.

Best breakfast in Chicago. I got the Mexican skillet and the white hot  chocolate and both were superb.

Waiting was long but absolutely worth it :)
Decent egg Benedict! Priced very reasonably and the potatoes were very flavorful and crispy! Will definitely be back for more brunch options'
Cinnamon roll French toast is to die for!! Super excited one opened behind water tower place as well. Great coffee and omelets as well. Large portions.
Amazing food with a wide variety menu. The service was great and the new location is very convenient!
It was crazy busy but the blueberry and pecan waffles were  we had to wait about 15 min for a seat and I totally understand why. This place knows how to make breakfast.
Got the chorizo Benedict and the cinnamon French toast. The Benedict was amazing, full of flavor. The French toast was also good, not as sweet as I would've liked but still very good.
Great food and great service. The cinnamon pumpkin pancakes were delicious. I would definitely return!

This is the best brunch place I've ever been!!! The food is awesome! I got the garden skillet with sunside up eggs. The hush potatoes at the bottom was awesome! U need to ask them for ketchup to add flavor though. The berry bliss pancake was a bomb, I like the cream drizzled on top.
However, if it's just the food, I won't have given it a 5-star, it is the service that makes this place a gem!!! The servers and waiters are super friendly!! And the food came super fast!!!
But they don't seem to take reservation though. You need to get ready to wait for hours if you come late...

A couple of my friends visited Chicago and told me I had to stop by Wildberry, and I am so glad that I did. My 5 friends and I went to breakfast here on a Friday morning around 10 am, so the wait ended up being only about 15 min. The inside of the restaurant is exactly what you might expect for a breakfast spot: very homey and open. The service is also awesome. Our waiter was very quick and attentive to all our needs.

My friends and I made sure to order different pancakes, so we could all try the different flavors. Every single flavor was fantastic. I ordered the garden skillet with a side of wildberry pancakes, and everything was so good. The portions were huge, so I was stuffed after. I will say that the skillet was a bit too cheesy but still very tasty. The veggies in the skillet were all very fresh and plentiful. These pancakes were probably the best pancakes I've ever had. They were fluffy and flavorful, and the berries and drizzle on top was the perfect touch. I also tried the cinnamon roll, oreo and smores pancakes, and I could not decide which pancake was the best. Every bite was amazing.

This is a must-do for breakfast/brunch in Chicago! Go a little earlier and avoid the wait, but it's so worth it either way.
The service and food was excellent!! They were fast and efficient. We added ourselves to the waitlist via yelp and were seated not long after we arrived.

I'm not understanding the high reviews on this place. The food selection was large, along with the servings, but the flavor was lacking... Maybe the pancakes are the thing to get, but I wasn't really wanting sweet. On an up note, the staff was friendly. Tip: Use Nowait as the wait is LONG.

It's worth a visit if you have time to wait in the line or can go SUPER early. The food is somewhat standard brunch fare with some flair here or there but really, the line can be a bit extensive. I'm planning to visit the new location at Water Tower soon however. The staff has always been great.

Great food! The service was on point, the portions are fairly large, so look to share, or come with an appetite. A lot of protein based foods with lots and lots of meat. Our waiter was awesome, we didn't eat pork so he gave us substitutes for the sausage gravy to replace it with the hollandaise. Overall great experience, great location, has an easy drop off and pick up lane.

This place was such a treat to visit on my trip to Chicago! Without a doubt, it lived up to its reputation. We came on a Wednesday morning around 9 so there wasn't a wait.

Everything we ate here was exquisite! We order the Napa Valley Fig omelette and "Signature" bliss pancakes. The pancakes were so delicious and actually tasted like cake. The fig omelette was incredible as well. You get huge portions here for a decent price. My wife and I were able to share an omelette and pancakes. We both walked away full. Wildberry also has some tasty lemonade. My favorite would have to be the passion fruit. If you're near Millennium Park do yourself a favor and check this place out.

Get here early because the crowd forms quickly! Great location in The Loop - walking distance from all the major hotels in the area. I chose this place for brunch mainly due to it being close by and of course because of the stellar reviews.

My friend and I arrived around 9:00AM and noticed an abundance of people waiting outside. We were told the wait would be about an hour. They give you a slip of paper with the time you arrived and told us to come back in 30 minutes in order to get a pager. Luckily it was really nice out that day, so the hour wait went by fairly quick. They also have a Intelligista Coffee kiosk located near the hostess stand, where you can order perfectly prepared drinks/pastries while you wait.  Definitely clutch.  

Service was pretty standard - friendly and quick.  Menu had great options. It took me a while to decide what I wanted because everything sounded great.  I decided to go with Espanola omelette, which consisted of jalapenos, avocados, mushrooms, chorizo sausage, and chihuahua cheese.  It also comes with tortillas, but I opted out of those.  I also requested egg whites, but I'm not sure if it was really all egg whites. It came with a side of either fruit or hash browns and toast or pancakes.  I chose fruit, so I could feel less guilty about getting the specialty pancake side option (extra $1.00).

The omelette  was hugeeee! Stuffed with all that goodness and perfectly cheesy. The eggs weren't dry, which is definitely how I enjoy an omelette.
I chose the cinnamon roll pancake and oh my goodness...delicious. You won't even feel guilty about it! I ate the entire plate - no shame! It came with two perfectly prepared pancakes that tasted like an amazing cinnamon roll.  Seriously, so good.

Definitely a great spot for brunch as long as you don't mind the wait!

pics.caption: Omelette with avocado, mushroom, chorizo, cheese
Cinnamon roll pancake as a side order to the omelette

review.des: Best thing I could've ever done was to place myself on the waitlist via Yelp. Genius. The wait? Outrageous, worth it? Would totally sacrifice my first born for those Oreo s'mores pancakes so yes. The wait was 90 minutes but we placed ourselves on the waitlist and arrived 30 minutes before. Getting in the door, to tell a hostess we were there, was a hassle, so packed! I literally got stuck in the revolving doors and thought I would end up on a thousand ways to die but guys I survived! Thank the lucky stars. Anyway, once we got in, our food came before we could blink. Pancakes were divine, my friend got the waffles and we shared an omelette. The bacon could have used some TLC but it was still good. Huge portion sizes, I ate half and had enough for breakfast the next morning. I literally pass this place every day, I'm happy to say I finally know what all the hoopla is about!

The food was fine.  The service, however, was not.

I got there shortly after it was opened (so it was rather empty).  I was seated and waited and waited.  5 minutes later they sat someone next to me and the waitress (Kelsey) showed up within a couple minutes to take her order.  Meanwhile, I was still waiting for someone to greet me and take my order.  

It turns out that Kelsey was my waitress; she took my order (a skillet) after finishing up with the new arrival.  

Within 10 minutes, the 4 tables with people around me were served at one time.  And still I waited.  Then someone came out from the kitchen and took away the plate from the diner 2 tables down; it was a skillet.  At that time, I realized he was served my skillet.  10 more minutes go by without any interaction from the staff, so I am about to walk out.  The manager then shows up and apologizes for the waitress - as she had entered the order incorrectly - and offers to take 25% of the bill.  Kelsey is standing right next to him and says nothing.  

A simple apology, Kelsey, could have gone a long way.  Disappointing.
It was Memorial Day Weekend. The food was great but the service was average. The wait was too long and the restaurant too crowded. It almost felt like a factory, in and out.

Absolutely the most popular place for breakfast in Chicago.
Me and my girlfriend try to go on Friday but was more than a hour and half of wait, the day after we use the waitlist on yelp and it's absolutely the only way for have a table in this super busy place.
I take the iced caramel latte and was for sure one of the best caramel latte of my life, great!!!
For breakfast I take the combo with eggs, turkey bacon, hash browns potato and was everything good, and the pancake was something great, my girlfriend take a veggies omelette and was so huge !
The service was excellent and fast, and the prices really good.
If I came back in Chicago this will be for sure a stop for breakfast again

Food: 4 stars. Wait to be seated: 2 stars.

Brunch here will certainly fill you up (if you can finish it), but the wait for a table might make you decide it's not worth the hassle. Wait time early on a Sunday was more than an hour.

However, if your sin of choice is gluttony via sugar, bacon, and carbs, then this place it for you. Every meal comes with a side (you can choose fruit instead of potatoes) and pancakes (you can choose specialty pancakes as well).

I ordered the veggie omelette made with egg whites, fruit, and the fig and walnut multigrain pancakes. The omelette was huge, and I'm pretty sure it contained at least half a dozen egg whites. The pancakes were good just with the toppings--didn't even need butter or syrup really. And the coffee here is at least decent.

Maybe I'm just one of those people who feels bad wasting food, but breakfast is a hard meal to reheat leftovers, so it would've been nice to have the option of a half order or at least a description of the size so that I could choose to share.

pics.caption: Partially eaten veggie omelette and fig & walnut pancakes.

review.des:
ATTENTION! If you're looking for a breakfast/brunch spot and NOT having ANY IDEA about this restaurant before, be aware with the WAITING TIME! I came here on Sunday brunch and the waiting time was 1 hour and 45 mins, heck NO. We decided to came back on the next day, Monday morning!

We got there around 8h40 and was quoted 15 mins! *YAY* and yes it was 15 minutes from waiting to sitting down! Our table was ready with water and menus. My friend ordered omelette with hashbrown and a choice of pancakes! You can choose specialty pancakes by paying $1.50 more. She ended up having tiramisu pancake and it tasted so good.....yet so fat lol. I had butcher block skillet and cinnamon roll pancake! Omg!!! I don't think I'll ever forget how my pancakes tasted. It was SUPER GOOD. The pancake itself was abit crispy on the edge yet fluffy and soft in the middle. Hmmmmmmmm yum.

Service was super friendly too! I remember it was Jeremy who served us and he's amazing!!!! 5*!

This place is always busy yet worth to try!

pics.caption: Omelette with hasbrown and tiramisu pancakes
Butcher block skillet and cinnamon roll pancakes

review.des: Wildberry is a standby in this area. Great everything; sandwiches, sides, and of course the pancakes. These pancakes are usually fairly crazy and will definitely satiate that sweet tooth. Be careful about going at peak times though, the lines get crazy at the rush.

I was skeptical of the high ratings, but our brunch convinced me - at least seated outside in the sunshine!  Love that we could get on the waitlist via Yelp.  And it worked.  Menu is huge but they seem to handle it- the food was great.  And our waitress was friendly knowledgeable and efficient.  AND they had a GF pancake and it was great!  So, five stars to (admittedly) my surprise.

So so good! We were seated pretty fast because it was raining and no one wanted to sit on the patio, we volunteered to sit outside because it's all covered by umbrellas so we didn't get wet at all. The cinnamon roll pancakes were to die for as well as everything else we had! If I had one piece of constructive criticism it would be for our server to be a little more attentive. He was very friendly and knowledgable but it took some time for him to come see us each time we needed him. Again, this place is crazy busy and it was raining so I'm definitely not going to dock them down for that. Definitely a place to try in Chi!

Before coming here, you must download NoWait. The normal wait for Wildberry is over 2 hours. I normally wake up around 9 and check in on NoWait and then by the time my family gets ready and out the door--around 11--we don't have to wait more than 10 minutes for a table! Even if you do have a longer wait, Wildberry is right across from Millennium Park and the Bean, so you have a lot to keep you busy while you wait.
To get the best bang for your buck, I recommend ordering a skillet and getting a side of the signature pancakes. You get the best mix of salty and sweet. I always take home 3/4ths of my meal leftover to take home. Additionally, you get 2 pancakes with this deal, which in my opinion is more than enough.
The staff here is so friendly and really cares about you having a positive experience. I think this is definitely rare in a setting as busy as Wildberry is every day. If you are visiting Chicago, you should definitely stop by Wildberry!

Great coffee full of Flavor. Went family style with friends and got the Mexicana skillet, strawberry chocolate chip waffles, and the eggs Benedict. Mexicana was great, if you like spice you'll love the chorizo and jalapeños mixed into it. Not a huge eggs Benedict fan but it was decent along with the waffles. Cool hotel restaurant vibe with really animated staff who were helpful.
Omelet and Berry Bliss pancakes are amazing!! I was hesitant at first to wait so long, but the wait is worth it!
Wow! I'm not sure what's better the service or the food no the food wins but seriously ... This place is amazing

Huge portions, great food and great coffee.  I have tasted every skillet on the menu, and every single one has been fantastic.  Most of the time, one skillet is good for two meals (at least) and I tend to eat a lot.  I am always taking food home from Wildberry.  The service is prompt and attentive once you are seated, but there is often a line/wait, so get there early!

Very busy place, but they line went pretty quickly. They menu was huge. I had an omelette and it was great. Hubby got the smoreo pancakes. Sounds like what it is -- pancakes with chocolate cookies and marshmallow. Our friend got a skillet (these are very popular here ) -- you get a skillet with eggs, hashbrowns and other things. They look really good. Overall, a good place to stop for breakfast.

Always delicious! Friendly staff and very patient with everyone despite the mass amount of people who come in. They have a great seating system. I would recommend joining the waitlist through yelp or be prepared for an hour+ wait. You can always come in and give your name and then explore millennium park in the mean time. Great location.

this is a great breakfast place - i have been 8 times in two weeks. Once 5 days in a row. Eggs have always been cooked perfect. The waffles are to die for. Wait staff is on it, the skillet meal is way to much food- i think no matter what i have, i never finish everything on my plate. Do mot forget the bacon, always perfect. Only down is the gray on biscuits- it was pasty. Go for great food without gravy.

Worth the wait!  Make sure you use the yelp app to check in ahead of time! They are highly organized are really know how to more people through without making you feel rushed. Food is great. Love the homemade corn beef hash ( pictured) . Wife had the wild berry crepe ---" to die for' .

Absolutely freaking amazing. The wait time was a little over an hour to seat my wife and I but that was expected when this place is across the street from Millennium Park (Cloud Gate too - where we went while we waited). Our server was amazing once we sat. I'd suggest sharing a plate because they're big! If I could give 6 stars, I would. Great place.

The line is long, guys. I don't know what to tell you other than to sacrifice a member of your party to get up 2 hours earlier than the rest of you to get you on the list! My friends live nearby and were able to snag me a seat for a busy Saturday brunch.

Normally, if a brunch place is hopping, the waiters and waitresses could not care less about you. Your coffee will go unfilled and you will be rushed in and out...not so with Wildberry. I was super impressed with our waitress, who went out of her way to look up dairy allergy information for me. The bus staff was also helpful and not pushy at all.

All that said, the FOOD! Wow. It looks Instagram-worthy and it tastes even better. I had a maple bacon and fig omelette; if you even vaguely like fig, you have to get this for breakfast. So creative and delicious! I'm only sad I didn't get a fancy coffee drink, after I saw those delivered to other tables.

This is my 3rd trip to Wildberry, Water Tower location.  OMGGGGG is all I can say!!!  It is something about those blueberry pancakes that keeps me coming back for MORE & MORE!!!  The older lady that ALWAYS take my order EVERYTIME is soooo polite and ALWAYS greet me with a smile!  The service and food is a WIN WIN!!!  P.S. I work in the Hancock "875 N. Michigan Ave." easy access baby!

My kids and I had breakfast here twice while visiting Chicago. I highly recommend getting on the yelp wait list if you plan on going during peak hours. My son had the cinnamon roll pancakes and said they were "better than candy!". I had the brisket hash which was delicious but could have used more gravy. My second trip I had the corned beef hash which was really favorable. I was hesitant about the chipotle hollandaise but it really made the dish - just the right amount of heat. The service was friendly and fast.

This place was worth the hype. It was a long wait but you can put in you name through yelp and they will they will text you when it is ready. The approximate time was pretty accurate.  On to the food. We got the butcher skillet and upgraded the pancakes to the berry bliss for an extra 1.50 which was worth it and the pancakes were as sweet and delicious  as advertised. The skillet had a lot of toppings and was cheesy. We also got the florentine benedict, it was good, a better than average benedict but wouldn't go out of my way for that. The pancakes make it worth a visit.

SO GOOD. We put our name down and had to wait 2 hours. We were here the weekend of Lollapalooza so it was extra packed.

It was nice that we could check our wait time on the phone. When I got there I ordered a skillet and added a wildberry pancake, very happy that it was easy to order off the menu and add that wildberry pancake. That was a must have, but the skillet just sounded so good, so I'm glad I got to try both.

Service was also very friendly! Our server was very charismatic and made the experience enjoyable.

The wait for a table was about 45 minutes. Great that they text you when the table is ready. Ordered the signature berry bliss pancakes which were AMAZING. Highly recommend it. Also got the slow roasted brisket hash. Very flavorful! Chicken and waffles was okay. Loved how the food came out super quick after ordering.

pics.caption: Berry bliss pancakes, brisket hash, chicken and waffles

review.des: Wildberry, I will see you again. At 3,000 plus reviews, I don't need to pour any more syrup on these pancakes to convince you to come here. I've been here twice on a weekday and been seated almost immediately between the 8-9 am hour. The service has been warm, helpful and never rushed. On my last visit, my sweet server even asked what plans I had for the rest of the day. It's nice to connect to others in this day and age of smartphones and looking down. I always start with hot coffee to warm me and a glass of freshly squeezed OJ because it's just so satisfying, pulp and all. You can have a field day here with the creative skillets and decadent pancake options on the menu. I adore crepes, decorated with fresh berries, a dab of butter and give me savory turkey sausage and creamy eggs scrambled perfectly lightly as requested to keep me full all morning. This is a place worth checking out, even if you have to zip up that thick coat and brave the windchill to walk here from your hotel.

pics.caption: Perfectly scrambled lightly as requested with turkey sausage

review.des:
Came here on a 10 am Sunday morning and it was a 1.5 hour wait. It was fine for us since the park was nearby and it was our first time in Chicago so we went to the bean to take some pictures. The line moved pretty fast but it was still an hour wait. The restaurant is pretty big and kind of touristy I would say.

We ordered the garden skillet & the mexican skillet. It was delicious and the portion was HUGE!! We took half of it back for breakfast tomorrow. I would recommend sharing so you can try a variety of food. The iced coffee we ordered was a little watered down though.

Overall, the food is great but I wouldn't say it's worth 1.5 hour wait. We waited since we were visiting Chicago and it had a lot of reviews on yelp. There are a lot of great brunch places in Chicago to try out so come early if you want to avoid the wait & the tourists!!

pics.caption: The mexican skillet - comes with a side of pancakes or toast (get the pancakes)

review.des: The best breakfast you will ever have!! Join the waitlist... it's worth it!!! Very well run.. even with an hour wait!!!

The New Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe on 180 East Pearson Street just east of Michigan Ave and Water Tower is really a marvelous , open with High ceilings andGood view through high glass Windows  The food is superb in good ambiance and cheerful servers !!! Excellent addition in the area Dr G on pearson Street

Amazing breakfast place in the heart of Chicago!  Right off the Magnificent Mile and next to Millennium Park.  Food so good it is worth the wait. They have a coffee stand inside the restaurant if you want to grab coffee and wait outside. The coffee served is amazing btw. They do have a patio for outdoor seating and I imagine outside seating has a longer wait.  Patio for sure only great for the summer time. Keep in mind, all the fantastic architecture of Chicago makes their outside seating shady in the morning.  

We got the berry bliss pancakes and the Espanola omelet.  You can get the omelet and upgrade your side to the signature pancake.  It was a lot of food for two people and that is only one order.  If you are very hungry then get your own order but the portions are very big. I did not need any extra syrup on the pancakes because it was so good without it.

People talking about the wait being too long, they have a check in system where they text you when your table is ready.  Go explore the park!  It's right next door.  The Bean is right there and the Art Institute is great to walk around after your very filling meal.

Fantastic pancakes. I'm not a pancake person at all, but Wildberry might be the only exception. The Signature Berry Bliss pancakes - stacks of soft, fluffy pancakes slathered with gooey, sweet and tart berry mascarpone in the middle- is not to be missed. Both the sight and taste of this amazing brunch staple is worth all the hype about this restaurant. I also shared with a friend the Venetian Sizzlin' Skillet, which is a pretty standard potato and egg skillet, nothing too special. The pancakes are unsurprisingly the star of the meal. We came on a weekday slightly before lunch rush hour, and the wait was around 10 minutes. Make sure to come prepared as the wait might get a little long!
Breakfast was well worth the wait! The staff are incredibly pleasant and create an experience that is appreciated. Great pancakes too!!

My friend that lives here recommended it And it was sooo yummy! Extremely friendly staff here that was super helpful!
We had two different Omelettes and pancakes with it and a fresh squeezed orange juice (that was REALLY fresh!!).
Loved it. I'll definitely be back!

They had a special area for us to wait for breakfast so we didn't have to wait outside in the dead of winter. The male worker working 2/10/2018 with the pony tail in the red shirt was busting his off and looked like he was working really hard. I should have told the manager we noticed he was a great employee. They texted us when the table was ready. Great food, great staff. Super busy but very efficient. Definitely will be back.

Food - some sort of fig/bacon/cheese omelette &  their poppyseed pancakes - was good.

Coffee - regular & a berry-flavored cappuccino - was great.

Service - exceptional.

Atmosphere - was meh.....  Kinda a touristy place.

And I won't return.  Why?  It's a great big city filled with lots of interesting restaurants and this one inserted b.s. into my special anniversary morning.

We were there early on a Saturday - like 6:40 am.  Aside from a bunch of singles along the wall the place was empty.  The hostess escorted us to a table right in front of the side by side kitchen and bathroom entrances.  Really?  A wide open restaurant and THAT'S the table?  I asked if we could have a different table not so close to the kitchen and she led us around a large pillar to one that was a mere one table away.  What the...  You reject two tables and suddenly you're the difficult customer, right?  Kinda like how if you're a hostess and you try to seat a couple at your two worst tables you're being a jerk.  So we sat.  

...except it wasn't merely an issue of aesthetics.  This was a LOUD kitchen.  My husband wears hearing aids and so that kind of clattering is seriously a problem.  Because we didn't want to make a fuss about a table we ended up spending our clattery breakfast in conversational silence.  Happy Anniversary.

I get that SOMEONE has to sit in the bad tables but it was too early and the restaurant too empty for a hostess to already be so weary of special requests that she jerks people around.

I think this was the best breakfast of my entire life...

I was visiting Chicago for the first time, and my boyfriend and I showed up here around 10am for a nice breakfast. Best decision of the trip. They said the wait would be 30 minutes, which we were fine with, but it was really more like 10 minutes before we were seated. Score!

I was having such a hard time choosing between the omelettes and pancakes when I read the fine print for the skillets - "served with toast or pancakes." That's right, substitute your toast for nice fluffy pancakes AT NO CHARGE, or some of their fancy pancakes for $1. Is that not the best deal ever?!

I got a massive, well-priced Denver skillet with buttermilk pancakes. I asked for extra cheese and they definitely listened, and I'm pretty sure they didn't charge me for it :) I had no chance of finishing it, soooo much food. My boyfriend and I probably could have split one skillet and done 2 orders of pancakes. Basically, it was amazing and if I am ever in Chicago again I will be coming back here first. It's crowded but the location near Cloud Gate was awesome for a tourist like myself.

pics.caption: Denver skillet with extra cheese and buttermilk pancakes

review.des: This was my first stop after I landed and got into town from the train. After a short walk on a muggy morning, I got there and was quickly seated (early on a weekday morning). It's a very bustling, modern restaurant. Very clean inside and staff was extremely friendly. After reading the Yelp reviews, I went w the Denver skillet and the berry bliss pancakes. Everything was delicious, not overly expensive and filling. It's was a great way to start my visit in Chicago.

Before going, use Yelp to get on the waiting list. This will cut down on your wait. The breakfast beverages were fresh. The hot chocolate reminded me of fine chocolate from Godiva. I didn't feel like experimenting with flavored pancakes so I opted for the buttermilk. Your meal comes with butter but it's not needed on these pancakes. You might want to request that the hash browns be cooked a bit extra if you like them crispy. The skillet was great though I had to add salt and pepper for seasoning. I chose this place over visiting Yolk and I didn't regret the decision.

Lovely place to brunch right next to millenium park. Food is delicious and service quick and friendly (once the looooong wait is over: 1.5-2 hours for a Saturday 1030-1100 table). The pancakes are a must of course and you won't be disappointed. I also got the vanilla berry latte but it was a tad too sweet for my taste. Portions are huge, especially the skillets. Be prepared for some serious carb coma afterwards.

pics.caption: Denver skillet and signature berry bliss pancakes

review.des:
Damn good brunch. I love brunch so I know what I'm talking about. I decided to drop by before my adventure of the day. They are on this app called no wait. It's actually the best way to get in line without being there.

Anyways, I ended up getting in line a few minutes before getting to the restaurant. It's popular, but it's pretty easy to get in. There's a lot of turnover and the space is pretty big so the wait isn't too bad.

I ordered so much food - or what felt like so much food. I got the mexicana skillet and the berry bliss pancakes per the yelp reviews. Since I was able to add on the berry bliss pancakes to the skillet, I decided why not - go big for vacation or go home. The Mexicana skillet was pretty good. Hash brown, cheese, sausage, japaleno, avocado, and onions. I'll be honest, I didn't find the avocado, but the sausage, cheese and hash browns made it a great dish. I also got the eggs over easy meaning that I could have my eggs all oozy. I love them like that.

The berry bliss pancakes were awesome. It was like a berry pancake - rather than just blueberry pancakes. Lots of berries on top too!

Protip: get the app no wait to put your name on the list and berry bliss pancakes!

Fantastic food! I was visiting Chicago and found this place on yelp. So glad we came in. You won't leave hungry and the service was great!
Remember to use the wait time app to check in before you get there because the line is long. Enjoy!!!
Delicious food everything I been other there is fantastic. Pancakes are really good. The french toast is enormous and taste amazing. Orange juice is 100% natural and omelets ares also great.

Out of the handful of places I ate in Chicago, this was probably my favorite. As expected, the wait was horrible. I used the no wait app to cut short the wait time, but the wait still felt super long.

However, once my boyfriend and I got our food, it was so worth it. I ordered the berry bliss pancakes. My boyfriend ordered the mexicana skillet. The portions were both huge and so delicious.  We were both surprised at how good the food tasted despite how constantly busy the place was.

I will definitely eat here again if I'm ever in town and highly recommend it to all of my family and friends.

We arrived with a party of five (plus luggage) on a weekday morning and were seated pretty quickly, considering. Our waiter, Jeremy, was high-energy, gracious, and beyond friendly. You will not regret asking to be seated in his section. The food is incredible and you get a lot of it, so come with an appetite. I got eggs, has browns, sausage, and substituted the pancakes for banana chocolate chip French toast. A LOT OF FOOD! But it was absolutely delicious.
Love it! Got here at 0700 hrs and got right in. The gluten free pancakes were fantastic.  Would definitely recommend and we will be back.

We headed to downtown chicago to do some site seeing and were in millennium park when my fiance mentioned he was hungry. Well, luckily we were right near wildberry! My fiance was worried about the wait for brunch, but we walked in and were seated right away.

Our server was nice, and she knew the menu well. However, the menu was slightly confusing. For instance, I ordered the veggie omelet and until it was explained we were confused as to what it came with. I could get it with hashbrowns WITH toast OR pancakes, but I could not do hashbrowns and fruit. But I could do fruit with toast OR pancakes. Fiance got the hashbrowns and pancakes.

Food was good. I liked that they brought over a little tray when you sat down of butter, syrups, etc. Large portions, not that that's a bad thing. But worth your money. Definitely do brunch here if you are in the area.
Always amazing breakfast ! My co workers meet before work as early as 7am just to eat here.
Wouldn't make a special trip.  45 minute to an hour wait. Yolk is closer to me and tastier!  Pancakes were very good! Plenty of food and good coffee.  Nice wait staff.

The food is to die for!
The location is great!
Customer service is outstanding!
I would recommend it to anyone
Fast and friendly service! The pancakes were absolutely amazing!! Get here early because I guarantee there will be a wait.

If you are ever in Chicago, the wait is worth it. This place is legit.

For a party of nine, we waited for about one hour on a Friday morning. While waiting, you can order beverages like coffee & tea. & also goodies like banana/strawberry/red velvet bread. I decided to sip on an almond hazelnut latte. It was the perfect way to start the morning.

I ordered the Fresca omelette with fresh fruit and the Signature Berry Bliss pancakes. The signature berry bliss pancakes are everything you can ever dream about. They were delicious and fluffy. I will probably dream about these pancakes until the next time I can get my hands on some. Please open a location in Atlanta!!

This place has the most amazing brunch I've had, I came back two times in a four day visit. During my first visit I got the signature blueberry pancakes, which really fulfilled my dessert craving. The second visit, I got the breakfast burrito sans chorizo and it was so amazing. The eggs were the perfect balance between fluffy and firm and the salsa they gave for it was delicious. I also ordered a hazelnut latte with soymilk which was excellent as well. One thing I feel that is extremely underrated are their fries. My sister had ordered a veggie burger which was incredible too but the fries are some of the best fries I've had in my life. They were so crispy on the outside but so soft on the inside. Ask for their chipotle ranch as well. You will not regret it. One pointer for avoiding the 2 hour wait on the weekends is definitely the No Wait app, so you can put in your name and get there 10-15 min before your party is called.

Their breakfast is exceptionally good considering how touristy the area is. The lines are long so I recommend you grab one of the pager thingys and walk around the area instead of standing there and wait. So what's so good about this place besides everyone's hype? How many ways can we cook breakfast food that keeps us coming back for more? Well, I think their signature berry pancakes is really the reason to come to this place. I had pancakes with that smooth yet soft texture before, but never done so well like they do it. I think this has something to do with their pancake mix. My only complaint about their pancakes is the fruit that they randomly put in. How can I complain about fruits if it's out of their control to grow it? Well, since they called it berry pancakes they should think about the sweetness and quality of fruits and how it affects their pancakes which they did not do. Otherwise, this is an awesome pancake overall. If you are deciding whether or not to try this place and wondering their pancakes are really worth the 2 hour wait. My answer to you is no, unless you have nothing better to do in an awesome town like Chicago.

We went to have breakfast at this place on our trip. Its usually really crowded, so I would recommend using Yelp checkin feature to reserve a table before you go. Their food is really good and filling. Must go when you are in Chicago! Its also walking distance to the Cloud Gate.

I ordered a skillet and a side of their signature pancakes. Everything was served super fast and it was delicious. I loved the berry spread on the pancakes and the skillet had loads of cheese which I also love. The coffee was great and I would definitely go back!

pics.caption: Skillet (forget which one!) and the signature wildberry pancakes

review.des: What a happy friendly place. After a short wait, I was seated and order taken quite promptly.  The waitress, Kim, was enchanting, cute and efficient.  The omelette, that I slightly modified with no issues, arrived, and it was even better than my highest expectations.  Despite the usual waiting time at this place, I would encourage anyone in the N. Michigan Ave area to go try an omelette, pancakes, or a skillet at this awesome breakfast place.
Wildberry is a great place for breakfast. I love, love, love the fun childish breakfasts. Also really enjoyed the brisket skillet. Hope I can get back soon.

Fabulous!  Surprise yourself!  The pancakes are exceptional. Eggs Benedict with a big hunk of ham steak and a mound of delicious hash browns. The prices are a bit lower than nearby restaurants, like Yolk. The food is arguably better. It's a bit noisy. There's an upstairs seating area-with a washroom. There's only one down on the main floor and it has one toilet. I foresee it as an issue because it's next to a wait station that has an air fresher on it!  Lol. There's nowhere to wait. It's fabulous for the neighborhood and the shopping tourists. It's wonderful to sit and look out of the big windows and view my neighborhood and Eli's Park. I'm thrilled.

This was the most underwhelming breakfast of my whole Chicago trip!

CG and I arrived around 11 on a Monday. We expected a long wait due to its convenient location to Millennium Park and exceptional reviews. 25 minute wait. Not bad.

I decided on the egg white veggie skillet with a side of their signature berry bliss pancakes. The veggie skillet was an incredibly large portion, loaded with hash plus broccoli, peppers, onions, asparagus and tomatoes topped with a heap of egg white. I was expecting more of a sizzling skillet with crisp hash and sauteed veggies but such was not the case. The skillet was baked(not a big deal really) but it wasn't seasoned whatsoever and totally bland. Boo. It had so much potential! I ended up loading on the ketchup to save it.

The pancakes were equally underwhelming. For a spot known for their pancakes, I expected them to incorporate the ingredients into the batter of the pancake. Instead, the ingredients were just nicely decorated on top. Soo, the kitchen basically makes a ton of standard pancakes and tops it off to order. CG's side of oreo pancakes came with just a sprinkle of crushed oreos. Such a let down! In addition, the pancakes were really flat and kind of spongey. The coulis also tasted very artificial. Bah.

Service was just fine but I can't say the same about the food. Belly was full but not satisfied. Oh well.

This place was amazing! We had to wait about an hour, but that wasn't a problem since we had to wait to check in to our hotel. After 4 days of enjoying ourselves at Chicago's Lollapalooza, we were in need of refueling to enjoy the rest of our vacation. We found it here. I got the Mexicana skillet with the berry bliss pancakes, freaking amazing! The two paired well and I enjoyed the mango lemonade. My partner, had her usual egg whites, hash browns and strawberry pancakes and bacon. She's a picky eater but she devoured every bite. Plus they asked if you want your bacon crispy or medium.... we've never been asked that. (We prefer crispy) So if you're here in Chicago, come and eat here. You won't be disappointed!

pics.caption: Everything was amazing. Worth the wait!

review.des: Great food good service.  French Toast is good better than others I tried in the city.  Omelette's were good I had the veggie but forgot to add cheese still good.  My wife added goat cheese and turkey bacon and it was amazing!  My daughter went Nutzzzz with the pancakes.  Mochas were excellent!!!

Pancakes are just as fluffy and amazing as everyone says. We dined here on a weekday morning, which meant the wait was only 20-30 minutes. Totally worth it! Portions are big and appropriately priced. Happy to check this place out after it's been on my Chicago bucket list for 2.5 years.

pics.caption: Corned beef hash benny and a side of the signature berry bluss pancakes

review.des: Great breakfast and service! We will definitely return! The Denver skillet, Mexican skillet, caramel latte were all really good. The portion was huge so we couldn't finish. Our waitress was very nice and attentive.

My six year old loved the chocolate chip pancakes! Usually just order him the regular pancakes, but thought I would give him a surprise and he sure loved it! I went on Monday and there were still a lot of people but the wait was only 15 minutes. They say is pretty fast.

Had the Florence Benedict. Halfway through I bite into a eggshell, soon after followed by a really gross taste in my mouth. I spat it out into my napkin! My appetite soon spoiled however still I wasn't remotely satisfied with the food at all. I'd added salt and pepper and hot sauce to help but it was overall just not good. The spinach had no flavor, the hollandaise sauce had no tanginess to it, barely any salt, no flavor. Like whipped mayo with no black pepper, lemon juice,  just blah. I tried the fried chicken and waffles and it was SUPER DRY. It was no moistness that made your chew an easy swallow. Not worth the 4.5 stars at all. The flavors are bland and whoever is preparing this food is doing so on the safe side. This is not a meal that'll I'll talk about for times to come. If you want to know how to do breakfast and brunch right call Green Eggs Cafe located in Aventura, FL. They do it ALL RIGHT. Good food isn't Great food if it only looks good and isn't flavorful, just good for photos. Please do better. My Chia Latte was good though. A manage later came and took the meal off the bill. I won't be running back here anytime soon. Sorry not sorry.

pics.caption: Spat my food out into that napkin there after chomping into an eggshell with the most rancid taste to follow. Appetite ruined.
Flavorlesssssss. Chomped into an eggshell. It looks good, but don't fool yourself. This is for the most basic of pallets.
Dry dry dryyyyyyyyyyyy. Change the batter.

review.des: Very nice place. Fast, friendly, efficient service. Made to get you in and out without rushing you. Food was good with generous portions. Only thing that was a disappointment was the Hollandaise sauce. It was flat and with little flavor. If I had more time here in Chicago and there weren't lots of other breakfast places to try, I would come back here again.

Mixed berry pancakes and waffles were delicious. Omelettes and skillets were satisfying and comforting, full of flavor and you can taste the fresh ingredients. Waiter was very thorough, attentive, and made sure we got our order in a timely manner since we were catching a flight.

What I love about this spot is the Waitlist feature on Yelp. You can put your name on the list, do something while you wait, and view your wait time in real-time. What's also nice is the video display of random art work which was entertaining as well.

Wait times can get ridiculous but at least you can wander around while you wait (tbh I'm not sure the wait is worth it, for me... but the food is definitely deserving of five stars, so here we are). The amount of food you get is also ridiculous - I always get two (large) meals out of one visit.

Lots of creative pancake flavors and you can upgrade the pancakes that come with other dishes to one of their specialty ones for a small price, which is nice.

The food is great, but the wait time is ridiculously long.

If you are willing to wait 1 or 1 1/2 hours to get in, it's worth it. The pancakes are delicious, as well as the brisket hash. Everything we've ordered has been awesome.

There are many times we've gone elsewhere only because of the wait. It's across the street from Millennium Park, so if you get one of those beepers, you can waste time there OR you can walk off all those calories.

This is a breakfast/lunch place. So, forget about dinner.
The line is horrible doesnt worth the wait ... but coffee is good  so if u wanna wait for an hour go ahead!

My husband received a gift certificate for this place for his birthday, so we returned.

He's vegetarian and found meat in his omelette. I think we're 2/4 with meat-in-vegetarian omelettes at Wildberry now. Our server was apologetic, but ffs, this isn't what we pay for (though I guess this time, we didn't...).

I ordered oatmeal and told the server I didn't need the brown sugar that came with it. What arrived was the saddest pile of lukewarm, gluey oatmeal I have ever had in my life. Moreover, our server didn't bring any of the other condiments that were listed with the oatmeal on the menu. It took me 5 min to flag him down and get the milk and raisins.

The servers have always been extremely friendly and nice, but the kitchen is obviously volume-driven. With the cramped and noisy seating, it's just a demoralizing experience.

Tip: Don't use the NoWait app, just find a better restaurant.
Good breakfast spot.  The food is very fresh. I enjoyed my food.  It's just not the type of place I'm dying to visit again anytime soon.

Awesome breakfast in the mornings. Has all the typical menu items with a bit of a twist. Try to go on a weekday as the wait is not as bad. It gets really tough on the weekends especially in the loop location, but if you have the time the food is worth the wait.

We absolutely enjoyed this restaurant while on vacation in Chicago. It is definitely in restaurant in high demand, so go knowing that you may be looking at a 30 to 40 minute wait to be seated. The western skillet was absolutely fantastic. I also enjoyed the vanilla berry latte. We will totally be going back when we head back to the Windy City.

Wildberry is the type of restaurant that deserves preparation both for its delicious flavors and massive portions. A breakfast/brunch spot located in a great spot just on the north end of millennium park, Wildberry delivers with a menu stacked with every breakfast food imaginable and more. The portions on their entrees, particularly on skillets, pancakes, and French toast, is not to be underestimated and can easily provide the fill of 2-2.5 meals. Everything on the menu is absolutely delicious and the service staff is friendly and helpful. Some highlights and must haves include bottomless lemonade (I still have yet to try every flavor - but I'm close) and the wild berry pancakes (which I recommend getting as a side order to your main dish to reduce the portion size). Despite plenty of space and tables, be prepared to wait for your food! Wildberry is massively popular and doesn't take reservations. If you get up very early you can find waits under 30 minutes but if you want to eat at 10 am I would recommend being there to put your name in around 7:45 or 8 (this can vary but it's better to be on the safe side). Despite the potential wait times Wildberry is an amazing breakfast/brunch spot that is perfect after a long Friday or Saturday night. To this day I still have Wildberry to thank for the best food coma I've ever had!

Not sure if I would wait the 2 hour for this place. Though we did get here at around 8AM and only had to wait an hour.

Pro Tip: They will text you when your time is near. So while you wait I suggest venturing around the city, or even Millennium Park!

I ordered the Butcher Block Skillet (~$11) with the side of pancakes: 5/5 There was so much food for a reasonable price. The pancakes were one of the best pancakes I have ever eaten. Fluffy and not overbearing with the milk. It was the perfect combination. The skillet itself was super yummy and ingredients tasted fresh.

My boyfriend created his own omelette. Something that really did surprise me though was how fluffy the eggs were. Didn't taste heavy at all.

The freshly squeezed orange juice was a nice drink to complement the meal. I appreciate that it tasted like they hand-squeezed rather than putting the whole orange through a processed machine.

I'm a brunch fan is my favorite and this place did not disapoint.

The place seems a little over-hyped! Its right next to the park which was nice to eat and walk over. Food wise its pretty normal for a diner nothing wowi or extra special. Staff is nice and friendly. In all honesty, we came by here only because we knew we was going to the park after breakfast and didn't want to uber to two locations.

Feeling like I'm Yolk traitor for digging this breakfast spot soooo muchh ...

My girlfriend was visiting from LA. After trying Yolk the day before, we wanted to try a new spot. We saw the 4.5 stars on yelp and had to see if it was worth the 4.5 stars.. OH YEAAA IT WAS ... plus the half an hour wait on a thursday morning!

--  m e x i c a n   s k i l l e t --
Hot skillet with chorizo, jalepeno, hash brown, cheese, eggs, and all that gooood good. It was like a fiesta in my mouth. More than enough food for 2 people to share. Comes with a side of pancakes (I upgraded to the tiramisu pancake for extra $1.50)

-- t i r a m i s u   p a n c a k e --
BOMBDIGGITYYY. It doesn't taste like a true tiramisu cake, but that pancake was so moist, flavorful. I don't really have a sweet tooth, but I finished that bad boy.  

[ T I P S ]
- Come early! Lines get long! (The bean is across the street, so you can visit it while you're waiting)
- Portion sizes are HUGEEE!! Sharing is the best way to go!

Besides the long wait, I love this place. Got the fig omelette but I wasn't to impressed. What made this review so high is the yummy pancakes. Well duh, that's what there name is all about. I try to come here at least once a week.
The wait is a little long but it's worth it!! The best pancakes ever!  We order the cinnamon roll, stawberry poppy and their signature berry pancake they were all so delicious!!

Conveniently located next to the The Bean. There was quite a wait so we went and visited the park and came back when they text us which was a nice way to burn time.

Had an average breakfast of eggs, hash browns, and was happy with the turkey sausage. Big portions enough to share. My boyfriend had the blueberry pancakes and they were very light and fluffy.

There are so many good brunch places in Chicago downtown, but when we moved to the suburbs, we couldn't find a good brunch place in the burbs.

Enter Wildberry - fast service, great food and a ton of options.  

Only issue is it gets rather busy so be prepared to wait.

Personal favorites: los altos Benedict, Mexicana skillet and the signature blueberry bliss pancakes
Goshhhh their food is to die for! Service on point. I've been there a while ago so don't remember name of my dish but it was delicious! Me, hubby and few of my friends really enjoyed that place!

I was exited to try this place in Chicago. I used the NoWait ap so we would not have to wait. The reason for four stars instead of five is because we still had to wait a long time. We got there on time and still had to wait over 30 more minutes and was seated when we finally said something to the host for the third time. They kept saying we would be next but kept seating others in front of us with no explanation. This went on for 20 minutes, after they said we would be next. If there was adequate waiting space it may not have been as annoying but people were tripping over each over with standing room only. It makes it very hot when you have all the winter clothing on your body. So hot hungry people are not a good combo. That said, once we said something the third time the host was able to seat us right away. Once seated the wait staff and bus staff were fantastic. They work like crazy to keep up with the tables. Food came out very fast and was delicious! Kudos to the chef. Best crepes I have had since working at Village Inn Pancake House in my youth and of course my husband and two daughters' famous Mothers Day crepes. I will probably come back but be ready for having to wait a lot more time than expected even using NoWait ap. Maybe there was a glitch, but better communication would have been nice instead of "you will be next please move aside" and then not being next for at least 20-25 more minutes while dozens of people were being seated in front of you.

Thank you Yelp for showing me this great breakfast spot.

The wait time was not bad at all, only 10 min and the services was just as fast! I tried their corned beef and hash and it tasty. You can tell its fresh has towns (always a plus) and fresh corned beef. The eggs cooked perfectly and the server kept the coffee refills on point. Great environment and friendly staff as well.

pics.caption: Corned beef and hash with 2 eggs and a side of bacon. Definitely hit the spot

review.des:
Let me start off by saying, WILDBERRY IS WORTH THE 2 HOUR WAIT!!!! Don't leave when you hear the wait time, it gives you a chance to explore the most beautiful city! I mean, millennium is right across from it!

Yes, I waited 2 hours and no, I don't regret it! We even got some great seats outside in this beautiful weather!

The service was great and friendly!

The food was amazing!! I got the Rutherford Omelette which I highly highly highly recommend! It has spinach, caramelized onions, bacon, and goat cheese!!!!! Such a great balance of flavors and textures in this massive omelette! The hash browns were kind of bland, but with a little bit of salt and pepper, it's totally fine! I also got the famous Berry Bliss pancakes, which were scrumptious as well! It has berries inside the pancakes, a creamy mascarpone custard on top and berry coulis on top! Yummy!!

My cousin got The Garden skillet, which I had a couple of bites of! It was yummy and had melted cheddar over a bath of vegetables and had browns, all topped with two eggs! It came in the cutest "plate" too! And she also had the Oreo S'mores pancakes to go with it, which are her favorite and she definitely recommends!

Only complaint is the small orange juice was 3.50, which I think is pretty expensive!

Definitely worth the wait for this awesome breakfast place!

pics.caption: The skillet plate is so cute!
The Rutherford Omelette with the Berry Bliss pancakes in the background!

review.des: Fast seating and delicious braakfast. Great recommendation from friends. I must on my list of places to eat!

I've been to many brunch places and this one is my favorite! A huge menu with a big variety to choose from. I'm always looking for something savory and something sweet so this was perfect. Use the Nowait app to get in line! Super fast and excellent service! There were two waters (one with ice and one without) at our tables before we were seated and we drank it without thinking. There was still a check on the table so we thought they were left over waters from the party before. We were assured they weren't by the friendly staff. Service is great until the very end. Minus 2 stars for finding a big clump of dish sponge scrubber in my pancakes... good thing i didn't get sick. Honestly, the food is to die for (no pun intended.. I'm still alive!), so I'll still be coming back

pics.caption: packed the pancakes to-go and found this in my pancakes later... wth
Veggie omelette with hash browns and the Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes!

review.des: Food was fantastic! I got their main special Wildberry pancakes and I loved them. They were fluffy and so yummy. It has a fairly long wait time but you get notified when your table is ready by cell phone and that was good so we could go sit a little ways away from the crowds. But the wait is well worth it! If you haven't been. I recommend.
This place was worth the wait. Yelp waitlist feature made it so much easier. Food was amazing!

Hello brunch, we meet again!

New city, same favorite meal of the day. I was ecstatic upon discovering that I would be staying inches from one of Chi-town's best brunch spots. We brunched on a Sunday afternoon and it was jam packed. The wait was 45 mins for two people, so we took our pager across the street and people watched at Millennium Park. Our pager went off after 25 mins and we weren't complaining.

We ordered a short-stack of the multigrain fig and walnut pancakes with a side of seasonal fruit. The pancakes were scrumptious! Fig+walnut is the perfect combo. I've had some multigrain pancakes that were either too dry or firm. These were neither, they were perfectly moist and soft. Of course, nothing like buttermilk either, but a very healthy and delicious alternative.

The seasonal fruit contained bananas, strawberries, one single grape, cantaloupe and pineapple. I honestly just needed some fiber that morning, but the fruit was extremely fresh, sweet and ripe.

We also ordered the Mexican Skillet to balance out all the sweetness from the pancakes/fruit. Let me just say, I felt right at home consuming it. Avocado + Cheese + Jalapenos + Chorizo = HEAVEN.  In my opinion the skillet is huge, it can easily be shared amongst two people. It's on the spicier side, so try it before drowning it in hot sauce.

Service was great, our waitress was attentive without being overbearing. We appreciated that because they were very busy that morning.  

We left with warm/happy tummies! I would def recommend this place, but if you're coming with a large group come early or be prepared to wait. Also, come with a strong appetite, servings are ample!

This was the best breakfast every I would highly recommend download the app to wait in line! When we got there we waited about 10 mins to be seated rather than 2 hours like some of the people who were still waiting. The skillet was amazing everything was cooked to perfection I just got the regular pancakes and they were so good I felt like they could have been dessert! I will Definitely be back to try more yummy food.

Three words: cinnamon roll pancakes.

I don't even LIKE breakfast foods very much, but I make an exception here. The food is fresh and the service is quick once you sit down.

I heard these were the best pancakes on earth, and judging by my meals in Chicago leading up to this point, I had no reason to doubt it...

I arrived around 11:30am on a Saturday and the wait was crazy. I was told an hour and 15 minutes and it ended up being exactly that. Luckily this restaurant is located right across the street from millennium park, so I hung over there for an hour and did the tourist thing.

After finally sitting, things moved very fast. I ordered the buttermilk pancakes, corned beef hash and applewood smoked bacon. The bacon and corned beef hash were excellent. Definitely some of the best corned beef hash I've ever had. The pancakes were very good, but definitely not the best I've ever had. They were cooked perfectly, but just weren't the home run I was expecting from a taste standpoint.

The verdict on this place is definitely one of recommendation. However, pending your life experience with pancakes, come into it knowing the meal with be delicious but debatable in terms of being the best ever.

Also highly recommend coming as soon as they open unless you don't mind waiting an hour minimum. This place is jam packed with people waiting by the entrance and outside of you come near peak brunch time around 12pm. Aside from that, definitely a must try.
Food was really good, I had the Fresca omelette and the regular pancakes.  Portion sizes are big.  Service was quick and efficient.  Staff were all friendly.

Not worth the wait. Great pancakes, but the poor service superseded our breakfast. Otherwise, amazing hostess and friendly staff. I'd recommend heading elsewhere for great food and even better service!!!  You'll be happy you didn't wait!
It's just your average breakfast spot.  Nothing great other than location.  Food is average.
Very good staff and food was just as good. I only stressed over the time from entrance to being sat, then waited on. The cheque was quickly announced and paying & leaving very fast..

Get here early, get your name in and go walk around the area while you wait (they'll text you).  Service was good and signature berry crepes, to die for.  Not too sweet, but just the right amount of fruit mixed with crepey goodness.  I finished my plate of 3, but just barely.  It was interesting to watch the people walk by on the street above.  If you can, get outdoor seating!!

Good place for a breakfast in Chicago.

WAIT: Check in BEFOREHAND on the NoWait app.  If i had known it would have saved us 30 minutes of waiting.  We came on a Monday at 11:30 am and for a group of 6 we still had to wait 30 minutes.  After being seated we ordered and the food came out fairly quickly.

ATMOSPHERE: it's cheery inside with bright windows, there is also an outside patio area with umbrellas to shade from the sun.  We got a nice booth by the back room.

FOOD: What I like is that they give you big portions, and it always includes either hashbrowns, toast or pancakes and you are only paying about $11-12!

BUTCHER BLOCK SKILLET - 3 or 4 types of meats (sausage, ham, bacon etc.) on top of hash browns, 2 cheeses and 2 eggs.  It's definitely a lot but if you were hungry enough you could finish it.  I chose to get the buttermilk pancakes on the side.  Their special wildberry pancakes looked a little sweet with the syrups on top and the fruit.  But my friends said it actually wasn't that sweet.

BUTTERMILK PANCAKES - not bad, they were actually fairly crispy on the outside so not overly fluffy or mushy.  With the syrup they tasted good.  I would say try the pancakes, they were pretty good.

Overall, definitely worth coming to if you dont have to wait more than 30 minutes.  Anymore than that and I'm not sure if I would want to.  Their food isn't mind blowing but it's good, big portions, decent price and lots of options.
Wow!!  The BEST pancakes I've ever tasted!  We waited a long time in the cold for a table, but definitely worth it!

Loved the berry bliss waffles and cinnamon roll pancakes that my friend got! SO good! The wait was super long, so we used the no wait app and that worked great, so we could come when the table was ready. Will definitely come back!

Take a pass on Wildberry, it is completely overrated.  If you are looking for a loud, crowded restaurant with mediocre food, by all means. I was completely underwhelmed by the menu selection and food was just poorly done. I should have known when even their coffee was bitter and over priced.  Our waitress was great but that was the best part of our visit. My food was bland,  tasteless and looked awful. Their description set improper expectations and what I got shouldn't have left the kitchen. The sausage gravy wasn't awful, but there was something about it I can't place. It wasn't very good despite a good amount of sausage and a good consistency. My wife had the eggs Benedict and it looked good at least. The eggs tasted like pure salt though. They put way too much salt in the poaching water.  She couldn't finish her meal and I sent my be back. Needless to say we won't be back. Save yourself a wait, it isn't worth it.

Great restaurant close by Millenium Park and the famous Chicago Bean.
The Cinnamon roll pancakes were absolutely delicious!! The Ham and Cheddar scramble was also good, but nothing could compare to the melt in your mouth scrumptiousness of those pancakes.
Friendly and quick service made it the perfect place to start our day in Chicago.
Be sure to add your name to the waitlist through Yelp. We did it, and even though there were 13 ahead of us when we added our name, our table was ready just as we walked in.

Had a 45 minute wait on a Friday morning, but I guess that is to be expected in the city. Ordered the banana cream pancakes which looked amazing when they came out, but Wow!, they tasted much better than they even looked. Liked how the banana cream sauce was layered between each pancake, just wish there were more fresh bananas. Service was good, food came out fast.

We came here on a Thursday around lunch and there was no line. Thankfully no line since I don't think it would be worth a long wait. I would rate it slightly better than iHop, well the pancakes are definitely better, but overall the food just not that special.  Food portions are HUGE! We had a Denver skillet and the signature bliss pancakes (as a side). The skillet was in the dry side and the pancake was good, fluffy and sweet. Hash browns wee also good, crispy, not dry.  I liked the flavored lemonade but was too sweet for my bf. Service is fine, not great.

Passed my expectations on every front. And my expectations were already high after reading these yelp reviews! Everything was phenomenal. Our wait was only 5 minutes which I was really worried about after reading about 2 hour wait horror stories. Our waitress was adorable and engaging without being overbearing. We pulled out all the stops since this was one of our local chow highlights of our trip to Chicago and we were not disappointed. We both ordered skillets with the upgrade to specialty pancakes, shared a side of biscuits and gravy, and the wildberry OJ and our bill was under $50. We were shocked at how affordable it was even when we spared no expense. Don't leave without trying the Wildberry pancakes. It's what they're known for and with good reason. We will definitely be back anytime we're in Chicago. Only thing that would've made it better was if they had mimosas but even without them this place was easily 5 stars.

The food came fast and was delicious. We had a sweet and attentive waitress. I had the eggs, hash browns, and berry granola pancakes. Everything was perfectly cooked.  My friend had the cinnamon roll French toast. She kept commenting how it wasnt overly sweet like she feared it might be. It had the perfect balance of flavors. Id definitely go again. Ensure you use the wait list though since the lines are very long.

I have returned to Wildberry once again to try one of their well loved dishes....pancakes.  I tested out the Tiramisu pancakes.  Now, I've also tried out their signature Berry Bliss ones as well.  I have to say Wildberry definitely rocks with pancakes.  

As for the Tiramisu, they aren't super sweet and have a nice balance of flavor. I do admit that I enjoyed the Berry Bliss ones better.  Even saying that, I can still say the pancakes were well done.

Next time, I might give myself a food coma with the Oreo pancakes.  :)

This place does not disappoint! Service was quick and responsive, and the pancakes - oh my stars! I had the cinnamon roll stack w/side of bacon and it was heaven on earth! Light and fluffy pancakes with salty and crunchy bacon - the perfect sweet and salty combo! The portion size is generous. You will leave satisfied and happy!

I honestly don't see anything special about this place. Pancakes were mediocre, coffee tasted burnt, our waiter left our drinks empty for 10+ minutes. I wouldn't go back, Yolk is a much better experience with better food. Oh well!
