Pros:
Good hash browns.
Cons:
Wait staff.
No wait area, super crowded while waiting for a table.
Coffee.

This was our first time visiting while on vacation. We were  not sure about waiting an hour for a breakfast place but it was well worth it! Orange juice was delicious, huge portions and the fluffiest eggs ever!

This has to be the busiest breakfast place in Chicago on a Saturday morning - HIGHLY recommend using the Waitlist app feature (people were waiting in line for 1.5 hrs).
To the food: Started with a hot cafe mocha (no whipped cream) very descent just a tad too big for my preference.

Ordered the Napa Fig Omelette and replaced the sides with Fresh Berries pancakes. Portions were generous. Got my food in under 5 minutes!

Omelette was a bit over cooked but flavorful - enjoyed it. Pancakes were also good (8:10)

I would bring friends and family back for sure. Not a place to have business breakfast

pics.caption: Napa Fig Omelette, wild berries pancakes

review.des: The food was fresh and delicious.  Huge portions. The wait was ridiculous.   The service was awesome.  Sophia rocked.  Put your name on the list ahead of time.

Went here on a Saturday when Lollapalooza was on. We had a LONG LONG 1.5 hour wait. But it was all worth it.

-Had their Strawberry Mango smoothie first which was fresh
-For the main course, I took the Espinoza, which had a wonderful blend of avocado, sausage, cheese and other stuff.

Massive portions as expected of a breakfast place. The staff is friendly as well. I just hope the speed of service is improved a bit, as it took quite a while to get the food

pics.caption: Wildberry pancakes and Espinoza. So good!

review.des: This was the best part of my Chicago visit. Thankful I read the reviews and made a reservation using the app, so when we got there we only had to wait a few minutes.  Everything was excellent. They should open a location in Miami :)

We tried to eat here several times while in Chicago and finally braved the wait time! It was SO worth it. We both ordered pancakes, my husband had the wild berry and I had the cinnamon roll. Talk about breakfast orgasm. These pancakes were beyond perfection. So incredibly amazing and worth the long wait! Will definitely return the next time I'm in Chicago!

My husband and I went here for our last meal in Chicago before returning back to CA. I expected a long wait and on a Monday morning it only took about 30 mins until we got a table. Luckily there was an esspreso bar to order coffee and fresh baked goods while we waited so we ordered two coffees and a delicious slice of Srawberry bread. It was very moist and the perfect snack to hold us over.

For our entrees, my husband ordered the Napa Valley Fig omelet and I ordered The Garden Skillet with egg whites and a side of buttermilk pancakes. Both came with very large portions and I only ate about half of mine because I got full fast. The pancakes were some of the best I have ever had, even though they were just basic Buttermilk. Very flavorful and fluffy, just the way I like them! I really like how they bring you all the condiments you would like: whipped butter, syrup, berry preserves and some ketchup for the hashbrowns. I highly suggest putting some butter and preserves on the pancakes as they make a perfect combination of flavors. My husband was very impressed by his omelet and was very happy I suggested Wildberry. There's no coincidence it is the highest rated place for breakfast and lunch in the Windy City!

pics.caption: Garden skillet with egg whites. So many delicious veggies and hashbrowns!!
Side of the fluffiest Buttermilk pancakes

review.des: If you're gonna get brunch in Chicago, there are a lot of really good places. This, unfortunately, is nothing special. Not bad--just not up to the hype. I had an omelette (which was dry), toast (which was good) and fruit (canned). The iced mocha was alright, but overall it reminded me of breakfast at an airport restaurant.

Is it possible to be this excited about pancakes?

Get the "Wildberry" Pancakes with the creme anglaise. OMG. Heaven.

The scrambled eggs, cheddar and ham are my go-to-Paleo meal but will is always broken by those darn pancakes - THEY ARE SO GOOD! - and I don't even like pancakes that much.

First trip back to Wildberry after a couple of years. Food was just as amazing as I remembered!

Got there around 9:30 am on Sunday with 2 friends. There were people waiting all over the place, as expected. Can't believe people were dumb enough to keep blocking the revolving door and then look at you funny as you push through... Anyway, they quoted me 1-1.25  hours and said they would shoot me a text. Turns out it only took 35 minutes and we had to run back over from Maggie Daley Park!

Went with the Mexicana skillet (loaded with eggs, cheese, peppers, chorizo, etc...) and a side of chocolate chip pancakes. The skillet alone is a ton of food so come hungry if you order it! The chocolate chips were a great addition to the pancakes and they were drizzled in chocolate too. SO MUCH FOOD. SO GOOD.

I love this place. It's always really busy on weekends but the food is awesome, portions large, prices generous and the atmosphere relaxed. Definitely one of the best brunch places in Chicago!

Food was good but I've had better mich better, the service was one of the worst services I've had in my life, my waiter was really rude to the limit I decided to change my order because she just don't want to customize my order neither she wanted to explain!!!

This place is awesome for breakfast. Don't be afraid to go big. You won't regret the choice. I had an omelet and the banana French toast  hash browns and bacon. Didn't have a heart attack. Lots of food. Hot. Good service. I'd eat like this every day if I could.

This was one of the best breakfasts I ever had. Granted I was starving by the time I got seated but the food was amazing and the service was very fast. I had the Venetian hash with Cinnamon roll Pancakes and a banana split smoothie. I would definitely go back next time I'm in Chicago. I would just have to remember to sign in an hour or so before I plan to eat next time because there were 88 parties ahead of us when I checked in from
10 minutes away. It was so worth it though!

we ordered the signature pancakes and espanola omelet. Both tasted great, the pancake was soft and fluffy, the omelet went well with the sauce. We visited at 7AM on saturday and there was no waiting till we left the place(around 7:45). It wasn't as crowded as i thought it'd be. I liked the place but i wouldn't say that it's the place to wait for more than 30 mins.

Well worth the wait!
We woke up, checked in on yelp got ready & walked from the Hyatt.
Food is amazing! Best pancakes I've had  down! Hubs had chicken & waffles, ate it all...maybe licked his plate, judgement free zone please. Service is friendly & quick, very accommodating with my mom in a wheelchair. Can't wait to go back!
They added gluten free waffles to the menu. My daughter loved it. The waitlist feature from yelp is awesome - no wait. Very efficient

Ah.. mixed feelings about this place.

I've been waiting to write the review, but found that I don't have much to say. Maybe that says a lot about my rating.

The denver omelette was good, the pancakes were good. Neither were special in any way. I'm glad we didn't wait 1-2 hours for these..

The location is good though, right next to the park, and you can kind of wander around, go to the bean and take some photos while you're waiting. Service was also friendly. It was interesting to see a lot of 1-person tables on a weekday.

This place was amazing! I got the berry bliss pancakes with poached eggs, bacon, hash browns, and a vanilla berry latte. Absolutely phenomenal. The staff was very attentive and friendly. I'm normally not a fan of pancakes, however, this place might have changed my mind on that subject.

They used too much yogurt on and in my crepes. The English Muffins with the eggs Benedict turned hard after we brought the leftovers home. The chocolate with banana nut cake was too much. The best part of the meal was the blackberry lemonade: delicious. The waitress was very nice and helpful. The food was prepared well, but they just did way too much. Batter & Berries food is much better: no yogurt

We find places when we go away based on Yelp reviews and all the 4 and 5 star reviews on here are well rewarded!  Great place for breakfast.  Pancakes, eggs, coffee, I could go on and on...but just read the reviews and go.  It's delicious.  Great staff.  Add your name to the wait list via Yelp to save your spot otherwise you could be waiting a long time.

I was so hopeful about this place. There are so many great reviews however, our visit wasn't so pleasant.
We visited on a Saturday and of course there was a long wait (1hr 45mins) but, we didn't mind. We were able to check out a couple sites and have some drinks while waiting. I did enjoy the fact that the  restaurant texted me when our table was ready. When we walk in the place was ridiculous packed! Our waitress greeted us right away and took our drink order. The Americano and mocha smoothie were delicious. I asked for a straw for my water and never received one.
My food was the main probably. I ordered a Florence Benedict. I ate half and went in for the second Benedict and when I cut it there was a HUGE curly black hair in the Hollandaise sauce. Instantly grossed out. The waitress brought over the manager and apologized, asked if I wanted something else...took it off the check.
Never again.

Wildberry was an excellent spot for brunch! My mom and I went by on a Wednesday morning. From reviews of brunch in Chicago my expectations were set high.

SERVICE: The staff were friendly and helpful when it came to the menu. We came specifically because the restaurant had gluten-free options and the staff were very knowledgeable on what to recommend.

WAIT TIME: This is why I knocked off a star. We waited right at 45 minutes on a weekday around 10:15am. The place was jam packed and not a comfortable wait at all. Also, they DO NOT take reservations.

FOOD: Very much so met expectations. I had GF Honeycakes with Strawberries and Applewood Smoked Bacon. These were the best gluten-free "pancakes" I have had! My mother ordered an omlet which she enjoyed. Her favorite part was the goat cheese in the omlet. PLENTY of food.

I would highly recommend and would happily go back on another visit to Chicago!
Fantastic! Would absolute go back. Every bite was incredible. The very berry pancakes are no joke amazing. Ate every bite and the coffee was so delicious I got one to go.

pics.caption: Very berry pancakes will make you wish you were dead, from bliss

review.des: This was by far the best breakfast we've ever had. Amazing food and the best waiter ever. Ask for Jeremy. Whole staff was amazing from hostess to buser. Eat here you will not be disappointed!!!

I got the cinnamon roll pancakes while there and they were delicious!  I was a little concerned it would be a little too sweet for my taste, so I asked for the icing drizzle on the side.  The waiter was more than happy to do that for me and was overall so nice and hospitable.  The atmosphere is nice as well.  Their portions are huge btw, so depending on what you get, you can definitely split it if need be.  I was overall happy with the service and the food.

Yum! We found this spot on Yelp while visiting from Dallas. We caught a sweet outdoor spot on a Fri morning. Omelette of spinach and goat cheese was delish. Jeremy was an energetic and delightful server. Hopefully he's working when you visit.
Excellent food, excellent service. Best pancake we have had ever!  We would love to come back

SO BUSY!! Not worth the two hour wait for standard (but expensive) breakfast food. My waitress wasn't super attentive, but kept bringing us tons of drinks. I had the eggs benedict and my dish was fine but nothing special. They actually have a ton of types of lemonade which was cool. I had the passionfruit lemonade which was good. Free refills on drinks. My friends had the iced green tea and loved it.
Very very loud

Really good food but there are somethings better than others. The signature berry bliss pancakes. Get those. They were the best thing I had aside from the kiwi lemonade. The  lemonade is life. The skillet was good. I did the Denver sub turkey bacon instead of ham. It was HUGE however needed more salt and pepper and I rarely salt anything. The brioche French toast was eh. Maybe the flavored French toasts are better. All in all a good experience. They were slammed so I get the service being a bit slow. Forgot the hot sauce and had to wait a bit for that and the kiwi lemonade didn't get refilled until I was almost done with the meal, bummer.

Notes:
Turkey Bacon:B not crispy but that's hard to do
Denver skillet: B+ size extremely generous but under seasoned
Signature bliss pancake: A+++++++++
Brioche French toast: B- was good but missing something. Needed berries on it or a jam

pics.caption: Kiwi lemonade is life. I just wish refills were quicker
Skillet was HUGE. Though under seasoned. The signature pancakes were amazing!
Brioche French toast. Was lacking something like berries or whipped cream or jam

review.des: Waited an hour and a half for a table on a Friday morning but the wait was TOTALLY worth it!! The food was amazing, service was fast and when my husband decided to join us last minute, they gave us the table right next to us to fit him in. Placed his order and had it come out with our original order. Our server was really sweet and accommodated all of my special requests without any hesitation... for example, I wanted a waffle for my side instead of pancakes or toast. I would easily wait two hours or more to eat here without hesitation. There's a Starbucks down the street that we walked to wait it out. Reasonably priced too!!

We went for a Sunday brunch there. There was a wait of 15-20mins which wasn't so bad. We ordered pancakes, waffles and omelettes. My favorite was chicken cheese omelette. The place had an old school vibe to it.

Visiting Chicago with my girlfriend and this was our first stop. Even though we had 37 people in front of us it was really quick. I had the Florence Benedict which was really good and the ice coffee (too watery), and my girl had the Signature Berry Bliss Crepes with fresh fruit and yogurt filling, which she loved.

Best wait staff, best manager. Thanks to all those that worked today Memorial Day 2017.

Also incredible food too, thanks kitchen staff.

We were the worlds pickiest customer and Mike and the manager made it to perfection!

Located near Millennium Park, Wildberry is always busy which makes it challenging to get a table during typical breakfast times. I would recommend calling ahead to put your name down for a table. What's nice is if you do have to wait, the host/hostess can text you when your table is close to being ready.

Wildberry would be a good place for any person visiting Chicago. They serve typical breakfast fare but also have a good take on pancakes and crepes. The Nutella crepes are rich, but tasty if you are in a sweet mood!

Wildberry would be a safe choice to go if you are looking for a place for brunch.  Definitely a tourist spot since it is in that hub near Michigan Ave, Chicago Theater District, and Millennium Park.

WOW is all I can say! Totally impressed with this joint! We tried to stop in on a weekend day, but the wait was almost 2 full hours long. So we passed that day and came back during a work day. The wait was still a half hour long, but that's more manageable when you're dealing with someone who doesn't wait well (that someone being my wife).

I'm not a big pancake or waffle person. I have a love/hate relationship with carbs in general. But my wife loves her carbs, so this stop was mainly for her. I was pleased when she could not decide between about 8 different things on the menu. To me, that was actually an accomplishment. She finally settled on the fresh berry crepes and was very happy with them.

I went with the Mexican skillet and found it to be everything I was hoping for. A great heat, amazing flavors and plenty big enough to satisfy me.

All in all, we're super happy we came back and stopped in here. I'd highly recommend this place, but make sure you have some time to kill because, having walked by it pretty much every day for 5 days, we never saw the place without a line.

Probably my favorite breakfast place in the city. They have an omelette with figs that is just delicious and you can get a side of a specialty pancake. The best of both worlds! There is, however, always a wait because it's always crowded.

Today was my first time eating at Wildberry with my best friend. It was delicious. I tried the Signature Berry Bliss Belgian Waffle with their fresh squeezed orange juice. Their fries are really good too; it's not too oily, not too salty, and it's very crispy. Our server Jenny is very knowledgeable and friendly. The restaurant is clean, and I got my food very quickly too! Definitely coming back after today.

Seeing this restaurant name on the map brought me in, as a breakfast lover. The 2 hour wait told me, "this must be good!" The corned beef hash skillet with the signature pancakes solidified the best brunch experience of my life. Definitely join the waitlist through Yelp. The portions are large, but you'll want to try EVERYTHING. This will be a regular stop on Chicago trips.

The insane popularity of this place makes it feel more like a pancake factory than a cafe, but they have the serving down to an efficient science. If you're okay with being shuffled through an assembly line, you'll end up with some delicious pancakes and enormous brunch portions. Coffee is also excellent. Just make sure to put your name down for a table on Yelp before you get there so you can limit your wait time. Even after getting the text that our number was up, we still ended up waiting an additional half hour for a seat, so definitely try to time your arrival to coincide pretty closely with the predicted time.

Worth braving the wind and the rain in inappropriate LA-based clothing to eat here. Seriously, I was suffering a wet-sock situation the entire time we were eating and it was still a great experience.

I can't remember what we all ate but there were some oreo pancakes that were RIDICULOUS. I mean...come on: a buttery, fluffy pancake stack topped with chopped oreos smothered in milk and white chocolate sauce? That's just not fair. It was disgustingly good and I'm both happy and sad that you and your pancakes are far, far, far away from LA.

It was really crowed and had a wait when i got there so i put my name in. It was just me and i got seated about two minutes later. The waitress was really friendly. I had 2 over easy eggs over brisket, crispy hash browns, sautéed red peppers and onions. I didn't get the gravy though. It also came with a side of two pancakes. It was hands down one of the best breakfast's i have ever had. Everything tasted so good together And the brisket was absolutely delicious. It was a really large portion and it wasn't even too pricey. With the meal and a lemonade it was $16. Definitely a must try! They serve lunch as well. They have a really big menu.

pics.caption: Brisket, eggs, peppers & onions and comes with a side of pancakes

review.des: So yummy.  Love the selection here.  They don't skimp on portion sizes either.  The house wildberry special is delicious and a must get for anyone who likes berries or is on the fence about them.  I got a cinnamon roll pancake and eggs benny and was very happy with what I got, and I am a breakfast snob.  THe prices are really fair too.  The wait time is worth it, just use the NoWait app and put yourself in line before you get there.  I only had to wait 10mins doing this.  Great spot!  If I lived in Chicago i'd go here weekly.

Long wait, but once you get inside the service is great and they get the food and drinks out really fast. We had: iced vanilla latte, black coffee, lemon poppyseed strawberry pancakes, and the butcher block skillet. We wouldn't order the skillet again, but the coffee was great, as were the pancakes.
The food was great at a reasonable price for being located in the loop. Had brunch here twice and both times it's been great. Had the skillet and pancakes. Great stuff.

Meh food no soul weak coffee. Signature pancakes warrant a lesson in penmanship - they are the bar for blasé bland banal cakes the likes of which a red roof in would be expected to serve. Skillet - good enough flavor but he cheese was weirdly resistant to melting making eating it a dubious endeavor. Will you hate it? No. But in a breakfast loving town there are way better options worth waiting on line to get served.

Breakfast IS the most important meal of the day. So much so that sometimes I have breakfast for dinner. But today I actually had brunch. Which, if you have breakfast for dinner shouldn't it be brinner? Anyways, we arrived here on a Sunday around 1:00pm and they were hopping. We couldn't get a table for another 45 minutes. Which I took as a good sign. Good food is always worth waiting for.

If you choose to wait they have a coffee bar available (serving "Intelligentsia" coffee). You could even wander around in Chicago as they will text your phone when your table is ready. Be sure to be there within 5 minutes though, or you'll have to forfeit. Our wait was totally worth it, not only would the food be delicious but we ran into Richard M. Sherman there, a writer/composer currently living in L.A. who wrote music for, among other classics, "Mary Poppins", "Aristocats" and "The Jungle Book". Score!

I ordered the Cinnamon Roll French toast. It was cinnamon-y deliciousness. My husband chose the "Build You Own Omelette" with ham, American cheese and bacon-a pretty standard breakfast item. What really knocked our socks off was the "Signature Berry Crepe". We opted to pay the $1.00 up charge to try that instead of having the regular pancakes that came with it. Worth it!! It has a generous serving of berries inside and outside the crepe, as well as a custard type filling inside. My only regret was not ordering two. A mistake I fully intend to correct at the earliest opportunity.

Until next time.....

pics.caption: Signature "Build your own" Omlette, Ham, Bacon and Cheese.

review.des: Omg this is amazing!! Everything was so good.  Huge portions, couldn't finish.  Had the Oreo s more pancakes, cinnamon roll and signature berry.  All spectacular.  Also had Venetian skillet and corn beef bene, so good.  Very busy, great service, food arrived quickly.  Get on the list early for a table.

Wow. Just, wow. I went here multiple times and have had the Espinola, Fresca, and Veggie omelettes. Can't go wrong with any! I also had the Oreo pancakes and the chocolate chip pankcakes. Their pancakes and omelette are unbelievably delicious. The wait is rough since it's a popular spot, but totally worth it.

I decided to come try this place after hearing so many great things about it. The wait was about 1.5 hours so I ended up having "brunch" at around 1:30pm on Saturday.

As the name of this place suggests, I ordered the wildberry crepes. While the crepes were not bad, I wouldn't say they're worth the hype. It tasted like most ordinary crepe places. The kiwi lemonade, on the other hand, was good. The right amount of sweetness that doesn't overpower the kiwi and lemon flavors, yet balances out the sourness of the lemonade.

My mom and I decided to choose this place once we landed down in Chicago for a weeks vacation. Since it was around 12pm we didn't know if we wanted breakfast or lunch, so Wildberry sounded just about right.

It was quite the wait, but we knew there probably wouldn't be a better place around for a bite to eat so we decided to wait the 40min. We looked over the menu and quickly placed our order because we were starving! I ordered a strawberry mango smoothie, and although it was pretty good it tasted more like a virgin daqueri than an actual smoothie.

As for our entrees, the important part, I ordered corned beef and hash with two poached eggs and my mom ordered a vegetable omelete. The corn beef was decent and the eggs were cooked perfectly. The vegetable omelete was loaded with veggies, and I liked how they added in many various vegetables you wouldn't normally find in an omelete.

All in all, it was a good experience. We didn't have the best waitress, but I would definitely come back for a well cooked breakfast.

The service is great, with a friendly wait staff. The food is not anything to write home about, considering the overall 4.5 rating. I'd say it's a step above IHOP with respect to the food. We loved our waiter and the service. It may have been what I ordered - Fresca egg white omlette.  Bottom line - service is great, food is mediocre at best.
We went there during weekday and the line is not long. The food is very good and the environment is wonderful. During weekend the wait could be up to 2 hrs which I don't think it worth it.

I'm a breakfast person. That's my thing hah. I love brunch. So when I heard about Wildberry I thought I'd give it a try.The wait was about an hour even though I was dining alone.

I got the rutherford omelet and a side of signature berry bliss pancakes. The rutherford omelet has caramelized onions, spinach, bacon and goat cheese. The pancakes have a vanilla sauce with berries and mascarpone. I truly enjoyed my meal--it was a greatly flavored omelet with the right amount of texture. The pancakes were also very delicious--not as fluffy as I like, but the sauce is truly where the flavor is.

I wouldn't really rate it a 5 because it didn't blow me away! Definitely a fan of the place, and if I were in the area and the wait wasn't as long, I'd definitely eat there but I don't know if it's really worth the trip! The skillets looked yummy and I'd want to try those out.

Yummy place to check out if you have the time and are in the area! Very generous portions, I took half home and was still so full!

pics.caption: Rutherford omelet with caramelized onions, goat cheese, bacon and spinach. Tasty!

review.des: I had Skillet butcher block and it was amazing. I was waiting for more than one hour, but everything was perfect! This restaurant is def the best brunch restaurant in Chicago.
We are here from out of town, and frequent travelers, so we have been to so many breakfast places.  This is the best!!!!! Beat out my all time favorite place in Maui.

Check in via Yelp to avoid waiting an hour for breakfast! Just beware of the looks you will receive from the non-yelp check-iners continue to wait as you coast right in!

2nd time in Chicago and I could not leave without breaking some fast at this establishment. Not disappointed.

I'm not a big breakfast guy, but I did enjoy the food here. My favorite breakfast food is country fried steak, and sadly they did not serve that here, but it affored me the opportunity to try something new: one of their skillets.

These are basically a skillet filled with hash browns, cheese, topped with eggs, and in between those staples, a variety of options based on your choice. I had the butcher's skillet, and I was happy they allowed me to replace all the pork meat with turkey/chicken alternatives (turkey bacon, turkey/chicken sausage). Really good!

I had the apple pecan pancakes and tasted my fiance's cinnamon pancakes, and they both were great (I prefer the cinnamon).

Another major bonus to this eatery is they have an extensive selection of coffee that rivals Starbucks.

Oh, and the price is reasonable and the portions are large. If you want breakfast, and you are reading this review, save some time, stop browsing choices, check into the wait list, and go here!

Food was amazing! wheather you order eggs, pancakes or French toast it was all to die for and even creative. I would 100% reconnend this to everyone. One thing that you need to know is that the wait time is crazy long!! We used the "check in" feature on yelp at 9:30 am and didn't get in until 11 am. The portions are large and can easily be shared. And I would highly recommend getting an omelette/ egg dish and substituting the toast that come with it for some sort of pancakes, that way you can have a bit of variety!

First time in Chicago. The first place we ate. Everything was so good and has a lot of portions. The service was good and fast. The restaurant is right across the street from The Bean and the rest of the park. So glad I came here.

We tried to eat here on a Monday around 10:30 and there were like 60 people waiting inside and outside to be seated.  Nevermind!  

We went back Wednesday morning at 8 am and were seated immediately.  I ordered a hazelnut latte.  It was delicious and served in a tall mug so the serving size was awesome!  I ordered the mexican skillet and pancakes.  The sauce that comes with that skillet was ridiculously hot for that early in the morning so I opted to skip it.  The skillet was still full of flavor without it.  The eggs were cooked perfectly to how I ordered them.  Between the skillet and the fig and walnut pancakes I was no where close to finishing the meal.

I wish we lived closer because I would eat here all the time!  Our waiter was very friendly and helpful as well.

pics.caption: Hazelnut latte...it's in a tall mug

review.des: Solid spot for some good breakfast or lunch.  It's always busy, I personally recommend calling ahead of time to make sure there is availability.  Also all their cafe drinks are pretty good, prefer them over a dunkin or starbucks any day.

Wow!  What a breakfast.  Prices seemed a little high at first, but once you get your plate, see the size, the presentation, and then the flavor...you'll love it.  I had the spicy skillet...chorizo was perfect with eggs, and jalapeños added just the right kick.  Pancakes were amazing as well!  Can't wait to come back

The wait is a joke! We were told 90 minutes we're now here for 2 hours. Not sure why we're stupid enough to be sitting here for breakfast food. We live in the neighborhood... we will absolutely not come here anymore.
Obviously a little touristy but they do a nice breakfast. I'd recommend if you can go early or late enough to avoid waiting.

I love going here for breakfast, not because it's convenient,very close to home but because I love their food especially, for breakfast. The menu is full of great variety of  pancake, egg, toast,skillet and their specialty.

They also have a great menu for kids and their side dishes are great, more options than most breakfast places.

The price point is very reasonable. The food portions are very big (even their side dishes) and I never finished my food, always asked for the box to take home because their food is too good to waste.

The decor is very beautiful with a lot of bight and colorful wall papers. The booths are super cute with their colors contrasting between seats, great for group of 4-6. I lot of small tables for 1-2 people as well. Great place for family and kid.

The service was always impressive to me. They serve water as soon as you sit down and I never had to ask for menu, always ready for you. Their time of preparation for food is quick here, even  their peak time, you will be amazed.

Right across the restaurant is a big bean in Millennium park, which is one of the biggest tourist attractions in ChiTown, that's why this place is always busy. Make sure you prepare for a wait time especially, on weekend. It proves how great this place is too :)
Yo the food was a great size and it was delicious. We walked around millennium park as we waited for a text to get back in line. We all loved our food

This place gets super packed on weekends due to its proximity to many tourists attractions... I came here on a weekday, around 8am. There was no line and I was able to get seated immediately.

They have an expansive menu. So, first decide whether you want savory or sweet breakfast and then make your selection from there... Easier said than done when everything sounds so tasty...hahaha...

I finally decided to go with the Berry Bliss Belgian waffles. Most places don't get this dish right... They are usually a bit too soft for my liking. So, I was pleasantly surprised that their waffles have the right crispness and softness to them. The topping is generous with lots of blueberries and strawberries on top. It was delicious. (I didn't regret gaining back all the calories that I just burned during my morning run before coming here...)

I also ordered the Wildberry Orange Juice, which had a thicker texture compared to regular OJ. I think the waiter told me that it had a bit of OJ purée in it. Yum!

Overall, highly recommend this place.

Arrived on a Sunday morning at 8:30am. The nice hostess told us there would be a 45 minute wait. Since we were referred by several friends, we decided to take a pager and wait. While waiting we decided to walk across the street and take pictures at Millennium Park(great time to go, no crowd).

To our surprise, we were pages in 20 minutes! We rushed across and got seated in a nice corner table away from the entrance. Our server was very pleasant and welcoming. The rest of the staff was also very attentive. Our group of 4 got our food on a promptly manner and at the same time!

I got the 2 eggs with turkey bacon, hash browns and their Signature Bliss Wild Berry Pancakes. Along with my breakfast I grabbed a Honey Toffee Nut Latte, which was delicious!

My friends got the Garden Skillet and a Three Egg Omelette.

I went to Wildberry for the first time for brunch with a friend on Monday! (Weekend waitlist is always over an hour) The food was super good and if our server wouldn't have been so odd and tried to be more personable, I would've given this place a five star review.  
I had a skillet that I created on my own with a side of chocolate chip pancakes. For anyone who's picky about their pancakes just a heads up the chocolate chip pancakes have chocolate syrup and chocolate chips on them. I'm not a fan of the chocolate syrup, but before I could remember to ask if they did this the food was ready.
Overall, I loop forward to eating at Wildberry again!

The fresh squeezed orange juice is delicious. The ability to join the waitlist on your way and get a text message when they're ready is really nice, and the place is right across a (busy) street from Millennium Park, which is a really nice place to wait. Service was prompt and efficient while still being welcoming. The bacon was thick and delicious. The fruit was fresh. Everything was great. I can see why this place has the reputation it does: it was worth the wait.

We waited about 45-60 minutes for a table, and the hostesses do seem to be a little unorganized.

That being said, don't let this discourage you. I am glad I waited.

I came here on a Saturday morning hungover as fuck and ravenous. I was ready to eat my feelings and submerge myself into a food coma.

I ordered a Mexican themed omelette which came with pancakes and toast. I also ordered a side of fresh fruit and hashbrowns. I told you I was ready to fuck up some food. EVERYTHING was so good. EVERYTHING. The pancakes were light and fluffy, the fruit was hella fresh, that omelette sent me into food coma oblivion, and the potatoes were fresh and buttery.

I have never left an establishment so happy and full. I would recommend this place to anyone!!

Holy smokes! The whole team was here for this one. All the flapjacks and colorful drinks made it look like everyone was sitting at turntables. I had the corned beef benny and, let me tell ya, it was the best benny I've seen since The Jet Rodriguez. The food was so good that it even got me a break from C baby's side stories for a time. Other than the fact that a lot of the eggs were killed out of season (poached), I really enjoyed my time here. Strong, strong rec from the team.

Do not roll your eyes, or turn around and leave like a diva when they tell you it is a 45 minute wait. Time will pass quickly and it is so worth the wait. While you wait, you can enjoy a latte or mocha from the coffee bar which is just inside the front door. I now can giggle at the couple who checked in after me and left. The man informed the hostess, "No breakfast is worth that long of a wait." That man had no idea what he missed out on, the breakfast at Wildberry is worth the wait.

As I waited outside with a Cinnamon Spice Latte, I checked out the menu on my iPad.
So when my waiter approached, I knew instantly that I wanted the Rutherford Omelette. It was a three egg omelette stuffed with Baby Spinach, Caramelized Onion, Goat Cheese and Bacon. I would have stayed on my low-carb diet if I didn't enjoy the Hash Browns and side of Pancakes that came with it. The servings was so large, I skipped lunch.

I liked how they served the butter and pure maple syrup for the pancakes. They brought them on a plate in stainless steel cups. My first though was, that's not enough butter or syrup. They proved me wrong, it was just the perfect amount.

The staff was friendly and they all were hustling to provide top notch service. If Wildberry was in St Louis, it would be in my breakfast out rotation for sure. I will be sure to enjoy another breakfast here on my next visit and after reading friends reviews and seeing pictures, I know to order the Cinnamon Roll Pancakes.

The only thing that could improve Wildberry would be a liquor license, so we could enjoy a Bloody Mary or Mimosa while we enjoy our breakfast.

Fast service, plentiful and delicious food at great prices. What's not to love?

I went here with two colleagues for a final meal in the city. The pictures posted by Yelpers were very enticing! We got a table immediately upon getting there (about 8:20am on a Monday).

I ordered the corned beef hash which came with eggs and fruit. I was floored to get the specialty pancakes on the side for just $1! I ordered the specialty berry pancakes. The hash was good but undercooked for my liking --I generally go for it as super crispy. Poached eggs came out perfect! The pancakes were moist and just the right amount of sweet. My friends got the veggie skillet and pancakes. Everyone loved the food! It is really enough for two meals! We didn't even need the butter, syrup, and ketchup they brought.

The table service was fast and friendly too. The line was crazy when we left though, so come early!

pics.caption: Corned beef hash with poached eggs and specialty berry pancakes "on the side." Lots of food and tasty!

review.des: This place was excellent in all senses of the term. The wait is long but joining the waitlist through Yelp was perfect. They send you a text message and the link provided shows you how many parties are ahead of you. The food is worth the wait they are good portions and reasonable priced. This place is so quick and on top of it that we were confused when glasses of water were waiting for us at the table. Back in socal you're lucky if a busy restaurant remembers to bring you water when you ask for it with your order. No straw, clean glass we trusted it. But above all this is worth every star and the servers are amazing. Quick and efficient. Hope to come back when I take another trip up.

The food was good but not really sure what the hype is all about. I was expecting more of a mom and pop feel but instead it felt more like a Denny's with better quality food. I guess I just had a fluke experience because this place is listed as a must try.

AMAZING! DELICIOUS! The wait is very long but I understand why! I STRONGLY suggest doing the mobile check in through the yelp app its so easy! I ordered the pick a cheese omelet with the wildberry pancakes it was AMAZING!!! The amount of food you get for the price you pay makes it worth EVERY PENNY! The food was amazing & so was the service! & the location is right in front of Millennium Park, so right after we ate our food we walked right across the street to feast our eyes on the famous bean! No exaggeration this restaurant is a must stop when in Chicago!

Seeing all of the pictures from fellow yelpers about their experiences eating at Wildberry I knew I had to eat breakfast here even if it meant waiting a long time to get a table.  How could I not taste their speciality pancakes? I set my alarm earlier then usual to make sure we arrived at a not so busy time even though as I soon found out from the minute the doors open at 6:30am they already have people waiting.

When we arrived around 8am there was already a line out the door.  We were told the wait time was 20-30 minutes but thankfully were sent a text within 15 that our table was ready.  Once we were seated I was torn between ordering a skillet or some speciality pancakes.  Problem solved! For $1.50 extra with your egg order you can get any speciality pancake side you want (smaller portion of course).  Our server was super friendly and offered any assistance we needed.  The entire staff was attentive and the food and drinks came out quick which was impressive considering how busy they were especially with large party groups. (It was during the Mid-West Regional Finals for March Madness so Iowa and Syracuse Fans were everywhere.)

I ordered the Denver Skillet with a side order of Chocolate Chip Pancakes and my other half ordered an Omelette with a side order of Cinnamon Rolled Pancakes.  The Denver Skillet came out so warm and toasty and full of flavor.  I was in breakfast heaven.  It was balanced with the perfect amount of peppers, onions, cheese, and eggs.  Best skillet I have ever had.  Now let's get to the main event, those pancakes!  The chocolate chip pancakes were so fresh and the chocolate melted with one swipe of the butter knife.  However, the cinnamon rolled pancakes were from another planet!  The pancakes were balanced with the perfect drizzle of cinnamon and frosting and truly there aren't enough words to describe the taste.  

My next trip to Chicago will have this place as a first stop for breakfast.

pics.caption: Omelette with hash browns and a side of cinnamon roll pancakes
Denver skillet with a side of chocolate chip pancakes

review.des: I don't write reviews often but this place was awesome! Did not disappoint. Emily L was absolutely great! The berry bliss French toast was amazing. And there were so MANY options to choose from. Will be back!

Came back again today. Second time this week while on vacation.

Ordered the Rutherford omelet with cinnamon roll pancakes. Wow so good !

I also ordered the "butcher" for my skillet. Tons of diff meat! Yummy!!

Yea this place is a perfect 5/5.

Arrived at 10am today. Wait was 1.25 hours like yesterday.

pics.caption: The butcher skilled. Yes this is the best skillet one! For meat lovers.
Cinnamon roll pancakes. Yummy order this if you've already tried the wild berry bliss one.
Berry bliss pancakes. Perfect and delicious.

review.des:
this is a amazing breakfast place !! the portions are huge and the food tastes so good ! their omelettes were as big as my face . lol The orange juice was sweet and fresh .
The customer service is great here !
the biggest down side is if you have a car , parking sucks ! I guess everywhere in downtown parking is a pain .
oh and be prepared to wait for a while , this place is packed .

pics.caption: may not look so tempting but it is so good!

review.des:
This place is delicious! My gf and I were visiting Chicago and I love doing research to find the best spots in town to eat. This place popped up as breakfast spot and was a short walk from our hotel.  This place was so good.  Service was very friendly, the place was clean, and the wait, while out the door, was not terrible (maybe 30 mins on a busy saturday).
When we got inside, we ordered a helping items.
I choose the mixed berry pancakes and my gf choose the smores. For one, these are the best pancakes Ive ever had! I dont have much of a sweet tooth but the mixed berry sauces and toppings were very light tasting and compliemented the pancakes too well. I can say the same about the smores. While my gf, who has a HUGE sweet tooth liked it, I didnt (too sweet for me); however she liked mine better.
To compliment our pancakes, we each got breakfast skillets.  I got the meat lovers one and she got the one with chorizo in it.  Mine was very good but i wasnt much of a fan of hers mainly because the chorizo.  I dont like chorizo being a main meat (like bacon is in a BLT). My gf likes choirizo and though hers was tasty.

Overall, this place is a must if your hungry or even kinda hungry! The pancakes are super!!!

We went on Tueaday right before closing (around 1,45pm) and had no problem getting in. It was actually pretty empty which was great cause the service was super fast and polite!

The Berry Bliss Pancakes tasted like cake basically. Very fluffy and not too sweet.

I also tried the Los Altos Eggs Benedict without the chorizo and they were incredible - I can only imagine how good they must have been with chorizo for someone who likes this meat.

pics.caption: Los Altos Eggs Benedict with chorizo on the side (toons of chorizo)

review.des: I've tried both locations! They never disappoint! I love the veggie skillet, slow cooked brisket, Denver skillet, AND THE CINNAMON ROLL PANCAKES! Kid friendly and definitely worth the wait! If your know you're going use the waitlist app to reserve a virtual place!

Always love breakfast or brunch at Wildberry. I truly don't think you can go wrong with any option on the menu and service has always been extraordinary. The only downside is the wait, but it is well worth it!

Tasty, but be prepared to wait!! We were told it would be an hour and ten minutes, but it actually ended up being two!! Lots of variety of pancakes, crepes, french toasts, and waffles -- wow I'm in heaven! We also ordered the garden skillet. It was okay, not very seasoned. My absolute favorite was the corned beef hash. I ordered it as a side, and wow, it was the best corned beef hash I've had! It is definitely a lot of food, but service was awful too. We saw our waitress to take our order, and that was it. When we asked someone for some water, they just said "I'll get your waitress," but she never came.

pics.caption: Garden skillet, banana cream pancake, biscuit and gravy, berry bliss pancake, fruity pebble French toast, and corned beef hash

review.des:
I couldnt give this place 5 stars based on parking and the wait. However everything else was great.

Came here on a Friday morning around 9am and have over and hour and 15 minute wait. This better be great. And that it was, once we ordered it wasnt much longer till my mouth was met with some of the best berry pancakes I've ever had.

If I have extra time to kill, during the week, I'll be back. Im not brave enough to wait even longer with the weekend brunch crew.
First tome visiting Chicago and breakfast at Wildberry was amazing!!!! The buttermilk pancakes were soooo fluffy and delicious!!!

Must visit restaurant on your trip to Chicago. Warning- the wait is about 2 hours, but if you download the No Wait app you can walk around and just show up when you receive a text saying your table is ready. The food is all delicious, but the best pancake is by far the signature berry bliss. They give you 4 pancakes per serving so I would also recommend splitting with another person
Fast service, Yelp wait list made the wait shorter as usual. Came in on a Monday morning and surprised to see it was busy

VERY BUSY place. Customers are in and out, non stop. I've been here twice. 40 min wait the first time. About 20 min wait the second time.  Very well worth the wait. They can seat on ton of people and they do what they can to get people seated ASAP. A must stop for those Chicago tourists. Great stop for breakfast. Top notch pancakes.

My favorite breakfast place downtown! I always recommend my friends and family go here. Although the wait is seemingly endless, it's totally worth it. Get the nowait app so you can check in before you get there. It'll make it a little easier! Their food is delicious and the servers are so friendly too. I got a western skillet of some sort, with a side of their signature pancakes! Although it is a little pricey it's totally worth it because you get a ton of food. :)

not really worth the hype. solid bfest spot but nothing extraordinary. always super crowded and feels like ur being rushed out of ur table. not a relaxed casual brunch spot youd typically want on a sunday
Smoothie and blueberry pancakes were amazing. Long lines but if you get on the yelp waiting list you can save yourself a lot of standing around time.

A friend told me that we had to try Wildberry while in Chicago and it is hand's down the best breakfast/brunch place we tried. We actually went twice!

First thing to know -- THERE WILL BE A WAIT. I would suggest going before 10 a.m. for a shorter wait. The first time we went on a Friday at 10-ish and we waited 40 minutes for a party of two. Second time we went was a Tuesday and we arrived around 8:45 a.m. and got seated within 15 minutes.

Now for the food. Prices are SO cheap compared to SF brunch prices. I think most things were $10.75, including benedicts!! Service was also great and your water cup is always full.

Chorizo Benedict: A bit salty, but so good. Perfect if you like spicy food.
Florence Benedict: Had this on the second visit and the eggs were slightly overcooked and not as runny as I would've liked them to be. There definitely could've been more bacon, and they definitely skimped on the hollandaise. Since the eggs weren't runny and there wasn't enough sauce, the benedicts were a bit dry.
Two eggs any style combo: This is a GREAT deal for all the food you get. For an extra dollar, you can sub in for their specialty pancakes, which we did both times.
Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes: "Berry Bliss" is the perfect description for this, and the berry marscapone really brings everything together. The blackberry coulis wasn't sour at all either.
Banana Cream Pie pancakes: Very creamy, but not too sweet. I'm not a big banana fan but the boyfriend loved this more than the signature pancake dish.

I highly recommend stopping by Wildberry if you're in the area! It's super close to the Art Institute, Millennium Park, etc. so you can grab a bite and get to sightseeing.

pics.caption: Sausage patties, eggs and hash browns

review.des: I love their pancakes. But I found their Los Altos benedict to be really oily. I'm starting to feel that that's just the downside of having chorizo on your plate, so it's still a 4 star place for me! I still feel that location is the main reason that Sunday brunches here are a 2 hour wait.

Wildberry Pancakes is the place for breakfast/brunch when in Chicago. It's so popular that even at 9:30 in the morning, there's already a 30-45 minute wait for two. Fortunately, they do turn over tables quickly here and it's not a small restaurant, so our wait was actually 25 minutes!

After some Yelping, my friend and I decided to order the Mexicana skillet and upgrade the regular pancakes that came with this dish to the Signature Berry Bliss pancakes for $1.50 extra only! This portion easily fed two for only $11.95; talk about a steal! For the price of each entree, the prices are ridiculously cheap (i.e. their pancake entrees come with 5 pancakes for $11-$12) compared to breakfast/brunch in New York. For the pancake raves, I expected to be blown away by the Signature Berry Bliss. Although they were good, they weren't fluffy like everyone claimed them to be. To both my friend and I, they were just your standard pancakes, fluffiness wise, but the berry bliss sauce made them better. Surprisingly, it wasn't as sweet as it looked as it was drowned in berry sauce; it was sweet with hints of acidity from the berries. The Mexicana skillet was more unique to us. It came in a huge skillet pan filled with hash browns, chorizo sausage, avocado, jalapeño peppers, onions, cheddar and jack cheese, along with 2 sunny side eggs. It sounds like a lot of ingredients, but everything was perfectly balanced and worked perfectly. Definitely recommend ordering this and upgrading to a speciality pancake!

My friend and I also had the iced honey toffee nut latte, which was delicious. Its taste reminded me of something, but I can't really put to words what it tastes like. You'll have to order this too!

Chicago, your breakfast game sure is strong; it pains me to say that it might even be better than New York!

We checked in online and didn't need to wait in the long line just outside the restaurant. We tried different items; Omelettes, scrambled eggs, bacon, fruit, biscuits and gravy, and PANCAKES!  Everything was very good, but the cinnamon roll and signature berry pancakes were worth the stop by themselves!
This restaurant is delicious every time I visit. Don't mind the 50 minutes drive to the city, then wait an hour in line for the coffee and yummy pancakes.

Solid breakfast joint. Came here with my wife and infant. They accommodate for strollers which is always a plus for us. I suggest you use the waitlist feature. That came in clutch since we killed a long wait time in our hotel

My favorite breakfast/brunch place in Chicago. The wait can be long but I always try to go early to beat the rush. Their corned beef hash skillet is fantastic. Also love their pancakes and waffles. And their fresh squeezed juices! Some people might think there's nothing special about Wildberry but what I appreciate most is their consistency. Their food is always consistently good! Never let down by Wildberry and the many guests I have dined here with would agree!
This is a must stop every time we come to Chicago! So delicious and the service is always amazing!

YAS, EVERY TOURIST WILL BE EATING HERE. AND YAS ALL THE LOCALS WERE RIGHT!
This is the best BRUNCH place in the city. BUT be prepared... as good things come to those who wait... atleast a 30 min wait that is...!

whatever you do... YOU MUST ORDER their specialty pancakes. VERY BERRY PANCAKES that is...
I had the basic breakfast.. 2 sunny side up eggs, hash brown, some sausage. I asked for my hash browns extra crispy and they came out beautiful. But what made my meal the very best was the pancakes. The fruits were refreshing. That colored cream thing they drizzle on top of their oh so fluffy pancakes.. oh my god. I can't describe how good it tastes. You'll regret it if you don't try it.

Anyways, I gotta cut this review short as I am drooling thinking about my breakfast...

P.S. my friends got the fresca omelette and they said enjoyed it very much as well.
Might be the best breakfast I've ever had.   Long wait, but totally worth it.    Get in line with the app to speed things up.   Once inside, service was prompt and the coffee was wonderful.

Sublime pancakes! Simply sublime! Great portion size with reasonable prices. I had the fresco omelette with a side of hash browns and some pancakes. The omelette and the hash were good but the pancakes were absolutely mind-blowing. Would definitely visit there again. Wait time is incredibly long on a weekend so try to make it on a weekday or use the No-wait app and save time on your visit there.
We loved the breakfast so much during our visit to Chicago, we ate there twice. Their berry pancakes were amazing. So was the cinnamon roll French toast.

Always wonderful, attentive service and delicious food in the many times I've visited! Favorites include: Wildberry orange juice, berry bliss pancakes, and the chicken and waffles. Don't forget to download the NoWait app to join the line from a few miles away (especially after 10am until closing- it gets packed)!
Delicious. You definitely want reservations as it is packed with an hour+ wait. Also, the skillets are easily split between two people.

Was finally able to try this place (third times the charm!). Because we were a party of 2 we were seated almost immediately. Because we were in a savory mood my friend and I had the classic eggs benedict  (ham off the bone on an English muffin with a poached egg and hashbrowns) and I had the Southern benedict (oven baked biscuits, sausage patties, sausage gravy and hashbrowns). I also had the fresh squeezed OJ and my friend has pineapple lemonade which she reported was a bit too sweet.
Our meals were super tasty and came in HUGE portions and our server was kind and attentive which is impressive in such a busy place. While it doesn't have much in the way of ambiance the food is good and worth the wait.

Amazing!! It is very very busy, so be patient and know that you will wait for a table. There is a waiting area inside, you may have to push through the crowd at the front of the door but definitely do it so you're not stuck outside waiting. Service was awesome, fast and just great!!

Love love Love this place! It has a long wait but its totally worth it. I ordered the blueberry bliss Belgian waffle and it was heavenly! I would really recommend you go here if you're thinking about going to downtown Chicago anytime soon.

Food served in incredible portions and we highly recommend the cinnamon bun pancakes if you like cinnamon rolls. Quite clean and friendly service. Be prepared to wait even if you're using the app. You generally check in and wait at least 15 to 20 mins beyond that (e.g. in for approximately 110 min wait, app said check in at 12:19pm, didn't get called to sit until 12:56pm, food came at 1:28 pm). Overall, a good spot to hit for breakfast in Chicago.

This is definitely worth trying. I got the Oreo s'more pancakes and they were so good. The Oreo is in side the pancake and on top and there is chocolate and marshmallow sauce in it. It is just so good. Other people at my table got eggs, berry pancakes, and cinnamon roll French toast. They enjoyed there meal too. I would definitely go back.

The breakfast is super good! It was worth the 30 minutes wait. I came here for brunch and got the wild berry bliss waffles while my boyfriend got the tiramisu pancakes. Both portions was super filling. I also ordered the raspberry lemonade.

TIP: THERE'S NO DRINK SHARING! I didn't know that and my boyfriend wanted to try my drink. When I asked for a refill, they said there's no sharing allowed. We didn't end up getting a refill even after finding out no sharing allowed. After finding out, it felt like we were getting the stink eye but we really just didn't know!

It's across the street from Millennium park and the cultural center if you're in line waiting to go check out.

The service overall was fast and efficient. The experience was mixed: yay for food and ugh for the horrible feeling like you've done something wrong but you just didn't know.

Such a Chicago classic for me, I have to visit every time I come! I've gotten a build your own omelette, the red velvet roll, and the Venetian skillet with the Oreo s'more pancakes. All delicious! Check in on the NoWait app to save lots of time. Once you get there, they run a pretty tight ship! Service is always nice there, and the coffee is good too!
Tons of menu options.  Very good and quick service!  The wait is worth it, but do get on the Yelp waitlist before going to save time.

We had breakfast/brunch at Wildberry on a Sunday morning and it was an enjoyable meal.

Décor: The location is tourist central - just on the north side of Millennium Park - and the main crowd reflects the same. However, it seems like it's just a regular breakfast spot from the décor. We sat outside so it's hard for me to comment on anything else... there are a few outdoor tables though and, depending on the time of day, they will be nicely shaded by the tall building next door. The one thing I will say is that there is really no place for people to "hang out" while they wait for their table. We choose to stroll around the park, as they were going to text us when our table was ready, but most people seem to stand out front... not the best for those who choose (or are given) a table outside.
Bathroom: unknown

Staff: The hostess was polite, despite the place being jam-packed and super busy, and our waitress was very friendly and quick. Additionally, the bus boys were fast with the clean up and the water refills.

Food: We kept it pretty basic but the food was very tasty. We had an order of pancakes (with berries) and eggs+sausage+hasbrowns+pancakes. The portions are not enormous but they are decently-sized and just about enough to satisfy a normal person's appetite.

Value: Given the location I expected the prices to be a bit higher but overall we walked away paying about what we expected.

Our breakfast was an enjoyable experience but I think we'll check out a few other places before returning again in the future.

Great Breakfast spot! The food and the speedy service was excellent. Will definitely return when Im back in town. Great variety of pancakes! I would recommend the Veggie Skillet, any of the waffles and Florence Benedict. The Butcher Skillet was a bit heavy on the meats but if you are a meat lover this would definitely be up your alley. The service was exceptional; prompt service from being seated until end of meal. Most likely there will be a wait and is worth it. Last time we got there super early so there was no wait at all which was great. But it was also in the high 30's so the temperature might have been an influence.
Great food, great service. Couldn't have asked for a better experience here! Definitely coming back whenever I visit Chicago.

pics.caption: Mexicana Skillett with Toast on the side
The Mexicana Skillet with Toast on the side

review.des:
Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe was so good. The restaurant was packed on a Tuesday around 10:00 am, and there was a wait. The wait, however, was not long for my family and I (a party of 5); we got lucky and another party left. The hostess told us the wait would be able 30 min if the party had not left.

I ordered the "Signature Berry Bliss pancakes" after reading so many good reviews. They were delicious; the pancakes were fluffy and light, and the berry jam and vanilla marzipan drizzle was not too sweet. I did not add any maple syrup because the drizzles were sweet enough. Hands down, the best pancakes I've ever had. I recommend.

Service was good as well. Our server was attentive and friendly despite the packed restaurant.

Highly recommend checking out if visiting Chicago!

USE THE NOWAIT APP. And make sure you get there in time to check-in with the host because they will not hold your table for you. Sunday morning I used the app at 11am to save a spot and we didn't get our table until 1pm. There was still a huge group of people waiting outside at 2pm - 30 minutes before they closed.

I'm not sure whether this place is famous with the locals or if it just caught on with all the reviews and compounding number of tourists always wanting to try the big thing in the Yelp world.

Regardless, while I did enjoy the food, it wasn't anything out of ordinary that I couldn't just find in Hollywood or Downtown LA (hello Blu Jam). I will give them credit for their signature berry bliss pancakes though. I normally never eat pancakes but I figured when in Rome...

I ordered the homemade corned beef hash and the girlfriend got their slow roast brisket hash. The corned beef hash was good but there was so little of it. It was an inch of hash browns and probably 1cm of the corned beef hash mixed in with the cheese on top. It was good but not worth what I paid for it. The slow roast brisket was better though. It had a much larger portion of meat compared to the corned beef hash. The brisket was super tender and the flavor was great. The pancakes were definitely the highlight.

I enjoyed my experience here but the food just didn't really hit the spot. I would come back again, sure. As the 3 stars says - A-OK.

We so loved this place we tried to get back in the next day!  It was so worth the wait!  Huge stack of cinnamon roll pancakes that smelled so good the entire time they were on the table (ok - until my daughter woofed down more than half).  I love eggs and the Mexican skillet was so many good things (avocado, cheese, chorizo, onions...) all hidden under my over easy style that were perfectly cooked!  My son who's the expert on hash declared "mom - this is real!" as it was fresh and not greasy.  We were so full but yet not uncomfortable (but we didn't need any lunch).  And while you're waiting, take a stroll in the park just across the way and see the historic riverfront planning that makes the city so beautiful!

This is probably the best breakfast restaurant in town. I had the Española omelet and it was very authentic. They have an excellent menu with a wide variety of choices. I would highly recommend to anyone in town. The wait can get pretty long (est. around 1-1.5 hours) but if you go on yelp and add your name to the waitlist you could plan your trip right.

Amazing food! Amazing service!

We decided to get a late brunch on our recent stay in downtown Chicago and realized quickly that we would be waiting a while to get in anywhere good. We put ourselves on their waiting list, through yelp, and we're pleasantly surprised that the time we were given was accurate down to the minute. For as busy as the restaurant was, they were very organized and quick to get everyone in and out. The food portions were big and the taste was delicious! We would definitely recommend that this be the spot that anyone try for a brunch on a Sunday morning!

I was looking forward to having breakfast here. The staff was attentive and the wait is long but with the no wait app I waited inside my hotel room! Big plus there. Here is what let me down, the eggs for the egg benedicts completely overcook, the yolk is supposed to be nice and runny. Their signature pancakes berry bliss, tasted artificial and the powder sugar on top only made them taste worse.
My recommendation if you order the pancakes tell them not to put powder sugar as this overpowered the taste.

This place CANNOT be missed when you're in Chicago...it truly is one of the best breakfasts EVER...and I'm not alone with making that statement.

Everything was delicious!

We arrived on a Thursday morning around 9:30am...to sit inside was a 15 min wait so we opted to sit outside for immediate seating.

Make sure the table outside is wiped down before you sit. Mine had syrup and it was very unpleasant to get my hands all sticky.

The staff was very friendly and the food came out very quickly!
Very solid menu, mildly overpriced and over crowded around noon, but we enjoyed our meals very much. Highly recommend the espanola and the Nutella crepes

One weekend in Chicago yielded two trips to Wildberry. The food was so good. The pancakes oh the pancakes. Lots of good breakfast options. I recommend getting an advance online/app reservation because there will be a wait.
Wait was 3+ hours. Have to download an app to get in line. Food was good, I wasn't completely impressed. Huge portions!

pics.caption: Food is ok. It's. It exactly worth the 3+ hour wait. Los Altos Benny!

review.des: Some of the best customer service I've ever had, not to mention how amazing the food is. If you could only eat at one place in Chicago make sure it's here

The food is decent. However, The service is a disaster!!! The hostess was like "we got tons of guests, so I don't care." Took forever to get a waiter to take our orders. When we seated, the check from last table still there, asked a waiter to take away and was told our table is not his table so we have to wait our server !!! So the check from last party just lay on our table for almost 20mins before OUR waitress finally took away!! Seriously??

The long wait is manageable if you check in online. Service was okay for a busy morning. I was able to navigate the menu to accommodate my needs (gluten free/paleo/autoimmune protocol/AIP). There are several gluten free options on the menu including gluten free waffle batter! I opted to order all a la carte, having hot tea, a side salad without tomatoes, a side of bacon, and fruit. They brought olive oil and balsamic for the salad, and my meal came just as I asked!

This is a decent place to get breakfast, if you put your name in on NoWait and the line isn't too long. The service is adequate but not great. I had a corned beef skillet and we shared lemon poppyseed pancakes and berry bliss pancakes. The hash was pretty standard, but the potato to corned beef ratio was off. The berry bliss pancakes were sickeningly sweet - they come with some sort of cream cheese sauce and it was way too much for me. The poppyseed pancakes were better, but still too sweet. Id probably go back but definitely wouldn't wait an hour for it.

Me and a couple friends planned on coming here for breakfast. It was a busy and humid day and the wait was long but surprisingly it didn't take that long and we were seated quickly. I had the corn beef hash skillet and apple caramel crepes. The food in my opinion were a good enough portion and tasted great. For a humid day inChicago we were just relieved for the AC inside. The service was great and so was the food will definitely reccomend for anyone visiting the Chitown area.

So delicious!!!! The food is really good I got the Denver skillet and it was bomb. Our waiter was super cute and friendly. They never refilled our water until I had to ask but other than that the service wasn't bad. Its close to millenium park and I suggest going there early on a weekday we had no wait but when we tried to go for Sunday brunch the wait was at 2 hours. Its good but not 2 hours good.
Amazing. It was a party of three. Everyone was impressed by their meal. Ask to sit in Marco's section. He's extremely accommodating. We will definitely be back with more friends!
Huge portions! I split a meal, but honestly it was big enough for 3 people! Be sure to put in your name early or put in a reservation, the weekend waits can up 2 hours!

After seeing a friend check in here made me realize that I never completed my review, so I apologize in advance.  Wildberry is a must when I visit Chicago, even if there is a wait which there usually always is. Despite the large group of people usually waiting outside, the lines actually move pretty fast so do not let that change your mind.

Service has always been top notch, with a friendly staff serving up some great eats. The food here is always delicious, and reasonably priced with great portions, so much so that I usually make it a late breakfast/early lunch and I am set for the day! I usually stick with a Sizzling Skillet, which is served with a large portion of potatoes, topped with eggs and cheese and served with either toast or pancakes. I usually stick with the Butcher Block, which adds Ham, Jumbo Sausage, and Applewood Bacon, which is amazing in itself however the pancakes help really set this place on fire with creativity. I have had a wide variety of their creations, however the two that are a must are the Red Velvet Pancakes and the Cinnamon Roll Pancakes, both are amazing and will have you coming back for more. So much so I am getting hungry just talking about it!

Best waffle with fresh fruit I've ever had. Still dreaming about our breakfast this morning. It wasn't too sweet, the berries were great and the fruit yogurt in the middle was yummy!! However, there is a line out the door. Our estimated wait time was 45-1hr but we only waited roughly around 30 minutes or so. We will definitely be returning before we leave!

On my God all I can say is I love this place. They have some of the best pancakes I think I've ever had the staff is friendly the prices are great and they also have a wide variety of other things that you anytime I'm I'm in the area I like to stop in and get some. I highly recommend this place

My cousin arrived around 8:20 am and put us on the list. By the time my friend and I arrived around 9 am we waited just 10 mins before being seated.

Our service was excellent even though the place was packed.

I had the banana cream pancakes which is actually an add-on to the skillet that I ordered. Even though it was an add-on the portion wasn't small whatsoever. I loved the pancakes! It wasn't too sweet. It was light and fluffy! It tasted like the way I'd expect banana cream anything to taste like.

My skillet was a veggie dish. The dish has hash browns, eggs, cheese, mushrooms, spinach, etc. I ordered my eggs over medium and it came out just right. It was good, but not quite memorable.

What's nice is that they give you your money's worth. There was a lot of food left over because I didn't finish either of the two.

I'd definitely come back for the pancakes obviously! I tried their signature pancakes too btw and I much preferred the banana one. The berry one reminded me of a cereal that I've had before, but can't put a name to...not my thing!
Awesome breakfast. Can't go wrong. The original pancake House is still my favorite Lou Mitchell's is second and this is the close third. Breakfast is my favorite meal.

So my girlfriend and I came to visit Chicago from Miami, we heard there were many options of great restaurants around the Loop area. Breakfast is my favorite meal of the day so we were in search of good popular breakfast spot. Many people talked to us about Wildberry so we decided to give it a try.

Woke up this morning and went on yelp to see how long the average wait time is, luckily they had an option to add yourself to the waitlist in advance, which was extremely helpful because the wait time was already at almost an hour and a half. We added our name to the list as we were getting ready to head out. Once we arrive, the line is out the door but we manage to skip to the front to check in and amazingly we were sitting ready to order 5 minutes in.

The menu consists of so many delicious options it was just hard to choose anything really. I started with a cafe mocha, topped with whipped cream of course, and boy was it good ! I ended up going with the Butcher Skillet, 4 different meats with melted cheese and 2 fried eggs on top with a layer of hash browns underneath. I sub'd out my normal pancakes for the Oreo S'more pancakes. The skillet was just absolutely delicious ! And the pancakes really ended up hitting the spot, I always finish my food but I had to throw in the towel with a few bites left because I was going to need a wheelchair out of here. The service was excellent. Our waitress was Alex, really sweet person , very attentive and just an all around great waitress.

I highly recommend this spot to anybody and if you manage to get Alex as your server, you'll be in good hands! Enjoy !

We went to this restaurant  twice for breakfast during our visit to Chicago. Excellent!!! The wait staff are all very friendly & efficient. The best way to avoid a long wait is to check in on your phone.

Waitlist feature worked great, timed it so we walked right in and were seated. Service was attentive and the food came out quickly considering the busy Saturday morning. Everything was fantastic from the hash browns to the cinnamon French toast. I would definitely return when in the area.
It's really worth to wait for half an hour. The pancakes were really amazing. Severs were friendly. The environment was comfortable. The best brunch place in Chicago!

Ah, the pancakes here! Mindblowingly amazing! I found this place via yelp, and was so happy to see I could put my name down electronically. This made the entire process very easy.

I came and ordered the Mexican skillet, with a side of berry pancakes. Both were great, but the berry pancakes were just amazing. So amazing, that I came back 2 days later again to order them. So fluffy, creamy, and accompanied by wonderful berry toppings.

Every time I visit Chicago, I make it a point to stop by here! It's one of the best brunches I've ever had. Honestly can't go wrong with anything on this menu. If it's your first time, I recommend going with another person because that way you can try something savory and sweet! Personal favorites: berry bliss pancakes (aptly named), red velvet French toast, Florence Benedict (omg my mouth is watering thinking about it) and the Mexicana skillet

Visited from California and had to stop by one of the best brunch places in Chicago! There is a wide variety of sweet and savory items on their menu so either way you'll be satisfied.

Food:  Their signature berry bliss french toast was absolutely amazinggg! It was soft, fluffy, berry flavorful (haha, get it?), yet not overwhelmingly sweet. There was berry yogurt glaze in between the pieces of toasts, which made it even more delicious!!! Definitely one of the best french toasts, if not THE BEST, I've ever had.

Service: Even though the place was busy, our server was able to frequently check up on us and keep our water glasses full!

I'm so glad we came here for brunch. If I lived in the area, I would definitely come here over and over again... until I try every single item on their menu!

Wildberry Pancakes and Café has 3 locations in the Chicago area. Obviously they specialize in breakfast, and pancakes in particular.

The Corned Beef Benny ($10.75) is a take on an Eggs Benedict. The corned beef hash is house made. While good, I would have preferred the corned beef hash to be a little crisper. The eggs were poached well, with a nice runny yolk. A chipotle hollandaise finished the dish, but was lacking in any spice.

The Crème Brulee French Toast was a thick slice of bread drizzled with a vanilla crème anglaise. I prefer my French toast super soggy, and this one did not fit the bill. I have found that most restaurants will not make French toast super soggy since it takes extra time for the longer soak. I understand that the kitchen needs to turn over food as quickly as possible, but accommodating the probably infrequent request does not seem like a huge ordeal.

The Red Velvet French Toast ($10.75) was a nice, thick slice of red velvet cake with an insane amount of cream cheese stuffed inside. Once again topped with a vanilla crème anglaise, this was a sure winner.

The Banana Cream Pie Pancakes ($10.75) were two large pancakes topped with freshly sliced bananas smothered in a mountain of whipped cream. The pancakes were light, but somewhat dense at the same time if that makes any sense. Crumbled brown sugar added a slight textural contrast.

The Chocolate Chip Pancakes (9.25) were drizzled in chocolate syrup. Chocolate chips were imbedded in the pancakes. These were okay and nothing special.

One of the specials was Duck Hash, which contained a very generous portion of large pieces of duck intermingled with hash browns. It was topped by 2 eggs. This was a very good dish.

Although Wildberry specializes in pancakes, I found that they missed the mark on that end. The red velvet French toast and duck hash were the clear winners.

Very, very good. SO CROWDED! Totally recommend the place holder app in Yelp for this place. Held our place in line at 10:15 on Sunday, showed up at 11:15, seated at 11:30am, out by 12:15pm! Such a great app! Great food, prompt service.

Hmmm what else can I add that the other 2000+ reviews haven't already mentioned?? I got Mexicana skillet with a side of berry bliss pancakes. The pancakes are served either as a side (2 pancakes), a short stack (3 pancakes), and a full stack (5 pancakes). The portion was HUGE. I had enough for an entire breakfast the next day. The best part of the pancakes is the berry whipped cream that they tuck away between each pancake. My friend had another skillet and mine, the Mexicana, was my favorite.
