I loved the tart pickeled jalapenos mixed in with the cheesey potatoey goodness. If you don't like a long wait, I suggest going on a weekday before 11:00am. I used the NoWait app and only had a 5 minute wait.

Obviously, Wildberry is wildly popular for breakfast and brunch. It's is a short walk away from The Bean, so if you decide to do an early morning trip to Millennium Park Wildberry would be a great spot to stop by for breakfast or brunch. The offerings are pretty typical and they have their signature Wildberry pancakes. It's more of decor and berries, nothing over the top. I'm a pancake fanatic, but my favourite will always be Lemon Ricotta! I think this place is frequented more so due to its proximity and convenient location in downtown. It's often very busy so plan accordingly.

Because this place has outdoor seating and is across from millennial  park it gets an abundance of tourists. The food does look good walking by. So we decided to go for lunch. I had a salad that cost $14 and was made up of mostly shredded iceberg lettuce. I asked the waiter where the avocado was that was supposed to be in the salad. It took them awhile before they got it but were trying to get away from putting it in the salad. Service was slow and we got attitude like they were doing us a favor by serving us. You end up getting served by millennials who think the world owes them a favor across from millennial park.
Some of the best authentic Mexican chorizo I have had in a long time. The coffee is amazing and all the food is worth the wait.

Just came here for the first time. A great breakfast place with typical breakfast fare to appeal to the pancake, bacon and egg crowd. For those wanting something different and healthier try the gluten free avacodo toast with a side of fresh fruit. Delishes. Service was friendly, welcoming and attentive.

DELICIOUS PANCAKES! I honestly didn't know they were going to be that good, but after reading all of the reviews and seeing the photos I had to try them! Yes expect to wait, but when you finally get a table it's highly worth it.

I would recommend after they send you a text, click on that link and download the app and it shows you how many parties are in front of you. After that take your time and walk around Millennium Park until your table is ready. Or if you want you can download the app in advanced and check the for a table without going inside, the app is called "No Wait" ... ok now back to the food!

You must try the signature pancakes! They are super delicious. I also had the egg white omelet with feta cheese, spinach and onions - it was also so good! I would highly recommend splitting a meal. The eggs come with two sides so I got hash browns and a side of their signature pancakes. I promise you will not be disappointed! Well priced food and very large potions. Almost everyone in the tables around me asked for a to-go box. Split a meal if you can, if not be prepared to have extras for later.

The service was also wonderful everyone was very fast and efficient. I truly enjoyed my time here and will definitely come again next time I am in Chicago! Believe the hype, yes it is true! Last word of advice download the app and check in advanced. Just trying to help ;)

Was here my business trip, and was my last day in ChiTown. I guarantee you this will be one of my first places to eat on my next trip. The food was absolutely amazingly good. I had egg whites on veggie skillet.....and berry pankcakes.

My one star is based on a combination of things.

I was added to the wait list at 10:04am and was given a wait time of 58-88 minutes.  I was seated at 12:13pm.  We placed our orders and the food took 40 minutes to arrive.  The waitress stated the kitchen was extremely backed up.

I ordered the eggs, applewood bacon, hashtowns and apple caramel pecan pancakes.  My daughter ordered the same but with brioche French toast.  Honestly, there was nothing special or spectacular about this breakfast.  I found the pancakes to be fluffy but dry and bland.  The apples and pecan did not add enough to hide the boring pancakes.

Prices seemed fair and reasonable.  The atmosphere was average.  The time is took to get a table and get served food is just not worth the wait. Our experience was roughly 3 hours.  

My office is a few blocks away so perhaps during a slower weekday would have been better, however the food is not good enough for a second visit.

I recommend going to any other breakfast spots in the loop (yolk, corner bakery, batter and berries) just to save yourself some time.

Wildberry gets a thumbs down from me.

AMAZING! Crazy long wait on the weekends (expect about an hour), but totally worth it. This is my favorite brunch spot in Chicago, hands down!

Everything is good -- you really can't go wrong any which way. I personally enjoy savory brunch foods, and loved the Fresca omelette sides of wheat toast and fruit. My only comment is that it is definitely heavy on the cheese, so ask for light cheese if you're not a fan of that. The omelette is more like a "bomb", it's enclosed on both ends and stuffed with cheese and veggies in the middle (not the traditional folded omelette). Soooo delicious.

My boyfriend had the Espanola omelette with sides of hashbrown and the cinnamon pancakes. He loved both. I tried the cinnamon pancakes, and it tasted like an open face cinnamon roll. If you're a cinnamon lover, definitely should be in your order!

pics.caption: Chorizo omelette with a side of hashbrown and cinnamon pancakes (couldn't resist before taking a picture!)

review.des: While the line might be long, the wait was worth it. Their breakfast was delicious. I had their pancakes and it was mouthwatering. But I recommend getting there right when they open up. If not, you'll probably have to wait for an hour or two.

A well deserved 5 star rating!!!Everything that you read on Yelp about the food here is true. Went in on Friday, around 745 am and there was a 15-20 minute wait. Ordered the wild berry French toast and chorizo Benedict and both were amazing. I didn't want to leave the restaurant. Coffee was descent and fresh. Staff however are on the arrogant side but I forgave them and didn't take any stars off because of how amazing the food was.

Just went to eat breakfast there this morning, it was amazing. Try the signature pancakes, they are so good. Just be sure to join the waitlist on Yelp before you go, some people had to wait 2 hours to get a table !

From the easy and convenient way you could "reserve" through yelp to the food and service at the restaurant, this place deserves a 5 star ranking. The prices are was you expect from a mid-scale breakfast diner, and the food comes out fresh and quickly. Their fruit is FRESH, so I highly recommend eating anything with a fruit topping. I had their signature berry french toast and it was delicious! You can get the two egg platter and upgrade your pancakes to anything else that way you can get eggs, hash browns, and sausage//bacon, with your meal. The place is always packed, so the fact that their servers are so friendly, and on top of their tables is amazing to me.

The breakfast was delicious! There were so many options it was hard to decide, but any decision would have been the right one. We got lucky and did not have to wait very long. The location is great for a weekend trip to center city and a stroll in the park after breakfast.
Excellent breakfast spot. We had the banana pancakes and cinnamon roll pancakes. My husband had the homemade corned beef hash and I had the homemade chicken sausage. Everything was awesome!
Great food and excellent service. Be prepared to wait. Highly recommend downloading the no wait app and put your name in ahead of time. Makes a big difference in your wait time!

Great food great service. We split one of the skillets and it was perfect because the portions are huge! The prices aren't so bad either, breakfast for 2 under $20 in the city center. Not bad at all! Our server Ahtian was great! She also gave us recommendations in the city. The rest of the staff were also very attentive, our waters were never empty which is refreshing to know each customer is not forgotten at a busy restaurant.  I recommend this place for breakfast to start your day off right. We will defiantly be back when we come to Chicago again!
This is one of my favourite brunch places! It's mostly crowded on weekends but other than that the food, ambience and service is too good ! Planning to visit again..

Delish! I went for brunch on Wednesday and it was soo good. It was packed even if it was mid week. I had the florence eggs benedict and my brother ordered the butcher block skillet with whole wheat pancakes that included walnuts and figs. I dig how they text you when your ready to be seated. It was our first time there and decided to try it out since it had tons of reviews here on yelp. Our waiter was professional and attentive. The food was great, the place is super busy and the location was excellent as it was across from Millennium Park. We will definitely come back when we're in town again.

pics.caption: florence benedict, pancakes with walnuts and figs, and the butcher block skillet.

review.des:
We waited for an hour and a half. Lucky there across the street from the famous bean so the hubby and I spend our time there. So I ordered the Mexican skillet, it was delicious! I would order it again but without the chorizo. I'm Mexican so I like my chorizo crispy. The chorizo was soft and watery.

My hubby has a sweet tooth and he ordered the Oreo S'more and he loved it. I took a bite and they were pretty delicious! You should most definitely try the Mexican skillet without the chorizo.

pics.caption: Oreo S'more with skillet in the background.

review.des: This strawberry poppyseed pancakes were bomb!!!!!! The Butcher skillet (minus the pork) was amazing!! They serve large portions so I still have two meals left

Holy FUCK. This place is so phenomenal and I love it so much and the wait staff is 14/10 attractive and the food includes the greatest stack of flapjacks I've ever consumed. Go here or you'll regret the fatal mistake. This place FUCKS!

After reading countless yelp reviews mentioning long waits for a table, my sister and I came to Wildberry at 8 am last Sunday and were immediately seated. By the time we were finishing up, there was a looooong line out the door. Never been happier to have set an early alarm!

We both ordered skillets. I ordered the Mexicana (eggs, chorizo, avocado, onion, cilantro, cheese, and hash browns) with berry bliss pancakes. My sister had ordered the Denver with toast. I found my skillet to be super greasy and heavy and I could barely finish even half. My sister felt similarly about her Denver skillet. I think if you had a late night out, this might be what you're looking for to cure a hangover.

The berry bliss pancakes, however, were amazing. They were light and fluffy and I loved the mascarpone and whatever other sauces they had drizzled on top. I could eat a mountain of them!

The service was great- all the staff members seemed to be in a cheery mood, which was nice. I personally don't think I'd put up with a long wait, as I don't think the skillets are worth it, but I will be back for those berry bliss pancakes! Delicious.

pics.caption: Berry bliss pancakes. So so good!

review.des: Because this place already has a lot of good reviews, I will keep it short and just say, GET THEIR PANCAKES!! We waited 2.5 hrs and the pancakes that came on the side were ABSOLUTELY TO DIE FOR!! We got buttermilk pancakes. I'd start from there. TRUST ME.

pics.caption: Waited 2.5 hrs. Finished around 3pm. Didn't eat again that day.

review.des:
Just go there for breakfast! This place just rocks.

We hade the garden skillet and special pancakes, and our eyes teared up when we had our first bites.

pics.caption: Garden skillet, cinnamon roll pancakes, wild berries pancakes, eggwhites with jalapeños and turkey bacon.

review.des:
Soo goood! Seriously the best brunch I've ever had and the reason I'm finally offering a view on Yelp rather than just trusting Yelpers to guide me to the best places to eat.

Food: 5 stars. I had the Denver skillet with the cinnamon roll pancakes. I'm pretty much obsessed with pancakes. These were a perfect combination of light/fluffy and flavor. The skillet was bursting with flavors and so fresh! I was upset I couldn't finish it all. The food came out quick and hot.

Service: 5 stars. Jeremy was funny, attentive, helpful with recommendations for food and city sights, and kept our drinks full. He was truly the best server I've ever had (and as a former Ritz Carlton concierge who's dined out tons, my standards are high).

Location/Atmosphere: Across the street from Millenium Park. Clean, bright, and not too loud to easily talk with friends while dining.

We used the No Wait app to avoid waiting the 120 minutes at the restaurant on a Sunday at noon.

WOW this place is legit.
We had a two hour wait to get in, so we put our name on the list, walked to LA Fitness worked out and came back hungry.

You MUST try the Cinnamon Roll pancake, it was absolutely amazing. The only suggestion is don't eat it first because peaking at the beginning of the meal is never fair to the food you taste lay the end of the meal.

The Mexicana Skillet was hearty, mix it up so you get all the flavor in every bite. It was great, but.... That Damn pancake stole it's thunder.

The Berry Bliss pancake was not even as close to the experience of the cinnamon roll pancake.

Great place worth the wait!

Wandering through Chicago we crossed this restaurant well before lunch time and since it looked intriguing we reserved a table - 2 hour wait with 145 groups ahead of us!!!  Somehow it was still worth it!  Fresh ingredients in indulgent interesting combinations

I really enjoyed my breakfast from Wild Berry! Honestly, I've never dined in, I've only had carryout. The lines and crowd keeps me away. Although carryout service is great and has not let me down, I may suck it up and dine in soon.

My go to options are the Napa Vally Fig omelet AMAZING!! It's a sweet and salty comb in an omelet. If the ingredients don't weird you out, it's a must try. I've also had the yogurt and granola again awesome and great as carry out( most restaurants can't get that right).

If you are in the area and want a treat or love breakfast food as much as I do, you must try Wildberry!

pics.caption: Napa Vally Omelet! Sooo good, I forgot to take a pic until it was almost gone!

review.des:
First of all.. download the Nowait app!! It's a game changer. At 9AM on a Monday, I got in line on Nowait and it told me 2-3 hours wait. We got ready and did some sightseeing. The location is right next to Millennium Park so there is plenty to do nearby. I received a text notification around 10:45AM to return to the restaurant, and we were seated soon after we arrived.

-Mexicana Skillet ($11.50) - 5/5 - Yum! I'm from Texas and this chorizo was impressive! Super generous portion.. couldn't finish all the hashbrowns. We ate this so fast, I forgot to take a picture :(
-Signature Berry Bliss Pancake ($1.50 add on to skillet) - 5/5 - Fluffy pancakes with a heavenly sauce.
-Creamy Nutella Crepes with Bananas ($11.50) - 5/5 - Typical Nutella crepe.

Overall, the food was delicious, the portions were huge, and prices were great. The place was very busy but our server kept coming by to check on us. The experience was definitely made better when we didn't have to waste any vacation time standing in line.

Great service and amazing food! You will leave happy and full!

My husband had the brisket and it was amazing. My corned beaf hash skillet was delicious! Their cinnamon French toast was incredible! It was like a yummy cinnamon roll! Sooooo good. Our waiter was very friendly and attentive.

We had to wait about 45 minutes for a table for 4 on a Friday late morning. Well worth the wait though. I would recommend!

Came to Wildberry at 11 am on Wednesday and was surprised at how busy the place was . The wait time for a table for four was only 20 minutes . Breakfast food was stellar . I recommend the eggs Benedict or pancakes as a must have . The smoothies are a great refresher as well . If your looking for a good breakfast joint you have found it .

pics.caption: Corned Beef Hash w/ Over Easy Eggs

review.des:
Busy busy place! Worth the hype! Recommendation put your name on the list the minute you wake up, by the time you are ready and make it over there you will only have to wait a little bit.
Get a coffee drink. Hands down the best coffee specially the best caramel macchiato i have ever had. Would go back from California just for that drink

Amazing. Definitely one of the best brunch places in the city. It is worth the wait. There signature berry bliss is too die for. Love the mexicana skillet, super tasty and satisfying. I have been here so many times. One my favorite places to eat at on the weekends.
Everything tastes great. I loved the skillet and berry bliss pancakes. The negative thing was the long wait (1.5-2 hours).
The biscuit and gravy was so good nothing like I've ever had. So many options and everything is delicious.

FIRST OFF, GET THERE EARLY TO AVOID THE WAIT and THE HERD OF PEOPLE

Let's start with the "intake", upon arrival at the restaurant, situation.  This place GETS PACKED / IS PACKED in the morning for breakfast time.  Super packed, I mean, the front area desk, looks like you're in a stock market room.  Its riDONKulous!  They need to create a system to be organized because getting in and out of that joint to get to the front counter is like seriously a sardines can.  It's totally unsafe if an emergency were to happen.  My first time in Chicago and I felt the insane coldness and I can see why everyone wanted to stay inside of the restaurant to wait to have their name called, but in all honesty, there has to be a better system or even, if they feel the cold weather is the primary reason why its so cramped in the front which it IS the reason, they need to expand their front area and create a bigger waiting area.  Its STUPID crazy.  Is really worth the wait?  Outside in the cold and pushing and shoving just to get to the front desk to put your name down??  Eh, it depends.  If this business can figure out a better and safer way to get customers to wait to the side without cramping the entrance, I think its well worth the wait.  

If you have to wait  30 min or so, take a stroll across the street to Millennium Park and get a picture with THE BEAN! (That is assuming you're new to Chicago and being a tourist) That's what we did while we waited.  They text you when you're next in line, so that was good for us.

Service and food was awesome. I would want to come back and try all the other stuff this place has to offer.  I tried their Chicken & Waffles with Maple Bacon & Jalapeno.  The waffle itself had a little kick to it which I liked and bits of bacon in it.  It was different, but good.  My guy ordered the Butcher Block Skillet that had hash browns, cheddar and jack cheese, eggs, ham, sausage, turkey sausage, chicken sausage and bacon.  I LOVED his order.  The combination of all the meats was awesome.  Good flavor, not overly salty.  Just right.  I really wished I had taken his left overs to go.  =\\  Next time I'll take a bunch of other stuff to go.  

So with all that being said, I really hope this place fixes the area where names are taken down so that it is easy and safer for people to walk in and out of the restaurant.  Hope you all enjoy this place!  Happy Eatings!  @~~}~~~~

pics.caption: Chicken and Waffles with Maple Bacon  #WildberryPancakes #Foodie #FoodPorn #ChicagoEats #ChickenandWaffles

review.des: Where do I begin?! Amazing. Hands down, top three on my list of best breakfast/brunch spots! We did the "skip the line" on Yelp and waited all of maybe 3 minutes. (We attempted to come on four different occasions and finally made it on the last day!) They typically have a significantly long waiting list (our attempts were all between 1.5 hours - 3 hours of wait time), especially on a Friday, weekend, or long weekend. Ok- now to brag about the service/meal. The service was amazing, welcoming upon arrival. The waitress was very quick and servicial! She had a smile on her face all throughout the restaurant. Now the food.. Y U M M Y, Yummy, YUMMMMMY! I had the mexicana skillet which can easily feed two- or you can take to go for some extra Yums later. It's greasy but the chorizo is what makes it that way. I tilted the skillet to each side and placed napkins to absorb the orange, thick grease ;) each meal comes with a choice of toast, fruits, or PANCAKES.. why have toast or fruits when the place specializes in PANCAKES?! the funniest, fluffiest, pancakes!!!! I upgraded to the Oreo S'mores and boy was I delighted and pleased. My food was what I expected and so much more. I put some WILDBERRY jam on the pancakes and it was delightful. Best part of this all.. I took home a portion larger than what I ate of each, the skillet and pancakes.. & I bought two jars of what I can undoubtedly say is "the best dam jam I've had in my life!" Can I give a sixth star?! Will be coming back to Chicago just to eat here! Hahahahah.
Amazing place! Great food close to everything in downtown and our sever Jeremy wS amazing and knowledgeable about the city and food. Omelette and pancakes here are the bomb!!!!

I went there with my whole family .. Excellent service and I like the pancakes... However breakfast menu was ok it wasn't the best .. Take a note that u need to wait 15 or 20 minutes ,, kind of crowded .. Definitely only will come back for pancakes..

pics.caption: Multigrain walnut fig pancakes was excellent

review.des:
I went with four stars because although the Berry Bliss Pancakes were amazing, I'm not sure that this place is worth the wait and craziness.  We arrived at 10:30 on President's Day, and it was PACKED--literally people were wall-to-wall!

Although we were told that the wait would be longer, we were seated a little after 11.  (In the meantime, we went to a Starbucks a few blocks away to wait, since there's really not space to stand inside the restaurant).  I still can't get over how crowded it was, and I would consider us pretty lucky, as I heard others being told that they would have a wait of upwards of an hour and a half.  

As I mentioned, I had an omelette with the Berry Bliss Pancakes on the side.  The omelette was average to good, but the pancakes were truly excellent.  My friends also enjoyed their food, and we were impressed with the large portion sizes.  The service was also good, and I was impressed that they split our check among five people without us even asking.  The ambiance wasn't anything special, but it was comfortable.

I would come back, but likely only on a weekday in order to avoid the craziness!
The food was great and the service was excellent!! If you're in town try the pancakes and the chai tea latte. Best combo!

This is probably the best breakfast I've ever had. I dream about coming back to eat here again. We came here while visiting Chicago from out of state.

Food: My husband and I both ordered benedicts. He got the Southern Benedict, and I got the Corned Beef Benny. They were both huge portions and so rich. We didn't come close to finishing. We also had to order the signature Wildberry pancake just to try. SO SPECTACULAR. Had so much food leftover.

Service: Great service! I think we were almost immediately seated on a Tuesday morning.

Environment: Such a bright happy place of delicious food.

If you're ever in the area, make time to visit. So worth the hype!

Place was great, and walking distance from our hotel.  It seemed crowded when we first walked in, but they were able to turn tables fast, so the wait was short.

I had the hash skillet, and it was amazing.  Way more than I could eat, so got to share with my wife.  Will for sure be back.
This place is so yummy! I love their benedicts! It has a wait though so get there early!

Came here while on a business trip to Chicago. The location is great. It's right across the street from millennium park, where the famous Bean is. Anyway, the restaurant fills up quickly so make sure to go early. I got the famous pancakes and have to say I was pretty impressed. They were on the sweet side. The waitress was very nice and let me order the kids size because I knew I wouldn't finish the regular sized one. I also got a side of eggs and fresh orange juice. A bit expensive for me but figured it's average price for downtown.

For such a popular place that's turning out dishes nonstop, our food was fresh and delicious. We put our names in on the yelp app which was a lifesaver. I don't believe you should ever just come here and put your name in expecting to get in in under an hour. It's in a great location if you're a tourist and looking to head to millennium park or around the loop while you wait! Our waitress was great and staff were friendly. I will say though that for the price, you can find a much better breakfast in Chicago. Don't get me wrong, the food was very good; it just wasn't a breakfast that I'd wait hours for.

15 min wait on a holiday Monday.  Plenty of chairs and booths.  Average level of noise.  Wood decor, maroon walls (Coincidentally I match the wall paper).  70's vintage-esque lamps overhead.  Water immediately on the table.  Asked for lemons, also prompt. Prompt water refill, attentive server.  Giant helping of ketchup, for those that like ketchup on their ketchup!  I had the cinnamon roll pancakes (as I read in a prior review). These are stupid (meaning ridiculously) fluffy cakes, just a perfect balance of sweetness, melting in your mouth. Stacked four high. Light dusting of 10x, with the right drizzle of frosting.  The temperature never went below very warm.  Per Kelseys' (our great server) suggestion I chose the chicken sausage over the turkey.  The links were tasty, and lightly charred with good smoky flavor.  We also ordered an Orchard Chicken salad sandwich. Pleasant crispness from the fruit/ celery bits in between a pretzel bun.  Sweet potato fries are full of flavor, fresh, and crispy on the outside.  

Pancakes $10.95
Chicken sausage 3.75
Orchard chicken salad sandwich $11.25 with the sweet potato fry substitute

pics.caption: Corned beef hash, whites, and fruit

review.des: Fantastic! My wife had French toast with a side of potatoes. I had the Yoke combo and upgraded the French toast to cinnamon roll French toast. This is an absolute must!

As a nationally ranked place for pancakes, you can't overlook Wildberry...or the insane wait time.  Here's my advice:

(01) COME EARLY.  Wildberry opens at 6:30 AM, and as someone who loathes mornings, I'll roll out of bed so I don't have to hear that there's going to be a 90-minute wait.  I can be seated right away at 7:45 AM, but by the time I leave at 8:20 AM, tables fill up fast.
(02) ORDER PANCAKES.  Duh, this is a no-brainer.  You need to eat the pancakes at a nationally ranked pancake destination.  The hard part is figuring out WHICH pancakes to order.  I tried "being healthy" and asked for a three stack of multi-grain pancakes with figs and walnuts, and I have zero regrets.  They were fluffy and fantastic from first bite to last.
(03) TIP YOUR SERVER WELL.  Wildberry has a pretty smooth operation.  I feel like it was a matter of blinks before receiving my coffee, fruit, and pancake platter.  They probably want you in and out as quickly as possible to reduce the line times, but most people are on the go in the mornings anyways.

Follow these steps, and you'll be indulging at The Loop's busiest and most delicious breakfast spot in no time!

Before coming to Wildberry, I thought: how good can pancakes get? But I was so wrong. Wildberry pancakes are some of the best pancakes I have ever had and they taste out of this world. It's fluffy, soft and delicious, all combined into one. What I love about Wildberry is not only its solid food, but also its affordable prices ($13 pp with leftovers) despite the fact that it's located right in the touristy area of the city.

We came in on a Tuesday morning around 10/11am and waited 10 minutes for a outdoor table, since the weather was beautiful outside. While our wait was short, there were definitely a lot of people eating there for a Tuesday morning - I can see how the wait can get crazy long during the weekends. I would definitely recommend coming here either early on a weekend or on a weekday.

We got the Garden skillet and the Mexicana skillet, which were both delicious and large. My Mexicana had a lot of chorizo and came with this delicious and slightly spicy salsa. Neither of us could finish them alone. We also subbed in our sides of pancakes (comes in two) for specialty pancakes for $1.5 more - we got the signature berry pancake and the fresh berry pancake. Both were delicious - the signature pancake is great, but on the sweet side and I would not add more syrup on it. The fresh berry pancake was perfect with syrup. They have more than 8 different types of specialty pancakes so plenty of options to choose from.

All of this came out to be $28 before tip. Servers were attentive and there were enough sun umbrellas outside for each table. I can't wait to be back!

pics.caption: Mexicana skillet with chorizo on the side

review.des:
My friend and I were staying way down in the South Loop but decided to try out Wildberry for a late breakfast before heading over to the Art Institute...and it was more than worth it! We waited about 30-35 minutes, which seemed a bit much for a Thursday morning, but I'm glad we sucked it up because the food was amazing.

I was also pleasantly surprised at the prices - my bill was less around $17 with tax and that included a very large and delicious cappuccino, as well as the "two eggs any style" with bacon and hash browns AND a side of specialty pancakes (the Oreo ones, to be specific). Everything was amazing and it was definitely more food than I could eat. (On top of that, I'd go back for the Oreo pancakes alone.)

My one minor issue was that while at first the server was very attentive and friendly, after we received our food he kind of disappeared and it was troublesome to get water refills and even our checks. Eventually I had to flag down a busboy to help us get the latter. But all in all, well worth the money and the experience and I highly suggest Wildberry if you're in Chicago and want a truly great breakfast.

NomNomNom !!!

Rating :
+5 - Food & Service
The place was closing in 15 but they graciously seated our party of 11 and took our presumably mammoth order! Our server made some excellent recommendations on the portions and signature dishes too :)

Recommend :
- Taking the omelette + fruits + pancakes combo
- Customizing the omelette to your taste cause they make it really well !
- I personally loved the S'more Oreo pancakes :D (The buttermilk pancakes are fluffy and awesome too )
- Right next to Millennium park & if you're not feeling like Giordanos :P

Not a fan :
- The Banana split smoothie. Was oddly different from what I was expecting.

pics.caption: Made my custom omelette (lots of cheese and chicken :P ) combo with some French toast and finger licking S'more Oreo Pancakes !

review.des: be here earlier～ we are here @ 8am on Sunday morning,  waiting around 20mins. We got hot apple cider & spicy pumpkin latte (seasonal) We share one omelette and upgrade pancake-berries pancakes (must try). Two people share one meal  Good foods, Good Location near cloud gate & navy pie

Such a great breakfast spot! The wait for a table went pretty quick and the food was speedy. Huge portions! Loved the skillet with the pancakes that I got and it's definitely worth checking this place out.

I looooooove Wildberry. Anytime I'm craving brunch food, I would want to go to Wildberry, except for the line is always out the door. That's the only thing stopping me from dining there every other week. Usually I don't have time on weekdays to go out to brunch, and coming here on the weekends is just a huge no-no unless you have a couple hours to kill.

I'm more of a savory brunch lover, so although Wildberry is known for their delicious crepes and pancakes, I always get their skillets or benes. Don't get me wrong, I always try to get pancakes or something sweet on the side as well, and it's always delicious. Prices aren't bad either. The skillets and benedicts are around $10-12, and pancakes are $10. Although if you get a skillet, you can get regular pancakes on the side or pay an extra $1.50 for specialty pancakes (which I highly suggest!).

Favorite savory dishes: Garden skillet, Florence Benedict
Favorite pancakes: Signature Berry Bliss

There was a long wait to eat here. Lucky for us the Yelp waitlist was there to help. We each had a sizzling skillet, I had the corn beef and my better half had the garden. The speciality pancakes were amazing. The blueberry danish had a good flavor and the chocolate banana pancakes were really good. I will be back on my next trip to Chi Town.

Wow, this place was hopping but it was worth the wait. We did an online reservation and still had to wait once there, however there were several events in town that weekend so I understand. Once in the service was great and even though they were jammed packed getting our food was pretty quick. The food good, flavorful and tasty and worth the money.

Advice is to either go early or do the online reservation as to avoid up to a 2-hour wait.
Adding our name to the Yelp waitlist ahead of arriving was a huge time saver for our group of 4. Our brunch was great. Great coffee!

Cinnamon roll pancakes are the breakfast of champions! Moist, not too sweet, and even had a little crisp to them. Highly recommend it if you like cinnamon rolls.

The signature berry bliss waffle was just okay  the waffle tasted more moist than most waffles, but it didn't blow me away.

pics.caption: Cinnamon roll pancakes are #breakfastofchampions! The signature berry bliss waffle was just okay

review.des: Very delicious food. Place was packed! Soo many people inside and waiting outside. The wait wasn't so bad. Decently priced.
This place is good, but not up to the hype. I wouldn't wait or stay in line to eat here. There are a lot of other places with similar food and no wait.

A brunch place downtown is always welcomed. This is located across the street from Millennium Park so a good option for before/after hanging out at the park or sightseeing. There may be a long wait over weekend but you can get a coffee while you wait.

Just about everything that I've had here is good. My favorites are the Fig and Walnut Multi-grain pancakes, Berry Bliss pancakes (blueberry pancake with berries and mascarpone), and Napa Valley Fig Omelette (fig, bacon and havarti cheese).
Great Waffles and coffee. Waited 45 min but worth it. Suggest sharing hasbrowns. Order was huge. Vanilla berry latte was great.

BERRY BLISS PANCAKES... Delicious!

Came here on a Tuesday for a table of 4 and waited about 25 minutes. Not bad at all! Ordered the Blissberry, Cinnamon Roll, Tiramisu & Buttermilk Pancakes as well as the Denver Skillet. Everything tasted amazing!

The Skillet is huge and definitely enough to share! It comes with 2 poached eggs, hash browns, cheese, & sausages... Perfect combination, especially with a nice runny egg to top it off. And why not upgrade for a $1 more for the special pancakes?! SO WORTH IT. The infamous signature Blissberry Pancakes comes with Mascopone Cheese and fresh berry sauce on top. Not too sweet at all. The Cinnamon Roll Pancake was also another favorite and tasted like a cinnabar!

Luckily this place was walking distance from our hotel (we stayed at the Hyatt Regency at the Magnificent Mile). It was definitely worth enduring the cold to try the best pancakes in Chicago. :) I definitely recommend coming here if you're visiting the windy cindy. One of the best meals I ate during my visit!

pics.caption: Poached eggs in my skilled! So good
Buttermilk, bliss berry, tiramisu, and cinnamon roll pancakes

review.des: I was in chicago and my cousin told me to try wildberry. On a Monday we had to wait over 30min to be seated. But once we sat down the service was amazing. The waitress was very attentive and the food which is the most important was delicious.

While visiting Chicago for the weekend, we came to Wildberry not once, but twice for breakfast. Holy bananas - this place is good! Thank the pancake gods that they are on the no-wait app, because we would have had to wait over an hour for a table. This is place is packed all day on the weekends and rightfully so! The first day I got a Garden Skillet, with walnut and fig pancakes. My skillet was HUGE and packed with a ton of fresh veggies, nicely cooked potatoes and eggs on top. I had a hard time finishing half of the skillet and I still had pancakes to eat! They were a perfect sweet ending to my mega-meal. Service is quick and everyone is really friendly. The next day, I ordered a Rutherford omelet, which was good, but I didn't enjoy it as much as the skillet. Can't wait to go back to Chi-town for another delicious breakfast!

Fast food, fast service! Great tasting, no wonder the lines during the summer was long. It was so worth it. Despite the long lines, they managed a fast turn around which was great! One of the best eggs Benedict's around! Great pancakes! Definitely coming back!

Went there for breakfast during a recent trip to Chicago and the Yelp reviews were on point.    The signature berry pancakes were on point.    Just make sure you are hungry.  Also get there before 8am on Saturday if you want to avoid the long wait for a table

Yeah, the wait is painful. Checked in via yelp, but total time was 2.5 hours.  It's worth it, service was good, waiter was very personable. Food is great; cinnamon roll pancakes, eggs, hash browns and turkey sausage patties. I was expecting different from the cinnamon roll pancakes, made me wish I got the french toast. Hubby got the berry pancakes, eggs, roast beef skillet- loved everything about it. My reason for 4 stars is because its so busy, ordering is kind of automated. After waiting so long, they kind of expect you to know what you want. Order fast, food comes out in reasonable time, but I never got the cheese on my eggs and hubby never got the requested refill on his drink. They cleared the table prematurely fast- so I had no utensils to put my leftovers in the take-out box.

Holy mother of gluten free glory!! Had the hot honey cakes (pancakes) and it was a tear shedding, life altering, culinary masterful experience. I swear they mixed up my order with regular pancakes because the execution in these babies is MIND BLOWING!!  
Then, when you think things just can't possibly get better...IT DID! The chorizo and egg casserole was outstanding! Not only in taste but in the presentation and very generous portion size. I do wish it would've came with some scratch made corn tortillas to really blow it out the park. All in all this was money well spent and a meal my family and I won't soon forget!

Good menu selection- note that they do not serve any alcohol though so no blood us or mimosas! I had the pancakes and a skillet- was all tasty!

Was a wait but was worth it- they are on the no wait app so I advise using that if you try to go on a weekend.

Yes the wait is long. However, this place is worth it. Plus, putting your party on NoWait allows more time(we were able to get coffee and hangout in the hotel).I know they are famous for their pancakes but damn their omelets are really good too! My dad and I loved this place so much that we came back the following day-despite the fact that we had a tight day as we were traveling back home! I pretty much think you can't go wrong with anything at this restaurant! My recommendation though would be do get an omelet (The Rutherford was my favorite) and a side of the specialty pancakes(The Cinnamon roll ones you won't want to miss out on.) With all the specialty drinks they have as well, you won't have room for an entree order of pancakes! I had a Mint Mocha Frappé so I could barely scarf down half of my side order of Banana Cream pie pancakes because I was sugared out! Also the service is very homey and the employees are very enthusiastic and flexible with orders and substitutions. I miss you already Wildberry.

Love,
Your biggest fan from California

The food was great after we finally got it. We were seated and ordered the waited almost 30min for breakfast on a Thursday late morning. I witnessed 2-3 other tables seated after us get their food before us. When our food finally did arrive the expo not even our server just dropped our plates in front of us like he was throwing them. Overall food was good but could have had a better customer service experience.

Pretty near perfection on the famous pancakes.  Sweet flavor, crispy outside and fluffy inside.  Just the regular pancakes are served with a berry jam and butter, so good. The corned beef skillet was good but the corned beef is steamed.  I like mine with a crunch to it.  Only warning - do not order a bisquit, you are not in the South where they are light, fluffy, crunchy on the outside and pillow soft on the inside.  You are in the Midwest where they are thick and dry.  If the bisquit was better, they'd get a 5 star
Be smart and put your name on the waitlist using Yelp or call in.  We had no wait by using the Yelp waitlist, we were 3 minutes later than the "required check in time" but they kept our spot.

I've been to Wildberry several times and it has yet to disappoint.  You will wait a long time, especially on the weekend, but I assure you it is worth it!  I get the Mexicana skillet almost every time.  This time I got it with chorizo and usually opt for it without.  The chorizo is good just a bit overpowering.  My boyfriend has been getting the brisket hash recently and loves it.  As always my go to pancakes are the cinnamon swirl but you can't go wrong with the oreo smores either!  Easily the best breakfast spot in the city!

pics.caption: Mexicana skillet cinnamon swirl pancakes and brisket hash in the back

review.des: No wait and super speedy service for 0900 on a Thursday morning. The wait staff was attentive and friendly. The food (and selection) was amazing. Omelettes, waffles, pancakes (oh the variety of specialty pancakes!), eggs Benedict's, and coffees. Would love to come back every day of my vacation.
Garden Skillet, Swiss bliss pancakes, side of bacon and The Wildberry OJ. Perfection! Not to mention the outstanding clientele service from Jasmine. Wifey and I will return for the sequel!

I have been to Wildberry twice now and I am in love. I love breakfast food and this is a must go. If you go to the location in downtown it's a bit of a wait but the one in Schaumburg suburb was not as busy. The service is pretty fast. I was super excited and satisfied with the S'more and Oreo pancakes!! My friend had their toast and it was also good. Their skillets are so delicious and tasty too. I ordered the Mexican skillet with chorizo and it was better than expected. I will be coming back for the third time.

pics.caption: The first time my best friend and I went to one of my favorite breakfast joints we went all out. Must haves are in this picture.
Half order of Smores and Oreo pancakes and the Mexican skillet was so tasty!! Must try!!!

review.des: When in Chicago this is a MUST!! Although I wouldn't recommend dining is specially on the weekend due to wait time of almost 2 hours I am pretty sure that it is still worth it. I got my pancakes and omelette to go and only waited for 20 minutes. Food was very delicious I kind of regret not getting any sweets or their crepe =(  but there's always a next time :-)

Not normally a big fan of brunch or breakfast either but had a chance to experience Wildberry when I was visiting Chicago and I must say it was a great time with even better food. The location was everything being right across the street from Millennium Park we decided to sit outside to have are meal fantastic choice. I will also say this come early and use an application called nowait on your phone it helps you get in line as you are arriving to cut down on your wait time which is helpful because Wildberry stays packed. I had the outstanding Butcher Block Sizzlin Skillet which was well worth the $13.00 price you could easily split that with another person if you wanted. The staff from top to bottom from our hostess to the wait staff was top notch and was the cherry on top to a very memorable experience, I most say somewhere I would visit again my next time in Chicago for sure! Premium service and food for reasonable prices that is how I would describe Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe.

pics.caption: I wasn't ready for the size of this skillet when they brought it out kept me full almost all day long, lol.
The massive Butcher Block Sizzlin Skillet.

review.des: Great breakfast spot.  Buffalo chicken wrap looks amazing and my skillet was awesome.

Very happy we found this place for brunch. The food was excellent, as were the lattes, and the prices are very reasonable. The wait time is a little long but using the waitlist helped a lot. Near some fun tourist-y things so easy to kill time while you wait. Friendly staff, nice ambiance, worth checking out!

As an out of towner, this was well worth the stop for some amazing breakfast. After looking at other reviews on here, we decided for a middle of the week stop while using the NoWait app. Grabbed our spot on the app before we left the condo, 8 minutes later we walked in, and then we received a text that we had 5 minutes to check in. We were seated immediately after. Easiest process ever. We also walked in at 9:30 on a Wednesday, which helped.

Everyone raves about the Berry Bliss, as they should, but don't discount the rest of the specialty pancakes either. The chocolate chip and Banana Cream Pie were equally as delicious. Hash browns were amazing, but the eggs were forgettable (both egg white scrambled and regular scrambled). BLT with egg was good as well. 5 stars with no complaints.

Service was great with our waiter cracking jokes constantly to keep the mood light. Helped out with the kid we had in our group.

pics.caption: Butcher Block with scrambled egg whites ($1 extra for egg whites)
Scrambled eggs with two sausage patties and hash browns
"WB" BLT on wheat bread with chips

review.des: Came on Sunday around 7am and there was a 40 minute wait... and for GOOD reason! We were able to walk around and they texted us when our table was ready on the yelp app. I ordered the Eggs Benedict and my boyfriend ordered the Mexican Burrito -- Yummmmms! While I didn't drink the coffee, my boyfriend had three cups. I drank the orange juice, which tasted fresh squeezed.

I get the seasonal fruit plate with a half of grapefruit. All of the fruit is very fresh and nice big portions. My wife loves their omelettes and has tried almost all of them by now.

We come here about once a week before we go to work.

It's always busy which is great but expect a wait. Tables are usually full around this time.

Great place to eat. Recommend it to anyone downtown.

Great variety of food, you can usually eat this for days after. If you're looking for good breakfast food, this is your spot but you'll have to wait especially during the weekends as it gets packed early (typical an hour to an hour and a half wait). Great touristy area.

Delicious food definitely!!! We waited for about 30 minuets, it is worth!!! I ordered f/g honey berry pancake and veggie omelet, the pancake may be a little too much for me. I look forward to being here again!
Have dined at Wildberry several times and I've always loved it.  The food is consistently good and service is good, too.  Love the omelettes and pancakes.  Worth the wait.

Went to this Fine establishment in Novemeber of last year and can tell you it is always packed! So get there early or if you are a heavy sleeper and don't think you will make it on time get the "Nowait" app and you can be put into the line for a table. I asked for the Denver skillet for breakfast...it is more than enough for me and I eat alot lol.

pics.caption: Denver skillet, with a side of Pancakes

review.des:
Food was great and potions were generous. Place was packed and hoping.
Had the cinnamon roll pancakes and they were fantastic.

THIS PLACE IS AMAZING! We had to wait about 45 minutes on a Monday morning for brunch for 2 which was a little crazy but it was so worth it. The food was awesome! The pancakes were the best - I had the chocolate chip and the hubs had the berry.

Service was quick. I wish the wait weren't so long but I would make it a definite stop on your trip to Chicago!

TIP: Use the No Wait app to check in prior to arriving!
So delicious!! The cinnamon roll pancakes were to die for!!! Fantastic service and you can tell the wait staff ya a lot of teamwork! Would love to come back!

I visited Wildberry two days in a row.  Had a traditional breakfast of eggs, sausage and pancakes the first day.  Tried crapes with a yogurt and berry filling the second day.  Enjoyed both equally!  The staff, servers and attention were excellent.  My waitresses was very patient with me and helpful.  A "must" for breakfast!

Perfect place for breakfast. Busy place but they get you seated and fed quickly. Looked around and found that was highly recommended and I can see why. Try anything with gravy on it, it will not disappoint. I would recommend making an online reservation to save from waiting outside for a seat. Enjoy.

Hands down, the best breakfast place I've ever had. Even better than Flappy Jacks on Route66, which is famous in LA. My favorite was everything I ordered, but what stood out to me the most was the berry bliss pancakes. It was very unique unlike any other kind of pancakes I've ever had before. This place is definitely a must try, especially if you are visiting from out of town!

Stopped by this place for Memorial Day. First off the places was supper busy with a hour and thirty minute wait. We waited did a little shopping in the area. Once we sat down from start to finished top notch service. Very delicious kiwi lemonade and then heaven arrived Denver Skillet with pancakes.
This meal here was a slap your moma meal. Perfectly prepared, each bite was like having party in your mouth with some good cocktails.
Whenever I'm in Chicago this is the place for me to stop by.....

pics.caption: Damn good breakfast.....Denver Skillet with pancakes that melt in your mouth.....

review.des: Pro tip for Wildberry: download the no wait app and get in line before you head to the restaurant. The food is great and there's never a long wait for food once you sit down, but the wait can be a downer if you're trying to go on a whim. The wait staff is nice and friendly, but it's obvious table turnover is the top priority. Can feel very rushed once you finally sit down after surviving the wait. The food is very appropriately priced and you will leave full. Favorite brunch spot in the Loop.

Usually when I go to brunch or breakfast or eating out in general I am looking for authentic, true to the city, local, fresh, made-from scratch, etc.

Wild berry pancakes is moderately good food, and somethings are homemade, but I have to think they are more great marketers than actual authentic made from scratch "homemade" it seems more like the PANERA of breakfast and brunch.

We had the pancakes and a skillet and omelette and they were good, the ingredients are definitely higher quality than a Denny's or IHOP. The service is excellent, these servers are pros, nothing but good things to say about the service.

I've been here multiple times and have tried several different things. It's always really busy but the wait isn't usually over 20 minutes long, unless you go for something like Sunday brunch on Father's Day.

I've tried both sweet and savory dishes here, and to be honest, the one that takes the cake every single time are the "Signature Berry Bliss" pancakes. DO NOT get these confused with the "Wildberry" pancakes. "Signature Berry Bliss" are much much better and, to put it how our waiter did, are "the reason you waited 45 minutes to eat here." They have them in the waffle, french toast, and crepe version - but trust me, pancakes are the best way to eat them.

If you're having a hard time picking between Sweet and Savory, try getting something that comes with a side of pancakes. You can sub in specialty pancakes for just $1.50 and it is so worth it. You get 2 pancakes along with your savory dish and it balances perfectly!

The skillets are alright. Every time I come here, I always convince myself to try one again. The hashbrowns are usually not crispy enough, and can sometimes feel mushy.

The french toast is really good as well. They have strawberry lemon poppyseed pancakes in season right now, and they are also good. But again, nothing beats the "Signature Berry Bliss" pancakes. Get them, you won't regret it.

pics.caption: Breakfast burrito with a side of hash
Strawberry lemon poppyseed pancakes with lemon buttercream

review.des: One of the best American breakfasts that I have eaten in Chicago was served by Wildberry pancakes restaurant! The quality of the food in comparison to its price is perfect! And because of that, all of its branches are full of people! Recommended!
This place has great food. It seems to always have a long wait. We were lucky and got a table outside! The service was great!

So Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe was so delicious!!! I had the berry bliss crepes and a white mocha latte and it was absolutely amazing! I took away one star because the wait was absolutely ridiculous!!! I mean 2 hours to eat brunch! I'm from NY and I totally get the popularity aspect, but 2 hours is a bit much considering the fact their wait in line app was having major issues.

Service was fine but they didn't ask if we wanted outside or in before putting our names down so we got stuck outside, which would of been fine except we were not dressed for how warm it was and also the bees. There was about 5 bees swarming us the whole time crawling on and in our food, and when we said something about the bees the server said "they are fine, no one has been bitten yet".
One of the best breakfast places I've ever been to. Would definitely recommend. Very long wait, so if you're running late on time, head over to their second location in the Water Tower Place.
Great service even though it's super busy. Food was delicious, we had the Mexican skillet and the banana cream pancakes. Would return again!

This place was delicious and well worth the wait!!! We checked in online before we left our hotel so when we got there we only had to wait about another 20 minutes. Definitely a must go when in Chicago. So much food for the money! Would recommend to anyone coming into town!!

This place was good food and fast service! The parking sucked and that was my only complaint we had to pay like $38 to park with no validation from wild berry. The food was great and reasonable prices but that parking tho

Great brunch! Fantastic pancakes and the skillet was awesome. The service was good and the coffee was good. The only downside is the wait time and the crowd level so wouldn't go every weekend but worth a try!

Really enjoyed the food. There was a huge lineup and we were lucky to get on the wait list on yelp, otherwise we would have had to wait about 1hour to get seated instead of the 15 min. And this was at 11:30am on Monday morning.

Service was great. The food was very tasty. The pancakes by themselves were excellent however the specialty pancakes tasted like dessert with loads of icing and other flavours.

Great way to start our day in Chicago.

Yeah, I don't get it.  The amazing reviews and news from my grandma that there's always a line out the door in the summer must have really psyched me up for eating here, but I found the experience to be lacking.  Our server was borderline rude and more interested in sharing Instagram photos with her fellow waitresses than waiting on us.  My egg panini was impossible to eat, the ingredients just slid everywhere on the plate, so I ended up eating my bread, cheese, and tomatoes as yolk-soaked separates.  Hashbrowns were boring and I ended up leaving 3/4 of the whole shebang sitting on my plate.  Don't worry, my waitress didn't ask if I liked it or if I wanted it boxed up.
My husband tried the slow roasted brisket hash and deemed in "unmemorable."  I guess he has it better than me.  I can't imagine why anyone would wait in line for food here.
This place definitely stands up to all the hype, the food was delicious, the service was excellent, arrived early to avoid the long lines!
Such a great breakfast spot and everything was delicious! After a pretty lengthy wait, we were seated outside. Service was quick, food was great and everyone was so nice.

pics.caption: Specialty pumpkin spice pancakes, worth the $1 upgrade fee!
Homemade pumpkin spice latte on this chilly day!

review.des: We went there because of the stellar reviews. With the caveat that none in our party ordered their fancy, signature pancakes, we were honestly unimpressed. The hash browns were tasteless. The breakfast burrito had all of the avocado toward the front of the burrito and all of the egg toward the back end. The omelette was also fairly tasteless. On the other hand, the waffle one in our party ordered earned good reviews. So, maybe you should stick with the pancakes and waffles.

As soon as our flight landed in Chicago and we reached our hotel, we were looking for some nice joint for breakfast and this place had so many great reviews and luckily was a few steps away from where we stayed(Hyatt regency) so husband and I decided to give it a try, went in and the wait time was 45mins!! As soon we got seated we ordered some freshly squeezed orange juice and a Fresco omelette(vegetarian version) with fruit and walnut and fig pan cakes and their Signature berry bliss, which was suggested to us by our friendly waiter! The food arrived in less than 15 minutes and the taste OMG was freaking delicious!! The fresco omelette was so filling that I couldn't do justice to the walnut&fig pancakes but were too good to pass but luckily we had a long day planned ahead to shed off those extra calories;)
Overall a 10/10 for food, service and ambience!!

pics.caption: Walnut and Fig pancakes--I didn't have any place left after fresco but they taste delicious!!
Delicious Fresco omelet with fruit(vegetarian version)
Signature berry bliss--is truly a bliss!!

review.des:
This is good ole, down home, American, stick-to-your-bones, go-out-and-work-in-the-field-the -rest-of-the-day, breakfast. Eat here once, MAYBE twice a month if you dare. From what I saw, people were eating food that as it passed their lips, the look of guilt for eating such gluttonous bites, was quickly eclipsed by a look of satisfaction. If it was someone else's tab, I would have gotten one of everything. I kick myself for not trying the biscuits and gravy, but let's get real. My travel buddy got the turkey sandwich with the egg (I'm not entirely sure sandwiches DON'T come with egg these days in Chicago...). I instead tried the skillet and asked for a side of hollandaise. Don't judge me. I wanted to see how they prepared it. They misunderstood and presented my side of their chipotle hollandaise in a ramekin with a soup spoon, as if I was going to eat it like a thick clam chowder. I almost did it was so good. It wasn't the best (if you're looking for the best, it's at Katy's in Carmel, Ca.) but it was daaaaamn close.
The sandwich was solid (I swear, if I have another sandwich with a fried egg on it...) and my skillet was cheezy, potatoey, sausagey, delishesness. I ate half and then threw in the towel out of fear of later cardiac complications. This food is by no means gourmet but any greasy spoon across the US would be LUCKY to have any of these items on their menu, let alone serving in their establishment. *slow clap* nicely done, Widberry, nicely done.

OMG!!! Our first time in Chicago and we came here for breakfast... Hostess said the wait was going to be about 1 hour and 15 min to 1 hour and a half... Well... We waited an hour and let me say this... IT WAS WELL WORTH IT!!!
I had the Mexicana skillet which I must say was amazing. All the flavors mixed together we Delcious. I also paired it with their specialty berry bliss pancakes that I have to say were so good they didn't even need syrup!!
Portions were so much that it's almost impossible to finish everything. Sadly I had to leave some pancakes behind .
I also had the kiwi lemonade which was also delicious!
If and when we ever return we will come back to eat here BUT we will definitely share a skillet that way we can eat all of the delicious pancakes!!!

pics.caption: The Venetian skillet with regular pancakes
Mexicana skillet with berry bliss pancakes

review.des:
Blegh. Why anyone would wait over an hour for this is beyond me. We used the app, so we strolled up  and were seated immediately, but even so I wish we had gone elsewhere. Our waiter was great, but the food was mediocre at best, and the atmosphere is uninspiring, even if it is right across from Millennium Park (you wouldn't know it from inside).

We didn't try the pancakes, so maybe that's the draw, but they didn't look particularly enticing, and the biscuits tasted like chalk. Hash browns were pretty limp, too. Definitely a pass; Chicago has way better options. Go across the river and get a fresh, hot doughnut from the Doughnut Vault. You'll save tons of time and money, and it will be delicious.

This breakfast was filling & delicious!! The wait was long on Sunday for brunch, but they turned the tables very quickly to keep the customer flow moving (without making you feel rushed).

The pancakes with the fruit topping were fluffy & perfectly cooked. The bacon was the best I've ever had, and the omelet & fresh juice was really good also.

Definitely worth the wait! We enjoyed it so much that we ate there twice while we were in town!

Mediocre would be an overstatement. Went to wildberry for a very late brunch and was deeply disappointed. Everything from the coffee to the eggs Benedict was almost repulsing. I don't get what the buzz is with this place. Service also felt rushed and dirty, the food looked literally thrown on a plate. Bonus was I found a hair in my hash browns before I even got to take the first bite. Totally cool.

The best pancakes! Our table ordered a variety from the menu. The gluten free pancakes were amazing! The regular pancakes were delicious as well.
I doubt there is a bad choice of any pancake option!
There was a line at 8 am, worth the wait. Service is good and very fast!

Food was great, customer service was fast. Only thing I would recommend is to make a reservation before going. You will have to wait and the wait is long, like 30-40 mins depending on your party size. I will be returning thou. Love the ambience

Such an amazing breakfast/brunch place! Wish I could eat here more often but live out of town. I ordered a skillet and side of plain pancakes for my breakfast and the pancakes were perfect! Probably the best I've ever had. Perfectly cooked and fluffy. The skillet was hearty and very flavorful. We came on a weekday because heard the lines could be long and had no problem getting a table right away. Highly recommend this place in Chicago! Will be back.
The food is good, not great.  Absolutely not worth the wait.  The pancakes are loaded with unnecessary sugar.
Awesome people.  The food was great.  The delivery was expeditious and the place was very clean and efficiently run.

I ordered an eggs benny platter with the pancake upgrade.

Great service, food was generally OK, the poached eggs were cooked perfectly but I felt disappointed with the pancakes, it was just so-so.

The food is better than a diner for sure, just with higher prices and better service.

This was a great place. I got in line on the Yelp app which was super convenient. They are very efficient so things flowed very smoothly and the wait was about what they said it would be. I am not usually a big fan of pancakes but love berries so decided to try their specialty. It was delicious!!  The best pancakes I have ever had. I will be back next time I am in Chicago.

I had been looking forward to this place for sometime. Unfortunately it didn't live up to its hype. I ordered classic eggs Benedict with a side of pancakes, juice and coffee. First let me preface that I always order eggs Benedict where ever I am. Because I had to make it so many times when cooking I know what it's supposed to look and taste. This one did neither. If I wanted a half of a shank of ham I would have ordered one. Eggs Benedict is supposed to have shaved ham or Canadian bacon. The hollandaise was also lacking in that it was cold and had no taste at all. The pancakes although tasted good were soggy and cold. Again very disappointing. They really need a quality person running their line and controlling what comes out of the kitchen. Doubt I'll ever return but luckily Chicago has a lot of other choices

I used to think all pancakes were the same. Wildberry changed that - these pancakes are sooooo good. How do they get them to be so fluffy and perfect? Tried both the downtown and the Schaumburg location. The wait is long at both, but you can use the nowait app which is like a reservation. The Mexicana skillet is good too, but I wouldn't miss out on trying at least one pancake.

This was the first time I had ever been to Wildberry and it was delicious! The staff was very friendly and the food was to die for.

First off, the location of Wildberry is prime. They are by the corner of Michigan Ave and Randolph St. It is close to the Metra, 'L', and easy to walk to if you are out shopping the Magnificent Mile. When we got their the line was crazy. The lobby was crammed with people waiting to be seated, but amongst the chaos our hostess still greeted us with a smile which is much appreciated. They also have a cool texting system, so even though our wait was about an hour, we were able to walk around Millennium park across the street always staying 10 minutes away. This made the wait go by fast and since you have about 10 minutes from when you get the text to when you have to get to the hostess, you have time to make it to the restaurant. Of course after they called us we still had to wait about 10 minutes to be seated, but that was ok. They have a nice system going that seems to work for them. If anything about our experience was bad, it was the crammed waiting area. Once you step inside, it feels very claustrophobic and I think opening up the area a little will do it some good. However, you have to work with what you got and they do that nicely.

Once we sat down we were greeted by a very nice waiter. He took the time to explain specials and answered our questions. He was in such a good mood even though they were swamped and really brightened our experience. Even the busboys were prompt, refilling our waters and taking away empty plates within seconds of us finishing.

All that aside, when you come to a restaurant you come for the food, so on to the important part. I ordered the berry bliss pancakes and it was a little slice of heaven in my mouth. The berry mascarpone was sweet and tart making a great addition to the vanilla anglaise. The pancakes were fluffy, but still decadent so I only ended up eating half of the breakfast. My boyfriend got the corned beef benedict and that was very good too. However, if you are coming to Wildberry, the pancakes are where its at.

I will definitely come again, although hopefully not on such a crazy Saturday morning.

pics.caption: Berry Bliss pancakes and it is truly... blissful

review.des:
There's easily a 1.5-2 hour wait to be seated. The food is ok. Biscuit was dry. Cinnamon roll pancakes only had icing on the top pancake and the 3 pancakes underneath were all plain. Bacon wasn't crispy. Skillet was pretty good though. Once you're seated, service is fast.

Not worth the hype or the wait. But if you insist on trying the food, do yourself a favor and call for takeout and skip the line.

Tigah is happy to report that Wildberry lives up to the hype. We had the Venetian skillet ($11)with a side of 2 cinnamon roll pancakes (extra $1.50), the signature berry bliss crepes ($12), and the biscuits and gravy ($9.50).  These 3 dishes fed a party of 5.

As you know, Tigah is all about the fresh fruits in breakfast foods.  We were really pleased to see a good amount of fresh, good quality blueberries, strawberries, and blackberries in the crepes which were thin and nicely cooked. The pancakes were very light and fluffy.  At first we were hesitant about choosing the cinnamon roll flavor because we were afraid it would be too sweet. It wasn't. It had a nice hint of cinnamon with a drizzle of sugar and icing that made syrup unnecessary.  

The biscuits and gravy were a nice surprise. Tigah usually avoids biscuits and gravy for breakfast because most places, the biscuits are dry and dense and use lots of gravy to mask it.  At Wildberry, the biscuits were light, moist and fluffy. The sausage gravy also tasted very good. Tigah loved it!

We ordered one large glass of OJ for $4 but it was worth the price. It was fresh squeezed and tasted like it.  All in all, one of the best breakfasts we've had in Chicago.

pics.caption: Venetian skillet with side of cinnamon roll pancakes ($12.50)

review.des:
The wait is no joke. Check in online before trying to get into this place.

We had the Mexicana skillet, berry bliss and apple cinnamon pancakes, and California fig omelet. They were all amazing!

The portions are large...we agreed we would split a meal next time.
Awesome food, great service. They are too popular and the wait to the table can be very long... when are they opening a new place?

The fruit is fresh, try out the smoothies for such.  The pancakes and waffle dishes are mildly creative but most importantly en pointe, and the sausage is comprehensively good even as an afterthought.
Try the Berry Bliss Pancakes and the Fresca omelette (add the maple turkey sausage) - great food, and fast service. I recommend getting on the waitlist through Yelp though...super popular place.
Just ok.  Definitely nothing special.  I would put it on the same level as Ihop.  If you are looking for a truly great breakfast spot, head on over to one of the Original Pancake houses.

I was looking for a good breakfast/brunch place before I kicked off my touristy day in Chicago. I found this place on yelp and am so glad I did. The waitress was nice and attentive and came by almost immediately after seating to take our drink order. I looked around and EVERYONE'S food looked incredible.

I ordered chicken apple sausage and the signature berry bliss pancakes to split with my partner, while he had fried chicken from the chicken and waffle special they were offering. The pancakes were off the hook! With the vanilla anglaise, blackberry coulis, berry mascapone and fresh berries on top, I didn't even need to use syrup. They were already sweet and yet held up to the topping without being soggy. I'm glad I split the plate, as I would've been weighed down (and on a sugar overload) if I ate them by myself.

I'll be sure to come back again if I'm ever in Chicago.
They give you a LOT of food.  The pancakes were enough for two, but they were great!  I enjoyed the corn beef hash skillet, but I wish there was more corn beef than hash brown in it.

Great breakfast right by Millennium Park.  Pancakes and French Toast are awesome.  The ability to use waitlist feature on Yelp was outstanding.  Was a thirty minute wait but checked in before leaving hotel.   Great workflow.  

Highly recommend.
Well worth the wait. We waitlisted through Yelp and it was a great timesaver. Service was prompt. Food was delicious. I had to try the pancakes and loved them

Waited an hour and a half to remember I had tried the #1 yelp brunch spot a few years back. WB evoked a similarly meh response after dining - it's a long wait for ok pancakes and average egg dishes. I recommend Beatrix for brunch instead.

3.5 * stars.

No matter what you order, it's outstanding. From the corned beef hash to the signature wildberry pancakes, to the simplest sunny-side eggs, it's served up hot, fresh and attractively. And, they have the hottest Intelligentsia coffee in town-- their coffee is so good I would go just for the coffee. There can be a wait, but it is one of the few places I would say it's worth it.

My partner and I have walked past Wildberry many times while visiting in Chicago and never stopped. We decided to wait about an hour today to get a seat. While I feel the pancakes (apple pecan) were tasty, the omelet was not!
Honestly, I do not think this place is worth the wait. There are a TON of better options in Chicago.

I have been to this spot for breakfast and brunch many times and always loved it. Their Classic Eggs Benedict are fantastic, but if you're feeling like eating healthy I suggest the Fresca omelette with tomatoes and avocado.
For those more into sweet breakfast, I think no one will argue the best are the Signature Berry Pancakes.
They don't take reservations and it's usually pretty crowded in the weekends, so either get there early or be ready to wait. But be patient, this place is worth it!

The wait was two hours, but it was worth it. That's saying something because I hate long waits. The omelettes and pancakes were delicious. The servers are friendly and knowledgeable about the food. The portions are big, and the prices are reasonable. A very good brunch experience!

Best breakfast place in Chicago!!
You must try the cinnamon pancakes and the signature berry bliss pancakes.
Also, we got the brisket hash from the specials menu-- slow roasted brisket, onions and peppers, and sausage gravy over hash browns with eggs on top, my husband said it was the best savory breakfast he's ever had.
Two breakfast entrees and a fresh-squeezed OJ cost us $25. The portions were extremely generous for the price!
Fair warning though, the wait is definitely long, and the hostess (20-something brunette with long ponytail) acted really annoyed when we asked her how much longer we had to wait after 30 minutes, but our water guy was cool and the food was fast and delicious so that makes it worth it to me!

While in Chicago we yelped a good breakfast place.  We are very picky in our breakfasts, most days we skip it for the pizza lunch.  But, these pancakes.  Omg. You have got to try them.  They are amazing.
First time here and not a single negative to report. Service awesome, food came out fast and was absolutely delicious! A must do when in Chicago.

pics.caption: Corned beef hash Benedict with chipotle holllandaise. Side of their signature pancakes.

review.des: Speechless. Definitely recommend wildberry pancake and crepe. Flavorful with every bite and still doesn't fail to amaze.

Fantastic breakfast spot. The signature berry bliss pancakes and the cinnamon roll pancakes are all world. Also, the best thick cut bacon around. Intelligencia coffee to top it off. Come early, the wait is brutal after 9:30 even during the week.

Fun food and pretty consistent with the quality.... however it's impossible to get a table on weekends unless you go early, put your name down, and wait around for an hour or so. Service was pretty fast when you did get seated. Lots of things to choose from, get ready for a sugar rush.
Best pancakes I've ever had. Definitely recommend. Good service and amazing food! A+!
Amazing food. Amazing atmosphere. I tied the veggie omelette and chocolate chip pancakes.
Definitely one of the best places to go for pancakes. Server was really nice and on top of the water service which was super clutch.
Flew in for a few hours and was looking for a nice breakfast joint, this place rocked, the eggs Benedict's are on point and the service was very fast and super friendly, definitely recommend.

Amazing pancake restaurant! Seated quickly and served in less than 15 minutes after ordering, and this was prime breakfast time. Got the Mexican skillet and chocolate chip pancakes and it was phenomenal! Just the right amount of spice. The pancakes were perfectly fluffy. The price is a great deal! 10.75 for the whole thing plus a $1.00 up charge for the specialty pancake. Not to mention the waiting staff is extremely beautiful. Great find in the middle of Chicago!

pics.caption: Mexicana Skillet with chocolate chip pancakes! So good!

review.des: This place is always packed, and for good reason. I got the Mexicana skillet and the Berry Signature pancakes, both of which were amazing. The portion sizes are huge, though! Put yourself on the waitlist on yelp and avoid waiting in the cramped lobby.

pics.caption: Mexicana skillet w Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes

review.des: Great food, highly recommend the cinnamon roll pancakes. A seating is crowded with a party of 2.

Great option if you're in the area! You should count on a wait, but the service is great and food is really good once you're seated. The breakfast burrito is a great option, and the pancakes were some of the best I've had. No regrets; highly recommend.
There is a bit of a wait, but totally worth it! The food is so good that they need beds here because you will be in a food coma!

It's breakfast people. If you start your day at Wildberry, then you're probably starting it the best way possible.  I know I did and had a spectacular rest of my day with some sightseeing through Navy Pier and bike riding across the Chicago river. Now, let me be clear that the food here didn't encourage me to do that, but it certainly made me happier to do so.

I got the vegetarian skillet and shared a side of candied bacon, because protein (and sugar) is necessary in life. With my skillet, I decided for the plush upgrade to their specialty pancake and got myself their berry bliss signature stacks with berries and other heavenly things.  I washed that down with a toffee latte and was pleased that I paid less than 20 dollars after a 3-way split check.

Our server was great as well. He misheard a chicken and waffles order from my friend who only ended up getting waffles. However, he fixed that quickly and the right order came out after a few minutes.
The best place for Brunch. Tried Hot apple cider, it was awesome. The pancakes are the best I have ever had and absolutely loved the service. Hope they open on Boston

Outstanding!  Long wait, but the check in function made it very manageable.  There is a reason people are lining up...   service was quick and the food very good.  Had a skillet with pancakes, and far more food than I needed.  But, embarrassed to say I ate it all.  Highly recommend.

I keep coming back! Their Intelligentsia coffee and specialty lattes are awesome. The vibe is nice - sunny and bright and open inside, which is the best environment for a weekend morning brunch :) If you have a long wait, grab some coffee from the intelligentsia bar and take a walk to millennium park.

Been to Chicago several times over the past couple of years and this place always comes up as a place to try. In the past we were put off by the line outside but today we committed to go!  There was a huge line but it turned very fast. Service was quick and the food delicious.
