This place is amazing and so worth the wait. I recommend the cinnamon roll or original pancakes, but you can't go wrong! Definitely suggest getting the app NoWait to hold your spot in line. It was great using the app, we wondered the city until our table was ready. Highly recommend!

One of the fluffiest pancakes I have ever tried!!
I'm not a breakfast/brunch food type of person, but Wildberry's pancakes were awesome.
We went pretty early, like around 10am, but we still waited 30-40 mins. But they text you, so you can go walk around. And the wait is totally worth it!

Arrived at 9:15 a.m.  Had 1 hour 15 minute wait, an accurate estimate.  Worth the wait.  Excellent omelette, Mocha Coconut coffee, Oreo
shake. Diverse menu. Service by Esmerelda A. was exceptional. She was patient, detailed-oriented and very accommodating when told my husband was in a hurry to make an appointment.  My daughter's farmhouse panini was huge. My son's nutella crepes were filling and delicious.  My other son's blueberry waffles were good. My husband's custom-made fluffy omelette and hash browns were amazing. My fig and walnut multigrain pancakes was a lovely offset to the usual sweet pancakes. Also like the option for a short stack or a tall stack.

So so good! Probably one of the best brunches I've ever had!

Note: this place has a very long wait however we sat out in the cold just to receive our food faster!

I had the S'mores Oreo Pancakes and the Butchers Skillet. The pancakes were amazing. The skillet was also amazing. It has turkey hash brown, cheese, egg whites, turkey bacon, turkey sausage, chicken sausage (I opted out of pork).

My friends had the Wildberry pancakes bs Wildberry pancakes!

I left very full and satisfied!

Sucks that they do not serve mimosas though.

pics.caption: Butchers Skillet. So much food! So good!

review.des: Wildberry is easily one of favorite brunch places in the city. Anytime someone comes to visit, it's one of the first brunch places I take them. The service is phenomenal and the food is super scrumptious! Over the years I have probably tried three-quarters of their menu and haven't been disappointed a single time. The bennies are bomb (I recommend the Florence). The skillets are super savory and satisfying (especially the Chilaquiles). If you're in the mood for something sweet, the waffles and pancakes range from decadent (cinnamon roll or chocolate chip) to fruity (blueberry danish and strawberry poppyseed are my faves) and will easily satisfy any sweet tooth you have. They don't take reservations so weekend waits are very long, but for good reason (use the waiting feature on yelp or one of the other apps). If you're debating about whether or not to give this place a try, do it. It's basically ambrosia from Olympus right here in Chicago.

I used to live by this place, so it was easy to get to the restaurant before the long lines began. That said, try to get to this place by 9 a.m., or prepare to wait a long time!  

I always went to Wildberry for the hash browns which are prepared well at this restaurant. However, make sure you watch every bite of food you put in your mouth here! My partner was eating an egg entree once and halfway through found a HUGE shard of glass in his dish. The manager apologized and gave us a $10 coupon to return--which was a very small gesture on his part given that this was glass. Mind you, after finding a massive shard of glass in his entree, it took us well over a year to return and we typically just avoid this place in general because of the incident.

Food was crazy good. Nice environment and service was top notch! 2 thumbs up.

I added a pic of the lighting because I thought it was cool. The setup is very nice but I didn't want to include people in the photo! No law suits.

This place is awesome . We decided to check it out our 1st morning in town & liked it so much we went back our last day prior to heading to airport.

Everything was good. We had zero complaints. The cinnamon roll pancakes, the Napa Valley fig omelet,  the garden skillet, & the wild very pancakes - all delicious.

The service was good, along with the atmosphere (noise level). Get there early for sure. Seems to always be a wait. But well worth it.

Best pancakes I've ever had in my life.  You need to come try this. Also got the Mexican skillet and that was pretty damn delicious and flavorful as well. It's quite a heavy meal so come prepared. Again, Signature Berry Pancakes = Truth.

pics.caption: The Signature Berry. You need this in your mouth
Mexican skillet with eggs sunnyside up

review.des: The quality and uniqueness of the food offering was amazing.  Although the restaurant was very busy the service was excellent and the food arrived very promptly.  This was our first visit and we were impressed to the point that it was added to "our top 5" breakfast places we have visited across the country.

Just moved to city I was so happy to see Wildberry because I loved there food and service.
Today I took my kids and our friend and my husband I am very disappointed at the service and food .
Enjoyed the breakfast here. Husband rarely raves on food, but he couldn't stop talking about this place. Pancakes are a MUST! Be prepared to wait long on the weekends though.

I very rarely find a restaurant worth 5 stars but this one ***almost*** earned it.
There was an hour wait on Saturday morning, which is to be expected but since I had to wait an hour, that's the only reason for giving 4 instead of 5 stars.

We got our suggested wait time for an hour and were seated in 55 minutes.
The couple at the table next to us were finishing their meal...which looked really good. When they left, their table was cleared, clean and set (quietly) within 60 seconds. Amazing!!

Menu was simple, had a nice layout and relatively descriptive. I ordered the honey toffee latte, which the waitstaff claimed was her favorite drink. It was really yummy!!!! And large!

I do not like chocolate but saw a pic of the Oreo Smore pancakes on here so I asked our waitress about how much chocolate was there --- a lot. I decided to go with the cinnamon roll pancakes and they were some of the best pancakes I've ever had, although sweet.  Not super overwhelming but I knew by the name what I was getting myself into!
BF ordered a skillet. I thought the hash browns could have been browned more but he liked it! Scrambled eggs were fine, nothing to write home about. There was a good amount of cheese on the skillet, too.

Waitstaff was wonderful - quick, pleasant, gave good recommendations...they did a fantastic job with every table around us.

I will say the restaurant was a little loud but not for the amount of people that were dining. This restaurant technically is handicap accessible but I would probably not bring my family member who is in a power wheelchair - and I wouldn't bring him in his manual, either. There just isn't enough space for him not to be bumped into.

Overall, a great place and wonderful meal! Will certainly come back!

Wow wow wow. Great service, amazing food. The eggs benny with spinach and bacon were phenomenal and the berry bliss french toast had me wanting more. This place kept us full for a day full of walking through the city

Pretty typical pancake house fare. Nothing special, but not bad. Compared to the legions of brunch-oriented spots outside of the Loop, I probably wouldn't come here, but if I was in the Loop and craving this kind of food, I would feel safe that it would serve up something that met the craving.

Very solid brunch spot but definitely get there ahead of peak hours, or sneakily use the Nowait app! Portions are pretty large and I highly recommend the special Wildberry pancakes. The omelets are not bad, though I didn't really enjoy the fig one. Intelligentsia coffee is also very good.

Went to Wildberry this morning. Wife and I both got the Denver Skillitt. Mine was perfect and wife's​ was messed up. They put wrong stuff in basically. Either way our very kind waiter took it back and several minutes later she got the correct one. All​ is well! Then, the manager came over and told us my wife's was on the house! Such nice people, we didn't even really complain. Definitely will be back at Wildberry!!

If you're a meat eater the butcher block is just for you! I absolutely loved that the ham wasn't just thinly sliced deli ham. It was nice and savory. I also ordered the Oreo s'mores pancakes. I was disappointed to find out that it was not Oreo and marshmallow infused in the pancake batter, but rather just spread on top. Wildberry is mos def worthy of a drive downtown! And I would likely mention it to anybody visiting Chicago.
Amazing!!!!! The place to go when in Chicago for the best pancake o your life, the best omelettes, super fast service.  Amazing place

Happy I had a chance to dine here while visiting Chicago. My friend and I decided to dine on a weekday to avoid the long, long, long wait on the weekends and luckily, we only waited about 30 mins.

We definitely came here with a big appetite..... maybe a little too big because our eyes were more hungry than our stomachs! Of course, we ordered the Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes, Corned Beef Benny and Mexicana Skillet......... brb, I am in heaven! The berry bliss pancakes had the perfect amount of sweetness. From the benedict to the skillet, both were savory and delicious. The portions are decent and we had plenty of food left. Can't wait to come back =)

Amazing Food!!!!

I got an omelette with fruits as a side and the cinnamon roll pancakes! And I finished all of it (even though that's quite a task ). The omelette was delicious but the pancakes were simply my dream come true! So if you don't feel like taking them as a main dish ... Definitely invest the $1 extra to change your side toast to a pancake!!!

When you order food that contains jalapeños just be a little careful, it gets pretty hot! Not too hot for my taste, but cut the edge!

I would have loved to give 5 stars, but the service wasn't really good! The waiter was kinda rude and they cleaned of the table before we actually finished our food! Maybe I just got a bad day, but that's why I cut a star!

#126
Great place to go for a quick brunch very family friendly.  I am with a pretty big group of friends and wanted to make sure they all got to see a little bit of where I spent my teenage years in Chicago.  

Was the wait a little long?  Yeah, but totally worth it.  Was the service faster than expected?  For sure.  We are staying at a hotel nearby and traveled the Loop to grab a bite here, upon recommendation of our concierge.  I need to remember to tell that guy "Thanks" when we get back.  

We loved our server, our food, the atmosphere--everything. We started out early today so that we could take in as many sites as possible, and the best start of our day was the Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe.  Our server recommended the Wild Berry pancakes, and I thought he has to know what he is talking about, so I went for it.  Never looked back ;)

We grabbed pancakes, waffles, eggs, potatoes, etc.  Everything was so good, I hated to share :( But, I guess that is what hungry friends do on a vaca.  Everything was so phenomenal.  Why can we not have one of these in the Bay Area?

The restaurant is pretty large, decorated very fun and family friendly, and the menu is replete with multiple options and substitutions are welcomed--that is always a plus for me.

Stephani Smiles for Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe ;)

pics.caption: Hands down best pancakes I've ever had!

review.des:
I come to Chicago once a year for business. Each time since discovering this gem, I make it a point to go back.

The skillets are large and plentiful with more than enough shredded hash browns to fill you up. I always order a specialty pancake instead of toast and have yet to be disappointed.

The cinnamon roll pancakes are second to none. Quite sweet (if that's what you're looking for) but not "put you in a diabetic coma" sweet. The fig, walnut, and multigrain pancakes are light and fluffy despite the multigrain pancake.

I have yet to try their Benedict as an entree but I sampled off a friends and the standard Benedict was delightful. The hollandais didn't shine but didn't offend.

A few words of caution:

1) if you go on the weekend, expect a wait. If you go after 9 on a weekend, expect a long wait. The service is very fast and the servers are polite but it is extremely popular in a heavily trafficked area.

2) order extra ketchup

3) prepare to leave full

4) the jalapeño are pickled from a jar, not fresh. This makes for, obviously, a very different experience in your egg dish.

pics.caption: Standard tray of butter, syrup, and ketchup

review.des: Per the recommendation of a lovely woman on the airplane we started our day here.  The timing was perfect, just before the 8am crowd.  We were seated quickly, our orders we taken and within less than 15 minutes the food was ready.  I had a veggie omelette with gluten free pancake.  The omelette was delicious, the gluten free pancakes were ok.  Overall it was a wonderful experience and I would totally go again.

go early to beat the line because this place gets packed pretty quickly! i had the signature berry bliss pancakes, which were to die for . . you don't even need the syrup on them because the topping (which is like yogurt and cream or something) melts in your mouth. also tried the chocolate chip banana pancakes, which reminded me of when i was a little kid. these were also good, but the signature berry bliss pancakes were def to die for and they also came with fresh fruit on the side like blueberries, raspberries, and blackberries.
Hands down, the best breakfast restaurant I have ever been to. No exaggeration. The food is amazing. Believe the hype. If you are looking for a tasty breakfast, Wildberry is your best bet!
Just going to say fantastic!  Really can't add more to all the great ratings.  Will definitely go again.
One of the best breakfasts I've ever had. Mexicana skillet w/Oreo pancake, deelish.  Latte was weak, but service friendly and attentive. We'll be back!
Pancakes and waffles were amazing. Homemade corn beef hash was excellent as well as the sausage patties.

I agree with all the other 5 star reviews.  The place is crowded, there is a long wait, parking is horrendous.  But, the food is beautiful, tasty, the service is exceptional, the owner checks in.  Its worth all the effort!

I loveeeeeee the food! DELICIOUS BERRY BLISS CREPES!!! The only thing I hate is the staff. I wasn't done eating and the crew was just standing over me the whole time waiting for me to finish. I was almost done and they took my plate and rushed us out. I would come for the food but not the staff members.

The best find on yelp in Chicago!  We shared the delicious french toast and each had a salad.  There were so many other things on the menu that I would have loved to try and looking at other guests, their orders looked delicious!  Thank goodness for the call ahead in line feature because this place seems to always be very busy.

We came on a Friday morning around 8:30 am and did not have to wait to be seated. The service was great. I ordered the mixed berry pancakes and hashbrowns. I loved the pancakes, but personally thought the hashbrowns were a little under-seasoned. I will warn that the portions are HUGE, so plan accordingly when ordering! Definitely recommend Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe!

What a wonderful treat! We found this while on a business trip, thanks to Yelp. Great food, great service, very kind and thoughtful staff. Do yourself a favor and use the Yelp Get in Line feature, otherwise you're looking at 1.5-2 hour wait on weekends. Weekday was no problem, no wait.

The wait time was very long, almost 2 hour, but it was well worth it. Yelp is great because we can add our names to the wait list, but it still takes another 30-60 minutes to get seated. The place is packed so be prepared to invade personal space or even wait outside. Luckily the restaurant is right across Millennium Park and there's an Intelligentsia inside.

I think every item on the menu is worth a try. I heard the omelets were good but my friend and I got the Mexican skillet and upgraded our side to the berry waffle. OH MY GOD. The food was AMAZING. Full of flavor, good portions and left us wanting to plan our second visit.

Definitely worth a try and next time I'm in town, I'll definitely go for the pancakes!
Totally unimpressed by this breakfast place, slow service, basic food you can find anywhere
Nice breakfast but rather a lot to eat. Had the berry pancake, which was special. No queue at 7am on Sunday, but started to queue shortly after. Very popular and foot atmosphere.

Meh. This place has really declined since my last visit several years ago. Maybe they are becoming a victim of their own success?  The crowds after 8am are ridiculous. A 2-hour wait for decent but not great food?  No thank you.

My recent visit left me completely underwhelmed. I went early (before 7am) to avoid the crowds. Ordered an omelette with avocado, broccoli, ham and cheddar. It was ok, but lacked any seasoning. The broccoli should also have been more finely chopped. The avocado was perfectly ripe, though.

They stress that they use Intelligentsia brand coffee. Beware that using their coffee does not mean it will taste like the coffee at their stores. If you want the real thing, Intelligentsia has a store right across Michigan Avenue on Randolph (same street as Wildberry).

Service was impersonal and efficient at best. Disappointing.

BEST BREAKFAST EVER!!!!! All that needs to be said, honestly.

Thankfully we came on our last day here, on a Monday morning with 75 degree sunny weather. They also have outdoor seating for days like this. The place was still pretty busy around 1 pm. It's also a great spot because Millennium park is right across the street.

They don't seat you until your entire party is there. There was no wait except waiting for the other half of our group to arrive. I read from other reviews the wait can be very long. I recommend either coming early if planned for brunch on a weekend or try coming on a weekday. They DON'T take reservations.

Their menu is quite extensive and entails a variety of pancakes, crepes, waffles, french toast, omelettes, benedicts, scrambles, skillets, sandwiches and salads. They also serve Intelligentisia coffee.

We ordered their signature Berry Bliss French Toast, the Butchers Block Skillet with a side of Red Velvet French Toast, and the corn beef hash Skillet with a side of the banana cream pie pancakes. EVERYTHING WAS AMAZING.

All the french toast and pancakes were soft and fluffy with loads of flavor and not overwhelmingly sweet. The red velvet french toast had a nice cream cheese filling between the slices of french toast making it just like red velvet. The banana cream pie and a nice banana cream filling between the pancakes giving it more banana flavor in addition to the fresh slices of bananas. The cinnamon sugar sprinkles were also a nice touch. The HIGHLIGHT was the berry bliss french toast with a nice berry yogurt glaze between the toasts with loads of berry flavor and the vanilla anglaise was superb.

The skillets came out piping hot! The corn beef was very good, chopped to fine pieces. The only thing they could have improved on was pan fry the corn beef a bit to crisp some of the pieces adding a texture like bacon bits to it, but I was a very happy camper with the corned beef hash skillet. I thought they did an amazing job. The butchers block was also very good with a good variety of meats that were juicy and packed with loads of flavor. Both skillets came with perfectly cooked sunnyside up eggs.

These 3 dishes stuffed 5 people. And our bill came out to be $9-9.50 per person including tax and tip. Amazing food under $10 a person?! What more could you ask for?!

Our server was also very helpful and explained the organization of the menu to us since it was our first time. They also made sure our waters were never left empty. Food took a bit to come out, but understandable because the skillets take a bit longer.

Overall, an amazing and the BEST meal in Chicago I had my entire trip. This is a must eat place if ever visiting Chicago!
The food is OK, but its definitely not worth waiting an hour +, which is what you will have to do if you want to eat here on the weekend.  Personally, I prefer the pancakes at Original Pancake House.

Phenomenal food all the way around! Saw the line when we drove in and we hoping it was worth the wait, WELL WORTH IT!! I'm writing this review from my table and slipping into my food coma. Will make this a must eat every time I'm in Chicago.
Excellent service! Delicious food! Put your name on the waitlist via Yelp ahead of time to save yourself time. Worth the wait!
This place is awesome!!! On our trip to Chicago we went three days in a row! The skillet with a side of cinnamon roll pancakes is my favorite

Yum!! Short walk from the Renaissance. Where to start??? Coffee? Check. Delicious and smooth. Almond milk and other paleo options? Check. Delicious and sizeable portions?? Checkity check check!! I'm still full. I will be back again. Worth the wait time.

I'm hesitant to review Wildberry too highly because another good review is only going to make for a longer line.  I'd love to keep this place all to myself.
Alright, I cannot lie this place is freaking amazing.  The long long long wait is a testament to just how delicious the good is. The OJ is as good or better than the fresh squeezed I've enjoyed in FL.

pics.caption: Waiter suggested gravy on the side. While it was good I appreciated being able to dose the sauce myself.

review.des:
Wildberry is a HUGE deal in Chicago. I felt like every Uber driver of mine knew about this place when we would make small talk about my plans while I was in Chicago. It is pretty easy to locate - and since pretty much every one knows about it my Uber driver did not have any problem in regards to dropping me off here. It is located next to Millennium park - so it is a pretty crowded place. When we called in to make reservation they said that they don't take reservations and we ended up waiting for over 2 hours to get seated (there were 12 of us in total). It is in the heart of the city so while we were waiting we had our own photo-shoot and walked around a bit. It has indoor and outdoor seating. For parking, one needs to go around the block and do the street parking.

The decor is pretty decent, there is couch seating as well as the regular chairs inside.. Our table was right next to to kitchen so there was lot of commotion around us. Our server was really nice and very patient - especially since there were 12 of us. She gave us her suggestions and the most ordered dishes from their menu. She was always smiling and had a great energy. I ended up ordering:

-- Hot White Chocolate Mocha: it came in a nice big mug, it was pretty good but I feel like since I am used to the Hot White Chocolate Mocha from Starbucks the one from here was little blend according to my taste.

-- Espanola: It was delicious! It was by far the best omelette I have ever had. The chorizo was well cooked and it was in the right quantity which blended pretty well with the veggies. It comes avocados as well - one can never go wrong with avocados. Jalapenos  in it doesn't make it extremely spicy - it just adds that perfect touch of spiciness to the omelette. The proportions here are huge and I couldn't even finish it. It comes with Hash browns, Toast or a Pancake. You can get their specialty Pancakes with an additional dollar and I opted for that option.

-- Tiramisu Pancake: IT WAS HEAVENLY! I don't think any words can describe how amazing it was. It is seriously to die for and it made the 2 hour wait worthwhile. For a side plate it is a pretty big proportion.

Despite the waiting part, food was great and the service was amazing. It is not that pricey. I ended up ordering too much food or could be that their proportions are huge. Next time I am in Chicago I will definitely come back here and ONLY order two plates of Tiramisu Pancake! Our server was kind enough to divide our  bill per our request into separate checks,.

pics.caption: ESPANOLA OMELETTE, HASH-BROWN  AND TIRAMISU PANCAKE.

review.des: Worth the wait! Great service. Delicious food. Efficient use of reservation technology so that you can walk around.

Amazing!! Great service, space and of course the food was 10/10. I highly recommend going here for a great breakfast. Skillets, and pancakes were tasty and super filling. The price isn't bad at all. So that's a plus. Like others, I do to recommend joining the waitlist!!

Excellent place for breakfast. Portions were huge, pancakes were soft and fluffy, eggs cooked perfectly, service was fast. Price was a little high for breakfast but you're in downtown Chicago and like I said there was plenty of food on the plate.

I love this place - ambience is bright and chirpy with sunlight pouring in from the large glass windows. We typically order the skillet and pancakes and always love it. Great selection of drinks too - love the freshly squeezed orange juice.

The only downside is really long wait. Weekends may require you to stand for 1-1.5 hours if you are going anytime after 9 am.... early risers are real winners here ;-)
Long wait and not accommodating to the patrons, bad customer service and not disable friendly.

We shared the corned beef hash with chocolate chip pancakes and the Denver skillet with the side of their special berry pancakes... Yummmmmm!
Even better, I had some of the chocolate chips with the berry pancake, and that made it even more yummy!

pics.caption: Corned beef hash with the spacial berry pancakes.  The hash browns were delicious!
Denver skillet with chocolate chip pancakes

review.des: This was our first time trying Wildberry.  The food was so yummy - we'll definitely return the next time we're in Chicago.  We had a 30 minute wait, which I hear isn't bad for this location.  We spent the time strolling the park across the street while we waited for the text notification.  We tried the no-wait app, but it just told us to come in.  Maybe the wait needs to be a little longer before the app works?  I had the Apple and Pecan Pancakes with a side of Hash Browns.  The pancakes were perfectly sweet.  The service was great - they refilled my water a few times.  It took around 15 minutes to get our meals.  The restaurant is very clean.  The place is packed a little tighter than some restaurants, but this isn't the worst thing.  It has the side effect of encouraging strangers to inquire about your meal and share their thoughts on their own order.  It was kind of neat.  I felt it added to the experience.  There's nothing more they could have done better.

This was quite frankly the greatest meal I have ever had in my life. I'm not being hyperbolic either. This meal was amazing. I had the Mexican skillet and my wife had the Wildberry pancakes. Both meals were incredible. Every bite basically made us both just moan haha. We were in town for the weekend and honestly could've eaten this every day. The coffees were delicious as well. Just the cherry on top. It is more than worth the wait. We woke up and got on yelp and added our names to the waitlist and they do a great job of letting you know how many more people were ahead of us. Whole process was great. I can't wait to make another trip to Chicago just so we can eat here again.
Great food great service this is a must place to go to if you are in the area. They have several breakfast and brunch varieties to choose from.

This was my first time visiting Chicago and I happened to stumbled across this spot being that it was so close to my hotel. I must say, the food was amazing! The cinnamon roll pancakes are to die for. I definitely recommend going here for brunch. My waiter Kimberly was very nice as well. I can't wait to rerun!
Call ahead feature worked out nicely.  Food was delicious and served quickly once you were seated.

The food is amazing!  I went twice while in Chicago over a weekend. The pancakes were amazing; the eggs fluffy (I ordered scrambled) and the bacon delish.  The server the first day was great; from Iowa with locs.  The second time, the server was adequate. Be prepared for at least an hour wait, but it was well worth it.

I was not that impressed with the food here. It really just seems like  a semi-fancier version of IHOP...literally.

For the life of me, I can't figure out why this place is so popular. I heeded the warnings from the Yelp reviews and arrived here early one Sunday morning at 7:30am. It was moderately packed with a few empty tables. By 8:00 however, it was completely packed and there was not one empty table in the place (or on the patio).

I ordered the Butcher's Block skillet and upgraded the pancakes to the specialty Oreo S'mores pancakes for only a dollar. The skillet was full of meat: pork sausage, turkey sausage, bacon and ham on a bed of hashbrowns and topped with cheese and scrambled eggs. This should have been good, however it was not. There was way too much hashbrowns in there and the hashbrowns were burnt and dry. There was also not that much cheese in there at all and the most disappointing thing was that the meat tasted of low quality and didn't have much seasoning. Overall, the skillet was very dry and bland. Ketchup couldn't even help it.

The pancakes were much better, They pretty much were the same as IHOP's: thin and very rich. At first I thought it only came with one pancake but was happy to learn that it actually came with two and it was topped with oreos, chocolate syrup and marshmallow creme. The pancakes were absolutely delicious and were the only saving grace to my meal.

The price was also pretty good. I actually received a lot of food for only $12 with tax. Unfortunately, the food didn't really taste that good.

The staff was very friendly and helpful. We were glad that we were able to get in line before we even left our hotel because the wait was an hour and a half to two hours. We "got in line" at 9:13 am and were told to be at Wildberry at 10:17 and that there was over 150 people ahead of us in line so we arrived around 10:10 and there were still about 41 people ahead of us in line. So we took a walk over to the bean that is right across the street awaiting our second text message that would tell us that we had to be at Wildberry in 5 minutes otherwise our stop would be gone. We got our text at around 10:40 and were seated about 5 minutes after being texted. Our server, Dustin, was very friendly and informative and we got out food in about 15 minutes. The food was great, I really enjoyed their fries and their Oreo s'mores pancakes. Will definitely be back again.

The WAIT. It's out of this world. Had a reservation that was made about an hr and a half before we went and still waited another 30 mins in that blazing sun. The hostess outside can't assist you if you made your reservations through an app. When we finally went in, the food was fine. I had an omelette with 2 pancakes, the pancakes were really good, the omelette was fine. Nothing spectacular. My cousin had the breakfast burrito but couldn't finish the rest. Normally, I would give a second chance but the wait is so nuts, and I know that's not really the restaurants fault, but I don't think I'll be back.

The pancakes here are a MUST-TRY.

Originally I got a hot skillet dish but i ended up liking my side pancakes that I upgraded to strawberry pancakes a lot better.

The dishes here are mediocre but the pancakes are worth it. They're buttermilk pancakes with your choice of topping and powdered sugar. They are definitely worth the trip & this is coming from a person who doesn't regularly like pancakes. These pancakes are as good as it gets!

They come with a little dish with cups of syrup and whip cream as well. Though for some odd reason the whip cream was actually quite salty?

Service here is quick and nice. The customer flow here is also fast, coming from a place that's always packed, you don't have to wait for very long.

Give the pancakes here a try.
I'm SO happy a Wildberry opened up in Streeterville! The service at this location is fabulous. Everyone is smiley and friendly. The pancakes here alone are worth the wait.

Highly suggest using Yelp's waitlist app and NOT just walking-up to this place. It's an 1.5-2 hour wait otherwise which is just laughable. No pancake is worth that wait!

Cinnamon roll pancakes were good, albeit a little doughy.

Do not, I repeat, do not get the omelette. Sad!

Pumpkin spiced pancakes with sausage and eggs Benedict were wonderful! Staff is very friendly, efficient and helpful. Our server was awesome. Close to our hotel too. Very busy place. Get on the waitlist or your wait a long time.

Really great service; expansive menu. The food was good but I don't think I'd wait an hour and a half just for breakfast again. It is nice because there's lots of shopping and the park right next to it though so if you went when it was nice out you could put your name in then go walk around. I ordered the corned beef hash Benedict; I do not think their hash is homemade so that was slightly disappointing, but overall it was decent. My boyfriend ordered the Italian ciabatta panini he liked it a lot the highlight of his dish though were the homemade chips. Those were awesome. Oh also one more thing they have the BEST coffee out of any breakfast place ever haha. So good.
I enjoyed my signature pancakes and omelet. They bring your food out quickly after ordering. However, I don't think it is worth the wait to get in.  You can wait up to 2 hours on the weekend.

One of the best breakfasts I have had in Chicago! It was soo good that I keep comparing this breakfast to any other ones i have in other places. We had ordered the The Garden Skillet, which is a vegetarian option of skillets and it was made to perfection! Crispy hashbrowns as first layer, sauted veggies as middle layer and topped with eggs well done as per our choice. We also ordered the Signature berry bliss pancakes. This is a MUST TRY.
The only issue if you go on sundays is the crowd, we had put ourselves on line still had to wait for another half an hr outside. But totally worth the wait. Though the restaurant was fully packed, the staff service was great.
Suggest to visit this place on a weekday.
Be sure to take advantage of the online waitlist! But the food is worth the wait no matter what!

This place was amazing!!!! Make sure to make reservations because it's usually busy. I'm still decently fresh to Chicago, so my family came to visit. This was my first time there, and it was an amazing experience. The service was excellent and the food was extraordinary. Like I said though, make a reservation. It will save you about an hour during rush time.

Mmm...Wildberry's! I received a recommendation for Wildberry's from a friend months ago when I was visiting Chicago. Now that I am a transplant, and I wanted to meet two other transplants for brunch, I figured I'd take my friend's suggestion and try Wildberry's.

Wildberry's Chicago location is located in the midst of tourist attractions, which makes it easy to get to but also a long wait. I arrived early and put my name on the list. I was told there was a one hour wait. The staff asked me to return after 30 minutes to pick up a buzzer, which I did. Wait was 50 minutes total for a table of 3 if arriving at 10:45 a.m. on Saturday morning. While you wait, you can order coffee from the stand-alone Intelligentsia coffee bar next to the hostess station.

My friends and I were seated by a hostess and our server greeted us promptly. She provided us with menus and water, and asked if we wanted anything else to drink. The menu had a a long list of choices that one would expect from a diner: orange juice, milk, tea, and for coffee, french-pressed Intelligentsia coffee, lattes, frappuccinos. There were also fruit smoothies.

My party of three opted to order three different menu items: the Mexicana sizzling skillet, which came with a side of buttermilk pancakes sprinkled with powdered sugar; the Fresca eggs-quisite omelette, with a side of signature berry bliss pancakes; and the Rutherford omelette with another side of signature berry bliss pancakes. The pancakes come with two smaller-than-the-average stack-size pancakes, drizzled in vanilla sauce, blackberry sauce, and fresh berries (strawberries, blueberries, blackberries).

The signature berry bliss pancakes are the most expensive of the specialty pancakes, but the fresh berries and special sauces/drizzles make it worth every bite.

There is great value for the money to be had here. Each entree and side could easily feed two people. But that's the standard Midwestern breakfast for you.

The service is as attentive as a place this packed and busy could be!

Ambiance: Very busy, and quite loud for an intimate conversation. This place will make you happy because it's filled with people sharing a happy moment in their lives: tourists with their partners and families. The comfort food will make you happy, too.

Recommendations:

Order an entree that comes with pancakes on the side. DO UPGRADE to specialty pancakes at the bargain surcharge of $1.00. Seems like this is the best value for your money. My friends and I saw a full stack of specialiy signature berry bliss pancakes, and it wasn't as large as we expected. Have some protein, won't you? Its like having your (pan)cake and eating it, too.

pics.caption: Side of signature berry bliss pancakes (strawberries, blackberries, blueberries, with vanilla and blackberry-based sauce)
Fresca eggs-quisite omelette (avocado, basil, provolone cheese, and sun-dried tomatoes) with a side of hashbrowns.

review.des: We loved this place. We got the Brisket Hash w/ banana pancakes and the signature wildberry crepes. The food was great. We can't wait to come back.

Their skillets and wildberry pancakes are amazing. This location is right next to The Bean so taking a quick walk through the park is best right after such a hearty meal.

We went very early in the morning (around 7am) on a Saturday so it was pretty quiet. It's a great place to start your day during a trip to Chicago!

never thought there'd be a breakfast joint that would outshine yolk but wow!

bf and i decided to brunch for lunch and i stuck with the thai chicken salad and it was extremely flavorful, not overly dressed, with plenty of crunch and healthiness.  

my bf opted for 2 eggs combo and we decided to upgrade to the banana cream pie pancake and WOW, after we had our share we wanted more!  pancakes were fluffy and the cream was not overly sweet and overwhelming.  

definitely a solid brunch spot with sizable portions and reasonable pricing.  it's a large restaurant but it does get super busy!  so be prepared to wait...  

located right across the millennium park, perfect place to start your day before exploring the city!

Get their skillets and signature pancakes! Love that they have the pancakes as a 'side' they could be a meal in itself. I, of course, ate it all! (it's ok, I was on vacation...at least that's what I tell myself).  
We also tried the stuffed French toast which was also very good.
Have recommended it to my friends visiting Chicago and will definitely return when I'm back there myself!

pics.caption: Cream cheese stuffed French toast with strawberries
AWESOME veggie skillet w/ poached eggs and AMAZING signature wild berry pancakes!

review.des: Yum! Get the berry bliss pancakes! We went At 7:30 and had a short waits the yelp wait estimate was accurate. Food came out incredibly fast!

It's an amazing place. Both our food and the food of people sitting nearby looked delicious. They have everything you may want for breakfast or brunch and the portions are huge .  Waiters are nice too. So I can just say that we had an amazing experience and would definitely come back despite the 40 min waiting list. You can just have a nice walk in the park while waiting it's totally worth it

The only bad food on this trip to Chicago.  Tough bread, seemingly stale hash browns, and not much else to it.  not sure how this place gets 4.5 stars??  I think the sugar options are a hit and those who get those dishes are so amped they start posting reviews.  Service was good and fast so I can get out of here...

Amazing! I have been here several times, and it's always the first place I recommend to people for breakfast. Service is always top notch. Yes, the wait can be a little long, but so worth it. And in my experience, it's always less time than they say.

The food is out of this world. And they have a seasonal menu that is always top notch. Seriously, cannot give this place enough praise!

Like it, 25 min waiting time, yet you get great white chocolate mocha latte with great brunch.recommended. Each city will have this nice pancake house, not so different this time, but it's always good.

Great value, excellent tastes! We got the Mexicana skillet with chorizo, it comes with a side of pancakes :) this is enough food to split between 2 (for real, I can eat). We tacked on a side of corn beef hash which was real good but left us feeling stuffed.

I really liked the corned beef skillet I got here.  The wait is ridiculous, but their use of the No Wait app to track your place in line is really handy.  Our total wait time was about an hour, but that was enough time for us to go check out some other things in the area.

If you're searching for a place to eat and you haven't gotten to the restaurant yet, you can download the app and put your name down even before getting to the restaurant.

Overall the food and service were excellent once you sit down.

It was my first time in Chicago and literally came straight from the airport. So happy I yelped and found this quite popular spot! It was about 7am when we got here on a Saturday and the place was already about half full. We sat down and the waitor was so friendly and explained how the menu worked. Beware, portions are huge! But we were on vacation so we were just ordering everything! Everyone at our table had ordered something different. I had the corn beef hash that comes with pancakes which I upgraded to wild berry pancakes. I'm not a real pancake lover but these pancakes were really good! The cream and the fresh berries were so so good! Make sure to get here early because by the time we left, there were plenty of people waiting for a table!

pics.caption: Close up of the wild berry pancakes
Breakfast spread of eggs Benedict, corn beef hash, wild berry pancakes, and scramble

review.des:
A goto brunch place every time I visit Chicago. The pancakes, omelets, skillets, drinks are all amazing!

As all have mentioned, be prepared for a long wait on the weekends. For our party of 5 we were quoted 45 minutes and it was on the dot. They will only seat an entire party so make sure everyone is there.

The portions of food are gigantic so consider sharing. I love that you can choose between toast or pancakes. My girlfriend and I shared the Napa omelet. Absolutely delicious with the figs. I felt the hash could have been cooked longer, a little raw.

The mint mocha is delicious too.

Everyone loved their meal and the server was great about splitting checks.

I must say they are aggressive about clearing the table, too. My friend wasn't done with his coffee when it was taken away.

But of course I'll be back. Food is totally worth it!
Great place to start off the day. Breakfast tasted awesome with a great double shot Expresso.

WOW. First timer here. My girlfriend came across this place on Yelp and said it was a must try for us. When we got there the line was TWO AND A HALF hours long!!! Crazy! We made the most of our long wait time by exploring the park across the street so it wasn't too bad at all. They also take your phone number down so you aren't obligated to stay out front the restaurant where there is very limited seating. The food was excellent. Everything it was cracked up to be and more. I ordered a eggs Benedict. And everything was cooked perfectly. We also order the berry bliss waffle and man oh man it was delicious. Not too sweet and not to tart. The waffle was nice and flakey. A must try for any visitor to Chicago!

Probably the most hyped up brunch place in Chicago. The wait takes forever but if you use the "Get In Line" app, you can minimize your wait time. Overall a great brunch place. Not particularly unique except for the wide variety of specialty pancakes. When it comes to their pancakes they live up to the hype! Their savory dishes are solid, but don't stand out. Definitely worth going to if you have the patience for the wait!
Delicious. Plain and simple. Extremely fast serving of the food and the wait staff is professional and friendly. It's no wonder why so many people love this place!

pics.caption: Denver skillet, pancakes and honey toffee nut latte from their in-house Intelligentsia cafe. Magnificent.

review.des: This is by far my favorite breakfast place in downtown Chicago. I go here every opportunity I get to be in town! The food is amazing! I highly recommend indulging in the cinnamon roll pancakes! I have tried their omelets and they are very good as well. Yes, you will wait when you come to eat here on a weekend. I used the Yelp app to put us on the waitlist as soon as we go to the city. It was between 1.5-2 hour wait. I already knew this, so my daughter and I spent some time at Millennium Park and Maggie Daly Park both of which are right across the street, before we had our brunch. It was perfect. By the time she was tired from running around at the park, she was hungry and it was time to check in. The service is fast and most servers have a great sense of humor and readily recommend interesting dishes.
Wildberry bliss pancakes are the best I've ever had in my life!!!! Amazing service, smiling friendly faces.

A study in social proof, there is literally nothing here above average but how many people come and wait for less than average EVERYTHING.  Food, decor, wait time, and service are all less than average.

People come here to seem hip and be with the crowd

Wow! I came here when I was visiting the Bean. I came down with the munchies real fast (probably because we didn't have breakfast yet) and this was the closest place to Millennium Park. We visited during early afternoon,12:30 pm. The wait was only about 15 minutes which wasn't bad. I must say, service here is phenomenal. From the moment we were seated, our waiter was attentive and always checking back on us to see how we were doing and asking if we needed more water. We never had trouble finding him or flagging him down.

As for the food, I love that they give you an option to get a side of pancakes with a non-pancake dish. They are known for their pancakes here, but I like to get some real breakfast food in me, preferably something that doesn't result in diabetes. My boyfriend and I ordered skillets and for $1 each, we upgraded to get a side of specialty pancakes. I got the green pepper, ham, cheese, onion skillet with an over easy egg and a side of Tiramisu pancakes. My boyfriend ordered the meat lovers skillet with an over easy egg and a side of Chocolate chip pancakes. We expected to wait for our food, but it was ready within 5-8 minutes. It was so fast! The food was great too. The skillets were amazing. The meat lovers skillet did look smaller than mine though, just FYI. I only finished half of mine because I wanted to make room for the Tiramisu pancakes. Those were heavenly. I was afraid they'd be way too sweet, but they weren't. It was the perfect amount of sweetness. My boyfriend even liked it and he doesn't usually like Tiramisu. The chocolate chip pancakes were good, but they were too chocolately. They put a lot of chocolate chips on the pancakes and it ends up encasing the pancakes in a chocolate coat. I usually love chocolate, but I thought it was a bit too much.

Overall, food here is fantastic, but the real winner is the service here. Impeccable! If I'm ever in Chicago again, I will stop by this place!

pics.caption: Butcher skillet: ham, bacon, chicken sausage, chorizo with hash and eggs over easy
Denver skillet: ham, onions, pepper with hash and eggs over easy

review.des: I really do not see the appeal. Party of two on 6/16. Ordered the Sizzlin' Skillet Denver (sub pancakes) and a Choose-A-Cheese (cheddar) omelet.   The skillet was average and the pancakes were simply okay. My selection, the omelet was bad. The cheese was dispersed along only a one-third end portion of  the omelet and not very cheesy at all.  A matter of fact, I had to really look to see if the cheese even existed.  I pointed this out to our hurried/robotic server and frankly, she could not of cared less. No offer to remake, no manager intervention - just a meh response. We went to Yolk the next morning and the food and customer experience could not have been more disparate. Yolk hands down was superior.

OMG. That wait....We waited 2 hours for brunch on a Sunday. And yes... it was worth it.

We totally carb binged at this place and ate like little piggies. The upside is that we had an AMAZING server who informed us that they did half portions of some of the items so we could get our gluttony on.

Signature Berry Bliss Waffle - MMMMmmmm
Oreo Pancake (Half Size) - OMG...
Strawberry Cheesecake French Toast (Half Size) - PROBABLY MY FAV!!!
Banana Cream Pie Crepe (Half Size) - Second fav!!
Corned Beef Hash - Meh... so so...

Stick with the sugary carbs. They do breakfast really really well....

The food is good but a bit overpriced for the quality. I felt like the service could have been better AND its always super packed.. Wait time is ridiculous! Dont see why people wait 1hr + for this place. Not even all that
Best breakfast! Great walk through park. Mexican Skillet, Berry Bliss anything and the Fresca omelette, all incredibly well done. Do not hesitate to go to this restaurant.

My family and I came to Chicago for a short weekend, and decided on Wildberry for breakfast on Saturday morning. Let me tell you now - best. decision. ever.

Being Saturday morning, the place was a full house. The wait was 45 minutes to an hour, but we didn't mind considering that Millenium Park is right across the street. It was just enough time to walk around and see Cloud Gate and some of the other sculptures around the park.

When we finally sat down, the service was absolutely fantastic. Shoutout to Fab M., he was absolutely amazing and so attentive. He seemed extremely genuine, and left a very good impression on us.

I ordered the chocolate chip pancakes, which were so fluffy and rich. Superb. It is a very large portion (5 pancakes), but I'm sure they would make great leftovers. We also ordered the ham and eggs, which were great as well. Overall, the food totally hit the spot and was worth the wait.

Wildberry is also known for their coffee, and I'm happy to share that that was fantastic as well. I would recommend the Cafe Mocha and the Cinnamon Spice, as they were our favorites. The Hot Chocolate got good reactions from the kids as well.

Couldn't have been a better choice for us. The wait was a little long, but the food and drinks were worth the wait. Highly recommend if you're in the downtown area and looking for a good spot to have breakfast or brunch!

Thanks so much Wildberry for such a great experience!

My new favorite breakfast spot - especially when I have friends or family in town.

My sister was visiting recently and she decided she absolutely had to go ice skating at Millennium park.  We decided to do brunch and skating.  Since the rink is insanely crowded on the weekends, we went on a Monday.  For 3 of us, the wait was about 20 mins but it was steadily growing as the morning went on.  Honestly, I would have been happy waiting an hour for this place.

We ordered a couple of the breakfast skillets, the brisket hash, and substituted specialty pancakes in for the sides on the skillets.  The skillets were huge and delicious and the pancakes were fluffy and beyond any pancake I have ever had.  I tried the caramel apple pancakes and my sister had the chocolate chip.  I think I was a little more impressed with mine than she was but overall, so good!

I was in Chicago for 5 days and 4 of my breakfasts took place here! I'm so addicted to their Berry Bliss pancakes/toast and their skillets are all amazing but my favorite was the Denver! Perfect meal to start off a fun, long, day of exploring Chicago!

Perfect location right across "the Bean" and Millennium Park! if you don't want to wait 45min-1 hour (it gets really busy sometimes) then just order TO-GO and eat it across the street at the Millennium park!

pics.caption: Venetian\r Hash Browns, Cheddar & Jack Cheese, 2 Eggs, Sausage, Bell Peppers Onions & Tomatoes

review.des: I was not about the hype of this place. But I felt like I needed to try it to get it out of the way. Boy was I wrong. The entire meal was awesome. I got an egg white omelette and my friend got the Mexican skillet. Both came with sides of our choice (the signature pancakes being an option) so he got the berry special and I got the cinnamon roll. WOWZA! Those cinnamon roll pancakes are top notch and seriously need to be in my belly 24/7. I wish I had ditched the pseudo health and just gone with my glutinous soul for that one. Next time. Either way, download the Nowait app from the App Store and use it to hop in line a few hours in advance. Happy pancaking.

pics.caption: The signature pancakes. Very good, but the cinnamon roll ones are better.

review.des: Great selection of food to start the day! Very long wait so put in your name and take a nice walk around the park to build your appetite!

pics.caption: Sweet and savory!  Cinnamon roll pancakes are a must-try!

review.des: Super like it! It's just impossible to not like pancake and harsh brown. And eating both of them at the same time is just perfect. Waiting for like half an hour but worthy!

I just ate enough food for two people.  Ordered the garden skillet with fig/walnut pancakes. The skillet was enormous and had good fresh veggies in it; it could have been a little lighter on cheese. The pancakes were delicious, with an unexpected but tasty nutmeg flavor and ample figs. Many good vegetarian options on the menu. The service was super friendly and very efficient, with not just the waiter but also multiple helpers and a food runner taking care of tables. I arrived about 7 am and didn't wait at all. Definitely recommended - though if I came here with another diner next time, I'd split the meal I ordered!

Great menu! Lots of variety! Friendly service and great coffee drinks! Our waitress recommend the " berry blend" (not sure if that's what's it's called" and I tried it with crepes and girlfriend tried it on pancakes.... WAS NOT DISAPPOINTED!!! Great little breakfast stop, especially when we arrived on such an early flight.  Just degraded a star because now that we have finished eating and are trying to pay we have been sitting here for 15 min with no attention of what so ever.

When visiting Chicago for a weekend away, Wildberry is our go-to brunch!

The wait is long but standing outside with hoards of other hungry breakfast goers, taking in the beautiful views of downtown Chicago and Millenium Park, isn't a bad way to start the morning. Once seated, the service was friendly and the food came fast - a pretty great feat considering how many tables each server was working and how many pancakes the kitchen was pumping out!

I had the Fresh Glazed Blueberry pancakes... I mean, it's "Wildberry Pancake Cafe" so I had to start with a berry pancake. The cakes were perfectly fluffy, the berries super fresh.

They also serve Intelligentsia which is always excellent; both hot coffee and lattes were spot on.

It's gotta be said and I hate writing multiple reviews with the same statements but.. "I don't get it".  I always thought the love affair was only for suburban dwellers.  I'm appalled to see the numbers of lovers here.  It makes me wonder whether Chicagoans are visiting the Mom and pop brunch spots or not?  This is essentially IHOP upgraded with a nice measure of Denny's mixed in.  

I can't believe people want to wait 45 minutes to eat here!? Chicago is a brunch capital! There are so many better places that make food from scratch!

I shouldn't mock them so openly.  Clearly, people like what they're putting out.  I've unfortunately been forced to attend brunch gatherings at Wildberry.  I hate waiting for meh-worthy meals.  I've tried different brunch entrees and nothing has wowed me.  If I'm forced here in the future, I'll get a salad or a smoothie.

Simply phenomenal... First of all most people can probably tell the difference between freshly squeezed orange juice and Tropicana, but the Wildberry orange juice was on another level of freshly squeezed.

As for the food, suffice to say I had to try the signature pancakes since this was my first visit.  You know the pancakes were good when you don't need to use syrup.  The fresh berries, strawberries and vanilla anglaise gives you all the extra flavor and sauciness you need.  Again, simply phenomenal.  

The veggie omelette was on point, but admittedly hard to make one that truly stands out.  But the hashbrowns were just that.  It's hard to find a place that can achieve the right balance of not to crispy, not to soggy yet savory and this place has it.

By the way, don't even think of showing up without checking the wait time on yelp and adding your name to the waiting list.

This was my first time in Chicago and Wildberry was highly recommended.  It was delicious.  The seasonal blueberry pancakes were unbelievable. Food was quick to come out and service was exceptional.  This is definitely a must do for brunch.
This is such an amazing brunch spot! I think the omelets are really yummy and definitely worth their price, and the pancakes that come with it are very soft and fluffy.

Came here during Lalapalooza and it was amazing. Came today with my kids and they absolutely loved it. The service is amazing and the food is to die for.

You have to wait but if you walk across the street and check out the park and the Bean you are set!!
This place was definitely worth the wait! The skillet and blueberry bliss pancakes were amazing! The customer service was excellent. I will definitely be back my next visit to Chicago!

Unlike other reviews, I don't see the hype with this place.  We decided to come here for breakfast due to the raving reviews; that and our hotel was within walking distance.  The wife and kids had the pancake and waffles, while I had the Butcher Block Sizzlin' Skillet.  The Sizzlin' Skillet was definitely a filling meal, but there was nothing great or excellent about it.  To me it seemed just a regular diner, but in one of the most beautiful cities in the country.  Perhaps, the fact that the restaurant is nicely situated and adjacent to area attractions such as Millenium Park and Cloud Gate, is the reason why the restaurant has overwhelming reviews particularly from out of towners.  Maybe the next time we're in Chicago we'll give this place another try because I really would like to see what the hype is all about.

Don't be alarmed by the very long waits. Just make sure you get on the waitlist on Yelp. The food was well worth it. I wish they served mimosas but I understand why they may not. Service was wonderful as well.

We were visiting the city and found the restaurant through the typical online/app searches. Based on the hype, it was a must that we checked it out. The no waitlist reservation is a good idea and I think we could have optimized its benefits better. We made reservations then walked down, the wait was 2 hours when we left. Instead, we should have hung around the hotel and headed down later.

Anyways, we ended up waiting, standing, and sitting around the entire 2 hours. Which was miserable. For us, the food couldn't make us feel better. But, the food was definitely good. Would I go back if I had to wait 2 hours? HEAVENS no! With proper planning, the experience could definitely be worth it.  Again, decent food. Good service even. Just crazy wait.
Delicious breakfast - the pancakes were phenomenal.  I don't generally eat pancakes out.  I left eggs, bacon and hashbrowns to finish the pancakes.  Great portions for a reasonable price.

Food and service from hosts and servers are amazing, and the long wait is reasonable for the amount of people that come. The 3 stars is because of the bussers who are way too aggressive with taking plates off tables, same guy came in under a minute to take my plate when there was still food on it, sometimes I like to sit and enjoy my dinning experience instead of scarfing everything down at once. They were also rude and obviously talking about me as I rejected their offer to take my almost full plate for the 3rd time, (this was still under 5 minuets of me eating). I'd go back to a Wildberry but probably the one in mag mile!

I came here with friends visiting Chicago for the first time, and it was a bad experience.  The food was terrible; a combination of overcooked (eggs), undercooked (bacon), flavorless (signature Wildberry pancakes), and hair in food.  Service was ok, but nothing special.  I hope that I never visit again.

Their service is awesome but not as awesome as their breakfast!

I had their fried chicken jalapeño waffle. It was absolutely amazing, I couldn't imagine having better breakfast in the city!
Great breakfast.... thick bacon, farm fresh eggs....pancakes were ok..but I'm bias...
Great vibe, great food and great service. The house pancakes were awesome. Will definitely be back the next time I'm in chicagi

Wildberry has large portions, tasty food, reasonable prices, and great service.  The only problem is that you'll probably have to wait, because everyone else wants to eat at the great place to.  Having gone 5 times on different days, there isn't any way to avoid the line.  The best solution is to use the No Wait App to get in line before you arrive, you'll know about when to arrive and get straight to your food.

On to the food.  Pretty much everything is good here, and most flavor combinations go well.  That being said, I sometimes remove mushrooms or Jalapenos since I would rather not eat them, and the dishes are still stellar.  Berry Bliss and Tiramisu pancakes both amazing (Oreo Smores pancakes extremely sweet, but exactly how you would imagine them).  Crepes are very light and fluffy, again Berry Bliss the best variety (skip the whole wheat and berries, sounds good but is dry, definitely need sauce). Florence and Los Altos Eggs Benedicts are both great, the Los Altos having a stronger flavor with a bit of kick from the chorizo.  Rutherford Omelette tasty, the bacon balancing well with caramelized onions and goat cheese.  Espanola omelette and Mexicana skillet are the same foods, just packaged differently, a Choose-Your-Own Adventure if you will.  Really the only item I disliked was the Garden Skillet, sounds healthy, but doesn't have any dominant flavor to carry the dish, and so it just falls flat and bland.

pics.caption: Side of cinnamon roll pancakes delicious

review.des: Delicious and huge servings! I had the Florence Eggs Benedict! Check this place out and then go walk around Millennium Park!

We waited three hours because he reviews were so terrific. Our pancakes were dry. They didn't have any fruit cooked into them, just a little dumped on top. The "fruit tray" was unripe cheap fruit. It was awful. We really felt like we wasted a lot of our time on this restaurant.

This is honestly an amazing restaurant! We had a long wait (2hrs)  but it was well worth it! A few things that really impressed us....very organized, great service and great food! Would highly recommend this restaurant!

My wife and I make a point to eat at Wildberrys every time we are in Chicago. They have the friendliest manager and staff we've met! The food is outstanding and if you have to wait a little while for a table just remember it's worth it!

I've been to the Schaumburg location multiple times, but this location was a first for me a few weeks back - and it did not disappoint. For being a Thursday morning, it was packed - but that's expected in a touristy city. My friend and I were seating within 15 minutes, not too shabby.

They serve intelligentsia coffee, so of course, it is delish and we each had a few cups. The Mexicana skillet looked amazing and caught both of our eye. It comes with hash browns, chorizo, eggs, jalapeño, avocado, onions, and cheese. I don't eat chorizo and my friend doesn't really like potatoes. Our waitress suggested that many people like to sub in black beans - sounded delish, so we both added that in. The skillets were delicious. They came with toast and I LOVE when breakfast places grill their toast, and they do!! He got a side of applewood smoked bacon and I got the chicken sausage. Loved the chicken sausage!

In the past, I've tried the Garden Skillet, Smore pancakes, and breakfast burrito and I've loved them all. I'm sure this location makes those just as well as the other.

Service was wonderful. We loved our waitress, she was attentive and everything she suggested was on point!

Location is wonderful - steps from Michigan Ave and Millennium Park - so if you're in town sight seeing and want to grab a great breakfast before - definitely hit up this location. You'd expect something with such a great location to be pricey, but it's definitely reasonable.

A great amount of delicious breakfast for a decent price in a wonderful location with incredible service? Sign me up any day :)

Stopped by for a early morning breakfast on Presidents Day. There was no wait unlike a previous visit we had made on a weekend. Service was prompt and the staff was courteous. We had the Berry bliss pancakes, the chocolate chip waffles and the Spanish omelette. The berry bliss pancakes came as a huge serving with plenty of fruit and were delicious. The chocolate chip waffles were tasty but weren't unique. The Spanish omelette was good and had plenty of filling.
The location is also great as we were able to visit millennium Park and the been after a delightful breakfast!

I know that wildberry is a huge deal in Chicago and it was definitely fun to go, but I felt like the food fell flat.  I got the duck hash with a side of the wildberry pancakes.  The duck hash was not super flavorful and the duck itself was overcooked and resultantly dry.  I had to add a lot of hot sauce to make this taste like anything at all because it was so plain.  I get the hype about the wildberry pancakes - they're definitely very pretty and fun looking - but I felt like all of that sauce was just there to hide an average, non-fluffy pancake, and the sauce itself was just too sweet.  

The reason I gave this three stars instead of two is because the service was phenomenal. I don't remember the name of our server (he was a skinny black dude with a big smile) but he was friendly, enthusiastic, and efficient. He regularly checked on us and made us feel like welcome guests in the restaurant. Despite the mediocre food, he made the experience itself pretty great.

pics.caption: A side of wildberry pancakes..why was the fruit pushed all the way off to the side like that?

review.des: I loved the pancakes. Just add butter and syrup. So good!  I had the mexicana skillet which was also good. It had jalapeños, avocado, onions, hash browns, cheese, chorizo, a side of salsa and 2 over medium eggs on top. The salsa tasted homemade.

pics.caption: Mexicana skillet with 2 eggs over easy. The salsa was great.  I loved the pancakes too.

review.des: Reasonably priced, generous portions, and great service. Long wait but download the no wait app--way better than waiting outside for 60-90 minutes. Our favorite breakfast place in Chicago. The pancakes are out of this world!!

pics.caption: Veggie skillet and a side of pancakes.

review.des: BEST brunch spot ever! The 2 hour wait Saturday morning was well worth it. We had brunch here Sunday morning as well, but only waited 10 minutes since we got in line at 8 am. So wake up early to beat the rush, you will not be disappointed! I've tried the skillets, benedicts, and french toast! Simply amazing!

My staple breakfast/brunch spot. Any day of the week this place is great. During weekday I sit down and eat because it is not as crowded early in the morning. On weekends, if not there before 8 am, I call in a takeout order. Everything on the menu is great. My go to is the Mexicana skillet with Chicken and a side order of cinnamon roll pancakes.

Visiting Chicago and this place was highly rated and it's right near Millenium Park and the Art Institute, which is where I was headed after my meal. The place was packed on a Friday afternoon; I think a lot of the workers nearby eat there? I'm not totally sure, but it was packed. I didn't feel like waiting, so I ordered a Florence Benedict to go and found a market cafe in the adjacent building where you could buy a drink and sit down with your own food. The wait for my food was about 10 minutes, tops.

I thought the food was alright -- there was a bit too much Hollandaise sauce that my meal was drowning in it. Other than that, it was tasty and the bacon and egg muffin were great. I think the place is well-priced and conveniently located, but given the number of reviews and the high rating, I was a bit disappointed with the food.

man, this place was slammed & we had to wait quite a while to get seated but, once we did, the kitchen staff & our server kicked some serious ass.  

fyi, the food here is enormous & i had the chicken & waffles ftw!

not a bad restaurant by any means, but not anything too special either. if you're going to wait in line to come here, it's only worth it if you order something more unique. (their two eggs + protein dishes are not worth AT ALL). their pancakes are really all the same  just with different toppings, although to be fair, they have some unique topping choices.

Came here for brunch on a Monday and was seated in about 20 min. Amazing food and service was quick. Our waitress was sweet as well.

Ordered the Mexicana skillet which was HUGE. It was the perfect blend of salty hash browns, creamy avocado, and silky eggs. That massive skillet also came with a full order of pancakes as a "side". I opted for the Signature Berry Bliss pancakes and they were honestly some of the best I've ever had. Fluffy, sweet, and served topped with vanilla anglaise, blackberry coulis, berry mascarpone, and fresh berries. The perfect complement to a salty skillet. (I asked for a "light drizzle" though, or else they smother them.)

My friend ordered the omelet and it was MASSIVE. Also came with a "side" of pancakes. Tummies were full.

Atmosphere was warm and cozy. Prices were outstanding. Awesome brunch place!!

pics.caption: Create your own omelet with side of pancakes

review.des:
This place is a tourist trap. just a better version of ihops  There was about a 2 hour wait at 11am, so we opt for to go.

This guy that was a regular came up to us and told us which entree to try...turns out he was probably trying to hit on us.

Signature Berry Bliss crepes - it wasn't the absolute best but I've had better in San Diego.

Cinnamon French toast - It was good, sweet. but nothing mind blowing.

Ordered to go, went to the park to eat and they didn't even give me ANY utensils or napkins...so I had to eat with one of my friend's plastic knife, and my butt got bitten by a centipede.

Maybe it would have been a 3 star if I sat inside.

I went in on a weekday at around 10.30-11am and got seated immediately (party of 2). This place was highly recommended by my friend and she was totally spot on about this place!

Massive serving, great food and affordable prices. I mean, omelette, hash and 2 slices of pancakes?? I was full for the rest of the day. Service was prompt too. Omelette was well done, hash was crisp and had the amazing golden brown colour on the outside. The oreo smores pancake I got was mindblowing (though it got too much for me after the first pancake).

I've heard that lines form early on the weekends as this is near a touristy place so be prepared for that.

pics.caption: oreo and smores pancake. this is recipe for food coma but it's sooo good!

review.des: Food was good, but I think this place is highly overrated.  Definitely not worth a 2 hour wait.

We Californians braved the cold in the early morning to avoid a wait, and our strategy worked.  We got seated right away on a Sunday (7-ish).  You get a stack of pancakes (4) and a good amount of  berries, but it's really no different from other eateries specializing in breakfast or brunch.   Hubby's omelet was good.  Perhaps our expectations were too high.  I would try this place, but I won't go out of my way to do so.
The pancakes and crepes are amazing. The wait to be seated, not so much. Use the Yelp app to "call ahead" and cut down your wait time.

its an updated take on an old favorite, one that will live up to your best memories from childhood. How much we love proper dinner food...there's something so American about it, you'll hear the national anthem play in your head as they bring you your sunnyside eggs with crispy hash, rye toast with a side of crispy bacon, a glass of fresh squeezed orange juice, and cup of Joe to boot.

If it wasn't for all the damn tourist ;) this place would be the neighborhood staple for Lakeshore East.  We long for it but rarely get to enjoy it because of the long wait times.
Great pancakes!!  I would definitely visit wildberry again. I was impressed with the food, service,  and affordable prices. I had the cranberry and pecan pancakes

Came to Wildberry for the first time and we really enjoyed ourselves. Long wait time but the food was very good.

Chocolate chip pancakes (5/5): Fluffy and crispy. Plenty of chocolate. Some of the best chocolate chip pancakes I've ever had.

Chicken Salad Sandwich (4.5/5): Very good and fresh, but we have had better.

Corn beef hash (4.5/5): Good. Had it with berry pancakes and really enjoyed it.

Denver (4.5/5): Very good. Had it with cinnamon pancakes that were very sweet. Nice balance with the salty and sweet.
This place has the BEST BREAKFAST! Everything is so fresh and I love the fact that their food is organic.

We came here the first morning because it was close to our hotel, and came back the next day because it was so good.

The food is great, and they made the best vanilla latte I've ever had. Portions are huge, and service is pretty quick.

The wait seems to always be long -- I recommend using Yelp to skip the line, so you're not waiting out on the sidewalk for 45-60 minutes minimum.

(Experience from August 2016) I used the nowait app early in the morning to help avoid the long wait in line I would have experienced upon arriving at the restaurant so that helped a lot.  There were 4 people dining in our group and we were seating right away as soon as the nowait app said our time was up.  

Service:  Great server, can't remember her name, but she was great.  She was informative, had a great attitude and checked on us frequently.

Ambience/Noise:  Loud, but of course, this location is in downtown Chicago and the restaurant is huge so it is to be expected.  The atmosphere is relaxed and is good for family dining.

Food Quality:  Meh.  Yes, I said it.  Just meh.  My group ordered pancakes for us all to share and the pancakes were phenomenal!  My problem was with everything else we ordered.  I had an egg white garden skillet, my bf ordered the Mexicana skillet, and I can't remember what else was ordered, but what I can remember is that the food was average at best.  I feel like I could have gotten the same kind of skillet at a hole-in-the-wall diner.  If I wanted that, I would have gone to somewhere I can expect that from.  I feel like this place is over-hyped and it's more about dining downtown than anything.  It really isn't that big a deal- I recommend going elsewhere if you plan on ordering something other than pancakes.  But, if you want a good order of pancakes, this is your place.

Wow... hands down the best pancakes I've ever had!! Incredibly soft and fluffy and melts in your mouth. The mix of berries make the blend perfect. I didn't add any syrup because they already taste perfect without. Staff is friendly. I experienced no wait whatsoever. Service was fast -- I got food within 5 minutes of ordering. Only tho g is the pancakes are huge!!!! I could only finish 2/5 of the food. Wish they made less..

Such a crazy place with a long wait for everything to be just below average.  If you want better quality yolk is or bongo room are totally better and less of a ridiculous wait. The service is also not that great. Maybe Would only be back if it was a quick convenient meal during lunch break ir something but with that long wait not even! Just won't be back

Over priced and not all of that. I can go to Yolk and get better food at a better price. I've eaten here twice and both times were a disappointment so I don't go anymore. I like a delicious breakfast at a good price and this isn't it. especially when there are so many places near it that are better in both respects

This place is absolutely amazing for brunch. The sweet and savory options are both equally amazing. For me, I always get an omelette and then do a specialty sub for the pancakes, often with the wildberry bliss. The wait is always long, but you can use the Nowait app to reserve a spot without having to be there. But regardless, the food here is worth the wait. Definitely worth a try!

Could not wait to try Wildberry Pancakes cafe! Visiting from California I LOVED everything. Flavor of the month coffee was Vanilla and my boyfriend and I both got two different skillet breakfast with two different specialty pancakes that was all amazing! I would definitely come back!

Prior to my first trip to Chicago, I read countless restaurant reviews. As a result, I found myself at Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe. As expected, there was a wait. The food didn't live up to the hype generated by the online reviews. The food was just ok. My wife and I both agreed that it wasn't somewhere we would visit again. She loves all things sweet, but even the cinnamon roll pancakes were disappointing. We've since made Yolk our go-to breakfast locale.

pics.caption: Bacon, eggs, hash browns and cinnamon roll pancakes

review.des: This place was recommended to me by a friend and this place will not disappoint! I highly highly recommend the berry bliss pancakes. My boyfriend ordered them and I was jealous. I ordered the chocolate banana bread French toast. It was good. But I wanted my boyfriend's plate lol. Fast service. Friendly staff.

This was walking distance from my hotel in the Loop, and it was clearly a popular place on a Saturday am. I can't say how many people were locals vs.  tourists, but it was fun and bustling nevertheless. I was dining solo so I hade only a short wait at around 8am. By the time I left it was clearly a long line.
But I think it would be worth at least a 30 or 40 minute wait. The menu had lots of options from gluten free to lower fat and the like. And the pancakes were really tasty. Someone at the table next to me had a skillet that looked pretty great, too. I had to convince myself not to go back the next day so I could a different restaurant!

pics.caption: Two eggs with chicken sausage, pancakes, fruit, and a latte.

review.des:
