THE BEST PANCAKES EVER!!!! I don't take my brunch choices lightly, so when I say this place has the best pancakes ever, they have one of the best pancakes I've ever had! We ate at Wildberry while visiting Chicago last week. It was comparable to my favorite brunch place in Maryland (Miss Shirley's).

The wait for Friday morning for 2 ppl was about 20 mins. Staff were friendly. We ordered Berry blissed pancake and garden skillet with a side of cinnamon roll pancakes.

I felt sick after eating here, but that's probably because I walked all the way to the museums after eating their delicious breakfast burrito filled with chorizo, peppers, cheese, buttery oh my goodness this is so rich and not good for me hashbrown (extra crispy), and a berry banana smoothie.

Come early, this place gets packed and you could wait an hour. As a breakfast lover, Wildberry gets my approval!
Amazing place to be... great people lovely food... always busy.. needs reservations... very fresh and good way to start your day..,
Was not all is was hyped up to be, decent service but the food was less than average. Blah. Super disappointed.

As busy as this place was, they didn't slack on customer service. Awesome for them to have the waitlist app for here. As an OUT of town guest I'm looking for the best of the best. Had to sample the pancakes most sought after. I us the banana Creme and berry ones. Both were good but the Banana Creme ones did it for me. I also had an omelette the Fresca one with chicken sausage. The sweetness of the sausage along with the savory was great. Loved it. Oh and let's not for get the full service  cafe with Fresh roasted Intelligica beans. I had the Vanilla Betty latte with almond milk. Yeeeeeeea to this place

First.  Download the nowait app and check wait times before heading out!  

Waited nearly 40 minutes on a Friday morning.  Not too bad considering this is a popular place!

Ordered the 'make-your-own' omelette, pancakes and coffee.  About $18 with tax.

Portion size was huge.  Omelette was stuffed with cheese, avocado, tomatoes and ham. STUFFED!  Equally large size portion of hashbrown.  Big or small, come hungry or bring someone to share it with.  

Did it taste good?  It tasted ok, just ok.  

The service was great.  Very attentive and quick to refill the coffee cup.

With the lines I am guessing the kitchen is working hard to prepare food fast, not fast food.  I just didn't see the value for what was served.

pics.caption: Large, no HUGE portions.  Bring a friend to share with!

review.des: Great food in general! We stayed 4 days in Chicago and went to this place three days in a row for brunch and tried different kind of food in their menu. The crepes, veggie omelet was really good, BLT sandwich was good, waffle and fried chicken was not bad tho the fried chicken was not hot and the waffle was not crispy outside, the pancake is a bit dry, it should be soft and pluffy

This place is super busy pretty much all the time from what I can tell, but it's because their food is delicious. I would have gladly given five stars if not for the pretty terrible service. Rude or inattentive staff everywhere which was disappointing. The Windy City was definitely not a friendly place. That being said, I grabbed the Denver omelette skillet and loved it. Piled high with hashbrowns, peppers, onions, meats and eggs cooked to order. I went with over medium and was disappointed they were overcooked (didn't run at all), but it was still very tasty.

They have good coffee and huge portions took half back to the hotel to snack on later (which was great).

If they'd been able to keep our water/coffee filled, been a little friendly, and we didn't have to hunt them down for the check, it would have been a much better experience. But the food was too good for me to knock it down to three stars for a staff that will likely turn-over before the next person's breakfast.

Omg, worst food ever, can I just say dennys even taste better! I swear when I read the Yelp review I was pretty ecstatic and excited to taste the yummies! Sadly, food was as great as all the hype people made it sound to be
I had the butchers skillet and man that was overly greased and oiled up! Gross! Barley even edible!!
I also got the fig and walnut multigrain pancakes and man, that was like the worst pankcake i ever had in my life, I swear my 2 year old makes a better pancake than that!!! It was so soggy like it was even cooked it was all batter! Anyways when I asked why my pancake was so soggy and all batter, the waitress had the nerves to tell me that's the way pancakes are made?! Are you kidding me?!!!
I wasn't born yesterday and so wasn't she! Rude!
Gross, will never return! And they need a fix in their rating! Cause this place is nasty! Dennys yup Denny over this place any day! Now that is sad.
Great breakfast food! Love breakfast anytime of day and Wildberry never disappoints. Very fast and delicious. Service a little show but the quick food makes up for it.

When I lived the burbs, we always went to the Wildberry in Schaumburg. Now that I'm in the city, it's always a delight to be able to go here. Parking is always an issue for this location, but the quality of the food is great as always. I usually order the Turkey Burger. Best I've ever had. I highly recommend. Otherwise, all their omelets are great and their salads are yum.

Definitely on my top 3 brunches ever had list (and I'm definitely a bruncher). The wait here on the weekends is definitely longer (we got here around 10:30 am and had to wait about an hour- not horrible). The location of this restaurant definitely gets it an extra star. Millennium Park was right across the street, so while we waited, we did our touristy photos at the bean and walked around the parks. When our table was ready, they texted us. We went to the table, and then had to wait an extra 10 minutes, which I thought was odd since they texted us saying our table was ready. This was easily made up though when we got our food. OMG the red velvet French toast was AMAZING, and the omelette was cooked to perfection. We were seated outside and it started pouring so they moved us inside. By the time they moved us inside, our food had gotten cold. They said they couldn't reheat it, but they brought us a new serving of hash browns, which was nice.

Tip: if you'd like to avoid the wait, there is an app that you can download to put your name on a call ahead list. But honestly the wait isn't that bad with the location of the restaurant and being able to knock out some tourist stuff while waiting.

Food- on point

Great place for brunch. Food is consistently awesome and portions are generous. Servers are always competent and friendly. If you don't mind waiting for a table, highly recommend as it is worth the wait.

Food was good, I wouldn't say 5 stars (maybe 4), but they get 5 from me because of the volume of food for the price, timeliness and great service.  

Although the waitlist was crazy, they are extremely efficient and service is fast.  My server, Aletse, was kind, friendly and attentive.  

Overall a great experience I would recommend.

Although the value is here in terms of price and the amount of food you get, I have felt sick after eating here on each occasion. If you are a breakfast lover and don't have a sensitive stomach I would say you will enjoy eating here but keep in mind that the food is very heavy.

The 2 hour waitlist says it all. Everyone wants breakfast here because it's THAT good. We are omelettes with specialty pancakes. Too much good but oh so good. Use the "add to waitlist" feature on Yelp. We did that from Amtrak 10 miles out of town, then casually walked there, arriving at the perfect time.

I'll tell you straight out of the gate. Visit this place in 4 easy steps! If visiting on the weekend...Download the No Wait app, show up at your scheduled time, check in with the hostess and eat! This food is slamming! The service is top notch and they give plenty of food! The next time I am in Chicago this is a must!

Leaving Chicago today. Before we checked out of our hotel we decided to try Wildberrys.
No long lines as we had encountered earlier during our 5 day stay.
Food was good Service was fantastic (thanks Kimberly). Will come again.

Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe is a good cafe. Yet, the food here can be found at any cafe across the nation. My review would've been a 4 star review, yet, the wait time was a full two (2) hours. I blame myself for succumbing to the buildup, yet I won't spend 2 hours of my Chicago summer hours waiting for normal cafe food again.

OK like seriously! The wait at this place is no joke!

We got there at 10:30 and a Saturday morning and the wait was 90 minutes. So we did with any smart person would do. And ordered to go... which was ready in 15 minutes!

The pancakes were great very big sizes and I can only finished three the freshly squeezed orange juice was definitely a plus!

Will return but next time will either call ahead       for pick up or do take out again...

pics.caption: All those people standing in the back... Are crazy for waiting 90 for pancakes... Lol! Order to go.

review.des: Delish. Excellent choices for breakfast. You can order an egg dish and also a 3 pancake side of the specialty pancakes -- which were to DIE for! Our server was friendly, knew the menu and gave us just the right amount of attention and privacy. Recommend the queue feature - get on the waitlist before you go. What was advertised as a 20 min wait was less than 10min. An excellent experience and perfect location adjacent to Millennium Park
Finally found a breakfast place with skillets! Delicious food! Had a warm Apple Cider too! My favorite in the fall! Highly recommend this place and I'll definitely be back!

******** We had Wildberry delivered with Postmates. I highly recommend it!! ********

I was so excited to go to Wildberry but knew the line would be crazy by the time we commuted downtown from Midway. I'd never used Postmates before but my local friend suggested it - and boy, am I glad he did!

In a matter of minutes (maybe 20), I had hot cinnamon bun pancakes brought to the door of my apartment! These pancakes were incredible and totally lived up to my sky high expectations. Just the right amount of cinnamon and sweetness (quite a bit). I didn't even need maple syrup. I saved half the pancakes and all the syrup for a second breakfast later that day. My husband had eggs, toast, and bacon, which were all hot and fresh.

5 stars all the way for Wildberry (and Postmates)!!

Download the No Wait app.  Even if you are just thinking of going download it now.  Get on the list on your way over.  We went early on a weekday and waited almost an hour to be seated.  I ordered Southern Eggs Benedict and a side of Berry Bliss Pancakes.  Hubby had a Create Your Own Omelette and a side of Caramel Apple Pecan French Toast.  Food was good but not amazing like I thought it would be based off reviews.  Service was surprisingly slow.  I appreciate not feeling rushed but it was way too slow.  I would think they would want to turn tables.  I liked our server.  She was super nice and friendly just took forever to order and again to get our check.  We sat for at least 15 min with our menus closed waiting for her to come back to take our order.  Slightly frustrating because we were ready when she took our drink order but she rushed off and said she would be right back.  At the end it was really awkward waiting and waiting with our table cleared, people waiting for tables looking at us and no check in sight.  We eventually asked a random busser for our check after our server passed by our empty table several times.  Def not the place to go if you are on any kind of time constraints.  Make sure to put extra time on the meter.

Gluten free pancakes!  I ordered the Honey Berry Gluten-free pancakes.  Five steaming, fresh cakes drizzled with honey and sprinkled with fresh berries.  Happiness!  The cakes were just a bit dense (like gf can be) but very good.  Our waiter was excellent.  And the Americano good.

Enjoyed the 'Signature Berry Bliss' pancakes, but I can't give more than 3 stars. There was not enough of the special toppings to make these signature pancakes extravagant. I didn't think the skillet was anything special and the blueberry pancakes were also good but not better than others I have had. It was very busy, which we expected; however, the service was less than hospitable. Everyone seemed stressed and overwhelmed. All in all, it was just ok.

This place is amazing! I visit every time I'm in town. . yes, the lines are long but using the NoWait app really helps! It tells you your place in line so that you could plan accordingly. Highly recommend Esp the speciality berry pancake and the skillet meals!

Came on a Saturday afternoon around 1 pm and ended up only waiting about 30 minutes for a table for 2! Coming from New York where the wait time is at least an hour for brunch, this was such a sweet blessing LOL

I ordered the Mexican sizzlin skillet which comes with Hash Browns, Cheddar & Jack Cheese, 2 Eggs, Chorizo Sausage, Jalapeños, Avocado, Cilantro & Onions. It comes with regular pancakes but for $1 more, you can upgrade to the signature pancakes so obviously I did that and got the Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes!! The pancakes were handsdown the best pancakes i've ever had. It was so moist and fluffy and was topped with Vanilla Anglaise which makes the pancakes sweet already you could eat it without the syrup! The texture was absolutely perfect and definitely the best part of the meal. The skillet was also really good and packed. I didnt expect how much food it was going to be considering the skillet & signature pancakes were just $11.95!! A great deal for a lot of food!

I also got the Honey Toffee Nut Latte, which was really goood and only $4!

The server we had was superrrr nice and always checked up on us to make sure everything was okay. They do close at 2:30 pm but we were there till 3 pm and they didn't rush us! Definitely a great place to check out if youre in Chicago.

This is our go-to breakfast spot whenever staying in the downtown Chicago area! Only trouble is, it's a lot of other people's too! Can't go wrong here, totally worth the wait if there is one! Love the locally sourced eggs!!
Honestly the best skillet I've ever had. I would go back even just for the vanilla berry latte... so YUM! Also the service is great, friendly staff. I'd recommend

I travel a lot and have ate at many breakfast restaurants, but this is definitely my new favorite.  Melt in your mouth Waffles and Pancakes, and their Omelets are excellent.  Large portions, left me wishing I had a microwave and refrigerator in my hotel room so I take my leftovers and eat them later.  10 Stars!!!!

One of the best brunches I've been too. The wait took roughly an hour and 56 minutes.  You'd think for waiting 2 hours,  I'd take off a star... But nope, this place has a line out the door and a crazy take out line for a damn good reason,  the food,  service,  and prices are fire. We sat down,  had a helpful waitress answer all our questions and take our orders. We ordered 1 iced coffee (great brew,  strong flavor,)  a fresh squeezed OJ (it was fresh squeezed but it almost tasted like it was cut with some Tropicana...), a bacon,  ham and cheddar omelet (this omelet was fat.. Fluffy.. And flavorful.) it came with two sides,  we got the very berry pancakes and rye toast. For 11.50 I don't think you can get more food.. And great quality.  My girlfriend got the Florence Benedict, with spinach and bacon(real bacon too,  not thinly sliced or bacon bites.. Like real chopped bacon). The flavor was Un real.  I've been to five star brunch places,  and Noone poached a better egg than Wild berries.

If you're a local or visiting. GO HERE

Check in online through Yelp so you don't have to wait long once you arrive! We only waited about 5 minutes when we arrived compared to 30+ minutes for the people who did not check in before getting there. If sitting outside, there will be honeybees constantly flying around you and your food, so I recommend getting a table inside. The pumpkin spice latte was good, however, the hazelnut latte was not. As for the food, I recommend splitting a plate if you don't want to be full for the entire day. You get an side order with the specialty Benedict. I had the Los Altos Benedict with a side order of regular pancakes and my girlfriend had the Florence Benedict with a side order of hash browns. The food delicious, however, it was annoying to have to constantly swat away the honeybees. The service here was great. I gave 3 stars instead of 4 because of the honeybees.

Actually THE best pancakes I've ever had!! I highly recommend the Banana creme pie and the Cinnamon Roll Pancakes, also the hash browns are delicious as well as the Eggs Benedict and omelets! Although it's Definitely worth the wait for the pancakes, I wish thy didn't remove the yelp waitlist option, that's a lifesaver !

I really hate it when my expectations are not met.  

I walked into Wildberry on a gloomy April morning.  One hour wait?  No prob.   It was a Sunday morning, they have four stars, and rave reviews - gotta be worth the wait.  

While we waited, we ran to millenium park with our buzzers.  We people watched and took photos at Anish Kapoor's chrome "Bean".  

Since I am a big fan of sweet and savory I ordered the Napa Valley Fig Omlette and of course I had to try the SIGNATURE Berry Bliss pancakes.

My review....meh.  I felt that the food was just okay.  Nothing special or worth mentioning.  The staff was friendly and service was quick.

No reservation here bcos here is so traffic, but i can understand. So my friend n I went there and wait for the line. Host said i took around 15 mins. But we was waiting for more than that. We i thought they forgot my line, then I reminded them my q. But It's ok. Then, we started to order almond latte n vanilla berry latte. VBL is good smell! :)
We ordered Southern Benedict, signature berry waffle, n kid size of berry pancake. They are all tasty, especially, the pancake! Its so fluffy. Besides, there are blueberries stuff. My friend likes it. N so do I!

On Easter Day the wait was long, but using the "NoWait" app allowed us to check-in 1 hour early from our hotel room. We waited at the restaurant for 20 mins. Very reasonable.
We sat outside and it was the right choice. Beautiful setting and not crowded. The patio wait staff was excellent. Our waitress was friendly and was very responsive to our questions about the menu. We asked a question that she did not know the answer, and actually told us the wrong info. But she found the correct answer and came to us with the correct response.
Food was delicious and no one had order envy! My wife wanted crepes, so we looked on Yelp and found this place- great experience! Totally recommend.

We had a great time while there, but let's be real... It's diner breakfast food. What I had was really good but very Midwestern... very heavy, salty, greasy, and heart attack inducing. But if you're in the mood for all that (because sometimes we just need some comfort), this is the spot! Their hearty dishes don't disappoint. The gravy is all things creamy and savory... Ooo! Just walk around Millennium Park (across the street) after to work a sliver of it off.

I still don't get what all the hype is about. We waited 45 minutes to get a table here and it took us forever to order and another bit of forever for us to get the food. And it was Monday morning! Maybe it's just because it's close to millennium park and is super touristy but man I don't know how people have the patience to wait 2 hours for food!

We ordered the strawberry crepes and the skillet. I have to admit, there was ALOT of food that came out. But the food was really under seasoned and undercooked. It was way worse quality than I would get at the nearest IHOP or breakfast joint. Although the food was okay for breakfast food, I don't think it was worth such the long wait. After all the hype I expected something stunning and delicious. The food seemed like nothing I hadn't seen before - pancakes, eggs, omelette...whatever, standard breakfast food.

My suggestion is to go somewhere more quiet and personal for breakfast for a cheaper price (and for the same amount of food). I definitely would not want to go through the hassle of waiting such a long time for this again. I wasn't blown away, I don't think I will be coming back here again.

I saw review on yelp also my friend who study in Chicago recommend me to try this cute place. It located near my hotel.  I choose three entree and there pancake which absolutely perfect choice! I also order hot chocolate that not too sweet i really love it! Very friendly service !
There is a reason that this place is so busy. I am now just getting to write a review. Their breakfast burrito is one of the best that I have ever had. Their team was great as well. Keep it up!!!!!

I had the Southern Benedict, and it was delicious. Every part of it was great - the biscuits, gravy, and the eggs. The side potatoes were also very good, and fried to a great consistency.

The service was fairly poor with our specific server, but hopefully that was a one-off. It wasn't terrible, and I recognize they were very busy, but we had to repeatedly ask for the same things.

I had the Slow Roast Brisket Hash ( omg, so goooood )
Wife had the espanola omelete (she said it was ok)

And we both had the special berry pancakes.... We both thought the pancakes were the best we ever had.

I would definitely be back for the pancakes and the Slow Roast brisket Hash.... Definitely.

Not sure why this is so popular. It's a lovely atmosphere across from the park, but food is average. Order of chocolate chip pancakes were soft and overly sweet. The veggie burger was obnoxiously large and too soft ,fell apart in the dish. My son's BLT was good he enjoyed it. Our service person was lovely but overall experience was meh

Today i start my official yelping review journey!

And what a better way to start with one of my favorite chicago places. I come here often when I am in chicago, i enjoy the quality of food here. It is like they never miss, every time it's great service. I usually order the butcher block and a signature berry bliss pancakes or waffles on the side. It may seem pretty old school for some but it just never gets old to me! I love it. I guess starting my nect b

The atmosphere is great, gets pretty load because they are always booked but it's still good. Make sure you try "nowait" app so u can stand in line early on and skip the long waiting time.

Great place, I always recommend this to friends and family.

Hope this help, hopefully I will develop my writing skills soon haha!

Enjoy

It's really good but based on the crazy hype I expected to be blown away but it's just hard when there's so many amazing places in Chicago. Very good but not worth the crazy wait times when there's so many amazing breakfast places in the city. Just spoiled I guess :/

It is very rare that you get a perfect meal and that's what I just finished Los Altos Benedict... it was just right! Loved the service and the ambience. The wait was worth the while. It's a must place for people in Chicago!

The food was delicious and the service was AMAZING from the moment we walked in the door!!!!!!!Haley, our hostess was phenomenal.  The request for a booth was given without hesitation even though there were only 3 of us.  I would definitely recommend.
We love Wildberry! It is fast and a great classic breakfast food restaurant. The portions are large and the quality is good. Sometimes there can be a long wait so make sure to get there early!

Food was amazing. However, we checked in and was told it would be a 20 min wait. We waited almost 40 min and people who came in after us were seated before us. The server forgot to bring out  our pancakes and my daughters drink.

Great food! I get take-away for breakfast from here regularly. I like that they separate everything so the pancakes are not soggy when I get them. The bad: they are a little pricey for pancakes. I think it's because they are millennium park adjacent. You will not be disappointed for the price--but they are still just pancakes.

I have to agree with Joanna N with this one. Wildberry was my least favorite brunch place in Chicago and a total tourist trap. More reviews doesn't necessarily mean good place. After speaking with her, I completely agree that a fast food chain like IHOP made better breakfast food. We ordered a breakfast burrito and blueberry crepes. I have to admit, it was pretty to look at but that's about it. It lacked a lot of flavor and there was nothing memorable about the dish. My friend did enjoy her Chai Latte, but I was okay with the Hazelnut Latte. Do yourself a huge favor and walk another 15 minutes to the Bongo Room near Solider Field. It's amazing and the wait is not as long.

Wild berry never disappoints! My 3rd time here but 1st time being at this location. Really enjoy eating here. The food is always fresh and hot. The service is never a disappointment. Just a heads up, the wait time is pretty long but that is expected since they are a very busy brunch restaurant but that honestly means it's that great!
I don't really like pancakes so I had the breakfast burrito. The food was pretty good.
Outstanding food and service.  The lines are long at times but worth the wait. They turn table very quickly. My favorites are any of the pancakes.
Traveled from Boston to Chicago to see a Blackhawks game. Best breakfast place ever! The wait was worth it because the food was wicked good. 10/10 recommended.
One of my favorite breakfast, brunch, and lunch places in Chicago. I'd call ahead of time to make reservations so you don't get a long line.
I ordered a Garden Skillet (Veggies) and at the bottom it had a few pieces of ham in it. I was also told they use the same gloves for all the skillets because the meat is pre-cooked. Never Again.

Make sure you plan to get here early if you want to avoid a looong wait! 8:30am and a 45 min wait is what we ran into on a Sunday morning. But with Millenium Park right across the street, wandering around there makes the time go by fast. We ordered a couple of skillets and the wild berry pancakes, oreo smores pancakes, cinnamon roll pancakes, and chocolate chip pancakes. They were all super delicious, and not as crazy sweet as you would expect! Awesome combinations of sweet and savory on the  menu, and the specialty pancake upgrade of only a $1.50 is definitely worth it! Overall, amazing splurge breakfast. Would definitely go back when in the city.

I have never left a yelp review before but had to for this place. Holy crap everything is delicious! I have never had eggs Benedict before but decided to try the Los Altos Benedict. Wow!!! Explosion of flavor and extremely delicious! I'm from Arizona so I LOVE the spicey aspect to this dish. We will for sure be revisiting.

There wasn't a single thing on the menu that didn't look tasty. I was very pleased to hear that everyone around me felt the exact same way when their food arrived. I had the Mexican scramble and it was fantastic! My friend had some sort of berry pancakes and she literally compared it to heaven.

What you should know: Put your name on the wait list prior to your arrival, as the line is outside the door and WELL WORTH IT! Once you arrive you should check in with the hostess who will then let you know when your table is ready. The wait list isn't a reservation, it pretty much allows you to skip the walk ins and provides you with a table in the order that the waitlist was received or depending on the size of your party.

I only had to wait 5-10 mins when I arrived. The hostess wasn't very helpful, but the manager stepped right in and made everything clear to me, which is why I'm sharing here since it isn't clear how the wait list works here on YELP.

Anyway, service is amazing and food is even better. The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because of my experience with the hostess and because my food had to be returned since they got my order mixed up. They were extremely prompt in returning my food to me correctly and did it with joy. The manager even followed up and came to my table to apologize and assure me it would be correct!

If you're in Chicago, GO!

My sister and her husband were in town so I chose this place based off of the yelp reviews. We went to Wildberry on a Wednesday morning at 9am and it was packed! The wait for the three of us was only 25 minutes, and after being seated we were promptly served. The bacon was slightly burnt, but the wildberry bliss pancakes were delicious. Will definitely be going back!

Wildberry is a must breakfast spot for when we go to chicago! The food is amazing. There is always a wait but it's right by the famous bean - so just put your name in and go see the bean and they will text you and it goes fast! I look forward to the next time I can go back..
I am not a breakfast person and this place was absolutely delicious! The corn beef hash was an experience that I won't forget. The wait is so worth it and I can't wait to go back!

The omelets here are incredibly fluffy.  I have no idea how they do it because typically the fluff comes with kind of a milk-based residue that really hampers the taste.  But these omelets are fluffy, well cooked, and full of goodness.

The value is great too.  All of the dishes are very large and fully filling.  It can sometimes be hard to get a seat, but if you are a smaller party, you should get in pretty quickly.

The pancakes themselves are good, not amazing - but the toppings are the best!

I went to Wildberry with a friend on a Wednesday morning and man was it packed. Wait was only half and hour, we were pleasantly surprised. They clear and set up tables so fast. Great service as well. I ordered the veggie omelet with a side of hash browns and chocolate chop pancakes. Omelet with sub par with flavor but hash browns were fantastic. Chocolate chip pancakes had interesting batter, I think they use a berry batter here as their signature. It was interesting, but not the best I had. However, for the $15 I paid, the portions were humongous. It's wild to eat that much food for brunch even. It was a good meal, but I don't think the flavors were outstanding. 4 starts for the portions, the service, and the wait.
By far the best skillet my boyfriend and I have ever had. I had the mexicana. I believe that's what it was called

The wait was an hour but it went by quickly. Once we were seated out order was taken quickly. The food was bought out within a reasonable amount of time and the food was delicious.

The glazed blueberry pancakes and the scramble eggs were light and fluffy. The hazelnut coffee was great.

I will definitely return.

My partner and I were visiting Chicago from Baltimore for our second time and decided to venture away from the touristy parks of Chicago and move north into the city. Not before we had something to eat though! We started searching on Yelp the different locations on our way and came across this fantastic restaurant.

My partner always loves breakfast food but I was also in the mood for lunch. That's a great aspect to this restaurant. You can have both. My partner and I walked in around 1pm to a very busy lunch rush but somehow the restaurant was running so efficiently that it appeared everyone was 100% satisfied with everything. We were seated immediately. Our server was amazing. She wasn't around too much but also not too little. She never pestered us.

The meals were amazing! My partner ordered a Banana Crepes with a latte. He told me it was one of the best Crepes he has ever had. He couldn't finish it all while we were there. I ordered a chicken panini (sorry I can't remember exactly what it is called). Another new item I ordered to add to my collection of drinks was from their amazing selection of lemonades. I ordered a cherry lemonade and couldn't have been more impressed. I have added the pictures of the entrees and the lemonade.

I recommend this restaurant to everyone! Plus it's located very conveniently outside the park and in downtown Chicago. Thank you for helping create a very memorable experience in Chicago! :)

Come on Sunday at 1PM, and the wait is an hour long. The two people I came and I decided to make use of the wait (and I was really hungry) and wandered over to Magnolia Bakery to "pass the time" (aka we ordered two cupcakes, a cookie, a banana cream pie, and a banana pudding... I like to think of it as pre-gaming brunch).

When we were finally seated, I was admittedly not very hungry. I ordered a "make your own omelette" and upgraded my pancakes to cinnamon swirl.

The omelette: I added spinach, basil and tomato, and requested egg whites. The dish also came with hash browns. This was good, but not spectacular. Tastes a lot like omelettes I've had elsewhere. 3 stars.

The pancakes: Really good... the pancakes were just normal, but they drizzled it with some cinnamony, frosted goodness, and the flavors were great. I was a little sick of sweets at this point in time (I blame Magnolia) but it was still really good. 4 stars.

Service was attentive, polite, and prompt. 4 stars.

Overall, not sure if it's worth the hour wait, but more than willing to go back!

Wow. Great service great food wonderful coffee. All items were oversized - you need to be very hungry when you go there. As I was.

Breakfast will last you ALL day.

pics.caption: Eggs florentine with ham not bacon

review.des: Can't go wrong with the Berry Bliss!  We also tried the seasonal lemon poppyseed pancakes with berries which was also delicious. Be sure to get on the waitlist. We came on a Monday and still had a 45 minute wait.

The food here was wonderful.  My friend and I split the berry crepes, cinnamon roll pancakes, and a skillet and were delighted with all three.  I also enjoyed the Intelligentsia coffee!  It does get incredibly busy, so I recommend making a reservation in advance if possible.  If there is a wait, though, they'll take your cell phone number and text you when your table is ready.  I appreciated that, because it allowed me to take a walk in the park and get some preemptive coffee during our 2-hour wait (yup).  Also, the prices were quite reasonable, especially for a place downtown.

I love the cinnamon bun French toast & my boyfriend swears by the cinnamon bun pancakes!! Definitely very fast paced, so if you're looking to sit back and relax for a couple of hours over coffee this might not be the spot for you. Always a long wait but the yelp app allows you to put your name in and see where you're at in line so not too bad. Service isn't too personable but I think that's because of the massive volume of people, I love it here!

Mmm. Those wildberry pancakes. That's what I think when this restaurant comes to mind, not the long wait (although mine was short due to the No Wait app). Tip: even if you miss your time, you can come within an hour and they will likely seat you. After an hour, the system boots you out. Now, I ordered the wildberry crepes but hubs ordered the pancakes. The crepes were good, but the pancakes were great!

We also ordered eggs, sausage and Western skillet. The eggs were actually just right and the skillet was good, too. Hubs decided to add sour cream and he said that made the dish pop even more. I did not like how limp and flat the sausage was and the taste wasn't great either. I'm used to crispy and fat sausage patties, but to each his own.

Our waitress was very courteous.

We'll definitely come back and next time I'll order the wildberry pancakes.

This is my first time coming to Chicago and I was on yelp looking for a good breakfast spot and I saw wild berry, I saw that the wait time was 35-50min so I knew it was good. I took a nice stroll through the park and took some pictures of the leaves came back just in time for my reservation, I got the Eggs, turkey sausage, and wild berry bliss pancakes which were amazing, the breakfast really filled me up. I recommend if you come to Chicago stop by wild berry right next to the

It was a good experience all together! We were a party of 3. Collin was exceptional in the greeting process and was very fast and personable! Our Wonderful waitress was Amanda, her precision a great listening skills allowed a flawlessly food to be delivered!
Good food and great service. Had the wildberry waffle. Mascarpone was a bit too sweet for my taste, but everything was fresh, overall very good.
I mean, if there's a wait, I wouldn't bother. It's honestly pretty overrated. Tourists just don't know where else to go for breakfast food.

This place was recommended to us by a Lyft driver on our way to the Cubs vs Sox baseball game last night.  So, we decided to try it out this morning.  Place looked really busy which meant it was a very popular place to eat.  The wait time was about 13 min.  We were seated a few minutes before our two neighbors, but did not get served until well after both had finished their food as you can see in the attached pic.  Our plates were being delivered while theirs were being picked up... a bit disappointed about the long delay.  I did notice the couple seated to our right shook hands with the tall bearded male host as if they were friends.  The couple to our left mentioned they lived near by to the waiter.  Our order was taken first and when it was taken the waiter asked if it was our 1st time here.  I should have said we we lived near by.   We ordered the pancakes thinking they would be amazing.  Neither one of us was impressed.  We had better pancakes for breakfast in bed yesterday at the Warwick Allerton where we stayed.  We also ordered a side of biscuits and gravy... not very tasty either.  The rosemary seasoning on the gravy was too bold.  The orange juice was awesome.  The seats were way too close for comfort and could not keep a private conversation.  Maybe being from California is different.   I dont believe we will recommend this place to our friends.

pics.caption: Story to this photo is in review

review.des:
Everything about this place was excellent.

1. Environment. Inviting and not overly proper while still being very nice. Open concept and bright.

2. Variety. While this is a breakfast/lunch place it has an extensive menu with lots of options. I was really impressed with the selection of meal sized salads. The variety of pancakes is the real showstopper though.

3. Quality. Everything was prepared and presented well. High quality ingredients and everything tasted spectacular.

4. Service. Our server was friendly and prompt. She seemed genuinely kind.

5. Cleanliness. Everything was super clean, including restrooms.

We will return on our next trip for sure. We had to wait around 30 minutes to get in but it was worth it. Sitting outside the plaza was actually kind of nice for an out of towner. Wouldn't want to wait out there in the Winter though! :P
Worth the wait. I've dined here on multiple occasions and this place never disappoints. Try the Banana Pie Crepes - they're great! Portions are quite generous.
One of the best breakfasts in town if you have time to wait. Be prepared for a 30 min wait minimum. Everything I've had is great.

First time visiting Chicago so we had to try this place out because of the reviews. Yes you do have to wait but if you add your name to the list through yelp it will seem shorter! Service is great! Even at the front desk with all the chaos of people trying to add their name and people blocking the entryway. Waiting staff was extremely nice and courteous. No dirty looks when we finished our food telling us to leave. Overall great experience!!!

Best pancakes I've ever had! Get the Signature pancakes. Not a local, but I saw all the reviews on this place and had to try it. People at the tables on both sides of me offered their advice on what to get. Sounds like there's a ton of repeat customers.

Food and service are top notch.
This place is too good for words. Pancakes, bacon enough said....sitting in quiet silence with a full belly.

4.5 stars

Okay I wanted to give this place 3 stars because of all the suburbanites and tourists that pack this place, but the food and price point are too good to do so.

The service is always good here but you will have quite a wait. I went here yesterday (saturday) at noon and our wait was 45 minutes. It may have been a little longer than usual because we requested out door seating.

As usual we shared everything so we could sample more items. We had the Mexicana (pretty much a chorizo omelette) and the specialty caramel apple pecan pancakes. Yum yum yum...the pancakes were fluffy, the caramel wasn't overbearing, and the big slices of sweetly seasoned cinnamon apples were delicious!

I have to mention the service too because our waiter was on top of everything. Bringing us extra plates cause he knew we were sharing, bringing us our straws wrap in a napkin (I have been to too many places were they have there hands all up on the straw...hello I'm trying to AVOID germs here!)  and he kept checking on us to make sure we were doing okay. Sure this isn't the "trendiest" brunch place on the scene but the food and service are too good to pass up.

Never come on the weekend otherwise expect anyway from 1-2 hour wait. And trust, it is well worth the wait.

Always my bfast spot to come when in Chicago. Come during the week day and you'll be seated right away. Service is always on top.

Any of the sizzlin skillets - you can't go wrong. The portions are huge so expect to share because how can you come here and not order pancakes?? The signature berry bliss is my favorite. So perfect with sweetness you don't even need syrup. Cinnamon roll is another must try when here. The only place that makes my hash-browns perfectly. I always ask for it crispy and it comes out just that. Not over burnt or undercooked. It's perfect.
I ordered the red velvet French toast, the portions are huge and the French toast was super sweet. Definitely shareable!
I used to come here all the time when I was stationed in Great Lakes. They have the best pancakes I've ever tasted. It's like fluffy clouds that you pour syrup on.

Great from start to finish. Fresh Orange juice, great coffee, amaaazing cinnamon roll pancakes. My husband also loved his brisket breakfast skillet. Now back to those pancakes... they were so amazing I was afraid I'd inhale the whole thing before remembering to offer my husband a try. Luckily, I had some self-control and could only eat about half. We are only in Chicago for a few days and I'd already like to go back before we leave.

Simply awesome. If you are looking for a special breakfast restaurant in Chicago-this is by far the best.  

There is a long line, so use the Nowait app-that is available on Yelp too.

The brisket skillet was very tasty. Also the Cinnabon pancakes were very special.

Service by Mike and the team was very accommodating.  Enjoy!

Probably the best food we have had on our 5 day trip to Chicago. Prices are great, servings could feed two, and the atmosphere is wonderful. I really enjoyed the modern building and wonderful wait staff.

We got here just after 9 AM on a Saturday and were told that it would be about an hour wait. We weren't that hungry yet, so we decided to wait. They have a coffee bar right at the entrance which is a great idea. I ordered a honey toffee nut latte and walked outside because it was getting too crowded inside. I definitely suggest waiting outside and enjoying your surroundings instead of trying to wait inside.

The honey toffee nut latte was delicious. I was scared it might be too sweet at first, but it was perfect. The coffee and the nice weather made the time go by quickly. Our wait ended up being 50 minutes, so still long, but 10 minutes shorter than what we were told. It was a good start because who likes waiting longer than what the hostess originally estimates?

As soon as we were seated, glasses of water were already waiting for us at our table and our waitress stopped by and apologized for the wait. I ordered the garden skillet with a side of the signature berry bliss pancakes.

Where do I start with the food? Everything was delicious, seriously. The garden skillet was so flavorful. I got my eggs over easy, and they were cooked perfectly. The pancakes were also amazing and fluffy. I'm generally more of a crepe person, but trust me, get the pancakes. Although from my experience, I want to try everything on their menu.

Our experience here was worth the wait. Our waitress was awesome and the food was great. Hey, that rhymes! Just make sure you come here with people you like talking to. You'll have some time to kill.

This is my all time favorite breakfast place EVER!!!!!! I'm not even from or live in Chicago!!

Order:
- Wildberry vanilla latte: DELICIOUS
- Southwestern hash: yummy and filling
- Wildberry crepes: AHHHHMAZING!!! I love the flavor of the filling and how it's nice and light and complements the crepes well. And the fresh berries of course!
- Tiramisu pancakes: tasted yummy, but wouldn't order again

pics.caption: Everything was so delicious! Love it.

review.des:
A great place for brunch!
We shared classic eggs Benedict and butcher block skillet. Both tasted good! The pancakes came with skillet were soft and delicious, not too sweet. Eggs were perfectly cooked, and the hash browns were crunchy and tasty.
The waiters were nice and friendly. And the location was pretty good, right across the street of Millennium Park. The only not-so-good thing about this place was the long wait, we had to wait about 40 mins, but it was well worth it!

Huge portions. Delicious food... I don't even want to think about the calories. It's my second time here, the staff is quick and efficient and your food always comes out quickly. While I cannot remember what I had the first time I was here, the butcher block j had this time around was so good. I do recommend you get that to split with two people, though as I couldn't finish it.

In short, this is a friendly place with delicious food - whether you're there for a quick bite or an extended meal with a big group, this is a reliable place to go.

I have high standards when it comes to places I have breakfast/brunch and thankfully Wildberry meets my standards. Each visit here has been one of pure enjoyment for my taste buds, stomach and wallet. From the omelettes to the pancakes to the skillets...all that I have experienced have been flavorful, filled with fresh ingredients and perfectly cooked. Some of my favorites dishes are listed below. Also, if you work downtown I recommend coming here for a breakfast "team meeting" or for an early lunch; that way you won't have to deal with the crowds and long wait on the weekends.

Favorites Dishes:
- Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes
- Butcher Block Skillet
- Fresca Omelette
- Cinnamon Roll Pancakes
- Oreo S'more Pancakes

pics.caption: Cinnamon Roll pancakes (got these on the side with my omelette - was $1 for the substitution)

review.des: Fabulous place to eat! Great service! Make sure you get on the wait list before arriving!

Top notch breakfast in the downtown area. Plenty of food on the plate. Enthusiastic waitress. I went on a Saturday morning with the st.paddy's day river color change happening. Got there about 30 mins after they opened and the place was already packed! Luckily my wait time was almost none because of the big parties waiting to get in so me and my friend slid past and got a table. Great selection of food, wide variety. Got myself a skillet and pancakes (had to try the pancakes). Tons of food, couldn't even finish my meal. Worth the price of admission and def a great breakfast spot. Nice decor on the outside and perfect location next to the park. Overall great choice for breakfast.

pics.caption: Nice decor for the entrance of Wild Berry

review.des:
Nothing super special, basically a overrated brunch spot like other places. Ate with a group of 6.

Vegetarian burger with fries 3.5: bland. Had to throw so much salt and pepper plus ketchup. It's a huge portion though-- and them fries: awesome crispness! I liked the fires better than the burger but that burger was descent. It came out with the cheese not even melted-- so I'm sure it's been waiting for everyone's order before it was brought to the table.

Biscuit gravy 4: was good. Could've had more pepper though.

Wild berry crepe 2: not worth it. It eggy and chewy. Don't ask how a thin fluffy crepe could be made with such an injustice--but it was. We sent it back without substitution.

Banana creams pancakes 4: it was pretty good. Fresh and filling, toppled with whipped creme, bananas, and a crumble topping. The texture was good-- not mush like most pancakes.

Mexicana 3.5: bland but filling.

Corn beef hash 3: unmemorable.

Must stop by when in Chicago, before heading over to Millennium Park, as it's across the street.

Lucky to have gotten here early on a Sunday morning, because it got so packed shortly after! Since I wanted something new, I opted for what seemed the most exciting to me: red velvet French toast. All I can say is that I have never enjoyed indulging as much as I did, because it felt like I was eating cake for breakfast! Super delish! My friends also got some really yummy looking food. I wish I could go back to Chicago just to have it again!

Awesome spot for coffees and pancakes! Had the caramel pumpkin pie latte, brisket hash and the pumpkin spice pancakes with cinnamon praline butter! It was AWESOME! There was a 2 hour wait but man it was worth every minute!!! Can't wait to come back to this place!
Worth the wait.  One of the best breakfasts I've ever had.  Brisket hash was amazing!

I really liked the food here!! Waiting was nice because they had a text message waiting list. So you could walk around then return when your spot was ready. Food was good. The staff, quick and amazing!!! Best part of the experience!

Excellent service and food
U know it's good food when there is line out the door for breakfast on a Tuesday morning
Large amount of food for the money

Okay, sorry to be one of those Elites who look down their noses at restaurants, but I have to give this place 3 stars. More detail below, so continue to read please.

Let me start with the wait time which I noted in my check-in... colossal 45 minutes for us, this is ONLY a breakfast restaurant, correct? Seating isn't impressive... they've even extended to the outside concreted area with patio furniture. It made me laugh to see guests being eyed wearily by eager standby's who were also trying to swallow the huge wait time.

Servers were kicking some butt, though. Once I was FINALLY seated, I was immedately welcomed with a nice glass of ice water, thanks very much. My waitress was on her way shortly and handed me a "specials" menu, didn't have anything too appetizing. I wanted to try one of the specialties - a Denver skilllet, which dear old Yelp coundn't stop raving about.

The Denver skillet was tasty: 2 medium-done eggs topped on a bed of hashbrowns with onions and peppers and peppper jack (?) cheese melting on top. The waitress brought by ketchup, whipped creme and syrup in little bowls beforehand. My wait for food was a bit too much... I am assuming they do indeed plate everything freshly from their kitchen, but who knows. The dish included either toast or pancakes, and was about 11$ after taxes. A decent price for a large meal which was, overall, very filling and sastisfying.

Overall, I'd give them 3.5 stars if possible because I really enjoyed the Denver. It was a lot of food BUT the restaurant interior was crammed and overwhelming so thus, the 3 stars.

Location: 7/10 close to Michigan Av, not directly off it, but accross from Millenium Park.
Interior: 4/10 crammed.
Exterior: 5/10 not mch better, awkward to be waiting right by people eating, they need to seperate the areas somehow.
Food: 9/10 yummy!
Cleanliness: 9/10
Staff: 10/10
Pricing: 8/10
Speed of Service: 1/10
Overall Experience: 7/10

*A note for those in a hurry - I noticed a little to-go bar near the front counter, possibly an alternative to the wait.*

Perfect place for breakfast and pancake ( if you don't mind waiting for 30-40 mins for a table) !! Tried their signature wild berry pancake and mint mocha. Omg I love it!!!! Service is fine and prompt. And the price is reasonable.

Stop by for a breakfast but only if you have enough of time :) will come back again when I visit Chicago next time.

pics.caption: Busy restaurant on a weekday morning
Signature wild berry pancakes and mint mocha

review.des: This was probably one of the best breakfast experiences we have had (and those are strong words for our picky selves). We started with the vanilla berry latte...smooth and flavorful! We then had an omelette and skillet. The eggs were fresh from the farm taste and everything was delicious! Steven Lloyd was our waiter and told us confidently that we needed to try the berry bliss crepes. I was leery at first but that had to be the best crepe experience yet. I even had to let him know he was right! I highly recommend coming here and be sure to ask for Steven Lloyds section..he is sure to make you laugh and direct you to some great food choices. We will be back tomorrow before we leave town! To the owner: please open one in LA...it would be successful in the right location!
Wednesday 8am meant no wait and thus no need for the Nowait app. Service was quick, and the berry bliss pancakes were excellent.

This place was so good we came back the next day to eat again!

Highlights: oatmeal, skillets, and their preserves

Very big portions! Definitely will return when we come back to town.

Absolutely amazing! This is the one place that made me break my rule of not visiting the same place twice when visiting a foreign city. Super busy but very efficiently run place. Quick service once seated.
And now about the pancakes! Yumm! My favourite was the glazed walnut fig multigrain  one. Just so so good! I tried there signature berry bliss pancake while my friend tried the similar waffles the next day! Really good but the portions were huge for me!
Their omelettes are so good too just the right amount fluffy.
The price is so cheap for the amount and quality! I don't know if it's an American thing but the portions are really huge I always had to take out after the meal. And now I can't stop thinking about the pancakes! Wish we had something similar in Canada!

Excellent place for breakfast and using the app to wait in line was amazing. Waited 10-15 minutes at location when total wait time was 60-90 minutes. Will definitely eat there again and definitely use this app to get on wait list!
Super yummy, pancakes with all kinds of flavors. Big servings. highly recommend if you are a pancake person.

Totally not worth the wait. Mediocre food and pancakes. Not bad food but it's basically like eating at IHOP. Just know that before you wait an hour or more. Best part of the meal was the bacon - thick cut and crispy.

The wait can be a bit long but there is an app that tells you how many people are in front of you and the front desk assistants will text you to let you know when your table is almost ready.

For food wise - the red velvet French toast is amazing and a must try! There is a lot of variety on the menu and everything looks pretty good.

I'm not from Chicago, but while visiting a friend of mine told me I had to stop here and I'm glad I did! There's a long two hour wait, but it is worth the wait! Good thing is you can walk around the lake, millennium park and go shopping while you wait and they will text you when your table is ready. I am huge on breakfast spots and I must say the food was amazing. I recommend the cinnamon roll pancakes and español omelette! They are a must try! They also have the best freshly squeezed orange juice too! I will definitely tell my friends about this joint!

Amazing breakfast. The best pancakes I have had till now. Go early n on a weekday to avoid crazy lines. We went on a Sunday n it was 2.5 hrs wait. So we went there on a Monday n were seated right away. Must try when in Chicago.

I'm beginning to think I must be too picky. Why are these places filled with people who consider them to be outstanding when all I can muster is a "Meh"? I've been a couple of times and both times were rather forgettable. Well, aside from the man next to me who SWORE he could see onions in his omelette and demanded his be made again... only to yell about onions again with the second omelette. Turned out it was cheese. Bahaha! I'm afraid his idiocy was still lost on him, but I digress.

Pancakes.... To state my case as nicely as possible, while trying to refrain from even an ounce of snark, I will say this: If you are a big city, popular, breakfast spot with "Pancake" in your name, you'd better have great pancakes. --You cannot rest on your toppings alone. They say that they are "buttermilk" pancakes, but if they are, they are assuredly from a mix OR their buttermilk is actually powdered buttermilk. They are missing that airy spongy flavorful goodness that real buttermilk pancakes have. --The very kind that come out of my kitchen. Wildberry can top them with every delicious concoction known to man, but they can't disguise what's on the bottom. --a not so perfect pancake. I want a pancake that is so delicious, you don't need to saturate it with sugars or cover it in whipping cream. It should stand on its own. These are not those.

While the pancakes are disappointing to me, their omelettes here have always been perfect. Light and fluffy without any signs of being overcooked --such as browning or a rubbery texture. And likewise, the service has always been good. --My waitress even kept her cool and remained polite when the man seated next to me had a coronary over his perceived "onions". I felt so bad for her, I tipped her extra well.... because who wants to start their day with such a buffoon??

I don't flat out dislike Wildberry; I just don't get overly excited about it. If you don't care as much about pancake quality or you're satisfied with Denny's, you might really love this place. I mean, the toppings are good. If that's the case, come early or even better, come early on a cold rainy morning. If you don't, be prepared to wait a loooong time.

Yelp, You definitely did not let me down with this one. After lurking through a lot of places in Chicago on Yelp for Breakfast I had decided that this is where my boyfriend and I would go for our last day in Chicago. We went around 9:00 on a Monday morning and I was worried we were going to have to wait like all the reviews stated. We actually didn't wait at all even though they were still decently busy, a lot of people sitting outside, and it was pretty packed inside.

Our server was extremely nice and friendly. Helpful and didn't rush us at all.
I ordered a vanilla and caramel latte from Intelligentsia Coffee bar and my boyfriend ordered the fresh squeezed orange juice.  Both my latte and his orange juice were really delicious. I still can't get over looking around the room and seeing two women sitting at a table with their Starbucks cups. Why are you drinking nasty burnt tasting coffee when you could be enjoying the amazing coffee here? Crazy.

Food wise, I ordered the "Signature Berry Bliss" Pancakes with a side of hashbrowns, and they were to die for. The pancakes were easily the best pancakes I've ever had in my life. No need for syrup because they are covered in Vanilla Anglaise, Blackberry Coulis, Berry Mascarpone and has a side of berries. It also has blueberries cooked into the batter. The hash browns were also really good. I'm glad our server asked me if I wanted them extra crispy, because I did. I also feel like everyone should just automatically cook hash browns extra crispy. It's the only way to go.

My boyfriend ordered the "Denver Skillet." The "Denver Skillet" has Hash Browns, Cheddar & Jack Cheese, 2 Eggs, Ham, Bell Peppers & Onions. He loved it. I took a bite without Ham (I don't like ham. ew.) and it was really tasty.

I think the prices are more than fair. You get really large food portions, and we walked out of there feeling like you could have or should have rolled us out in a wheelbarrow. That's how full we felt.

The only complaint I have about this place is that the seating is really crowded. Once you're sitting at the table you can't really get up. The tables are so close together that the guy who was sitting behind me kept running his chair against mine every time he moved. I also had to wait for them to leave and another table around us so I could get up and go to the bathroom. I felt kind of trapped. haha.

This place is in a really great location as well. It's right across the street from Millennium Park.

I always give my Mother crap for not trying new places every time she goes to a city, but I think I'm going to have to break my own rule and go back here again next time I come to Chicago.

pics.caption: Side Brought Out Without Us Even Asking.

review.des:
I've been here twice and I absolutely love this place.  If you're in Chicago and are willing to wait up to an hour for an all-star brunch, Wildberry is the place to go.  Both times I was here they cited me expected wait times of roughly 1 hour 15 minutes but on both occasions the actual wait was under 50 (this was at around 10am).  I strongly advise showing up early because after 11am I've heard that the wait can be as long as 2 hours.

Food:  
My first visit I had a cheese omelette with a side of their "Signature Berry Bliss" pancakes.  The omelette was the best I've had in Chicago; it was filled with delicious, melt-in-your-mouth cheese and the omelette itself was nice and fluffy.  The berry bliss pancakes were spectacular as well; they were very light and fluffy and the berry sauce and berries added a delicious combination of sweet and tart.  I also had the pineapple-mango smoothie which had mind-blowingly good consistency and flavor.  If you're debating over which drink to order, I highly recommend you give it a try.  The second time I went I had the Florence benedict which was also delicious.  My friends ordered skillets and they all loved them as well.

Service:
I was pleased with the service here.  During the second visit, the food took a while to arrive (about 30 mins) but the waitress checked in to inform us of the status of our food during the wait.

Price:
I usually mention pricing as a passing comment, but Wildberry is probably the most criminally underpriced food I've had in Chicago.  The omelette and hash during my first visit were monstrous in size. I generally have no problem eating large amounts of food when I'm hungry but these with the side of pancakes were just too much for me.  The food is extremely delicious and filling and costs just over $10 - an absolute steal!!  This was honestly one of the few times in my life I wanted to overpay the price of the food because I felt guilty getting so much good food for so little :O

Wildberry is a must-try if you're in the Loop looking for a quality brunch with family/friends.  I've thoroughly enjoyed everything I've ordered here and consider this to be my second favorite food establishment out of the more than 130 I've visited in Chicago.

Best breakfast I have ever had! You must try the pancakes and crepes. The berry bliss pancakes were amazing. I also had the butcher's skillet. Very generous portions and a whole lot of good food! We arrived at 10:00am on a Saturday and there was a 2 hour + wait. We made a reservation an hour in advance through yelp and were seated in two minutes upon arrival. I highly recommend doing that if you plan to visit on a weekend. My boyfriend had the eggs benedict and loved it. The ham was so thick and right off the bone. Definitely a breakfast place that you must visit while in Chicago!
Great food, huge portions and awesome service!  Best pancakes I have ever eaten.  Do not let the long wait scare you, it is so worth it.  New fans from Michigan!!!!

There's always a long wait!! Go early to put down your name at least 1 hour in advance.  I ordered the classic eggs Benedict and my boyfriend order the berry waffles! They're both deliciously satisfying. Throw in an extra side of Apple Smokedwood bacon and you're in heaven! If this is your first time, go for the pancakes!! It's a must and it's what they're known for. If you're going with a friend or two, on have everyone order something different so you can try everything!

Beautiful place,  Great food, and friendly staff. What else should a place have? I had a great experience in this Cafe. We stopped by on Saturday and it had a two-hour line to get in and we went somewhere else, but on Monday we escape the line using "Nowait" app and it worked great and the great food made our day.

Waited about 35 minutes. They placed us outside but at the table without an umbrella, on a gorgeous sunny Chitown day. It was a bit of an inconvenience, with the bees flying around the syrup on the table & lightweight baking in the sun. Some breeze came, but by then we had decided we couldn't enjoy the meal without the bees interrupting it. The waiter was cordial & understanding, & we were placed inside, no worries. Ordered the fresh berry & s'mores Oreo pancakes... UM YUM! Worth the wait. Also enjoyed the veggie garden skillet which was delicious... But I was surprisingly happy with my order: corn beef hash. Cooked to perfection! It was crispy & soft at the same time (underneath) complimenting it with just the right ratio of hash browns. scrambled eggs were OK, but the whole meal in genera was yummy. I understand why they're 4.5/5. Would recommend to anyone around the bean!

If you have the time to wait for a table; this is an amazing place.  Mine had the biscuits and gravy (made with a hint of Rosemary)... he thought it was great.  I had the cinnamon raisin French toast... amazing.  The portions are huge... so be prepared to be full.  Would definitely go back.

pics.caption: Their special... cinnamon raisin French toast... yummy

review.des: This place is always busy, on the second day of our trip to Chicago we finally got to try out their menu after a hour wait. I ordered the southwest skill it and my wife ordered the French Toast berry bliss. We were beyond happy with quality and freshness of our choices. I'm positive that We will be returning to wildberrys  on our next trip to Chicago!

On Sunday you better be there by 7:30 or you'll be waiting. The banana cream pancakes were fantastic and the drip coffee was really good.

The scrambled offs on the side were the small crumbly type so pass on those.

Every time we go to Chicago, we make sure to hit this place for breakfast!  Such a great place to enjoy breakfast/brunch, they have a wonderful menu full of delicious food.  Make sure to get their early, or check in online, the wait can get mighty long on the weekends, but it's worth it, this place is awesome!

Ah, if I lived in Chicago I would be this place's number one customer. I would try everything on the menu and they would know my coffee order by heart. Alas, San Diego is not in Illinois, so it's looking like tough luck.

Their menu items are so basic (pancakes, omelets, scrambles, etc.), but they all have such a unique and delicious twist which is what makes this place so perfect. AND they have intelligentsia coffee on the premises, which is fantastic. The restaurant has a cozy, friendly ambiance, the service is great (very busy but our food still came out very quickly), and it's in a good location--just down the street from the bean.

Grab some friends and check it out!
The wait was long but well worth it. I'm not a pancake fan but couldn't resist trying the Berry Bliss Pancakes which I nearly ate them all. Waitress Kimberly was pretty awesome too!

Definitely worth the wait, though I highly recommend joining the waitlist via Yelp early in the morning to get in at a reasonable time. Pancakes were light, fluffy, creative, and filling. The menu is expansive and varied if pancakes aren't your thing.

Nice breakfast/brunch place in an area that is a breakfast place desert.  I have been here a few times. It is always crazy, busy especially when the weather is nice and you can sit outside.  The ingredients are fresh, everything I have ever tried has been excellent and the staff have always been very friendly and professional.  If you are in the area, I would give it a try but be prepared to wait for a table.

This place doesn't need my review because everyone else's is spot on. DELICIOUS. I got the Richmond (?) omelet - goat cheese, spinach, carmalized onions & bacon. Perfect balance of flavors. I substituted toast/pancakes with the Signature Berry Bliss pancake- seriously, try this thing. I came on a Monday morning around 9am, no wait. Prompt service. Highly recommend!

Not gonna lie, when I had their crepe, I teared up a little bit. There's a reason why this restaurant has amazing reviews. Mind blowing food, great service! The only downside is the wait, but hey, that's expected from this place. I will definitely come back whenever I'm in Chicago again

This breakfast place gets a solid 4 stars. This dining establishment is massive, with lots of employees, allowing customers to eat, pay, and leave at a quick pace.  There was no wait despite almost all the tables being occupied.  

Our server was friendly and gave us plenty of time to look over the vast menu.  After a careful amount of consideration, we  decided to share the Two Eggs Any Style and the Red Velvet French Toast.  The two eggs come with hash browns and choice of meat, served with either toast or pancakes ($1 extra for specialty pancakes).  We decided on sausage and upgraded the pancakes to the Signature Berry Bliss.  

The french toast came out first, and the eggs, shortly after.  The french toast was absolutely amazing.  The plating was on point, and understand the french toast is not your traditional french toast.  It tastes more like a cake and resembles a lemon cake roll.  I would describe the texture as light and airy, and definitely fluffy.  It was moist, and the frosting was decadent.  

The eggs were nothing special.  It lacked seasoning.  The hash browns were extra crispy and delicious.  The sausage was good.  The specialty pancakes scream diabetes.  I was quite disappointed.  The plating was out of control for this one.  The person who does the sauce needs to calm down.  The entire dish was overly sweet, and an eye sore to look at.  I do not understand how anyone could possibly add syrup in addition to all that is going on.  I would not recommend this one.  

All in all, I would visit again.  If I were to come back in 5 years, I would order plain pancakes to compensate for all the sugar I consumed 5 years ago.

What to get: Belgian waffles. period. This place is popular for lunch also, but honestly, I'd just stick to the breakfast/brunch.

When to come here: ummm... like an hour before you actually plan on eating.

Come back? Yep!

Oh my g. BEST BREAKFAST IVE EVER HAD. I ordered the build your own omelet which comes with a side of pancakes of your choice and hashbrowns. UNREAL. So good.

With my perfectly cooked omelet I ordered the wild berry pancakes. They were so tasty!!

Jeremy was my server. He was very knowledgable about the menu and suggested a lot of fun things to me. He was so great and fun! I stopped in here by myself so he did a great job of making me feel welcomed and got me my food very quickly!

Overall so impressed with this place and every time I'm in Chicago I will be back!!

Definitely use the no wait app to sign up for the waiting list before coming here! Upon arrival you usually need to wait no more than 15 minutes before they seat you. Even though they are always busy, every single time I've been here the service was great. Food is definition amazing, I've tried everything from the eggs benedicts to skillets to pancakes, and I have not been disappointed. The price is very reasonable for the portion you get too! Definitely a must-visit if you're in Chicago!

The best pancakes of Chicago!

Avoid weekend or prepare to wait a long time, even when going early... But during the week, it's really easy to get a table.

You really have to try the signature Berry Bliss pancakes, there are amazing! Omelette are great too with pancakes served on the side, more than enough to share!

Chocolate pancakes are good too, but one of my favorite is the cinnamon roll pancakes!

This was an awesome recommendation! We checked in on Yelp and arrived with 20 parties still ahead of us. This number quickly diminished within minutes and we were seated. The staff was friendly and accommodating. Our server, Mike, was knowledgeable and helpful. I had eggs with ham and cheese and cinnamon roll pancakes. Delicious!

I'm still in the middle of eating my breakfast. Omelet is amazing! They are very generous with their food! The omelet is huge and very filling, the signature berry bliss is good but I agree with some other reviewers that it's a bit too sweet for me, but I don't eat too sweet anyway.  Please come here early. I'm here on Tuesday morning at 710am and there are a lot of people in here already so I can imagine how it's going to be like later the day.

pics.caption: Egg white veggie omelet and signature berry bliss

review.des:
Wow, the Wildberry Cafe is absolutely amazing!

My dad and I came on Saturday, May 21, 2016, around 7:30 AM. If you're going to eat here on the weekend, I definitely recommend coming early. By 8:00 AM, all the tables were filled and some people were waiting.

We ordered homemade orange juice and grapefruit juice! For my breakfast, I ordered the Denver skillet with a side of Cinnamon Roll Pancakes. My dad ordered a BLT with hashbrowns.

Our food came out quickly and was SO GOOD! The Denver skillet was simple but really delicious. Although there was A LOT of cheese on it. Like, a whole layer of it. If you don't like lots of cheese, ask the server to keep the cheese light or just take it off. Next time, I'll do that. My pancakes were the best part! They were so flavorful and YOU SHOULD GET THEM!! My dad says his BLT was really good. It was so big, he only ate 1/2 of it.

Our server Robert was okay, he was nice but didn't come back to refill our drinks when we were low :/

Place is very clean, and I love the decor!!

Overall, this place was great and I will definitely come back!!

Wildberry is just a solid go to for breakfast, nothing more nothing less. It's not life changing but it's consistent af with a lot of options. I always go with the Mexicana skillet with turkey sausage and add strawberry or berry bliss pancakes. I still can't honor the crazy line outside but if you can catch it on a weekday with little wait, you're in for a solid choice. If there was a Yolk nearby it would be a coin flip for me, both are solid.

researched for places to go to for breakfast..liked the pics n what i read about them...i was able to find the place easily..there was a crowd of people waiting outside...a good sign of good food! it was going to be about a 45 min wait but i came all this way..i'm waiting..but when i checked in on yelp it said to download the no wait app n u can get in faster...i did n i got in, in 10 min! yay! got a great seat..server came right away despite it being so busy because the place was packed..i ordered the signature berry bliss pancakes...omg so yummy! fluffy n tender...vanilla anglause, blackberry coulis, berry marscapone n fresh berries alk just right together! large u.f.o. sized pancakes.. i couldnt finish them! awesome food n service i definitely will be back!

pics.caption: crowd of people waiting to get in

review.des: Ok don't kill me but I wasn't impressed with the food -_-. The service was bomb. Food was regular nothing out of the world. I didn't really like my eggs- maybe because they were really cooked and I should have specified I wanted them soft. Four stars for excellent service and unfortunately the wait was long- but I expected that since it has so many reviews!

Great pancakes and probably the only time I've really enjoyed them with fillings. I had their very popular berry bliss pancakes with the cream/jam syrup on top, and what made the difference was that it was not overly sweet. The blueberries weren't drenched in syrup, and they didn't go heavy on the jam syrup either. The pancake base itself was fluffy and well-made. The scrambled eggs I got on the side were also delicious and buttery.

If you're not picky about whether or not you want to eat in or dine out, I highly recommend doing takeout on the weekends. Seems to be a super popular place, and I saved a lot of time doing takeout. Not sure if I would have waited an hour for the food.

Okay, I hate to be a downer because the food definitely was very good, but the service....almost non existent.  We never got refills on coffee or water, and it took forever to get our check back after we gave them our credit card.

I also liked the feature to be added to the wait list, that made a BIG difference as we were able to walk right in and sit down, when others were being quoted 45 mins to an hour wait!

We waited for 1.5 hours on Sunday.  I suggest download the app Nowait. That way, you can go around while waiting for your table. The pancake is fluffy, must try. The Florence Benedict is good, the poached eggs were not running as expected.

So many delicious looking options, so little stomach space. I wound up going for the los altos Benedict and it was delicious. Usually when I order anything with chorizo, it's hard to find. That was not the case at wildberry. Chorizo overflowing (sorry no pics, I ate it all too quickly)

My friend got the signature berry bliss pancakes so I had to taste test and it was perfectly sweet without going overboard. The mascarpone cream was decadent. And fresh fruit was a great touch. The pancake was so fluffy I wanted to die.

Definitely needed to walk that meal off, food coma for the rest of the day
Grabbed a business breakfast here.  Nothing to write home about.  I would put this as slightly better than a Village Inn, or some chain breakfast greasy spoon like that.
By far my favorite breakfast spot in Chicago so far! The cinnamon roll French toast is perfection and so is their corned beef hash! Must try!!

The wait for this place is ridiculous. We came by on a Monday morning at 10 am and the wait for three people was am hour. But trust me the wait is worth it. I would just put down your name and walk the park nearby until the thing they give you starts buzzing.

This is one of the few restaurants where all their dishes are amazing so don't worry about ordering the wrong dish because I feel like that is impossible here.

Duck confete:
Chopped up duck perfectly grilled and so tender. Comes with hash Browns and pancakes. I upgraded my pancakes to the specialty wild berry pancakes which are super delicious as well.

Omelette :
I forgot the name of the specific omelette but it started with an e...let me tell you that this will omelette is huge. It's the size of a football. It was so good though but they could have put some more chorizo. My friend got hers with fruit and upgraded her pancakes to the cinnamon apple ones which I wasn't too crazy about.

Skillet:
We got the first skillet on the menu. I forgot the name again but it was super good. The cheese melted perfectly on it and it came with pancakes that we upgraded to the cinnamon roll one which in my opinion was my favorite pancake.
