Each of the dishes are about $10-13 and upgrading your pancakes to a specialty one is an additional $1.50

Overall I think everyone should try this place while visiting Chicago. I wish I lived in the area so I could try more of their dishes!

As good as the original in Schaumburg! I'm glad they opened one up in a more touristy, convenient area, but that means longer lines and longer waits. This location is also smaller in comparison.

Portions are big, pancakes are delicious, service is wonderful. That's all I have to say.

The seating process is absolutely a cluster!!  The wait is certainly some sort of ploy. The attendant handling the seating is rude and asked me to stand in a certain place then lied about me standing where I wasn't. I asked to see a manager who never came to our table. They screwed around so long I was Not to interested in giving them my business. However after we were yelled at, we were seated just in time to get a plain pancake. It was ok. Only plan to go here if you have half a day!!!  Not sure what all the fuss is about.  The girl doing the check ins was the only polite person we encountered.

Delicious food! Very willing to substitute, which is especially useful for me as a vegetarian. They were cool about switching in avocado. The mocha is well priced and twice the size of a normal mocha at other coffee shops. You can also substitute your side for a sweet French toast or a pancake. The line is long but they have a good system of texting you when your spot is available and the line moves quickly. They close at 2:30 pm on Sunday but seat up until 2:30 pm. Staff is amazing - very nice and helpful.

pics.caption: Los altos Benedict with avocado substitute

review.des:
Huge let down!!!
Read reviews, saw a lot of people waiting... but after an HOUR AND FIFTEEN min wait... food was average, omelette just basic and needed salt/pepper... pancakes looked good (not worth $13), but were mushy and gummy... yuk!
Won't return...

Had a breakfast twice as nice and half the price at Gail's Carriage Inn the next day!
SO MUCH BETTER!!!

Won't dock any stars for being crazy busy, wait was about an hour and a half, bc I quickly figured out why...food is amazing.  Great location for walking and sightseeing after a great meal. Service was very attentive and really hustling.

Went here on a tues around 9am and had minimal wait though line grew quickly.  Food was amazing - kids smores pancakes (best ever per 8 year old), cinnamon roll pancakes (I thought delish though 6 year old said too much cinnamon), Mexicana skillet and caramel apple French toast (husband licking plates of both).  Jeremy was our server and he was fantastic.  Highly recommend!

We love this place. The lines are long but with the nowait app, it has never been a problem. Everything we have tried is good. We have tried a few of the skillets and almost all the omelets. The kids always sub the pancakes for specialty pancakes (all of those good as well).

Voted as having the best pancakes in all of Chicago, I knew Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe had to be first on my list of brunch options.

----The Food----
Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes ($10.95)- This is one of those dishes that look and sound better than it actually tasted.  Consisting of 3 average sized, fluffy pancakes, it's topped with blackberry coulis, berry mascarpone, vanilla anglaise, powdered sugar, and fresh berries.  The visual appeal is enough to give you that wow factor, but unfortunately the taste wavered from being too sweet or too sour.  By no means was it horrible, it just lacked a comforting, culinary medium that I seek in pancakes.

Classic Eggs Benedict ($10.45)- I'm a sucker for this dish anywhere, anytime.  Here at WIldberry, they did a terrific job with it.  It comes with poached egg, ham off the bone, toasted egg muffin, and homemade hollandaise sauce.  I love the width and flavor of the ham and the hollandaise sauce has a sweet taste with a pleasant, thick consistency.

Butcher Block Sizzlin' Skillet ($10.75)- A fitting name for all the dreamy components that is contained in this dish! It's a meat lover's dream. It comes with 2 scrambled eggs, ham, sausage, turkey sausage, chicken sausage, bacon, cheddar jack cheese, and hash browns!  As delectably wonderful as this dish sounds, I felt it lacked a punch of salt as the hash browns and eggs were a little bland.  Maybe, Wildberry was depending on the cured meats to compensate, but if that's the case, it didn't fulfill the job well.

Corned Beef Hash ($4.25)- Love the texture as it wasn't mushy like most places, but could use more seasoning/salt.
----
Conclusion: Based on the high reviews, I guess it's fair to say my time at Wildberry fell short of expectations, but I still enjoyed it...even with the one hour wait-time! Wild berry's extensive and creative brunch menu is deserving of praise and a visit when you're in town.  A convenient spot since it's next to Millennium Park where you can check out Cloud Gate while you wait for your table.  

Extra Notes:
-Accepts credit card
-Wait times can be a pain--ranging from 30min-1.5 hours. Come early!
-Decor is modernly elegant and atmosphere is bright and inviting
-Service is friendly, but could be more attentive
-Restrooms are clean
I tried their tiramisu pancake. Delicious. Breakfast is big portion and good quality.

Went here on a visit to Chicago. Grateful that I read reviews on Yelp and used the waitlist option.  When we arrived it was a 2.5 hour wait at 10a on Sunday. We waited only 10 mins thank goodness. Food was great.  Expected omelette to be better.  Was kind of like whipped eggs which had a weird texture to it.  But overall great and wonderful of you have any gluten allergies.  I had the GF waffle and GF toast! Awesome!
Amazing food and service use the yelp app to reserve a place in line WORKS AMAZING. They text you 5 min prior to be seated and you don't have to wait in the waiting area !!

Just came back from my trip to Chicago and I'm still dreaming about my signature berry pancakes from wildberry!! We came here based on a recommendation from a friend and the fact that we stayed at the Hyatt Recency right around the corner.

We came on a Thursday morning thinking that it wouldn't be packed.. Boy, we were wrong! Ended up having to wait 30 mins for 2 people. That still wasn't a bad wait time considering that there were so many big parties waiting for tables.

The menu is really great for a brunch place. Omelets, skillets, waffles, pancakes, and even crepes. The boy ordered the butcher block skillet which had literally all kinds of sausages, bacon, ham, etc. It had an egg on top and it was all on a bed of hash browns. I tried some of his skillet and it was soooooo good! I ordered the napa fig omelet and it was DELICIOUS!! It had fig, bacon, and cheese. I think Gouda? Whatever it was, the combination of everything was so good. I honestly hate fig newtons but I like to order quirky menu items so I took a chance. Glad I did!! I also ordered the signature berry pancakes for a dollar extra. The pancakes were SOOOO GOOD! Holy crap, still dreaming about the pancakes. They also have them in waffle and crepe version.

The service was great. I didn't have any problems. For a place being so packed, they have their service on point!

Makes me wish I lived in Chicago to have the pancakes on the weekly. Noms.

pics.caption: Signature berry pancakes. SO FREAKING GOOD!

review.des:
This place is supposed to be the end all and be all but I really felt oversold.

Don't get me wrong,.. the "berry bliss anything" (we had Belgian waffles) was amazing... but not  really THAT different.  The staff was just "ok" typical waiter.

My visit was tainted by a negative experience that the staff or owners could not help,.. I badly needed to use the bathroom before arriving.  Someone was throwing up in the only stall for over 30 minutes (I don't think from the food) so I ate a big meal with existing discomfort. Get a second toilet in the mean's washroom, please!  Also, train your staff to kow where plan B might be without sending someone blocks away!

With that out of the way, the food was good but the hasbrowns were not crispy or crunchy,.. a pet peeve of mine.  I think you best bet is the better topped sweet stuff and you can find the rest elsewhere.

-It's my second morning here to try the enticing wild berry crepes I saw someone get yesterday.

-Welcoming, friendly service and the brisket on hash browns topped with sausage gravy and eggs was excellent. Additionally, the Intelligencia coffee is fresh and unburnt despite being served about 8000°F.

-Worth noting, quite a few tables were already filled when they opened at 6:30 am Saturday - today it's not even 7:30 and more than half the place is filled. Yesterday late morning a line was down the street so it could be safe to say if you're not an early riser, you'll be waiting a while.

Biggest advice for this very popular brunch spot--get on waitlist on Yelp prior to getting here physicially. 85 min wait when I put my name down, when we got here, we waited 5 min to get seated, meanwhile huge crowd outside with 2+ hour wait.

Jeremy was our waiter, made great recommendations, quick efficient friendly service.

Had the espanola omlette, arrived so quick, fluffy light and yet moist soft insides, so so good. Husband had strawberry lemon poppyseed pancakes, also fluffy sweet zesty. His coconut lime smoothie was out of this world.

I Went to Wildberry's on my last day in Chicago (08-30-15) with my bachelorette crew. When we checked in they told us it was going to be about an hour and a half wait. No problem, because we knew it was going to be busy on a sunday morning. When the buzzer buzzed it was only 45 minutes in. and I would have waited longer because we thoroughly enjoyed our time there.

I had the Butcher's Block Skillet. It... was... the... bomb!! so much meat and my favorite hashbrowns on the bottom. a lot of variety and flavor and very filling. if that wasn't enough I upgraded to get a specialty pancake and got the cranberry pecan pancake. it was absolutely Delicious! I was sad because I did not have enough room in my stomach to finish all of my food.
People of my party also ordered the Signature berry bliss, banana cream pie, and the tiramisu pancakes. I tried ALL of them and they were delicious! My favorite was the berry bliss pancakes.

Also must try the Wilberry Orange Juice! It was so yummy~

On top of all the great food our service from our waitress was perfect. she was nice, energetic, knowledgeable about the menu, gave us excellent recs, and great followup.
One of the best breakfast places I have ever been to! Granted, I am comparing it to places like IHOP, but still-absolutely amazing

This place was slammed even early on a Saturday morning.  Despite the craziness, our server, Jennifer, was outstanding - so friendly, helpful and speedy.  The miniscule upcharge of $1 for a specialty pancake is just insane.  I'm not a pancake person normally, but the cinnamon roll pancake and berry bliss pancakes could convert me.

My Rutherford omelet (baby spinach, bacon, caramelized onions and goat cheese) was tasty, and the hash browns came out well done, just as I'd ordered.  My husband got the corned beef has skillet, which he really enjoyed.  But again, the stars of the meal were the pancakes - oh, those pancakes!

pics.caption: Cinammon Roll and Berry Bliss pancakes

review.des:
Found a place opened for Brunch right after the red eye! It was delicious!!!

I got the Veggie Skillet and it was buttery goodness! It came with 2 pieces of pancakes on the side. I must say the buttermilk pancakes may have turned me a fan of pancakes. I wasn't able to finish this but wish I could've! Portions are wonderful! Prices are right. $10-$15 for a skillet with 2 pancakes on the side.

My friends also ordered various skillets - corn beef hash and Mexican and were both pleased. We tried some of their special pancakes - cinnamon flavor and it tasted like a Cinna-bun.

This was definitely a great beginning to my trip. Wish I could eat here right now!

Get there early because the wait can be treacherous. Food does not taste the same when taken to go. Always better when eaten fresh!

Delicious food, wait wasn't too long, they told us 30-45 min and we were seated by 25 minutes..place was packed..beef brisket was delicious ...veggie skillet was really good...daughter loves the cinnamon roll pancakes...prices are reasonable

We wanted a good brunch near Millennium Park, and we hit the mother lode!  I got an omelet with carmelized onion, spinach, bacon and goat cheese. it was perfectly fluffy and had the most incredible flavor combination. my husband and son went splitsies on a skillet and the chorizo Eggs Benedict. our meals came with pancakes, which were sweet and fluffy. we all agreed it was the best breakfast any of us had had in a while.  the service was top-notch. the price was about $40 for three adults to eat well and take food home.

DEFINITELY use the NoWait app. Be sure to be within 5 minutes walk of the place by the time there are only 30ish people in line in front of you on the app. that time went quickly for us, and a few others we spoke to. you may wait another 5-10 minutes for your actual table after you arrive and check in, but we skipped a 120-180 minute wait using the app, so we had no complaints. we are already planning to brunch here with the whole family on our next trip in!

I finally had enough patience to wait an hour and a half but it was worth it. The food was awesome, our server was great and I like the overall setup of the cafe. I will definitely come again. I would just tell anyone interested, expect to wait at least an hour in a Sunday, or utilize the "get in line" feature on Yelp.

Best pancakes I've ever had. I don't even normally like pancakes. These were worth it. If you don't order anything else get the wild berry pancakes and the berry vanilla latte.

I went twice on weekdays around noon and the line wasn't bad. Maybe 15 minutes. Heard it gets much longer on the weekends.

This is just about as good as it gets.  I ate breakfast here today (Thanksgiving), so big points for being open to start with.  Second, it wasn't crowded at all, due to the holiday, but it started getting full as I left.  I am sure it's a madhouse on weekends here.
I got the Mexicana skillet, mostly due to the good reviews I read about it on here, and I'm glad I did.  It was absolutely phenomenal.  I was tempted to get pancakes with it, but I was good and chose fruit.  It's a LOT of food.
Generous portions, cooked wonderfully, with good service.  My only gripe is with the seating.  There are a lot of 2-person tables situated very close to each other, so if you are a party of 1 or 2, you'll be eating about 24" away from a complete stranger.  Bring headphones!
AMAZING PCAKES! The fluffiness is incomparable! The French fries are also great. And blackberry lemonade is a graft touch for a savory dish

This place was awesome. My mom and I were in town visiting and decided to check it out. We were staying a couple of blocks away on State Street and opted to walk. As we were walking up I started to get a little nervous about the wait time because there was a decent sized crowd outside. We walked in and asked how long it would be and to our surprise it was only a 15 minute wait...we stood off to the side and within 5 minutes our name was called and we were seated. After being seated we placed our order with a few suggestions from the waiter (who was super handsome). It took little to no time for our food to arrive. It was delicious and more than enough. I'm not sure  how they are able to get so many people in and out so fast with great service, but they do it well.

pics.caption: You have to try their signature wild berry pancakes!

review.des: Great food. Great price. Be prepared to wait. A table for 2 at 9:45AM on a Saturday gets you a 1.75 hour wait. I thought the host was exaggerating but it really did take that long. When they put your name into the system, you get a text message with a link to an app that tells you what place you are in line, so you can walk around the city and see sites, which we did. Once you get in, be prepared to munch for under $10. I had a huge San Antonio skillet ($9) that came with a generous heap of hash brown, chorizo, avocado smothered in cheese and topped with 2 eggs. Not to mention two pancakes. The place was very busy and their are a ton of families. If you can stand the wait, you'll be a happy camper

First time visiting Chicago and found this place on Yelp. The reviews were accurate. Delicious food. I wasn't a fan of my glass of water waiting for me on the table when I first sat down but was informed it was typical behavior by a friend. Staff was friendly and food arrived quickly despite the place being packed. I ordered the chorizo benedict with fruit. The chipolte hollandaise was incredible!
Excellent food! Their crepes were amazing and the pancakes were really good too.  Atmosphere was warm and cozy and I'd go back for sure.

Four stars because of the hour long wait, but other than that, the food, atmosphere and service were fantastic!!

I went with my boyfriend and got the duck confit hash with over easy eggs! The duck was not the best I have ever had because it didn't have much flavor, but was still a good alternative to normal breakfast meats like ham or bacon :) it gave the hash more consistency and texture ! My boyfriend got the cinnamon roll French toast and it was perfect for people who like sweet breakfast food! Lastly, we got the Oreo s'mores pancakes to share and they were sweetness overkill for my taste, but still delicious!

Came to Chicago for Sound Physicians NLC meeting. We decided to go here for lunch, since well we are west coast folks and are not waking up earlier than we had to. We made an online reservation for table towards the end of our morning session. We walked over and as soon as we checked in we were seated. That was awesome since lunch time is limited and it was busy time for them! We ordered and food came. Panini, skillet, Benedict, to pancakes an all was on point. Place will not disappoint and lived the fact we put our name down for wait online!!
Excellent food, great service....worth the wait. Everything on the menu looked great. Got the butcher block skillet was amazing.

Wildberry has changed my life, I don't know if it was the fluffy pancakes with the mascarpone in the middle, the casserole with melting cheese and avocado, the warm apple cider or the fact that I waited in the cold for 1.5 hours. This place has just changed me.
Arrive early or maybe 1 hour waiting, try Oreo Pancakes are awesome  and definitely you gotta try Vanilla Berry Coffee

I came here on a Friday morning for brunch. We waited 40 mins to get seated but its one of those places that txt you when the table is ready (thank you!).

I ordered the espanola omlette with a side of tiramisu pancake. The omlette was a 4/5. It came together well and would have gotten a 5 if the jalapeños were a little Spicer. The tiramisu pancake was a 3/5. It's really good but it is wayy too much cream and frankly too big of a portion considering its the "side" of my order. Sometimes less is more. I felt bad leaving that much pancake behind and I really think it should be half the serving when its a side order.  

Overall it's a nice diner-like experience. Nothing fancy but nothing unpleasant about it. Oh and they do serve intelligentsia's coffee for the fans out there.

In my head I was like -
hahahaha I'm going to show up at 12:30 and skip the wait
hahahah I'm so clever...
hahaahah no.  

They have a wait. all. the. time.

I was like UGH HOW GOOD COULD IT BE? TO WAIT OR NOT TO WAIT?! IM HUNGOVER & STAAARVING.  

It was worth it.  Definitely had the shakes as I was sitting down from all the caffeine I drank on an empty tummy.  ah, the things I do for 4.5 stars on yelp.

Service was incredible - our server (Bryce?) was the nicest human on the planet & our food was deeeeelishhhh.
This breakfast place is well worth the wait. They get your food to you quick and they have huge portions. I got an omelet with a side of waffle! Aaaamazing!

Los Altos Eggs Benedict was too spicy, waitress said that it would be only a little, and the regular Eggs Benedict my wife chose had huge slices of ham steak that over powered the balance you want in a Eggs Benedict maybe this is common in Chicago but not PA, NJ, NY.
Tossed out the Ham and the Chorizo Sausage which was more of a finely diced cream sauce.

BG :- (

Tasty brunch spot in the loop. Located right next to Millennium park, this is a nice spot for a pre-work meal or a stop on your day exploring Chicago attractions. The breakfast options are tasty with decently large portions. Prices are reasonable. They serve intelligentsia coffee and it looks like they also sell it here. Nice outdoor seating in the warmer months.

This is a great place to start your day. Very good food, and an excellent coffee. I totally recommend people for a breakfast but you better be early there or have patience for a long wait which it worth at the end cause you will enjoy a delicious breakfast. Recommend berry bliss pancakes

It was very crowded but cute. The berry bliss pancakes were the best thing there. The skillets were pretty big however, there is a place in Oak Park that my boyfriend and I go to that serves better skillets, in our opinion, than here. But the pancakes here are amazing.
I ordered a vegetarian skillet with added turkey bacon (you can add meat for like 75 more cents) and I got the berry bliss pancakes on the side (signature pancakes, aka any pancakes other than regular buttermilk, cost 1.75 more). My boyfriend ordered the Mexican skillet without chorizo. He finished everything and I finished one pancake and half a skillet. But the pancakes was worth the one hour and twenty minute wait.
All the workers are very nice, no complains. Presentation was beautiful.

pics.caption: Total price 11.5 +1.75 for signature pancakes +.75 for turkey bacon in skillet
The veggie skillet with turkey bacon added and the berry bliss pancakes as a side. (11.5)

review.des: OMG BEST PANCAKES AND BREAKFAST OF LIFE. Get the berry bliss pancakes with extra cream cheese topping. I am craving that as we speak. Definitely get there before 9AM, because the line gets a little crazy and the wait will be too long. But this is a great deal for awesome breakfast food!

This place was so great that I went two days in a row during my trip to Chicago. Even though I visited on a Wednesday and Thursday morning-early afternoon, there was a bit of a wait (no more than 20-30 mins). After we received our food, the wait was completely understandable. The food was amazing and our waitress was wonderful and very friendly. I will definitely be back during my next trip.

pics.caption: Mexicana Sizzlin' Skillet with a side of  Caramel Apple Pecan French Toast. Amazing!!

review.des:
Best breakfast burrito I've ever had.  Roasted slices of green chilies, perfectly ripened avocados, not too much cheese, spicy chorizo...and a bunch of other stuff inside.  It was a nice spicy and flavorful burrito served with a side of red salsa and sour cream.  Loovveeeed it!

Also ordered a short stack of their signature berry pancakes...that's about a 2 star.  Their sauce either bland or tasted like cough syrup.

Use the No Wait app. We signed up, were 23rd in line, and in 15 minutes when we got there were ready to be seated. As always, the food was amazing. I got the Espanol omelet with egg whites and no chorizo. Oh. My. Gosh!  The eggs were the fluffiest I have ever had, and the ingredients were delicious. This place is the real deal and we will be back every time we are in Chicago.

I love how early this place opens at and on top of that there food is amazing. You can not go wrong with choosing this place to go for breakfast. Another plus is that it is literally right across from Millennium Park so, after you enjoy your meal, you can take a nice stroll through the park.

I would wait days to eat here. The trick is to come early to put your name in and hangout around the area. My wait was an hour and 45 min so it was perfect to go around close and explore.

The berry bliss pancakes are the best dish hands down. The skillets and eggs Benedict are delicious as well. I will be back very soon!

pics.caption: A berry happy camper with his berry bliss pancakes
Berry bliss pancakes and the mexicana skillet

review.des: Amazing "Berry Bliss" French toast!!!! Super awesome view of millennial park. Ask for Jeremy! The best of the best. Super fun and energetic. Love him. He's the best !
Amazing brunch spot! You cannot go wrong here. My husband and I have been a few times, and we are never disappointed! The wait is worth it!

Decided to come here after reading all the amazing reviews, and we weren't disappointed! The wait list option on Yelp is clutch, and we were seated within about ten minutes of arriving (we heard the regular wait was about an hour). This was on a Sunday around 8:30 am. Our server Justine was super friendly and attentive, and the food came out very quickly! I ordered the Carmel Apple Pecan pancakes, which were delicious! Beware, the pancake orders come with 5 pancakes, so pack your appetite! My husband got the Rustic Farm Egg Panini after seeing the table next to is order it, and he said it was awesome! Overall, great place with delicious breakfast! Just be sure to take advantage of the Yelp wait list option!

Ever thought figs would taste good on an omelet? Neither did I.

You really can't go wrong with anything you order here.

If you come here and turn away because of the wait period to get a table, you are doing yourself a huge disservice.

While on my trip to Chicago from Los Angeles, this was the ONLY place i visited twice. We found it on a whim and fell in love.

The service is friendly and prompt. If you come over the weekend you will find that your wait time will be quite lengthy. The first time I came in was on a Saturday, my friend and I waited about 25 minutes for our table, but we overheard the wait times of other parties of 4 or 5 at 45 minutes or so. The second time we came in was on a Monday. This time we had a party of 4, but we waited about 5 minutes for a table--and we were able to get a table on the patio :D

As for the food.... MM. We all had specialty pancakes, served with warm maple syrup:
-Cinnamon Roll Pancakes
-Caramel Apple Pancakes
-Strawberry Pancakes
-Cranberry Apple Pancakes

I had the cranberry pecan--DELICIOUS! I had them with two over-easy eggs, crispy hash-brown, and three crispy (and large, IMO) strips of bacon. Their passionfruit lemonade was also very refreshing and tasty. So much delicious food for a reasonable price.

Also, one of my friends had the veggie omelet and she could not get over how good it was, haha. She ordered it both times we were there and both times she raved about it lol. She also said it was some of the best coffee she'd ever had.

To make a long review short: YES!
This place is worth your time, money, and appetite!

pics.caption: Pancakes, Starting at the bottom and moving clockwise: Cranberry, Strawberry, Cinnamon Roll, Chocolate Chip.  ALL DELICIOUS!

review.des:
Normally I'm not the biggest fan of breakfast food, but Wildberry is pretty good. One of my go-to spot when visitors are here. The lines are massive, but aim to go on a weekday morning(I went on Tuesday at 8:30), ad you'll be rewarded with no wait, receptive service, and some great breakfast food. I went with a friend and we ordered the Butcher's Block Skillet and the Espanola, and upgraded our pancake sides to get the Pumpkin Spice and the Cinnamon Roll pancakes(as recommended by our server). No missees across the board, but special points to the server, because those Cinnamon roll pancakes were on point.

Butcher's Block: Hashbrowns had great texture and the melted cheese on top of it combined with the medley of different meats is the epitome of hearty, wholesome breakfast food. While I wouldn't give it any points for creativity, it was just on its own made very well and you can't ask for more when it comes to this sort of breakfast food.

Espanola: This omelet was huge.....must have had like 5-6 eggs in it. Mixture of spicy ingredients(jalapenos, chorizo) and south of the border ingredients like Chihuahua cheese and avocado made for a flavorful and very filling omelet. The entire meal(pancakes included) could probably feed you for two meals if you exercise a little restraint and don't down it all immediately(I couldn't help myself).

Pancakes: Pumpkin spice was just alright. However the real MVP was the Cinnamon Roll pancakes, which tasted exactly like a cinnamon roll and had small crystals of cinnamon sugar in it to add an appropriately crunchy(for lack of a better term), texture to the soft pancakes. Other favorites like the berry bliss and any season specials they have also tend to be pretty good.

Unfortunately they've had a few price increases since I've been here so now it can slowly add it to a pricier breakfast which docks a point, but otherwise still a good breakfast all around

Gosh, its been a few months and I'm still raving over these pancakes...that's how good they get. The portions are very generous and I struggled with my order of berry bliss pancakes (the best) and my butcher block skillet. I highly recommend the skillet with the upgraded signature pancakes. The skillet was delicious with very rich savory flavors which perfectly balanced with the sweet pancakes (but not overly sweet which was the KEY here). My girlfriend got an interesting omelette called the Napa Valley Fig Omelette (ironically we would be visiting Napa a month later...but that's for another review), as well as the Red Velvet Latte. Boy, that was a sweet drink but to her it was just alright.

My hat is to the chef, this establishment truly knows how to make an outstanding pancake, one of the best I've ever had, and a filling skillet. It's rare that every bite is as good as the last and this place delivers.

We came in right at 8AM (early flight) and there was plenty of seating.

This place is probably why I gained so much weight on this trip... we came here 2x during our 4 day trip in Chicago. This is American breakfast at its finest and you can eat a lot of good food for very little.

TIP: Come here weekdays before 8:30 for shorter lines.

Food: 5/5
You'll see this dish over and over again on Yelp, and for good reason - the Bliss Berry pancakes are amazing! If you have a sweet tooth, this is what I recommend. However, the portions are HUGE; I was only able to eat half of my pancake. You can actually order a smaller "side-portion" of this, so I recommend that if your stomach is not a bottom-less pit.

We also had the skillet (butcher block & garden veggie), both were delicious. The most amazing thing about the skillet is definitely the crispy hash browns. They are deliciously crunchy and I could just eat bowls of that by itself.

Surprisingly, this place also has good coffee. I was expecting standard diner "sewer-water" coffee but apparently the coffee is sourced from Intelligenista, a specialty-coffee place in Chicago.

Service: 5/5
The food came within 15 minutes of ordering! I really miss American service in this aspect. They are fast and efficient, you get fed quickly and the waitstaff are friendly and nice.

Atmosphere: 3/5
There is a random mix of business people, locals and tourists in this joint. Clearly the food is delicious and the location is super convenient, right near Millennium Park.

Value: 5/5
The portions are huge and will keep you full until dinner. Dishes are around $10-12 each.

So I'm giving this place a 5 star just on their pancakes and French toast alone. I had the cinnamon roll pancakes and my husband had the red velvet French toast. Amazing!!! I also had an omelette and my husband had a skillet. Both paled next to the French toast and pancakes, so forget about those unless you need your protein.

Biggest con is that you will be waiting for hours if you go during peak times. Try to get there early or you'll regret it. When you arrive they'll take your cell phone and text you when your table is ready. Dining room is pretty big and it is good for families or couples or just because you want something unique. Breakfast and lunch served the entire time.

It's across the street from Millennium Park.
Specialty pancakes were awesome. Little on sweeter side. Service was great. Waited 45 min during brunch. Made up time with quick service. More spacious inside than I thought.

Amazing. Amazing food. Their pancakes are super fluffy and really addicting! I got a side of Banana cream pancakes and it was SO good. My aunt also ordered the fig omelette and I HIGHLY recommend this one if you're looking for a healthier omelette! I had the Mexican and it's got a slight kick to it. If you're ever in the area and visiting Chicago, definitely come here!

TIP: The lines are always really long so just call in for pick up and head over to Millennium Park to eat :)

pics.caption: Banana cream pancakes, fig omelette, and Mexican skillet!

review.des: I ordered the wild berry waffles to-go as soon as I got off the train, and they were ready for me when I got there. It was all wrapped up very nicely, with butter and whip cream and syrup on the side. I ended up getting it to go, so I can eat it at millennium park. It was a perfect Monday morning breakfast!

pics.caption: Ordered their Wildberry Waffle to-go and ate it in the park. Best idea

review.des: Long wait but this place makes it easy with the yelp line check option that gives you an idea of when you are next. Was able to go see the cloud gate "The Bean" and stroll around the park while waiting for breakfast. Great food and they are big portions with quick service. Great breakfast place but check in early on the yelp app.
Totally worth the wait... pancakes were SUPER light and fluffy and NOT too sweet which was really surprising. Gave you 5 -- portion size was huge. Definitely try the pancakes.
Wildberry is the best place for breakfast I've ever been. It does have a long wait, but food comes out in ten minutes and is a great value. They give you so much food and it's all around delicious!

Love the food, and the atmosphere. The prices are a little above average, but worth it. The only reason it gets 4 stars is because of the absolutely ridiculous wait times during the busy hour. You can expect to wait up to two hours. I will say though, that they do get you in and out fast. I know it's only that busy because it's that good, but if you plan on just "going out for breakfast" this isn't a quick bite during peak hours.

This is the perfect breakfast/ brunch spot! We went on a Friday morning and had to wait for about an hour and a half, but it was well worth it. We were able to put our name on the waitlist and use the Yelp app to track our spot in line as we walked around town. The "berry bliss" french toast and corned beef hash were phenomenal!

Awesome place conveniently located near a lot of tourist attractions.  Perfect place to grab a bite to eat before a day of touring.  The potions are big!

We ordered the Venetian skillet and upgraded the pancake to the cinnamon roll - worth the extra dollar!  Two eggs, hash browns, sausage, roasted peppers and onions and tomatoes.  Great combination and should order your eggs sunny side up/over easy to get the yolk flowing through your meal.  Very difficult to finish the whole meal.  I would've liked if the skillet was cast iron instead of metal so it would make the hash even crispier.

Also got the Los Altos Benedicts -  comes with chorizo and chipotle hollandaise.  The poached eggs were slightly over-cooked and wasn't as runny.  Good flavors overall and reasonable prices for the portions!

Delicious and so fast!! Tasty pancakes and lattes! Make sure to put yourself on the wait list prior to going; we were glad we did, because of a 2 hour wait time. We waited only about 15 minutes because we put ourselves on the wait list. Efficient texting system to let you know when they're ready for you.

The food tasted spectacular and the service was fast, however, I found hair cooked into my pancakes and my wife had hair in her eggs benedict.  We both found these at the end of our meal or else we would have had a less enjoyable experience. Hopefully they will "clean" up their act and be more careful with the food prep.

My friend had suggested me to try out this place for breakfast and had warned me about long waits. I went here on my birthday for breakfast and waited for an hour to be seated. Good thing, they take your number and text you once your table is ready but still it takes another 5-10 minutes to be seated. We had already decided on as what to order, so without wasting any time we ordered Florence Benedict with hash brown and garden skillet with a side of signature berry bliss pancakes. Benedict was great, loved the hollandaise. Only problem, too much spinach. Also, the menu mentions baby spinach but it was not at all tender, rather stringy. So, I ended up not eating it. I had ordered extra crispy hash brown, which was great. Garden skillet tasted fine, but was terribly under seasoned. Pancakes tasted really nice with beautiful presentation. However, service was really bad. Our server came only once to fill our coffee and when my husband wanted some more coffee, she was nowhere to be seen. She never came to check on us in between. We still payed 20% tip but it was not worth it.

pics.caption: Florence Benedict- too much spinach for me

review.des: Everything about this place is amazing . The portions are huge and the food is tasty. The house coffee was a delightful medium roast . The seasonal pancakes had a bourbon sauce

When I told my friend that I would be in Chicago, she immediately said she would take me to Wildberry - so immediately I had high expectations.

I ordered a make your own omelet with egg whites, spinach, and ham. When I tasted it, I was shocked - didn't know that eggs could be so juicy and flavorful, and the waiter was kind enough to allow me to order a smaller two egg potion for cheaper. My friend ordered a skillet with beef and avocados and that too was delicious - crispy, fresh, and very flavorful.

The pancakes, while famous, did not live up to New York standards. Yes, they are fabulous and fluffy but for some of the best known pancakes in Chicago, doesn't quite match New York's output.

The wait was an hour and half, but we didn't mind.  The prices are cheap, and the service efficient.  Would love to come back again!

This place was our first stop in our Chicago trip. We had a 1 hour wait so took the time to walk through Millennium Park which worked out perfectly. The service was fast once we sat down and next thing I saw were my empty plates! Meat skillet, banana pancakes and fresh berry pancakes were out of this world!

pics.caption: Banana and fresh berry pancakes. Life altering...

review.des: Visited on a Sunday morning. There was an hour and a half wait for a table. Luckily Millennium Park is across the street so you are able to explore while you wait. Once in, I ordered a cheese omelette, which comes with hash browns and pancakes. I substituted for the banana cream pie pancakes instead of regular pancakes. They were excellent! Great texture and taste! The omelette and hash browns were good as well but it was the pancakes that made my meal! The mango lemonade was good enough to warrant a refill! Staff was pleasant as well. It was worth the wait.

TO-GO YOUR ORDER!!! Known tourist spot, hopefully by locals as well. We got our order to go & sat & ate in Millenium Park across the street. Beautiful place for breakfast.

Steak skillet - size was more than decent & would get you goin' in the morning. Tasted good, not grrrrreat, but the bed of crispy taters with the steak omelet on top made for layer-ey goodness.

Berry bliss French toast - get this!!! I'm a waffle/ pancake/ French toast kinda dude & this one didn't disappoint following my not-too-shabby steak skillet. It was toasty soft, it was huge, if was sweet, it was fruit decadence. Share this! Or not.

Really great food. We had the Southern Eggs Benedict and there Florence Eggs Benedict. Huge portions. Easily enough for two to share unless you're an aggressive eater. Wait staff was fantastic. Long line but it went surprisingly fast.

This was amazeballs! The wait was about an hour and a half but it was worth it. Millennium park is right across so you can walk around as you wait. However, turns out whoever I initially checked in with had entered my number wrong. When I went and asked making sure my name was on the wait list, it wasn't. The guy at the front was very corteous and worked with us to get seated almost right away, after he realized our number had been entered incorrectly. Really enjoyed the service and the food was great. Def recommend especially if you're from out of town!
AMAZING! Their signature berry bliss pancakes are scrumptious. Fresh fruit and delicious glaze. Service is top notch. This is a must if you're visiting the Windy City.

This place is the bomb. If you're looking for any kind of breakfast or brunch, come here and look no further. We got a few bennys and an omelette and they were perfection. Quick heads up, the wait will be long, especially if you come on the weekend. We used the app NoWait which was a great way to get on the list. It tells you how long and how many people are ahead of you. Highly recommend it, as well as Wildberry. #noregrets

Let me start out by saying I do not get excited by pancakes. I will never order pancakes when I go out for breakfast or brunch and I rarely eat a pancake when my husband makes them on Sunday mornings. The Signature Berry Bliss pancake is the only pancake that makes my mouth water. I have no idea why I like this thing because it is smothered with mascarpone and strawberry creek and all sorts of sweet berry stuff. I just can't help myself..I love it. I have tried one of their "healthier pancakes" which was the fig whole grain or something like that. It was alright....def not the berry bliss.

This is probably one of the best breakfast I had. Reserve your table on-line on yelp to avoid the long line up. Lots of healthy savory vegetarian options which were delicious, add on the highlight, which is the crepe with berries. Great way to start out the day with a good breakfast.

Great location near Millennium Park and Michigan Avenue, and near the train route.

Although the wait was 2 hours we enjoyed our brunch. I highly suggest using the Nowait app and put your name before arriving. My boyfriend loved his omelette. I really enjoyed my eggs benedict. The prices are fair and very reasonable for the portion you get. Would highly recommend to anyone who is looking for a stellar brunch place in the loop.

This place is super busy but the food seemed worth the 90 minute wait during brunch rush hour. First time I got the corned beef egg benedict and was super satisfied. Second time had their Signature Berry Bliss pancakes which were delicious and such a big portion I couldn't even eat half. I enjoyed picking off my cousins' orders too...good quality food.

Food?!? DELICIOUSS omelets. Pancakes and french toast were a little dry but good. If served with food, it would be better.
Service? 2 stars!!! The young lady couldnt find our reservation and wasnt very nice. She thought we were lying that we already booked a table. (She found it afterwards) The place was packed so I understood her frustration.
Overall, great! I will def go back again!

This place is awesome! I had the Mexicana Skillet with side pancakes and both were delicious, definitely fills your stomach up for most of the day. The service is really friendly and fast. Even with reservations the wait is still long, but the food makes it worth it!
I got their classic eggs Benedict and it's arguably one of the best. Their bone ham slices and hollandaise sauce are superb. Great service!
Excellent every time. Delicious fluffy pancakes with fruit baked in. Prices that are very reasonable and a nice and efficient staff. A long wait, but worth it for some really good food!

Finally perservered (sp) through the legendary wait and ate at Wildberry, reportedly the "best" carby-type brunch in the city. Didn't disappoint. Had a caramel/apple waffle and savored it. Also tried somebody else's "super berry" (or something like that), which was also sublime. Stack of berries and whipped cream on a waffle.

I'd skip non-waffle/crepe/pancake items like chicken sausage and eggs. Nothing exceptional there. Also unclear if it's worth the wait or if the wait is a psychological trick that makes everything tastes better. Think Wildberry likes the long wait, too, to cultivate a "mystique" around the place.

This all said, wait isn't horrible. Just go wait in the office building next door that has a functionally useless humongous lobby with like 6 comfy chairs in it and GO READ A BOOK.

Super yummy and worth the wait.  Go, give them your cell #, they'll text you when your table is nearly ready.  Go kill time taking pictures at the Bean (Cloud Gate) and stroll the park around the Jay Pritzker Amphitheater.

I can't even remember the name of the dish I had but it was a very flavorful omelet with chorizo and avocado.  My bf had brioche French toast. Feet thing was so good and the options on the menu were so inviting, I wanted to eat EVERYTHING.  

Service was great. Would definitely go back.

The best breakfast of our trip to Chicago. Incredibly busy but the wait time was cut because we used the No Wait Guest app. Only works within a 5 mile radius. Be sure to time it properly. If you arrive late they will give away your table. The omelettes and the meat skillet were excellent.
Well the portion is huge, and the price is very decent. However I felt that I ate too much oil and/or calories... therefore one star off.

This was one of the better places I tried while in Chicago. I heard about the long wait but thanks to Yelpers I downloaded the NoWait app to wait in line in the comfort of my hotel. After they send a second text to say your table is almost ready we only waited for an extra couple of mins and was seated. The omelette was good (espando?!) and the corn beef hash was delishhhh, BUT my favorite thing was their CINNAMON ROLL PANCAKE!!! I don't have a sweet tooth at all but it wasn't overpowering and was absolutely fantastic. A must try!

Amazing!  I've been here a few times when I'm visiting Chicago and there is always a wait on weekends.  I suggest using the Nowait app.  Very helpful!  The omelets are amazing, especially the Mexicana one!  I also have to give a shout out to delicious gluten free pancakes.  The signature berry ones were very tasty as is the Nutella crepes.  The skillets are delicious and very hearty.  Basically, I have never gone wrong with an order and always leave feeling full and can't imagine eating lunch.  
My only constructive point was the coffee was average at best, but they do have soy and almond milks.

I can't believe I had never been to this place before, it is AMAZING.
It is CRAZY busy, but it's a huge place, so once you get seated, you don't feel it. The portions are huge, and everything we tried was delicious. The waitress was super sweet, as was everyone else we encountered. I'll definitely be back next time I'm in town!

Check in through yelp before your visit to avoid a long wait. (Although, long wait is well deserved!) I recommend the berry bliss pancakes which can be made gluten free! Hurray for the gluten free club bc these are the most divine pancakes I have ever had!    (Fluffy, not dense.)The pancakes are large, full order comes with 5 and half order with 2. I did a half order with a side of hash browns which was absolutely heavenly! I must say the only thing I wouldn't recommend is strawberry banana fruit smoothie, couldn't  even drink it. It taste like pure sugar, not fruit. Room for improvement on that recipe, try including real fruit!

Phenomenal tourist trap. Slow to get a table, slow for anyone to show up to our table once seated and slow even after someone eventually showed up.

My waffle tasted like it came out of a grocery store freezer.  Eggs over medium came out with some of the white uncooked. My wife's pancakes were okay but easily gotten elsewhere. The rest of the food was mediocre at best. What a waste.

I had off on a random Tuesday and decided to grab some breakfast at Wildberry on a whim. I walked in around 9am and the place was PACKED. Seriously packed. I waited about 5 minutes for a table but even parties of 2-4+ only had about a 10-15 minute wait. I can't imagine the chaos here on a weekend!

I was seated and the waiter Bryce took my order after I had time to look over the menu. The coffee was excellent, well worth the $3 charge for Intelligentsia coffee. As I waited for my food, the table next to me had an issue with an omelet. Bryce came over, took the omelet back and they made a whole new plate for the woman even though she had eaten her sides already! Talk about service! Once that table left and another came in, I overheard Bryce talk about the smoothies to a customer. With the customer being hesitant, Bryce suggested a sample of the smoothie before she made her mind up. I was greatly impressed by his true care for his customers and it would only get better....

I had the Butcher's Block skillet with pancakes and it was delicious! Perfect mixture of 5 different meats without it being TOO meaty...I could still taste the eggs, cheese, and hash browns. The pancakes were simply divine. I had regular buttermilk and while they were a tad on the sweet side, they were probably the best pancakes I've ever had! I couldn't finish my skillet but I left full and satisfied. When getting the check Bryce asked me if I wanted another cup of coffee. I hesitated and then said no thank you. But that's when he asked if I wanted a to-go cup. Heck yes. Bryce is by far one of the best waiters I've ever had at a restaurant, he's a real gem who knows how to treat his customers, and for that I will definitely be back to Wildberry!

It was good breakfast food and they really do have a great selection of pancakes. I got the slow roast brisket hash with their special pancake on the side. The hash was good. The pancakes were good. The other specialty pancakes left something to be desired, so I would only recommend their specialty (and we had enough people that we could try almost every pancake on their menu).

Overall, good, but nowhere near good enough to justify that wait.

Yes, I know a 2 star review is not what you would expect from a place that is so Yelpy with almost 1,300 reviews and 4.5 starts but hear me out.

When you go to breakfast/brunch, you want something that is satisfying with a balance of sweet and savory that won't punch your taste buds in the face the first thing in the morning. Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe just does not have that balance.

They are famous for their "Berry bliss" style toppings on pancakes/crepes/Belgian waffles, but all you can really taste is sweet, sweet and more SWEET. The berry cream or whatever it was supposed to be was almost like yogurt consistency and I couldn't really make out what flavor it was supposed to be. Once you take a bite, it's just like a mouth full of mush.

My friends ordered a side of the Oreo pancakes just to try and that was even more disgustingly sweet. They had chocolate chips as a topping and the melted chocolate just stuck to the top of your mouth as you ate.

They did mention that their savory chorizo hash was better so maybe you're better off picking a savory dish.

I'm not sure what the huge hype is being a visitor in Chicago and having limited meals to try all the great food the city has to officer, I would definitely skip this one. If you are looking for a good brunch place, I would recommend going to Yolk which was more satisfying and tasty for sure.

Nice straightforward breakfast place, with friendly service. HUGE portions, my wife and I could have split her espanola omelette easily. It was very flavorful

I got the biscuits and gravy and it was pretty bland and disappointing.

The atmosphere looks like a step up from ihop.
I like that they have clever creations of pancakes and waffles etc.

I got the Mexican skillet, and that stole my heart. I also got a side of the cinnamon waffles (because cinnabons are my favorite) and they were pretty good! They had melted cream cheese and I didn't expect that.
Overall it's a tasty place, nothing majorly gourmet. Definitely a must try though! Any palette can appreciate this place.

Everything you want in a breakfast spot. Next time I'm in Chicago, I will definitely revisit. Although the lines can be long, it goes by quickly. My group grabbed coffee and hung out outside until our table was ready.

So this is my first visit to Wildberry Pancakes  and Cafe and I'm sorely disappointed. After being given a 2 hour wait.., after 2 hours and 15 minutes we still had not been seated. It is easy for the untrained eye to see that their seating practice and waiting list is extremely biased. Not everyone is required to adhere to a waiting policy.

This place is well worth the wait and really good. My friends and I were recommended this spot for brunch from a local and we were not disappointed! In fact the food we ordered (one dish per person plus we all shared a side of the berry bliss crepe) pretty much lasted us the entire day up until dinner.

I ordered the Los Altos benedict, something that wasn't necessarily a must-have or their specialty, but I never had chorizo in any kind of benedict so I decided to go with that plus hash browns! It also came with chipotle hollandaise, pico de gallo and roasted red peppers; order if you love spicy! My other two friends got a florence benedict and biscuits with gravy. Overall, it seems anything on their menu here is good. We were about to order a full dish of their crepes, but thank goodness our waiter told us we should order a side instead.

I would recommend ordering any of their berry bliss sweet dishes to accompany a savory one!

There is also an Intelligentsia Coffee bar at the entrance if you're looking for something warm to sip on while waiting for a table!

Wow. This place is amazing. There's a reason why they have a wait on a Wednesday morning (only 10 minutes though!). Went with a friend and ordered the "Signature Berry Bliss" pancakes, recommended by the waitress. Service was a little slow, but it's because the restaurant was packed. Plus the wait was totally worth it.

The pancakes were fluffy and flavorful. I'd consider myself a breakfast snob, but I will remember that quintuple stack of heaven for a long time. Wildberry is a must! And if you overeat, just walk it off at Grant Park :)

Ordered home made corned beef hash skillet with eggs. The food was ok. My eggs were over cooked for sunnies, and skillet was mostly potatoes not much beef.  So I'm bit disappointed.
I will be back to try other items from their large good looking menu :)

Very long wait. I have been a couple of times and the wait has never been shorter than 40 minutes (For 2 people on a Wednesday morning).

This place is awesome to get your $$'s worth though. For a little over $10 you can get a giant entree of omelette / skillet / what have you and just another $1 to substitute for a side of specialty pancakes (which I highly recommend). I normally have a big appetite but have never been able to finish an entire meal here.... so while it's already pretty cheap for a brunch place in the loop, you essentially get two breakfasts for the same price!

For the specialty pancakes I highly recommend their signature berries one for a slightly healthier twist, and the banana cream pie is also very rich and delicious. I've also had the Oreo's one, which is a tad too sweet for me.

Not giving them 5 stars since their stuff, albeit very decent, are pretty standard.... so nothing that makes me throw back my eyes going like "OMG I can die happy now!!"

This place was great!   Food was unbelievable!  I had the blueberry Danish pancake. It was delicious.  Huge plate of pancakes I could not even finish but got to enjoy the next day again. And reheated was just as good!

5 stars for the pancakes. I don't usually like pancakes so that already says a lot. They were flavorful and not too sweet. Did not need syrup.

2-3 stars for the garden skillet. Pretty bland so I had to drench mine in hot sauce.

Host and waitstaff were attentive. Definitely would come back for the pancakes and try other things.

This restaurant was near the Palmer House where we were staying, so we decided to try it out for breakfast on Sunday. It was amazing! It was about a 20 minute wait. The waiting area was a bit cramped, but it was alright since the wait wasn't very long. It's very nicely decorated, and the service was great. I had a latte with almond milk which was probably the best latte I've ever had. I also got the veggie omelette which came with fruit and toast. It was the best omelette I've ever tasted; it was so delicious and filling! They brought a little tray with butter, syrup, and marmalade that was really cute. The marmalade was excellent. If you get toast, don't skimp on the marmalade! Everyone else in my family loved their meals and said they'd return as well.

pics.caption: Veggie omelette (with no onion), fruit, and toast

review.des: All I have to say is do yourself a favor and get this signature bliss berry pancakes! The absolute best and tastiest pancakes I have ever had and it's a beautiful concoction of heaven and sin all in one! I normally eat egg whites and chicken sausage for breakfast but I went out on a limb after the suggestion from G and I am glad I did... Now if I can walk out of here lol!

Needed a place to have breakfast downtown before we explored the city. This place is right in the middle of everything you need to see, is right next to Millennium Park and convenient to get to. The wait time on a Tuesday morning (11AM) was 25 minutes. We took the pager and just enjoyed the weather outside while we waited.

The food definitely exceeded my expectation. I got the strawberry waffles with bacon and my boyfriend got The Garden skillet. We saw that the kids menu had Fruity Pebbles french toast, so we decided to share that to try it out. Everything came out to us in a timely manner and looked just as good as it tasted. Next time we're in Chicago, we will definitely be back!

pics.caption: Strawberry Waffles with Bacon, Fruity Pebbles French Toast, The Garden Skillet

review.des: Worth every penny. The food here is excellent. Not your average pancake... crepe... eggs... etc. Highly recommend. Huge variety of items and drinks to choose from.

I don't want to give this restaurant such a low review because I thought the food was pretty good not excellent but good. What threw me off was the rules they had. So I generally like my waffles to come out a few mins after my breakfast because I generally don't eat it till the end. This won't take me longer to eat as I would let it sit there regardless. When I asked if I could get it a little later just a few mins she was so hesitating to even ask. But she asked because I was like please and they said no. That is a first as normally I always request this and never had an issue.

Second my fiancee ordered a lemonade and he said " try it, this lemonade is strangely warm." So I said ok, I tried it than I said oo just ask for more ice. They probably just don't ice the lemonade. So when the waitress asked me if I needed anything. I said " yes could I please get some hot sauce and ice please?" So the waitress says " we don't allowed sharing of drinks". I said ok but can he get some ice? she repeated it 3 times and kept looking at me and saying we don't allow sharing of drinks. It made me really uncomfortable. I never been to a restaurant that needed to remind me 3 times that we cant share a drink. We didn't have any intention to share drinks. I simply wanted to get him ice because the lemonade was really warm. It really threw me off because I felt like it was extremely rude. If we were sitting there sharing the drink and you had to refill the drink 3-4 times than ok. That is fine. I think she refilled it once and I felt like it was something so small that she made into a big deal. If it wasn't for this experience I would have given them better stars but I thought that was really unprofessional and unnecessary. So remember people DONT SHARE A DRINK unless you want to be insulted.

As for the food, I enjoyed the berry waffle. I thought it would be more crispy. It is more of a soft waffle.

We got the southern Benedict and I thought it was ok. The biscuit was a little soft for me and the sauce was ok. I would suggest not getting this.

We also got the corn beef skillet and that was the best thing we had. It was really good. It taste like corn beef hash mix with hash browns. It was very taste.

So much food. But great! I got the wildberry signature pancakes (since, ya know the name) and my boyfriend got the skillet. Both were very satisfying, albeit a lot of food. Took over an hour to be seated but we wandered around while waiting and when in the restaurant, our food did not take too long. Would definitely recommend if you're in the area and have time to wait.

pics.caption: Wild berry pancakes, bacon and skillet

review.des:
My husband and I had to wait about 45 minutes to an hour for a table at 9am on a Saturday morning. However, we really appreciated the app that they use. We were able to go back to our hotel and visit the Millennium Park across the street instead of sitting outside the entire time.
On to the food. I had the eggs benedict and a white mocha. Lots of yummy coffee options. Husband had the butcher block skillet. Both were very filling and delicious! This is definitely a go to breakfast place when visiting the windy city.

Found this place when searching Yelp for a good breakfast spot.  Thought wow this has great reviews with so many people that have reviewed it.
I was not mislead once again.
The place was located just across from millennium park and had a 45 min wait on a weekday.  I contemplated finding something else but decided to wait and see if the hype was all it was cracked up to be.
I have to say it was then some.
I had blueberry pancakes.  My daughter, who met me there had some pancakes w figs and something else in it that she said was really good.
They were by far some of the best pancakes I have ever had.  My only advice to my Yelp friends - sharing is caring!
I had 2/3 of the pancakes left and I left full.
No need to let your eyes be bigger than your stomach because they are very generous with the portions!
I would say put this place on your breakfast dining list if out and about in Chicago!

Honestly this place is amazing. And so accommodating. We had a wheelchair in our party and they made it very easy to find a table that could fit it. The place does get insanely busy but thankfully it's across from Millenium park so you can walk around and they will text you when the table is ready. Everything from the skillet to the crepes to the coffee was amazing. Highly recommend.

pics.caption: Garden skillet, pancakes, and a pumpkin spice latte

review.des: I had a skillet that was perfectly cooked, crunchy hash browns.  Pancakes were light, fluffy, and delicious!  Burger and chicken wrap were also great!  Sure wish I could have tried the specialty pancakes!  Wait was 45 minutes, but worth it!

A great brunch place to try out. We came on a Monday, so the wait was not as long as it would normally be on the weekends. I can't say that I would be willing to wait an hour for this place, but our wait was only 20 minutes. I ordered an omelette, which is a pretty large portion. They did mix up my order and served me someone else's omelette, but the waiter insistingly offered to have my omelette remade. I did not feel it necessary, but he still did so anyway. Great service always makes the food taste better. The pancakes that come with the omelette is also very delicious, so definitely eat that while it's warm.
The restaurant itself is pretty large, so the turnover time is not bad. It really is just such a popular location that the long wait time, especially on weekends, is inevitable.
Overall, definitely a solid place to get brunch. Just plan your time accordingly!

My fiance LOVES this place.  I think it was just okay.  I don't really like pancakes and got a waffle instead and I just didn't think it was great.  I would give it another try.  Get there early as it gets pack early with a lot of tourists.

Oh My. Lanta. This place already has thousands of reviews, so what could I possibly add? I ate brunch here on Memorial Day weekend, and it was well worth the hour-plus wait. I had the Signature Berry Bliss pancakes, while my fiance had the Mexicana skillet. Both were amazing, and portion sizes were generous. I couldn't even finish half of the pancakes.

Now I'm hooked and want to come back to try like fives other things. And I plan to. Even if there is an hour or 1.5 hour wait. It's worth it.
I had a Mexicana skillet and it was bad. My sister had the chicken chipotle panini and it was amazing!!!! Their pancakes are amazing too.

Delicious!  Went on a Sunday around 9:00 and it was packed -- 40 minute wait.  They get you through in a timely fashion, without feeling like you're being rushed.  Had the corn beef hash skillet, which was delicious, but seemed to be overwhelmed with the hash brown.  The next time I'll get normal egg breakfast with hash on the side.  Pancakes are light and fluffy.  Location is very convenient to train station.. great place to grab a hearty breakfast before jumping on the train.

Love this place! But, prepare to wait... for a really long time. When we got there at 9am the wait was an hour and a half. By 10 it was up to two hours. Either get there early, or be prepared to wait. They do text you, so you can do what you want during the wait time.

I had the Pecan and Cranberry pancakes which were very good. Such a large portion! I still had some leftover but I was stuffed. Very good. We try to visit here at least once when we're in town visiting. My husband had the Cinnamon Swirl french toast and he didn't care for the cream cheese in the middle, but he did eat it all so.... it wasn't that bad obviously. I also got a side of bacon and he got a side of fresh fruit. Waitress was very attentive and friendly. Nice atmosphere and clean.

If you are going to have breakfast near Millenium Park in Chicago, then make a stop at Wildberry's.  I had a wild mushroom omelet - highly recommend.  Our waiter was very helpful, courteous, and humorous.  I'll be back!

Four of us arrived at this breakfast icon on a relaxing Sunday morning and the place was packed with more than 40 minutes worth of wait for a table. The modern, light-wooden décor consisted of good natural lighting and plenty of squared tables scattered across the floor. The festive environment was a huge contrast to the previous weekday visit where the place was virtually empty. Fortunately, they have an Intelligentsia stand by the door where my friend got a morning drink to keep her company.

The Corn Beef Benny ($9.50) was amazing. The large plate was stacked with two English muffins, homemade hash, perfectly poached eggs, gooey chipotle hollandaise and hash browns on the side. The corn beef was tender, flavorful, and out of this world. It was sinful to know that the savory flavors would soon join runny egg yolks and chipotle hollandaise sauce as second and third layers of complex flavors. The hash browns were deliciously added to pick up the rest of the hollandaise to make sure nothing was left behind. I highly recommended.

The Red Velvet French Toast ($8.95) arrived egg battered with cream cheese frosting, warm syrup, and fresh strawberries. The two-piece French Toast had a soft, cake-like muffin consistency, mild buttermilk surge, and a lowdown of cream cheese drizzles. Decent option, but more a novelty than something I would order again.

Service during this second visit was much improved from the previous. Our server was attentive, made good recommendations, and was genuinely friendly with a good sense of humor. My friends really liked their food too, and were pleased to be introduced to this place before we left Chicago. Interested diners should come on a weekday to avoid the weekend crowd. I'd be very interested in coming back.

This place is breakfast heaven. We got here at 0900 in the morning and the line was like a mile long. So we waited for 30mins and it was worth the wait. The food was yummy. The berry bliss pancake is to die for. Everything was great. Everybody in our group really enjoyed their meals. Highly recommended.

pics.caption: Berry pancake, scrambled eggs and bacons, Berry bliss crepe.

review.des: The wait is very long but the food was great. I'll try the new location which is less crowded then this one.
Long wait, so come early! Skillets and pancakes are delicious. Obviously and highly popular place near Millenium Park!

Delicious Benedicts, omelettes, pancakes. If you like a spicy breakfast try the chorizo benedicts. Topped off with fig and walnut pancakes or the cinnamon swirl pancakes. Just very well done food. The ambiance is just a little bit off so I'd take away half a star but with a cappuccino like that, I'd forgive. Also do not underestimate the 2 hour wait !

Great place to eat food was great and service was prompt and thorough. I had the cinnamon roll French toast with a side of bacon it was extremely good. My wife and son had the crapes they were out of this world. Would definitely recommend
Pancakes, scrambled eggs, potatoes, and bacon were all great!  Big portions, so a single carry out meal easily feeds two.

So good!! They're very centrally located and easy to find, and definitely popular- there was a wait at 830am on a Tuesday morning. It looked to me like a lot of business people have work breakfasts here, but there were lots of tourists and people by themselves too. We only had to wait about 5 minutes though, yahoo!

Their menu is pretty vast- eggs, omelettes, skillets, pancakes, crepes. I opted for regular ole eggs with turkey bacon, hash browns, and sourdough toast. Hubby had the Denver skillet, which came out in a tin bowl. Super cool! The eggs were laid over the hash brown, ham, peppers, onion mixture, and he said he loved it. I tried some, and it was definitely much tastier than any other skillet he's had. I loved their whipped butter (smooth tasty goodness) and their toast was so fluffy. Now, the best part, the hash browns: SO GOOD. Crispy, but not burnt, and lots of flavor.

Service was friendly, prompt, and my water glass was always filled despite how busy it was. Prices are also more than reasonable, we'll definitely make this a regular spot now whenever we come to the windy city!
Omg I love love love this place! Food is awesome service is great! I got their pancake special, talk about delish! I can't wait to go back and try all of them!

Dude.  The skillets are HUGE.  We each ordered a skillet.  This is a "deep-dish-breakfast-orgy-food-of-goodness."

Service is quick. The food is fresh.

It was my first time traveling to Chicago. My husband has been here numerous times. Our friends live there and took us here for breakfast. We came here on a Friday morning, and it was so busy. But the turn around time was quick. We waited about 30 minutes, which wasn't bad. My hubby had the Corned Beef Henny, he loved it. I had the Butcher Block Skillet, it had a bunch of meat and eggs and cheese, but what I really enjoyed was the chicken sausage in it. It was really good and full of flavor. Stood out from the entire dish. I tend to order more than I can eat, but who doesn't right? So I also ordered their signature Berry Bliss Pancakes, and delightful is the only way I can describe it. It was so good, not as sweet as it looks, and the fresh berries just made it that much better. Can't wait for another trip to come back here!

Excellent food and great staff. It was a long wait (almost two hours), but it was worth every minute. Once we got or seat, our order was promptly taken. The food came in no time. Everything was fantastic. I highly recommend for anyone wanting a great brunch for a reasonable price.

Don't even bother checking in via the Yelp app... you'll show up when they text you and then stand around while they seat people who show up after you... until you inquire and find out your name is no longer on the list.   Add some attitude from the manager and you're finally ready to enjoy your meal.

4 stars because of the often ridiculous wait here. but 5 stars for the food!

like most reviews have already mentioned, be warned that the wait can be ridiculous especially on weekends and they don't take reservations. go on a weekday if you can.

I tried one of the skillets and one of the omelets, although it's been a while and i don't recall which ones. both were good though! the omelet is served with hashbrowns or fruit & toast or pancakes. the skillet is served with toast or pancakes. for both, you can substitute specialty pancakes for $1.50 extra which i highly recommend doing because the specialty pancakes are BOMBBBBBBB.

don't be tempted by all the delicious sounding specialty pancakes and get distracted from the real must try name sake of this place -- the signature berry bliss pancakes (vanilla anglaise, blackberry coulis, berry mascarpone, and fresh berries) aka magic fairy dust. guys, this is an absolute must try. so much deliciousness on one plate. just get in my belly!!

i also tried the tiramisu pancakes which were good but not even in the same league as the berry bliss. so whatever you do, order the signature berry bliss pancakes!!

I've passed by this place several times and have ALWAYS seen it packed with people, so we decided to see what all the hype was about. Certainly came in with high expectations, hoping it lived up to it and after today I'd say they definitely did. Don't let the crowded scene and long wait detour you, it is worth the wait. I loved that you  could even download yelp to see your place in line and see how quickly they seated people in front of you on the app, it's really genius. Great service and great recommendations from the waiter as to what was some good specialities. The food was great as well and nice portions for my buck, so I didn't feel cheated. It'll be nice if they expand a bit or have a nice waiting area since they are so popular because I know the Prudential building gets a lot of their waiting customers. But all and all, great experience and I look forward to eating here again.
U must try florance bendict  ammmazing breakfast ever !
Food was amazing and they were really accommodating of my dad who's handicapped and has an electric scooter. Also the nowait app was really clutch!
I went there 2 months ago with some friends and as always, fully booked, but that's ok. We waited 47 min and we got a table and it was worth the wait. The food is good and the plates are huge :)

Host has a 10/10 face and an 11/10 butt. God bless America, and God bless Wildberry.

Probably good food too.

The food was very good. Nothing too greasy or heavy which is a good way to start the morning.  We did have to wait to be seated but we walked around the area and by the time we came back we were next to be seated.  Our waiter was very friendly and attentive.

The pancakes were on point I ordered the house famous pancakes and they were delicious. They really didn't even need syrup.

This has to be one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago! Every time we're in town and looking for breakfast, this is where we go. It's gets busy pretty early on the weekends, so go online and reserve your spot in line then explore Millennium Park (and Maggie Daley Park!) for a while.

The food is fresh made and well thought it. Honestly, it's so filling we'd stop in the morning at Wildberry for a big breakfast, and that would fill us up for the rest of the day. It would be late in the evening before any of us were hungry again, giving us plenty of time to explore the city.

I was surprised to hear there was a 20-30 minute wait for a party of one on a Friday morning. I'm so glad I stayed in line. The food and service were well worth the wait! I had the Rutherford omelette with the berry special pancakes. The pancakes were the best I've ever had. Amazing! The service was excellent from the hosts, to server, to bussers. Five stars all around! :)
My absolute favorite place to have breakfast in the city- prices seem steep but the portion sizes are incredible! Everything I've had here is to die for.

I've always tried to eat here whenever I was in Chicago, and FINALLY I have made it. The line is always super long, but it's worth it. We arrived at around 10AM on a Tuesday and there was a 45 minute wait. The wait actually went by pretty quickly as it seems like the workers there are really efficient. For example, as soon as we got to our table, there was water already set for us. And even when there were a lot of people waiting in line for a table, they never once rushed us to leave at all. I ordered the classic eggs benedict with fruit. Their menu also had sandwiches too but we were there for the breakfast! I was able to finish my food, but the portion sizes are pretty big. Depending on what you get, they are big enough to share. I suggest coming here right before it opens so there would be less of a wait :)

I went there around 7am Friday morning to have breakfast with a few girlfriends.  The food and service was pretty good.  I had the homemade corned beef hash with scrambled eggs and a side of fruit.  The corned beef hash was on the oilier side and the eggs were a bit dry.  Our waitress has helpful and friendly.
This is without a doubt, the best breakfast I've ever had. Every time I visit Chicago, I always make sure I stop in at this place. Especially for the price, you can't beat this place.

Really tasty food, paired with speedy, pleasant service, despite the hectic environment.

Two cautions:

1. The portion sizes are insanely huge. Be prepared to split dishes.
2. The wait times are off the hook. Use the NoWait app for best results, or be prepared for a 2-3 hour wait during brunch on weekends and holidays.

The hash browns are sooooo gooooooodddd.

My husband and I waited for patio seating which was lovely. We walked around the park while waiting which made the wait no big deal. We both ordered a breakfast with two eggs, hashbrowns, bacon and upgraded to the berry pancakes. We loved the whole experience!
The pancake was sooo good, not too sweet, looked gorgeous, and just about the right portion.

Wildberry is a really cool little breakfast joint located right in the heart of downtown Chicago near the "bean, cloud", whatever you want to call it lol. I must say, their omelettes and pancakes are pretty freaking unique and delicious. Also, the service here is exceptional considering all of the tourist business they get and I must warn you, this place gets REALLY BUSY! Expect a fairly long wait for your breakfast but that ok because the walk ability of the parks located right across the street is fantastic.

Pros-
Taste
Menu
Service
Location
Outdoor seating

Cons-
BUSY
Expect wait times
Touristy
