Awesome place for breakfast! If you don't have time to wait in line, just get a to-go order and then go sit at the park and enjoy your delicious food! My friend and I were so hungry that we just parked ourselves outside the restaurant and ate it right there!

The food was delicious--my friend and I split the Los Altos Benedict and the Napa Valley Fig omelet. Loved the benedict--great hollandaise, loved the spice and flavor from the sausage, just yum. I also particularly loved the figs in the omelet--delicious!! The hashbrowns that came with the omelet were SO crispy, highly recommend. Can't wait to come back!

Had a great experience at Wildberry. The food is decadent to say the least! Delicious and almost worth the wait. Our server, Dustin, really elevated our visit to the "best ever" territory. The group was admittedly a little cranky after waiting for our table, Dustin was well armed with thoughtful humor and genuine care to put everyone at ease. A true pro! Single star deduction for wait.
Too delicious, second time during our vacation. Great prices, lots of food. Great service A+

Truly lived up to the wait!! And yes there is always a wait :) Husband had the full breakfast that included pancakes. Holy cow - best pancakes I have eaten in a very long time. I was full and still had to have just one more bite of yummy!!!! I had the eggs benedict  - it was tasty and alot of food. You could split a plate if need be. Enjoy!!!

Had a great breakfast earlier second time coming and it was worth the 2 hour wait

Great food and I have to give it up to the bussers they are the reason this place is what it is they are on top of everything very helpful and nice my coffee stayed full the whole stay and if it wasn't for them being so attentive it wouldn't be what this place is true definition of the way a restaurant should be ran

RED VELVET ROLL TOO DIE FOR RECOMMEND TO EVERYONE

will be back soon thanks for the great experience

This place deserves all of the stars it has! There will be a wait but it is worth it. While the name suggests you get wildberry pancakes, I would order the cinnamon role. It melts in your mouth. Also, take advantage of the great coffee available. It will get you charged and ready for a great adventure in Chicago.

Ohhhhhhhhh I LOVVEED this place! Despite the hour and a half wait, the food was incredible and cheap! The berry blast pancake was beyond delicious and addicting! The service was quick and the place had a nice ambiance. I would definitely recommend this place if youre in Chicago!!!

Been here before and loved it. This time we waited 90 mins and when the food came out it was just not as good. Felt like it was rushed when cooking. Benedict florence was a bit overcooked. The omlette espanola was too junky tasting as well. Disappointed overall :(

Although this is in a very touristy area surprisingly delicious brunch. There wildberry pancakes are light and fluffly and SO good. Fairly extensive menu, service was good.

Although this place can yield 1.5 hours waits, if you use the noWait up... like we did, you can just walk right in.

I was here with a group of Ducks fans to watch our team play the Hawks, and stayed a few blocks away.  I yelped this place, and liked the photos and reviews, and, it seemed they could accommodate a group of 10 people.

We all ordered different things, and they all looked fantastic, and hearty portions.  The prices were a bit higher than say, a Denny's or IHOP, but its a local place that seems very popular, and freshly made.

This place is on my "come back" list when I am back in town.

Service was great. The food was good but not amazing - I got the veggie scramble with a pancake. Overall a good, reasonably priced breakfast, so recommended if you're looking for a spot to eat in the Loop.

Best breakfast I've ever had! Ordered two eggs scrambled with sausage patties well done, hash browns, and two chocolate chips pancakes. The eggs were the tastiest I've ever had. Everything was perfect including service. I'll make sure to stop here every time I'm in Chicago. A+++

pics.caption: Two eggs, sausage patties well done, hash browns and two chocolate chip pancakes

review.des: While I wouldn't say this place is fantastic or the best breakfast place I've been to (it's a little bit of a tourist trap TBH), it's still an all-around good option. Their menu is huge, and they allow "sides" of specialty pancakes (2 stack), so if you're like me and can't choose, you can have it all. The skillets are absolutely huge - enough for 2 meals in my opinion. And the signature berry bliss pancakes were very good! We got a strawberry smoothie too, and that was great!
I highly recommend the skillets and pancakes.  Our waitress JB was awesome! Your tastebuds will be pleasantly surprised!

Food: 8/10
I don't usually LOVE pancakes or HATE them but I order them from time to time. I didn't think I could do a whole entrée of pancakes this day so I opted for them as a side. My main dish was their Slow Roast Brisket hash with eggs on top. It was great. The potatoes came in good sized pieces and had a decent amount of crispy ones. The brisket  was nice and moist with a small sear on some of the pieces. The gravy on this was freaking great and really blended well with the potatoes (and balanced well too when you added ketchup). The pancakes on the side were good and they were  mabye just a bit overly sweet. The pancake texture was alright, with a bit of fluff (I love fluffy pancakes) and this had a decent amount. I'd definitely recommend if you were pancake person or just likes (or is even just okay) with pancakes.
Service: 7/10
Their service was pretty normal here IMO for such a packed and popular place. Had to look for our server a little bit but it wasn't terrible. Nothing really to add here.
Overall: 8/10
Additional Notes: This place is in a pretty prime location and also has some outdoor seating. If it was hotter in the summer, I wouldve really hated it but it was a nice cooly breezy (early) summer day so it was great. Loved eating outside. Also, a must use is the NoWait app which allowed us to virtually wait in line (which was FREAKING AMAZING).
The pancakes were cooked to Perfection. The eggs over easy and hash browns were awesome, the bacon beefy and really good. Loved the wild berry pancakes have won my repeat business.

I love wildberry. I live in Columbus, Ohio and dream of eating at wildberry almost daily. I had the Denver omelette, it was delicious! The pancakes are a perfect sweet side, and the hash browns are perfectly crisped. I'm not even ashamed of how much I ate here. My boyfriend had the signature bliss pancakes and every time he has similar pancakes he always compares them to wildberry's (and they're never as good). Would definitely recommend! Great views and a great staff.

Best omelette I've ever had. It was huge! Stuffed with tons of cheese and other fillings. The menu over all was impressive, a large breakfast selection and solid brunch/lunch selections, including some yummy-looking sandwiches and salads.

pics.caption: The biggest, best omelette I've ever had!

review.des:
Worth the wait!

This place has a wait on a Monday morning for a reason. The food was excellent. The portions were ridiculously huge.

The service was great. We never had to ask for a refill or wonder where the server was.

The check came...the price was low! I was very surprised!

Thanks, Wildberry! I'll be back soon!

A little late to the party since I visited about a month ago but still wanted to leave my thoughts. After reading all of the high-praise reviews, I was so excited to try this place. Unfortunately, they disappointed.

**this review is for take-out only

I ordered the corn beef skillet with a side of the signature berry bliss pancakes (what it seems like they're know for and everyone raves about). When I finally got my breakfast, I was so evicted to finally give this place a try; however, the corn beef skillet was filled with an abundance of potatoes and barely and corned beef. I felt like I just ordered the potato hash. The Berry bliss pancakes were disappointing. There was nothing really special about the pancakes - other than the fact it was drizzled with berry sauces. They didn't astound me like I thought they would (and the other reviewers raved about). They were solid pancakes though, just not worth the $11.50 you'd be shelling out if you ordered it right off the menu.

Again, I'd like to say that I ordered take out. I would definitely give this place another shot but only for dine in. Maybe the dishes I ordered didn't hold well to-go.

Tip: If you're thinking about grabbing take out, make sure you call 25 minute before. They get really backed up and you could find yourself standing around and waiting in the overly-packed restaurant.

pics.caption: Exterior - right next to millennium park. Look at that line..

review.des: Had a latte and the signature berry bliss French toast. Fantastic with fresh ripe blackberries, strawberries and blue berries. The filling is simply wow. Definitely worth the wait if you are ever in Chicago.

pics.caption: Signature berry bliss French toast. Fantastic with fresh ripe blackberries, strawberries and blue berries.

review.des:
Came to Chicago for July 4th weekend and my friends highly recommended wild berry pancakes, so I came here with a group of 4. We ordered banana bread french toast, southern egg Benedict , Napa valley fig omelette, and duck confit skillet.

The banana bread french toast was highly recommended by the waiter (his favorite) but it came out just like a banana bread. It was good but it was dryer than id liked.

The omelette was a solid omelette.

Egg Benedict was good because of the much needed sausage.

The duck confit was better than expected. I'm a big fan of skillets but the flavor of duck definitely helped.

The highlight of the meal were the upgraded side pancakes that came with the omelette and skillet. I really enjoyed the wild berry pancake - so fluffy, sweet and tender. Just the best addition to brunch.

It was a solid brunch but I don't know if I'd wait another hour and half just for it.

Really wish they take reservation.

wildberry pancakes was awesome! I was smart enough to use yelp to save my place in line while still at my hotel so that when i arrived i literally waited 5 minutes. i got a skillet which was delicious and my partner, he had bacon, eggs and a few other breakfast items which he really enjoyed it.

key tips:
1. use the app to hold your place in line.
2. order a skillet

Arrived at about 1 PM the place was packed waiting time was one hour. Me and my wife shared a garden skillet OMG it was amazing, served in a pan the hash brown was mixed with the veggie's with cheese on top, topped with two sunny side up cooked your way (you can do any style) it was delicious.

I also got the Oreo S'more signature pancake which prepared by pancakes with marshmallow sauce between the pancake and on top then chocolate syrup lightly spread over chocolate chip and crumbs of Oreo cookies. They were only a stack of two I ordered as a side. I only ate half of it.

TIP: they don't write it on the menu but when you ask for a half portion pancake the waiter will till you. It's either a stack of three or five.

The latte and cappuccino was not that exciting while you get a free refill on coffee.

Finally I WILL DEFIANTLY GO BACK AGAIN TO TRY NEW THING ON THE MENU.

Many kudos again to Yelp for helping find another fantastic place.  

It's located on the north side of Millennium park in the large building (kinda difficult to find at first if you've never been there).  After a short wait, we were taken to our table and the fun started there.  

The menu is packed full of delicious breakfast choices, we opted to go with the skillets and shared pancakes.  We did NOT go wrong, the food was just that good and the portions were huge (maybe even too big, I can't believe I'm even saying that).  I mean there's just so much food that you want to just lay down (which you can in the park across the street) afterwards.

If you're in Chicago, try this place for breakfast.  You won't regret it.  The cinnamon roll pancake is out of this world.

pics.caption: Denver skillet with wild berry pancakes.

review.des:
The 35 min wait for a table was worth it. The food was on point, everything was hot & fresh. Customer service was great, I believe our waiter name was "Nat". I paid for a meal & receive just that.

The red valet French toast was amazing!

pics.caption: Red valet French toast! Damn good, best French toast u ever had
Cinnamon roll pancakes! Right amount of sweetness. Did not need any syrup

review.des:
Wildberry will definitely be a must on my next trip to Chicago. I had breakfast there twice within my four day stay. I tried the Veggie Omelette, Garden Skillet (shareable) and the Berry Bliss pancakes. Amazing. The blackberry Lemonade was refreshing and sweetened to perfection.

From hosts to servers, the staff were very welcoming and friendly, which is always a plus!

The line/ wait can get long, but put your name down check out the park and hurry back when you get the handy text that alerts your table is ready.

Have now visited Wildberry about 6 times over a 3 year time frame and can honestly say it is always consistent in service food quality and value.. only drawback is it can be quite a wait especially on weekends.  But a testament to wildberry is I keep going back and enduring the wait due to the excellent food and service. All the dishes I have tried would recommend and would order again, pancakes, skillets, Benedict's .. especially the Mexican Benedict with chorizo.

Had breakfast there to start my first day in Chicago. Had the Denver Skillet with eggs over medium and sourdough toast. Fresh squeezed orange juice was awesome!!! With the skillets you can get either toast or pancakes. Many different choices of toast. Delicious!!!! And the wait staff is friendly too!!!

pics.caption: Denver skillet with eggs over medium and sourdough toast. Fresh squeezed orange juice. It's worth it just for the juice!!!!

review.des: I made my own omelette and also had tiramisu pancakes. The food was amazing and the service was great!! I would suggest downloading that app so you can put your name on the list at least an hour before you get there. If you just walk-in you could potentially wait an hour and 45 min at least for a table of two. (It would totally be worth it though!)

Let's talk about Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe. As a tourist of Chicago, or a tourist in general, I'm always looking for the best places for food and I of course, always visit Yelp for recommendations. After trying two different breakfast places that my boyfriend knew of, I went to Yelp and discovered Wildberry. We came here on a Sunday morning, expecting it to be somewhat slow, since it was early, however this was not the case. For a table of two, it was a 35 minute wait. Basically, this place is busy, so be prepared to wait.

When we sat down, we waited a bit for our server to come over. I won't lie, he didn't have the best appearance; his hair was a mess, his shirt was wrinkled, it seemed as if he rolled out of bed this morning. We ordered drinks, a coffee and a cappuccino, the coffee came immediately then, we waited, and we waited, and we waited. Ten minutes later, the server was walking by and I stopped him asking about the cappuccino as well as informing him we were ready to order. He said it would be "any moment" so we still waited. Finally, the drink came, after fifteen minutes of waiting...for food, I ordered their combo that included two pancakes, two eggs, your choice of meat, and hash browns. You could substitute regular pancakes for their speciality ones, which included chocolate chip, cinnamon roll, cranberry pecan, and many more. My boyfriend ordered the brioche french toast. When our food arrived, I realized my eggs were not cooked to how I requested however, at that point, I was starving and I could care less. Everything was very good, from the coffee, to the pancakes, including the hash browns and bacon, two thumbs up.

If I came back to Chicago, I would come back here. The only reason I am not giving five stars is the poor service, however everything else, five out of five.

My first visit to Chicago and this was our first stop for breakfast. Luckily the wait wasn't as long as I thought it would be. The inside of this restaurant is very elegant. Love the red walls and the natural stoned walls. The food was great! I had the corned beef hash egg Benedict. The strawberry vanilla smoothie was the good too. I'm usually not a big fan of pancakes but I must say, their pancakes were pretty good. Definitely recommend this place for breakfast. Our waitress, Esmeralda gave us great customer service, she went above and beyond to explain and provided us great service. Good job!

Until next time Chicago....

pics.caption: Strawberry vanilla smoothie! Best smoothie ever!!

review.des: We were recommended this restaurant by a friend! We are so happy we went, it is located across millenium park and gets very busy so be prepared to wait a little while but trust me it's worth it. Our breakfast was delish! Highly recommended! I will definitely be visiting again!

This place definitely gets a lot of foot traffic but I got here at the right time and was able to be seated right away. It's fairly big so I knew I wasn't going to be disappointed seeing all the seats/tables filled.

The menu looks super yummy but I was having a sweet craving and ordered the crepes. Very berry satisfied. Pun intended. I wish I could eat some everyday.

The coffee was a bit pricey for how it tastes ($4) but oh well. We'll thank Starbucks for that.

The staff/service was great. If/when I come back to Chitown I'll be sure to come back to this place.

pics.caption: The exclusive wildberry crepes and a toffee nut latte

review.des: Definitely book your table online in advance. The food is great, the coffee servings are amazing.

One of my favorite breakfast places! I have been here many times and have yet to have a bad experience and my food is always tasty! Wait time can be long at times but it's totally worth it!

Restaurant  is very spacious and clean. Friendly staff and reasonable prices.  Highly recommend for the  breakfast fanatic.

Good place for breakfast
Service very pleasant
Food is big portion and good but not really sophisticated.
Take some precaution for the waiting time: very popular place where tourists and locals line up for a table

I love this place! There is not one thing wrong with this restaurant. Overall, this place was excellent-service, food, price, and vibe. Our table ordered the skillets with signature berry bliss and cinnamon roll pancakes. They all were consistent in taste. The vanilla berry latte was also very delicious. Our server was so friendly and on point with everything. I would definitely come back.

Actually disappointing.  Not terrible, but disappointing.  Asked for the omelette to be 'loose' and it came with the outside fully browned.  Unfortunately the pancakes were just as gummy as most places serve.  And I kept having to ask for coffee refills.  They gave them quickly, but a better run place won't require the asking.
We ordered the hot Mexican skillet and their special berry waffle. The pancake was the winner, soft and has their distinct smell

Excellent food. Excellent service. Excellent location. If you are at all near the millennium park area I would highly recommend going. Get the signature pancakes. The lines can get really long on weekends but you can always go, put your name it, walk around the park, then come back to eat!

I found this place via Yelp and I am so glad I did. Although we waited for 30 minutes, it was totally worth it. I ordered egg whites, turkey bacon, fruit, and the cinnamon roll french toast. My colleague ordered the veggie omelet, a waffle, turkey sausage and fruit. The food was light, but flavorful. I love a good brunch spot. Two thumbs up!

I don't have a lot of details, because I went over a year ago. But the banana cream pie crepe was probably the best crepe I've ever had. I don't give away 5 star ratings either. Unfortunately I don't recall what my dining companion ordered. We live 5 hours away, but I want to go back JUST for the crepes. Wish we had this near us. If I ever go back for another reason, you can be sure I'll come here. We drove overnight and arrived very shortly after they opened on a Saturday, so we encountered no wait time. It did fill up pretty fast though. I don't think we had any complaints about speed of service.

Wildberry is a solid breakfast spot. When I know that I want a simple omlette or pancakes or eggs, I crave Wildberry. It always hits the spot and is always great food and quality.

However, it's ALWAYS jammed with tourists. Only downside of Wildberry.

I was walking past yesterday and saw a waiter carrying out a tray of something and it looked good so I made my family get up early today to eat breakfast. I see tons and tons of people commenting on the wait time to be seated but if you check in on the yelp app or use the NoWait app, it's hardly worth complaining about. I checked in mobile and 20 minutes later we were at a table. When we got there, the wait time was 90 minutes but take advantage of the check ins and the wait time will be minor.

My daughter and I ordered the berry bliss pancakes and they were fantastic. *Much* larger portions than necessary but they were delicious and I would definitely come back.
Best breakfast spot in Chicago!  Use the NoWait app for easy seating.  Fast service and the food is absolutely terrific.  Cinnamon roll pancake is ridiculous - a must!

We stumbled onto this gem by searching YELP, and the excellent reviews did not lie.  Huge portions, great food, and professional service make for the start of a nice day downtown.

The hash-browns are grated a little thicker than usually found in Dallas.  This allows for a longer cooking time on the flat-top, creating a fantastic browned crust.  Ketchip served in a ramekin and Cholula is available.

The corned beef hash is diced finely, so it mixes well with the rest of the plate.

The banana pancakes were simply over the top.

Go here for breakfast, now.

Crazy long wait for a snowy Monday morning, so I had high hopes. I ordered badly - got  a "sizzlin' skillet", which I think is doomed from the start. The hash browns have no hope of being crispy when served under vegetables and eggs (or really anything else for that matter). I love that one can opt for pancakes instead of toast. Chocolate chip pancakes were very good, as was fresh squeezed orange juice. I plan to return, order wisely, and be blown away. Will update review accordingly.
Great breakfast once again.  Hands down must do for breakfast in Chicago.  Had omelette, pancakes and hash brown!
Amazing Berry Bliss pancakes, skillets, and breakfast burrito! The latte was amazing too. Highly suggest this place for breakfast, but get there early!

pics.caption: Amazing skillet, burrito, and Berry Bliss pancakes

review.des: Amazing berry bliss and Mexican hash. I substituted beacon for the sausage and it was incredible. So much food too!! Five stars I want to eat it again. Tip: download the wait app so you can know the wait time. Or order togo.

Such a popular break/brunch place, if you go late, have to wait for long time. Well, the coffee was from intelligence, and was pretty good~ Nothing is better than that to start a day.
The portion of the food was very big, we can never finish the whole thing. This time, we loved the Southern Benedict with biscuits , sausage patties and poached egg. I loved it~the combination was so perfect. Biscuits was flaky and patties was juicy. The signature pancake was awesome! Fluffy, slightly crispy skin with perfect mix berry sauce, you have to try it. If the line is short, I will go back again and try other stuff they offer.

We enjoyed the food and coffee here, however my low rating is due to the subpar customer service and treatment we received from Peter Bovis. A member of our party went to use the restroom due to the long wait, and upon being called to be seated, Peter refused to seat us until our whole party was present. I don't mind their unique policy, however Peter conducted himself unprofessionally in communicating their rule and nonchalantly ignored me when I asked him a question. Despite the food being good, the customer service was off-putting, and thus I wouldn't come back nor recommend this place.

Very busy spot in the perfect location. The wait is ridiculous so I would advise to check in and get on the waiting list here on yelp. Super convenient! I got the cornbeef hash skillet with egg whites. It was a huge portion which I was only able to eat less than half of the order. The hash was good but not what I expected it to be. Kinda sad and disappointed. The hubby got the southern Benedict which he said was very good and finished it all. We also got an order of signature berry bliss pancakes which I would say was the best thing. I'm not very much of pancake person but these were yummy and moist and has such flavor. The ricotta in the pancakes was the perfect touch. Our friends got the special pumpkin spice and she said it was Delish and her hubby got the cinnamon roll pancake which he did say was the best and had the perfect amount of cinnamon. I'm glad I tried wildberry but not sure I would go out of my way to go back when in town.

My sister and I went on a busy day and time - about noon on a Sunday, we weren't in a big rush so we knew there would be a wait.
We stood at the hostess stand for about 2 minutes while four women stared down at their iPads, and talked among each other; no greeting.
When we received a text that our table was ready we followed a man with menus to the tables outside where he handed us the menus and said, "here you go, the first table that gets up is yours" and left us standing there watching everyone.  Food wasn't bad.  Our waiter's service was good.  We must have caught the rest of the staff on a bad day.

Best breakfast ever! It's been a few months since I was there but I still say it's the best pancakes I've ever had! I had the wild berry pancakes (I'm not the kind to ever order fruity pancakes) and omg am I glad I did!!!! Can't wait to come back!

You will wait. It will be worth it.

This place is expansive, especially for the area of Chicago it's in. The menu will please even the pickiest of eaters (I think. I hope.) and it will probably be too much food, but that's okay.

Got there at around 9:30 on a Sunday morning, with a party of 3. They estimated an hour to an hour and 15 minutes, and we were seated around 10:40. There are 8 or 9 different kinds of lemonade. I ordered the Pineapple lemonade, my friend ordered the kiwi lemonade. We both thought ours tasted good, but didn't really taste the flavoring that the menu promised.

Still, tasty. And refreshing. There were plenty of condiments brought over to go with our sides of toast, pancakes, skillets and sandwiches/chips. The garden skillet was packed with veggies, hashbrowns crisped up perfectly, with gooey eggs over easy, spilling over everything.

We had 2 hours on the meter on Stetson, where we found parking, and we got back to our car (including the wait) with 5 minutes remaining.

Bill for 3, before tip was right around $50.
The food is fantastic (try the omelets or wild berry pancakes), but the wait was lengthy, and the restaurant is very loud.

Food was average.  Very packed as already mentioned.  Practically hitting elbows with other diners and so loud you couldn't have a conversation.  Even with the Yelp waitlist feature we waited another hour past the time we were told to be there.  The food was not worth it.  I wish we hadn't waited and found a small obsolete cafe off the beaten path as we did the day prior.

I thoroughly enjoyed my Signature Berry Bliss French Toast. I accidentally ordered the Wildberry French toast by mistake and asked my waitress Andrea if they could just drizzle the toppings of the Signature Berry Bliss. They obliged but actually remade the order. I'm grateful to have been accommodated without any attitude.

Overall the taste and quality of the food was good. The service and food wait time were great. The price point is affordable. I came at 7:35am so I was able to get seated right away. Usually there is a wait. I recommend this place for breakfast or brunch and I'll undoubtedly be back.

The tip I have is to walk, bike, or bus because parking is extremely expensive. $8.00 for 1.5hrs.

pics.caption: Signature Berry Bliss French Toast with vanilla anglaise, blackberry coulis, berry mascarpone, fresh berries and powdered sugar.

review.des: We arrived and were told about a 45 minute wait, which I anticipated. However, they seemed so annoyed about it. A few employees at the hostess stand were discussing how they wish they could just turn people away. I thought that was so rude, especially since I asked if it was too late to be put on a wait list since they closed in an hour and a half. Feeling unwanted, we left and went somewhere else, then 10 minutes later we received a message our table was ready. We didn't bother going back. We didn't know you can take a coffee or beverage to go either, it would have been nice to be offered that option while we waited.
Came here with family. Oreo pancakes very sugary made my little brother feel sick. Wait wasn't that long
Best breakfast I have ever had in USA. Garden is the best dish for breakfast  it contains eggs with vegetables and mix with the hash browns  Waffles and Crepes are so delicious

pics.caption: Garden,Waffle, Crepe and the berry pancake

review.des: I don't give many 5 star reviews, but this place deserves it! My husband and I are visiting from Boston, and weren't quite sure if we should stay after seeing the long wait lines, but it's worth it! Great selection with a ton of fun breakfast options. I got the classic eggs benedict which came with a good portion of hash browns and it was delightful. My hubby got a scramble with a side of pancakes, and it was equally as enjoyable. We'll return on our next visit to Chicago !

The pancakes were perfection, and I couldn't part from the Rutherford? Omelette (bacon, onion, spinach & goat cheese). Kids tried different options, then decided they liked s'mores and plain buttermilk best.
We went there 3 times during our week vacation because it was THAT GOOD!  Yelp waitlist worked great. Our hotel was close, but u can wait at Millennium Park until you get the second text then walk over to wait for a few more minutes. It's not worth hanging out with the crowds at the restaurant when you don't have to. Mid/late week, we saw 30-60 wait times. Saturday, wake up early and jump on yelp quickly since wait times can be two hours or longer.

My husband and I shared the Rutherford omelette 3 times with hash browns and a side of 2 pancakes. Twice we has berry bliss (amazing!), and the cinnamon roll ones came in as a great second. That was the perfect size for us, but if you want an oversized meal, get your own.  Enjoy!

Arrived at the cafe around 8:30 a.m. and the wait was about 45 minutes. While we waited we read reviews and had a great view of Millennium park right across the street.

I didn't pay much attention to the time but it felt much shorter than they stated so that was nice. When they seated us they already had water on our table and took our order promptly.

They were pretty busy so food times were a bit longer than I would have liked but after I received my food all that waiting was tossed out the window! The corned beef hash skillet was divine! And the banana cream pie pancakes were perfection! I didn't even need syrup.

They were are not the best pancakes I've had but still very good! Such unique flavors it was great. My friend got the Mexican skillet and the cinnamon roll pancakes and she loved it!

Overall, very nice atmosphere, great location, decent service and delicious food! Definitely worth your time!

pics.caption: Mhh mhh mhh!.corned beef hash skillet and banana cream pie pancakes!

review.des:
Stopped here for breakfast before exploring the Millennium Park. The wait was about 30 minutes before being seated which wasn't too bad.

I had the vegetable omelet with hash browns on the side. The omelet was delicious but the hash browns had no taste. The pancakes ordered by customers nearby looked yummy but I opted for something less sweet.

Thumps up to the service and quantity.
Signature berry bliss Pancakes are amazing. Even they had berry frost in between the layer. The veggie omelette with avocados is a different combo to give a try.

Wait time was 45 min. Luckily we had the patio tables settled up with which the wait time was 30 min

pics.caption: Veggie Skillet, veggie omelette & signature berry bliss pancakes!!!

review.des:
Food is great, but you may have to wait...

Famished after finishing the 2016 Hot Chocolate 15K, my girlfriend and my run-buddy were insistent on going to Wildberry, as they had both been there before and loved it. We get up to the hostess stand and are told the wait will be about two hours. Now, I was still feeling good coming off of my runner's high from the race, and didn't want to spoil the experience for my two dining partners, but frankly if it were up to me, unless Thomas Keller is going to come by the table and shave black truffle over my omelet, there's pretty much nowhere I'm willing to wait two hours to eat. You can catch me on Randolph sitting on the curb, eating a couple egg McMuffins outta the bag.

But, in the democratic spirit, I kept that opinion to myself and we put our name on the list. We hung out in the park, and the time estimate of two hours was almost exactly right. When they finally sent the text letting us know it was our turn, we came in through the front and were whisked into a busy, but not chaotic dining room. Our server was great, clearly busy but did not rush us at all, and we ordered fairly quickly. The food came out in very reasonable amount of time, too, considering it was a packed house. I had the Venetian skillet, which was heavenly, and enormous. My gf had eggs and the specialty pancakes with fresh berries, which were also very good.

All things told, I would highly recommend this place for their food alone, and kudos to those who are able to mitigate the wait time through the app everyone on here has mentioned. If you can get your name on the list as early as possible so you're not stuck waiting so long, you should be in for an excellent breakfast!

Recently, I visited the great city of Chicago for the first time. I had the pleasure of dining at this wonderful place. It is smack dab in the middle of downtown Chicago, just north of the famous Millennium Park.

I noticed the line to get in was long. This should be expected due to its touristy location. But me and my party talked for a bit and interacted with others. Time flew by fast and it was finally our turn to be seated. It was at this time that I wondered if the wait was worth it. Yes it was!

The restaurant was indeed packed and you could tell by the noise level. However, for this to be a packed place, the servers moved pretty fast, took our orders and brought us our food seemingly without hesitation as if we were the only customers there. And they did with a great smile, very reminiscent of Southern hospitality.

I kept it simple and ordered egg whites, turkey bacon, hash browns and wheat toast. Additionally, I ordered coffee. My breakfast was brought out to me just the way I ordered it. Being that I am one of the most pickiest eaters alive, I can appreciated when my food is prepared to my specifications and does not need to be taken back to the kitchen. I loved the way they cooked their hash browns. The turkey bacon was crisp and not soggy. The coffee was perfect and did not have that burnt smell to it.

Once again, this place is VERY busy. However, the restaurant staff does not skip a beat and can make you feel as if you (and your party) are the one(s) there.

This is definitely a good downtown spot for breakfast!
simple perfect. food was good and the homemade juice, oh god. the stack of pancakes are fortfilling for lunch.

Came for breakfast on a Monday around 9:30AM and there wasn't a wait :) When we got out around 10:30 it was really busy. Glad I tried this! I'll forever remember the pancakes!

FOOD
Wild berry pancakes (5 stars): so good! Mascarpone was amazing on it. Pancakes are so fluffy and light. Get this!

SERVICE
Great service. On top of all our requests. They go pretty fast since they have so many people waiting for tables!

I learned something about myself this weekend. I learned that maybe breakfast CAN be good! Thank you, Wildberry, for opening my eyes to the potential of breakfast foods.

I wanted to try the infamous pancakes, but I didn't want an entire stack of them. Solution? Order an entree that included pancakes on the side. Add an extra dollar to get the "specialty" pancakes, which basically "upgraded" my pancake to the Wildberry per my selection. So I ordered the corned beef hash and with Wildberry pancakes on the side. I also had an option to have hash browns or fruits on the side. I went with the fruits.

The pancakes were amazing. They were soft and fluffy. Wasn't too heavy to eat, and then they put on a perfect amount of berry flavored cream onto it. In between each pancake there is more cream and even blueberries in each pancake. They were delicious! I'm not a breakfast person nor do I particularly like pancakes because I get tired of them after a few bites, but Wildberry has found the perfect recipe. Don't add syrup to it. You'll ruin it. Shame on you if you do. This masterpiece needs nothing added to it. It was so wonderful, I found myself going back to my pancakes instead of working on my corned beef hash.

Speaking of the corned beef hash, it was mediocre. Any typical corned beef hash for you. Nothing special.

This was about $11 for the meal, pre tax, pre gratuity.

TIP: Wait can be up to an hour long on a Saturday. So plan ahead!

It was such a long wait, but I went to try it out because of all the rave.
The location is very convenient but the food wasn't any different from other brunch restaurants. It's worth a try though.

The food is great. The gluten free pancakes are yummy. They even have real maple syrup available if you ask. I have gotten the ham scramble twice and they'll substitute GF pancakes for the hash browns and avocado instead of toast. Expect to wait. Put your name on the wait list here on Yelp... Especially on the weekend!

Hands down my favorite place brunch place ever in the entire world that I've tried so far. Okay, that was dramatic but for reals. This place is SO GOOD. It's a must-go for every tourist visiting the Bean since it's literally right across from there. I usually get there pretty early so I've never had to wait that long.Their menu is extensiveeee...but my favorite is the Butcher Block with specialty pancakes (either the berry bliss or tiramisu). You MUST get the skillet + pancake special...its only like $3 more and it's so worth it because you get both savory and sweet without having too much. They're also huge portions and for a whole skillet and 2 huge and delicious pancakes, it's extremely shareable with another person. They also serve Intelligensia coffee and lattes & they're super yummy :) Good to get to-go for your walk around the Bean! Such a good brunch place that's super worth the price.

The service was terrible! Waited for about forty minutes and then when they called us we waited another hour or so all the while standing with a small child! We spoke to he host multiple times about the wait and they kept calling parties of four( we were four) multiple times in front of us! Each time they told us we had not been taken off the list but they did not call us. We would have left had there been any other options nearby without a wait! Our only other option was Dublin donuts! Very disappointed!!

Typical run off the mill quantity-over-quality breakfast/brunch spot. A lot of tourists and folks who work at Prudential come here. Not a place to impress on Chicago's dining scene if that's what you're looking for since there are way many other amazing chef-driven quality brunch spots in the city. Similar experience to Yolk.
One of the best meals we had in Chicago! Portion are huge and delicious! Great to know we could put our name on the waitlist. By the time we walked from the hotel our table was ready.
The breakfast is great and the staff is always polite. The only downside is long wait times (because everyone knows how delicious the food is, lol).

At over 1,100 reviews with a 4.5 star rating I came in with high expectations and they were definitely met.

We came in for brunch, but it was 8am, so we ate breakfast... it was just as good as brunch would have been, I am sure.

As our waitress described, the place is as large as a 747... tables for days.
Excellent food, but it's always so crowded. The wait is always pretty long, but worth it. I love their pancakes (so fluffy!) and their salads are really nice too (very big portions).

Give me a break...2 hr wait...not worth it at all! Pancakes were just generic (nothing special). The berries are just thrown on top of already cooked pancakes. The hash browns are just bags of hash browns browned and thrown on the plates. In a city with about 30000 places to eat, reader you can do better. Better places with better service and better food are all around Chicago. Pass on this

In town from FL with a couple of girlfriends. The food was A+, as well as the service. One of my friends wasn't feeling well and Gihad made her laugh with his jokes and table conversation. Constantly checked up on us despite how busy he was and always had a smile on his face. In fact, every employee had a smile despite the lunch rush. The corn beef eggs bene was EGGcelent :) will be suggesting to friends!!
Great breakfast with many options. We got our order fast and out server was nice recommending options.

Love it. First time here, and we'll be back next time we visit this amazing city! I chose this place based on the huge number of highly-rated reviews (2,600 Yelpers can't be wrong..). I did not expect to wait 30 minutes for a table at 10:30 AM on a Tuesday morning. The place is packed! Yes, it's all worth it. Our group of three ordered various omelettes with sides of specialty pancakes. Our server, Mike, accommodated my request for strawberries instead of the seasonal fruit cup, and he basically made sure we had everything we wanted/needed to enjoy our experience here. Thank you, Mike! The food is outstanding and was ready in five minutes, or at least it seemed to be really fast. Great place. Five stars all around.

pics.caption: Side of specialty Berry Medley pancakes...it's even better than it looks!

review.des: This place was just alright. Food was mediocre and service was okay; not terrible, not great. I don't know, I'd probably never go back

pics.caption: Mexican Skillet w/ a side of pancakes, Signature Berry Bliss French Toast, Chai Tea Latte w/ a shot of espresso

review.des: We had such a great experience at wildberry! Our server, Jeremy, made some great recommendations. Even with a completely full restaurant he was so attentive and full of energy. The food could not have been any better and our specialty coffee drinks were delicious.

I've always been told that this is a MUST when I come to Chicago, so I was really excited to finally get a chance to go on a trip up. My husband and I came up at about 7 am and were very easily seated on a Sunday morning - but the tables definitely filled up quickly. I ordered the Mexican Skillet and my husband ordered a side of pancakes and the Eggs Benedict. All of them were above average, but it's what you would expect from a diner. Great for a post boozy night! Only four stars since I felt like it was something I could have experienced at another place, but I would come back!

Amazing! The egg on the hot skillet was divine and one of the best breakfast meals I have had. They don't allow you to share coffee so there's that. Their pancakes were good but not overly amazing. The service is speedy if you have a smaller party otherwise you have to wait
The best. Though waiting time was tedious, food just compensated all the time I have waited.

Oh my goodness, if I have to wait an hour I expect exceptional food and service. Let me tell you that we ended up only waiting 35 minutes. And, I can not express to you how worth the wait this place was.

We tried the Classic Eggs Benedict, Denver Scramble, and the pancakes. The service was quick, all the items were delicious. I may even go back and wait another hour tomorrow for more hollandaise sauce.

It's amazing. Just amazing.

I came for breakfast and thoroughly enjoyed myself here! It was nice seating and pretty big. I loved my coffee it wasn't that water brew coffee so I appreciated it. The family enjoyed the different pancakes! Good stuff! I finally got some hash browns that are crisp and not oily, which was a gem to get.

The manager is such an A hole . I told him my pancakes were cold & he put the plate in my face and told me to feel the bottom. I felt really uncomfortable & all of the staff kept looking & laughing at me. It gave me bad anxiety & felt an urgent need to leave.  It was ridiculously horrible customer service but our server was a sweetheart.  I was embarrassed and harassed. I serve in fine dining. I'm also in law school.  It was difficult for me to put myself in the lawyer prospective or in server prospective. Waste of my money because I was looking forward to coming. nick Bodis is the worst manager I've ever dealt with.

Awesome brunch...eat outside if you can...that way you can people watch and rub it into all of the health nuts running by you catch a wiff of the cinnamon french toast.  They will look at you with pure disgust....priceless!

This is the best breakfast on the planet. The Berry Bliss pancakes are unbelievable. All the skillets and benedicts are outstanding. Friendly, efficient service. Be prepared to wait - but it is worth it!!!

Honestly, I don't get the hype. Waited an hour for a table.

The entryway is a genuine hazard - someone is gonna get hurt there with the crowd of people and the revolving door.

Service was excellent. Friendly waitress, fast and attentive staff.

The menu and the food were pretty boring. I had the turkey burger, which was bland and came with a salad that had zero personality - greens from the bag with simply chopped cucumber, tomato and onion. My wife had the southwestern wrap and ordered a grapefruit half that she had to send back because it looked and tasted like it was cut last weekend - dry and shriveled.

Denver, our home, has a breakfast craze going and features restaurants full of amazing ingredients creatively combined to make interesting and delicious menu items. Wildberry was just plain and boring. The hype seems to be about serving giant breakfasts, for which no awards should be given.

I'm an out of towner who was wooed by the yelp reviews and yelp didn't lie! This place was excellent.

My server was super sweet. I ordered a honey toffee nut latte based on her suggestion and it was super good. Pretty and very tasty but not too sweet.

For breakfast, I ordered the veggie skillet with a side of the cinnamon roll pancakes. They were both extremely delicious. The skillet did need a tad bit of salt and I wish I wouldn't have gotten spinach in it because there was a lot of it, but otherwise it was good. It was a huge portion. I only ate about 1/3 of the skillet because I wanted to eat my pancakes. The pancakes were soo good! Tasted just like a cinnamon roll but still had the lightness of a pancake. Perfect!

Oh, I came on a Tuesday morning around 9 am and had about a 10 minute wait, maybe even less.

I would highly suggest Wildberry!

Oh my gosh! That's all I can say! If you haven't been here you HAVE to try this place. Between the 3 of us EVERYTHING we got was spot on! I got the southern Benedict which was delish! I highly recommend this place! Also our server Sofiya was so sweet and helpful and fully attentive even when they were jam packed.

I come here for one reason only, and that is to get the s'mores pancakes. These things are a bucket of sugar shoveled into your mouth, but they are fantastic and I love them.

You also can't go here on a weekend morning, because the wait is unbearable, but that wait should give you perspective on how good this place is.

Another good thing to try are the skillets. I normally get something like the lumberjack or something (yea I know it's not Dennys) but all I remember is that it has like 4 different types of meat.

AND THEY HAVE Cholula!

To be fair, they made me aware of the witing time.
Having said that. ..
there was an hour and a half wait just to get in. Then I had to wait another 15 minutes to place my order.
I haven't tried the food yet, but even if it is the best breakfast of my life, it already ruined my plans for the day in such a vibrant city

Nice location and great service. Their pancakes are delicious!! Also tried the veggie wrap and veggie omelette and they were amazing. Prices are very decent and they serve huge quantities in single portion.

pics.caption: Pancakes with caramelized apples and pecans.

review.des: Best breakfast place in the loop, by far. Quick service, great portions, and prices are pretty standard.

The food & lemonade drinks were AMAZING!! It's definately a spot I would enjoy having brunch at everytime I visit Chicago!  The staff was super friendly & every plate that came out looked delicious!

The picture I shared is of the Rustic Farm Egg Pannini!

pics.caption: The food & lemonade drinks were amazing!! It's definately a spot I would enjoy having brunch at everytime I visit Chicago!

review.des: Food was good but expect a long wait. We went on a holiday weekend so maybe this is why the wait was longer, I don't know.  They will take your phone number and text you when your 5 min from seating, which is a nice touch. However we waited at least another 15 min after checking back in to be seated. Again it's a holiday weekend.

YUM YUM YUM! This place is great! My boyfriend and I were visiting Chicago for the weekend and I found this place via Yelp. We tried to come on a Friday afternoon, but we lost track of time and arrived just as they closed :( HOWEVER, we were able to come back on Sunday around 9 AM (yay!) for an early brunch before walking around the city.

When we arrived the wait was anticipated to be 45 minutes, but we ended up waiting 30 minutes. I got the Wildberry Signature Bliss Belgian Waffle, which was SOOOO good. The berries were tart, but they played off nicely against the sweet cream that was spread on top of the waffle. My boyfriend got the red velvet french toast and was not disappointed. He was a little disappointed at first that there were only 3 pieces (for reference he's 6ft. 3in with an appetite) but was barely able to finish his meal. The red velvet french toast is deceiving in that the cream between the rolls is dense and will make you full quickly.

Our server, Nate, was great! He was friendly, efficient, and made sure we had everything we needed. We didn't feel rushed even though there were so many people waiting for a table. The busboys were also very helpful. One of them noticed our table was uneven and put a tile underneath our table so that it wouldn't wobble while we ate.

If I'm ever back in Chicago I will definitely come back!
I have been here a few times and have walked in at 7 am on a Saturday or Sunday to find 30-40 people already enjoying breakfast that early. I love their banana cream crepe and any of their skillets.

If you're looking for an amazing breakfast place..you'll find it here! Located in the loop you can easily walk across the street and check out the bean while you wait  for them to text you that your table is ready. (it fills up fast so get there early!!) Alex was our waitress and was super friendly and helped us navigate through the menu( everything sounded so good) our table finally decided on sharing a few of the favorites..all were a hit!! The berry bliss pancakes were fluffy and just the right amount of sweet. The eggs Benedict with chorizo was amazing! The brisket is a must with a side of their hash. And then cinnamon roll pancakes are super sweet...just like a roll! Just so yourself a favor and try it!

Best. Pancakes. Ever.
And surprisingly reasonablly priced! Make sure you book ahead with open table or you get there early in the morning though!

Best brunch I've ever had. There is a crazy wait on weekends but it was worth it. I will definitely be coming back, everything on the menu looked amazing and my egg panini was unbelievable. The coffee is delicious and the servers are so friendly and attentive. Go to Wildberry for brunch!

I would give five stars had it not been for the long wait. We decided to try on a busy Sunday and while I understand it's a popular place, waiting over an hour without having adequate waiting area was rather uncomfortable. I had their signature berry bliss pancakes and they were decadent and delicious. My husband tried the chocolate chip waffles and thought they were the perfect balance of chocolate and waffle. Will return but on a day that's not as busy.

Restaurant is located across from the Bean. Very crowded therefore you must expect a long wait time. It took is about 1.5 hours to get in. We ordered Southern benedict, Wildberry Signature Berries Pancakes and Chicken Sausages. The food was decently good. The Chicken Sausages were my favorite. Be warned that the Sausages are quiet small.

After the raving reviews, we went to Wildberry while visiting Chicago. It's a great option for tasty breakfast fare. I had the fig and bacon omelette, which was a new combo and quite good! The omelette was light and fluffy, plus it comes with pancakes. So, of course I had to upgrade and get the signature strawberry bliss pancakes. Yum! We were most impressed with was the speed of service. If you can, I recommend going during the week. I can tell the weekends get crazy, but they allow you to add your name to the waitlist before you arrive, which is a great idea (why don't more places figure this out?!).  Overall, a great breakfast spot!
How about I don't do the whole review thing and you just skip right to my pictures....
It is good nothing extraordinary..may be all those ratings are from the tourists as it is close to the bean :-)

Corned. Beef. Benny.

All you need to know. Yelp said my review was too short so the wait kinda sucks but you can hang out in the park before your coma you are about to enter. Worth the wait

Fantastic food and service. Use the check-in ahead feature, it worked great and hit the check in time a minute early. My daughter had the Kids Berry Bliss pancakes, which she loved and were an amazing portion for $5. She also ordered a side of bacon (crispy) for $2.50. They were large pieces done perfectly. My wife created her own omelet and substituted the toast for the strawberry pancakes. She was amazed. I had the Southern Benedict with cinnamon roll pancakes. Awesome balanced flavor of sweet and savory. The food was enhanced with fantastic service from Jeremy B. I will definitely be back next time I am in town.
This is the BEST breakfast place in Chicago! The food is delicious and the service is great! Be prepared to wait though, especially on the weekend! But, in my opinion, it's so worth it!!

Their signature berry bliss pancakes are to die for! They look super sweet but they are just the right about of sweetness for breakfast.

After talking to a local, this place is always busy and there is always a wait. Don't let the wait discourage you. Once you're in, you will not wait long for your meal.

Great service and great food. I will definitely return to Wild Berries the next time I'm in Chicago.

pics.caption: These pancakes look super sweet, but they are just right amount of sweetness!

review.des: Food is phenomenal. The berry cream pancakes were amazing. Husband had the Barbacoa skillet which was phenomenal. Go early to get a seat with a shirt wait.
Shockingly inexpensive, but holy crap is it hard to get in on the weekends. Fantastic service, despite how busy they are. Really good food. I've paid much more for less tasty in Chicago.

Came here around 9am on a Friday morning. You'd think on a work day there wouldn't be a lot of people here but boy was I wrong! This place was paaaaaacked! That's a good sign because it means the food is good!

Instead of waiting for a table, I decided to just have my food to-go. I ordered the breakfast platter of scrambled egg whites, turkey bacon, hash browns, and the fruity pebbles French toast to satisfy the kid in me :) the staff was extremely polite despite the hecticness and craziness in the restaurant. My food came out quickly and I was able to get out of there alive haha

The food wasn't amaaaaaaaazing but it was good and very worth the wait. It is fairly priced and I definitely recommend it as a place to visit if you're a Tourist like I am lol

I've been to Wildberry on two different occasions and both were great experiences. Most recently, I chose Wildberry as the place to be for four of my friends and I to eat for Valentine's Day breakfast. Everywhere else in the Loop area took reservations were completely full for Valentine's Day, so we were lucky that Wildberry doesn't take reservations.

We arrived at 9 AM and I was given a buzzer to hold while waiting for the table. I was quoted a 40-45 minute wait, which was cutting it close for my friend's schedule, but it wasn't as bad as it could have been. I was delightfully surprised when we were seated after only a 25-minute wait! One of our party hadn't arrived yet, but we were still seated. Our orders were taken quickly and the food also came out quickly. Our friend arrived 15 minutes in and we already had our food before she even placed her order. We had some trouble flagging down the waitress throughout the meal, but it was admittedly a very busy day. The whole meal start to finish took 45 minutes only. They definitely were trying to free up tables, understandably so!

I had the berry bliss pancakes, which were about $11. There were fresh blueberries, strawberries, and blackberries and a huge stack of pancakes. There were two kinds of berry syrup drizzled in a pattern on them, making them Instagram-perfect. If you're into that kind of thing (I am). My friends really enjoyed their very berry breakfasts in the crepe and french toast form.

I will definitely be back here on a less busy day when the service is a little more attentive. My friend did mention that she had tried to come here before on a weekend and were quoted a 2.5 hour wait. Yiiiiiikes. It is worth the wait!
Top 2 fries and top 2 cinnamon roll pancakes, 10/10 would come again.. also my stomach hurts cause I ate too fast but I would consume more

We were told by many people that this was a must try place in the Downtown area & I would 100% agree! First off we went very early (probably 7:30am) so we had no wait at all, but as we left we saw the busy rush start to come! I started off with an iced coffee and it was super good, I am an iced coffee addict and I would recommend it to everyone. It was also super nice because their cafe is right in the front so you can order coffee to drink while waiting for your table or food! My mom ordered a custom omelet and thought it was really good besides a little too much cheese, and their regular buttermilk pancakes as a side (which were amazing and a perfect simple pancake!) I had their veggie omelet with egg whites and LOVED it. It was super fluffy and the veggies were not over cooked or anything. The best part in my opinion though we're the chocolate chip pancakes, they were so perfect and the chocolate chips were only on top, but it didn't both me at all!! We both loved their hash browns as a side as well because they were so crispy and buttery. Most importantly all of our food was hot, done exactly as we asked, and we had good/fast service too! We didn't end up trying the famous berry bliss pancakes, but I saw some across the restaurant and wish I would have ordered some! I would tell anyone coming to the area to check this place out for their amazing breakfast opinions executed perfectly! Also got take out online from here the next day and they had  it done right on time, order was right too.

pics.caption: Chocolate chip pancakes (AMAZING) and veggie egg white omelette.
My moms food in the background: omelette & buttermilk pancakes. Mine: omelet with egg whites & chocolate chip pancakes

review.des: Fantastic breakfast... Pancakes are to die for and they serve Intelligentsia coffee!!!!

Across from Millenium Park.. which is a good thing because the wait to get seated is rediculous; place was packed!  The food is great though.  To compare..  the ommlettes/ grittles are not as good as The West Egg's.. but the pancakes/ waffles/ etc are by far top shelf.  Food came in about 10 minutes after being ordered too!!  The men's and women's restrooms were completely out of hand towels to dry off with buuuut they had the blow dryers.

pics.caption: Signature berry bliss french toast, side of crispy bacon, a loaded potato omelette, and chocolate chip pancakes!

review.des:
Didn't see what all the hoopla was about.
We were told it would be thirty-five minutes, ended up being seated after one hour.  Dry eggs,  tasteless turkey sausages,
and very crowded atmosphere.

Great dark roast coffee. There will be a short wait but it's worth it. Next time I'm getting the crepes!
Rutherford omelet was STUFFED with creamy goat cheese, thick cut bacon and spinach.

The wait is crazy, so I recommend making a reservation. Even still, well worth the hassle of getting on the wait list. The classic wildberry pancakes were out of this world, they didn't even need syrup. The garden skillet is something I would order time and time again. My partner ordered a dish that consisted of biscuits, sausage and gravy & it was so rich and delicious. We would definitely visit wildberry again.
I ordered glazed blueberry pancakes. Surprisingly, the glaze was not overly sweet and there were plenty of blueberries. Pancakes were super soft and fluffy, and there were enough pancakes to share.

Coming from SF this spot is a must try must eat in Chicago. The food is amazing the service was phenomenal (Kimberly was our server). We tried the signature bliss berry crepes, the corned beef skillet with cinnamon roll pancakes and the los altos Benedict and 2 cups of coffee. Everything from start to finish was delightful and would definitely recommend this to anyone who loves breakfast.  Food comes out fast and we didn't even have to ask for condiments Kimberly kept us well stocked.

I'm only giving them 5 stars because their pancakes were the best ones I've ever tasted. They were light, fluffy and not too thin or thick.

Everything else on their menu is basically whatever. Stick to pancakes. My friend ordered the blueberry and I got the chocolate chip. Incredible, truly.

The only thing that was a turn off about this place was the wait time. We arrived a little before noon and weren't seated until 1:15pm. It was about an hour and a half wait. Worth it? Probably.

The best pancake I've ever had! I had the Signature Berry Bliss pancake which had berries baked into the pancake with fresh berries and cream on top. So delicious! I also had the Denver skillet to add some protein to my meal - delicious as well.
Nice ambiance and friendly staff made this an ultimate breakfast experience.
I will be back the next time I visit Chicago.

Followed the reviews and wasn't let down! I ate alone and ordered a garden skillet with two eggs over easy - simply amazing. Good food, simple, not greasy. I probably would have skipped the cheese, but decided to splurge - totally worth it. I ordered a side of wild berry pancakes just to try. Not really my taste - just too sweet - would be a great dessert though! It was seriously a lot of food for one person! Coffee was good too. Lucky for me it's was a weekday, so I only waited 5 minutes.

pics.caption: Garden bowl with 2 eggs over easy and a side of wild berry pancakes

review.des: Great brunch experience! You can put your name on the waiting list from home on the no wait app, and on a weekend the wait can be 120 minutes, so works out really well! They were also able to combine two separate reservations for us for outside seating on a Sunday! Great service overall! We had the breakfast burrito, Mexicana scrambler and a side of cinnamon roll pancakes! All around excellent food. One of the top brunch spots in Chicago!

Great service and breakfast done right regardless of your preference for sweet or savory.
I had the Rutherford, an amazing omelette with spinach, bacon and goat cheese. This came with a choice of toast or pancakes. I opted for the fig and walnut pancakes. The side of pancakes was enough for a meal in itself!  
Really tasty food, an extensive menu and top notch service. Don't miss it!
This place is fantastic. Had there berry pancake,  and chipotle omlette. Everything was great. Place is very busy so service might be a bit slow. Worth the wait.

This place is freaking awesome! First place my girlfriends and I went for brunch in Chicago and I left this restaurant full, happy, content, and sad that it ended so soon. There was a bit of a wait early in the morning, but I understand why people would wait. We put our name down, got tea from a local tea shop, took a walk around downtown, and received a text that our table is ready. We all ordered our own separate dish as well as pancakes to share. I can't get enough of how they have amazing tiramisu pancakes! Our waiter was attentive and cracked couple of jokes- even shared areas on where we should go during our trip in Chicago. Loved this place and would definitely come back whenever I visit again!

This place is fantastic! Yes, it is a long wait. Yes, it is worth it. But be smart about it and use the NoWait app! We "checked in" while still in the hotel, got ready, walked there and only waited about 10 minutes with 70+ people waiting outside. Went there twice on our trip and had the scrambles (all good) and a variety of pancakes. The wildberry bliss is fresh and yummy, the cinnamon roll pancake is SUPER sugary sweet (too much for us), and the banana creme pie pancakes are my fav! Hats off to the owners for keeping this busy place well staffed and we always had friendly servers. I will miss this place when we go back home!

Chitown has no shortage of breakfast/brunch spots,but Wildberry is def top 2-3 in my book!
Go-to brunch spot when people visit..delicious meal & generous portions,you can't go wrong. I've tried several items & love them all..last time had the chicken,spinach,feta,sundried tomato omelette..Holy $#%^... Get.It.Now.
And berry bliss pancakes/french toast!

We got here at 7.50am on Labor Day Sunday and it was only a 25 minute wait. So top tip - get here earlier, it's worth not waiting an extra hour.

Menu looked incredible so was very hard to choose. Service was speedy and very friendly - our waiter was a real joker.

My husband loved his hazelnut latte and I thought my English breakfast tea was the best I've had in the states. Husband order the sizzling plate - huge portion and comes with pancakes. I got the omelette, again huge, but also so good I managed to finish it.

Great place, you couldn't beat it.

Great food. Great service. Huge portions.
Long wait, but... it was prime brunch time and still well worth it.
Amazing breakfast!  Best omelet ever and wonderful fresh fruit and great coffee!  Great place with wonderful food and friendly staff and right next to Millennium Park.

Had Denver Skillet with Wildberry Pancakes.  Skillet was above average and those pancakes were incredible.  Serving size was quite generous.  

Very busy place, but was seated in about ten minutes.  Wait staff was very attentive.

I'll be back!
Good breakfast. Not that special though. I wouldn't wait two hours to eat here. Use the Nowait app to get in line before you get there. Best decision I have ever made..

Wow ! This place is absolutely amazing, how I wish we had one in Miami.

Food: we went twice to wildberries cafe just bcUss it was that good, we tried the Denver skillet ( good enough for two), if you get 2 skillets for 2 people it will be way too much food, unless you eat a lot of course. I had the berry pancakes, it brought strawberries, wildberries and blueberries. I had the cinnamon  bun pancakes literally tasted like a cinnamon bun ! I was so delicious. My absolute favorite was the s'mores pancakes !!! Omgggg you must get it! It taste just like snores and it brings crushed Oreos! It's so so good ! I also had the white chocolate mocha! So delicious it brings a lot of whip cream but hey that never bothered me.

Service: everyone was so friendly the first time we went was on a Thursday around 1pm and there was barley anyone there. Our waiter was so amazing and friendly, we told him we were from Miami and he he recommended some of his favorite dishes. The second time was on a Sunday, wow it was so packed but the service was still great and worth the 30 minute wait outside. The hostess told us 30 minutes and at exactly 30 minutes they were calling us in !

Price: so cheap the first time we had 2 pancakes and the de never skillets plus drinks and it was around $26 the second time it was $20. The prices are very good for all the delicious food and the positions !

If I lived in Chicago I would go all the time ! So yummy

pics.caption: Smores pancakes Denver skillet and cinnamon bun pancakes

review.des: Wonderful breakfast! Tons of food! Had the Mexicana Skillet and it was phenomenal! Nice patio and great service. Highly recommend!

Delicious sausage links and bacon, come early to avoid the wait, their signature berry pancake is a two-stack with yogurt in between--gets kinda messy and soggy after awhile. Regular pancakes taste --regular.

Went there on 4th of July.. coz my friend and I couldn't get a reservation on the 3rd.. the wait is horrendous, 1-2 hrs and i kept saying this better is worth the wait and......
I had orgasm and a foodgasm!
my expressions said it all to the waitress.
Must visit place in Chicago :)

P.S: Get the skillet and pancakes comes along with it and make them house specials. We had 2 pancakes and 2 veg skillets for just $28.

Why fix something when it's not broken? We came here for breakfast and returned the next 2 mornings as well. Very accommodating, great tasting food, generous portions and good coffee. We came later every morning - first 2 we had no wait and the last day we utilized the waitlist on yelp to jump in line before we left our hotel room.
Best waiter, hands down, was Jeremy. Helpful, funny, understanding and made our kiddos smile every time he came by. Will be back the next time we're in town!

This was definitely a highlight of our food visit in Chicago. The food was tremendous and also reasonably priced. The wait was long, but I'd advise to add yourself to the waitlist before arrival on Yelp. Great feature.

Good night nurse! What is it about Chicago? The food is crazy good! This is hands down the best breakfast establishment I have ever experienced. 45-minute wait was worth it. Cinnamon roll French toast was my selection along with the Blackberry and Banana Yogurt Parfait. Amazing! Also kudos to our server NATE who was top notch. Thank you Wildberry!

Went to this location this morning with my father.  Service was very friendly and prompt. Our waitress was very sweet and the food did not disappoint. I suggest either the Mexicana Skillet or the Benedict that has sausage gravy rather than hollandaise sauce.

Stopped by this place twice on our short 4 day stay in Chicago. Ridiculously good breakfast and great service. The plain buttermilk pancakes were amazing. A definite must try!!

I must note that we did arrive before 9am and had no wait time. By the time we were done with breakfast and stepped outside the line was LONG! So arrive early or prepare to wait. :)

One of the most overrated brunch places I've ever been to. Omelets were over cooked and not fluffy. The signature wildberry pancakes were picture perfect, but tasted overly sweet and fake somehow. The plain pancakes were very dry and not delicious. On the plus side, the intelligentsia coffee was good, it was nice to be able to reserve spot in line via no wait app, and the service was spot on. Will not be returning ad there are way too many more yummy brunch places for both sweet and savory dishes

Perfect location right across from millennial park.  Said 15 minute wait only took about 5 minutes (not a long wait for 2 people, fairly large place).  The service was great very attentive waiter and not pushy with such a busy place.  I ordered the Rutherford omelette which had onions, goat cheese, and bacon and was amazing.  My wife and I decided to get sides of the speciality pancakes to try instead of toast and they didn't disappoint. I ordered the walnut and fig whole wheat which is a must try no syrup needed and she got the cinnamon swirl (Cinnabon basically). Amazing breakfast with good sized portions and options and a great variety of coffee drinks (hazelnut latte was great).

Dear pancakes, you make me wanna gain weight.  Being the health conscious woman I sometimes pretend to be, I ordered the whole grain pancakes with walnuts and figs.  Holy, geez!  They were so GOOD!  The pancakes, being whole grain, had an amazing texture.  Dotted with dried figs and sugared walnuts, drizzled with syrup...heaven.  The coffee was hot and the service was friendly.  They were slammed at 830-9am on a Monday morning.  I was thinking everyone would be at work.  I'd have no issues.  Luckily, I arrived at the right moment.  I was seated immediately at the last available table.  The lobby quickly filled up spilling into the seating area.  Packed.  Go early.  Go during the week. Just go...and get the pancakes.

WOW.  just wow.  slap me and fuck me sideways.  i left full and speechless.  
I am seriously considering flying back to chi-town and going here and then flying back.  this place is THAT good.

a breakfast place that makes you wait 45 mins.... you know this place means business.  i almost wanted to walk away and find a different place to eat... so glad i didn't!

if you do not know what to get, i will help you.  just shut up and listen to me.

start off with coffee/orange juice.  then.

Espanola
Spice up your Morning with this Combo of Chorizo, Jalapeño Peppers, Avocado, Onions, Cilantro, Mushrooms & Chihuahua Cheese, Atop of a Tortilla. Served with Salsa.
WOW.  did i just eat magic or something?!  this was mexican heaven on a plate.  everything worked perfectly together.  god damn, just writing this review makes me crave for it.  it also comes with fruits / grits / or hashbrowns.

PAY EXTRA FOR THE specialty pancake upgrade.  TRUSTTTT.  its so worth it.
get the below.

WB Signature "Berry Bliss" Pancakes
Buttery Pancakes Stuffed with Fresh Maine Blueberries & Layered with Wildberry Mascarpone. Topped with Fresh Blackberries, Strawberries, Vanilla Cream Anglaise & a
Fresh Blackberry Coulis.

I swear on abe Lincoln grave, you will NOT find a better pancake than the one listed above.  i would seriously just sell my soul for a lifetime supply of the berry bliss.  its that good....  i'm having withdraws now.  :(

I wished they moved or franchised it over to california.   :c

pics.caption: Wild berry pancakes are to die for.

review.des:
The wait may be long but it is so worth it. We had the Los Altos Benny and pancakes and both were amazing. The Benny was packed with flavor and savory notes and the pancakes were deliciously fluffy. Highly recommend!
Be sure to send someone in your group early to see how long the wait is, it could be anywhere from 20 mins to 2 hours but they will text you to let you know so at least you can shop or go to the park nearby.

Went back a second day and it was just as wonderful as the first day. Service is fast but go early if you can't handle an hour wait. I had the Napa Valley Fig omelet today and it was a wonderful combination of flavors. It was a hard choice because of all the wonderful things on the menu, but also because I thoroughly enjoyed the Venetian skillet the day before. Cinnamon roll French toast had us all closing our eyes in a sugar-heaven yum! I don't think you could go wrong with anything on this menu. Someone has to order the bliss pancakes so you can appreciate their house specialty.

Really great restaurant, I was very pleased with the service and quality of food! Our waitress was so nice and helpful. Good variety of coffees and other beverages (I tried the honey toffee nut latte upon server's recommendation and loved it). They offer breakfast and lunch options, and portions are very large and filling. It does get really busy and can have long waits, but we went on a Monday morning at about 9:30 and had no problem getting a table.

pics.caption: Garden Skillet (broccoli, asparagus, onions, hash browns, tomatoes, scrambled eggs, and more!)

review.des:
Skillets were just ok. Hash at the bottom and all the extras in the middle and eggs on top. I got a garden skillet and it seemed like they had just reheated the skillet. Wasn't fresh. Wildberry pancakes were Delilah though!!!

Pancakes were warm and chewy and fluffy!

pics.caption: Garden skillet with egg whites scrambled

review.des:
I had attempted to eat at Wildberry back in July, but was deterred by the 1.5 hour wait and was starving at that point so I passed on the supposedly oh so delicious looking pancakes.

8 months later, I find myself in the neighborhood and getting hungry around brunch time and recommended Wildberry as an option to my friends. It was a cold day so when I saw just as many people waiting outside just as in the summer time, I thought "Wow, this place must be really really good." So we decided to wait the 45-60 minutes to get some delicious breakfast. The nice thing about their pagers is that they have a pretty large radius for you to wander around instead of standing right outside the restaurant. So my friends and I walked and grabbed some smoothies at a place nearby. It made the wait go by a lot quicker!

We were seated after about an hour wait and were ready to order immediately (at this point we were starving!). Our waitress was very friendly and played along with how hungry we were by acknowledging our sense of urgency for ordering. My friend order the vanilla berry latte which had a strong, berry taste - very unique and satisfying. I ordered the omelet with the signature pancakes. The omelet was the size of a baby football and was amazing. And i understood why the signature pancakes are a signature dish....so yummy!!! You don't even need syrup with all the berry drizzles on there. Portion sizes were more than generous and you can't beat it for the price!

I would gladly wait another hour to have myself another wildberry breakfast experience :)

Best Breakfast eats in the Chicago Loop! Yep, that's right, Wildberry offers an innovative selection of Breakfast and Lunch cuisine from 6:30AM - 2:30PM, no dinner. Upon arrival at Wildberry don't let the line discourage you, give your name to the Hostess and the wait is relatively short.
