They have 3 dining areas and it's like they know what your gonna have even before you do. My son and I both ordered the Butcher's Skillet loaded with meat and 2 easy over eggs on top. It seemed like our waitress had just taken our order, when voila, our skillets arrived!
Wildberry gives generous portions so, be prepared to bring home left overs for the next day. Another reason I love this restaurant, they serve Intelligentsia coffee which is a coffee roasting company founded in Chicago, 1995. Rich and full bodied coffee.
Haha, they funny thing is; I live closer to the Libertyville location but, the Chicago location was the 1st time I visited Wildberry. I'm anticipating visiting both locations frequently.

pics.caption: Savory Butcher Skillet loaded with protein & carbs, accompanied by a thick English Muffin.

review.des: Food totally worth the wait. I was wondering why I had to wait an hour to eat here and the food is absolutely delicious!!! I ordered one of the eggs Benedict items with chorizo and wildberry pancakes, very yummy!!

Great Service and Amazing Pancakes but I must be honest when I say that Eggy's breakfast potatoes had me at "Hello" and still do just about every time we hem and haw about where we're going for breakfast this morning...

Got in at 930 and was told there was an hour wait. By 1015 they had a table ready. We walked around Millennium Park and Cloud Gate ("the bean") which are right across the street while waiting so it wasn't too bad. Food and service were great. Prices very reasonable ($40 for 2).  
Vanilla berry latte - 3/5
Pineapple Mango smoothie - 5/5
Southern Benedict with sausage gravy and hashed brown - 5/5
Butcher block skillet with signature berry bliss pancakes - 5/5

pics.caption: Southern Benedict with sausage gravy and hashed brown, Butcher block skillet with signature berry bliss pancakes

review.des:
Pros: Prices are reasonable, solid options, can't really go wrong here. Location is also great, right next to Millenium park.  

Cons: Nothing particularly amazing here. Wait is also extremely long on Sundays, but that can be said about any brunch place around that time in Chicago.

Great restaurant but the waiting time was so long they told us it was going to be a 45 to an hour wait and that we were going to get a txt but we never did so when we hit the hour wait I went to ask how much longer and the hostest couldnt find my name so another hostest said just wait in the side and will get u seated, so after another 15 mins we got seated. Our waitress was very attentive and very nice she took our order and explained what came with what and what could be substituted with what, loved it... after we placed our order it wasn't even 20 mins when we got our food, very fast food service and I have to say that we loved every bite of it... So overall the wait is long but so so worth it I would recommend it to everyone just be worn its a high waiting time...

pics.caption: The Creamy nutella crepes were amazing perfectly balanced with nutela and bananas...
Strawberry cheesecake french toast oh boy were they good every bite was perfectly balanced with cheese, bread and strawberry a must have...

review.des: After being on the hunt for a good breakfast place, I stumbled across this restaurant and it was close to my hotel.  Based upon previous yelp reviews, I ordered the Berry Bless pancake.  And my husband ordered their skillet hash dish.  My food was tasty but it didn't blow me away.  Maybe because I've had more creative pancake dishes in other cities.  But, the food was definitely delicious.  And my husband raved about the skillet hash.  I would definitely come back to this place and would try a few different flavored pancakes.  Berry Bliss was good but not worth all the hype.  To each it's own.  As far as the location, I love that it was close to the bean and that it was a pit stop, on my way there.  The restrooms was nice and clean, and the staff was super friendly and very knowable about the menu, especially given that I wasn't sure what I wanted to order.

25 minute wait for 4 of us at 10:30 on a Wednesday. Wonderful food. We went with two paninis and an omelette, with some pancakes in the side. The pancakes were high points. We had blueberry on one stack and mixed berries on the other. Strawberry lemonade was very tasty; not too much sugar.
Meh. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing but I don't feel this place is worth going out of your way to try. If you're nearby it is a solid breakfast but nothing special IMO.

Overrated. Food is decent, but definitely not worth the wait. The omelette was ok, but honestly didn't have a lot of flavor. The pancakes were better (the apple pecan ones are good), but nothing outstanding. Portions are decent but the food is pretty expensive. Service was about what you'd expect for such a busy place. I can't say I'm terribly disappointed, but it's definitely not worth the wait or the price. And even if there weren't a line, I wouldn't come back. Do yourself a favor and skip the tourist trap. This place is overhyped.

In my opinion, this is the best breakfast place in Chicago. Everything here is tasty and the pancake selections are unique and delicious.

Even though there is usually a long wait, it's always worth it. Another complaint is that there is difficulty finding parking around the restaurant since it is in the downtown area. But that comes with the territory.

Nonetheless, I still give wildberry five stars because it's so darn delicious. My favorites have been the chocolate chip s'more pancakes and the banana cream pie pancakes! I haven't had the skillets but have been told that they are delicious so I wouldn't put it past them.

Please give this place a try, especially if you are a person who loves pancakes!

P.s. The strawberry lemonade here is to die for!

pics.caption: Chocolate chip smores pancakes! This is a must!!

review.des: Went here for brunch and immediately  saw the red velvet french toast on the menu. Tastes as good as it sounds! I would recommend everyone at least try it because it's worth the extra time in the gym. Service was good and prompt as well. You may want to call ahead to ask for the wait time because it can get crowded.  Cheers!

Wild Berry Pancakes were delish. Fresh fruit on top was a plus as well as the three different sauces. Not too sweet. Eggs Benedict was also good. Ham was nice and juicy. Chorizo Benedict was also good with a good hint of spice from the chipotle sauce. Not a long wait at all during the week.

Southern Eggs Benedict was so salty I actually couldn't finish my plate--and that's unheard of, especially with anything smothered in gravy.

Coffee was very good though, as was the service--from the hosts to the server.

Plain pancake was ok.

I will confirm that this is truly a tourist trap, or maybe a novelty trap, which usually goes hand in hand with tourists. Flour and water drizzled with various artificially flavored sugars shouldn't cost $10. Not to mention the fact that it's not even REAL maple syrup that comes with the $10 pancakes (it's an extra $2 for the real deal), it just shows the quality of your meal. And if you're wondering what the difference is between real maple syrup vs. the stuff they give you for free--well that just speaks volumes about the standards of the majority vote and why this below average establishment has such high reviews.

Go if you must, but life's too short for a repeat visit. Anything that needs novelty is usually a good indication of substandard quality.

Between this and the 2nd breakfast place that comes up in the search (Pittsfield), avoid the latter at all cost. Just grab a quick breakfast sandwich at Dunkin Donuts if you're that desperate. Pittsfield is the pits.
The good is excellent- I've had the pancakes and the French toast. Both very good and s healthy portion. Also has the omelette which is huge. Highly recommended. And the are open by 0600

pics.caption: DJ and Pete at wild blueberry pancakes in Chicago

review.des: Yes, it's worth the hype / wait. The food is out of this world amazing. Like another reviewer said, definitely download the no wait app. On a Saturday morning, the quote time on the app was 90-125 minutes so we put our name "in line" and we're technically waiting for a table while we got ready at the hotel and took an uber over. You HAVE to try the cinnamon roll pancakes. That's all.

Go there when you know that you are going to be very hungry in about 1.5 hours. The interior is not special, rather common. The service was ok, but not overly friendly. They deal with loads of customers every day, so expect a lot of people waiting. We came on a Saturday morning and the wait was 1:40 min, so we left, on Monday morning the wait was still 1h but we got our table after 30 min. The portions we got were huge. We took the Omelette and pancakes as sub. We couldn't finish our dishes, so couldn't most of the others around is. The summer specials looked also very interesting and tasty. The omelette was delicious, the pancakes maybe a bit too sweet. The price is fine, good value for money. But a shame that we had leave alfalfa of out portions on the plate.

I am only given this 3 stars based on things that are just plain annoying for people who actually live in Chicago. Food is awesome yes, however, location just plain sucks! There is no parking without a 4 block hike, and the wait is also ALWAYS stupid long with no waiting space except for outside!! This location only appeals to tourist and people who work nearby.

They need to place another location somewhere in River North, Lincoln Park or West loop. There is so much property out there and they would do awesome. That is if they want to expand past the tourist crowd. I would love to brunch and lunch here regularly; yet current location blows!

The wait is very long, but worth it. Use yelp's 'add me to the waitlist' feature to save some time. They are pretty efficient at getting people in and out. The restaurant is clean and tidy, but feels casual, like a couple steps above an iHOP. The food, however, is fantastic. I got the special of 2 eggs, 2 sides, and 2 pancakes. The signature berry bliss pancakes are a must. They are sweet but tart and incredibly fluffy. The melt-in-your-mouth pancakes come with fresh fruit and are heavenly. If you're not into sweetness, go for the buttermilk pancakes, equally as delicious. Their hash browns are definitely worth it - but are considerably under salted. But don't worry - they keep salt on the table. If you're two people who aren't too hungry- i would opt for splitting a skillet with a side of pancakes, still a filling meal for two. Whatever you do, though, it's essential that the pancakes are a part of it. I would definitely come back!

Crepes were delicious . The portions are big so think about sharing. Go early as the wait times get long the later you go. They open at 6:30am and we got there around 8am on a Sunday with only a 10 minute wait time. When we left the wait time was hour. Their hot apple cider with all the fixings was delicious and felt like you were drinking a hot apple pie

Pretty good restaurant. The pancakes are great.  The berry pancakes are the ones I would suggest.

Only thing about then is the very long wait.  Over an hour.

Customer service is really bad, people work at front dest doesn't even look at you when they are talk to you. Over 1 hour and still no table available. All the ladies at the front dest, I don't think they are happy to be working here.

I loved this brunch spot! Don't expect to be seated right away, it's busy. But tables do turn pretty fast. It's worth the wait. I suggest putting your name in then getting a coffee and relaxing outside. I had Chicken & Waffles (special) and it was amazing. The service is fast and prompt. Diner feel, not too stuffy. But great, quality food.

I'll never get tired of this place. Took my mom and step dad this time, they fit us all in really quickly, only about a 20 minute wait even though it was packed. I'm just never let down. The food comes so quick, the presentation of food is beautiful(especially  the signature pancakes), and the setting is modern and classy

pics.caption: My favorite. Napa Valley omelette and the berry bliss pancakes
Corned beef benedict. I wasn't a fan of the hollandaise but my boyfriend loved it

review.des: OH MY GOSH! Why is this place rated so high! We ordered a skillet, corn beef bene, ham bene, and a side of the berry pancake. Skillet was a bunch of stuff mixed together... It was okay. Corn beef bene didn't have much Going on. Ham was thick cut real ham with an extremely buttery hollandaise sauce. The hash browns were crispy and delish with ketchup. The ham was thick and pretty good. The egg muffins were really thick and dense. Portions were pretty large. Prices were pretty 11$~ for each. I don't understand why any would want the pancakes. It tastes super sweet.. Just sweet. We were mad that we choose this place for brunch.. OVER HYPED!

Very yummy and poppin! The staff was friendly and took care of us right away. They have the nowait app so you can out your name in ahead of time! I ordered the strawberry lemon poppyseed pancakes. Of which I tried to finish and was way too full! Coffee was good. Oh and when I ordered a latte I didn't care for the waiter was very kind and the manager cared for me and took it off the bill and offered me something else! Very kind. The bus boys take your plates right away so beware!
Excellent experience! Super busy inside, but food was hot and came quick. Service was awesome, would definitely come back!!

The BEST Gluten Free pancakes in the city! I love pancakes - blueberry pancakes in particular - and being gluten free it's hard to find good ones. Wildberry has the best ones in the city and a great menu of eggs, scramblers, salads and the like for everyone at the table.

As you can see this place is very popular! Which sorta is the reason why I don't give it 5 stars... There is always such a long wait, the most recent time going we waited almost two hours. It turned our late breakfast plans into lunch plans. Yes the quality of the food and the service is nice, just maybe not worth it for that wait? Because after the long wait, you finally get in, want to order right away and just in a rushed feeling mood.
I got the Venetian skillet. They come with pancakes and for a couple dollars you can upgrade to specialty pancakes, which is a really really good deal. I upgraded to the chocolate chip pancakes. The skillet was pretty good and filling, barely any room left for the pancakes. The pancakes were okay, sort of expected more. They didn't have any chocolate chips inside the pancake, just on top. They also drizzle it with chocolate syrup, which honestly didn't go well with the pancakes. It would have been great with just chocolate chips. The coffee was also just okay. My boyfriend got the Butcher Block skillet and upgraded to the Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes. Of course though, he finished his whole meal and loved it. I think the signature pancakes were better than the chocolate chip pancakes. Future tip from observing the table next to ours. Don't get the full size pancakes because all the "fun" stuff was on top and all the pancakes below it were just plain and dry.

One word:  YUM.... We did have a full hour wait, and were starving when food arrived- which always improved the taste. Buuuut, the food was divine.  Brian had the French toast berry bliss and it was heaven, Hannahs pancakes were airy and divine, my Rutherford omelet was an absolute delight!!  The toffee nut latte was heaven, as was their white hot chocolate.   Okay, enough said.  It was worth the wait.  5stars easy

pics.caption: French toast nirvana. Toffee nut latte heaven

review.des: This place is filled with tourists but the pancakes were amazing and the price was quite reasonable. I would recommend getting a side of the pancakes with an omelette or skillet if you don't have the biggest sweet tooth. But you have to get the berry bliss pancakes... Melts in your freaking mouth! Only reason I'm hesitant to go back is because of the line. You can't go further than 100 ft either and there is absolutely no place to wait (a big problem in a city like Chicago). If you are a tourist - it's central to the ice skating, the bean and weird faces fountain so it'd be a good place to do brunch. Just be prepared to wait! The bongo room is pretty good too if you're looking for other brunch places but I prefer the wildberry pancakes (to each their own). I just cringe thinking about going back due to the ridiculous wait but the pancakes might be worth it...

pics.caption: You can't go wrong with these pancakes.

review.des: Come hungry!  Food was delicious and service excellent.  One of best breakfasts I've had in a long time.  Quite crowded but because so efficient the wait was very reasonable.  Omelettes were awesome.  Crepes and pancakes wonderful.  I would definitely recommend  highly.

Everyone i know from Chicago has recommended this place for a great brunch, so I had to try it while I was in town. It definitely lived up to all the hype! We came in around 10:00 on a Monday (MLK holiday) and it was already pretty packed. I was surprised to hear the wait was only about 20 mins, which was pretty spot on as we were seated not too long after putting our names down.

As for the food, there's tons of options and I was having a difficult time deciding if I wanted savory or sweet. Then our waitress let us know that most of the main dishes come with a side of toast or pancakes so that made everything a lot easier. I decided to get the Denver skillet with poached eggs, and a side of Wildberry pancakes, and it was amazing! I'm usually not even much of a ham fan, but it was so good I almost asked the waitress what kind they use. And the crazy part is that you basically get two entrees for the price of one ($12.95). Another great thing about this place is that they have an Intelligentsia coffee bar on sight, so you can order some really tasty lattes. I got the toffee honey latte, but it was actually pretty cold when it got to the table. I asked our waitress if it would be possible to get a new one and she gladly brought out a piping hot one. Definitely appreciated considering how busy it was.

I don't often give 5 star ratings but Wildberry definitely deserves it with their amazing food and service!

The wait was ridiculous but their food makes up for the decade long wait. We ordered cinnamon pancakes and they were too sweet. Mint mocha was good. Their chorizo Benedict was goooooood. Would totally come again
We waited 1hr for our table. This is a family restaurant.  Not a diner joint...but not a foodie spot. Decent ..ordinary breakfast fares. Would not wait to eat here again. Nothing special.
Wildberry is a MUST if you're un Chicago. Their pancakes are the best. If you're not early be patient and wait, it is well worth it

This place is worth the wait!  My wife and I shared the Mexican Skillet and an order of the Cinnamon Roll Pancakes.  The Skillet was flavorful with the perfect amount of spiciness.  The pancakes were out of this world.

Look...the line is intimidating but I've found they give fairly accurate wait time estimated  so at least you know what to expect.

This is a top notch breakfast place!

Holy shniz is this place PHENOMENAL. I almost don't want to give away the secret, but given the 2 hour wait.. secret's already out!

Food is absolutely AMAZING. My favorite is the get a skillet, and add on specialty pancakes for just a couple bucks more. Totally worth it, I was stuffed for the rest of the day. And the bill? under $15. Easily the best breakfast I've ever eaten.

There is usually a long wait but it is absolutely worth it. The food was incredible and the service was extremely personable.

I ordered strawberry glazed and chocolate chip pancakes with two side orders of bacon and hash browns. I would highly recommend this meal as the presentation was carried out very nicely as well.

pics.caption: I ordered glazed strawberry and chocolate chip pancakes. Incredibly delicious and the presentation was very nicely done.

review.des: The wait time is kind of insane, especially during high times, but Millennium Park is right across the street! They'll text you when your reservation is ready. Their special berry pancake is BOMB. I got their Mexican skillet and that was really good to.

pics.caption: Their special berry pancake is BOMB.

review.des:
Looking for generous portions, polite wait-staff, and a pleasant atmosphere to grab breakfast or brunch while near the bean? Then definitely stop by Wildberry - be wary though as there is usually a 1 - 1.5 hour wait (use the NoWait app to find out in advance!).

To be honest, the actual food is not exceptional or unique in terms of taste. It tastes delicious but I would not say it is anything special. However, the variety of savory and sweet as well as the generous portions make this well worth the wait. I arrived with a group of 5 on New Year's Day around 10:00AM and waited till 11:30AM to be seated. I got the Denver skillet with a side of Signature Berry Bliss pancakes as well as the seasonal drink - warm apple cider with spices. The skillet was hearty and very filling. The pancakes were sweet and delicious even without syrup. The cider was a welcomed comfort from the wintry cold. All in all, it came out to $16 so ~$20 after tax/tip.

If you're not able to wait, you can always order take-out. In general, the skillet is enough to feed 2. Definitely worth checking out!
Excellent service. Even better food. I wish there was a Wildberry location back home in San Diego! Don't be afraid of the crowd or the wait list-- it moves quickly and it is worth it!

Wildberry, how did I not know about you earlier? Delicious food and very reasonably priced for the quality and quantity.

I came here with my partner in crime last Friday around 1030am and there was...wait for it...NO WAIT. Already thrilling. We decided to split a skillet with a side of specialty pancakes. We left completely stuffed, and we both can pack it in. The Mexicana skillet was scrumptious, and HUGE. Perfectly poached eggs over a skillet of avocado, spicy chorizo, jalapeños, cilantro and cheese. This satisfying goodness sits on a large bed of hash browns. The hash browns could've been crispier, but that was my only complaint of the meal. We paid a tad extra to get a side of their famous berry bliss pancakes. God, these were incredible. Fluffy pancakes drizzled with vanilla anglaise, blackberry coulis, and berry mascarpone. So decadent. Definitely some of the best pancakes I've ever had. Next time I'm here I'll be making a meal out of these bad boys.

Our server was very friendly and attentive. Oh, and they serve Intelligentsia coffee. Need I say more?

Had breakfast here this morning.  Looong wait but totally worth it!!  Visiting from Phoenix AZ, and would most definitely return here  if ever in the city again.  The Omelet,  pancakes and even the coffee was all very good.  A must try, just be prepared for the wait.  People arrive here at all times even though this place closes at 2:30 or so.  Our waiter Jeehad (goes by G)  was awesome!!

When my friends and I were planning out our itinerary for our Chicago trip, this spot was on the top! To my surprise, Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe exceed not only my expectations but my friends as well. I really hope they will open a cafe here in California soon or else I will be traveling to Chicago every other month.

After taking some photos at the famous "Bean" my friends and I ran (literally ran because it was freezing cold, almost below 0 degrees that day) over to Wildberry and we put our name down and gave the hostess my phone number. The wait was an hour long. We later received a text from Wildberry telling us to download the app "NoWait". NoWait is pretty much an app that you can place yourself into line without having to be physically present to put your name down and you can see how many parties are ahead of you as well as your approximate wait time. Definitely a super handy app if you do not want to wait for an hour, but instead you can put your name down and see how many people are in front of you, plan accordingly and arrive just in time for your table to be ready. Definitely one of the handiest apps I've seen, I told another group of friends who were in town about the app and it worked out perfectly for them.

The service is excellent, everyone is really nice and they are quick if you have any questions or requests. Although the only problem I had was that there are a lotttttttt of people who are in the front, waiting to be seated and the employees did not do much about it. It was pretty hard for me to make my snowball clothed self all the way to the front to put my name down for the table. It was even harder for me to pull myself and my friends to the table to be seated. I wish their waiting area had more room, if anything people can always walk around the area while they wait for their name to be called. Other than that the service was great!

Now to the best part! The FOOOOOD!!! If you order any egg item, either the skillet or the omelette, you can add a Specialty Pancake for $1 more, DEFINITELY choose from the SPECIALTY PANCAKES option! You won't regret it! I decided to order the Venetian Skillet and the Berry Pancake and it was delicious. For the skillet, you can request your eggs to be however you want them to be! I requested for my eggs to be poached because I saw the lady at the table next to me with perfectly poached eggs and I kept scanning the menu for that item, turns out, all you have to do is request for them. The pancakes were not too sweet but like it had the perfect amount of pancake fluffliness paired with the precise amount of syrup. Just typing this is making my mouth water and me miss Chicago. My friend ordered the Mexican Omelette and the Banana Cream Pancakes, which is a MUST!!! It was not overbearingly sweet at all like the dessert, it had the right amount of richness and sweetness to it. I can definitely eat another plateful or two of it! We also ordered the Berry Waffles which were yummlicious as well! Our total including tip came out to ONLY $42!!! Which is a steal and the best part is that you are full to your satisfaction but you aren't full to the point where you can't walk out the door. It was definitely a happiness full.

I am definitely returning here in the future, hands down it is one of the best brunch/breakfast spots I've been to in my life! If you are in town or you live in Chicago, you DEFINITELY HAVE TO GO!!!! Remember to download the app NoWait, you will be grateful for it later, as it not only comes in handy for Wildberry, but many other restaurants!!! Don't forget to order an egg item and pay an extra $1 for the SPECIALTY PANCAKE!!!

Great breakfast.  Be prepared to wait in line but worth it.  We had a large party of 8 and were treated well.  Service was great as was the food.  Generous portions and quick coffee refills.

All in all, a great breakfast in Chicago!

Came here on a Friday at 9:30am this place is busy!! But we were seated in 20 min (which is fast) and the waiters/waitresses were all so kind. The hosts were all so patient and the food was great( it came out in 10 min)! Definitely recommend this place to anyone in downtown area for a great breakfast!

Wildberry is easily one of my favorite breakfast spots in the city. The place gets packed quickly so a wait for a table could easily be 35 - 45 minutes. I go as early as possible and always order the same thing - a skillet with pancakes (specialty pancakes are an extra $1.50). It's always more food than I can eat in one sitting which means I get breakfast for dinner as well. The location is also a plus since you can stroll to Millennium Park (right across the street) to walk off some calories after your meal.
The one hour wait was well worth it. Greeted with warm smiles and specials, my server was awesome. Shocked by how rapid the meal was served. Everything was delicious.

Unfortunately Chicago is light on real breakfast options. Wildberry has an extremely long wait and I'm not sure why. Yes the portions are huge, you get a free side of pancakes and it's all cheap. But if it isn't great quality then who cares? Evidently a lot of people do and if that's what you value then go for it!
Fabulous breakfast spot. Really great coffee, wonderful fresh juices. The pancakes were superb and the omelet was out of this world. A definite must go in Chicago!!

Five stars of course

Berry bliss waffle. Again!
Took company this time.
He had the crispy buffalo chicken wrap
With a whole grain tortilla
Delish. Fresh crispy fries. All the.ingresients in this wrap were perfectly put together for a great meal. That didn't over stuff
Nice clean environment, friendly service.

OMG I died and went to breakfast heaven when I came here on a quick visit to the city! First, let me start by saying I LOOOOOOVE breakfast anything. I could easily live on a diet of eggs, hash browns, pancakes, and coffee. So, needless to say, I am very particular about my breakfast foods.

This place knocked my socks off. I got a meal that had all the classics; eggs, bacon, hash browns, and their signature berry bliss pancakes. I never wanted the meal to end.

I went during the week and had no wait! Go here! You will not be sorry!!!!

pics.caption: a little bit of everything including the berry bliss..... delicious!!!

review.des: I highly recommend their Tiramisu pancakes, Espanola omelette and strawberry French toast.....And their portions are huge which basically fills you up for the entire day. They are known for their wild berry juice which is beyond heaven....Great place for a weekend brunch!

The best Pancake i've ever had. Their pancakes are at the right mix of softness and chewiness, just perfect texture. and On top of that i got full by a kid meal.
I am lucky that I dont live near by , otherwise i will have to fight the temptation of going there everyday.
The staff at the front desk was nice but the staff inside could be a bit friendlier. Like smile more so that i dont feel stressed when i spend more time going over the menu. I was new to the place anyway.

So this isn't necessarily their fault it just sucks that every time I go there the line is ridiculous. Their food is pretty good I've only gone there one time and had food that wasn't as great as the first time. But I definitely recommend their food just plan ahead.

Great place to have breakfast before going to Millenium Park!  Go early or during the week.  We arrived in town on Thursday morning and went straight here for breakfast.  Had no problems getting a table but that was because it was a week day.  We past by on Saturday morning and the line was out the door with no room to move in the waiting area.  The skillets and pancakes are amazing- come hungry!

I made it back - had the Wildberry French Toast (yo! half-order makes me a fast fan, thank you!) and it was decadent but also somehow seemed light and healthy!  Ever the fan of the oxymoron, perhaps there should be more on my plate next time.  OK, I couldn't resist that line but I probably will indeed resist a full order since the half was perfectly satisfying to me. Also...great tip from our server - no need to load this plate with syrup...there is already a perfectly balanced flavor explosion as it is.

The restaurant was full up but it wasn't terribly noisy which I find delightful! Late morning light filtered in beautifully and it was a cozy little feast.

pics.caption: The other side is even prettier. YOU MUST get the OJ here, btw

review.des:
If you're wanting to try the pancakes but also want something savory, most entrées come with toast or pancakes so you can just sub speciality pancakes for an extra $1!

I didn't love this place as much as I had hoped to, but I still give four stars because it was still pretty decent. The pancakes were soft and spongy. My boyfriend had the tiramisu ones, although to me it was just chocolate sauce drizzled over pancakes. The tiramisu flavor was too light for me. I got the signature Wildberry pancakes. It was sweet but not overly sugary or artificial tasting. Pretty good!

Portion sizes are good, with the omelette we got being nearly as big as my face! It also came with a generous side of hash browns. My Mexicana skillet was a bit spicy for me, but still pretty flavorful and very cheesy!

Overall, I'd come here again to try another skillet or more pancakes.

I just moved to the neighborhood so I was looking forward to trying Wildberry because I had heard great reviews. I expected the wait and used the yelp wait list to put our name in without having to walk over- very convenient. We finally sat down & the server was sweet but obviously rushed. I ordered the berry bliss pancakes which were rich, but yummy. My boyfriend got the corned beef hash omelette special which was disappointing.
The 2 star review is because I noticed a short black hair on the surface of my pancake- it was mixed into the batter & literally cooked into the pancake.  Working in the industry myself- I understand that this happens but the problem is that the waitress NEVER came to the table to check how our food was or refill drinks. I saw her at other tables & I even waved a couple times when she looked up but she never glanced at my table once- it seemed that she forgot about us. My boyfriend & son were almost done eating & I was starving so I just decided to remove the hairy piece of pancake from my plate & eat the rest (which was cold at this point). A manager FINALLY walked by so I got his attention & he was extremely apologetic & comped my pancakes from the bill- but my breakfast was still ruined & I'm going to have to look for another neighborhood breakfast spot.
Best breakfast I've had yet in Chicago. Had their Los Altos Benedict, with chorizo. Highly recommended

A little disappointed...

- Corned beef hash was not good.  I like more things in my hashes; there was just too much potato compared to the corned beef or other things, and it wasn't even crispy.  The poached eggs on top were also a little overcooked.  I normally love cheese but am not sure how I feel about cheese on my corned beef hash...
- Eggs benedict weren't memorable.  There wasn't much flavor too them; kinda blah.  The hollandaise was also a little too thick, and the english muffin wasn't toasted enough so it tasted soggy.
- Pancakes were pretty darn good.  It was the best thing we ordered; nice and light with a little crisp to them.  Should've ordered just this instead... go figure.

It was pretty busy when we got there, but we were seating right away and served food within 15 minutes. The BLT was good and had an interesting spin with a fried egg on it. The only downside was it was a little pricey, but if I'm in the area I will definitely stop by again

First time I have been disappointed in the food.  My corned beef hash Benedict was room temperature. Only part that was hot were the poached eggs. English muffins were tough and had to saw through them with my knife. Hubby's scrambled eggs were cold. Son's avocado pieces in his omelette were a very unappetizing brown. He plucked them out and set them to the side. Pancakes were good. Service was great. We use the nowait app so never have to wait too long. Hoping it was a fluke.

Good food but don't sit outside.  The sun is brutally hot and there a lot of bees.

Food is good and quantity is pretty large.

I am the ultimate brunch person and I had really high expectations for this place.
There was a long line and we waited about 30 minutes until we were finally seated.
The menu is really unique and has a variety of brunch items from red velvet french toast, strawberry pancakes, skillets, etc.
I personally ordered the Apply Caramel French toast, and it was really big! It was tasty, sweet, filling, and delicious but not sure if it was worth the long wait. The strawberry pancake was also mediocre and the pancakes itself weren't really fluffy.
It appears that everyone raves about this place because of their specialty menus. I recommend this place if you love brunch and you love dessert brunch and you are craving a heavy carb-full meal.
While on vacation we were looking for a good breakfast so of course we turned to Yelp---score!! Best breakfast, great service and worth the wait!!
Food is amazing! Came out really fast, servers are nice :) great experience for my boyfriend and I.

Always a long wait but the food is good. Great breakfast egg options. I got the garden skillet. Their pancakes are of course delicious. I got the fig and walnut multigrain pancakes. Literally the most delicious pancake I've ever had.
Taking off one star be said of the crazy wait and the rushed service. They cleared the entire table and even took my water which I was drinking away before we even got ready to get up.

pics.caption: Garden skillet and the fig and walnut multigrain pancakes as a side. yummy!

review.des: I got to the restaurant and was told they were no longer allowing people in, this was an hour before closing. This was extremely inconvenient. The restaurant should post that policy on their website so people know to call first.

While I normally would not wait hour and fifteen minutes for pancakes, the reviews helped and we enjoyed our wait outside after being stuck inside all winter long.

My boyfriend and I had already sucked down a couple cups of coffee while we waited but could not resist their coffee drinks. I had the honey toffee nut latte, it was not too sweet. My boyfriend had the vanilla berry latte. Both went down well.

I had the garden skillet with a side of bacon and the berry bliss pancakes. The bacon was thick cut and crisp, but not over cooked. The skillet was just ok. The star of the breakfast was the very bliss pancake. I am not even that big of a pancake eater, but would change for these. Next time I will probably just get the pancakes and a side of bacon. My boyfriend had the special omelettes that had goat cheese, bacon and caramalized onion. He said it was good but after waiting that long, he was ready to gnaw off his hand.

I would come back, but either early or closer to when they close.

If you can get a table, this brunch house really is worth the wait! Be careful of super long weekend lines... Otherwise, enjoy!

Everything on the menu is splendid, from French Toast to Pancakes to Omelettes and more! The service was good, but the taste is top notch if you are looking for mouth watering breakfast!

This brunch spot was pretty bomb. We shared 3 different omelettes. All were really good, but not AMAZING. The fresca was a bit boring and the espanola was really good but had too much meat. The napa valley fig omelette was the best. The hash browns did not have too much flavor.

The signature wildberry french toast was excellent!
I think I was expecting this to be better because of the reviews but I think the location is the only thing that keeps it running. It was decent but nothing special.

While doing research for our family trip to Chicago, I kept seeing this restaurant pop up.  The reviews seemed great and the menu looked promising and had something the whole family would like.  When we arrived, we had a bit of a wait, but it was worth it for the cinnamon roll pancakes alone!  My 11 yo daughter also raved about her Oreo smoothie.  Will definitely revisit this restaurant when we are in Chicago again!
Amazing!! That's the only word that comes to mind! Fast, friendly service along with absolutely fantastic pancakes!!!

Love love LOVE this place to bad they don't have one like it in miami florida service was awesome we went twice & couldn't go more cause it takes u 2hrs and 1/2 & they r not kidding when they say that LOL but the waiting was worth it  we got the same server twice & she was a jewel very nice & lots of patience plus she understood how i liked my eggs.. oh wait order the white mocha BEST i ever had

On a nice day I would recommend taking your order to go and eating at Millenium Park like I did. I orderd my food online and picked a time to pick it up. It was ready when I walked in. I got the Espanola omelette made with eggwhites, and paid the difference to make my side panakes the Oreo s'mores. The omelette was large and delicious. I don't normally like chorizo but the one in this omelette was well-seasoned. When I first saw the pancakes I was a little disappointed to see that only the top pancake was dressed with all the goodness. But as I started eating it I realized that flavor was more than enough for both layers. Even I who usually drowns my pancakes in syrup, did not need to add syrup to these like I thought I would. I see why this place is popular. Definitely go for the pancakes :)

pics.caption: On a nice day, I recommend taking your brunch to go :)

review.des: I really love breakfast food and you could say I'm kind of ad-dict-ed to eggs benedict, but Wildberry Pancakes was pretty average. I had the Florence Benedict, which was good, but not spectacular. I liked that I was able to choose fruit as a side instead of the hash browns though! No upcharge, so that's always a good thing. The portions were large, and my friend couldn't finish her buttermilk pancakes, so I graciously volunteered to help her out. They were A-OK. Again, nothing to write home about. Overall, the food was average but the wait time was long. I'd probably keep searching for other breakfast places.

pics.caption: Eggs Florentine with a side of fruit ft. buttermilk pancakes

review.des: Everything we tried was delicious! We came 3 times during our stay in Chicago! Oreo pancakes, cinnamon roll pancakes, and berry bliss pancakes were all delicious! The Rutherford omelette and brisket hash were amazing as well. Come early... or put your name on the waitlist electronically using the No Wait app.
Over rated. It's a pancake house but I prefer their waffles than pancakes. I tried their pancakes twice and ...well, they are okay, but not that good.

Yuuuummm.
Buttermilk pancakes w fresh fruit, omelet w cheese, sundries tomatoes and avocado. Pancakes are fluffy and light; be sure to request the REAL maple syrup. Worth it.

Amazingly tasty. Coffee is great, too. Portions are really generous, so maybe consider sharing.

Nice atmosphere too. Large, open space and some outside seating.

Would be 5 stars except for the hour wait and surly staff at the front. -- Monday at 1 p.m. You don't expect a crowd like that for a pancake spot.

My cousin, whom I haven't seen in over 20 years, and I came here for brunch on a Saturday we had a great catch up over a very appetizing meal!

First Impression
It was BUSY! We arrived at 11:30am and put our name down, noting a 45 minute wait. From the time we walked in until we were seated, the traffic entering the restaurant was continuous. We got a text just before we were called to be seated and be hostesses, despite the busyness were all very friendly.

Our table was clean and the environment overall is very pleasant.

Menu/Price
The menu was extensive with a lot of great options. Basic dishes, a variety of eggs benedict, omelettes, pancakes, waffles, french toast, etc. Typical brunch pricing with most dishes averaging between $10.95-$12.95

Order
I ordered the Signature Berry Bliss Belgian Waffle and my cousin ordered an omelette (but I can't recall what kind). Both dishes were delicious but I gotta say my waffle dish was better than the omelette. The omelette was gigantic and it looked like there were at least 4 or 5 eggs in it haha! My dish was sweet, no doubt, but I ordered a side of bacon and made it somewhat savoury. I suggest others do the same because you won't be disappointed! The Signature Berry Bliss had some sort of berry cream and was topped with fresh blackberries, blueberries and strawberries. Just talking about it makes me want to order it now!

I also ordered the Wildberry Orange Juice and it did not disappoint. :)

Service
Our server was friendly and prompt to greet us after we were seated. She was also very attentive to our needs throughout the meal which is impressive for a busy brunch rush!

Other
Love it! Can't wait to come back. Parking was pretty easy to find around here too.

My wife and I were in Chicago and we were looking for a good place to eat. We were extremely happy that we found Wildberry. It was a 30 minute wait on a Friday morning at 9:30am, but it was definitely worth the wait! The servers were friendly and fast. The food was amazing. I had the chicken and waffles and my wife had the hash. If you are in Chicago, check out this place!!!

This place is just ridiculous. The food was over the top, as were the drinks. We had the banana cream pancakes, the Mexicana skillet and the toffee nut coffee. It was all so good. The only issue here is the 2-hour wait. (Put yourself on the waitlist via Yelp!)

The one hour wait was totally worth it! This place is crowded like crazy for weekend brunch and for good reason! The number of options in the menu will blow your mind off! From pancakes to crepes to skillets to burgers this place has it all! We ordered the Denver skillet, signature pancakes and the Nutella crepe with banana and all of them were awesome! The service was great as well and food came fairly quickly..prefect place to go for a brunch the day after a night out in Chicago!

I've been here a couple of times. I'm not going to lie and say that the food isn't good. It is. However, I do think it's over rated. First of all, being downtown, its not convenient to get to. I wouldn't make a special trek just to have brunch here. But if you're in the neighborhood, sure why not. Second, the wait is always long, sometimes anywhere from 2-3 hours. Again, it's not worth the wait. The food itself is tasty, I like their skillets and pancakes. And while they were good they were not superb. The staff is busy but somehow they do manage to be attentive. The prices are reasonable and the portions are big enough to share.

Had to see what all the fuss was about, and this place delivers.  First, I'll just say that if you don't use the Nowait app to reserve a place in line (and avoid the waits that can be in excess of 2 hours), it may be hard to justify waiting so long for breakfast.

Now, the food was excellent. My wife loved her turkey sausage omelet with green peppers. I had the classic 2 eggs with bacon and hash browns. But the star was the Berry Bliss pancakes that we shared. Incredibly good!

Great location with great price for a brunch.
While, waiting too long time for a brunch here is not a good idea, I will defiantly go to another place to have a better brunch and not waiting that long somewhere else~
The triple berry bliss pancakes are fantastic. Get them with a skillet and you wont need to eat again all day. They are so good you have to finish them. And Intelligentsia coffee!
Quite amazing from the coffee to the hash browns to the eggs to the pancakes! Highly recommend using the app "no wait" before you go so you don't have to wait so long!

The wait was 1 hour and we had to go shopping for an hour :-) So its gonna be an expensive brunch
I got the Mexicano, which was great. I added bacon to it and really loved it. I should say, its hot, it has jalapenos.
The server was really nice and helpful.
Very cool place.
Wait for 2 hours for the cheap unhealthy brunch? It depends on you. The server is kind of rude.

Of course, this was delicious! I found this spot on Yelp and realized it was just a 5 minute walk from our hotel, the Hard Rock hotel. When we arrive (on a Saturday) at 10am, we found the line out the door and the wait long. So we called in our order and took a walk for 20 minutes. It was a perfect breakfast picnic in Millennium park. Everything about our waffles was perfection. A must do in Chicago

I have been to Wildberry in the past and it was amazing and the service was great so I wanted to come back when in town again. However, My second experience was not as pleasant and I was disappointed. The food was great but the service was lacking. I understand it is busy in there but I felt overly rushed and every time someone walked by the would take something from the table. We could not really eat in peace. Before we were all finished eating the waitress suggested boxes and brought them over. When ready to leave there was 3 people standing at the end of the table, could barely get past them, waiting to clean and put new plates and grab the check. Just because the place is busy does not mean you can forget hospitality and force people out 15 minutes after they get their food. I was disappointed, even more so because the first experience was so great. But, I doubt I will return to Wildberry when I am back in town again.

Intelligentsia coffee and fresh squeezed OJ FTW.

I had the berry pancakes and they were fantastic. My husband had the apple cinnamon waffles and it was like apple pie with waffle instead of crust. Just delicious.

There is a typical wait on weekends but nothing crazy. Make sure you get a coffee from the coffee bar while you're waiting.

Normally, I would not write a review since this place already has more than 1k others... however - I feel the need to gush about the gluten-free pancakes. Holy cow, those were completely delicious!

Seriously, we have been deprived of appropriately tasting pancakes for many years. I didn't think I would remember what a good tasting pancake was - but I was instantly transported to heaven the moment I ate the first bite. They were light, buttery and fluffy. You didn't need extra butter or even maple syrup. The berries and berry sauce stuff was a perfect compliment - adding the right amount of sweet to the savory. My mouth is watering right now thinking about them.

We each got a dish with a choice as pancake as a side. I got the butcher skillet (was ok, not the best skillet I've had and something that I can definitely make at home) and the bf got the special omelette of the day that came with chili. You can customize the side pancakes - so we both got gluten free berry bliss. With the special subs, it came out to $29 after tax. While a bit pricey for breakfast food - that meal was both enough for breakfast and lunch.

Other yelpers are totally right: the food is worth the wait! Next time, I will just get a giant plate of their gluten free pancakes!!

Agree with all the other 5 star reviews!

Awesome skillet and hash breakfasts with even more awesome pancakes that came with it. $1 extra for the specialty pancakes is well worth it. We had the signature berry bliss and cinnamon roll pancakes, and both were fabulous!

We're stuffed and skipping lunch today!

Great! I've been here several times. My favorites are the Mexicana skillet and a side of hash Browns. On the really busy weekends, I use the NoWait app to avoid the 2 hour wait and usually get seated within 5 minutes on Saturdays or Sundays.

The pancakes and coffee are really good. The fresh squeezed orange juice was okay, but my girlfriend loved their lemonades, which you can customize.

I am not a big breakfast person. I'm perfectly fine with cereal, eggs & bacon, or a bagel with cream cheese. But then we came here. This place redefined breakfast for me. The service was fast and friendly, even with how busy it was.
The only thing I don't understand is why it's missing a half star. It was worth the hour wait in a torrential downpour.

Great food. Our wait time was almost exactly as quoted, if not a little early. Waitress was very attentive. Had a skillet with asparagus mushrooms cheese etc. was amazing, along with a side of the signature wildberry pancakes  (substitued egg whites instead of regular eggs for only 99 cents). Great bang for your buck!!!

"Signature Berry Bliss" anything is 5 stars! I went for it on the pancakes and they were amazing. Great coffee bar, quick service and tasty food. Does have a long wait but that's common for Sunday brunch + tourist location. Try using the Nowait app to add your name to the seating list and then spend your time elsewhere while waiting.

This was our last breakfast on our Chicago  trip in October.

I feel we saved the best for last!

The place was packed! So that's a great sign that you are at the right place! We were only a two top so we didn't ha e to wait too long to get our table.

The wait staff buzzed all around each table and made sure that everyone including us had everything the needed or wanted.

What I got:

The butchers block: Hash Browns, Cheddar & Jack Cheese, 2 Eggs, Ham, Sausage, Turkey Sausage, Chicken Sausage & Bacon.

I couldn't pass up the opportunity to have some of their famous pancakes! I got them topped with wild berries. They were well worth the stuffed feeling I got after powering the whole meal down.

If you are a local then you should already know about this place. But if you are a visiting tourist, then you need hit this place up and then go walk it off at millennium park right down the street!

pics.caption: Hash Browns, Cheddar & Jack Cheese, 2 Eggs, Ham, Sausage, Turkey Sausage, Chicken Sausage & Bacon w/ wild berry pancakes!
Butchers block skillet and a side of wild-berry pancakes!

review.des: There was a wait but it seemed to go by quickly as everyone working was very efficiently. They even have an app to tell you just exactly what spot in line you are.  There's a coffee shop there too you can order something while you wait or walk around the city. The food was delicious! We shared an entree that came with a large omelette, pancakes and hash browns plus coffee! Plenty for 2 girls! Hehe (I know my husband would want his own..) food came out quickly and the waitress was great. I will definitely bring people back here!
This place has great food and service but the wait time is ridiculous!! If u have time to wait and u aren't starving then line up!!

Breakfast "Haven"
The best place I ever eaten in  OMG
I'm gonna missed it
I recommend everyone who come to Chicago to eat Here.

Om nom nom..!! Wildberry smells great the moment you walk into the cafe.
The wait was approximately 45 minutes but it wasn't that bad because it allowed for us to walk around Millennium park for a bit.

CARAMEL APPLE PECAN PANCAKE
My favourite out of the bunch that we've ordered! The pancakes were so fluffy and soft.. The apples were a good touch since they were a bit sour - a good contrast to the sweet maple syrup, jams and butter provided.

BERRY BLISS BELGIAN WAFFLE
Just as good as the pancakes! It comes with strawberry ice cream along with fresh strawberries and blueberries.

EGG, CHICKEN SAUSAGES & HASHBROWN
A good combination with the dishes that we've ordered since everything else was very sweet. This was more on the salty side :D The chicken sausages were really good - love their hashbrowns as well.

This place was phenomenal in terms of food.  The wait was about 45 minutes on a weekday morning around 9, but the food was not disappointing.  I got the cinnamon bun pancakes and my friend the wildberry special cakes.   I also had the wild mushroom + cheese omelet which was also divine.  I don't actually like pancakes, but I figured I'd go for it and I was happy I did.  Service was a bit slow but most likely because it was packed. Coffee was hot and refills were quick; portions were plenty. Overall, for how much food you get and how wonderful it is, the cost is extremely reasonable for a city restaurant.  I'm a lover of breakfast, and if that can be done well, I'm happy to give my rare 5-star review.  

I will note that I did not see parking for the restaurant, and I can see that would be annoying if I were traveling by car.  I did appreciate the texting when the table was ready, it makes it easier to go outside and explore a little.

Great breakfast place. I recommend getting here early because it tends to get crazy after 10. We came around 9 and were seated quickly. When we were leaving we could see a line up outside the door even in the cold weather. The service is fast and friendly. I split an omelette and order of pancakes with my husband and it was more than filling. The cheesecake stuffed French toast was also delicious!

Wildberry Pancake and Cafe
Chicago, Illinois

Ordered: Berry Bliss Pancake

Not being from Chicago and staying downtown in "The Loop" this restaurant was a must try for me. I had read reviews and was curious if it was really that good and it REALLY IS that good !

I wanted to try a dish they were known for so I picked the Berry Bliss Pancakes and I'm not one to like really sweet stuff on pancakes let alone that early in my day but I wanted to taste it, no ... I  HAD to taste it !! lol ...and I was not disappointed one bit.

I'm so glad I took the time to dine at Wildberry Pancake. There was a short wait time to be seated but to me that's normal and expected especially with all the positive reviews, it being in the city and it being rush hour breakfast hours. I DEFINATELY recommend giving this restaurant a try.

Wow! The wildberry crepes were AMAZING! Seriously. I went with a small group and we each ordered our own dishes then got a plate of crepes to share for the table. Best decision. The crepes were sweet but so delicious! Everyone also raved about their skillets as well. The latte I had was also very good.

The service was great and our waiter was friendly and attentive. The place was pretty packed (Saturday of St. Patty's day) but there was only a 30 minute wait so not bad at all. We debated coming back the next morning for breakfast and ended up going elsewhere and we should just have gone back to Wildberry.

Long wait on a Saturday morning, of course, but they have a texting service that tells you when your table is ready and I found that convenient. The waitress we had was so kind and friendly and our food came so fast. Our food was also delicious! We will definitely be back on our next chicago venture.

pics.caption: Breakfast burrito and strawberry cheesecake French toast

review.des:
Popular place so be prepared to wait. They have a good system for getting people in and out though.  They will text you so can wait outside, which is nice because it can feel pretty cramped inside. You can even download an app to see where you are in line. For a place that is so crazy busy, I was pleasantly surprised by the upbeat wait staff and hostess.
Portions are enormous so come hungry and walk the magnificent mile a few times afterwards (we walked 8 miles without feeling hungry again!). Nice variety of breakfast options with different kinds of skillets, eggs benedicts and of course pancakes, waffles and crepes. I just wished they had small plates so we can sample more things.

Food was a bit underwhelming the I had the veggie wrap it was a bit soggy and it was really greasy from the large amount of cheese. I did enjoy the sweet potato fries and the waitress was fantastic. I would be up to try them again.

Do yourself a favor- and if you want to visit Wildberry do it midweek at about 12:30-1.  The wait on weekends can be long and all around not worth it, but the late lunch work crowded is smaller and doesn't sit around dawdling after finishing.
For a short wait this place is great- yummy pancakes and attentive service 4 stars.  If i'd actually waited the 90 minutes i've been quoted here on weekends, this place would be a 2 star.
Amazing!!! I'm generally a big eater and I could not finish my garden skillet.  If you're looking for generous portions with fantastic service come to this place.

Attempted to come here on a weekend while visiting Chicago-1.5 hour wait so left and went elsewhere.  Decided to come on Monday morning before leaving-45 minute wait, thus more doable and decided to wait.  My husband and I split the espanola omelette and opted for both sides to be pancakes so we could try two different kinds-chocolate chip for him and cinnamon roll for me.  Everything was definitely good, however I definitely did not think it was as amazing as other reviews had mentioned.  Maybe it was the hype?  Portions are large and MORE then enough to share, prices are reasonable, service is good, very kid friendly, so definitely a good place to check out.  I do not think it's worth waiting over 1 hour to be seated though, thus I recommend going on a random weekday during non peak hours!

I came here a couple of times for lunch with co-workers/friends.  I highly recommend making reservations for lunch if you plan on coming with a group of people or even if it's with a couple ppl [better safe than sorry].  I have had no issues getting seated during lunch time (only because I made reservations).

*Random note: i love the aroma of coffee when you step into the restaurant!!

Denver Skillet: a good mix of veggies, meat, potatoes, eggs! Yum!! It is usually served hot/warm since it was cooked in a skillet..
*I would recommend for anyone that is indecisive when it comes to picking an item from the menu...this can't really go wrong..

Costs: ranges from $10+ if you are planning on getting an entree.  However, you can order the "extras/sides" like hashbrowns, eats, meat on the side if you want..which range from $4+ per side if you aren't that hungry..

Entree Portions: are huge so you will either leave the restaurant tummy stuffed and/or with major food coma..or with leftovers to eat later in the day/the following day.

Atmosphere: diverse and all age groups.. a lot of people come here to dine in for lunch (so you'll see a wide professional atmosphere during that time)..

*they are currently doing construction here so if you are walking from the Aon Center or any of the other buildings connected to this building..you will need to walk around to their main entrance to get in (yes you need to step outside to get in--don't forget your coat!)

I would come here again if I was craving breakfast food...nom nom
Perfectly good breakfast place... nothing to make this place stand out however. Food was decent and would come back if I didn't feel like looking for something more interesting...
I've been here on multiple occasions and I keep wanting to come back. The Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes and Southern Benedict are incredible, and the fresh squeezed juices are great too.

There was a 70 min wait, so we d/led the nowait app to track our status (you can do this from home fyi, so you don't even have to wait at the restaurant). All good though, we walked around and explored the city while waiting!

Anyways, I had the venetian skillet, and loved the hash browns, eggs, peppers etc mixed into my dish. I also got the fresh glazed strawberries pancakes which were alright-same with the caramel apple pecan pancakes. Ah, well-that's why you get pancakes as a side to just check 'em out!

The white chocolate mocha was tasty, though! They have intelligentsia coffee here, yum.

I'm posting this after a third failed (separate) attempt at ordering for takeout.   The place is overrated-  always an extremely long wait.   Granted, I'm not a breakfast type of person and the food is decent (when they get their orders right).   The reason why I give them two stars is that they have repeatedly screwed up my takeout order.   They redeem themselves by giving gift cards which is why I continue to go there.

While the wait time is always long, the food here is so worth it. I have never had pancakes that good and their egg dishes are also so so good. The portions are big - you'll definitely have leftovers or enough to split dishes. Would recommend going during the week or checking in on yelp ahead of time because the wait is kinda ridiculous.

Don't be too discouraged by the size of the line, it moves pretty quickly. The servers are speedy and helpful, the coffee is great and the choices, OMG, the choices. I had the cinnamon roll pancakes and they were to die for, so yummy. The guy beside me had the berry pancakes and they looked equally delicious. Reasonably priced and you don't wait long in between ordering and having a huge plate of breakfast in front of you. Centrally located and you can walk off all of the carbs at the park across the street right after ;)

We looked for a brunch place in Chicago and this place had such high ratings, plus so many reviews that we just had to come here. It's conveniently located across Millennium Park, making it easy for tourists to hit up many of Chicago's must-see spots.

For a workday, this place was packed. However--and luckily for us--we were seated right away and didn't have to wait. Our server gave us an overview of our menu and told us to take our time. And we needed the time. Everything on the menu looked so good! I had a hard time choosing. I ended up opting for the Homemade Corned Beef Hash which came with two eggs.

Husband got the Napa Valley Fig omelette with the side of "Signature Berry Bliss" pancakes. My brother and his wife also got their own dishes and added a side of the signature pancakes since we saw them raved about in Yelp.

Let me start off by saying that these are big portions. Plates can easily be shared. For four people with four separate dishes, we had plenty of leftovers by the time we were done eating. Keep that in mind if you want to eat here but don't want to lug around leftover boxes.

As for the food, I liked my corned beef hash. But when it comes to the popular Signature Berry Bliss pancakes, I wasn't a big fan. It was so SWEET. The pancakes are even stuffed with some type of creme. The pancakes, with the fruit, and the syrup tasted like a big pile of candy. It was too much to handle for breakfast. I don't know how people can finish a whole plate of those pancakes.

Our service was spotty. We asked for ketchup in the beginning and had to wave down another server to remind them of our missing ketchup. Also, it took a long time to get a refill of water. We would ask our waiter but we hardly saw him.

I liked the food at Wildberry Pancakes but suggest staying away from the pancakes and crepes if you can't stomach too much sweets early in the morning.

I LOOOVVVVEEE this place! Best pancakes I have every had. Everything here is good honestly. However, I would suggest using the "Nowait" app, you can get in line via the app and show up when your table is ready to bypass the standing wait that is inevitable if you don't use the app. Any who the breakfast is amazing, a visit is a must!

Wildberry never disappoints. We have come for breakfast regularly since Wildberry opening in Chicago. The savory Berry French toast, to the yummy scrambled eggs and turkey sausage are always tasty. We enjoy the patio in the summer months as well.  We have brought out of town guests here and they enjoy the breakfast food as well. Wildberry is a great addition to our neighborhood
Let us sit with our dogs outside.  Service was okay, but they were pretty busy for 8AM.  Food was delicious!

Freaken delicious!  Every last bit was yummy.  The pancakes were beyond delish and I wished that I had more room in my belly for the eating.  

They lose a star for refusing to give us refills on coffee when the server saw me sipping out my husband's cup.  I did order my own juice, but apparently he was more concerned about the coffee that I was "stealing".  We just paid for 2 cups of coffee to avoid any issues and he was happy to refill our one cup.  I don't like to deal the petty crap over a $2 cup of coffee.  

Besides coffee-gate and the 45 minute wait,  I loved the place.

pics.caption: Corn beef hash skillet and fig havarti cheese omelet

review.des: Great crepes. Loved the brisket hash. Excellent service. Reserve your place in line on Yelp!

The Signature Berry Bliss!

hnnnnggg soooo gooodddd.
This place is awesome, I would say the wait was long but my friend had a table when I arrived:) the food was absolutely delicious and if I lived closer I would visit almost everyday! Banana pancakes
It was worth the wait! I ordered the Denver Skillet with buttermilk pancakes...to die for! Servants were very nice and friendly!

We arrived at Wildberry a little after noon, and waited just 10 minutes for a table for 2, which is fortunate. I know of people who have had to wait over an hour for a brunch spot on the weekends.

Because Wildberry only serves brunch, their doors close at 2:30 p.m. every day. However, every patron has to wait his or her turn for a taste of what this place has to offer, because this place doesn't allow reservations. I can't imagine how long people wait on the weekends...

The menu offers twists on classic brunch items, both sweet and savory, from breakfast burritos to omelettes to French toast to waffles.

It also has something for kids and seniors, and their extensive drink selection offers smoothies, lemonades, espresso drinks, mocha drinks, and more!

Next time, we'll be back to test the lunch items like salads and sandwiches, but since this place was voted best pancakes in Chicago, we just had to try them out.

Shortly after we were seated, our waiter brought out a plate of assorted sauces: cream cheese, warm syrup, ketchup, and a delicious strawberry jam.

Even though the restaurant was very near capacity (~100), the wait time was barely 10 minutes.

*drum roll*

The "Signature Berry Bliss" pancakes ($10.95) were stacked 4 or 5 high, drizzled generously with a vanilla Anglais sauce and blackberry coulis. A scattering of fresh strawberries, blackberries, and blueberries helped cut through the richness of the pancakes, and a delightfully sweet light pink berry mascarpone was slathered generously between each pancake, tying the whole dish together.

Our Venetian Sizzlin' Skillet ($10.45) came with a generous portion of hash browns, which were topped with a double blend of cheeses, two eggs cooked to our liking (we ordered sunny-side up), Italian sausage crumble, bell peppers, onions and tomatoes. Though the dish was above average, I think that if some sort of delicious sauce had helped to tie it together, it would have been exceptional.

It came with a side of toast or pancakes. We chose white toast, though most other patrons opted for pancakes, understandably.

I also ordered coffee ($2.65) which came with a cute mini pitcher of cream, and free refills.

In the end, we paid ~$26 for two people. I was happy to pay it. I've paid a similar amount or even more for a meal that hasn't been nearly as satisfying as Wildberry. Due to generous portion sizes, we were reasonably full and content when we left.

Read my full review on my food blog! catthecritic.wordpress.c…

You must try this place! But expect a long wait. While my friend and I were waiting for our table, Forrest was super helpful in answering all of our questions and giving us tips on what to order. We ended up sharing the signature berry bliss waffle and multigrain fig pancakes. We also had berries and their brewed coffee. All delicious! I also had a goat cheese omelet, while my friend had the turkey sausage and egg whites. My omelet was delicious. My friend said the turkey sausage was unremarkable. I took off a star for the insane wait, but the service and food were amazing. Go now!

pics.caption: Multigrain/fig pancakes, egg white omelet, fruit, egg whites and turkey sausage, signature berry bliss waffle and coffee

review.des: Great breakfast place!  The wait was not bad. They texted us when out table was ready. The coffee was excellent. The pancakes were light and fluffy. The service was on point. Our tables food was excellent. The food did not take long to come out, even though they were crowded. My eggs Benedict were cooked perfectly. My husbands omlete was light and fluffy.

We had great food and fact and attentive service! I can't wait to go back. The Yelp app helped shorten our wait time from  90 minutes to 15! Oh how I love technology when I'm hungry!  I can't wait to go back again and again. I just wish they had one in the southern suburbs.

Don't know what to say, except this place is solid. There is a long wait, but once you get in, the service is fast and friendly. Word to the wise, get on the wait list via Yelp before you even leave home/hotel/Airbnb.

120-180 minutes of wait time. We went by the ratings and we waited 120 minutes for a table. But disappointed in the food. Nothing original about pancakes. Skillet was alright. You could eat it but there was no wow factor about any of the food we ordered. I usually don't eat pancakes but since it's called wild berry pancakes I wanted to see what was so special about their pancakes or breakfast in general. We should have gone to yolk with less wait time. I would not recommend it. If you do end up eating there make sure you don't wait 120 minutes! It is definitely not worth the wait or ratings! It's average Cracker Barrel type breakfast

My fiance and I used to live one block from Wildberry and it was our go-to breakfast/brunch place. Everything on the menu is gigantic (we normally take home leftovers and it feeds us for the entire day) and excellent. The only downside is that due to its popularity, there's always a long wait on weekends! Because of that, at busy times, we've called in orders for takeaway, which skips the line.

Note: This is not a trendy, new age brunch place, just a good old fashioned American diner style breakfast place. You'll find skillets, benedicts, french toasts, and the like on the menu here.

After reading the thousands of yelp reviews, i came with sky-high expectations. Sadly, this spot fell way short. The ingredients tasted packaged and not super fresh to me. The fruit was an exception. I got the veggie omelet and could taste the vegetables and the oil they used yuck. I don't like the flavor of olive oil in my omelet, no. The american cheese I ordered on the side was the kraft kind that is packaged in plastic by the slice, weird. The cinnamon roll pancakes I got as a side were just regular pancakes with a hefty douse of cinnamon swirled in. Weak! I was envisioning a sliced up cinnamon roll but no not so much. I had to use syrup b/c they weren't even super sugary tasting. Hmm. So yea, with so many inventive brunch spots in Chicago, I will not be waiting two hours to come here again soon.

This breakfast mecca would've easily gotten a 5 hadn't the hostess been so rude when I walked in. I told her that I was meeting a friend who was already seated. When I told the hostess her name she laughed at me and said that she "had no one down with that name but I could go check if I wanted." She didn't even offer to help walk me over to see if she was there or asked her name again maybe if she has misheard me? My friend was there when I checked and the rest of our experience was great.
Awesome pancakes! Great environment for family at a weekend morning to catch up and relax a bit. Great location. Highly recommend it.

Excellent food + excellent service. I wish I could have lingered longer over this wonderful brunch! I joined my friends a bit late, but our superb server made me feel right at home. My friends had an assortment of amazing looking eggs, potatoes and omelets, and they also did well for my friend who needs gluten free foods. I chose the breakfast burrito, full of yummy chunks of avocado. I also observed the hash browns were crispy and light, not greasy. Coffee was very good too.

We had to get to an outdoor activity immediately after this, and our server went over and above helping us with to-go boxes and hot drinks. I feel fortunate to have discovered this place as it is not too far from my sister's new home. I think I will be back when I'm in the area.

The waits for this restaurant are stupefying, but I've always attributed it to the location. Go on a weekday if you can (the weekend wait is often 1-2+ hours). There's a coffee bar near the hostess stand, so if it's nice out grab a drink (they serve Intelligentsia) to enjoy outside while you wait.

This is definitely the sort of place where I indulge in the less healthy breakfast options... you only live once. It's hard to go wrong with the pancake options (highly recommend the Signature Berry Bliss or seasonal specials). The waffles are just okay compared to the pancakes. They also have a large selection of omelets and skillets if you want a more substantial (less sugar-filled) breakfast.

Excellent friendly and fast service by Brittney G.  Scrambled eggs and link sausages yummy!  Never can go wrong with chocolate chip pancakes!  Would definitely have on the 'to do' list if I visit Chicago again.

Oh my. And I mean oh my. Well worth the hour long wait for this place. I ordered the Wildberry signature French toast. Seriously the best French toast I have ever had. No syrup necessary, as the berries and cream anglaise delivered the perfect amount of sweetness. The texture of the bread was perfect. My dining companion ordered a skillet (with several substations that they were incredibly willing to accommodate, thank you so much) and thoroughly enjoyed it as well. I will be dreaming about this until the next time I return to Chicago.

Great spot for breakfast. We went on a Monday, later morning and had to wait about 30-45 minutes for a table of 6, but it was well worth the wait. Everyone loved what they ordered. Our server, Jasmine, did a great job - spoke loud and clear and knew her stuff. The decor/ambiance isn't anything special.

If you visitors to Chicago you should try this amazing breakfast restaurant

I love the red velvet French toast its melting in your mouth
and the Benedict its how it's supposed to be delicious
And they are so kind and friendly you will forget the long waiting after trying the food with a good and beautiful smiling from staff
Best breakfast place in Chicago!  Great service too. Beware sometimes the wait can be long but it's worth it.
Crazy large portions of excellent food. Fresh quality. Friendly staff. Expect long waits on the weekend for brunch.

Ok, so they messed up my order so I couldn't give them 5 stars.
But let's get on to the important stuff.
The service was great and pleasant.
The waiter was really pleasant and great to deal with.
My omelette was perfect!
Cooked well and tasty!!!
Even with the flub of my order I would come back in a heartbeat.

Such a cute breakfast place!! Loved it! Yes it's a long wait but we put our names on the waitapp and got to walk over right when it was ready! Lots of options for breakfast food! It's right across from millennium park so it's a perfect spot to hit up after!

Amazing food!  We asked our server what we should eat and he recommended everything. We had a party of 11 and we tried almost everything.  I highly recommend any type of pancakes.  The lemonade was awesome as well.  Our server was really friendly and the manager stopped over a couple of times to check on us!  I wish they had one in Texas and then we could really enjoy them often.

My son turned 7 on the 7th it was his GOLDEN BIRTHDAY & he wanted to go eat breakfast especially some pancakes!(first pick was IHOP then he changed it lol)This was our first time here, the wait was long, but it was worth it. The food was good & everyone working was very nice!! We all enjoyed & will definitely be returning!!
Always, always perfect!  I drive out of my way for this place.  I try something new each time.   In my opinion, Wildberry and Yolk are neck and neck as far as my #1 breakfast spot.

If you're by Millennium Park or just downtown and want a good meal that is reasonably priced. I've been here a few times for business meetings or brunch. It's a great brunch/lunch spot, love the Mexican skillet and cinnamon waffles.

Good coffee too. The menu is large enough that if someone doesn't like breakfast food there are plenty of other options. Good for kids, couples and business.
