I'll keep this short and sweet just like the WildBerry Pancakes. This place is hands down the best breakfast joint in the USA. You won't order anything that doesn't make you feel at peace with dying right after the last bite. Simply amazing and well worth the wait.

Southern Benedict and their orange juice was delicious! Place was around the clock busy with friendly staff. Be sure you are not in a rush to eat. This place is quite the wait. Millennium Park is across the street and on the other side of the park is the Art Institute. Stop at all three for a fun day!

One of my favorites breakfast spots. It's just flat out good and breakfast is my least favorite meal.

Get there early because it gets very busy especially on the weekends.

The Mexican skillet is delish and go ahead and order a side of their famous pancakes.

Great food, long wait (even checking in advance via Yelp) - but worth the wait!  TIP: if you're splitting specialty pancakes, get the sub on your meal for $1.50. Everyone should pick something different because they are ALL so different and good!  Our fav was the cinnamon roll pancakes.

And the award for Best Brunch of 2016 goes to... Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe.

Was in town for a conference, and 3 Chicagoans recommended this spot for brunch, so we gave it a try. PRO TIP- Yelp lets you get on the waitlist from the app, and you'll want to do that since the wait on weekends is about 1.5 hours. But it's soooo worth it. We weren't going to chance it, so I signed up on the Yelp waitlist and we also went to the restaurant to sign up in person, and confirmed the wait time. As visitors, we took the time to walk around the city, visit Millennium Park, and do other basic girl Chicago things, and that really helped pass the time. And finally, we received the text that sent us sprinting towards the restaurant for our table.

Atmosphere:
Instantly greeted by the sweet smell of pancakes. Huuuuge restaurant, but definitely packed, although not to the point where it feels cramped. They have a variety of seating options, from booths to tables and etc. The decor is super cute and unique; I remember commenting on it while salivating over the menu. The wait staff is super friendly and informative, and the wait for the food is probably proportional to your hanger level. Still, every patron has the moment when the tray of piping hot breakfast foods stops at your table, and you know you've reached the stairway to heaven.

Food:
Seriously, if I'm dying and randomly happen to be in Chicago, take me here and let me enjoy my last blissful moments surrounded by my friends formerly known as the Signature Wildberry Pancakes and the Butcher Block Skillet. If I find out you took me to a hospital instead, I will be unspeakably upset. I cannot believe how much quality food you get for the price (maybe totaled $12 before tax). I was going to go for pancakes for sweet and bacon for savory until I saw the skillet options. The Butcher Block skillet offers a huge serving of hashbrowns, endless turkey ( or was it ham), sausage, and BACON, onions and other worthy vegetables, and is topped off with 2 eggs any way you like them ( the correct answer is over medium so the yolk comes crying down the heap of breakfast). I was beyond thrilled  to find out the skillet comes with either toast or pancakes, so obviously I added $1.5 and got the signature Wildberry Pancakes to find out if the namesake was any good. Oh my goodness. Each bite of pillowy goodness contained more berries than I could count, a wildberry syrup of sorts that wasn't too sweet but still made a perfect binding, and the lightest marscapone I've ever had. Holy cow. Still unsure if it's pancake or just cake. My friends ordered other skillets with the pancakes and were also very satisfied with their meals.  Under normal circumstances, I would absolutely advocate for making this two meals ( maybe three if you're a good person). But my hunger level +the fact I was leaving the city in an hour + the fact that I was in heaven = I ate every single decadent bite of the skillet and the pancakes. No berry left behind. No regrets, just love.

Maybe it's the happy tourist speaking, but this was hands down my favorite meal of the trip, and I cannot wait to come back to Chicago for another bite (or several bites) here. Delish!

After a nice walk in the brisk autumn morning we stopped by the Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe and was treated with a homestyle breakfast that really hit the spot. I am a sucker for seasonal specials so I ordered the hot pumpkin spiced apple cider and it was so comforting. I also ordered the Berry Bliss pancakes. Normally there are 5 pancakes but I was afraid I couldn't eat all that and I hate wasting food so our really nice waitress recommended I get the short stack which is only 3 pancakes and $1 less. It was the perfect amount and the pancakes were so good that I could have licked the plate.

pics.caption: Short stack of Berry Bliss pancakes

review.des: Literally my favorite breakfast place. I guess only downside is that they have a long wait typically, especially on the weekends. I really love their pancakes and their location is very nice as well.  I can't wait for the one to open up at water tower place.

I came here for brunch on a Friday and the wait was only about 30 minutes. We checked in, walked over to The Bean to kill time, and received a text in no time. We ordered the Florence Benedict and the "Signature Berry Bliss" pancakes. Both were so delicious! The pancakes were a little too sweet for me, but still yummy nonetheless. Loved the hollandaise sauce on the benedict! Definitely recommend going!

Really had high expectations for this place, unfortunately it did not meet my hopes. My family waited the hour and a half it took for us to get seated - we figured if there was this much of a line, it had to be great. By the end of the meal, we all wished we had gone back to Yolk instead.
I had ordered the Cinnamon Roll pancakes - they looked amazing! Sadly, they were just regular pancakes with a cinnamon drizzle on top. So with 3 pancakes on my plate, only the top pancake had the cinnamon roll taste to it. The other two pancakes were plain, average, and dry.
We were pretty disappointed, especially for how long we waited. I would not recommend waiting in line here - there are better places in the city to try.

This was probably one of the best all around breakfasts I've ever eaten!  This service was fantastic,  and the food came out promptly and hot!  If you are going to have one breakfast in Chicago,  this should be your choice!

The service was fast, but our waiter forgot many things and gave our table no personal attention. I felt like he wanted to flip our table for the line waiting at the door and I HATE that. I do not go out to breakfast to be treated like a number. I think of breakfast as an experience. This location attracts a lot of tourists and the tables are crammed in.

I got excited for the pumpkin spice pancakes on the menu, but they were a big let down. You are much better going to Yolk or Brunch.

The s'mores Oreo pancakes were amazing!! The service was great and efficient. I got the omelette and upgraded to the s'mores Oreo pancakes. If you love chocolate then I would recommend these pancakes.

Food was great!!! But the wait time and crowd takes away from the experience, even with the no wait app it's still at least 45 mins. I wish I could give it 4.5 stars. Literally everything I tried was great. Choc chip and cinnamon roll pancakes, make your own omelet, hash browns, Venetian skillet. I'd definitely go back but maybe do takeout instead.

We stoped for brunch while in Chicago.  The wait was a little long, over an hour but the food was with it.  Wild berry pancakes were amazing, eggs were perfect.

Parking down town was $13.00 for 2 hours on the street

We only waited about 25 minutes for a Sunday morning breakfast. I love that they text your phone and tell you that your table is ready. I got blueberry pancakes which were really good. The blueberries were really sweet.

I read tons of reviews about this place maybe I ordered the wrong thing, yes my pancakes were delicious but I'm not sure what the hype is about

After a night out in Chicago, we wanted to have a good sumptuous brunch close to our hotel and this place was a great find! Has rave reviews on Yelp and so we chose this place! They don't take any reservations and so the wait was really long. But once we were seated the service was very fast and the food was delicious. We ordered Signature berry pancake, Nutella crepe with banana and Denver Skillet. The food was served in less than 10mins. Everything was super tasty and the portion was huge. The interior decoration is casual and service is spot on! This is a great brunch place- food, service everything is AWESOME!!
I went here for brunch with six other people on a Wednesday. No line and they sat us within 5 min. Food was fresh and tasty.

The food in this restaurant is great, no doubt. I come here often with friends and family who visit from out of town, but I won't be returning here anymore.

I took my family of 5 and registered to be seated in an hour and a half. I had no problem waiting. We waited our turn like everyone else. I notice a second family of 5 check in an hour later. Literally 15 minutes later, that family was seated. I asked what was going on and why we weren't seated and I got "sorry, we don't really know when seats will be available" from the hostesses. Then I asked how long my wait is for, and they told me that I had another hour and that I've only been waiting for 30 minutes, which is totally not true.

As I argued about the time issue, another family of 5 that came much later than my family were seated. Again, at this point, it's been 2 hours of waiting, and when I went back to ask what was going on, I was told that I've only been waiting for 30 minutes.

I have no clue what went wrong or why the hostesses did what they did, but I know that it wasn't normal. My family and I were so frustrated that we left. I will never come to this restaurant again. I was a regular and I always told people to come eat here, but now I'm going to take my network elsewhere.
Everything was very good.  Portions were more then enough.  No wait list was great.  In there in about 15 minutes.

I went on a Saturday morning around 8:30 and the wait time was about 20-30 mins. (A table for two). I had the cinnamon roll french toast! OMG they are amazingly good!!! Also added a side of smoked bacon (the side is three slices). I prefer bacon really crunchy and this one was completely the opposite, anyways I ate it all since it tasted so good.

Definitely recommend the place.

pics.caption: Cinnamon Roll French Toast with a side of Smoked Bacon

review.des: Came here when I was in town for the Chicago marathon and was really glad I did. The restaurant is cute itself. Great service, amazing food at decent prices. The special pancakes can be slightly overwhelming with lots of sweet toppings, but make a great option to split with another person.

Very nice place, next to the famous park and the lake. Staffs are very friendly. Be prepare you need you come very early, or you have to get a very long line. Waiting time to get in around 1hr. But it was okay for me because the food very delicious, it was huge. The main food plus the 2 pancakes. Anyways, good place to come when you visit Chicago.

Boyfriend and I tried it for the first time. I didn't understand the hype. We saw a long line of people the previous day so we tried to beat the line the next day and the sizes were good but there wasn't anything special about it.

I was never a fan of pancakes and still aren't UNLESS it's from Wildberry Pancakes. The pancakes here are so light and fluffy. It's so good, you don't even need to eat it with syrup or honey. I just wished I didn't share my plate of pancakes with anyone... The pancake I ordered was the Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes served with vanilla anglaise, blackberry coulis, berry mascarpone, and fresh berries. I can't get over how delicious it was.

Of course, with such good ratings and great food, expect a long wait. The wait isn't that bad, You have Millennium Park right across the street you can go to while you wait to be called. Regardless of the wait time, this place will NOT fail you. It's totally worth the wait.

I can still remember how fluffy the pancakes were. This will be the first stop when I'm back in Chicago.

Gimme my pancakes!!

I lived just down the street when Wildberry opened so I was aware of how popular it was right from the start.  After a few weeks I went, and was shocked when they said the wait was 2 hours-really??? Since I lived down the street, I signed in and went back home.  then returned at a little earlier than the time with my family-and I was NOT disappointed. The food was amazing (the berry bliss pancakes are RIDICTIFIED and portions were large) and the atmosphere was a a tad bit loud but this was breakfast with my family not an intimate dinner. The only reason I can't give it 5 stars is because of the wait.  Not sure if that's fair, but...just get on the wait list on yelp (but that only works if you're within 10 mi of the restaurant) since not everyone can go back home, work out and come back.
Amazing!! The breakfast skillet with pancakes can't be beat. Must eat brunch here!  Coffee wasn't as high quality as the food, but the food was worth the wait.
Two words: wildberry pancakes. SO good! Everything we tried was excellent but they are known for these pancakes - and it's clear to see why. Very special. Lives up to their Yelp reviews.

Absolutely the best breakfast I've had. Cinnamon roll pancakes are delicious, 3 large pattie sausage yummy, chicken sausage amazing overall you can't go wrong.  Just get there early so you can get a seat, if not put your name in and they will text you when to come back you have 5 min after they text you to show up. Denver Skillet a little too much cheese but tell them to go easy on the cheese A+++++ place if your from out of town it's a must go too

The food is so good and the plates are massive, but it's quite a chore to get in here. We had to wait nearly 2 hours. That's not fun at all. I know, I know, it's the Chicago Brunch Scene and it is what it is. But it's exhausting when I'm hungover as hell and hungry as a hippo.

I've been to Wildberry a few times now and it has never let me down. The wait is a bit of a pain, but the food and service is exceptional and well worth the wait. Try to get there for an early breakfast or a late brunch to beat the rush. I gravitate towards their skillets with a side of specialty pancakes. And their portions are quite large for a great price. Save some for dinner because breakfast for dinner is always a great idea. :D

How do I put into words the amazing, outlandish ly perfect meal that I had here on the morning of November 1st, 2015? I'm at a loss.... every time I try to think of what to write, the vision of getting that plate of homemade corned beef hash and that other plate of signature berry bliss crepes. I am a huge breakfast buff - I am very picky about what makes a good breakfast,  let alone a great one. But make no mistake,  this restaurant gave me the best breakfast of my life. Absolutely breathtaking corned beef hash that were finely chopped small bits of meat and potato  (no bug chunks like you sometimes see) cannot be missed.

Your server will likely recommend that you try their signature berry bliss pancakes.  I suggest you try the signature berry bliss crepes. You can enjoy more of the meal by eating the crepes without feeling overly bloated halfway in. Also, I strongly suggest getting the corned beef hash and signature berry bliss crepes (if you're with one other person) and sharing. Have the best of both worlds in this otherwordly establishment. YES!!! IT IS WORTH THE WAIT FOR A TABLE!! :)

We almost didn't go here bc we really enjoyed our breakfast yesterday at yolk (best juice ever FYI) but at last minute decided to give this a whirl. Glad we did. Long wait on Sunday morning at 10am (1hr) but get the no wait app and you can easily track how many people are in front of you. The wait was shorter than they said it would be.

Now on to the food.. Toffee nut latte was warm but not hot. Still good. We shared one. I ordered garden skillet - best skillet I've ever had. Not kidding... They don't skimp on veggies and flexible on changes ( I got feta instead of cheddar). Seriously. So good. Got the gluten free honey pancakes to go with and man... So good. Don't taste like some GF I've had that are lacking in flavor. I almost did the signature berry but wanted something a little lighter. Did not disappoint. My guy got the potato pancakes and he loved them. Light and fluffy, flavorful with chives, cheese, bacon crumbles and sour cream.

Best breakfast I've ever had. Go. Just go. Worth the wait.
Food was amazing! The wait was 1 hour, but it was so worth it. Food came out cheesy and fresh! Every time I visit I will eat here.

Order the berry pancakes! They are the fluffiest and most delicious pancakes I have ever eaten. We ordered them as a side to come with our omelet. Then, we ordered more because they were just so good! My hubby got the biscuits and gravy with eggs, which he said was pretty great. The waitress was kind and friendly. The service was quick! The line was incredibly long at about 11AM on a Sunday. They were telling people an hour to an hour an a half. However, we only waited about 5 minutes because we used an app on our phone called nowait. I would definitely suggest going that route so that you can enjoy the food but not spend an hour standing outside of the restaurant waiting!

Go here. Seriously. You will NOT regret it. The most amazing food. I loved what I ordered but I also wanted everything else on the menu. Coffee is superb. Orange juice is something you should not pass up.

I have heard so much about this place.
So, I decided to check it out.. it was unfortunately on a Saturday morning.

When they tell you it will be a 3hr wait, it WILL be a FULL 3 hr wait.
After 1st hr, I really didnt possibly think it was going to be another 2 hrs.
After 2nd hr, I felt like I was too invested to leave.
I prob would've given 4 star review if the wait was less.

Some restaurants usually are able to accommodate you and your party faster than the expected wait time. Not here given the immense volume of people. To give them credit, they do work very efficiently.

Anyways, its good quality brunch food for sure.
not drenched in oil, etc etc. was very happy to be seated.

I will not ever ever again wait 3 hrs tho.
I would recommend order and pick up.

I went wild after having their insanely amazing signature Berry Bliss pancakes. No, I really did. If you were at this cafe last week and wondered who (possibly) ruined your morning with the "mmm's" and "ahs", chances are it came from me. This was my very last meal in Chicago and they sure sent me off well!

I haven't had dessert all summer. Actually, I've been working hard to avoid having any dessert all year. I'm 800 miles away from home - why the hell not? I squeed at those photos of the Berry Bliss pancakes and I just had to have them.

I took one bite of those scrumptious and playful pancakes and ate like there was no tomorrow. I'm usually a syrup on pancake-kind of girl but with the vanilla & blackberry creams, I forgot syrup ever existed. They were so delicious with the fresh berries on the side and the best part was that there were blueberries stuffed in the pancakes! It was like getting a Wonder Ball chocolate and finding your favorite cartoon in there - a delightful surprise! It was even better than I thought; hot blueberries are so good!

I was stuffed halfway because I was just overwhelmed with the all the sweetness but I wish I packed my leftovers in my bag. The Classic Eggs Benedict are also worth getting because their hollandaise sauce is amazing and the fresh hash browns are just phenomenal.

This is my ideal breakfast-kind of place: great atmosphere, kind staff and great location. I didn't even have to "wait" as I expected I had to wait for at least "30 minutes". But they definitely did their part in making me go wild afterwards.

Upon arrival no smiles from hostesses, which kinda dampens the mood. Waiter was alright, came off a little blunt at first, but as the meal continued we all warmed up to each other! The food was great! Especially the pancakes! We had enough left for leftovers for another breakfast meal! I would definitely go back!!

pics.caption: Omelet and skillet along with buttermilk pancakes & cinnamon swirl pancakes!! Yummy!!

review.des:
Gluttonous and heavenly.  I mean, red velvet french toast? Cheesecake pancakes?  I honestly came into this restaurant with a mission and I succeeded in eating countless delicious dishes.  You can get half orders of items so do that, come with friends, and try as many different things as you can.

Also, my waiter was very friendly and efficient, so the experience was just awesome. I know I'm adding to my own wait when I say this, but go here if you get a chance!

Best breakfast I have ever had!!

I saw great reviews on this place but to be honest I thought it may be standard since I have had that so many times.

To start the great vibe and color ambiance in this place make it feel fresh and the service was great.

I had the meat skillet (I forget the name) what a great creation, blended together perfect, fresh tasting, and bustling with flavor!  For my side I got the signature Wild Berry pancakes...beautifully down! You do not need Syrup, they were the best pancakes I have ever had!!

A MUST VISIT!

Service, menu, food quality all first rate.

Visiting from Seattle and despite the wait this was our favorite restaurant experience. Generous portions, friendly, helpful, and engaged staff. The place was packed yet the door and waitstaff were cheerful and attentive. Pancakes were all that you'd expect. Be ready for the sweet though if you go for the cinnamon roll cakes!  I got a sausage and egg skillet and it was perfect. Excellent corned beef hash as well; my wife enjoyed that. This place is worth the wait!

If you should ever stop at Wildberry Cafe for breakfast, then I must only recommend one thing and one thing only. Their signature "Berry Bliss" pancakes. Each bite was blissful indeed.

Make sure you are prepared to wait a hefty amount of time. We were told the wait would be about 2 hours. Fortunately, WB is walking distance from Millennium Park and Cloud Gate so we took our time enjoying the sites before walking back to WB. You will see a slew of people sitting/standing outside WB, wishing for their vibrator to go off to alert them of their table being ready.

Every item on their menu sounded delicious but I had to get their signature dish. Buttery soft pancakes with blueberries and WB whipped mascarpone. Every bite had the finger-licking good mascarpone which brought the pancakes to a whole new level. The pancakes are topped with fresh berries, vanilla cream anglaise, and a fresh blackberry coulis. Their house coffee is Intelligentsia. The brand speaks for itself!

This place was ridiculously amazing. I was trying to convince my friends to come back for lunch but we had other "fishes to fry" on this trip. Sigh. 'Til next time WB!

We came here on a Sunday and got here at or before 8am and walked right in, zero wait. I ordered the berry crepes because it was one of the items suggested by Yelpers and they were absolutely amazing. My husband had the biscuits and gravy and they too were very good. Our waitress was also excellent. I highly recommend Wildberry for breakfast or lunch when you're in downtown Chicago. We will definitely be back again.
Perfect Pancakes with every berry on the menu  !! The wait was 2 hours, the front looked like were lining up to be selected to enter a rock concert.
Chocolate banana bread French toast! If weather permits go for patio seating - faster and great view of the park.
Love that you put your name on yelp waitlist ahead of time. Service is spot on & pancakes are crazy good!

We went to this place twice last time we were in Chicago.

I think this is one of the best breakfast places I have ever been to. Not sure why, but the combination of huge dishes, awesome food, good service, and just being in Chicago, make it one of my top favorites for breakfast places.

Others report very long lines to get in here, We have been here a few times and each time We was able to get right in.

The food was very delicious- very rich, a lot of good flavors and a variety to choose from. Couldn't finish our meal because the proportions were huge! (but I wish I could!)
Excellent service- we were seated immediately and our waiter was friendly, attentive to our needs, and had good advice.
I would definitely recommend this and would love to come back!

pics.caption: cheese & ham omelette and hash browns

review.des: Best breakfast in Chicago. Get there early to avoid the long wait times. Staff is great too.
Signature berry pancake is fabulous! Long wait, but it's worth! Good service. Coconut mocha was my first try that is really good.

All the reviews are great on this place and they were right. Jeremy served us with a smile and wit. Fantastic way to start the day. Here's a tip we came on a Monday morning and avoided the 2 hour Weekend wait!

Despite all the glowing reviews, I found Wildberry to have mediocre food. The latte was too hot and the milk was burned, the bacon was tough like jerky, the hash Browns were cold and burned, the sausage was flavorless, the waffles tasted like Eggos, and the chicken (for the waffle) was a breaded cutlet, not fried.

I was impressed by the efficiency of the operation. Even though there was a huge crowd, the wait was only 20 minutes, and the server was fast and courteous. I just wish the food was worth it.

PROS
- Efficient service
- Great location

CONS
- Bland food
- Not worth the wait

TIP
If you insist on going to this tourist trap, then there's an app to add your name to the wait list early.
The pancakes were amazing!  The wait was a little bit out of control (like an hour), but it was worth it.  I was dreading when the meal would end after each bite.  This place is legit.

Very good breakfast food. I got the butcher skillet with  gluten free pancakes and had no complaints. Quality of the food is definitely up there after eating this skillet.
Service when we got seated was pretty good as well too. Only thing is that this place is super busy on Sunday around noon. It was between 45 to 60 minute wait but was well worth it.

I heard about the infamous wait to eat at this place- and even when I gave in my name for a table of 8, they told me that it'd be a 30 minute wait (mind you, WAY less than the actual time I thought I'd have to wait). The Millenium Park is right across the street and there's a lot of other nearby places to wander to but I really wanted to see the bean, so as I was making my way over... I didn't even make it over. I got a text message saying that my table was ready for me to be seated at. I chose the most popular pancakes- the berry one and my boyfriend opted for the mexican benedict. Oh wow, both were just packed with so much flavor but not in an overwhelming way. The pancakes' sweetness level was extremely tolerable that even my boyfriend could grin it through many bites. I unfortunately had to take more than half my dish to go.. the portions are HUGE. But heck, it tasted even better a few hours later. This place is going to be forever bookmarked on my list and will always be the first trip I make every single time I land in Chicago.

I really enjoyed my food, I ordered a skillet loaded with breakfast meats, my wife thought her's Eggs Benedict was just OK. Also had a side of the lemon poppyseed pancakes which were awesome.  Busy place, but you can make a reservation.  Would go back.
This place is too crowded and the quality and flavor of the food related to the price are not worth it. I would not recommend it at all.

Very nice please for groups.. lots of veggie options for myself and some of my vegetarian friends.. I took my mom for graduation who is not a big fan of restaurants in general but she liked this place.. fresh OJ was her fvt :) plus unlike other places, now you don't have to wait in line to be seated, they will give you a buzzer and take your name down, you can walk around till your turn to be seated arrives. Just walk in when the buzzer goes off!

Reserve a table! Glad I did as I saw people waiting outside for 30+ minutes. Excellent food, had the classic Benedict with the tasty free refill lemonade, yum. Employees were very kind and attentive. Definitely will be back.
It's fine. Not special. Standard breakfast. No complaints but nothing done exceptionally well. Efficient service and huge portions.  If the lines not too long eat here.  It's not worth waiting for.

Hands down thee best breakfast place, with location location location. Literally across the street from Millenium and Maggie Daley Parks. I always have the eggs Benedict with the sausage and the strawberry crepes. It's heaven in your mouth. Love this place. Beware though that the wait time is almost always long. Either arrive bright and early 7-8 or wait an hour but even then, the food makes up for it. So worth the wait.

What should you eat at Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe? Hmm. Oh I know. THE WILDBERRY PANCAKES. These were probably the best pancakes I have ever had. I also tasted their cinnamon roll pancakes, which were also good, but the wildberry pancakes is where it's at.

The only reason I'm not giving this place 5 stars is because of the exhausting wait times they often have. We went on a Saturday around 11:30, fully expecting a wait, but not the 2 hour wait we were quoted. Thankfully, they use an app that updates you on the status of your wait time. That way you can go take a stroll around Millennium Park or something and use that time rather than just endlessly wait.

Good food but suboptimal customer service. On our first visit, the food was delicious but the staff appeared overworked and were not the most friendly. On second (attempted) visit I called ahead to join the wait list and was told the wait list is available only by using an app. Could that be more impersonal? We went to Sunny Side Up instead and had even better food from very pleasant people.
The Corned Beef Benny was outstanding. Ask for their fresh made sals and you'll be glad. The specialty pancakes were good as well. Expect to pay 10-15 per person.

With a Monday morning off of work, I thought I'd seize the opportunity to try Wildberry between the typical breakfast and lunch rush. But even at 9:30 our party of 3 didn't have much luck skipping the wait time, at an estimated 45 minutes to be seated. I did appreciate the coffee bar in the front though! We definitely took advantage of grabbing a cup to sip while we waited. We also perused the menu, but there were so many options it was hard to decide! I finally settling on the Rutherford omelette, and was not disappointed. Not only was it tasty, but the portion was sizeable too. Prices are fair, and pretty on par with breakfast/lunch spots around Chicago. The ambience is bustling and lively, but the service just ok. Decor and style of the restaurant was pretty run of the mill. Overall, the experience at Wildberry was good but left just a little to be desired.

Great food and great service!
The Espanola omlet and Oreo S'more pancakes were really good.

OMG I love this place!
First time here and well worth The long walk to get here.  The food is phenomenal and the service was fantastic.  our server Kimberly was great had a lot of fantastic recommendations.  This is definitely a must in my book. You will not be disappointed.

pics.caption: White chocolate mocha Carmel coffee. Made to order hot and fresh

review.des: Oh my gosh that was a long wait for the pancakes.  This place is seriously popular. Came here at 10:13 am on a Sunday, and got a table by 11:45am. They text you five minutes prior, so you can wander around a bit. They also use an app called NoWait. Parked at Park Millenium using Spothero for $10 parking for 3 hours. Got the wild berry pancakes and red velvet toast, about $11 each plate. Both were really good, and I probably would come back here again if the line was shorter.

Best Breakfast and Service in Chicago!

This seems redundant in that everyone I talk to about WIldberry is in love with it... but they deserve all the kudos they get.

Everything we've tried from the omelets to their variety of Egg Benedict to an off-menu Banana Walnut Pancakes is satisfyingly, delicious!

The only downside is the long line (although, always worth the wait) and the fact that you'll be anxious to get back there until you return.

pics.caption: You'll Want to Try It... ALL!
Hot Chocolate, You'll Crave In July!

review.des: Very busy and very quick service. Breakfast was great! Our party had French toast and several different types of omelettes. French toast was a bit sweet but perfect for those that like dessert for breakfast! We also sampled the cinnamon bun pancakes, blueberry and plain...all were very good! Great breakfast for marathon weekend =)

What a neighborhood gem! Delicious. Great service. Pancakes light and fluffy. Everything is scrumptious: eggs, bacon, omelettes, coffees. We've been in town 3 days, and we've been here for every breakfast. Meaning we are here at 6:35 in the morning to start the day off right.

Can't say enough about this fantastic breakfast and brunch place!

You just can't make a bad choice here!

We went there this morning in a group of five, and we each ordered a drink ( they have pumpkin spice latte too for you fans) and we ordered five dished to share. The food came in very big portion! We ate until we were stuffed but still couldn't finish it. Their pancakes, waffle and crepe were very sweet and tasty, but their savory dishes were ok. I love their food very much and would probably come back after a while since the food was really high cal.

pics.caption: Banana cream crepe, really sweet and tasty!
Some walnut french toast, my fav of the day!

review.des:
Their pancakes are to die for, very fluffy and you have a lot of choices to the special ones. I ordered the garden skillet with the berry bliss pancake, and my friend ordered the egg white omelet with regular pancake. The wait was an hour which was not too bad because it is near the Millennium Park and there are just a few other places you could wander around before they text us.

I would say the food was worth the wait, and definitely would come back if I am around the area again!

pics.caption: The garden skillet and berry bliss pancake. The other one is egg white mushroom omelette. Both delicious and fulfilling!

review.des:
A couple of Chicago buddies recommended this place when we stopped out and it didn't disappoint at all. Going on a weekday ensured no wait at all, and a great seat on the patio.

The service was fast, friendly and attentive when we did need somethings. No complaints at all.

I ordered an omelet with the berry bliss pancakes, and the woman opted for the berry bliss waffle.

Wait was pretty minimal for the chow, maybe 10 minutes, which was not bad at all while we people watched on the patio.

The colors and the presentation was amazing for the breakfast, then, it was time to dig in.

My omelet, loaded to the brim with blue and chedder, broccoli, peppers, sausage and avocado was amazing. Cheese was melted perfectly, the veggies tasted great, sausage had some solid salt/spice to it, and the eggs themselves were still light and fluffy while not being over done to keep the omelet together. Little dash of hot sauce and it was on like donkey kong.

My pancakes... sweet mother of god were they good. The berries and cream sauce they use is divine on these nearly perfect cakes. I say nearly because I prefer a little extra time on the cakes to crust them, but no biggie, just a personal preference I didn't voice. Added some maple syrup just to see what kind of bliss it'd put me in, and yeah, the city could have caught fire and burnt to the ground for all I cared, I was in heaven.

Snagged a couple bites of the waffle which was buttermlik'y perfection with some solid crispness to the edges, and the sweet/tart flavor of the berries made me want to snatch it for myself. Just a perfect waffle through and through.

In talking to the host, the weekends can be a ridiculous wait, so go during the week if you have a chance. Otherwise, the way might be worth it still.

pics.caption: Omelet and hash, berry bliss cakes, and berry bliss waffle. Mmmmm

review.des: Great food and excellent service despite the wait! Cinnamon roll pancakes were delicious as well as the fried chicken with the chicken and waffle! Make sure to reserved for seat before you head that way! Wonderful coffee too!
This restaurant is worth the wait. Order a side of the specialty pancakes. I tried the veggie omelette with the banana cream pancakes as the side. Both were delicious!

I have only been here a few times and my old coworkers absolutely loved it. It's very busy and if you go towards closing (being a breakfast spot, they aren't open all afternoon), expect slow service. The food is good and the servings are massive, so bring your appetite!

The food is delicious and the staff is friendly. The wait time is too long dispite the fast service. However, this just speaks to how popular they are. Great location for brunch. l look forward to my next visit.

I was looking for a more savory breakfast that was close to the hotel, and I was happy to see chicken and waffles on the seasonal menu!

The chicken isn't your usual bone-in chicken, it was a breast with a spicy breading to it which was pretty good, especially with a splash of the maple syrup.  It was a little dry though, as chicken breast tends to be, and a tad hard.  The waffle was ok, fluffy in the middle with some jalapenos and crisp on the outside.  The bacon, OH the bacon!  Two strips of carmelized goodness!  

I also had a bowl of sliced strawberries, and well... some of the strawberries on the bottom were rotting, dark and mushy : /.  I get it, they're a busy breakfast place so they probably have a big bowl of sliced strawberries to use, but they really need to check them that morning, or at least before sending them out.  

All in all, I think if I stopped by this place again, I would probably stick to trying their sweeter menu.

pics.caption: Seasonal Chicken and Waffle with a bowl of strawberries. Chicken was ok, bacon was GREAT!

review.des:
I have to jump on the Wildberry band wagon.  I do not enjoy waiting in line for brunch, so I came on a random Monday at around noon and was able to walk right in.  

I had the Mexicana skillet and it was awesome- very flavorful and HUGE.  I am a big eater and only had 1/2 of it.  I loved the spicy kick with the jalapeños and the salsa was a great addition. I think if I came again I would swap out the chorizo sausage for ham (not even sure if they do substitutions) or mushrooms.  The chorizo, while tasty, left a pool of grease at the bottom of the pan that was less appealing.

I upgraded to the cinnamon roll pancake and they were fantastic!  So soft and perfect with the cinnamon icing.  I liked having something sweet and something savory for breakfast, normally I am forced to choose.

I had a bite of my husband's Denver skillet, the bell peppers were plentiful and this was just as delicious as my skillet.  

As much as I loved my brunch I would never wait for 1 hr for it so I recommend going on weekdays only.  

Tip: the Art Institute does not allow food to be stored in the coat check so don't attempt to bring leftovers there if going afterwards.

Thank god for the no wait app, otherwise we'd be having breakfast for dinner. The wait is immense any day, and that's certainly a tribute to the food and service. Everything from eggs to bacon to pancakes was delicious.

pics.caption: May possibly be the most popular breakfast spot on the planet.

review.des: Their skillets are really good!  I also ordered the s'mores pancakes which were delicious.  Not really s'mores but more crumpled up oreos but still good. Busy place.

OMG. The banana creme pancakes. These are the absolute best pancakes I have ever had in my entire life. The place is always busy, all the time, which is kinda annoying but man, those pancakes. The Mexican skillet is good too.

I heard so much about this place while visiting Chicago. The wait time is a very long wait but definitely worth it. While waiting you can visit Millenium Park (Across the street). Definitely a place to go to when in Chicago!

Most amazing breakfast I've ever had! Reviews were no joke. Pancakes are soft, fluffy and just perfect. Skillet was amazing, big servings, fair prices, just a wait but worth your time. Can't wait to come back!

Had breakfast for lunch here - food was incredible.  The only issue is they called for us way before the table was ready.

Tip:  if you get here around 1:20pm, the line dies down
This place was great and worth the wait! The portions are huge and can easily be split. Coffee and espresso drinks were well made.

pics.caption: Napa fig, bacon and havarti omelette

review.des:
Wildberry Pancakes... so good. One of the best pancakes I've ever had. I usually feel my arteries clogging after eating pancakes... but the pancakes here were fluffy, tasted so0o0o0o0o0o00o good, and got me feeling super satisfied/happy. I usually saturate mediocre pancakes in syrup, but the wildberry pancake didn't need any help... sooooo good on its own...
This place also has intelligentsia coffee (unlimited refills) so yay!!!!

hated the wait time, but it was worth the wait.  I am glad we worked up our appetite while we killed time at the park, weather was good so enjoyed that.  We were at Wildberry for a brunch, and it's truely a brunch place, the entree's are a good size, kids split their entree's but adults we were good for a solid 5-6 hrs after eating.  I understand place is bz but the clean up crew didn't even let us finish, and seemed like were hawking for our plates while we ate.  Which was not only disturbing but also awkward and uncomfortable.  My brother didn't even start on his pancakes and the busboys took the syrup, it seemed like they were pushing us out.  It's not like we were planning on sleeping there, but after an hr of wait, atleast give us an hour to eat.

The red velvet French toast. That's all the needs to be said about my favorite dish here. When I visited back in December from Los Angeles, I was looking for a great breakfast spot. This place was amazing. From the service down to the OJ. Everything was great. I catch myself missing this place when I go to IHOP. Lol. I'm gonna go back to Chicago to just get some French toast to go !! Go now, you won't be disappointed you went

WORTH THE HYPE. My husband and I live close by and have tried on numerous occasions to eat here without having to wait five hours. Veterans' Day at 9 am turned out to be the sweet spot apparently as we only had to wait 20 minutes. First let me start by commending our server. I wish I would have gotten his name because he was great. He's the reason we moved to Chicago. Friendly, charming, funny...just wonderful all around. He looked and sounded like he actually liked working there.

Now onto the food. I'd love to meet someone who doesn't like the pancakes at Wildberry. I'd be like, "oh, ok...you're a square. An "argue to argue" type of guy. I get it." I say that because they're out of this world delicious. I had a side of chocolate chip pancakes with an omelet (because I like gaining weight) and my husband had one of the scrambles with a side of cinnamon roll pancakes (because he likes taking a two hour nap after breakfast). OMG. I can't remember the last time I ate something that I knew was bad for me, but still said with each bite, "this is so worth it." Every bite.

I doubt my review is going to be the tipping point for you to check this place out, but if it is, great - your belly can thank me later.
OK breakfast stop.  Had a hard time getting coffee refilled amidst all the cheery server banter.
Wildberry just, actually, strictly dominates Yolk. Good pancakes, good omelet, good fruit. What else could ya ask for in a brunch place.

This pancakes here are AMAZING!!!! This place has that wow factor for brunch food. Like it's delicious, but they take it to another level. You can't find better pancakes! There's so many different flavors of pancakes, the cream in between, the drizzles, all the toppings! And each detail tastes sooooo good! Not too bland and boring, not too overly sweet, but just perfect flavors, that make the pancakes here such a decadent indulgence. This is the type of food you want access to anywhere you are lol
The Oreos Smores pancake was my FAV!!

Discovered this gem while visiting Chicago last weekend .  We couldn't decide between the egg dishes and signature pancake .The waitress was nice enough to offer a smaller version of the pancakes. Not to be missed. Looks like a dessert but not gooey sweet at all. There may be a long wait but it's well worth it!
Great food. Great service! Love that you can be added to the waitlist without actually being there.

Starving and looking for a good Sunday brunch place downtown close to where I was staying.  The place was packed and with the rain everyone was waiting inside so it was even more so.

After a bit of a wait (it was a Sunday afterall), I was sat and ordered up the Veggie Skillet (no cheese, add avocado ) and upgraded to the specialty pancakes (there are probably a dozen to choose from).  The Veggie skillet is a medley of spinach, onions, asparagus, mushrooms,  tomatoes, on top of hash browns (I will ask to make mine extra crispy next time), topped with eggs however you like them.  It was perfectly seasoned and hit the spot.  I choose the Berry Bliss Pancakes as my "upgraded" carb side which were heavenly! Two fluffy blueberry buttermilk pancakes topped with a vanilla anglais and berry coulis and served with a handful of fresh berries were delish.  Served with whipped butter (yes!) and maple syrup (not needed as the drizzle sauces were all you need for sweetness) on the side, you can doctor it up as you please.  I would have loved some pecans to sprinkle on top but it was pretty darn near perfection. Definitely going to come back before leaving. It's a don't miss!

FYI: No reservations so expect long waits especially on the weekend; they take your name and cellphone at which point you receive a text notifying you that you'll receive a text when you're close.  You can also download an app that tells you exactly how many other parties are in front of you.  Pretty cool.

pics.caption: Yummy! Veggie Skillet and Berry Bliss Pancakes are the ticket!

review.des: My wife loved it (she got a specialty waffle), however, I really wasn't that big of a fan. My oatmeal didn't have a lot of flavor. I ordered an omelette as well and it kinda tasted watered down. Also there was too much cheese for my liking. All in all it was alright I just don't see what all the fuss is about.

Now when I look at the review, I realize that I should have tried the pancake, which is recommended by everyone here. But I have to say that everything is just so perfect! I had the southern Benedict, it was excellent! Will definitely go there next time for the pancakes!
Don't order the crepes. The coffee and service was good. We only waited 15 min but by the time we left it was a 2 hour wait. Definitely not worth the wait..

Its a long waiting time on the weekend mornings. Almost 2 hour wait time. But rest assured, its just regular American breakfast. There is nothing in the omlette or pancake here that u wouldnt find elsewhere to be waiting 2 hours for. I like to try different places, so it was on my list of things to do in Chicago, but I wouldnt go back here if I have to wait absurd times in line. You will not miss much if you do not go here!

Went here for breakfast. We had an hour wait. While we waited, we decided to cross the street and enjoy the sites first. The food was above average from your typical breakfast joints. For an added 1.50, you can bling up your pancakes so you can order those too and not feel like you are missing out on them because you ordered a different type of dish.

pics.caption: I'm not sure what this was anymore, but man it was amazing.

review.des: Wait was 90 minutes, but with putting our names down on list through Yelp we only waited 10-15 minutes.  I had the Mexican skillet, wife had butcher skillet.  Both were amazing and HUGE!
I came here awhile back, it was okay. Nothing to write home about. It was decent food. Very busy and chaotic when I went.

The best crepes the world has ever known. Berry blissful & just enough to share with friends & still be more than full.
( not the most convenient for parking )

The coffee here is pretty good. However, I find the breakfast to be oversold.  Yes, it tastes ok, but any of the hype you hear is strictly from those who haven't been to any other fine brunch establishments in the area.  C+ at best.
You check in, they text you in minutes to be seated, the server is there instantly, high quality breakfast comes out fast, you pay, you stand up, you leave.  That's what I want, good job.

I love breakfast, and this place is what breakfast is all about!  Be forewarned that you will have to wait if you get here after 8:30ish, but well worth the wait.  Lots of seating so that helps with the wait time. Coffee is good, I enjoyed the white chocolate mocha but must say the caramel machiatto here is my favorite.  The regular coffee is good as well.  Now Food, this place has eggs galore, skillets, delicious crispy hash browns, pancakes, french toast, and my favorite berry Belgium waffle which I ate without syrup and it was perfect.   I tried the pancakes which were good as well.  I haven't tried the french toast but based on the great service and everything else I tried, I would trust this place to explore the menu.  Great job Wildberry.  Oh and it's right across from the bean and millenial park so you can wait with a gorgeous view.

pics.caption: Signature Berry Bliss Belgium Waffle so perfect! No syrup required.

review.des:
The food here is impressive, whatever you order must be tasty!
However the waiting line is too long and you have to be present to make a reservation.

Hands down, best pancake of my freaking life !!

I ordered the all meat ( that's not the name ) skillet and my buddy ordered the corn beef hash skillet. Trust me, they are very generous with their hash browns and cheese !!! I would suggest sharing a skillet and pancake, but since the wait is 30+ minutes and everything just looks so delicious, you would probably order your own pancake and skillet. But hey, you're on vacation. No ragrets.
One of the best breakfast places around. I've eaten here 10 to 20 times and I've never had a bad meal. Staff is always fast and very professional and they have great coffee.

Wildberry is hands down the BEST breakfast in chicago! Everything is amazing! I am a huge fan of the rocky Mountain crepes, I get them everytime and my husband likes the skillets and we recently tried the oreo smore pancakes, berry bliss pancakes and the cinnamon rolls pancakes and they were out of this world! We will never go to another breakfast place while visiting chicago

I don't leave reviews, but felt the need to start now thanks to Wildberry!

I visited Chicago a few wks ago when the weather hit -5*. I'm from the bay area, so you can imagine just how *cold* I felt walking from the nearest parking garage to this cafe. I wondered if it would all be worth it.. and to my surprise, it WAS. I'm usually a savory-dish type of person when it comes to breakfast, but after reading the reviews, I knew I HAD to try the Signature Berry Bliss pancakes. It was the best. tasting. pancakes. EVER! Vanilla Anglaise, Blackberry Coulis, Berry Mascapone & Fresh Berries... you cannot go wrong.

Stacks of fluffy.. warm.. pancakes. Just the right amount of sweetness... It was perfect.

Along with the pancakes, I also ordered the Vanilla Berry Latte with Sugar Free syrup. It was amazing!

We also got the Corned Beef Benny, which was just -alright- IMO. The menu said the benedict would come with Chipotle Hollandaise sauce, so I thought it would have great flavor.. but it was so-so.

If you're in the area, this place is a must! Unlike other reviews, we got seated right away, but that's because we flew in early and got to the place around 8:30 am on a weekday (and cause I assume everyone likes to stay warm at home.. lol)

Food was ok - I'm sure it would have been great warm! Unfortunately, it got cold while we stood and watched it sit for 15 minutes while Amanda at the front desk refused to turn around and grab our "to go" bag and give it to us, because that was "not her job". Literally, our bag was at arm's length and she refused to grab it. If she was busy doing something else, I would understand, but her job was to check in new customers and there were no customers around when I asked her (probably about three times) to please give me my bag of food. Finally her colleague standing next to her heard our futile pleas and apologized and gave us our food.

We ordered "to go" - and was told the wait time was 20 minutes. 30 minutes later we went inside, saw our food being brought up and could see our name on the bag. The lady who was in charge of "to go" orders was nice, but unfortunately slammed, and Amanda apparently didn't care to help her colleague or her customers. Thanks Amanda for doing your job!

This is my favorite breakfast spot.  They have a large selection of pancakes to choose from.  My favorite was the Cinnamon Roll.  Also had the Eggs Benedict one morning served with hash brown potatoes which was very good.  This place dies not take reservations so on the weekend there could be a long wait versus weekday mornings.  Once you are seated the service is prompt.  I would recommend making this a must place to come to eat when in Chicago

Great find near the river.  Came on a whim as I was at a conference nearby.  Had some amazing lemon-poppy seed with strawberry pancakes.  Had some type of mascarpone dressing.  If that wasn't enough--also tried the side of biscuits with gravy.  Really a unique gravy on them--highly recommend.

Would go back for sure!

The food was fantastic and the customer service was awesome!! I loved the fact they give you the choice to put your name on the wait list before you even get there. That saved us a ton of time!! The food portions are generous and the coffee was tasty! I see why there is always a wait for this restaurant!

I work in the building and always see crazy lines for wildberry. I usually just order by phone and get pick up. Once in a while if I'm very early, I will sit down to eat. The breakfast burritos are great, but I hope you don't have anything important afterwards because MAN do they make you gassy. And it's not just me it's all my coworkers. I don't care; I still get them. Another item I will get is the corned beef hash skillet. This might be strange, but the butter there is good and I usually get toast so I can slather the butter and jam all over it.

Excellent!!!!!!

My son and I got the butcher block skillet with the Berry Bliss pancakes.  The food is great.   It is worth the wait.  

The wait was 1:15 on Saturday morning.     Very few places to sit while waiting, so we ventured to millennial park and gat a few Picts.  

Wait staff is very good.   We placed our order and the food took about 5 min to come to the table.   Super fast.

pics.caption: Berry bliss pancake as a side to my skillet.

review.des: What else is there to say beside they have a SOLID menu. The huevos rancheros is amazing and they have a great eggs benedict. Be prepared to wait for a delicious meal. It's easy to come back when you've got Millennium Park right across the street!
Incredible. Priced reasonably and this was the best breakfast my wife and I have had in a long time. Worth the wait. Reserve on yelp and then show up and be seated
Expect to at least wait 1.5 hours, but SO worth it! Everything is AMAZING. I got the mexican skillet hash with cinnamon roll pancakes

Went around 6:45 with no wait. Quick ordering & received food fast. Great breakfast with a lot of options. I got eggs, hash browns and the berry bliss pancakes. Will definitely go back when in Chicago again!

I came here twice in one week. The food is good and I'm not the biggest lover of breakfast food. The Intelligentsia coffee has the most decadent hot cocoa. It made me very happy. You will have a wait. No matter what day or what time of day. There'll be a wait. Once seated, we had Renzo as our server. He was awesome.  Friendly  and efficient. I ordered biscuits, bacon and chicken sausage.  My bf got an omelet and strawberry pancakes. . He said pancakes would've been better if berries in the batter. . But still very good.

Mom "wow this was worth wait." This restaurant was defiantly worth the wait if you ask me. Staff was very friendly. Didn't take our food very long to come out after we ordered. If you ever have the chance try it out.

pics.caption: Pancakes with a little powder sugar
Sorry already started eating before I took this pick. Bacon, eggs, hash browns

review.des: I go here every now and again with my coworkers on our lunch breaks.  I usually get an omelette to split with a side of pancakes.  I love that that they have free refills of intelligentsia coffee. Clean, friendly, convenient and quick!!!

Great food. Lots to choose from.
Recommend the Mexican breakfast burrito or the Mexican skillet.

The only con is there is always a long wait. We waited 1 hr 45 min but it was totally worth the wait.

We were a party of 7 and everyone enjoyed their food.
Very good breakfast. Way too much food. A couple could share a skillet with side of pancakes rather than ordering individuals. Use the no wait app as the lines are nuts.

I went here for breakfast with friends and have fallen in love with this resturant!!! I had the Pecan Waffles and my friends had the Breakfast Skillets that came with pancakes. We had so much good food at affordable prices. I would suggest making reservations because there could be a twenty or thirty minute wait for walk ins, but it's worth the wait and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful.
If you're getting pancakes, then you will definitely enjoy them.  Other breakfast selections are also good!!
Lovely place with quick and friendly service and incredibly delicious food! Our waitress was genuinely kind and we only had to wait ten minutes to be seated, despite how busy the place was.

OMG SO GOOD!  When visiting a city I seldom eat at the same place twice.  My sister and I walked here 3 times over a four day weekend. The food is amazing! You seriously could not find breakfast anywhere that's better than this. Great coffee ,great omelets , great pancakes, great French toast , and I could continue to list all the things that we sampled -all awesome. No matter what time of day you go there is going to be a wait. But it usually goes fast and if you can't wait just get it to go-but don't miss out!
Absolutely amazing! Will direct all friends visiting of moving to the city to try it out! Only draw back was long wait even after the waitlist service which is a necessity to avoid a 90 minute wait.
Wait line is CRAZY so get on the list via their app ahead of time. BIG portions and fast service. Seating a little cramped. LOVE the food!
Long wait but get on the wait list through Yelp and it is manageable. The food was great. Really enjoyed the Denver Skillet.  Sit outside if you can - much quieter and nice view of the park.

My favorite spot for breakfast meetings downtown.  My office is nearby and this side of the loop is sorely lacking in breakfast restaurants.  This is a great option, serving breakfast all day as well!  I tend to be more savory for breakfast and they have a wide variety of omelets.  My fav is the veggie omelet, with tons of fresh veggies.  I also love that you can get fresh fruit as your side rather than hash browns.  They've also given me double fruit sometimes as I decline the toast that comes with as well, so great if you're trying to cut down on carbs!  I'm a little picky with altering my order to make it healthier and they are always so nice about it (even though I'm probably annoying) and never mess up the order.  Service is also really quick in the mornings, so you can get in and out within an hour for sure.  They are also great about coming around to top up your coffee, etc. as well.  

This is also a great spot for a quicker sit-down lunch as they continue to serve breakfast all day, but also have some great salads (that are pretty huge servings!)   My fav salad is the spinach and goat cheese, but the Mediterranean is great as well.

This place can get pretty busy around lunch time, last time I came it was going to be 45 min wait, so keep that in mind if you don't have the time to wait, but if you are in early for breakfast, generally not a wait.

They also do good carryout for lunch on the weekends (when I am unfortunately at my office working), but it's fast and the carryout is up to par with the food in the restaurant as well.

pics.caption: Side of fruit in their carry out. Ugh no one likes melon and one grape!

review.des: The hostess of the restaurant is just super rude. I have been waiting in front for at least ten mins yet the hostess is still busy on the phone with whoever she is talking to

You have got to try the place. The berry bliss pancakes are so amazing we went there two days in a row. The Venetian skillet was so plentiful I had 1/2 left over for breakfast the next day. Be sure to try the wild berry OJ. Amazing!!!!

pics.caption: Venetian Skillet is plentiful as are the Berry bliss short stack pancakes.
Berry Bliss Pancakes will melt in your mouth.

review.des: Let me start off by saying The only reason this review is getting four stars it's because the one hour and 45 minute wait. Once I was in it was well worth! I had one of their specialty Benedict plates  and was impressed. There signature pancakes were great too especially being that im not a pancake person. My girlfriend had the belgain waffle and that was OUTRAGEOUS. If i had to describe it; melt-in-your-mouth. And all lattes are awesome(especially the caramel). Just dont go hungry because you will get cranky in line!

Love this place - the food is very diverse so everyone can find something they'll love and, most importantly, it is delicious! The only downside is the waiting time - usually it will be like an hour to an hour and a half to get seated. With that being said, there is an app called Nowait that I installed based on a text from Wildberry that will show you where you are in line and best of all you can put yourself in line before you get there - so be smart and put yourself in line a good hour before you actually get there and you'll be seated right away :)

Second time in Chicago and second time here.. It's always a wait no matter when you come and that should indicate how good the food is. Those red velvet French toast are to die for I promise you... Just get a order for the table like we did it's absolutely worth every single calorie.

pics.caption: Brought my colleagues to taste the frames and they are still praising my name!!!

review.des: I see why the wait is so long!!! The hashbrowns are the best I ever had. I might have been super hungry but they were crispy on BOTH sides!! I had the chorizo Benedict and really enjoyed that and we also had pancakes of course and those were awesome.

For my last day in Chicago, I wanted a good breakfast to send my boyfriend and I off I'm really glad that I found this place. We got to the Cafe around 10 Pm on a Monday and there was a wait for it. That always means good things. This place is located right next to Millennium Park. Normally place near tourist areas are not that great but this place lived up to all my expectations and I can see why it's so popular.

So they give you a buzzard and we got called up within 20 mins, not that bad of a wait. We got seated outside, which was nice because you get a great view of the amazing city. Once we were seated, I decided on the Napa Omelet and the signature berry bliss pancakes. Both were pretty amazing. The Napa Omelet was delicious and nothing like anything I've ever tired before. veggies and figs. IT was so good!

The best part of this place was their pancakes. Probably the best looking pancakes I've ever seen. Pretty, but was it good? heck yes!

Overall, Wildberry Pancake and cafe was a great treat in Chicago. I'm glad I went and I would totally come here again on another trip.

The only thing I have to complain about is that they sat us outside and I kept getting bit by something near us. That was kind of annoying, but the food made up for it.

This is probably the best breakfast, brunch or lunch spot in the area. Amazing waffles and omelettes.
The people sitting next to us had a cheeseburger and fries hat looked awesome! Great coffee!!

After I graduated from graduate school my family and I came here for brunch.  The food was great.  I ordered the Chicken and Waffles and they were fantastic.  The waffle had bacon and jalepeno inside it which sounds like it would not taste good but in fact it was amazing.  It gave a sweet and spicy contrast.  The only reason why this restaurant is 4 stars is because we did have a long wait.

Typical breakfast food and okay prices! Very long wait and I do not think I would wait that long again to go there.  However, it is in a great location! I ate here and then went ice skating at maggie daley park, which is right across the street!
Crazy long wait.   But still great as always.   Never disappoints. The cinnamon roll pancakes are so good.

This place is honestly great. The location is the perfect spot for tourists because it's so close to Millennium Park so you could easily walk there from the park! However the only downside is that since its in such a great location for tourists it's always packed. I have been there 3 times and every time we have had about a 45 minute wait. In most cases that would be way too long but the food here is worth it and you can go sightseeing while you wait so it's no big deal at all! I usually will head over to see the Bean and take pictures and the restaurant will text you when your table is ready!
Although the they are always super busy the staff is very friendly and I've never waited too long for my food to come out.
I definitely recommend the Wildberry pancakes aka their specialty! Honestly some of the best pancakes I've ever tasted. I also think their skillets are delicious and very filling! For being in the heart of Chicago the prices really aren't that bad compared to others! If you're a first time visitor in Chicago you should definitely make a stop here!

pics.caption: Wildberry Pancakes and Butcherblock skillet with a sunny side up egg!

review.des: Delicious breakfast food. Gluten free pancake options. Great for morning business meetings.

I had an omelet, which tasted heavenly. The service was friendly, casual, and prompt.

I am giving four stars, but probably it might go down 3 and a half if I had to wait more than 30min. It was a great breakfast, but no worth too-much-waiting. Just my opinion.

This is what brunch is alllll about: Pancakes covered with fruits and syrups, omelettes stuffed with just about everything, and food-comas by noon. It's a great place to go with a group. The staff is friendly and takes care of you even though this place can get swarming on the weekends.

I'd say my favorite part of the meal was definitely the Signature Berry Bliss pancakes. I'm glad I took Yelp's suggestion. It was delicious to the last bite.

Like I said: this place can get busy, so be prepared to wait on the weekends!

pics.caption: Rutherford omelette with signature Betty bliss pancakes

review.des: First time coming here. Right across the street from Millennium Park, and very reasonably priced. The wait was long for a Sunday morning, but we weren't in a rush. Service was great once we were seated. My friend and I each had the skillets: eggs, hash browns, sausage, etc. and pancakes. We really could have split one and still have been full, but we each had our own. I ordered the pumpkin pancakes and they were fantastic! Definitely would go there again!

Always an amazing experience and ALWAYS worth the wait.

Have I ever been here and not had to wait 30+ minutes? No. But have I ever been here and been willing to wait for the great service and great food? Absolutely.

You would think with a place with such a high volume of patrons, that the service would be rushed and stressed...but it is the complete opposite. Once you've waited through the line of french toast-skillet-omelette crazed people, you are welcomed with a friendly greeting and a patient attitude. Everything here is so efficient that I continue to be impressed each time I come back.

Highly recommend each of the skillets -- can't go wrong! The french toast is also delicious and it's very convenient that they have a coffee bar available while you wait.

What a great breakfast. We use the Nowait app and walked down from the hotel and the table was ready. Amazing hashbrowns. The original buttermilk pancakes are light and delicious. The coffee latte with almond milk was better than most. My son loved his banana strawberry smoothie.  Wonderful thick cut bacon. And the hashbrowns are amazing. Highly recommend - there is something for everyone at this restaurant!

This place has been on the "must try" list but every time we have tried to eat there it was a weekend and the line was out of order or they were no longer taking people on the waitlist due to being at capacity for the rest of the day. We went on a Monday at 11am and were seated immediately. I ordered the 2 farm eggs cooked anyway, I got chicken sausage which were freaking bomb and my eggs cooked over easy because I like the "run." I also got toast and the signature berry pancakes...oh and a cup of coffee. My friend ordered the same thing, but she got her eggs scrambled with cheese and a side of fruit and cinnamon roll pancakes. First off, the food came out fast. About the food: my friend said her eggs tasted like powder eggs (she eats eggs everyday; it is her favorite food. That's not good). My pancakes were not hot, they were slightly warm. Overall the food was VERY tasty. It was a very good meal. The service was also attentive. 4 stars.

pics.caption: Eggs, Bomb chicken sausage, and toast

review.des: When I saw tiramisu pancakes I was sold. I had the tiramisu pancakes and my husband had oreo smores pancakes. I was expecting two pancakes...was I wrong! We had a stack of five with filling between every pancake!!! We went early in the morning around 7:45 and when we left at 8:30 the place was filling up. Parking was a little confusing, but then again all parking is confusing in Chicago. I loved the design of the restaurant (I love red walls) and I loved the simpleness of it all. We will definitely go back with friends especially since they have glutton free options. Please go to Chicago today and make this part of your trip!

Thought the reviews might be inflated because it's located in the prime touristy spot, but it's one of the delicious breakfasts I ever had.

Generally there's gonna be a lot of wait and they don't take reservations. Plan on waiting for good amount of time during a nice day.

We'll managed service and intelligentsia coffee are good additions to this place.

Above and beyond breakfast food and is great any time of the day! The place has a cozy atmosphere which is a nice change up considering its location. The pancakes are awesome, the salads are full of fruits and veggies to keep you satisfied for the rest of the day, and the omelettes are enough for two full meals.

The only down side is that it gets really crowded for weekday lunch so I'd recommend going off hours - between 10am-11:30am.
The pancakes took me from 6 to midnight, I would definitely come here every day if I lived here.  Amazing

What possessed me to go to this place? Well, it's right across the street from the bean and down the street from the Chicago Art Museum.  And of course, yelpers said great things about the food. Apparently, eating here wasn't an original thought. so when I arrived about 9am on a Saturday the wait was already an hour. I figured, I would put my name on the list and meander over to the bean, take pictures, walk around, and come back in time to eat.

An hour after I had been waiting, I returned to ask the hostess when my table was going to be ready. She informed me another ten to fifteen minutes. So I used the restroom and waited ten minutes. I checked in again with the hostess to find out how much longer. She told me another ten to fifteen minutes. At this point, I was highly aggravated. I informed her that if she knew it was going to be longer than an hour wait, she should have told me that from the onset. Seeing how vexed I was, she called for the manager.

I can't remember his name but when he arrived and I had to re-explain why I was so irate, his response was priceless. He said "Why are you so angry with me when all these other people are also waiting?" After I made it clear that I don't like being lied to and should have been told the real wait time, he informed me that he would get me seated as soon as he could.

Needless to say, after about five minutes, I was being shown to my seat. Don't know what he said to the wait and cook staff but my service was on point and so was my food. While enjoying my eggs benedict, I even found another visitor to the city to chat with.  

If it hadn't been for the manager ensuring that I was seated rather quickly and that I didn't have to wait to order or for my food, I am certain my review would have been very different. Overall, the price, service, and food are great but do get here before 9am. When I say there's a wait - holy hell - I mean there's a wait.

Loved the place and food. Alfresco dining, great food. We tried the omelettes, pancakes, OJ .. the usual and everything was yum yum! Gets pretty crowded during brunch hours so may involve a wait. But the food is worth it!

Had their "Signature Berry Bliss" Pancakes, and boy were they plain bliss! I usually hate having creamy, unhealthy tasting stuff on my food, but this combination of vanilla anglaise, blackberry coulis, and berry mascarpone was so perfect I found myself soaking my pancakes in every last bit of it  this comes with 5 fluffy pancakes and a generous portion of berries, and it was a huge portion definitely worth its price. LOVED IT!!

I came down for the weekend to visit Chicago for the first time. I came here for brunch on a Saturday afternoon, the place was ram packed. 1hr and a half wait. We sat outside so the wait was a tad less. The wait staff is friendly, and fast. The food was good, npt amazing but good. I had pumpkin pancakes to go along with my meal, the pancakes were delicious, everything else was just okay.If you love pancakes it's worth it, if not fond somewhere else with less of a wait time.

pics.caption: Omlette, hash browns and pumpkin pancakes.

review.des:
Wildberry was the first place I ate when I got to Chicago on a Wednesday morning, and was an outstanding introduction to the flavorful, fresh food that the city offers.  I had the Rutherford Omelette with fruit (plus 3 pancakes on the side!), my dining companion had the strawberry pancakes, we both had coffee to go with.  
My omelette was cooked perfectly and every bite carried the flavor of smoky bacon.  The salsa that was provided at request was the perfect sauce to accompany it.  
The dining area is spacious, open, and modern, and wasn't too crowded or too loud; they also had outdoor seating available.  The price was entirely reasonable.
Just make sure your parking is addressed before you go; expect to pay $40 for a place to put your car (we paid $40 for parking three different times, so this seems to be the going rate in Chicago), so make sure you have other activities lined up - such as Millennium Park right across the street - so that the cost of your visit doesn't amount to food, plus tip, plus parking.
Excellent pancakes and generous sides of fresh fruit at a very reasonable price. The long queue outside at brunch time was the only minus.

This was my best friend's first time in Chicago and I wanted to make sure that she had a good experience. As I searched yelp for good brunch places (she's an Eggs Benedict fanatic and loves sweet and savory breakfast items!) and stumbled upon Wildberry. We used the NoWait feature on yelp to get a place in line and I'm so glad that we did so! It was a 64-84 min wait but taking into consideration the time it took for us to travel from my friend's place (blue line and walked)--it worked out perfectly! The staff was friendly and professional and our waitress was warm and bubbly and answered any questions we had about the menu. I ordered a White Chocolate frappe, cinnamon roll pancakes, and corned beef hash. My friend had a caramel macchiato, smores pancakes, and eggs Benedict. Holy moley, every single bite was a life changing experience. My friend actually cried at how good it was. So please do yourself a favor and try this place out!!

Every time I'm in Chicago I make a point of having breakfast at Wildberry. Wether you choose an omelet, a skillet, pancakes, or one of the many other options, the food is awesome. Just make sure you plan on getting a workout in. Portions are large and you won't want to leave any behind. Be aware: wait times can be long well into the morning and even the afternoon. Arrive before 7 AM or use Yelp app to get on waitlist.
Yum. Just yum. Get the signature pancakes.  Just do it. I had an omelette and husband had the corned beef skillet. Both were tasty and fresh

The food was great and they were large portions. I had the eggs Benedict with chorizo and it was good. My only warning here is I grew up eating authentic Portuguese chorizo and this did not taste anything like it. Not sure if there are other types but that's what I went in expecting. It had more of a beefy taste. My fiancé got the skillet and he really enjoyed it as well but couldn't finish it. The portions are really that big. We waited well over an hour, which should be expected on a Friday morning when there is a festival happening in Chicago. My only issue here is the system the restaurant uses. They text you when they are 'ready' to seat you but then you end up waiting in another line for about 10-15 mins until your table is actually ready. Overall good experience. Wait staff was efficient and friendly. The noise level wasn't bad. We were really close to two other tables but this is a breakfast place not a date night spot!

This is THE place for brunch after long morning stroll through Millennium Park! I've passed the place before and didn't think much of it since their sign is pretty cheesy and looks like a cheap wine label or something. I guess I shouldn't judge a book by its cover!:)

There was a long wait but I guess that's expected anywhere downtown on the weekend. Word to the wise: get on their wait list BEFORE going to the park to save a TON of time. This is one busy place and theres not a ton of brunch options in that area.
