I had the Berry Bliss pancakes and they might have been the best pancakes I've ever had! They were overflowing with fresh blueberries and strawberries topped with a vanilla cream. Delicious! This is the perfect brunch place if you're entertaining family or friends visiting and staying downtown.
Outstanding!!! its whats you hear and more, wait is long but the food is worth it. if you love breakfast food, you will adore this place. red velvet roll French toast was off the chart.
Good cheap breakfast food. Nothing worth waiting over 20min for, but if your in the area looking for American breakfast, this is a solid choice.

Food: delicious.

Sofiya T's service: impeccable

This is my second visit and this time I had the cinnamon rolls pancake and I must that that was the best pancake I've had in a long time. I went my friend for a birthday brunch and it was definitely worth the trip. Will definitely visit again.

The wait time was quite long but you can definitely walk 2 full blocks away and over to millennium park before you are out of range from the restaurant.

I have been wanting to try this breakfast spot since it was recommended that I try it by the locals. I was not at all disappointed. The service, the food, the ambience - all top notch! I was seated immediately upon entering the restaurant and the waitress came to take my order within minutes. The food was excellent. Fresh and made-to-order. Will definitely be back again.

pics.caption: Create your own omelette with hashbrowns

review.des:
DELICIOUS!

Came here for brunch during my visit in chicago after some yelping.. And I was not disappointed. My friends recommended me other brunch places but I think hands down this one is the creme de la creme.

My boyfriend got the biscuits and gravy with a side of cornbeef hash and I got the wild berry pancake stack with a side of hashbrowns.

Everything was AMAZING but most of all the berry pancakes are a MUST. The exact detailing of the sauce they use slipped my mind at the moment but trust me its delicious.

There was about a 40 min wait when we went BUT it was perfect because we signed in, walked across the street into millennium park to take some tourist pictures with the bean.

By the time we finished up and walked back, our table was ready so the timing was nothing short of perfect.
I would go back to chicago just to eat here for brunch again. PLEASE COME TO LA

I don't get it. Why are there so many good reviews of the pancakes here? The pancakes are good but it's nothing to write home about. $9.50 for a short stack of pancakes with cinnamon roll sauce drizzled on it? Maybe it's better value to get the eggs with the hash browns and regular short stack for a dollar or two more. Maybe then I would add another star on to this rating.

Good service though... but I wish that I didn't have to wait for all my party to be there before being seated. That always irks me. Well, it's always nice to be able to have breakfast food for lunch on the weekdays.

This is a very, very good breakfast spot. If you're visiting Chicago, then this is one place that needs to be on your list of restaurants to try for breakfast.

Get there before 7:45/8:00 am in order to avoid the wait. If you get here later, then expect to wait 15-30 min for a table.

What to order: their pancakes do rock something fierce. The oatmeal is also better than any other restaurant oatmeal I've ever had. My favorite thing is their home made corned beef eggs Benedict with their special chipotle hollandaise.

Expect to pay around $20/pp (including tip)

BEST BREAKFAST....EVER! I was so surprised from how good the spanish omelette tasted. Great portion, and best of all, everything tasted fresh. The fresh squeezed OJ was delicious as well. I also had the raspberry lemon pancakes, loved the bittersweet combo. Location was great, across the street from millennium park. Top place for breakfast, so arrive early, as there was usually a long wait

Start with a latte, they have a wide variety of flavors. I order the honey truffle nut and it came in a giant mug. Very delightful and the milk was frothed perfectly.

The veggie omelet! FULL of veggies so it manageable to finish; portioned just right. The veggies all still had their flair so it wasn't a giant ball of mush eggs. The broccoli, asparagus, mushrooms onions and tomatoes were a perfect concoction.

A side of banana pancakes since everyone was raving about them. If you have a sweet tooth you'll love them.

Service was kind and prompt. Always had a full glass of water. A little loud, but the place was packed on a Tuesday morning at 9:30! Was told a 10 min wait and only waited 5. Prices are great for being in the Loop.

If you have the opportunity to come here, do it!

I had 2 c Wht all the hype is abt & after a 1hour 15min Wait on this Saturday Morning  (which Wasn't as long as it seems with the all stores & the Millennium Park n walkn distance) I definitely Enjoyed My Meal ! More Thn Enough Food ! This will not b my last Visit !
Very convenient location and nice service. I went to this restaurant on the day held the St. Patrick's day parade, thus, so many guests. I waited for near 2 hrs but it was worth to eat.

The place is always packed and wait time can be 1 hr long, which means it's a excellent place to dine in.

I come here for their brunch. Excellent quality. Their pancakes come in varieties too: tiramisu, chocolate chip, etc. Yum! I would recommend this place to anyone

pics.caption: Pancakes plus main dish(forgot the name. Oops)

review.des:
I finally took the time out to try out the overly hyped Wildberry Pancakes and Café for brunch on a Wednesday afternoon.  I was pleasantly surprised that my friend and I were seated pretty quickly since everyone was telling me that the wait time here is ridiculous.  The atmosphere here is similar to a diner, but it is more open and brightly lit due to the huge windows.

For food, my friend and I shared a butcher block skillet with a side of the signature berry bliss pancakes.  The skillet was pretty solid.  It was comprised of hash browns, cheddar & jack cheese, scrambled eggs, ham, sausage, turkey sausage, chicken sausage, and bacon.  I liked that they use a blend of cheddar and jack instead of cheddar cheese like other brunch places.  The jack just gives the skillet an extra kick it needed.  The pancakes were definitely the star of the meal.  It was glazed with vanilla anglaise, blackberry coulis, berry mascarpone, and then topped off with fresh berries.  Just looking at the pancakes, I thought it would be overly sweet.  To my surprise, it had the right balance of sweetness and the pancakes were one of the fluffiest pancakes I have ever tasted.

Wildberry definitely lived up to the hype.  I can definitely see why it was voted having the best pancakes in Chicago.  If you have been contemplating of coming here....don't!  Just come during non-peak hours or take a stroll along Millennium Park while you wait.  Either way, go check this place out.

Good quality breakfast. Everything tastes fresh. We went at 7am on a Sunday morning & got seated immediately. It is a little pricey to me ($15-20pp aprx) but worth it. I had the Butcher skillet. Plenty of meat & cheese. I think they under cook the hash browns, so if you like them crisper then you should tell them that prior. Also had the Signature Berry pancakes. Very nice. Worth stopping by.

This was my first time at Wildberry's!

Using the app Nowait, I was able to be put on the waiting list before I even left my hotel room. When I was notified that my table was ready, I showed up and got seated immediately. Rain was coming on and off throughout the morning, and they attempted to seat my party outside, which was understandable because the place was jam packed at 11ish on a Saturday. I did not want to sit outside in case of rain, and we were accommodated quickly.

I ordered the Butcher Block skillet with a side of Signature Berry Bliss pancakes as well as a mug of coffee. The meal was very filling, as the portions are more than good enough for breakfast/brunch. The skillet was very delicious, and good for anyone who loves breakfast meats. The pancakes were amazing, but definitely for those who have a sweeter tooth in the morning. I think the berry bliss pancakes are very comparable to Bongo Room specialty pancakes.

The service was very good here and the food came out pretty quickly with respect to how busy the restaurant was. Overall a very good experience here! I'll definitely be back when i'm back in Chicago.

Really amazing food and service. I got the espanola omelette and gluten free pancakes. The only bad thing was that we chose to sit outside and there was a ton of BEES. We both got pancakes and the bees kept trying to get to our syrup. One of them actually got to it and started drinking the syrup for our pancakes. As long as you're inside, it's an amazing food experience. It's also very busy on sundays so get your name in two hours ahead of time. We used the Nowait app to get in line at around 10 am we got in at noon.
Come to this place, you won't be disappointed! Five stars all the way! Great service and awesome food! Must try!!!

I was in chicago for work and this lovely little place was around the block from my hotel. When I arrived I found I would have a 25 minute wait to be seated. By the line and populous this is the happening place to have breakfast. Reminds me of the park cafe on salt lake city.

My wait was less than advertised, the menu was well fleshed with standard breakfast fare, the portions were genereous and you could tell the pancakes would be delicious just by looking at them. I didn't even mind the turkey Sasuge in my skillet, also real oranges were harmed in the making of the orange juice, not a Tropicana carton like many places.

Service was fast and the staff knowledgeable. I would assume there was a small army on the line in the kitchen as, it was packed but plate came in reasonable time.

4/5 would do again.
One of my favorite breakfast places! Came to Chicago all the way from Cleveland and this was my first stop. Corned Beef Benny is amazing!
Best pancakes around. Can't wait to come back. I had the eggs Benedict and had to fork fight my wife to try her banana pancakes. Worth the valiant fighting effort. Two thumbs up and five stars.

Be prepared to have a long wait.  I had the fresco omelet and the blueberry bliss pancakes. The omelet was so so...not enough flavor,  but the pancakes were moist and tastes like a moist cake. We sat outside..right next to millennium park.  Great spot to people watch.

They have good breakfast, but I would not say it's the best breakfast place I have been to.
There was surprisingly no wait when my friend and I went. We went around 11am, and was seated right away. The food came out fairly quickly (around 20mins) We decided to share the Caramel Apple Pecan pancake, and it was really good! The Classic Eggs Benedict was okay, but the hash browns were really wet and tasted like frozen store bought hash browns.
I would come back again for the pancakes.

I seriously need to stop. I will be HUGE by the time I'm 30 if I don't slow down!!

But nonetheless this place is five stars HANDS DOWN!!

Lovely lovely food. It is such a rich experience with all of the variety of options and favors!!!! I never say this but this place was "finger licking good"

VERY POPULAR place - come early or be prepared to wait.  

food was classic but well executed.  great service and optional outdoor dining.
Great Food and Great Service! We come here at least one time a year. But the pancakes are so delicious! I highly recommend this restaurant. Enjoy!

pics.caption: Butcher Block Skillet and Maple Apple Pancakes!

review.des: I'm not a fan of dishing out five stars but this place really impressed me. Decent prices, huge portions and absolutely delicious food, it was worth the 20 minute wait and the two mile walk from our hotel room. My group ordered a variety of things and they all looked and tasted fantastic. If you're from out of town, make sure you incorporate it into a visit to Millennium Park. It's a sure win for breakfast lovers!

The banana cream pie pancakes--WOW! It's so good but very filling, I could only eat half. The graham crackers sprinkled on top made this dish divine and the bananas were sliced think and complimented the fluffy pancakes. I'd go back here again for sure.

FINALLY I made it to Wildberry Chicago. I have heard so much good reviews about this place. I must admit, I was impressed with their pancakes. Some friends and I went to wildberry to grab some quick lunch. We were seated right away... but I must admit, we were with one of my friends whom works there :-/ So these review might be slightly biased but I will be as honest as I can. :-) My friends order the vanilla berry latte. One of them got it hot and the other got it cold. I tried both, naturally, and I preferred the hot one. It is a very tasty latte but I probably wouldn't get it myself. A bit too sweet for me. Nevertheless, give it a try if you like sweet drinks, it is pretty good.  I got the duck confit hash.. pretty excited because I realllly enjoy hash browns. The food came out super fast [maybe because we were with a worker but maybe not, they seem to be pretty quick there].

// Duck confit hash - it was one of their specials.. I have to say.. I did not like it that much. Maybe 2 - 3 stars. It was a bit on the dry side and the duck was a bit chewy. I would not recommend it.

// Wildberry pancakes - these were DELICIOUS. the pancakes here are really good. I would go back for these. I prefer savory for breakfast but if I was in a sweet mood, I'd get these again in a heart beat. I have had pancakes before where they smother the cakes in some sugary shit sauce... completely ruins it. But wildberry DOES NOT do this. They put the perfect amount of sweetness. I also had a bite of the cinnamon toast crunch pancakes... WOW. Also delicious.

Summary: Go if you like pancakes for breakfast. Don't get the duck confit and expect to wait in a line.
great pancakes service was just so so but overl ok
Heard a lot of great things about this place and had to try it. Did not disappoint one bit! Everything is good but you can't leave until you get the cinnamon roll pancakes. It's amazing!

Really impressed with this place. 40-45 min wait @ 9:30 on a sunday morning for two people (expected). It was nice that we were able to snag a couple of iced coffees to sip outside while we waited.

Despite our server (Laura V) being insanely busy with several large parties, she never made us feel rushed & offered great suggestions. (Had no idea you can get any speciality pancake for a buck more with most dishes, which was perfect)

I opted for 2 eggs poached, ham off the bone with fruit and the berry bliss pancake. Ham off the bone (Laura's reco) was crazy good. 4 ginormous pieces. Eggs were perfect, side of fruit was a mix of melon and berries. But the pancake... wow. The batter itself was really good and it had this delicious vanilla cream that was crazy good.

Hubs had the Rustic Farm Egg Panini. Fried eggs with applewood bacon, grilled tomatoes, basil & havarti on ciabatta. Messy, but one of the best egg sandwiches we've ever had.

Topped off with fresh orange juice and Intelligentsia coffee. Look forward to coming again.

Stumbled over this place on a quick 3 day stay...so good came back next day also.
Fantastic food, very attentive staff and quick food delivery.
The cinnamon French toast is just ridiculous!!!
Skillets are phenom, and the berry berry pancakes are next level stuff.

Cannot say enough good things about this place.

This is one of my all-time favorite brunch spots in Chicago. I usually come alone, so I'm usually willing to wait in line for a table, which is a big sticking point for most people. I haven't yet tried the pancakes yet, but the Butcher Skillet is out of this world. I love finding new places to brunch in Chicago. Excellent, friendly staff as well. Keep it up, Wildberry!

This is a consolidated review of the 2 times now that I've been. The two stars are for service, our servers both times have been friendly, helpful and attentive. I have never waited more than 15-20 mins to get in here (thank you, nowait app) but man would I be pissed off if I waited 2 hrs for this kind of food, like many people do end up doing.

The good: the skillets are maybe the best thing I've had at this place and they're fairly average at that. nothing to write home about. Fresh squeezed orange and grapefruit juice are available; I can get down with that.

The awful: the wild berry signature crepes are an abomination to all things tasty. They are drizzled in this radioactive Willy Wonka purple goop that tastes like melted crayons and jam. I tried scraping this crap off and just eat the inside of the crepes, but to no avail - I ended up pushing it around my plate. Personally, I prefer paper thin French style crepes and these erred more on the side of being thin pancakes, but I won't hold that against them. It is, after all, diner food. The chorizo on the chorizo Benedict was more Taco ball mystery meat than chorizo - it had an oddly unsettling spongey texture and tasted vaguely like generic spiced lunch meat.

I am utterly baffled as to why this place commands such a crowd.  Thanks, but no thanks.

This place is pretty solid and it's conveniently located across the street from Millennium Park.   If you have day plans to be at the park, I highly suggest starting your day with breakfast at this spot.  

Food:
We ordered the meat lover skillet, the Apple pecan pancakes, and banana cream pancakes.   The skillet isn't bad as I only ordered one to share with my girlfriend.   The banana cream pancakes is probably one of the better pancakes I remember.   The Apple pie pecan is pretty damn good as well.  

Ordered the smoothie... Bad choice on my end.   My girlfriend ordered the regular coffee and it was bad choice on her part. Lol.

Service
The wait is ridiculously long as we had to wait for 45 mins.   You probably should come as early as the place opens in order to avoid the line.

Tasty and fun, great location especially for entertaining out of town guests- directly across from millennium park.  But be prepared to wait on the weekends- I've been three times with an average wait of one hour.

This is probably the best brunch spot in Chicago, we had skillets and benedicts and pancakes of course! The waiter was so cheerful and helpful as well. Everything was just delicious, dont forget to get your coffee to go!!

pics.caption: This is probably the best brunch spot in Chicago, we had skillets and benedicts and pancakes of course

review.des: I wish this place was in Cali.  Their pancakes are too die for!!  In the span of a week, I went here twice!  My favorite dishes were the cinnamon roll pancakes, white chocolate pancakes, and their brisket hash.  Everything was so delicious we actually cleaned off all the plates.  Although the wait was a little long, this place will not disappoint.  Here are a couple of pictures for some food porn.  Enjoy!

Get here early and make plans just in case you have to wait for two hours like us. The food and service was absolutely amazingly. I have the Denver skillet which as delicious and the cinnamon bun pancakes with pecans. Definitely a must. Try to get there early or make reservations!

The best place in Chicago to get breakfast. Everything was amazing. From the skillets to the pancakes my group was so impressed. Will go again when in town. Lines do get long so reserve ahead of you can.

I eat here every time we are in town! I think I've been dreaming about it lately! When we go we all get our own entrees, and then a huge platter of pancakes for the table to share. Never had a single item that disappointed, my favorites are the omelettes. Even the coffee is great. Make sure you get here early, especially if you have a large party. This place fills up quick.

Ok so being someone that works in the industry I usually try to give places the benefit of the doubt, but I just can't. Neither the coffee nor the food were anything outstanding, service was just average, and the managers seem utterly awful and uncaring. I'm going to assume it might be better on weekends considering the wait is always stupidly long, but I honestly can't imagine the food or service would improve enough to justify an hour or more wait.

I love this place. I haven't been in a while but when I first moved to Chicago I'd visit this place like twice a month. They are usually very busy so get there before you reach the point of becoming "hangry" there will likely be a wait.

Food is really good here. I have tried a few different pancakes and all were outstanding! Coffee is really good to - reminds me of the all night diners I used to go to as a youngster. It's a bit of a hike from the city, but if you have something to do out there like Ikea or business appointments - this is a must try!

Came here due to the reviews we read. Great location, very busy but nice they use the app to alert you when your table is ready. We had the 2 eggs combo and fresh berry french toast. The iced coffee was AMAZING.

We waited for 2 hours and although the service was ok the food was not worth the long, long wait. My eggs were tasty but the corn beef hash tasted like it was from a can, flavorless and greasy.  They said my plate was dairy free but when it came out it was smothered in butter so the waitress took my plate and brought out a new one. Although she said the hash browns didn't have butter, I could tell they did so I just didn't eat them. The bacon was so tough, almost like it had been cooked hours before and tossed on the plate. My girlfriend said her waffle was good but for $10.75, it was a tad pricey. I really really wanted to like this place but I probably won't be back...

With 2000+ reviews, I had to check it out. Came by at 9  and there was already a 45 min wait. But it was totally worth it. I appreciate that patrons can get coffee while they wait.

I got the skillet and it could easily feed two. It came with pancakes. Hands down the best pancakes I've had in a while.

Really really good, I struggle with paying what places charge for breakfast, it has to be the most profitable right? I mean flour eggs vegetables are relatively cheap. But I had one of their skillets & my wife had pancakes eggs bacon & it was really well done. The lines suck but it's worth it.
Amazing breakfast! Perfectly crafted pancakes, fresh berries, good strong coffee -worth the wait. Reasonably priced too.

pics.caption: Strawberry Lemon poppyseed pancakes - to die for!

review.des: The wait was as we expected for this place, although a little longer for a Friday morning. We decided to get the good to go and sit by the bean. Ordered the berry pancakes, a regular egg/bacon breakfast, two coffees, and a bagel. Good was great, coffee even better. Didn't find a bread haft place better than this during our stay and with all the local parks and landmarks no need to confine yourself to eating there if you don't have to.

I get why this place is always packed after a few visits. Great breakfast food (and lunch food) downtown. Tons of choices. Really friendly servers and front desk folks. And the prices aren't bad for being downtown! If you are staying downtown and looking for a "diner" experience, this might be your best. But, surprisingly, if you are staying downtown and looking for a ton of choices of sandwiches and big salads, this is also a great quality choice!

My favorite breakfast place close to the loop.  You can have everything from a start-your-day-with-a-filling skillet to I'm-going-to-pass-out-from-all-this-sugar pancakes.  Coffee is great!  Service is fast.  Place is clean.  Even a wait is pleasant enough.

One caveat -- if you have family visiting from the South, you'll have to explain what "smothered and covered" means, but that's kind of funny anyways.

Omg so fantastic. We ate like crazy haha. Worth the one hour wait for sure. Espanola omelette, cranberry pancakes, tiramisu pancakes, skillet dish. And the best vanilla latte ever. It's super crowded at the door but the dining room is just fine. We loved it!

My husband and I ate here on a very, very cold day in early spring.  We waited outside in the cold for at least an hour before we got seated.  Clearly SOMEONE (and by that, I mean a lot of people) think that this place is worth waiting for.  I would definitely put myself in that camp.  There aren't a ton of non-chain breakfast places in the immediate vicinity open on the weekend, so I think that helps give this place an edge.  

The restaurant is classy - well decorated and modern.  The staff is super efficient.  The food is excellent and well priced for the city.  But yeah, this place is packed, even very early in the morning on very cold days, so plan ahead!  If you've got a bunch of starving little ones, you definitely want to be prepared.
phenomenal breakfast spot!!  was worth the over an hour wait.....
One of my go to places when I come to Chicago. Menu is extensive and I have yet to be disappointed. I stick with the skillets and the Mexicana is great if you like some spice.

Delicious Pancake and Food. Been here already five time.
great spot for brunch. they also have great tasting coffee.

I yelped the best breakfast place in Chicago the minute I landed, and I saw Wildberries. We checked into our hotel and got here only to hear that there's a 30 minute wait. Let me tell you, its the best thing ever! Definitely worth the wait!!! The waiter was incredible, charming and handsome. He knew all about Chicago, gave us the best tips as we hungrily waited for our food. We ordered the white hot chocolate and chai tea latte (the best we have ever had!!!) For our breakfast I ordered the Chorizo Eggs Benedict and my friend ordered the skillet with pancakes. We both were so content and full after eating just half of it, but it was so good that we had to finish it!! Loved it! If you are in Chicago and don't know what to do, go here and have breakfast, it's a Chicago experience in itself!!

pics.caption: Chorizo Eggs Benedict, Scrambled Egg Skillet, Pancakes, White Hot Chocolate and Chai Tea Latte

review.des: This restaurant was AMAZING! We came here after getting a few recommendations from people. We got there and they said the wait was about 20-30 minutes, so we put our name down and were called in about 10 mins. The service staff was super nice, very polite and even with the long list of people waiting, we never felt rushed! I ordered a custom omelette and added the specialty berry pancakes on the side. The pancakes were AMAZING. I'm not usually a pancake girl, but these were super delicious! You get a lot of food for your money (we each spent under $15). My friend ordered an Eggs Benedict and she LOVED it. I would absolutely recommend this place and would most definitely come back! =D =D

Definitely go sweet breakfast here! The pancakes were amazing.. the spinach Benedict was average. Service was good. Would return for the sweeter side of the menu. There will be a wait, but it's right next to the park and they text u that you have 5 minutes to return so don't wander to far.

Bring a book or your iPod because it's most likely going to be a long, but worthy, wait. There is space in the lobby of the building so you don't have to cram in by the hostess stand. The menu is huge so part of your wait can be given over to trying to decide what to get. My advice? Bring lots of people so you can split dishes.

In town for a show, we wanted to have a really good brunch and this place kept popping up on the lists. Our exchange student had chocolate chip pancakes, I went savory with the open faced breakfast sandwich and K went luxe with red velvet french toast. Or: friend cake. It was insane but I could only handle a bite or two. He enjoyed the little bit he ate but after brunch we were glad we didn't have dinner reservations until 8 pm. Worth it but make sure you have time to wait. And that you show up hungry.

The wait is long, but you can put your name on the waitlist online and arrive later. The food is amazing and once seated, the service is fast but not rushed. I recommend anything called "wild berry bliss". I had the crepes and my husband had the gluten free pancakes. Both were wonderful.

Totally delicious signature wildberry crepes!! Their sausage patties are pretty damn tasty too. I was so happy to try a delicious cinnamon spice latte.  Truly hit the spot.  What made the visit extra special was our service. Totally on point! I ordered a side of eggs and they were cold when they arrived. I don't care too much so I asked my server if he wouldn't mind zapping it for a few seconds to warm them up, he immediately brought me back some fresh scrambled HOT eggs versus nuking my cold ones. He also topped off my latte when I transferred it in a "to go" cup.  Just downright good food, great service. The lines on the weekend are fierce so come early or expect to wait. I chose to come back and arrived on a Tuesday morning. DELICIOUS DECISION.
YUM!

My friends and I came here super early and were seated immediately. As we looked around the restaurant, we saw several different groups who had brought their luggage into the restaurant -- like us, this was probably their first restaurant stop upon arrival.

We ordered the Mexicana skillet, which had hash browns, chorizo, cheese, jalapenos, and onions, and was topped with over easy eggs. We all thought it was a really solid skillet.

What makes this place amazing though, is its pancakes! Personally, I'm not really a fan of pancakes or sweets in general, so at first I was kind of reluctant to order their pancakes for breakfast. However, I was reading reviews, and they were a must-try, so we went with the signature berry bliss pancakes. Visually, it did not disappoint. We got a heaping pile of fluffy pancakes with a large portion of blueberries, strawberries, and blackberries with it. It was drizzled with a berry topping. I think we were all eating them without syrup and they were actually pretty good that way. Then my friend tried it with syrup and was like "ok...that actually doesn't hurt". With syrup, these pancakes were absolutely bomb!!!! For someone who doesn't really like pancakes for breakfast, I actually liked them more than the skillet! That's saying something!

Like many other reviewers, I too came after the bean. Wildberry almost didn't happen because it's a bit hard to find.

DIRECTIONS: Heading west, it's on Randolph St but before Michigan Ave. It's located in a business-like complex on the right side of the street. There is a small but obscure banner that says Wildberry in an almost illegible font. Your best bet if driving is to head east on Lake St, turn right on Stetson Ave, and walk around by turning the right corner to Randolph since it's a busy street. There is street parking on Stetson Ave.

FIRST IMPRESSIONS: My party and I were excited that we finally found the place and could try a brunch place unique to Illinois with 4.5 stars and thousands of reviews. Much to our surprise, Wildberry was already hoppin' on a Tuesday morning. What surprised me most was that for such a touristy area, I expected more patrons who were tourists. Instead, there was a decent number of locals in business attire, having sit down brunch on a weekday morning.

FOOD: We ordered to-go for our party of 12. We ordered: 1 omelette (the Napa Valley Fig); 1 skillet (the Garden), with a side of Fig & Walnut Multi-Grain Pancakes; and 1 French toast (the Wildberry). Food was amazing, even when as take-out. Savory food hit the spot, though Tabasco would have taken it off the charts. Loved seeing asparagus as an ingredient on the Garden, as I feel it's not a common brunch ingredient. Sweets were not too sweet and didn't require syrup to aid in taste or texture. People in our party raved about both the French toast and pancakes. Addition of fresh berries in the Wildberry French toast was absolutely delightful. Overall, we all agreed the food was a good choice.  

10/10 would come here again or at least recommend Wildberry as brunch spot for anyone in downtown Chicago. They have both indoor and outdoor seating. Indoor is clean but does not seem that special. Outdoor may be good for early summer mornings before it gets too hot and humid. Takeout is obviously good as well.

Place was packed on a Wednesday brunch time

Pancakes are great, I had the tiramisu, if you like rich pancakes.
Also tried the cinnamon roll ones which in my opinion weren't as good. Also ordered a veggie scramble ... and it was definitely lacking some flavor.....my mom's egg dish also lacked flavor.

This restaurant doesn't take reservations and operates on a first come first serve basis. The wait will usually be over an hour.

I've been here twice now and I have to say they are consistent with fresh and quality ingredients. The orange juice is fresh squeezed and the maple syrup was real.

Vanilla berry mocha:
The sweetness didn't overpower the flavors of vanilla and blueberry. Upon drinking, you're hit with a wave of richness and creaminess from the mocha. The aroma and taste of vanilla came next. Blueberry flavor is what you will taste last.

Signature berry pancakes:
The pancake was fluffy and light topped with syrup and berries. The berry syrup helped enhance the freshness of the berries. Five layers of pancakes left my mouth very dry after every bite even with a drizzle of maple syrup and fruit.

If you like to eat, Wildberry is the place for you. I was in town and was craving breakfast. Their Mexican skillet is amazing, and their pancakes are the most fluffy and cakeist (if that's even a word) I would suggest not to have it together cause you're going to be stuffed! But I did say that if you like to eat, this place is for you. Next time I'm in Chicago, I will be stopping by.

This was our first breakfast in Chicago and OH MY GOSH, it was my absolute favorite. First of all, expect to wait, so download the NoWait app, get in line on it, and go check out the Bean and Chicago Cultural Center while you wait. The service was AWESOME! Jeremy was great and so animated and perky - he was the best server we had all trip! I got the corned beef Benny with a cinnamon roll pancake... You can get their signature pancakes as a side! Love! My hubby got the butcher skillet with a caramel apple pecan pancake (his pancake wasn't nearly as delicious as mine)! Definitely a must for anyone visiting Chicago!

pics.caption: Corned Beef Benny with a Cinnamon Roll Pancake! Moneyyyyy

review.des: Incredible!! Food was amazing, service was impeccable, Intelligentsia coffee was perfect. The Napa Valley Fig omelet (bacon, havarti, green onion) was A-MAZING and I wish I could sleep in an egg blanket next to a melty cheese pillow surrounded by figs and bacon. The Mexicana skillet was delicioso as well. You can substitute waffle or pancakes for toast and the caramel apple waffle was yum-yum in the tum-tum. The wait was about 1h 15min on Labor Day around noon, and it was well worth it.

pics.caption: Napa Valley Fig Omelet, hash browns extra crispy

review.des: Wildberry was recommended to me when visiting Chicago. I went twice. The first time I walked in and was told my wait would be about 25 minutes so I stuck it out. I was seated quickly once my turn on the waitlist came up. My server took my order and got my food to me at a reasonable amount of time. Everything tasted good and I was pleased. The next day, I decided to add myself to the waitlist on the app since it said it was about an hour wait. I was taking my mom who wanted pancakes. We got there on time and I checked in with the host who told me I would be receiving a second text message once our table was ready. Well, I never received that text. My mother was upset that others were being seated, and also cranky from not eating, and walked away. I understand the restaurant was busy, but this was awful. When I asked the host again 30 minutes after I've been there where our table was she said if I had gotten a text. I explained that I had done the online waitlist and had been waiting. I was then told to wait on the text for our table. I left and went somewhere else. I never got the text that day.

Visited Chicago for "Taste of Chicago" weekend, but had every intention of stopping by this place due to the overwhelming great reviews on Yelp, and HAPPY that I did!

I went the very last morning that I was in Chicago, woke up early, and left to try to beat the morning rush. My friend and I got there at about 8:45am on a Monday (7/13/15 to be exact) , and we were seated right away. The menu is extensive (don't let that scare you), and the waiter went over it the best way he could in a short amount of time. I ended up ordering a "Denver " skillet/omelette with a side of "signature bliss" french toast. The omelette was "okay", but the french toast... O.M.G.! DELICIOUS!  I should have just gotten that as my meal! But I'm a "sugar head' right, so how did someone who tries to avoid sugary/sweet things feel about it? My friend, who is that person thought was was really good as well!

Another reason I'm giving this restaurant such a high rating is while only my friend and I started out eating there together, three more of my friends ended up coming to breakfast as well, and the restaurant (and our waiter) was more than accommodating. They added a table and chairs, and allowed us to order their food once they told us they were joining us. This was really nice of them

When we left there seemed to be a wait at least 30 minutes long, so get there early! I don't know when is the next time I'll be back in Chicago, but if I ever go back, this will be my first, and last stop! :-)

This is a wildtastic establishment.

I live pretty close and have typically been deterred by the long lines on the weekend, but they actually move through the crowds pretty quick, give you a beeper so wandering through Millennium Park for an hour is totally okay, and really make an effort to seat you as fast as possible.

This is one of those classic brunch establishments that takes IHOP and makes it more exquisite. My big recommendation: get anything with the chorizo. The breakfast burrito, the Los Altos benedict, the Espanola omelette, and the Mexicana skillet are all variations on the theme--and all superb.

The chorizo is perfectly tasty and flavorful with a touch of spice. In the breakfast burrito, it's SO beautifully mixed with the egg scramble, Mexican cheese, AVOCADO, and sweet poblano peppers.

I am also a huge fan of their benedicts, given that they have a wondrously thick hollandaise that just melts in your mouth. They have a smoothie bar that rocks out too--super fresh, hand squeezed.

I'm a fan!

Amazing pancakes and syrup! Lots of things to choose from on the menu. Almost too much. This is my second time here and certainly not my last time.
Perfect location, Millenium Park is across the road. Conveniently located near lots of shops and restaurants.

It was decent. Wasn't really worth the wait, especially outside in the rain. The service was under staff for a Saturday. Our waiter came to us 30 mins late! The food was decent but he forgot to ask what kind of eggs we wanted for our skillet. Our group felt bittersweet about the food.

pics.caption: Our Mexican omelette but the waiter forgot to ask what kind eggs we wanted. It would have fast better if it was pouched
Oreos chocolate chip s'more. Pancakes. It was too chocolatey. should have done the signature berry bliss

review.des:
I went on a friday around 9:30am and the wait was 50 minutes. I'd recommend going a bit earlier.
I ordered the red velvet french toast which was delicious and very filling. I also got a side of hashbrowns which was also very nicely done. The portion size for both dishes was HUGE and I didn't finish either. Overall I would definitely recommend Wildberry!

BEST BRUNCH EVER! I have nothing but great things to say. We did a girls long weekend getaway found this place our last day. The food and service was phenomenal! The servings are huge I give props to anyone who finishes their whole meal.

We ordered Omelets which came with the best hash browns and pancakes. We did chocolate chip and cinnamon roll pancakes. The orange juice is fresh. Our server was also a delight. Must go if you're in Chicago!

pics.caption: Omelets, crispy has browns, cinnamon roll and chocolate chip pancakes!

review.des: Wild berries never disappoints for anything other than the long wait on the weekends. So yes, on the weekends, be prepared to wait. Fortunately it was a great day in Chicago so we walked around downtown for an hour before receiving our text message. The food was great and the cinnamon roll pancakes can be eaten without syrup. I ordered the tavern burger with grilled onions and the fries were great ! If you're in Chicago, I'd recommend.

pics.caption: Tavern burger with American cheese and grilled onions :)
Cinnamon roll pancakes (& wild berry OJ)

review.des: Amazing bliss pancakes and only $1.50 added to the inlet.  Taste like heaven in your mouth.  The chorizo omelet was excellent as were the crepes.

Come on a weekend after 9am and expect to wait over a hour. The wait was worth it given the there were not many other alternatives nearby. The food was great. The service was spot on. Space is limited and your neighbor feel too close for comfort.

Was in Chicago for a couple weeks for work and was luckily staying in a nice apartment a couple blocks from this place. Super good food, good service and I'm super picky! Definitely get the Nowait app if you want to go at a typically busy time because this place often has a long wait for a reason: It's Worth It!

Came here for breakfast Sunday majoring around 9. Wait was a little over an hour but they have a nice system gave a check back I. Time so we were able to walk around the park for a little while then came back and within ten minutes are table was ready.

I ordered los altos eggs Benedict. It's was amazing. Their bacon and pumpkin pancakes are on point as well. I would recommend all of that.

Service was good food came out fast coffee was refilled. Not to much to say on it. They were busy but never had a problem with the service so I would give it five stars.

Outstanding. Our server was magical, the food was magical, and it was well worth the over an hour wait to get in. I had the Mexicana skillet with a side of the very berry pancakes and it was absolute heaven. The portions are huge and I regret that I couldn't box it to go (I'm at a conference). I did take a very berry latte to go though so I could savor my experience for a little while longer. I wish I had time to go back, I want to live in this restaurant.

pics.caption: Mexicana skillet with a side of very berry pancakes!

review.des: Delicious! Husband and I checked in from our hotel room on Sunday morning around 8:35am and were told 30 minute wait. We took our uber, and still had to wait about 25 minutes on top of that. We sat down around 9:30am and had our food by 9:45am. I had the minced ham, eggs and cheddar cheese, hash browns and fresh berry pancakes. Husband had corned beef hash, hash browns, and signature berry bliss pancakes. My husband is a big eater and he left full. Our water glasses stayed full and our server was very pleasant. We will be back every time we come back home to Chicago.

Upon arriving to the restaurant, we assumed that the wait was going to be long due to all the people standing outside, however to our surprise the wait was only 20 minutes at the height of breakfast time.   Once we were seated, our server [Aleatse] was very prompt and courteous; I think she knew this was our first time. While the menu was a bit overwhelming, we ordered the corn beef hash breakfast meal, which was a WHOLE LOT of food.. but it was so flavorful and delicious.  The fresh-squeezed orange juice was refreshing. I've never had corn beef hash that was more like a shredded hash brown mixture, but it was scrumptious. The food came out within 15 minutes.. totaling our experience to be about 45 minutes in total. I would have to make Wildberry my first stop for every trip back to Chicago.

Oh my, I am a big fan of Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe. While walking along the Mag Mile, my boyfriend and I stumbled upon this place and knew we had to try it. Thanks to other Yelpers (hey guys!) I read that the wait was pretty long (two hours on any given day), but using the No Wait" app, we got seated as soon as we arrived. Our server was super friendly and chipper, and made some great recommendations. I went with the Mexican scramble and the Wildberry pancakes (SO GOOD), and I walked out a happy camper. I'll definitely be returning next time I'm on the Chi!
All I can say is get the brisket hash!  Generous portions also.  You can't go wrong with this place!

Yummy Yummy Yummy!  Clean establishment.  Attentive waitstaff.  Went here for breakfast with the family while visiting Chicago - even though it was the middle of the week - it was extremely crowded.  We sat outside and were seated immediately as most people wanted to sit inside at that time.  Food came out pretty fast, the kids enjoyed waffles, omelettes and pancakes - lots of fruit and coffee as well.  Everything tasted really good.  A breakfast for 5 people will end up costing around $70 but we were full and didn't even have lunch that day!  Definitely recommend it for families - place is very kid-friendly.

We come here all the time. Weekdays, weekends, I'm sure we would come for dinner if they were open.

The boyfriend has gotten the biscuits and gravy, eggs Benedict and the Butcher skillet. He likes them all, but the skillet may be his favorite.  It's a lot of food, probably enough for 2!  Actually, all of the meals here are enough for 2.

I usually create my own omelette, bc everything else is so overwhelming. I'm a big fan of the corned beef hash skillet but it's a guaranteed coma so I don't order it unless I can spare a 2 hour nap after.  Hey have a number of different specialty pancakes.  They are good but really sweet.  They also have gluten free honey cakes, I get these with chocolate chips.  Oh and the red velvet French toast is amazing, but you may only tolerate a few bites so order it and share it.

We were just in Chicago for one day and stopped here for morning brunch after our uber driver recommended it. When we arrived there were plenty of people out front, but the wait went by very quickly. The portions were large, service friendly, and quality atmosphere.
We had breakfast at Wildberry Pancakes. The service was great. The food was excellent. I truly enjoyed the Apple Cinnamon oatmeal with the seasonal fruit plate. Thank you.

This review is for the casual diner as well as the serious foodie.

Overall, the restaurant is just a good experience. Very nice ambiance, great location. Only downside is the guaranteed wait time. Regardless of when you go for breakfast or lunch, your wait time will be between 1-1.5 hr before getting seated.

Let's talk about the food. Pancakes, Waffles, Crepes are all heavenly. I had em all. Everything tastes fresh. Texture is perfect for waffles and pancakes. I'm one to like my waffles/pancakes well done, so that's how I asked for them. And they were spot on. I loved the combinations of toppings. Whether it be pecans, apples, or cinnamon. The best thing might actually be their skillets. Everything is fresh and hot, with the cheese melted into the skillet. Served on top of perfect hash browns. One skillet is easily good for two people. They also serve Intelligentsia coffee inside, which is genius.

Lastly, price: Very good. Not over-priced at all. Just depends on what you ordered, but overall very fair. 2 people can feast under $35.

The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because I left feeling like, "I could have made all of that at home." If you're used to cooking, which I am, you may feel the same. This may deter some foodies, but it shouldn't if you have a hotel nearby looking for a spectacular brunch place.

The food was good, but the check in process was so unorganized. I put my party's name in via yelp before I got there and when we were called in, we were ignored and pushed aside for more than half an hour, even though we followed check-in instructions. The hostesses weren't friendly, but the waitress was the saving grace and was the only friendly worker we encountered.

Sometimes I want to cut all the fancy-ness out of brunch and get a regular stack of pancakes. THIS is the place to go. Everything is delicious, and I really like how it's a good combo between chain restaurant and neighborhood spot.

I also went to an event at their event space -- I had no idea they had an event space -- and I was very impressed. Good food, good service.

Very quick turnover with tables, so no matter how crowded or long the line looks, be patient and you should be seated in less than 30 minutes.
My daughter said that her omelette was the best she had ever had, fluffy on the inside and well done on the outside to perfection. My butcher's skillet was less than average. It was tasteless and the tiny chopped pieces of meat were hard to find. Otherwise the pancakes, biscuits, corned beef hash were good.
Best food around, the prices are very fair. the wait is long but well worth it!!!!!!!!!

amazinggggggg.
great price.
great portion.
great taste.
your normal brunch but upgraded for no extra cost.
the wait is always worth.

Beware - do not eat here on a weekend . It is so packed, with kids and families, it is just not worth it for a moment. You have to wait hours for a table - the service isn't very good because they have so many people (it isn't terrible or anything just very rushed), and if you sit outside you just are SURROUNDED with families waiting. It's like you're an exhibit or something.

Just really, unpleasant. I'm sorry that I waited for it. The food was fine but really, not much better than any other place. I think people like it so much because they have to wait so long for food?
The Berry Bliss pancakes everyone raves about - they have much better versions of that type of pancake item at a MUCH better place -- The Bongo Room (there is one on Roosevelt and a few other locations in the city) - go there instead.

I'm gluten intolerant and this place is super gf friendly and has THE BEST gluten free pancakes I have ever had. We stayed in Chicago for a week and came here twice because the breakfast was so good! Everything was delicious, it's definitely a must try! The berry pancakes were my fav.

The best breakfast I have ever had! I love a good breakfast traditional and not. This place is amazing. It's quite busy so you make sure that you reserve a table with the CheckIn app ahead of time. Make sure you try the berry pancakes because you won't find better pancakes anywhere else. The wait staff was wonderful as was the taste, timing, and heat of the food! I would recommend this place to anyone and everyone.

pics.caption: The best pancakes on the planet!

review.des:
The best omelette I've ever had!

Visited this place with my family and had a wonderful experience.  My fresca omelette was delicious and my family all enjoyed their meals.

It was a very enjoyable experience.  Friendly service, wonderful food and the coffee was pretty good too.

The wait was about 30 mins for a table, so no big deal. After they sent us the text that our table was already, we head over to the front desk to let them know that we were there. They told us to just wait a little bit more while they got our table ready. My friend then had to use the restroom so when they called us to follow them to be seated, me and my two other friends went. When we got our table, the male host (we think he was a host) asked us how many people were in our group. We told him that there were 4 of us, but our friend was using the restroom. He then gave us an attitude about our friend for not being present. He proceeded to say "you know that it looks bad on me right and that your friend had to be present within 5 minutes?".... Like why does it matter?  We already checked in at the front desk and they even saw that there were 4 people. We understand maybe there's a different culture, but we don't expect a 5 star service. It was honestly so uncalled for and unprofessional. Our waitress later arrived to help us with our order. We expressed our feelings and we appreciate her for helping us throughout our stay.

Overall, I believe that customer service goes a long way. This situation was so uncalled for. All my friends work in the customer service industry so we understand that customer service can be difficult, but even if it's a simple hi can make a lasting impact. The food was honestly really good but personally, I would have a hard returning because of the situation that I experienced. The waitress that we got did try her best to make up to us which we saw.

Went on a Saturday morning, and of course it was packed. Waited about 20 mins for 2 people, which isn't that bad.

I do think they have a great location (being right next to Millennium Park) and our waitress was friendly and efficient.

Ordered the Venetian skillet, thought it was just okay. What I did like was that for just $1 extra, you can make the pancakes that come with the skillets a specialty pancake (perfect for those craving sweet and savory breakfasts). Coffee was amazing (Intelligentsia)!

tl;dr: Good location and service, okay skillets, and damn good coffee.

Would I come back? Probably not.

Worth the wait!!  Wait times can be an hour or more. Use the Yelp app to get your place in line before you head out to the restaurant. Fabulous brunch. If you're visiting Millenium Park, you can put your name on the list, walk across to the park and get back in time for a nice brunch.

Visited Chicago and stayed at a bed and breakfast which obviously provided breakfast. And that breakfast was delicious. However, we had to try Wildberry because of high recommendations and we were so glad we did!

My friend and I wanted to get the garden skillet which comes with pancakes. For $1 more you can get the specialty pancakes and for an approximate additional $3 to $4 you can get Belgian waffles added. That's exactly what we did and essentially got 3 meals for the price of one and a half!  Our waitress was awesome and was the one who told us about this! It's not all spelled out on the menu.

The service was great. On a nice day, the outdoor seating is great. And the food is delicious.

Have been here once before, it was amazing. Came here today and it absolutely sucked! Checked in at 8:43 got a text at 9:23 came in waited another 15 min. They sat us at a booth my husband and my 10 and 2 yr old. The table smelled like wet dirty dish rag. Got some juuces! Great! Ordered finally got food at 10:20am and the food was cold! I let them know and they offered to make a new one but I'm here with a 2 yr old and it's been two hours. Very disappointed, won't be back but, it won't hurt their pockets.

A great place to get a gluten free, dairy free salad! We were able to modify the ingredients without any pushback and complete accommodation!

I highly recommend this restaurant for those with food sensitivities!

This place is the bomb dot com. They literally have everything you could want and more. Don't come here trying to be healthy though. My friend and I split the Venetian skillet and added avocado and jalapeños (which actually barely cost anything to do and they gave us a generous portion). We also upgraded to the berry bliss pancake, and for only $1 more you really can't go wrong. Coffee drinks they have are also off the hook. The best part is that I was able to walk out of there stuffed (even after splitting), got everything I wanted (and a fancy coffee drink) and spent about $15 after tip. Totally reasonable. The wait wasn't horrendous either (even though it looks like it may be). Fast and friendly service to top everything off.
Best breakfast in Chicago, probably in the country! GET THE CINNAMON ROLL PANCAKES!  Only downside is this place is packed. If you come on a Friday or weekend expect at least a hour wait

HAVE AGAIN: The bacon was very good.
NOT HAVE AGAIN: The three berry coulis crepes was just too much. This was a signature dish, so I wanted to try it (with a side order of bacon). One blueberry on top still had a stem attached, so it made me wonder about the blueberries inside. Skip the coulis - it did not add anything to the crepes. Far better to have had one crepe, an egg and bacon. I asked for bill when my food served but it still had not come by the time I finished, so I had to ask again. Service was somewhat lacking.
NEXT TIME: Have the bacon Benedict.

Highly overrated and underwhelming. Subpar pancakes masked in a glaze of berries and other nonsense. Once you actually taste the pancakes, they are not that great. Unless you want to feel like you're about to burst with sugar, don't waste your time. And time you will waste, as the average wait time is an hour and a half.

We went on a Friday morning around 8 o'clock and didn't have to wait. The service was very quick and everybody was extremely friendly. The food was great and you could taste the quality - highly recommend!

This was the first place we went to when we arrived (around 8AM). There was no wait and we were seated right away in an already filled restaurant. We both got skillets: the garden skillet and some meaty skillet? I accompanied my garden skillet with the tiramisu pancakes.

My boyfriend enjoyed his skillet and the regular pancakes, but I wasn't crazy about my own. I thought the vegetables could be fresher so overall it was average. My pancakes, on the other hand, were super yummy. My boyfriend pointed out that it tasted too much like cake but I really enjoyed them. When we were leaving, the front was packed and people were waiting outside the restaurant. That was around 9AM so I would definitely check this place out not at their peak hours.

This little gem of a breakfast place should be on everyone's "to do" list! It was a little busy when we got there but the 15min wait is worth the reward!
My husband and I always split plates when everything looks good, so we tried the veggie skillet, strawberry cheesecake french toast and a side of their seasonal banana cream pancakes. My tastebuds were singing (and my pants were getting tight)!!
Absolutely no complaints, even the atmosphere is bubbly, busy and yet still so friendly and welcoming.

pics.caption: Veggies hash, cheesecake French toast and banana cream pancake...all to die for!

review.des:
Perfect Breakfast.   It is delicious, the restaurant runs like a well oiled machine, and for it's location it is fairly prices.  
Many people told me to try Yolk... and I did.  Unfortunately I tried Yolk the day after I tried Wildberry.  Wildberry is the major leagues, and Yolk is the farm team with no prospects.

Definitely worth the wait. We used no wait to avoiding waiting there physically for a hour and a half. When we arrived our wait was about 30 mins. Think of it as the flash pass for restaurants. We ordered the wild berry pancakes, cinnamon roll pancakes, butcher block skillet. All of it was delicious. We also had lattes to finish off the meal and it was great!

We got duped on this one. Yelp reviews fooled me into believing it would be good. I'd rather ate at Waffle House.

I truly wonder about all thee people that gave a 5 star review. I wonder...  Have these people never had a truly good breakfast abroad? Is this REALLY the best they have ever had? Maybe they have never been out for breakfast before? Have they ever been to Waffle House? Ann Sather? IHOP?  Because this place is certainly NOT one ounce better than any of those.

Save your money and eat the continental breakfast at a nearby hotel.

I was totally craving brunch food one Sunday while I was in Chicago on vacation (I know, Sunday brunch is not very orginal, and as it turns out everyone else was craving brunch because there was a huge crowd outside!!)  The wait to get seated was almost 2 hours!  who waits for 2 hours for pancakes?????  I was smart and read yelp reviews and got my order to go!!  I REPEAT! GET YOUR ORDER TOGO!! I got the popular "signature berry bliss.  It had vanilla anglaise, blackberry coulis, berry mascarpone, and fresh berries!  it was delicious! and In only waited 10 mins for it!!!!  I took it across the street and ate it while sitting at a table near the bean.  It was a perfect way to spend sunday brunch!

Finally a good breakfast place in downtown Chicago!!!

My wife picked this location based on the fact that it was family owned with a proven track record of two suburban locations.  I was a little worried because I read a bunch of reviews that talked about having to wait for tables.  We arrived at 7:30am on a Sunday and there was no problem getting a table...maybe all of those bad reviews kept people away...good for me but bad for the restaurant.

The kids menu was great.  We were able to get silver dollar pancakes and a glass of milk for $3.45 for our little one.  What a great deal and our little one loved the pancakes.

I got a side of the buttermilk pancakes and I must say that they were some of the best pancakes I have had in a long time.  I was also happy that the waitress was able to make this happen.  I really did not want a full order.

My wife got the breakfast burrito.  She gave me half and it was really good.  She changed out the chorizo for sausage patty.  The poblano peppers in here gave it a nice little kick.  This tasted like a gourmet version of the McDonald's Breakfast Burrito.  I know that doesn't sound like a compliment but I mean it to be a compliment.  The hand cut hash browns were very bland.  They almost did not have any taste.  They need to figure out some seasonings to make these pop off of the plate.  This was the only bad thing that we had at breakfast.

This location has only been open for about a month and breaks my rule of giving a location six months to get the bugs worked out.  I was really happy with the service and the quality of our breakfast.  I can not wait to come back.  The location is also very large too...there seems to be a lot of tables in here.  I can only imagine that when they opened up customers swamped this place and they were not ready for all of the crowds.  Everything seems to be worked out now.  A manager also walked around to tables checking with customers to make sure that everything was good.  This place is making an attempt at caring about the customers.  I really love seeing that!!!

Nice breakfast/brunch location. .good service & good food...for being near Michigan Ave and milineium park nice atmosphere, a little. But,something for everyone breakfast and lunch . biscuits and gravy we're delicious. Had nutella crepes yummy..

This was my first time trying Wildberry after a very long wait. I must say I was pleased. I went here with a friend from Germany and we both enjoyed our meal. He had the Fresh Berry French Toast and I had Crepes with Strawberries and Whipped Cream. I came here during the week in the morning which is better than coming on the weekend. I visited on a Saturday and there was an hour and a half wait. This is a pretty popular spot. I would try to go during off peak hours. I can't wait to come back!! Yum!

pics.caption: Crepes with Strawberries and Whipped Cream

review.des: Big.Delicious.Worth it Meal! The pancakes are the BOMB! its very delicious and the serving size is good for sharing. They have many options for breakfast for a very reasonable price! no wonder many people are willing to wait coz its worth it! We will surely come back and i highly recommend this place specially if you love a BIG BREAKFAST!

Came here during my first visit to the city and this cafe remains as one of my most memorable experiences. We tried on 3-4 different occasions to get seated in a timely manner but the wait for this place was completely unexpected. Each time we made an attempt the wait was at least 45 minutes to an hour to get seated. This was during labor day weekend so it's not too surprising. What got me was how worth it the wait was! To start, this place has a great selection of food and it's very difficult to make a decision but I ended up ordering the Los Altos Benedict, my girlfriend ordered the berry bliss pancakes and both plates were way beyond my expectations. The pancakes are nice and fluffly, the benedict was well prepared, and the foot came out very fast so I didn't salivate over other people's plates for long. The portion sizes are big so walking around the city afterward felt like hell but that was one trip i wouldn't mind coming back to. Highly recommended!

We were out of town and found this place on Yelp. So happy we did! I had the Butcher Block skillet and it was delicious! I love anything with potatoes and with the crispness of a skillet really made the hashbrown base great. Getting fancy coffee drinks was easy since there's a small coffee counter at the front. Our food came out super fast and the service was friendly.

Waited an hour and 15 minutes for a table for two at brunch, and the wait was 100% worth it. They've got a nice coffee bar that you can order from while you wait, so we sipped on some nice lattes while we waited in the sun outside.

They're known for their pancakes of course, but everything is so good. I highly recommend the skillets, I got the garden skillet which was filled with yummy fresh veggies, and my friend had a fantastic eggs Benedict with spinach and bacon. The skillet came with pancakes on the side, so we ordered the blueberry ones and got a perfect something sweet to complement our savory egg plates. Will definitely return to check out more of their offerings.

Nice location right by millennium park, but since they give you pagers to wait with instead of taking a phone number, only complaint is that you can't walk around the park for a bit during the hour wait. But with great service, delicious food, nice ambiance, wildberry is definitely a new favorite brunch place.

One of the best breakfasts Ive had. The Rutherford omelette with goat cheese caramelized onions spinach and bacon was delicious. My son had one of the benedict dishes and my husband had a skillet. We all loved it. and we split an order of berry bliss pancakes.. yummy!! The service was great. There was  a 30 to 45 minute wait but soo worth it.

Food was great.
Service was fast.
Would recommend and will definitely be back to tey more of the specialty pancakes.
Their signature wild berry pancake is the best pancake I've ever had. I've never finished a plate of pancakes, but I did finish this plate. Their latte was okay, had better.
Totally worth the wait! You can put yourself in the queue online which is great and the online wait times are accurate. Amazing food! Best breakfast in town.

My sister and I came here on a Sunday morning however the wait was almost 2 hours. Hungry and hungover, we decided to go elsewhere. We did return Monday morning however to a no wait time which was awesome.

We ordered the butcher block. This was perfect. Hash browns, cheese meat..you really cant ask for anything better. We also ordered a side of berry bliss pancakes. These were really good!!!

This is just next to Millennium Park so long waiting times arent overly boring. On my last visit I tried the Bliss Berry Pancakes and their Garden Skillet Omelette. Amazing breakfast place - just check out the raving reviews. Go for it... you can't go wrong with it...BTW using NoWait app really helps with the waiting time.

We arrived around 8:30am Sunday and the place was super packed with people waiting inside and outside.  That's how you know this place is crackin! The host asked for my cell number so that she could text us when our table is ready.  This restaurant is literally across the street from Millennium park so our 45 minute wait was worth it.  My bf and I shared the Venetian skillet sub the protein with brisket (3.5/5, I could taste ALL the butter that went into that dish :( also, the brisket was a little too salty) and the berry french toast (4.5/5, this place is known for their sweet items and you HAVE to get this).
Thanks Chicago for a great breakfast!
Creative and delish dishes plus yuuuge serving sizes make for a great breakfast while visiting the windy city

Not quite sure why this place is so highly reviewed. It was fine, fine like a Denny's or IHOP is fine. I got the Napa Valley Omelet and I love figs but it was weird in an omelet. The hash browns were fine and the toast was standard. My hubby got the corny Benedict and it was fine as well. We also got the berry pancakes which were nothing special. Service was good. Decor was average. I am glad we came on a weekday and didn't wait for this, then I would have been really disappointed. The bongo room is leaps and bounds better than this place, do yourself a favor and go there for breakfast instead.

I love this place. SO fresh, wonderful service, and a no nonsense breakfast experience that sets you up for a greatness for the remainder of your day.

The red velvet french toast is out of control.

I usually go with the egg white Fresca Omelette with chicken sausage and a cup of Intelligensia coffee.

I highly suggest making this place a part of your breakfast rotation.

This was one of the most amazing breakfast places I've ever eaten at, and the server Jennifer was hands down the best server, no wonder she was training someone new. This is must stop visit for anyone visiting downtown Chicago!
Delish!  Not willing to wait so I called in early for a pickup order.  Took my meal across the street in the park to eat.  Had an omelette, I think it was the napa one.  Would go back.

Great service great food! Put yourself on the waiting list ahead of time through the yelp link. Portions are massive. Split an omelette with a friend with an extra side of hash browns and it was plenty. Even gave us coffee to go!

I hate waiting to eat, seriously, if they tell me anything longer than 20 minutes I'm already checking Yelp for comparable establishments. Not at Wildberry, I can't pass up those wildberry pancakes and when they tell me, 45 minute to an hour for food, I plop myself on the ledge outside and get into a game of angry birds to kill the time! I GOTTA HAVE IT! When we are finally seated, I always find something else on the menu that calls to me...and after hemming and hawing about what to get, you already know, the usual, wildberry pancakes. Delicious, good friendly service and tasty tasty breakfast fare. YAY. I'm a fan. Now if I could just make it on some secret get to the top of the line list, it would be perfect 5 stars *wink*!

Worth the hype! 20 minute wait for our table but food came out lightning fast. Outstanding service by our server Mike and the hostesses. They truly let you customize anything. Farm egg panini and the wild berry bliss pancakes were outstanding. Fluffy, creamy, and not too sweet! Overall fantastic breakfast

My sister and I went here yesterday for brunch. We were staying at a nearby hotel. Our wait was about an hour total, but we had heard great things so were willing to wait for a table. The service was fast and good. Like I said, we were willing to wait for a table because we had read AMAZING reviews about the food. I ordered the veggie omelette w/ hashbrowns and fruit. My sister ordered two eggs w bacon and pancakes. The food LOOKED good when it arrived (minus the white pile of hashbrowns). The hashbrowns were mushy- tasted like they came out of a microwave. Read: NO CRUNCH. The Omelette had ample vegetables, which I appreciate. Unfortunately, the eggs were overlooked and dried out.  Fruit was fine. My sister said her eggs were good, bacon okay, and pancakes okay. Overall a cute restaurant in a convenient location adjacent to Millennium Park, but the food was perhaps not worth the hour wait.

Somewhere between perfect and heavenly!  Rice based GF pancakes were fluffy with light crumb, not gummy/stretchy like they are frequently served elsewhere.  Plentiful fresh fruit garnish.  Fig and brie omelette was a wonderful experience!  Accepts reservations via Yelp! App; otherwise expect 2+ hour wait time Sundays.

I literally go here 10 times a month as it is amazing! Crazy pancake selection but also great for healthy power breakfasts! Attentive staff and comfy settings. Feels like a small pancake house in the middle of a big city. Anything you want they most likely can offer for breakfast!

If you go after 11am prepare for a MASSIVE wait!

Visited in mid September. We had booked reservations using the no wait app so we had no wait at all, highly recommended. I had the Oreo's more pancakes and they were to die for. Mix of Oreos, marshmallows, and lots of chocolate, highly recommend if you have a sweet tooth. Portions were very big. Definitely going back next time I'm in Chicago.

Used the Yelp app to avoid the wait. Food is spectacular. Very creative and satisfying. We had the Mexicana Skillet and a Spinach Eggs Benedict. Service is amazing and it's so worth a visit. Really great spot and well run.

Excellent! Expansive menu. Great specialty coffee selection. Place was crowded but orderly. Service is excellent. The fresh blueberry pancakes were awesome. Definitely a great place for breakfast / brunch.

we come from Taiwan.
I think it was the best breakfast we ever had!
Nice food and service!!!

I've been at Wildberry when there was no wait and I have been there when it was an 80 minute wait. However, once you are seated and place your order, the food comes out fast. They have some of the best  pancakes I have tried. Combine them with one of their fruit toppings and it's heaven. My eggs are always scrambled just right. Delicious bacon. Great service. I always find myself over over tipping. Just one thing, I always find myself having to fight off some flying bug :-(

Great bunch place in Chicago! Food is delicious, though similar to many other brunch places. What sets this place apart is the value. I highly recommend the skillet + upgrading to the specialty pancake. Many, many choices but with the combo, you'll be able to get a bit of savory and sweet.

Downside is the wait, likely due to its location next to millennium park. But that's also the upside...put your name down and go tour the park. Good if you're visiting the area and have time to kill. If you're in a hurry, you probably don't want to wait in line, which is especially long (1hr+) on the weekends.  

The service is great once seated and they have a good system of handling the wait. Definitely try it a least once.

I got sick after eating here.

Waitress also upsold me a pour over coffee, which wasn't on the menu, and told me it was only $1 more than a normal coffee order.

It was almost $8 for that coffee and wasn't worth it. I have had plenty of pour overs, and it wasn't very good to begin with but to see the price tag after that put me over the top.

Worse was I got sick, from the food here. Reported it but as you know I'm sure the restaurant didn't do anything with this and probably skated over it.

Will never go back.

Came here for Saturday morning brunch!
This place is super popular and the wait is like 2 hours. However, they came up with a perfect remedy to the problem! You can make reservations on Yelp and they will text you when your table is ready! I made reservations and we just walked down to millennium park and hung out. So convenient!

I had the Mexicana skillet and my gf had the corned beef Benny. I chose to upgrade my pancakes and got the berry bliss pancakes (well worth the upgrade!). The skillet was amazing! The portion was very large. The eggs were nice and runny and you could really taste the delicious chorizo. The avocado gave the dish a nice creamy flavor and the salsa added a nice kick to it. The Jalapeños were present with another kick but did not overpower the dish (a common problem with jalapeños). Best skillet I've ever had. It was a little greasy but not too bad for a skillet. The corned beef Benny was good. The English muffin was nice and fluffy but I wish I had tasted more corned beef. The berry bliss pancakes were heavenly! There was some nice fresh berries on the side. The craime anglaise was deliciously sweet with a nice vanilla flavor. The berry mascarpone sauce between the pancakes was rich and warm and made the pancakes even better. Probably the best pancakes I've ever had!

Overall Wildberry has found an ingenious way to cope with long lines while keeping customers happy. I had no problem with waiting because of how convenient it was. The service was fantastic and the food was amazing! Will definitely be coming back when I am back in the Windy City.

So coming from LA I definitely have patience for food but there is ALWAYS at least an hour if not two hour wait to be seated and sadly it's not really worth it. Once we were seated our waitress forgot to give us utensils and she was extremely rude / stand off-ish . I would tell you her name but none of the waitresses have name tags so good luck with that.

The food itself is good but you will wait like at least 15 min for your order. I got the breakfast panini and it was okay but not worth the wait. We also got wild berry French toast and pancakes and those are delicious and worth the wait . Just don't expect grade A customer service .
Loved eating here and enjoying the park nearby--a great intro into our stay in Chicago. Delicious savory and sweet breakfast menu items.

Worth the wait! Waited for an hour on Saturday morning in the rain but man, it was worth it! The cinnamon roll French toast is to die for! We also had the Mexicana skillet and cranberry turkey sandwich which were both great. The berry bliss pancakes were sweet but good. Definitely will come back if I get the chance. Everything is big enough to share.

pics.caption: Cinnamon roll French toast, berry bliss pancakes, Mexicana skillet and cranberry turkey sandwich.

review.des: WOW - one the best breakfast joints I have ever been to. The pancakes are worldclass. The wait was reasonable but I can see how it can get long. Come early and be ready for a wait.

Oh! My!!! We decided to eat here based on their reviews. When we came in, we were told the wait was an hour and a half...we put out name in the list and checked out millennium park while we waited. They use the NoWait app, which I would definitely use in future. Even still, this place is worth the wait! The Slow cooked brisket entree was awesome. And the rutherford omelet was incredible! The pancakes were perfect...fluffy and tasty. Fresh squeezed orange juice and decent coffee.
The best pancakes I ever had in my life. Amazing !!!! Latte was good too and Mexicano skillet.

Wow! This place way exceeded my already high expectations. I read on Yelp that there would be a long wait, so we used the No Wait app & it had us wait around two hours (granted it was Valentine's Day around 11). So that held our place in line & we were able to wander around Millennium Park & the Bean & all that. It was packed, though! But definitely worth the wait, in my opinion. Very friendly service. We got delicious coffee drinks that come in a rather large mug. But the best part was the pancakes! I got the berry bliss pancakes & they were without a doubt the best pancakes I've ever had. I didn't even get around to finishing the rest of my food (though it was very good as well) because the pancakes were just so incredible. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a wonderful breakfast experience in the Loop!
