pics.caption: Not exactly a Starbucks date  but nonetheless delicious. Boyfriend got a mocha & I got the white hot chocolate.
A wonderful Valentine's Day treat! So worth the wait!

review.des:
Breakfast/brunch is probably my favorite meal and Wildberry is one of my go-to places to satisfy my craving. The location is incredibly convenient as it's located downtown, which means parking is a clusterf*ck!! Either way, it's definitely worth the trip!

Came with friends pretty early in the morning to avoid the lines. Luckily, our plan worked and we were seated immediately. My friends started off with lattes made with Intelligentsia coffee, which Wildberry serves and I chose to go with a flavored lemonade which are bottomless (score!) I tried pretty much all the flavors, but passionfruit and kiwi stood out.

We ordered the butcher block, garden and venetian sizzlin skillets which come with 2 eggs of your choice as well as pancakes or toast as sides. I'm all about that runny egg yolk action so I got mine poached. Instead of getting the ordinary toast or pancakes, we all upgraded our pancakes to the berry bliss pancakes which is about a dollar more (do it!!). Despite all the food that we were about to receive, we were a bit overzealous and ordered chicken sausage links and stuffed strawberry cheesecake french toast as well.

The skillets were all equally tasty, but I still prefer the butcher block skillet which has ham, sausage and bacon. I took a bite of my friend's garden skillet, which was good, but too many veggies for my taste, haha. The berry bliss pancakes were stuffed with blueberries and mascarpone and topped with fresh blackberries, strawberries, vanilla creme anglaise and blackberry coulis. At first I thought there were waay too many things going on, but everything worked. The pancakes are light and fluffy; the mascarpone is creamy and creme anglais rich, but the tartness from the coulis and fresh fruit keep the dish from being cloyingly sweet. I loved the chicken sausage -- flavorful with a nice sear on the outside. Although I enjoyed the stuffed french toast, I could only take a couple bites because I was A) full and B) combo of brioche + cheesecake filling made for a super rich dish

Our server was great at clearing our plates and making sure we were taken care of. The great food, price and service will keep me comin' back!

pics.caption: Butcher block skillet with poached eggs

review.des: I came here Tuesday morning around 11:30 and you need everyone there to be seated. This is the yelpiest breakfast place so obvs I had to try it. I had to try the orange juice since I read something about it and it was actually quite delicious since I love pulp. Beware though because if you are getting the pancakes then this is just too much sweetness. I got the berry bliss pancakes and I guess a full order is 5, a short is 3 but you can get a side with 2. Even two was too much but I had to try it. There is sauce between the pancakes too so it was all so sweet jeez. I thought it was a solid pancake. We got the Mexican savory plate and that was completely necessary to balance out the sweetness. You get stuff on the side so we upgraded the pancake to the smore oreo one. Jeez do not get that. That was painful to consume and it made the berry bliss taste sugarless. The skillet is just a pile of stuff inside including eggs, meat, avocado and onion but that was gooood. I would say that this place is good but it is not to die for.

pics.caption: Berry bliss pancake side comes with two

review.des: This delectable cafe is the perfect example of "bang for your buck." The amount of food that comes with a single order is enough to satisfy the biggest of eaters (I would know). I could almost swear that the ceiling opened up and a single light shone on to my food as it approached the table. Worth the wait, walking around millennium park is an option while you wait. Double the local flavor, double the fun!
Great bfast spot and the advice received here to check in on Yelp about an hour ahead worked perfectly. We skipped the pancakes and saved room for dessert - the signature berry crepes were wonderful!

They are an interesting place to go..the first time I went I was stuffed from the banana pancakes that taste like banana pudding! however the last time i went back the food was overly bland and they even forgot the steak in my steak and hash brown dish...I don't understand how that happens but OK....

Visiting from out of town we saw this restaurant on Yelp and the reviews don't lie it's AMAZING. Service is on point and food is delicious.
I highly recommend this to everyone who wants a great breakfast in a beautiful setting!
No doubt that's the best breakfast restaurant in Chicago. The best red valve with French toast I ever try in my life. smoothies amazing and their coffee is unique. My family loves it.

GOD! Words can't even begin to describe how much I love this place! The food is like freaking HEAVEN! Jesus! You really need to try their signature pancakes and omelettes. So freaking good. Actually EVERYTHING is good. You can honestly get away with literally ordering blind and it will guarantee that you will love the food. I wish they opened up more locations cuz I would seriously be their #1 customer. No kidding. Go here please. This is your #1 breakfast place.

The only downside is that there is a long wait time usually about an hour to an hour and a half but honestly the wait is so darn worth it.

Yes it is worth the wait.... Go ahead put your name in go for a 45 min walk and come back for a great meal!   Friendly and fast once you get seated the lattes are perfect and the scrambled egg Ham and cheddar is fab!   Go for the side of berry pancakes as it is a speciality and it shows. Have your friend order the cinnamon roll pan cake so you don't miss out on that great one too!!

pics.caption: Scrambled eggs which cheddar and ham!  Yummy

review.des: Great place for brunch. Get there early or expect to wait a minimum of an hour. We we're told 1:15 wait time but we're seated in about 1 hour. So much to choose from on the menu. All entrees come with a side of their yummy pancakes. We opted for an "egg-quisite" (specialty) omelette. Mine was fig, scallion, cheese and turkey bacon( comes with reg bacon but I changed it). Very good omelet and so different. My hubby had the sundried tomato, provolone, basil and avocado omelette. He loved it. I had cinnamon pancakes, he had pecan caramel apple pancakes. Both amazing. Waitress was exceptionally friendly and provided excellent service. Definitely recommend this place

Not sure what is the hype is with this place. It is always crowded, and the food is mediocre. There are much better brunch place in downtown than Wildberry. But if you want to try it, go for it, it is not bad, but not impressive. This will not be my re-occurring choice for brunch.

omg amazing!
Enough said!
I took my mom here when she arrived from Orlando and she can't stop talking about it. She has many many allergies and they her patiently and politely they listened and accommodated her! Beyond impressed with the service, atmosphere, and food!

Amazing place. I will say this to start off, they have one of the best smoothies and the best mango lemonade I have ever had. I wasn't expecting having great drinks when I came, but they are very good.

I had the Apple Cinnamon pancakes with eggs over easy, and hashbrowns. Everything was awesome, huge portions of hashbrowns with topping options. The pancakes have many options, can miz it up everytime you come here. They also have a great sized menu, if you want something delicious and different everytime this place is for you.

Great breakfast there on Sunday!  When 40 -50 people are waiting outside in temperatures below zero, they're doing something right!  Service was very friendly. Fair warning, portions are very large so consider that when ordering. We split two breakfasts between three of us and we still took some home.  Pancakes are always great.  Coffee was just so so, that's my only dig and doesn't keep me from 5 stars. Just be ready to wait a bit.
Wonderful service and great coffee latte! Went there twice it was so enjoyable and such good food

Who knew that heaven was located in downtown Chicago.  This place is literally next door to my work and I have been DYING to try it ever since I walked by and smelled the bacon.  They don't take reservations and the place is always packed so we decided to show up at 1:30pm for lunch, 1 hour before their closing time of 2:30.  We were immediately seated.  So I have been studying their menu back and forth and ordered their Denver skillet and substituted for their specialty pancakes, just $1 extra.  Okay, the skillet, easily the best I have ever had, and I have had MANY skillets before.  The ham they used was delicious and they added a ton of veggies.  And then I had their Berry Bliss Pancakes, omg. So good, and although they look like they would be loaded with sweetness, they are actually NOT overwhelmingly sweet.  If I could, I would eat here everyday.  You get a ton of food for a decent price.

The food was great. The service was slow. The wait was epically long.

And, while it was absolutely delicious, I'm. It sure it warranted waiting 90 minutes to enjoy.

If the wait is short, under 20 minutes, you're in for a treat. Anything longer & I'd advise using that time to walk somewhere else.
I absolutely love the salads here...nice and big, enough to take home for leftovers!

We had to wait about an hour, but so worth it!! The cool thing is they text you when your table is ready, so we were able to explore Millennium Park while we waited.  The staff was very friendly!!! Highly recommend!

Great selection, fun omelette choices. Delicious coffee and friendly staff. For all the hype about the pancakes We thought they were rubbery. My husband got buttermilk pancakes and I got berry. Both were flavorful but not fluffy and delicate. The Napa Valley Fig Omelette was very good! A little too much cheese but excellent flavor. We would go back again. Glad we tried it.

pics.caption: Side of very Berry pancakes instead of toast.
Napa Valley Fig Omelette, very good.

review.des:
Decent prices, good hashbrowns, fluffy pancakes--this place is nice! However, I don't think it's anywhere worth the wait on weekends.

Also, the spinach in my eggs florentine, despite the bacon (thanks for that non-vegetarian touch!) actually tasted a lot like burnt veggie oil. Why? I don't want to taste veggie and canola oil when I'm having brunch.

And they serve Intelligentsia coffee here, a plus yes, but why's it gotta taste so watered down? Sadness. I like coffee a little more boldly brewers than this!
I have been to breakfast on Sundays twice. Due to long wait times we go early-8:30am to 9 am. We did not wait. The food was fine but not worth the long wait. The platters are not special.

We visited this place on a weekend trip to Chicago - the wait was an hour, and it was totally worth it.

The food was amazing (eggs benedict for me, an egg white scramble for him), the service was stellar, and everything came out very quickly.

The hollandaise was clearly made from scratch, and was better even than what I make. Definitely recommend.

So much hype about this restaurant. Most of it is true. Service is stellar, food delicious with a huge menu - something for everyone. Location is perfect - right outside Millennial Park where you can walk, play, rock climb and sightsee within a few feet of rolling out the door.  
Here's my only hesitation. An hour and 1/2 wait. If I wait an hour 1/2 for any meal it should be so good it makes me cry. It was good - the skillet was a fun way to mash up and kick up your eggs and hash browns; the option for a pancake instead of toast with your omelette is genius. The omelettes were so savory and filling they were like a gourmet meal within themselves. So, overall all positives. Just still not sure I would wait that long again next time. One tip. They say "hour to hour 1/2 wait" to every single person who walks through the door. We arrived at 940am and were seated at 11.

THE best breakfast spot I've been to in Chicago.

They're known for their pancakes -- and unsurprisingly -- deliver with high marks. The pancakes are light and fluffy. I highly recommend the signature berry bliss pancakes. Absolutely exquisite stuff. My brother got the cinnamon roll pancakes -- and they literally taste like the soft, gooey center of a normal cinnamon roll.

We also got the Southern Benedict...which was outstanding.

Next time I'm in Chicago, I'm coming here.

*Disclaimer: It's very popular, and thus there can be long waits/lines. I suggest trying to make a reservation in advance. It's that good. It's nice that it's also located across from the Bean in Millennium Park.

lit. It was soooo lit when I first tried it. So I went there literally every morning....and have tried most of their menu...turns out I'm sick of their food. So I give a 3. But a hard 4.6 when I first tried their signature bliss pancakes.

Came on a Tuesday around 12:30p and was seated right away. I ordered Signature   berry bliss crepes. So delicious! Fruit on it was super fresh! My sister ordered an eggs Benedict plate with chorizo (can't remember exact name) and was a bit spicy but delicious. Service was fast from beginning to end. Great brunch spot that is a must try. I have heard weekends should be avoided because there are really long waits.
So good but you better get here before 7 am or else you have to wait! The vanilla berry latte is also to die for! Can't wait to go back.

pics.caption: Vanilla berry latte I can't quit you.

review.des:
This is as good as pancakes get!  

We had the Berry Bliss pancakes and the Cinnamon Roll pancakes, with a side of bacon.   Everything was terrific.  The Cinnamon Roll pancakes were a tad too sweet for my wife but again really really good!

The next time we're downtown with our girls (8&6) we'll for sure get the berry bliss pancakes as a side dish (looked like 3 smaller pancakes vs the 5 large ones we got as our entrees).  I don't see any reason to get a full order for the little ones.   We could have easily split ours with the kids as we each ate about half of our orders.

The service was great especially given how busy the place was even during a blizzard.  

Easily one of the best pancake breakfasts ever!

pics.caption: Berry Bliss pancakes - the best pancakes I've ever had!

review.des: Hands down best breakfast place I've EVER been to! You have to try their specialty pancakes

The short: Great spacious breakfast spot

Our waiter was so friendly and charming! It's great when they bring a laugh out early in the morning. And though the room had plenty of diners, the tables were spaced out real nicely that it never felt crowded.

I ordered one of their omelets, with the addition of gluten-free honeycakes. Great portion size for brunch. SO GOOD! My friend ordered one of the skillets, and let me try some. SO GOOD! And her tiramisu pancakes were good too! We were somewhat rushed at the end because they wanted to combine our table with another. It's a good thing we were just about done anyway.

The next time I'm in Chicago, I know what I want to come back here for some morning smiles :)

I got the berry bliss pancakes with a vanilla berry latte, and sides of bacon and corned beef hash. So good! My husband got the biscuits and gravy and that too was very good!

I don't usually take home leftovers but all my leftovers got packed to go :)

I'm looking forward to trying this place again!!

The food was amazing. However, I highly recommend either calling ahead or putting your name on no wait so you can get on the list. Typical wait can be over an hour+, so plan ahead and get on the list at least an hour before you actually want to be there.

I stopped here for breakfast one day on my solo trip to Chicago. I was very glad I was alone since I didn't have to wait for a table at all. I was there quite early (before 8:00) and there was already a massive crowd outside. Once inside I was ready to eat!

I had the Venetian skillet (scrambled eggs, hash browns, green and red peppers, Italian sausage, some cheese), which is basically an omelette but dumped into a pan. It was really good and a LOT of food! It comes with your choice of pancakes or toast, and I chose the tiramisu pancakes. This was a great choice, albeit very sweet (which I like). It wasn't quite as tiramisu-y as I wanted, more like a regular coffee/chocolate chip, but still very good.

Service was what you would expect at a crowded, busy spot such as this. It's very close to downtown and Millennium Park so it's a good spot to check out if you're staying nearby. Overall I was quite pleased.

The most amazing breakfast place I have ever been to! My mom and I shared the cinnamon roll pancakes and the wild berry French toast, and it was fantastic! The portions were huge and we had a really fantastic server! The wait was kind of long (35-45 mins) but it was definitely worth it!

Despite super long wait times, I think it's pretty standard fare for the tourist set. Their pancakes and waffles are overloaded with extras turning them more so into a decadent dessert and less a hearty breakfast. It has an ideal location and decent service at peak hours. Nothing extraordinarily memorable that I can recall, but if you're wondering where to take your middle-of-the-road relatives from out of town who won't want something too fancy or too pricey, it's a solid "diner" vibe with good options...ideal for taking food baby selfies at the bean in millennium park afterwards.

For the Chicago set, it's along the same vein as Bongo Room in terms of dessert-like menu options, a touch more expensive than Yolk. I've been three times in the last 3 years and cannot recall having a bad experience. It's filling, so come with an appetite and you'll be satisfied.

I was looking for a good (and not exorbitantly expensive) breakfast place in downtown Chicago and Wildberry cafe definitely caught my attention with its 1500+ reviews. I was told the restaurant is pretty busy around 9-10 am, but I was lucky to escape a long queue since it was a weekday. I was pleasantly surprised by the quick turnaround time for each table.
I ordered Chocochip pancakes, Fresca omlette, and Cherry almond mocha (season special). The pancake was fluffy, tasty, and yet felt very light (generally not the case with chocochip pancakes). The omlette was made to perfection with sun-dried tomatoes, basil, and avocado blending quite well with provolone cheese. What stood out for me was a subtle taste of fresh (yes, you heard it right, fresh) olive oil that made the omlette all the more enjoyable. The hash browns were crispy (I ordered it crispy) and delicious. Seasonal specials are a must-have. Somehow, the ingredients for all the items we ordered tasted very fresh. The portions were pretty generous. We (me and my wife) had difficulty finishing our orders. The staff is pleasant and courteous. I would definitely visit the restaurant again when I am around downtown Chicago.
Went in on a Friday around 12:00 p.m. we had breakfast and it was scrumptious. Excellent customer service. Went back on a Sunday around 11:00 am and the wait was 2 hours :/ the wait is well worth.

Been here a few times but just getting around to a review.

The wait here can be pretty long so I would recommend going early. Usually seated quickly and able to get orders in fast if you know what you want. The menu is extensive so I would recommend you do a little research beforehand.

My favorite dishes here are the scrambles and they make great basic breakfast items (eggs, hash, bacon, etc)

I dream about the honey cakes here and they are also gluten free! Delicious and I haven't had anything quite like it anywhere else.  Try them next time! Their regular and specialty pancakes are also really tasty and come in a huge stack!

The portions here are extra large so come hungry!

A solid gem in the lakeshore east area. Take your family and friends when they come into town.

This place is so good! Although the wait time for dining in was pretty long--90 minutes for me--the food was worth it. I used those 90 minutes to walk around the Chicago Cultural Center(free museum to the public) across the street and made it back to Wildberry just in time to get seated. The service made us feel comfortable there and the food fills up the whole plate. I took home some that I couldn't finish, and even as leftovers, the food was still delicious. I will most definitely have breakfast here again when I go back to Chicago!

This place is on another level when it comes to brunch.

Pros:
- Amazing food. Love their Mexican scramble and omelet
- Amazing coffee.
- When I go to breakfast/brunch, I always get caught making the decision between sweet and savory. Wildberry doesn't make me choose! When you get an omelet or scramble, you can add on any of their pancakes for a few more dollars. Last time I went, I got their cinnamon roll pancakes, which were amazing.
- If you value portion size, you won't be disappointed.

Cons:
- Long, long wait on weekends. Often end up waiting over an hour for a table.

The wait for this place is insane. 2-2.5 hour wait for a table of 6. However, the pancakes are to die for. Tried the signature berry bliss and the special strawberry lemon poppy pancakes. They were so fluffy and not overly sweet from the toppings. The other things on the menu were good too. I had the beef brisket sandwich and they piled the sandwich high.

We waited an hour, and it was well worth it. Okay service, fresh berries, and excellent overall flavor.

The creme en glacé is tops almost all of their signature products and flecks of vanilla bean can be clearly seen. A nice touch on a heavily used component.

The syrup is marginal at best, pancake house quality, not 100% maple.

Coffee is decent quality as well, but don't expect your latte to be made by an Intellegensia barista (though they sell their coffee). Ordering a simple brevé left the barista a bit dumbfounded.

Overall, a decent experience. I would come back again, mostly for the quality of ingredients, atmosphere, and location.
Worth the wait (which was spent in Milennium Park conveniently located right across the street), great atmosphere, delicious food!

Oh yes, this place is popular!! Be prepared to wait. We are lucky to get a table right away but that's only because we arrived before 8:00 and on a work day!!! Quickly after we sat down, I noticed that the few open tables were quickly filled. But you will not regret the visit. Usually I don't eat pancake to be honest, but I have to say they have the best pancake here! I tried the signature berry pancake! Highly recommend!
I have been here 3 times. I've had the pumpkin bread French toast, the breakfast burrito, and roast beef hash. All we're very good. Get on the wait list early. It's worth the wait
Nothing special, just ok. The decor is a little boring and uninviting.
Shared Rutherford omelet and cinnamon roll pancakes, it hit the spot. Very enjoyable and worry the wait. Definitely a go to.

Service was absolutely terrible. By the time we got our hot chocolates they were luke warm. Tried to tell our server about it she called us liars. And even the manager told us it was hot. Like he was the one drinking it. I was completely in shock zero customer service. Food was ok they could do a lot to improve. Also they have around 10 guys just standing around waiting for you to finish your plate so they could grab it. But no one to give you a coffee refill. Just a terrible experience very disappointing.
I work next door and have eaten here a few times. Good food that's moderately priced. Service is adequate and ambiance is pretty simple.

I really enjoyed my experience at Wildberry while visiting Chicago.  It's in a great location across the street from Millennium Park.  It can be a little loud inside, which doesn't bother me, as I love to be able to converse freely with my company without worrying so much about bothering those around me.

If you go early enough, you shouldn't have a problem with a long wait.  After 9am, it's more of a toss up.  Either way, service inside once you are seated is quick yet very attentive, and a nice glass of water will be waiting at your seat for you, no need to wait.

The food is spectacular.  I mean, it's a little hard to ruin breakfast, but they do breakfast just right.  I got the Venetian skillet, and I was so bummed not to have enough room in my stomach to eat every bit of it.  The buttermilk pancakes were just right, and from what I saw around the dining room, the specialty pancakes are probably a huge hit also.

Love this place, will definitely return whenever in Chicago.

pics.caption: The Venetian with scrambled eggs.  So effing good.

review.des: Long long wait but it was worth it. We put our names on the waitlist and that was the way to go. The cinnamon roll pancakes were to die for. Good service and friendly staff.
AMAAAAAAZING breakfast!  (weekend waiting list cane be prohibitive)

So, I come here almost every week. I LOVE this place. I will put up with the 45 minute wait (come after 9 AM on a weekend? There's going to be a wait). I'll cut to the chase, I don't really pay much attention to the service/seating because all I care about is the food. Here's what I recommend ordering:

Skillets. My personal favorite is the Mexicana skillet, with a side of berry bliss pancakes (you can upgrade to specialty pancakes for an extra buck or so). It is LOADED with avocado, chorizo, cheese, jalapenos, onions and a little bit of cilantro. It is so, so tasty and such a massive portion. It comes with a side sauce but I personally haven't tried it, since I didn't really need any more flavor. The berry bliss mix is just wonderful, it's a mix of vanilla anglaise, blackberry coulis, and berry mascarpone with fresh berries. I didn't know what an anglaise or coulis is and I didn't care, because it tastes amazing.

Another great berry bliss option is the crepes, which I actually prefer to the pancakes. It's easier to enjoy the berry bliss filling because there's less in the way. Also a huge portion, so I would recommend getting it to share after something savory.

Seriously, just go to Wildberry.

Went to Chicago for a little weekend get away. I really enjoyed this place. The food was amazing. I had the wildberry pancakes with the eggs and bacon. I also had a kiwi lemonade and that was great. The pancakes were delicious and I usually don't like anything on my pancakes and I enjoyed that. The kiwi lemonade was a great surprise and I'm glad I tried it. Also it was almost closing time and even with that the staff was great and didn't rush me out they still served me with a smile.

The pancakes are above average and the hash brown is nice. Its still not the best pancake in the world to me since pancakes Mama's in San Francisco are so much better.
The greentea mocha latte is a MUST.

Chose this place for brunch on a Sunday morning and had to sit through an hour and a half wait, but it was worth it.

A popular menu choice is one of the savory egg skillets paired with a side of pancakes or toast. BUT you can substitute any of their specialty pancakes for just $1. They have lots of flavors including berry bliss, tiramisu, and cinnamon roll.

I chose the berry bliss crepes instead of pancakes, and they were YUM.

Wildberry also serves delicious Intelligentsia coffee.

Excellent choice for breakfast, indoors or out. Pancakes were fluffy and tasty, including the fig and walnut multi-grain. Coffee was hot and the medium roast was flavorful. Portions were plentiful and fruit was fresh.
The service was exemplary and pleasant, from reception to departure.
Downtown Chicago has a breakfast hotspot!
We loved it! Very busy, even 45 minutes before closing but very worth the wait. Our server was friendly & attentive, the food was delicious. Gluten-free pancakes are the best I've ever had.
Great food, great service. Can't ask for a better place for breakfast/brunch.

Wildberry pancakes  niam niam  and vanilla berry latte

Service is very quick! And hostesses are very beautiful and welcoming!!

Besides for the wait and it took a while for my food to be served, yummie place to get a delicious meal.   Their portions were generous and the server was friendly.  I loved their pancake and crapes.   Budget friendly and conveniently located I n downtown Chicago.
This place is SO good! Fantastic fig omelet and fluffy, delicious pancakes. Great coffee. Good service. I can't wait to go back. Yum!

Always a great place for brunch. My favorites are the variety of eggs Benedict that they prepare. I love them all. The waffles and pancakes are delish too. The worst part of dining here is the wait- so if you can manage to get a call in before you head over- all the better! Come hungry and you will not e disappointed.

A must when visiting Chicago. Most delicious and affordable breakfast. We went in on a Monday and still had to wait an hour. Make sure you make it with time to spare. Don't miss out on this delicious place. All the skillets are delicious and the pancakes are so freshly made. Delicious!!

I'll be back.  

While the red velvet french toast was not as good as the rv pancakes at Bongo Room, it was a hefty serving, and it was enough for 4 separate sittings for me.  What did rock my socks off was the corned beef hash though!  Crispy, meaty, and delicious with ketchup!  Also, kudos on the interior decor.  Very cozy... there's something about those warm, rich red tones.

Advantages over the not-too-far away Bongo Room:
- bigger interior.  Read: faster turn around.
- manageable noise level.  You can actually hear your own conversation.
- 3x as many choices on the menu, but not a big deal for me.

Next on my list to try: the tiramisu pancakes.
Great service, & food!!! Topped off my weekend in Chicago! Define plan on going back here next time I'm in town. Strongly suggest adding your name to the waiting list before arrival.

Everything we ordered was amazing and had great presentation. From the Oreo s'more pancakes to the cinnamon roll pancakes to the los altos Benedict. There was a long wait but well worth it because it was great food with big portions at a fair price. Also helped that they had a waitlist program built into Yelp which also showed your spot in line.
Wait was too long, but food was good.  Hostess was a bit rude, but our waiter was pleasant.

So my wife and I stayed downtown and we looked at Yelp for a good breakfast recommendation. Wildberry was rated high so we gave it a shot. We got there around 9:00 Sunday and waited 15-20 minutes but it was already busy. We both ordered breakfast burrito for me and corned beef hash for her and we decided to split the house special pancakes. Everything was exceptional, fast including the server. I highly recommend going here and this will now become a regular staple for my wife and I on trips downtown.

Lots of good food, with good service. Not great food, or service, but a good value. Lots of food, so share. And be prepared to wait if you don't have the app. I had a skillet, which could have been better by simply cooking the hash browns and sausage longer. The fresh squeezed OJ was great. Ambience was creating lacking. Better than Dennys.

I'm sooooo thankful for Yelp for the great reviews of this place.  

Just a few blocks from our hotel we stopped by on our way shopping and to millennium park we had to stop by.  

They serve Intelligenstia coffee and Tazo tea - both amazing in their own rights.  

I ordered the chorizo eggs Benedict that was the best eggs Benedict I've ever had.  Watch out though - it's spicy.  

The girlfriend got the napa omelet with figs and a side of the signature berry bliss pancakes.  I'm not a fan of pancakes yet they were the best I've ever had before.  Juicy, fluffy, and delish.  

Definitely stop by this place.  Best brunch place in the area.
Must have buttermilk pancakes! Omg! Add some apple butter to that and you've met heaven!
The wait list option needs a lot of work. Put in an hour ahead of time, showed up when they said, waited 30 minutes in the sun and there were still 34 parties in front of us. Get a life!
Good food if u don't want the wait go early got here at 8:15 waited 20 min really good banana crime lie crepes

A great breakfast place. It was a perfect place to sit outside and people watch while we ate our delicious breakfast food. And oh yes, put your name on the waitlist from Yelp. That was the best thing ever. I put our name in while lying in bed at a hotel up the road. An hour later, we walked down to Wildberry and were sat within 15 minutes. There were literally over 100 people waiting to be sat.

A local friend brought be for breakfast the other day  The interior is nice, bright and open.  Staff was super friendly and welcoming even opening the door for me as I had some luggage in tow. They also get +'s for refilling my coffee several times without me asking.

I ordered a Denver skillet while my friend got a pancake egg combo.  It was ok... but the potatoes were a bit soggy which is always a turnoff for me.  Overall... It just wasn't anything special.. or even as good as other Denver Skillets I've eaten during my travels.   On the plus side... the toast was nice.

To bad I am not a pancake person because those looked a lot better.

I'm not really sure why this place is so popular. I came here on my last visit to Chicago two years ago, and again on my most recent trip. Both times, there wasn't anything to write home about. Expect to wait a long time and get an average breakfast/brunch. I was here on a Monday around 9:30 AM... and had a half hour wait for 2 people. I would hate to see what it's like here on the weekends. I guess if you had a long enough wait, you could go across the street and ogle the Bean before coming back.

They use buzzers to alert you when your table is ready, but they're sometimes defective (i.e. they don't vibrate). I'm glad I asked why my table wasn't ready yet after my estimated time was up instead of just blindly waiting.

The portions are huge! I was a little upset because I wanted to try other food Chicago had to offer... but I was too full.

We came here early Sunday morning after strolling through Millennium Park. We arrived around 8:30 and there was already a 30-45 minute wait - so be aware that you'll have to come early just to make sure you eat before lunch rolls around!

They seated us within 30 minutes and the staff was incredibly friendly! Our waiter gave us some great recommendations. My companion ordered the combination plate, which came with eggs, pancakes, hash browns and added an order of bacon to that.

I ordered the Florentine eggs Benedict which came with a side of hash browns. Their hash browns have the option of having it cooked with cheese of your choice or onions or both! I've never had this option before, but wow! Those hash browns were delicious with pepper jack cheese.

Overall, both of us enjoyed our meals immensely and would come back. For the price, it's a great value!
First of all the coffee is great...food was served fast and hot. But the waiter brought the check and said no rush but I felt a little rushed. But I will come back....

I finally made it to Wildberry. After contemplating a visit to the popular breakfast spot during several weekend trips to Chicago, but realizing that at the time that I was going to go the wait would be too long, I went early to beat the Saturday crowd about a week ago.

We arrived around 7:45 AM and the restaurant was about half full. As we waited for the third member of our party, throngs of people began to file in and by the time that we were ready to be seated about 15 minutes later, the place was almost packed. We were seated promptly and our waitress came over shortly thereafter.

Having read the yelp reviews, I knew what I wanted - two (instead of five) of the signature berry bliss pancakes. Despite knowing this, I ordered them incorrectly and I ended up with pancakes topped with fruit. The waitress was kind enough to take them back to the kitchen to add on the mascarpone and anglaise. Then, it was perfect. The pancakes were small, but light and fluffy and most importantly, delicious!  I heard that the multi-grain pancakes were similarly good from another person in my group.

I also tried the red velvet french toast which was breadier and heavier than the pancake with good red velvet flavoring. The cream cheese frosting filling complemented the dish well since the cake wasn't very sweet. This spin on french toast was done better at Yolk in the South Loop.

Accompanying the main courses, we had the hash browns and biscuit. The hash browns had onions in them but they needed a bit more flavor. Salt for sure. There was nothing special about the "homemade" biscuit which was not worth $2.50.

Wildberry makes great pancakes. If I return, that's what I'll stick to ordering.

As we walked out, I saw the line of people waiting for a table. Believe the reviews - come early or be prepared to wait.

It's a hot August mid-morning. We are all dying in here! Either turn up the AC, or send a hot dude over to fan our table!

Aside from the heat, this is a gorgeous location for the Wildberry. Libertyville's is also nice, but this building just takes it all up a notch. It used to be the Prairie Rock Brewing Company. The stone work is amazing, it's a really large location with great decor vaulted ceilings, big windows providing natural-lighting, and I've only seen a small portion of it. The booths are nice and roomy, too.

The food is amazing! I rarely venture to the lunch menu when here but the items I've tried, like the turkey cranberry sandwich on a pretzel roll, was really yummy. But it's truly all about the breakfast here, at least for me. The skillets are full of flavor and extremely hearty- my fave is the Mexicana, oh baby! Omelettes are consistently cooked light and fluffy, just perfectly, and they don't skimp on ingredients or sides- or portions for that matter. Pancakes are delicious, especially if you get it smothered in something fruity and sweet, or decadently chocolatey- kids love the ooey, gooey chocolatey s'mores pancakes EVERY TIME- or if you tend as I do toward the crepes instead, they will let you upgrade your pancake side to that and they are delicious.

Another nice option is all the healthy options they offer, like using EVOO instead of butter, or egg whites or beaters instead of regular eggs. They make it easy to cut calorie corners if that's your goal, albeit you'd have to be quite disciplined in a place like this, but it can be done. :) They are great about switching out ingredients, too, even if you can be high maintenance like me.

Intelligentsia is always a welcome sight for my coffee here. And they make a mighty fine cup. Also noteworthy are the hash browns. They give them a great crispy sear and still soft on the insides, plus I have them add onion to mine. Just add hot sauce and I'm ready! They even boxed my hash brown side to go for me as our orders came to the table! I didn't want the temptation that day, but I did want the value. :) Yup, told you- high maintenance! Oh, you'll make points with your dad and MIL for the Dutch apple pancake, I know I did. Yummy, and insanely huge, sweet and decadent.

I've always had fantastic service at either Wildberry I've been to, even when busy, which boy-oh-boy, this one was swamped last visit. You must be prepared to wait on weekends especially. We waited 45-60 minutes last visit. At least it's a decent size lobby and they have a patio for waiting as well, but on a hot day, well, it was a little brutal.

Wildberry always delivers in food, service and atmosphere! I don't know anyone who doesn't like their experience here, and most of my visitors want to return often. So do I! It's not cheap exactly, but fairly moderate. You definitely get quality and value for your dollar here. Don't forget to take some of their jarred Wildberry preserves home with you. Talk about making points! It's a great little gift. Just be prepared for a wait, and if it's August, ask for the "wild" and hot dude to fan you.

pics.caption: Upgraded my pancakes side to a crepe, opted for plain w side of butter, cuz that's how I roll. :)
Veg omelette (egg whites, no cheese or broc/asp, add spinach) w sides of (partially eaten) fruit & upgraded crepe (not shown)
Vegetarian omelette (egg beaters) w included sides of hash browns and toast.

review.des: The food and service were great, but the long wait and awkward reservation system keep it from 5stars. The food was terrific!
It was indeed worth the wait! There were so many items to choose from and everything on the menu looked delicious. My meal was great! A must visit if in Chicago.

My friends and I came to Wildberry Cafe during our annual St. Patty's Day trip to Chicago.  Normally we would go to South Water Kitchen, but after our last few disenchanting visits, we decided to give something else a go.  We were seated within 10 minutes, which was great considering they were fairly busy and we had a party of 8.

The first day we went, I had the pot roast eggs benedict with blackberry lemonade and was very happy with the food.  I'm always up for trying something new, and this particular type of eggs benedict was exactly that.   There was good flavor, and a good sized portion as well, while not leaving my wallet too light.

Also, upon finding out that they had sweet potato fries, I immediately ordered some (being a sweet potato french fry fiend).  Unfortunately, they did not have cinnamon butter.  Our waiter was very apologetic though, and brought out a few small dishes of butter and stirred cinnamon in for me (at his suggestion, without me even asking!)  It wasn't quite as good as some other restaurants' cinnamon butter, but he was just guessing at the ratios, and I really appreciated the effort.  Overall, his ratio was pretty good, and it still worked out well with the fries.

With how good my meal was Friday morning, I just had to go back on Saturday and try the red velvet french toast that everyone else had been raving about on Yelp.  I mean, it's red velvet AND french toast!  How can you possibly go wrong!?  Well here's the answer:  you can't!  It was an absolutely delicious meal, one that I plan to repeat next March!

pics.caption: The red velvet French toast is to die for!

review.des: Came on a Sunday around noon, and wait time was 1.5hrs! When we finally got seated, we were ravenous and ordered skillet+pancakes and 2 omelettes+pancakes between the 3 of us. We finished all of it and were very full at the end. The skillet was tasty, but the omelettes were my favorites. I enjoyed the Napa Valley Fig more than the Rutherford, but both were excellent. We ordered Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes, Cinnamon Roll, and the Raspberry White Chocolate Chip special. The former 2 were too sweet and drenched in sauce. I liked the last one best. Service was decent.

It was a beautiful Saturday to have brunch so of course the wait for Wildberry was extremely long. They give you the little flashing buzzers so you know when it's your turn without having to wait in a line. When we finally got seated, it was already near their closing time. I got their signature berry bliss pancakes and thought it was more visually appealing than anything else. They tasted good but I didn't think they deserved all the hype they get, except that they're gorgeous. I also got some sweet potato fries but they were pretty standard. The service was standard, nothing particularly noteworthy. By this time it was already near or a little after their closing time so they'd already taken down all their other tables and umbrellas so we were just sitting in the middle of their little entrance plaza aka the area they turn into outdoor seating. I thought it was just us being slow but then I went inside and there were still a ton of people eating. Just overall was a little underwhelmed by my experience at Wildberry just because it does get so much hype. The food was good but if I did ever come back I would try to order something else instead of their signature berry pancakes.

A friend recommended this place for brunch and it was spot on. I had the butcher block skillet, which was probably the best American style breakfast I have ever had. Portion was enough for 2 people, especially if you add $1 for a specialty pancake add-on. I'm not a fan of pancakes so I can't judge, but friends said there pancakes were very well-made.

Location is perfect for people visiting Millennium Park as it's just across the street.
This place is worth the wait and there is always a wait at least 30 mins. If your starving it's best to call first . Hands down the best thick cut bacon and buttermilk pancakes .
The food is good but not as good as expected. I found this restaurant in yelp that people recommend as one of the best brunch in Chicago. But it is just a good restaurant not excellent.

I went out with a girlfriend for breakfast. The wait was long but great customer service, food and coffee were all fantastic!

I will definitely go back.
The best crape I've ever had! But need to come early to put your name on. I wait for an hour 15 minutes to eat, worth it though!

Amazing. If you're visiting (we're from nyc), you have to stop by this place! Eggs are cooked perfectly with the right texture and my Belgian waffle was extra fluffy with the proper crunch. Super delicious, I would go back if the wait wasn't 1hr for about two ppl but definitely worth the wait!

pics.caption: Duck confit with two eggs over easy

review.des: Amazing breakfast!  I used "waitlist" prior to getting there which helped with the wait when we got there.  We were seated quickly and given an excellent run down of the menu by our server.  I went with the Garden Omelet and Cinnamon Apple Pecan pancakes.  My husband had the corned beef hash and berry bliss waffle, and my daughter had the silver dollar chocolate chip pancakes.  Everything was A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!! I would recommend to everyone and I look forward to returning again soon!

Really, really long wait time but truly excellent food.  A huge variety of incredibly good pancakes.  The hash skillet was outstanding and extremely filling.  There is indoor and outdoor seating but you kind of have to take what you can get as there is always a crowd waiting to get in.  The servers were all very friendly.  It's easy to see why the place is so popular.

You know when you watch Rachel Ray or any other food network person take that bite of whatever it is they're featuring. And you always think,"Wow, they really practice their mmmmmm noises."  I ordered the Banana Cream Pie pancake special and felt I made an "mmmm" noise worthy for the food network.

I've seen red velvet quite as an option quite frequently, but banana cream pie?! My favorite kind of pie. I don't care for pancakes, I'm a savory breakfast kind of girl, but this was totally worth it.

Other points:
- looks like an upscale panera
- great service
- if you're thinking "would be weird to NOT order pancakes here?" the answer is yes. you may as well throw yourself out.

3.5 stars. Rounding down because wait time is way too long, and food can be a little oily.

Wildberry is delicious. But be prepared for a wait. I've had the wait time be between 1-3 hours the visits that I've gone. Generally I wouldn't say that the food is worth that sort of wait, and I wish they would just implement a reservation system, but if you happen to be in the area and have time, Wildberry will give you food that is satisfying.

This isn't fancy brunch - and there are plenty of options for fancy brunch in Chicago - but it is hearty brunch. Their skillets could probably be 2-3 meals for me. A little greasy.

The Berry Bliss pancakes were great. I loved the mascarpone, and would order them again because they weren't disgustingly sweet, very refreshing. Smart thing is that if you order a skillet they come with pancakes, and you can upgrade to specialty pancakes for only a $1 more - love that. You get the sweet and the savory!

This place has reasonable food, however the one and a half to two hour wait is just definitely not worth it. There are plenty of breakfast restaurants in Chicago. It's a tourist spot. The Berry French toast was great!

So let me explain. Wildberry isn't anything special.  It's located on the edge of Millennium Park so it's got a great LOCATION.  The long line outside becomes a self-fulfilling prophecy, and hence more people get in line, assuming the long line means its good.  The long line, my dear people, just means that some cattle want to get some chow.  There's no reason they shouldn't be ringing cowbells whenever you enter or exit.

I had waited 45 minutes (I was waiting for an appointment at the French Consulate, just around the corner, and I didn't want to venture too far.  A local had told me to check it out, but since he had never been there I was a bit dubious of the recommendation) so I ordered almost immediately upon sitting down.  No more than 5 minutes after the order, it appeared (it, being a corned beef hash eggs benedict).  Along with a macchiato.

Now, a macchiato is one of the easiest drinks to make.  Pull a single or double espresso shot.  Dollop or small amount of steamed milk.  That's it.  I explained this to the man, and he brought me an obnoxiously large "caramel macchiato" in the tradition of Starbucks.  I explained it step by step to the waiter again.  He brought back the same thing, again.  

I just kept eating and when it came time for my check I just told him to take it off my bill.  I couldn't be too irritated.  Sure they offered coffee.  The sugary coffee "drinks" that Americans love.  Not real coffee.  That's fine.  The bigger issue was not listening to my patient, step by step instructions.  

Skip this place.  Go to Panera or Au Bon Pain.  You won't be waiting as long, pay as much, or get such clueless barista service.
Simply put, I could care less about the wait I will be standing in line smiling every time I'm near Chicago. Eat big and get an expresso beverage to go!
OMG so big, you can share an omelette; the strawberry pancakes are awesome!! Great service even there some of them that talk in Spanish! It's a place for all ages!

Came here for breakfast and the food was amazing ! Service was top notch!! I didn't have to wait in line at all, walked in and got seated right away this was around 9 am, but I noticed right when I was done with my meal there was a long line. I ordered a skillet with the wild berry bliss pancakes ! The pancakes were great!!! I also ordered a buffalo wrap with fries. The fries were amazing and crispy!! I will be back when I'm in town and I recommend this place to anyone here in Chicago.

Amazing place to eat.
My friends came to America early in the morning and we didn't want to eat Mcdonalds.
So we gave this place a try and OMG they were outstanding... !!

Great breakfast on our second to last morning in Chicago. Based on our last visit over 3 years ago I knew this place was crowded so I used the Nowait app to put myself on the list, the timing was perfect just as we were walking up they texted us that the table was ready. I got the fresh berries pancakes (and man is it a lot of pancakes, like 6 so enough for two people). Hubby got the veggie omelette which was a little bland but came with a huge fruit bowl and toast. Overall, reasonably priced food, fairly decent service (we had the little one so were at the mercy of her attention span). I would come back again.

You will need to book in advance or do what I did and go in, reserve a place, then take a look round Millennium Park. It's worth the wait.. great food, I had the Spinach Omelet with pancakes on the side.

Great breakfast, we had the eggs Benedict and Mexican skillet with berry pancakes. Wait time of 90 minutes was a bit insane, but completely worth it. Will come back tomorrow for breakfast and try something else!

Wait is long but well worth it. Just get out of bed and immediately go to Yelp and get on the list.  Fresh juice, interesting Omelettes and benedicts plus variety in pancakes, waffles, crepes and French toast.  Love the variety!

i dream about this place
The prices may seem high at first but they give you /so much food/ and the service is pretty great. The only downside is the waiting time. @wildberry maybe ya'll should expand (or maybe I shouldn't go at peak hours).
Amazing people. Amazing food. The portions are very large and the prices are great. The bacon is thick and the service is righteous

The waitress was so slow and rude. I kept asking for our waitress, finally she came, did not apologize for being late. The food took too long, ppl came after us, sat after us and were served before us, The service and food taste were below average, don't waste ur time, Chicago has plenty of other nice places to have breakfast at. This place is not one of them. They are so overrated.
I had the BBQ chicken salad and it was delicious! Their portions are HUGE so Coke hungry! Definitely worth every penny!

Awesome place. We got there just before 8:30 to beat the rush. Had an amazing breakfast skillet with a Oreo Smore pancake on the side. My stomach hurts, but that's cause I ate too much. Service was great. Good coffee. Attentive staff. I'd go back for sure.
Yummy gluten free pancakes and breakfast skillets! You HAVE to go here.  So gooood!  Long waits at breakfast though.
This place is awesome and should have a warning label!  Ahtian was a very cool server. She gave a great coffee recommendation. I went into sugar overload. Food was so delicious. Will be back!

pics.caption: Cinnamon Roll pancakes with eggs and hash browns. Honey Toffee Nut Latte

review.des: Food was good. The host told us that we were next and then made us wait until she seated six other parties. You do not tell a customer that they are next if they aren't, especially when they're hungry and its first thing in the morning. The server was not friendly. She barely smiled and did not check on us at all- except at the end when she gave us a fake smile with the bill. The service was horrible...

The wait was long but very well worth it.  Outstanding food, good service, and they operate like a NASCAR pit crew.  My wife had some brisket thingy for breakfast while I had the Mexicana platter.  Neither of us could decide what we wanted so we ordered the Cinnamon French Toast also.  That was a little slice of heaven.   The best surprise was that the price was cheap for Chicago.

I was expecting a line, but luckily, I got a seat right away. (It was thursday around 12:30). I had the Veggie omelette, it was alright. didn't really meet my expectation. People say the skillets are really good. I should try that next time. I also had their signature pancake, it was delicious.
Personally though, I would recommend yolk over wildberry.

Thank you, Wildberry, for the great start to our day! The red velvet French toast was excellent and the banana cream pancakes were light, fluffy, and tasty. Pair them with eggs, hash browns, and sausage, and it was awwwwwesome!

Yup. It's just as good as the Wildberry back home in Libertyville.

I did stray from what I usually order and went with The Rutherford omelet that sounded tasty. I made it with egg whites only and that was cooked up with spinach, bacon, and caramelized onions (I nixed the goat cheese). That plus my side of cinnamon roll pancakes made for quite the fantastic meal.

It was a Friday around 9am that our party of two dined here and we were initially intimated by the huge crowd of people waiting around outside the restaurant holding buzzers. But, as with our Wildberry in Libertyville, the wait is typically pretty quick and once you order the food comes out fast. So don't be scared off by the wait; we ended up sitting outside for just about 15 minutes before they called us in to our table.

Wildberry nails everything they make.

The pancakes are all phenomenal and come in the coolest flavors: oreo s'more, red velvet, cinnamon roll...
Their omelets and egg dishes are also delicious and generously portioned.
Every one of their meats is very high quality - the bacon is ultra thick and meaty; the Canadian bacon is also one of my favorites to order as it's perfectly browned up and tastes great.
The hashbrowns are always crispy.
Their toasts are quality; I am so in love with their nine-grain toast - it has a subtle sweetness to it and is wonderfully fresh and hearty with seeds and such to crunch up the crust. So good.

If you haven't already been here, Wildberry is a must try breakfast place.

pics.caption: side of cinnamon roll pancakes!! incredibly delicious
rutherford egg white omelet (minus the goat cheese) w. crispy hashbrowns
nine grain toast - I love this stuff

review.des:
Nice place! Typical American pancake joint (that's a good thing). I had a skillet with a pumpkin latte, very well done.

Would have been 5 star but I felt the guys working there clearing the plates could give you more time and smile a bit more, isn't enough to put me off going again though.

Worth a visit!
Fancy Denny's. What's with the wait - is this posted in every tourist book currently in publication? There are other places to go, out-of-towners.

Friendly service, nice choices for breakfast and lunch. Amazing food !

Can get crowded on weekends. Just go early and you'll be fine.
Simply the best breakfast place in Chicago! The selection of unique and tasty items is abundant. The service was outstanding. The pancakes are out of this world good.

To die for! We waited almost an hour and a half but it was totally worth it...and there's plenty to see in the city while you wait. I had the Rutherford omelette with tiramisu pancakes and freshly squeezed berry orange juice. Best breakfast, hands down!

As noted in other reviews, expect a wait--even mid day weekday.

Servers are great--friendly, and attentive. Every breakfast comes with choice of toast or pancakes--splurge on the pancakes. Original and specialty are really tasty.

Unique omlette combinations, and multiple choices of breakfast skillets offer a different take on breakfast.

Tables are VERY close together.

It was my first time visiting Chicago and this place was definitely on my to-go list! It is located right in downtown across from Millennium Park/the Bean. This place was extremely crowded on a Saturday during brunch time. Luckily they participate in the No Wait app so I was able to put my name on the waitlist without actually physically going to the restaurant first. Loved that because my bf and I were able to just walk around downtown while we waited. The app said that 96 parties were in front of us, but the wait only ended up being about an hour long. Not too bad! We got the homemade corned beef hash which came with two eggs of your choice. It was hearty and delicious! You should ask for salsa on the side...it gives it that extra kick of flavor :) For an extra dollar or so, you can order a side of pancakes with this entree. I ordered a side of the cinnamon roll pancakes. It tastes like a delicious cinnabon! It comes with 2 pancakes which was definitely enough. We also ordered a full order of their signature berry bliss pancakes. I thought it was good, but I was expecting a little more because of the hype. I wouldn't order a full size of the pancakes unless you're going to share it with like 2 or 3 people. It is huge and sweet. I would definitely order an entree and just pay extra to get these pancakes on the side. Overall, nice and yummy brunch place in downtown Chicago.

pics.caption: Homemade corned beef hash with scrambled eggs, cinnamon roll pancakes, and the signature berry bliss pancakes

review.des: Signature wild berry bliss pancakes are amazing! Light, fluffy and yummy. We also had a Fresca omelette and butcher block scramble. Great food, service and very worth 75 minute wait to get in. We will be back.
Great breakfast spot. The skillets have great portions and taste, fast service once you're seated. I'll be back again.
Had the portabello eggs benedict, fantastic! Be sure to use the app to get your reservation in--easy peasy!

In town for a few days on vacation, we tried to eat at Wildberry on a Sunday. You know, brunch day. That was a funny idea- and a two hour wait- so, no Wildberry. for us!

Convinced to hit up this joint near our hotel before we left, we tried again on a Wednesday. It was still busy, but for two we got right in.

The breakfast options were varied, leaving me wanting more than any breakfast allows, and I ultimately ended up with a make my own omelette, 2 wild berrry pancakes, hash browns, and a VERY full stomach.

Since I was leaving Chicago that afternoon for a long Megabus ride, it was helpful that this passed for both breakfast and lunch.

Good food, lots of options, and very popular.
The serving size is huuuuuuuge and the prices are reasonable. I ordered the omelette and hashbrowns! It was worth the 45 minute wait!
This place is yummy! Their pancakes are delicious as are the skillets. Came early as there is always a line.

Don't get me wrong, the food is good, but I don't understand why it's as crowded as it is on the weekend.
It was a 45 minute wait. When we were seated, the waitress came to us immediately and got out order. Our food came out quickly, it was good and what I was expecting. It was a bit annoying that a bus boy came up a couple times, even with food still on out plate and kept asking if we were done. Then the waitress kept asking if we needed anything else and if we needed the check.
I understand you're busy, but I want to at least finish the food I paid for before you rush us out.
The atmosphere was like any other breakfast place, and I liked the Wildberry pancakes. Probably wouldn't go back though

Very popular food destination in Chicago as evident by the number of reviews and also the 1 hour wait line. My friends and I decided to just get it to go so we only had to wait 15 minutes. We got the berry bliss pancakes which was amazingg. They give lots of fruits!

Pic: yelp.com/user_local_phot…

Had the chance for the first time to have breakfast at Wildberry Pancakes cafe. As per all  the Yelp reviewers, it is worth the try.  The breakfast was very good and the service was excellent. The portions are huge, and you have to wait. I used the Waitlist option on Yelp which was well worth it.

Great service! The skillet was amazing! My iced tea was never empty. I am very impressed. The 10 wait was well worth it. The side of pancakes are a meal by themselves. Thanks again for a great experience.

Sooooo good. I had the Mexicana skillet and cinnamon pancakes. The skillet was absolutely incredible, easily the best skillet I have ever had. The pancakes were also very good. They definitely try to innovate with their pancakes.

The service was also very friendly and good. There was a wait, but once we were seated our server paid attention to us and the food came very quickly.

Highly recommended!
I had the berry special waffles and holy shit it was good! Not to sweet perfect waffle. sauce was delicious. berries were fresh. this place was totally worth the 1.5 hours!

Great place for breakfast! I like their wide breakfast options and their friendly staff. Expect a long wait due to the high demand and it's location. Always had a good experience every time I go there with my family.

If you ever notice about a dozen skeletons sitting east of Michigan Avenue on Randoph in the  morning hours, don't panic.  Those are just the people who died of starvation before getting a table at Wildberry Pancakes and Café.

This is the preeminent breakfast joint on the New Eastside.  Be prepared to wait on a busy morning.  Omelettes, pancakes and waffles can be found here, as well as a full selection from the espresso machine.  Many exotic flavors can be found here which mix natural flavors that you just don't find regularly at your typical waffle house.  The faire is not overly sophisticated, but interesting enough to keep you coming back, just to try new flavors.
This place gets so packed! So packed that you can't even move. It was so good though, which made it worth the wait.
Good food but the wait is totally ridiculous. Be sure you are using the No Wait app or you could be stuck waiting 2 hours for your breakfast.
DEEEEEE-Lish! The wait was banana's, but the food was filling. The portions were quite large, so beware and share if you eat smaller meals.

We went this morning to wildberry. Very good brunch with a very varied menu. The berry bliss pancakes were just amazing, liked the Venetian skillet was less good than the pancakes but still very good.

My brother took Benedict eggs that were also very tasty. To sum up good brunch not expensive and in the center of Chicago! Do get in line online on no wait cause you can get up to 2h wait to eat.

Ok - regular coffee nothing to speak of fig omelette mehhh dry hash browns oknot really worth the wait nitellacaferight around the corner omelette waaay overdone - when it's brown and the hash browns are not .....

Used to be good but not so much any more. Don't be fool by the reviews people. The wait here is horrible and they are PLAYING hard to get. Constantly extending wait time for customers - what a fucking annoying deceptive practice. Dont the manager ever consider that it's a bit too much? No one is gonna enjoy the food if the stomach starts hurting. Could have gone to a different place had I know the wait time is double what was initially told. And add up to the frustrating wait time experience is the attitude. I'm definitely done after this time.
This is a bold statement, and I take this kind of stuff very seriously. This was the best breakfast I've ever had! Worth the wait!

Quite possibly the best breakfast I have had in Chicago. The atmosphere is fun and energetic, the food was great, and the service incredible. I am pretty sure the food came to our table within five minutes of ordering, on an extremely busy morning. The fastest turnaround time I have seen in such a high quality restaurant.

Great food. We are the sun dried tomato and avocado omelet, hash browns, and fresh berry pancakes. It was delicious and definitely worth the half hour wait. They don't do reservations though. They have coffee, smoothies, and other drinks you can order while waiting. Location is great as well:)
Standard breakfast fare, overpriced for breakfast food(location). Not a gourmet breakfast experience like the Bongo Room or Yolk.

During a midweek trip to Chicago my husband and I stopped in here around 9:30 for breakfast. It was quite busy but the two of us were seated in about 15 min. Our waitress was very pleasant and gave wonderful recommendations. We had the Mexicano skillet with sides of pancakes. My husband had the Oreo s'more pancakes and I had the cinnamon roll. They were all DELICIOUS!!! Even though the skillet was amazing the cinnamon roll pancakes stole the show for me. Be sure to make this breakfast/brunch spot a priority!! It's worth the wait.
Delicious breakfast!! I tried the crepes and an omlet and both were super yummy!! The coffee were very good too! So happy to find this little gem while visiting Chicago!!

Thanks to Yelp we were able to add ourselves to the wait list (which was a 60-90 min wait) which was awesome. The restaurant was VERY busy but they didn't slack on the service by any means. They pre-bussed out tables like crazy and even wit it being so busy our food came out fast. We've been in Chicago for almost a week and out of all the restaurant we've dined at this place by far had the best service. We really enjoyed our server Jeremy. Great peraonality! Tons of food and the hash browns were bomb

This is one of a handful of restaurants in my life that makes me wish I were fatter. Best breakfast that I can think of in Chicago.

I highly recommend the Mexicana Skillet with a Cinnamon Roll Pancake. The coffee (Intelligentsia) is a guaranteed win every time. I do not recommend the walnut fig pancakes, as they taste like cement.

Also recommended: a long, slow walk after you eat to work it all off.

Great spot. On the north end of grant park. Across from The Bean. Great selection. Pancakes. Eggs. Etc. nice spot out front to wait and a super cool Pru Tower lobby to check out before or after. Family friendly for sure.

First things first:
1) if you plan on eating inside, expect a wait over the weekend of 1-1.5 hours
2) you can always place a to-go order and eat at Millennium park (picnic style)

Since Wildberry Cafe does not take reservations, I decided to come here earlier to put my name in for a table for two.  I arrived around 11:15 and they handed me a buzzer and quoted a one-hour wait, which was spot on since I got seated close to 12:15.

I was promptly seated and ordered a coffee while my friend ordered a "special" drink named the Funky Munky Banana Frappucino, which was ridiculously delicious. The coffee was good, but the frapp was out of this world... So good that I ordered one to go after being filled with brunch-y ecstasy.

I ordered the corned beef hash skillet (with my eggs over medium, if ya wanna get real specific) and upgraded my pancakes to the Berry Bliss pancakes.  The corned beef hash was made in-house and was moist, delicious and perfectly salted. The yolks from my eggs surrounded the hash browns and corned beef hash and sent me to food heaven once I took my first bite.

Onto the pancakes. Ohmygerd. Some may say its overly drizzled with a variety of syrupy goodness, but I don't mind it one bit. The pancakes were fluffy and light. Perfection.

Service was average and I'm glad it was kept at a mediocre level. The long wait makes hungry people quiet during the feasting hour.

Overall, I'd highly recommend this place.

pics.caption: Funky monkey Frappucino $4.25 very worth it.

review.des: Awesome breakfast. While I am normally impatient and hate to wait in line, I waited because my wife wanted to, and I am glad it did. The pancakes were awesome (if a tad too sweet) and the skillet dish I had was hearty and tasty! Service was great too. In the end, it was indeed well worth the wait.

This place was worth the wait to be seated.  I placed my order with the waiter and he basically told me that it was going to be way too much food.  A stack of pancakes is like 5 or 6 pancakes or something absurd, so he recommended that I get a side of pancakes, which I did.  I also ordered a side of bacon and hashbrowns.  And it was STILL too much food!  The bacon was cooked perfectly and the gluten-free pancakes I ordered were so good that I was convinced I was going to find out the hard way hours later that they were regular pancakes.  But no, I felt fine!  Too full, but totally normal otherwise.  The hashbrowns were just standard, so if they don't come with your meal and you're going to have more than enough food with your main dish, I would skip them.  Next time I'll just get the side of pancakes and side of bacon.

And everything showed up in what felt like mere seconds, despite the fact that the place was packed and we'd waited 20 minutes to have our name called.  So the service all around was very good.  Prices are very reasonable especially when you consider the almost burdensome quantities that come on each plate.  My sister got some sort of benedict skillet that she said was equally delicious, but which she also totally failed to finish.

So the one complaint would be: portions are too large.  I can live with that.

When I first moved to Chicago I kept hearing about how wonderful Wildberry brunch is... my first brunch experience launched my never-ended brunch adventure!   Although the wait was very long,  I was impressed  by how smoothly they corralled people in and out, and the service was wonderful as well.  

Bottomless Intelligentsia coffee, delectable, soft, fluffy pancakes and gigantic skillets make this place a must-try brunch destination in Chicago!

The location is off of an offramp and can be a little challenging to find with no parking on street in that area. Then again we are in Chicago and parking is a premium.
Ordered a Bacon, mushroom, onion omelette with mozzarella and was delicious with hash browns. Instead of toast the pumpkin pancakes were soft and fluffy.
The wife had the apple pecan and cinnamon pancakes which were really good and not to sweet. One thing to note is that the apple cakes had topping over it and the pumpkin does not it is just mixed in to the batter and both not overly sweet.
Great way to get on to a plane in complete content.

Tried the famed berry bliss pancakes and the biscuits and gravy.   Fabulous service!  The food was ok.  Not amazing but worth the price.  Bonus they let me order off the kids menu.  Felt like Goldilocks, the portion was just right.

When I went for brunch on Saturday, this place was packed.  My friend and I had to wait for around 45 minutes before we were able to be seated but they have a really nice app that lets you track your place in line and texted you when the table was ready.  It was very helpful to plan how far we could wander before the table was ready.  

The food here was so good.  I got the Mexicana skillet with over easy eggs and a side of pancakes.  I'm not normally a big fan of chorizo but the skillet was perfect and the pancakes did not disappoint.  

The price you pay for the amount of food you get is awesome.  Everything here is so reasonably priced and I was even able to take half of my skillet home for dinner.

I definitely want to come here in the future for brunch again.

Great food and service! A little pricy but you are in the city. It was $70 for 4 of us. Never spent that much on breakfast in my life but I definitely went away stuffed. If your in the city you have to try at least once

Delicious food. We ate here on a Saturday morning, so of course they were packed. We got the wild berry pancakes. The coffee was delicious. My only annoyance was how quickly the bussers sweep in when they think you are getting ready to leave. I understand they need to get a lot of people through, but it was a little offputting.  Would love to return at a less busy time, if they ever have one, and enjoy a leisurely delicious breakfast.

Not that impressed.  My vegetable omelette was tasty, but the strawberry bliss pancake was eh.  Matt's chorizo omelette was good too, but his walnut & fig multi-grain pancakes were also eh.  The atmosphere was so chains, eck!  Not sure why this place gets so many good reviews.
Took over 2 hours to get in, and the service was terrible once we got our waiter. Don't go here !!!!

This place is worth the wait! I had a Denver Skillet with Cinnamon Roll pancakes which were both very delicious. Dont forget to try the Orange Juice. They serve plenty of food that I thought  could be shared between 2 people. There is the Intelligentsia Cafe inside so I grabbed a Turtle Mocha while I waited for a table.

pics.caption: Denver Skillet, added bacon. Cinnamon Roll Pancakes and orange juice

review.des: I was looking for a great breakfast place while visiting Chicago and I found it!  I went on a weekday morning and had a 5-10 minute wait.  The menu has a great selection and the food was fantastic!  I highly recommend this restaurant!

Great place for brunch.
I explored the place during my Chicago trip.
It has around an hour or longer wait on weekends but he food is great.
The signature pancakes are yum, I also tried the veggie omelette and burger.
Overall a great experience.
Cinnamon roll French toast is best thing on the menu. The berry bliss pancakes are hands down the best followed by the cinnamon roll pancakes and Oreo Smore. It is totally worth the wait!!

Wildberry was the first place I took my mom when she came to visit me. They have great coffee and super delicious food. What more could you ask for? When we were there, we had to get a little bit of everything: waffles, pancakes, a skillet and an eggs benedict. I wasn't kidding about the little bit of everything.

The waffles were perfectly cooked with the right amount of softness and crunch. The blueberries that topped the waffle were also real! They weren't that canned syrupy version that is deliciously sweet, but artificial in flavor. The pancakes of course were to die for. I mean, they can't screw that up, can they? Pancakes are part of the restaurant name! The skillet was great and a little spicy, and the eggs benedict was delicious too. One thing about the bendict though is that the roasted red peppers were a little overpowering. I probably won't get that again, but the chorizo it came with was fantastic.

Overall, great experience. A little pricey for a brunch spot, but it's in the touristy area of town, so to be expected.

Awesome breakfast in Chicago. We came for the pancakes and stayed for the breakfast bowls (eggs over cheese, potatoes, and sausage).

Good friendly service too.

It's a long wait, so plan for that.
Great service and food. You'll never run out of coffee, by the way. We didn't wait at all but we came on a Tuesday. Wish parking was easier, but I guess that's asking too much in CHI.

Absolutely loved it here that I went two days in a row. Food is great! Service is even better.
I had the Mexican skillet with a side of the wildberry signature pancakes. The skillet was a tad spicy for me, but I still enjoyed it. The pancakes were the best I've had in a long while. I went back for the wildberry signature french toast. I loved that even more than the pancakes. I prepared myself for a long wait but wasn't too bad (20-30 minutes).
Nice breakfast if waiting line is less than 30min. Won't wait if waiting time exceeds 30min...

Such an amazing variety of options. The food comes out fast and tastes great. My waiter was super cool and very helpful explaining how the menus works. For example, for an extra $1, you get a side of any of the pancakes on the menu. Can't wait to visit Chicago again and stop in for another great meal.

pics.caption: Banana Cream Pie Pancakes ... Need I say more?

review.des: Ate here twice while I was in town...great place for breakfast.  I had the classic Benedict the first day - perfectly cooked eggs and delicious sauce.  The second day I had the brisket hash...also VERY good and way too much food (but, yes, I ate it all).

Oh my god, you NEED to go here! Their cinnamon roll pancakes are to die for--no syrup needed. I had the garden skillet and it was probably enough for three meals! The place is huge, tons of hot male servers for some reason, and the prices are reasonable. This place is a must!

This place is a jamming business. But while we had good food and we got in fairly easily (use the Get in Line app).  I had the corned beef hash benny with chipotle hollandaise. Really good. But my husband had a veggie omelet skillet type thing. It was ok. We have had better. Pancakes were really good but we make similar at home. If you go....try the unique things on the menu. Don't go for the norm.

Long wait so leverage the Yelp wait list feature to get a place in line before you head out. The food is delicious so I can see why it's a popular spot.

My son ordered a seasonal menu item, the pumpkin spice pancakes. My daughter had the children's pancakes and my husband and I ordered two different Bennie options. All were delicious and generously proportioned. Service was quick once sat. We'd go back again.

had a bit of a wait for a group of 6 but not terrible. Our group had skillets and omelets with toast or fruit or you can get pancakes for an extra $1.50, including the specialty pancakes!
