There were three people taking names for the waiting list...two girls and a guy...they seemed agitated and not happy to be there.  As great as the food was, the service impacted how I scored this establishment.

pics.caption: Napa Valley Fig Omelette with a side of a Nutella w/ Banana Crepe
Skillet Hash with a side of blueberry pancakes

review.des: A friend of mine who lived in Chicago recommended this place. The wait was ridiculously long; however it was absolutely, unequivocally worth it. I had the brisket with eggs and hash brown and caramel apple pancake it was just delicious. With that kind of food, I'm not going to mind my Chicago relocation.
Excellent service. Seated outside on a beautiful sunny Chicago day! Right next to Millennium park. Pumpkin pancakes and biscuits and gravy rocked! What a treat!
It can be really busy here but the food is worth the wait, noise and crowded dining room.

Visiting from Columbus ohio-
We want one of these in Columbus!! Amazing food, great service despite the fact that is was Father's Day.

pics.caption: This is what I COULDN'T eat of my Mexicali skillet-

review.des:
I had been feeling a little under the weather my entire trip in chi town and had trouble eating full meals... not the morning I visited Wildberry on Randolph.

Our server (Dustin) was friendly and I admired his style of checking on us to make sure the questions were positive leading: "Everything's Good right?" instead of "Is everything OK." I felt like he was the right amount of friendly and checked in on us the perfect number of times. Also, was able to pare down the menu for us with strong breakfast recommendations.

I had the Wildberry Signature "Berry Bliss" Pancakes:
Buttery Pancakes Stuffed with Fresh Maine Blueberries & Layered with Wildberry Mascarpone. Topped with Fresh Blackberries, Strawberries, Vanilla Cream Anglaise & a Fresh Blackberry Coulis.

F^&K me seriously!!!! I don't care I gotta swear here.... Marscapone cheese and berry coulis.... I mean I think this meal single handily cured me of my cold while simultaneously helping me to achieve a food-gasm. Do they deliver internationally?

To add, excellence to perfection, the layout and decor of this place was as expected for a breakfast stop, however I was just floored by every aspect of this location.

Future trips to Chicago are probable, but visits to WB are a for sure thing.

Thanks Dustin and WB for making me feel better and filling me up with breakfast TLC!

Stopped by this hot spot for breakfast on Saturday.  Definitely download the "nowait" app if you're going and check in early, I recommend going for a walk around millennium park while you wait because it does get busy.

That being said the pancakes are worth the wait.  We got the signature berry bliss which was excellent.  Stacked pancakes with fresh fruit both inside and out.  The pancakes here are a little dense but still fluffy which is perfect.  Also order the southwest hash eggs Benedict.

Everything came very quickly and was delightful the berry bliss in particular was delightful with both the berry and vanilla sauce accompanied with fresh fruit, the hash eggs where just ok I think.  I was hoping for more a quick but again were still delicious.  If you plan a visit to this restaurant well in advance, you will no doubt enjoy your time here.

We stopped here for brunch during a visit to Chicago.  It was conveniently located across from the Bean and near the parks and museums.  This place is popular so we did have to wait in line for a table, but only for about 20 minutes.  
The food was average - lots of pancakes and sweet breakfast creations.  The staff was polite, but busy.  Overall, this is a good breakfast spot, but not worth it if there is a long line waiting to get in.

The pancakes!! Visiting here for a convention right by  our hotel.  I had "the Benny" the first time I was there which was yum!  You can switch out the toast for pancakes.. Highly suggested!  The pancakes are amazing!  

Went back a second time just for a stack with the fresh berries... Very good! I also ordered a side of bacon which was nice and thick cut and a strawberry lemonade (also yummy).

Does get a little busy but the wait is worth it (and goes fast)

Everything the reviews said it would be! Waited only 30 minutes and we enjoyed a fantastic brunch. For a Wednesday, we couldn't believe how packed they were. Could only imagine how packed they are on weekends. The downside was our service. She was not very attentive and it felt uninviting. But we didn't care, we went for the food. So the 5 stars is strictly to the food!

This place is so amazing!!! Me and my boyfriend went there for a wednesday morning brunch and the place was still very crowded, and i see why, the food is amazing!!! I ordered the signature berry bliss french toast, which came was so good! And my boyfriend ordered the cinnamon roll pancakes which was highly recommended by the staff and it was by far the best pancake i've ever tasted!! I think will hit this place up again before we leave!!

pics.caption: Cinnamon roll pancakes and signature berry bliss french toast

review.des: Once again, I am going off Chicago best  saying how great this place is. I was disappointed like I was with Calzone and Macaroni. Wild berry food was okay and not really nothing to brag about. The hash browns were good , but the pancakes were average. I still have not had breakfast that has been better than Continental House of Pancakes. There prices and food are great. I am starting to think that the people of Chicago best don't want to tell the people their food is terrible.
OMG - if you do not eat at this restaurant while in Chicago you will regret it!  It is awesome!  There WILL be a wait so go early.  This is by far the BEST breakfast we have EVER had!!  Just go!!
Went by for breakfast and totally enjoyed the experience, place was packed but still sat down in relatively fast time. Food was goof

One of the best breakfast food places I've been. Just had a great bacon & ham omelet. I'm a big guy and I could not finish half of it. Big serving of has Browns that were very good, but I should have asked for them to be crispy. And I ordered the Cinnamon Roll pancakes as an upgrade from the bread, and that was a very smart move. Those were some of THE BEST pancakes I've had, and I don't usually like pancakes. They were like a fluffy cinnamon roll. If you go, GET THEM.

Be prepared for a wait. We went yesterday and the wait was too long for me, an impatient guy. Went back today a couple of minutes before 8 and there was no line. But the line formed again by 8:30.

This was the third time I've been to Wildberry, and they've been great every time. It's a can't-miss.
The corned beef is to die for. I have been lucky to come when the wait time hasn't involved a wait down the street. It's a good quality busy diner.

First time in Chicago and of course I had to yelp all the top places to eat. This was one of the highly rated places for lunch/breakfast foods. You gotta order the wildberry pancakes or waffles. I was a bit hesitant to order this because it's like ordering 10 pounds to your stomach (sarcasm laugh), but I'm glad I ordered it. It wasn't as sweet as I thought. It had just the right sweetness to it. Also ordered the skillet and man, hands down best skillet I've ever had! Check came out to $23 bucks. What a deal!

We went to Wildberry when we first got into Chicago and found out quickly why this place is amazing. If you want to eat great food and get blown away by a solid skillet and the signature berry bliss pancakes. We ordered the chocolate chip pancakes as well and they were good but nothing tops the signature berry bliss.

Our meal came out quickly and our server was great. You can't beat this place when in Chicago.

I am visiting Chicago and tried Wildberry on the basis of Yelp reviews. I had the signature berry pancake plate, which I took a picture of. And a side of eggs. The eggs were great -- and useful in cutting the just-a-little-too-sweet pancakes. There is a lot going on in those cakes, pretty evident in the picture. Still, the staff was great and the food very good overall. I was by myself and seated relatively quickly (10 minutes on a Saturday morning at 8:30). I was told the wait would be 30-40 minutes. And that it is always that way. So shoot for an early breakfast or be prepared to wait.
Best pancakes of my life!! Everything was was delicious. The wait was pretty long but definitely worth it

Let me preface that we came here during Lollapalooza. Over an hour wait, we roamed Michigan for 45 minutes then waited another 20.
  We had the hash benny, hash skillet with 2 pancakes. We liked the hash but a few things were off putting. First the loved pancakes tasted like imitation vanilla extract. While the hash was indeed great, the ketchup served on the side was grainy and sour. They are not using Heinz back there and whatever hey are using would be better for building materials.
 Finally, I asked for my eggs to be poached "lightly" and was told they are all poached medium so I asked they be a little less done. Instead I got two poached eggs cooked so hard that only 1/2 teaspoon of yoke was left to run and season my hash.
  As for the service it was terrible, but we didn't expect better during such a busy time, it was actually only thing that met our expectation.

Be prepared to wait. Most items on their menu are finger licking good. Unfortunately I ordered roasted zucchini panini which was a bad decision - it was grilled to death and I could taste the char on my bread.

I was nearby with my husband and 8-year old daughter two days running for appointments. Wildberry Cafe was so good the first day we went back the second.

My husband had the Mexicana Skillet the first day and the Butcher Block skillet the second. He said both were amazing. I had the Classic Eggs Benedict on day one. It was so good. The Hollandaise was delicious. The next day I had the "Signature Berry Bliss Pancakes". Oh dear Lord - how good were they. The Vanilla Anglaise sauce was divine. The portion was big so I had half left over for breakfast the next day. My daughter had chocolate chip pancakes off the kids menu both days and loved them.

The coffee was decent. If I lived nearby this would be a regular stop. I'll have to make up excuses to come in. The service was very good. The food was out quickly.

The only other brunch spot in Chicago that can compete against Yolk in my opinion.

The serving sizes are huge here so watch out when ordering!

You can't really go wrong with any of their staples like french toast and omelets. Their skillets are MASSIVE so if you're a real man you can order one of those.

Just watch out, if you come here after 9am on a weekend it will be a 1 hour wait.
So yum! There was a long wait but took that time to visit the bean and the culture center nearby.

Nice service, good prices, large menu selection - all good. I am giving it a 3 because the food was ok. Not bad, but not a 4 either. Had omelettes, crepes, eggs benedict, GF pancakes, chicken wrap. Like I said for food selection was good as were prices. But the food itself was average. Not sure if I would go again while in Chicago - would probably try someplace new.

Went to Wildberry for a late brunch. It was 2 o'clock and we had to wait 20 minutes to be seated, which is understandable for a Saturday crowd.

When we were buzzed in, we were quickly seated. The hostess was very pleasant but our waitress was very attitudinal, and the busboys were intrusive and bad-mannered as well.

I ordered the Los Altos Eggs Benedict (pictured).  It was okay. The chorizo came out tasting more like ground beef... but the chipotle hollandaise sauce was a nice twist on the original. The portions were HUGE... I didn't eat a quarter of that thing and I was famished and brought home the sides (pancakes). Take this with a grain of salt though cause I am used to Canadian portions, which are a great deal smaller than American ones.

Midway through our meal, I realized the restaurant staff was starting to clear around us, putting chairs on tables and mopping floors. They wouldn't even let people use the bathroom and our waitress tried to rush our payment. It was so disappointing to watch and we snapped at her. She didn't make eye contact with us once so I guess she just didn't care.

Overall, there is value here (price is so right- three of us ate and drank for $50). Plus the menu had a lot to offer so I suggest giving it a try, but it wasn't the best brunch experience. If it wasn't for the poor service, it could have been a solid 3.
Pretty solid food, but we had to wait for over an hour for a table and very few dishes are worth that wait.
